Summary: The hotel is located well in the Disneyland area.  The front desk staff are less than the nicest or helpful staff I’ve encountered on my travels either.  The interior of the hotel is dated. Rooms are spacious enough but you have to ask for the room to be serviced.  This is not explained at check in an when we asked the second day it was apparently a chore for the front desk staff to arrange it and they never did come.  I wouldn’t stay here again.  You pay a premium due to the area but there are much better hotels on the strip around the same price point. Don’t waste your time or money

Summary Heading: I really liked the layout of the rooms
Summary: This hotel is clean and conveniently located. I loved the layout of the rooms which had two doors to the bedroom (one by each bed) and allowed me to use the bathroom without waking up my wife. The bedrooms are totally separate and can be closed off from both the bathroom and the living room.  We stayed for Star Wars Celebration and the hotel is a short 12-minute walk to the front door of the convention center. We'll be back here for our next trip to Anaheim.

Was not impressed by this hotel. Unfriendly front desk staff. Old, uncomfortable furniture, mold in bathroom, no cleaning of rooms or fresh linens, bad TV signal, lumpy bed. Just bad experience overall. The other DoubleTree in Anaheim is much better.

Summary Heading: charged for parking and we didn’t have a car
Summary: I would have given 4 stars, the hotel is nice & clean, but their parking situation & people, not so much. I know parking costs overnight, I’ve stayed at enough Hiltons to expect parking charges. But our car was there for barely a couple hours. My husband pretty much dropped my son and I off at the hotel, he stayed with us for a little bit as we got ready to go to disneyland, and he went back home as we waited for the shuttle. The next day my receipt showed a full nights parking charge. I called & let them know I did not have a car & we were dropped off. The FD agent informed me that we were charged for a full nights parking because it was cheaper than charging us the $5 they charge for every 20 minutes for parking. Really weird and sad we have to be a charged extra just for

Summary Heading: Extremely rude staff and parking rip-off!!!!!
Summary: For many years, we have been loyal Hilton customers. But our stay at this DoubleTree in December made us consider switching our loyalty to another hotel chain. I never thought I would say that, but we may do that solely because of this hotel experience.   The first problem was parking upon check-in. This hotel has 2 entrance/exits. The one we entered requires you to take a ticket. We go to the front desk and Josh was working. Zero personality, no greeting and no real interest in helping us...it showed! We arrived well after check in time. He said no room was available yet and we would have to come back later. We had been flying all day and we were very tired and hungry. So Mr. Personality did not tell us anything about the pay parking lot situation and so we were charged $60 on

Summary Heading: Save yourself money and look elsewhere
Summary: Check in process was easy. Lobby clean. BUT staff is very rude and did not feel welcoming. Had boxes delivered and wasn't warned they would cost me so extra charge for those. Which is fine but they could have told me when it was set up. Heading to Room and we noticed how old and gross the carpet is; smelt musty. In the room was clean but the carpet was obviously very very old and stained. The $5 water is simply ridiculous and offensive; didn't drink it. Had to constantly ask for coffee refills for the pot in room but the cleaners had been coming to stock towels and empty garbage. Issues with laundry room. Machines broken and run down. Detergent and static sheets empty so it would take money and not dispense. Had to drag our clothing to a different floor (same thing with the

this is one of the better Hilton properties in the area in our opinion. Unlike other hotels, this one actually had ample parking, both handicap and regular stalls. Clean and comfortable rooms. We will stay here again.

This place is a joke and so are Hilton hotels. I was charged for parking each night when i checked in. I parked my vehicle in the parking lot and to get it out i was charged 3 times the amount to get it out. Contacted the hotel and even Hilton customer service with no resolution. Ill next stay at another hilton hotel let alone this double tree.

Our AC went out and the thermostat could not read the temperature in the room and had hot/cold air blowing all night.  Maintenance left us blankets for the cold night.  The next day I asked for the thermostat to be fixed or replaced since it had been raining and cold and there was no follow up.  When I realized the room was freezing I came back down to the front desk and was told the thermostat was unrepairable and needed to switch rooms. A combination of the cold/hot air with the cold weather caused us to get sick.  This was a horrible experience with no empathy of follow up displayed.

Summary Heading: Poor, Poor Customer Service ... Terrible Property.
Summary: A dive of a hotel that has management with ZERO customer service skills.                     DO NOT STAY HERE! The rooms are old and at best they are not clean. The carpets are filthy, the walls had stains of some sort or another. My room felt like it was a petri dish  of disgust waiting to germinate. The bathroom had mold, leaking, dripping facets and had no regular amenities, the towels were old had thin. I could on and on.  Hilton, you need to look at pulling this contract. It's bad for your reputation.

Summary Heading: Disappointed.  Not 4 star at all. Fleas or bugs that bite.
Summary: Pros -queen beds were fine.  Pros - location fine.  Cons - sofa bed was uncomfortable for teen. Could feel springs under the thin mattress.  Cons - suite overall tiny and dated.  Cons - bathroom tub had pealing enamel and either dirt or mold  one bar of soap. No lotion. No creme rinse. No makeup remover. Thin towels.  Cons -- old carpet with fleas.  Cons - no free water. We did not open nor use the $5 water in the room. Cons - No towels by pool so we had to return to room to get bath towels.  Cons - No valets for luggage.  Cons - one surly server at breakfast the last day.  Cons - hard to get table service.  Cons - desk staff not interested in experience.

Booked this hotel purely on price and location and was pleasantly surprised on arrival as the photos on travel websites do not do it justice. It is well appointed, looks and feels great, rooms are spacious and functional for families but the cherry on top was its Agio restaurant.  The food was amazing at breakfast and dinner and the service from the waiters was second to none. I will be back and recommend the hotel to travellers with young kids.

Summary Heading: Be careful!! Not so clean as they say!!!!
Summary: I went to LA with my family Ane we stayed in this hotel for 7 nights.  Upon arrival, they informed us that cleaning was only going to be done once because they do it every 4 nights!!!  Despite this, everything was going well until on Friday, September 16th, when I was making the bed, I saw a disgusting hair stuck to the duvet.  I called house keeping several times but nobody answered, finally I went to the front desk at noon and showed the photos to the lady who was there, she apologized, wrote down my room number and told me they would correct it.  When we returned at night, the room was still the same.  I called the front desk and they sent two people to change the bedding at approximately 11 PM, while they changed everything, they left the pillows on the floor!!  and that

We stayed at the Doubletree because we had car issues on the way home from the Rams game. Arrived at the hotel at 2am and Jae was all smiles. He was very helpful and a great guy. We got to our room and it was great. Large room with separate living area from the bedroom. It had a microwave and fridge. If we need a place to stay in Orange county, we will definitely choose this hotel again!

Because the moment arrived the front desk was extremely rude!! He didn’t greet me I said to him “ Ho how are you” he complete ignore me! He barely said 1 word to me! I love Hilton customer service it’s the reason I come owner but very disappointed from this hotel! I when to the room, and I found a cable I think from a phone or usb under the coffee table in the living room, I ask my daughter if was her she say  nope, I said weird, we pull the pillows to used and dirty pair of socks was in the middle of the 2 pillows very disgusting!!! I call the front desk guess what? Never nobody answer the phone… I call 3 times no answer, really?? My daughter she said mom maybe didn’t change the sheets?? Very very disappointed  Thank you God I used for one night!  When I check out I said the

The AC didn’t work very well in my room the ice maker didn’t work so I had to go to another floor the couch was old and worn out and wasn’t very comfortable the bed wasn’t the best but it was just ok there was also hair in the bathroom tub and sink this room was not what I expected for a doubletree

Location great as far as Disneyland..However, this hotel is in a desperate need of an upgrade.. Very very old furniture! The bed skirts on the bed were stained grossed me out.. Laundry room on 7th floor not working correctly 5th floor laundry room dryer out of order.. you have to request to have your room cleaned 24 hours before due to covid restrictions but however the hand sanitizers when we arrived on the 24th and until I mentioned it they were not filled until 2 days later.. I checked every day for 2days!! Shower water pressure was great though! Hilton makes to much money to not update and have more happier staff.. Your staff doesn't appear to be happy working here.. You have to like your job to serve your guest respectfully! You ask a question they respond with no smile its

Horrible experience at this hotel! I really got disgusted that I ended up going home and not staying for the night and just wasted my money. When we came, the bathroom smelled like vomit from previous guests. It just shows that they don't clean nor disinfect the rooms and bathrooms. They couldnt give us another room as housekeeping staff was gone for the day. Instead they just sprayed air freshener on the bathroom to mask the smell! Carpet and sofa in the room also has stains. The hotel is run down and outdated. But i wished they maintained cleanliness. The towel also had a strand of hair. I would never book a Doubletree Hilton again if this was their standard of 4-star hotel! They also charge $30 for parking.

When around the Disney area, This hotel was great! The rooms are suites with a living room area with a pull out sofa that the kids can hang out while the parents sleep in the bedroom. Employees were very friendly and welcoming.

I stayed here years ago with my kids to go to Disneyland and it was great. Not anymore. I chose this hotel to drop my son off at college. I picked the parking package. It did not say it was for only one car (I double checked the website and **) and we had two (for only the first night). They charged me for my son’s car for both nights, even after I had told them it was only going to be there for one.  When I checked in and asked for a very quiet room (the hotel was not full) I was given a room on the very busy street side. I came down to ask about it and was told it’s an upgrade to have an interior room. Had I known this at check in, I would have paid for the upgrade. The front desk guy was not helpful, seemed bored and annoyed, and even more so when I asked about the

Room was dirty. Hair in the shower from the previous guest(s). No housekeeping service unless requested and even that was not a LIGHT cleaning as they called it (new towels - garbage emptied). The COVID excuse for room cleaning is getting old now. Pretty bad when you have to make your own bed when you stay at a Hotel.

Our carpet in the room is wet because the ventilation and smell like mold but they said they can do anything for the time being because they fully book and no room available to transfer us  , we stay 4 night my kids keep complaining about the smell

The Business center lacked access to download pdf's, required updates, and I could receive fax from any resource.  The hotel room was clean but, quite frankly, reminded of rooms from 1990-no updates.  Staff was polite.  I ate at the restaurant, open 5-10 daily only, and found flies!

I had bigger expectations of the Hilton. The pool could have been bigger. The suite was actually pretty small. The washer was broke for doing our laundry-bigger sign could have helped, as I put soap in then tried to use it. Also washers were dirty.  Nice to have a Starbucks in the Lobby.

Very high price and worst service and worst property. To stay in. Never expected from Hilton Brand. Being Hilton reward member this was the last visit in Hilton property. Will not recommend to any family or friends

Summary Heading: This is not a four-star hotel by any normal standard
Summary: We stayed one night, having booked through Hotels.com, who rate this as a four-star hotel. They are out of their minds, and everyone who gives it a 10/10 review on their website has clearly never left their house before.  The staff are very pleasant, and the location is good for Disneyland. The room was clean. But that is all I can say. It's cramped, everything is old, and the whole vibe is far from the kinda-fancy feel you should get from a four-star hotel.  We stayed in a two-queen suite with our three kids. They cram two queen beds into one room, with a sofa bed in the living room. This means you have to still have 1-2 of your kids in the room with you, and no one staying in the bedroom can access the bathroom  without disturbing the ones sleeping on the sofa bed. The sink is

Summary Heading: Good place for families for disney
Summary: Not the first time we have stayed in this hotel but post covid it is still a good place for families.  Very large rooms which allow a bit of space.  Clean and tidy with everything working. In walking distance to disney, but also has the regular ART bus or even the local bus along Harbour.  For ease we just jump in an uber works out less than the bus for our party.  Good breakfast buffet and safe parking.

Hotel staff are friendly, they are willing to help and I felt welcoming.   The room is clean and requirement as expected.  For the problem that I addressed to the front desk staff, it was resolved without problem.  The breakfast buffet was good and provided good amount of varieties inside a convenient restaurant.  It was a comfortable stay.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to the park & convention center; friendly and helpful staff
Summary: First time we have stayed at this DoubleTree and enjoyed our three-night stay. It's a pleasant 1 mile walk to Disneyland entrance (shuttle bus available) and even closer to the convention center. Nice room, beds were comfortable, reasonable rates, food was good at the restaurant (we had dinner once and breakfast once). Service was very good. In fact, my daughter left behind her air pods and housekeeping found them and Henry  the manager sent them to us in Denver. Thanks Henry! Recommended

Summary Heading: It’s like get your own towels and toilet paper. No one answered phones
Summary: We had to get our own towels and toilet paper. They never answered there phone housekeeping and front desk. They look mad when you ask for towel and toilet paper.The only friendly person at hotel was that man that stays on podium by front desk.

Summary Heading: Horrible Sofa Bed mattress and Breakfast
Summary: This hotel needs lots of remodeling, I travel a lot with my kids and I book a room for just one night to go to Disney and which I end paying $270 dollars as a member but end having an sleepless night, starting with piping sound coming from the bathroom, then the sofa bed felt like a cardboard, no even my kids could slept on it and the breakfast cold and tasteless. The next day we were so sleepy that we couldn't enjoy the Disney Park :(

Clean yet slightly dated rooms. Liked the two room design. Staff are friendly yet seemed unknowledgeable about what Hilton honors status enholds.  Convenient location to restaurants, Disneyland, and convention center. Overall was a good stay, and would recommend over the Hilton right next to the convention center. Would be good for a family going to Disneyland.

Poorly ran hotel. Not 3.5 stars .   Cribs for babies were broken(floor piece was broken when delivered. Big hazard) ,hot water issues(water goes from boiling hot to cold to boiling hot every few minutes during a shower ) , no dining option  between 11am-5pm, poor service (no one picks the phone when you try to ring front desk ).  Room was outdated but was clean . Parking was 29$ which is expected due to location to Disneyland. I am a gold honors so I’ve stayed at numerous doubletrees, this is by far the worse ….. if your not going to Disneyland , I would recommend staying at the doubletree by the SNA airport.

Dirty room, dirty shower, cookies are good and the room sizes are nice. The cafe is nice when they have enough food and the line isn’t a mile long. The bar is nice to have a overpriced adult beverage at the end of a long Disneyland day.

Being this property is close to Disney I’d planned to eat at the hotel using my diamond credit. To my surprise it was not open and the small cafe inside did not honor the daily credit.   Rooms are also a bit out dated. The sofa bed was awful. I booked this room thinking it would be like most double tree suites. I was disappointed.

My family and I always stay at this Hotel whenever we go to Disneyland. We absolutely love the location & Hotel is great. It’s so close to everything🤗 We’ll definitely recommend to friends and family & for sure be back.

The hotel is nice and comfortable. I didn’t expect to speak with the staff as much but when I did, I did not expect the front desk agent to be so rude. I spoke with a representative named Denise and she had a bad attitude with me; which totally ruined my morning. Surprisingly, she was a supervisor.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel if you want a quiet
Summary: This is a good Hotel to stay if you like a quiet. Just understand there’s limited services due to Covid. The restaurant is closed but the bar is open if you want to get drinks. There is no housecleaning due to staffing issues. Overall it’s not bad.

The couches are worn down, it looks like the last time the room was updated would be in the 80’s-90’s. The carpets were filthy. Unacceptable in this day and time.the towels in the room had blood smeared on them.

This hotel is not a four star property. The staff upon check in was rude and short. After stating we were checking in and we knew it was before check in time but wanted to let them know we were here, the front desk women whose name started with a D responded “early check in is 25 dollars plus tax”. I tell her to go ahead and add it so we wouldn’t have to come back later to the desk. She made no conversation, and had an attitude the entire time. We get to our room and the keys don’t work. The front desk agent Sara then asked if we were even checked in. Back up to room and keys still don’t work. When we finally got into the room it was dirty. Food particles on the light switches and phone. Sequins from what looks like a costume and dirt were all over the entry table to the suite.

Visiting Disneyland for a day and this hotel made everything so much easier for me. Parked in the morning, they took my bags and gave me a pre-checkin. That way I could come back in the afternoon and just walk in, get my room card and take a nap! I appreciated everyone's courtesy and professionalism. They made things super easy so that afternoon I came from Disneyland to relax, and ended up staying another night because I was so happy to take time to myself. The best part is the money I saved - I stayed in a big comfortable room for the same price I would have paid for a cheap, ugly motel. I will definitely stay here again next month!

Service was nothing special, wasn’t greeted upon arrival and felt very rushed. Staff was rude until they realized we already had a reservation. There was no room service and all shops/cafe/restaurant were all closed in the middle of the day so nothing was accessible to us. I feel we were treated different since we are visibly young adults so it was obvious they showed very little to no respect towards us when we arrived. Just disappointing when we wanted a little Disney get-away for a few days :(.

The hotel was clean and nice. The staff were friendly. Parking is charged at 25 per night that would have been nice to know ahead of time. We had already paid for parking at Disney, which they said we didn’t need to do however the key card is used for parking so we wouldn’t have been able to get out of the lot.

Overall The hotel was lovely except for there were no  breakfast foods available for anyone had to find it and the beds were horrible and pillows were horrible.  The hotel through it was fairly clean. Upon checking out we ask the concierge to call a cab for us they did.

Summary Heading: Out dated and needs to be remodeled
Summary: Property is old. This hotel was our go to. The couches in room and in lobby were filthy. Rates increased with little improvement or amenities. Hoped the hotel could get a remodel to compete with other hotels

Great place to stay - convenient to Disneyland - it was a bit pricey but worth it.  Wish they had a continental breakfast for the price  you pay for the rooms.  Loved the cookies they gave us when we checked in

Staff was very rude and made us feel unwelcomed, they seemed bothered by us asking questions. All amenities were missing, soap, lotion, shower gel, shampoo, trash bags, etc. good thing we brought our own. However housekeeping made the room look nice and clean

Rating 2 stars because of pandemic. But felt hotel deserved 1 star. Was in Mexico in September of 2021. Stayed in a beautiful hotel. Super clean and well cared for. Very friendly and helpful staff. Delicious food. Why does Mexico do so much better than the USA, at least wrt the Doubletree in Anaheim? Sadly, at the Doubletree, each day there was uncollected garbage in, on, and around garbage cans both inside hotel and outside on hotel grounds for over 24 hours. Hotel grounds not policed and kept clean. Stains on carpet near elevators. Large gap between headboard and mattress caused pillow to fall between wall and back of bed under headboard into never cleaned area. Yuk.  Stayed 3 nights and staff uninterested and unable to move me to room with 2 beds instead of 1 king bed. Staff

We found hair in our bathtub, there were tons of crumbs all over the living room couch and a huge wad of someone’s used chewing gum was stuck to our headboard.   Front desk supervising was rude and condescending to us when we shared a concern about guest parking.

Our car was broken into and the staff did not care nor made our stay feel safe . In addition trying to get any help from them regarding the incident that occurred in their parking lot which they charge for . In my opinion is they lack the Hilton customer service.

Rooms were so nasty! Unfortunately, we had no other options given the time of year. It’s so sad to see such a nice hotel but it was so so so dirty and not clean from the entry to the rooms need a deep cleaning.

Clean room, great  and fresh cookies & comfortable beds. The staff was so helpful and always available. Marvelous location, close to many places to eat, at least 3 restaurants are a 2 minute walk away.  Less than one mile from Disneyland. My only complaint is the carpet in the lobby, it has seen better days. Everything else was wonderful.

Summary Heading: Comfy Room for Family Trip but Service…Meh
Summary: My family stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. It was plenty spacious for us with two queen beds in the bedroom, a large bathroom to share, and a living room with a couch that folded out into a bed. They told us there was no housekeeping service unless requested, which is fine. However, we did request it on our second morning—just to have the trash cans dumped and to bring fresh towels / take the old ones. It was disappointing to return to our room after being at the park all day to find that at 11 PM there were no towels for a shower, our dirty towels were still in the bathtub, and our trash was still full. I called the front desk and was told that I could come pick up some towels. When I sounded surprised by that the front desk man said that he could send them up with

Summary Heading: There was no maid service and we had to request clean towels
Summary: There was no maid service and we had to request clean towels.  One bar of soap for three days.  No replacement coffee, shampoo or conditioner.  Location was not as convenient as described.  Required a $25 fee for early check-in.

Excellent hotel, felt at home from cleanliness of the property to all the friendly staff even at the gift shop. 5 stars!! The parking was convenient and near by with no huge parking structure to deal with. Love it!!

Staff ( Erica) was rude and is not kind to people with disabilities. My daughter has a service dog and Erica did not understand the ADA act. My daughter service Dog is well trained and from a very well known service dog training organization. Erica said so you say he is a service Dog ( he is 100% a service dog and is register with the state of California as a service dog.)  and she told me I did not have common sense because not registering him as a guest. According to the federal government he is viewed as durable medical equipment. I would never register my daughters wheelchair, oxygen and all of her other medical equipment. I tried to explain to her that we travel with my daughters service dog all the time and we have stayed at this hotel at least two other times and have

Next hotel, wouldn’t stay here again if I don’t have too. Nice hotel but the inside of our room was Dirty sheets was a mess and left over bottles in fridge. We called for some clean towels which took 45 mins just to get and never experienced a long wait like that.

Great staff and site. Close to the parks. Continental breakfast wasn’t available during our stay due to COViD which was disappointing. Ended up having to spend more for breakfast that originally intended.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel does feel clean sofa bed not comfy
Summary: The hotel is nice you can tell it’s older because of the furniture the sofa bed is cool to have but the mattress is not comfortable you can feel the coils when you lay down on them but it is an extra bed the comforters were you could just tell they were just older OK I guess the price is pretty good it’s a sweet so I would stay there again

Summary Heading: Never going back to Double Tree
Summary: I’ve paid for breakfast package in the past and it was a decent little buffet setup. This time it was gas station type food from the coffee booth, and was told instead of a buffet, I had $12 credit. This covered one food item and one drink. Never was I told the restaurant was closed. If I would have known I would have selected a cheaper room category or went elsewhere. I also wasn’t told they no longer offer Disneyland shuttles and only found out when the bus driver from the bus o caught across the street told me double tree stopped paying them so they are no longer on their route

We stayed at this hotel to visit Disneyland down the street. It was a very nice hotel. We were not expecting it to be that nice. The cookies at check in were a favorite ! Very close to Disneyland ! We live 2 hours away and we loved that it was just a 3 minute drive to the park. You can also purchase tickets at the hotel to Disneyland there’s a small kiosk located in the lobby.  Next time we plan on staying longer we did only one night and arrived late. We did not have a chance to use any other amenities. The pool was nice, seemed heated. I saw a family in it around 9 pm

Summary Heading: Stay away!! Smelly, dirty and loud!!
Summary: The rooms need updating. Our room had a strange oder and we found hairs floating in the toilet. The internet reception wasn't great. We got no sleep as our room was facing the very busy and loud, Harbor Street! We couldn't wait to get home! Avoid this hotel.

We were greeted with a friendly staff. In fact, the staff was friendly throughout our stay. The suite was spacious and clean. Although it took about 20 mins for us to walk to Disneyland, we were glad that Dennys was across the street. Bring noise machines to pollute the noise of the hallway, especially early in the morning when guests are up and walking down the hall. Great stay overall.

The experience was vey blah. More akin to staying at a motel than a Doubletree.  The front desk was not rude or grossly incompetent but not helpful and not even trying to be helpful. We were rushed through check in even though we were the only ones in the lobby and were obviously having a (not loud) moment with one of our young children. Questions about route to Disneyland were answered matter of factly with an “I don’t know”, and referring us to a brochure. No “I’m sorry I don’t know, but…” or other phrases that typically indicate a desire to be helpful, and no “have a nice stay”, etc. Other inquiries led to similarly vague and blah kind of answers. Housekeeping came to turn the room over before checkout time on the final day. Other small things that made the stay very

Very nice hotel with super helpful staff. Would have liked the restaurant and room service to have been opened. Will definitely stay here again. Many nearby restaurants and taverns. Easy Uber distance to many places.

My friend and I stayed here for our trip to Disneyland and it was fantastic! The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful and the hotel was beautiful. The rooms were clean and it was the largest double tree I’ve stayed in. Its 5 min away from the park and there’s a $6 round trip shuttle that picks you up right in front. When I come back to Disney I’ll definitely stay here again!

First night we stayed here our truck was broken into. Truck was parked in their security patrolled parking lot. Thief’s broke bed cover and stole several items. Would not recommend and they told us park at your own risk. Not much concern on their behalf.

Excellent hotel, clean and excellent service. Located close to everything. Coffee shop in the nice lobby was delicious and fast and friendly service.! We enjoyed our stay, we plan to come back again!!

Summary Heading: No one at the front desk
Summary: Unfortunately the service at this hotel was horrible. When we went to check out in the morning, there was no one working at the front desk. We had originally attempted to use the self check out on the app, it was not working and directed us to the front desk. There was no one at the front desk and we waited and called for about 20 minutes. During that time we also attempted to get help from other employees working on the first floor. We were told they did not know if there was anyone working the front desk, and they could not help us. Eventually, The single employee working that area on October 30, came back from break or wherever she was at and checked us out. It wasn’t the wait at the front desk as much as the rude and unhelpful staff that was a problem.

Overall its an ok hotel, not very many amenities as the restaurant is closed, House keeping only available certain hours. Rooms are dated and need remodeling. You can stay down the street for the same average price and get more

Broken lighting. Mold smell. Restaurant closed, only a coffee shop was available, and only in mornings. Was ignored at check in for 2-3 min. No separate Diamond line. No enough handicap parking, full every night. Couch broken, just sinks in when sitting. TV and internet not working during half of trip - no concession for it. Not properly greeted at checkin. Older property- 15 years; doesn’t look like it’s a makeover since opening.

Upon checking in, we found food crumbs in our bed. We told the front desk and they handed us 1 flat sheet. I called them after realizing this and they said they can’t deliver another sheet but we can come get it. The fact that the burden of cleaning up after a previous guest was placed on us sent up so many red flags that we felt anxious about what other shortcuts were being taken (in the midst of a pandemic, no less!).

I took four of my granddaughters and my daughter on a trip to Disneyland.We had postponed a visit like so many others, due to COVID.  This hotel was a wonderful choice for my family.The room was a suite with 2 rooms.It had a pullout couch and two queen beds,which worked well for us.The room was clean and well appointed.We opted for housekeeping each day.I appreciated having clean towels each day. We arrived early in am.from Seattle.We were able to check in early. Kim gave us  a pool view room on the Hilton Honors floor.She took great care of us.I so appreciated her hospitality. The girls loved the pool area,gift shop,and the cookies!My daughter appreciated the coffee bar.We also got a cocktail from the bar area.There was no restaurant open and that was the only negative. I think

Close to Disneyland and ART, which was the main reason we picked the location. They are a good neighbor hotel with Disney and made the stay convenient. The rooms overall are a little dated, but overall clean and comfortable for a short stay.

Summary Heading: Affordable and great location for Disney vacation
Summary: The hotel is affordable and the location is great. We walked to Disney and several restaurants in the area. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite with our two little ones and were extremely comfortable.  The rooms have some outdated furnishings but the beds are comfortable.  The rooms are also extremely clean, spacious, and quiet. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and shared the Covid precautions when we arrived. We would have appreciated if the hotel restaurant were open but we also understand the difficulties with staffing and hiring staff at this time. In the past, we have visited the restaurant and bar in the hotel (bar open),we appreciated the convenience and were pleased with the food and service. Overall, another great stay and vacation to Disney.

Front desk staff should be more welcoming and helpful. Attitude is important and guests should be acknowledged and greeted upon arrival. This didn’t happen to me. Also called prior to checking in to inquire about early check in but staff was rude

My recent stay 8/20-8/25 would have been great till the service I received after check out.When I checked in I was told I would receive a food credit for each my wife and myself. When I looked at my card statement and saw charges that exceeded what I thought were right I looked at the receipt and saw I was charged for the bad coffee and stale danish I got from the snack bar, because they didn't have a restaurant as advertised. I was only credited for one person. When I called to question the charges I was told only one person checked in so that was that. I know I had the conversation with the clerk when I checked in and it was made very clear about the food credit. When I said I would put in a call to corporate I was hung up on.I would only expect that type of attitude from a

Hotel was pleasant and enjoy the location to enjoy my trip to Disneyland with my kids. Thank you for the clean room and wonderful hotel. We used the ANT transportation to Disneyland and it was quick and easy when it right outside the hotel.

We got to our hotel early and was able to check in before our 4pm check in time! They were also able to get us some bus passes to shuttle us to and from Disneyland. They also gave us free water bottles for our trip.

Summary Heading: Overall nice...won't pay to park there....unless they have EV charging
Summary: Customer service no issues.  Rooms were good.  Beds were nice.  Did not really hear anything outside of door.  They have a Starbucks coffee shop in lobby.  The bar and restaurant were empty all the time.  No reason to have those open or to go there.  Lobby big

Summary Heading: Pay A Little More To Stay Somewhere Better
Summary: The hotel is very outdated for the price that’s charged. I normally stay at Homewood Suites. I chose Doubletree because the cost was cheaper and boy did I get a cheap experience. I’ll never stay at a Doubletree again. Even the furniture in my initial room was stained (the couch pillow), the pillow cover was wrinkled as if the couch is 20+ years old, the pull out sofa was SO LOUD that I couldn’t even use it without waking up my children. The cabinet to where the fridge is located was loose - wish I had a screwdriver to fix it myself. One of the hotel elevators ended up being out of service. It was just an overall BAD experience. I even complained about my initial room and all the front desk supervisor did was change my rooms - no other accommodations or apologies or anything.

They did not bring clean towels or toilet paper without us calling for it no replenishing coffee and supplies. No vacuuming during four day stay. They never informed us about this and that they had no room service. The water was shut off for give hours so we had to change our plans and go to park early. Worse stay ever.

Close to Disneyland.  Really nice front desk staff.  However, the room itself was dated and the sofa bed was not usable (which we actually needed for our family).  There are probably better options if you’re looking for the Happiest Vacation on Earth.

Summary Heading: Clean, Affordable, and Close to Disneyland
Summary: This property met our needs for our recent Disneyland trip. It is very clean. Check-in was quick and easy. We were given a room on the 4th floor.  The room was a large 2 queen bed suite .  It appeared to be cleaned and sanitized per company policy.  We didn't have any problems.  The queen beds were in a seperate bedroom. There is a sofabed located in the living room area. Refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker included. There are flat screen televisions in both rooms. Bathroom was very clean. The hotel did not seem too crowded during our stay. We never had to wait a long time for the elevator. There is a pool on the 2nd floor we were able to enjoy on our first day after check-in.  Due to the pandemic, the restaurant and bar were closed. That was a bummer.  The grounds were

This hotel was in good walking distance to Disney/California Adventure lots of stores and places to eat nearby.Front deal staff was nice and always will to help.Room was nice and big for me and my family of 5

Summary Heading: Excellent Customer Service (Thanks Henry Hang!), Great Value, and Very Comfy Rooms
Summary: Firstly, I want to recognize Henry Hang (Reservations Manager) at the DoubleTree by Hilton. He was very kind, attentive, and provided excellent customer service which is what made our (my wife and I) stay there most enjoyable.  I particularly appreciated how personable Henry is. He greeted me and my wife regularly and made small talk about our trip when we passed by the lobby which made us feel more comfortable at the DoubleTree.  Our room itself was also nice. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows were too soft for my personal preference. My wife and I had no trouble sleeping though so the pillows were not a major issue.  My only minor complaint I had was that I wish the hot water from the bathtub faucet was hotter. At its max setting, I found the hot water to still be

Overall experience was not that great as soon as I walked in I asked for an upgrade in my room since I am a diamond member and I was told that there is an any rooms and then I had came back from the car and asked a different member and said there was two rooms available but I had to pay the difference and I told her that I was a diamond member and she said that they do not do that there then I had to go out of my way and call the diamond customer service and then finally I was able to get it a upgrade and I feel like I just had to go through way too much for being a member of the Hilton

The property itself is located in a great place and the rooms are nice. The staff was terrible which made for a bad experience. 1. The room wasn’t ready at check in. 2. When requested the room was cleaned. 3. Even when the room was cleaned it wasn’t cleaned completely.

We decided to come up a day early for our Disney trip.  We’ve stayed at this particular location before & the service & accommodations were excellently. Rooms were very clean & it had al the amenities we needed.

The check in process was easy and could be done on the mobile app. The room was clean and sealed off. The hotel was located about a mile from Disneyland. There was a Denny’s across the street. I would recommend this hotel.

Rooms were a little dirty and upon arrival we did not get the room we requested. Other than that the people customer  service was and the cookies are absolutely DELICIOUS 😋 great cookies! I think next time I will emphasize the room desired

Disappointed with my stay, I decided to try Hilton Honors chain a try again but came up short. All the extra amenities were not available even though the website clearly said they would be with modifications, plus who leaves a half started toilet paper roll for a suite with 5 people staying and no extra in the room. On top of that I had to go down and get another roll they wouldn’t deliver. Staff never asked how my stay was on the way out which was sad which felt like they didn’t care. The random yellow spots on the shower tub made us uneasy as well. Overall disappointed

The hotel just went thru a major upgrade with new carpet and painting.  The room is clean, and new.  We really enjoyed our 2-day stay over the Memorial weekend.  However, during the pandemic, most of the services were closed: no room service during our stay, no food or coffee served. But we are ok with it.

Customer service at check in was horrible and uncomfortable. Arrived at 2 am after 6 hour drive to just get accused and questioned never again will we stay here. This was my to go hotel when visiting Disneyland, NOT anymore.

Clean and welcoming post-covid!!! Helpful, welcoming and knowledgeable front desk staff. Will definitely stay again. Recommending to family and friends. Close to numerous restaurants, theme parks. Room was clean and area felt safe.

Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Rooms spacious enough for 2 people; would probably be tight with 4 people. Rooms were neat and clean but could use some upgrading.  It was nice to have both fridge and microwave in room.  Not sure if they were short staffed during our stay but when we called for housekeeping, the phone rang and rang for about 2 minutes before we hung up and called the front desk.  The phone rang for quite awhile before someone picked up. This happened both times (on 2 separate days/occasions) that we tried to call housekeeping. Little further from Disneyland than we were used to.  Technically walking distance but does take a while.  Shuttle system is available (for a charge) but it takes much longer than just walking.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. As a loyal Hilton customer, you are among our most valued guests. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we're very sorry it took so long for the phone to be answered. Our Executive team is reviewing your comments to ensure they are used to improve our guest's experience.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The hotel is overall in a good location, you've got a Denny's nearby, gas station, am-pm. My wife and I chose this hotel because Disneyland is nearby, you can take the bus or walk if you want. Uber costs around 6 bucks to get to Disneyland and bus is like 2 bucks per person, so it might be worth to take an Uber if your group has 3 persons or more.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your very kind words – we are all delighted that enjoyed your visit so much. We do try hard to make our guests feel at home, and well taken care it is very rewarding to know how much our guests enjoy themselves. We hope to be able to welcome you back very soon.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: This hotel is so nice.  My hotel suite is larger than my first apartment!  Staff was always friendly and helpful.  Very clean and well managed.  The location was perfect for walking to restaurants and our group event.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler. Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and I’m looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: We have stayed here in the past due to the location, cost and especially for the free cookie at check in! Staff are very helpful and friendly and it's not too far from the park, but wished they offered a free shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. As a loyal Hilton customer, you are among our most valued guests. Our Executive team is reviewing your comments to ensure they are used to improve our guest's experience.  Management,  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort-Convention Center

Summary Heading: Value for money, clean and spacious room, would recommend for visiting Disneyland.
Summary: The hotel lobby is grand, and I was provided with warm cookies upon check-in. My room was on the 7th floor and had a bit of a view. The room itself was big and clean. The bed was comfortable, and the fridge included a freezer. The staff are very friendly, and always say hello to you when they see you. This is nice, but something I personally find slightly off-putting, as I feel like it is something management pushes. I felt the hotel was value for money. I would recommend staying at this hotel if you're visiting Disneyland. The Anaheim Resort Transportation shuttle stop is just over the road, so you can go directly to Disneyland and back (runs every 15-30 minutes). It's easy to buy a pass on the app, and you just have to show it to the bus driver. Otherwise the walk isn't too
Manager Response: Thank you for this amazing five star review! Thank you for taking the time to share your great experience and for being a valued Hilton Honors member! We are delighted you enjoyed our hotel. We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to welcoming you back!  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Our stay at the Double tree was great. It was a priceline express deal. It was very quiet in our room. We only went to be at Disney, and if you walk down Harbor toward Convention way and cross the street, you will be in the Toy Story lot. Walk back in that parking lot, and you will come to the Disney shuttle busses. Anyone can ride these busses. Probably took us less than 10 min to walk there from the hotel. Remember no continental breakfast here, but there is a coffee pot, fridge, and microwave in the room. It was very clean.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your very kind words – we are all delighted that enjoyed your visit so much. We do try hard to make our guests feel at home, and well taken care it is very rewarding to know how much our guests enjoy themselves. We hope to be able to welcome you back very soon. Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our Disney trip and it was great! Really good service and good quality room. We walked to and from Disneyland every day and it wasn’t too far. The mattresses were so comfortable, I would buy one if I knew what kind they were. We will definitely stay here again for our next big Disney trip.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler. Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and I’m looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel. If you go to Hilton to Home I believe you can purchase the same beds there.   Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: Spent Valentine's week at Disneyland.California Adventure stayed at this property.  Dining and bar was great, especially the Grilled Salmon with brocollini, tomatoes and potatoes.  Toshiro bartender was tops.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your great experience and for being a valued Hilton Honors member! We are delighted you enjoyed our hotel and the Grilled Salmon. We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to welcoming you back !   Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort-Convention Center!

Summary: Grand lobby, super helpful and friendly staff, nice large rooms, comfy beds, and a great location. The ONLY criticism I could have is the furniture is rather dated, even in the lobby.  But whatever, it's a very nice hotel with a great staff.

Summary: Great location for Disneyland visit with family.  Hotel was very clean.  The room was stocked with enough towels for our family of 5 so I didn't have to call down and ask for extra towels like I normally do.  Quiet hotel - don't hear any noise from the hallway.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler. Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and I’m looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: Hotel is in a great location, close to many restaurants and Disneyland. Hotel staff is friendly and courteous. Parking is easy at the hotel and easy exit. Hotel shuttle is nice to Disneyland but it’s easily within walking distance too.

Summary: Easy access and nice rooms.  15 minute walk to disneyland or option to take from street outside hotel.  Dining is close enough to walk or drive to with lots of different options or you can dine at hotel.

Summary: The bed could be better with more none feather pillows and extra blankets it was cold.  The room was very nice with good refrigerator, microwave, and two TVs.  The bathroom was generous in size and accommodated our family

Summary: We are so incredibly pleased with our decision to try this hotel. We have been staying at a different hotel for the past 15 years, but the management has gotten so bad that we could no longer justify spending our money there. We found a really great price online for the Double Tree Suites on Harbour Blvd and decided to give it a try. What a difference! From the moment we entered the lobby to the time we checked out we had smiles from the staff accompanied by friendly and welcoming attitudes they had made our overall experience such a nice change. The room was in great shape and very clean. Upon check in I asked for a quiet room because we were there for 7 nights and I am a very light sleeper and they gave me just that! I was super pleased. It was about a 15-20 minute walk to
Manager Response: Thank you for this amazing five star review! Thank you for taking the time to share your great experience and for being a valued Hilton Honors member! Summary: My family of 6 recently stayed here in a two queen suite. We found it a little cramped for us but it worked for a one night stay however if you have older kids and plan on staying several days I would suggest staying at a hotel with larger suites. We were a little bummed to find out “complementary” breakfast wasn’t included with out stay as we planned to have breakfast before heading to the park. This apparently was something I missed when booking and not the hotels fault but none the less I’d pay attention to that detail when you book your room. Luckily there are endless places to eat nearby and we were able to quickly find food. Our room was definitely dated but it had a bit of charm to it that I liked and most importantly the room was clean. We found the staff to be very
Manager Response: Dear Traveler. Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and I’m looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: The dishes at each of our meals at this hotel were dirty.  Staff was good about bringing us new ones, but should have checked dishes before putting out for guest use.  We were on floor 6, room did not get cleaned until 4 pm some days.

Summary: I've stayed here 3 times and its always been my favorite place when im in the area. Everything is so great that I don't even bother looking for other places to stay. Meets all my needs. The location is perfect, room are nice and everything is always so smooth.

Summary: Just stayed here for a long weekend. The hotel staff is super nice and the lobby and common areas were sparkling. Large spacious room with separate living area is always a plus.   The hotel is located just under a mile from the park entrance so it’s walkable. ART bus service does pick up outside hotel but the paid shuttle doesn’t run often enough. Only drawback for me was the pool was shaded all day long. I was looking forward to a little sun time but given the location the pool was built -never happen.

Summary: Stayed for New Year's. 2 queen suite w/sofa sleeper was just right for 2 adults and 2 kids. Breakfast included. ART stops in front of hotel every 20 minutes, no driving for a few days. Nice rooms, good breakfast, great staff all around. Will be back!👍😎

Summary: The Associate that helped me check in was great.  She was respectful and nice.  Room service was great as well.  Dining was great.  My room was great except my room was not serviced on one of the days.  I love a clean put together room.  When we returned from Disneyland after being gone all day and night, I went to the front desk and asked for water because I was out and arrived back to the hotel late.  I was given a lecture by one if the Associates that the next time she will not be able to give me water because they are only allotted so many bottles of water by housekeeping.  I stay only at the Doubletree and Embassy Suite hotels because I continue to have great experiences there, but to be told lectured and given pause late at night about asking the front desk for water was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We appreciate your feedback as this allows us to constantly improve upon our guest experience. Summary: This was a good hotel that is right at the edge of walkable for a family with young kids to the Disneyland resort.  There is a nice cafe downstairs.  The libby was beautifully decorated for Christmas.  Good secure parking, a little pricey though.

Summary: It was the trip to Disneyland park. Location is good because we can either take bus at the bus stop by the hotel or walk to the park about 15 to 20 minutes. Its breakfast is pretty good in terms of quality and quantity. Our kids love the breakfast.

Summary: Very clean and quite hotel, despite the many families with excited, Disney-bound small children.  Plenty of parking, nice pool and hot tub area and adequate fitness room. Breakfast was a nice plus.  Would stay here again.

Summary: Nice rooms and the location is convenient to the convention center, Disneyland and lots of dining options.  The staff was friendly and the cookies were always warm.  This is definitely a place I would stay again for business or if I was traveling with my family on vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler. Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I’m happy that you enjoyed your stay and I’m looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel.  Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort – Convention

Summary: My wife and I just stayed 14 nights at the Doubletree in Anaheim and were totally impressed. Is a Hotel as compared to Motor Inn, which was definitely appreciated. Front desk were cheerful everyday and Gary at guest services an absolute legend. There are closer accommodation options to Disneyland/DCA however, that is offset by the fact the ART bus number 1 drops you at the door.  Denny’s across the road was a great option, with many other eateries either onsite or within a 10 minute walk. Room was what I expected, improved by the extra comfy bed and reliable/trustworthy housekeeping.  All in all highly recommend this spot for a Disney/Convention Centre Anaheim Trip 😍

Management, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Hidden gem. There are many new hotels that popped up around this doubletree but by far I still love this doubletree location and the 1 bedroom suite.   The staff is friendly and the best part is complimentary warm Chocolate cookie upon checkin.

Summary: My wife and I checked-in to the hotel for a brief one-night stay on Thanksgiving day after returning from an international flight (we just weren't ready to head home yet). The hotel was welcoming and prompt in checking us in. We were out most of the time, but returned just before the hotel bar was closing. The bartender was friendly and helpful. The room itself was tidy and neat, but we did find a small piece of cheese (in a wrapper) in the mini fridge, seemingly leftover from the last guest. Otherwise, we had a good, short stay.

Summary Heading: Great accommodations for a family Disney trip!
Summary: Decided to spend Thanksgiving with extended family (4 adult cousins and 6 kids) so chose this hotel due to the location, reasonable price, and accommodations (suites, yay!). My cousins got there before I did and were immediately texting about how great the rooms were. I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room when I got there and felt it was perfect to let the kids hang out in the living area even if the adults wanted some rest time.   I walked from the hotel to Disney twice and also took an Uber. The walk is a straight shot down Harbor with easy access to the park. I would actually recommend that over driving/Uber since it's kind of a pain to get into the rideshare dropoff.   The restaurant has good selections for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It's on the pricier

Summary Heading: Left my teenage son stranded in the lobby at midnight
Summary: Paid for 2 adults and 3 children. Got 2 bottles of water. Only 2 breakfasts. Breakfast was awful, tried to get my younger son something, soggy waffles, very few yogurts, old looking fruit. Teenage son got locked out at midnight and the front desk treated him like some kind of drug addict trying to sneak in and rob the place. He had his ID and his key card which would not work and they refused him a new key. They finally called my room at midnight and stated "someone is trying to get into your room!" AT MIDNIGHT.  Sent us into a panic that someone was trying to break into our room, absolutely ridiculous. Will NEVER stay at this hotel again. How hard is it to simply say your son is here at the front desk and is locked out? But no, someone is trying to get into your room. Who says

Typically loyal to Hilton. Sometimes when I’d get great service at a property, I’d go out of my way to review it. Typically if I had a bad stay, I’d either just not return or give it a shot later on. I usually wouldn’t go out of my way to badly review and rip a property - until this week’s trip here, to the Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim. They earned this, so I’m gonna go out of my way to give it to them.  I’ll break this into 2 parts - my summarized thoughts on the overall property, and my thoughts on a specific issue that most T’d me off.  Doubletree Suites Anaheim is a large size property about a mile

Summary Heading: Nice home base for visiting the park
Summary: I have been trying new Hilton properties in the vicinity of Disneyland to get a feel for my options. This trip was the Doubletree Suites on Harbor.  The location of this property is great. Justvl 1 mile down the road from the main entry to the park. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the gates or a 5 minute Uber. The Art stops just at the end if the driveway, as well. In the morning and evening (prime time for park goers) I found the uber rates to be between $10 and $15, but after just a few hours, it dropped to less than half of that. The Art pass (with available phone app) is a more cost-effective option unless you share the ride.  I experienced rush hour traffic from LAX, due to my choice of flights, so the trip tool about 90 minutes. On the way back, it was about an hour in
Manager Response: Thank you for this amazing five star review! We couldn't be more pleased to know you had a wonderful time at our hotel. That LA traffic can be wild at times. Summary: I stay at this hotel about once a year for an annual convention, and sometimes more frequently to visit Disneyland. Over the last several years, I have tried many of the other hotels in the area and none of them match this Doubletree in terms of price to quality ratio. It is walkable to the convention center as well as to Disneyland. The rooms are always clean and are spacious. I have never had any issue with the staff, who have always been very friendly. Despite many stays I have also never had an issue with my reservation or anything similar. I love this hotel and truly think it is better than many of the pricier hotels in the area!

Summary Heading: Great Visit easy walk to Disney
Summary: Stayed here for  weekend to go to Disney with my wife and son.  Showed up at 5 on a Saturday and was able to find parking with no problem.  Booked the extended weekend package and with parking it was only about $80 than the Motel 6.  Walk to the park is about 20/25 minutes, and to the Toy Story parking lot for a free Disney shuttle it is about 7 or 8.  The room was spacious and clean with no defects or mars to the walls or bathroom.  For the first time I could say that I was given plenty of towels and did not have to call housekeeping for them.  We did not try the restaurant or bar and ate at the Carls Jr. next door and there other places to eat near by.  The pool is semi-heated and the hot tub was great.  Towels were available at the pool.  Overall this was an above average

The design was very old with the ac vent facing directly into the back of the door! There were plenty of windows in the room so natural light was great and the bed was relatively comfy.   The lobby and restaurant area are really aged and the Starbucks kiosk around the corner is small and not very well kept. Pancakes, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, bagels, etc. There was a bit of a mixup at breakfast as they mentioned someone had already eaten breakfast with our room number - but they quickly seated us and there was no issue with getting the free breakfast as offered. There is a fee for parking, but all hotels in the area charge around $20 - and the lot was well lit and seemed secure. We were assigned to room 721 right in front of the elevator. By the time we grabbed something small to eat, parked our car, and grabbed our bags to go up to the room it was a little past 9pm. As soon as we walked into the room, there was a strong cigarette smoke smell, but it clearly stated "non smoking room" on the wall. Summary Heading: A warm and inviting place to stay and they have the best chocolate chip cookies!
Summary: Warm and inviting, especially the chocolate chip cookies.  I was treated incredibly special from the time me and my family entered the front doors.  I'm part of the Hilton Honors program and was able to be upgraded to a bigger/better room for free along with views of the Disneyland fireworks show.  Great staff and great hotel.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone especially since it is close to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney with all the shopping and restaurants.  Great location.

Summary Heading: Love this property - Great for a Disney Vacay!
Summary: I have stayed at this property several times - with my family and when it's just me and my wife. Great breakfast that starts at 6 am so you can head out the door for the Disney Resort and be one of the first in line. The resort is about one mile away - an easy stroll considering the distance you'll be walking during your day in the park(s). Great service also and a helpful tidbit of info - you can park for free on Orangewood (except Thursdays for street sweeping). If you're an HHonors member, this property often is lower or lowest on the amount of points required per night in the area. Highly recommend this hotel!

Summary: We chose the DoubleTree for this Disneyland trip through the Hilton Honors program. We usually stay at Embassy Suites down the road but I did some checking of all the Hilton properties and found that this one had a rate that was much lower for pretty much same amenities (except breakfast, which isn't important as we can eat on the run).  Why it's a first for us is because everywhere we go - all over the U.S. - we always request a hypoallergenic  (no feather bedding) room due to allergies. Not only do we request this during reservations making but we call ahead the day before or day of our arrival to make sure it's done.  Problem we run into every trip: it's never done.  This is the FIRST HOTEL to actually have done this prior to our arrival!! Every other hotel misses this and we

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland but be aware of the Airport Disneyland Shuttle Bus
Summary: A very good stay at the Hilton Double Tree.  After a traumatic transfer from the airport (more on that later!) the reception staff were really friendly & welcoming and made the check in process simple.  The room was spacious although (like the rest of the hotel) rather dated.  The double beds were a bit on the small side so my wife ended up sharing a bed with my 3 year old daughter and I (being 6ft 5in) had the other bed to myself.  The room was thoroughly cleaned each day.  Aircon & Wifi both worked well.  The receptionist explained that to get to Disneyland we'd need to get the RideArt Shuttle bus (Number 14) from outside the hotel.  I think I paid around 30 dollars for a 3 day pass for the 3 of us.  The buses were approx every 40 mins and only stopped at a couple of stops

Summary Heading: Not for working moms...no sympathy for breastfeeding
Summary: I talked to three male employees, two who were managers and one front desk employee.  None of them would accommodate storing freezer packs for me overnight for travel with breastmilk the next day.  Airlines will not let you fly if cooler packs are not completely frozen, and the mini fridges in the rooms do not get cold enough.  I travel a lot as a working mom, and this is the ONLY HOTEL EVER to not accommodate this request.  They claimed it was a health code violation for the freezer in their restaurant, but I find it hard to believe in a property that size, there are no freezers where I could have stored 3 small ice packs.  They told me they “understood”, but simply could not help me.  Most places I have been go above and beyond to help working moms, because they know how hard

Summary: Of the options available in the Anaheim area, the Doubletree turned out to be one of the very best. It is one of the few major hotels in the area with rooms with 2 Queen beds (as opposed to 2 Double beds), and the suite with 2 Queen beds was perfect for our family! The hotel was very clean and had a more upscale vibe than the typical hotels in the area. The beds were very comfortable, however the pillows leave a lot to be desired. Bring your own pillow, unless you like fluffy pillows that flatten immediately upon laying down. In general, all staff members we encountered went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.   As a Hilton Diamond member, the breakfast buffet was included, but otherwise it is approximately $15/person. The food was good quality and always hot and fresh.

Summary Heading: Nice room, good price, but rude, hostile staff and policies
Summary: My wife booked 2 nights through Hotels.com and then realized we needed the night before as well.  She called Expedia immediately to adjust things, and they were willing to honor the price, but said they must contact the hotel.  They called and sent an email, but weren’t able to get ahold of the manager and heard nothing back.  The hotel was inflexible on giving their approval to adjust the price, even though it would make sense.  More than that, though, it bothers me that they don’t give you many things that the majority of other hotels all over the country give standard: they charge $22 a night for parking. They charge 5.00 dollars per water bottles put in the room by the coffee maker.  They don’t provide an included breakfast, and something else I have rarely seen, they don’t

Summary: If you pay for a suite and expect a large suite, you'll be disappointed. The suite we got, although supposedly the largest one, was dark, with low ceiling, and the decorations were dark and depressing.  The hotel listed parking at $18/night, but would charge me close to $22 because they would have to add taxes on top of that. That was a little annoying.  The hotel staff I interacted with wasn't great. Probably all Hilton receptionists in the Anaheim area are the same, by some reasons. I would recommend not to stay at a Hilton in the Bay Area, especially if you're a minority. Next time, I'll be going back to having a suite at the nearby Marriott.

The Lady from Front Desk who answered the phone was very nice and patiently listening to my request. She did put a note on all of my reservations and she said “ her team will follow up on the arrival date for the room assignment so we could stay in the same room for the entire nights. She was so professional to explain that it is not 100% guarantee, however they will try their best to accommodate my request. Martina Hummel, you are amazing! We are looking forward to staying at the hotel this weekend June 21 and

Summary: This DoubleTree needs investments across the property, urgently. The suites are spacious but... The room decor and furnishings are very much dated- remember that era when people wanted to make their stuff look like an “Italian villa”? The sitting area furniture was pretty worn out. The fitness center is not very well-equipped. The restaurant closes “early” and there is only one bartender working between the kitchen and the bar. The place is “walking distance” to Disneyland, but give yourself time if you have children. It is about 1.5 mi to the entrance of Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Not a good two days experience

Front desk claimed that they need some "fax confirmation" from Marriott.   Being a Hilton Gold member each and every year for 20+ years.  I was extremely disappointed that not only we had to pack and move; and moved to the 1st floor with heavy traffic.

The room has all essential amenities including a refrigerator, plus a dining table.   One thing that surprised me is how quiet the hotel is. Located in a busy resort area, I heard virtually no traffic noise in my room (that may not be the case for rooms facing the street) and I'm usually very sensitive to noise. Summary Heading: Would stay here again for Disneyland.
Summary: Family trip with 3 kids to Disneyland. Hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and helpful, room was very clean, comfortable, and spacious. And who doesn't love the cookies?! The only mishap we experienced was when my toddler had an accident on the bed. We asked for a new comforter to be brought up, but instead we were brought 3 bedsheets. Not sure how that got misunderstood or whatever, but when it was brought to their attention they fixed it quickly.  Close enough to Disneyland to walk there (we did a few times), or you can walk across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and just take the tram over to the entrance, but those lines can get really long. Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Double Tree.  The staff were friendly, the place was clean.  The price was affordable!  It was easy walking to many places.  It was a very sound proof hotel the rooms were clean and updated.  The breakfast buffet was worth the cost, with the room price.  Alone it is expensive.  The beds were comfortable, the linens were great!  We loved the suite it had the bedroom and living room separate.  We also loved that the shower and toilet were separate of the mirror and sink.  Two of us ladies could get ready at the same time the mirror was so large.  We had a microwave and refrigerator.  I would recommend the suite even if it cost a bit more.  If you are staying more then a night or two it is worth it!  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Summary Heading: Ripped off and credit card hacked.
Summary: Not a bad place to stay but my credit card was hacked on arrival and used in both the UK and USA within 5 minutes of each other, apparently presented in person. Bank picked up on this and stopped the card. I don't usually travel with two credit cards but had one on this occasion otherwise my holiday would have been compromised. Hotel management didn't care and were totally disinterested in what had happened. The hotel reception was the first and only place I had used my card on that trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We appreciate your feedback as this allows us to constantly improve upon our guest experience. Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights with my partner as part of a West Coast tour from the UK. We use Anaheim as a base for various attractions including Disney, Queen Mary, Universal Studios/ LA. We usually stay at the Hyatt Regency however due to some work being done there and some previous room request problems we decided to try somewhere different.  We were very glad we did. Although this hotel  has a lower official star rating we were very pleasantly impressed. The suites are spacious, clean and the way they are designed you don’t hear corridor noise in the bedroom.  The staff were very friendly (much more so than the other hotel) and the beds were very comfortable. We slept well throughout. The suite was well appointed with a safe, coffee facilities, free WiFi, fridge and microwave.

Summary: We try to make it to Disneyland once a year and this hotel has come our go to place. If you have more than two kids or teens who don’t want to share a bed it’s great. Plus, the shuttle lines are faster than the Disney parking lines.   Rooms are always super clean, beds are pretty comfy. They use fitted under sheets (big deal to me). Charger outlets in bedside lights, good bath towels and hygiene products.   Elevators are quick and you don’t have to wait too long, which is a problem at some of the nearby places especially during peak hours. Summary Heading: The Birthday Girl Goes to Disney
Summary: Decided to spend my birthday at Disney with a little weekend getaway, tried to sneak down without the kid and grandkid but they caught me, so along they came. Choose this hotel on a whim and I'm glad we did. Room was a 2 queen suite, beds were comfortable, little living room area was clean and nice. I think what I really liked was the fact that the bedroom area had two doors, so if you are an early riser you can close the bedroom doors so others are not disturbed. If you have more than 4 people that works too because the couch is a sofa sleeper.  You can buy your Disney tickets on the property as there Disney actually has cast members that work there. There is also a little coffee bar that makes lattes, chai's, green tea lattes, so no need to hunt for a Starbucks.  Disneyland is

Summary Heading: NIce Hotel but some major CONS IMO
Summary: Stayed at this property several times over the last few years when attending a trade show at the Convention Center.  Pros -   - Staff is very friendly, welcoming and eager to help.    - Grounds are very attractive and well kept  - Rooms are spacious  - Hotel is way quieter than other properties I've stayed at during the same show  - Restaurant is normally available without reservations and food is above average. Cons  - Rooms are getting a bit dated and need work.  Furniture hasn't changed since I first stayed at this hotel most likely over 10 years ago.  It's due for a refresh   - For a major chain like the Hilton (even for a sub brand) the gym is VERY disappointing.  One treadmill, one bike and some weights.  If you want to work out, best you go around 5 AM or later in the

Summary: The staff is very nice, but I just felt the whole time that the property was just lacking something to make it better.    The brown overtones are too much. I'd say it's in need of an upgrade throughout.  But at this price point I get why it hasn't happened.    The beds are old springy and weren't great for me.  The rooms felt pretty clean but when everything is the color of fall it's hard to tell.   The little shop and coffee area carry short hours and weren't used as much as we would have liked.    The one thing that got me was a transient sleeping in the elevator area of one of the floors.  Was quickly dealt with but I can imagine how this happens just not sure why it happened.   This sounds overly negative in general but there were some good things.  It's not that far from

Summary Heading: Adequate for purposes, dated compared to Homewood Suites
Summary: Stayed in a one-bedroom queen suite with sofabed with pool view for 5 nights with two colleagues on a conference at the Anaheim Convention Centre.  Pros: The room was adequately spacious and provided for with all the usual amenities. Reception desk staff were friendly and helpful as all three of us were checking in at different times. It was handy that the very large vanity sink was outside the bath/toilet.  Cons: I emailed in advance to ask if I could have Amazon goods delivered to me at the address and was advised that there would be a USD5 charge for that! I’ve done the same at other hotels and never been charged before! The rooms are rather dated with a 90s feel. And the pool view was of a very tiny pool.  It was a standard hotel to stay in for me. Nothing particularly

Summary Heading: Very clean hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Room was a good size and very clean. We arrived late to hotel and we greeted with a friendly front desk person. Area located in was good as well. 15-20 minute walk into Disneyland/DCA area. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends staying in the area.

Summary Heading: Walk to Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: We chose this hotel because it is a Hilton and because of the walking distance to the Convention Center and Disneyland.  It only takes about 10-15 minutes to walk to the Convention Center, hotel staff can give you the shortest route through adjacent properties.  It is about a 20 min walk to Disneyland.  For our family that was ok, but with smaller children you may have some difficulty.  There is a shuttle stop across the street, but there is a fee to ride it over to Disneyland.  We opted to get the breakfast at the hotel instead of the points and we are glad we did.  The breakfast was a buffet and had a good variety.  My youngest forgot her toothbrush and I was able to get one from the front desk.
