Manager Response: Good Morning    Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. You are our most valued guest. We sincerely appreciate and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations with our customer service at our hotel.   Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Your feedback will be share with all Managers.

Summary Heading: Very large room, the entire hotel is very spacious
Summary: Stayed here with family for 3 nights to visit Disneyland, Our room was very spacious, large living room with plenty of seating, a microwave and mini fridge.  Bedroom was large  with floor space and closet space for suitcases. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and spacious.  Overall housekeeping do an excellent job of keeping it very clean and leave towel animals throughout the room, very cute for the kids.  The walk to Disney is a long one about 20 mins, there is an Art station outside if needed.  I would love to stay at this hotel again. I should mention there is a small starbucks in the lobby and a well stocked gift shop for last minute supplies, the gift shop also sells Disney toys etc. Lobby is large with a lovely restaurant and bar. We had room service 2 nights

Place is spotless, and kids eat free! We had 2 rooms and on both rooms they had the main room separated from the bedroom. We had a sofa-bed in addition to the 2 other beds! Great place, and 10 min away from Disney and Knotts.

We book a night here to help with the overall price of our Disney adventure ( park hoppers $300+ ( MIL rate ) Two nights at Paradise Pier $800 ( MIL rate ) and staying at Double tree was excellent nice room, good service, friendly staff. good location , free shuttle to the park. What more could we ask for and at fraction of the price.

I'd recommend this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and close to everything, especially theme parks. Staff were excellent.they organised tours for us and rang shuttle companies. We arrived early and they accommodated us as best they could.

This is one of our favorite places to stay while visiting Disneyland. Conveniently located near Disneyland without the close to Disney price.  Double room suites make this the best Family place for us!  The Kids eat Free for ALL meals at the excellent quality restaurant make this an extra great deal!

Rooms were good sized and clean, need to replace sofa sleepers, very uncomfortable. Desk staff should have given us information about the bus prices when we ask for location to catch. After paying full fare another guest explained the three or five day passes, which were cheaper.

This is the 2nd time I stayed at this hotel. Both times were exceptional. Being a business traveler the rooms met my needs...very nice, clean, hot water9 and each time they had a desk area.  No issues with the internet connection or strength of signal. Location is excellent. Walking distance to the outlet mall, restaurants and movies. Easy access from the highway and a short drive to the baseball stadium, hockey arena and Disney. There is a hospital directly across the street. Because this is a pick up location for Disney and various tours the lobby does get busy in the morning. Minor traffic noise. Breakfast buffet offers many choices. Be sure to try the breakfast empanada. I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Always a good place to Stay
Summary: Great hotel, great staff, breakfast buffet is amazing!  Parking is easy and a quick drive to Disneyland.  Can walk to convention center and the park  Uber is also fast and inexpensive highly recommend this hotel

Summary Heading: Love this place and the Manager!
Summary: Thank you Freddy (manager), for taking such good care of my family.  You made what we needed happen and I am so grateful to you for that!!! I feel like I was bugging you so much, but you were so patient and kind, so kudo's to you!  I am so glad my sister did not have to stay one night in another hotel!!! This is a great hotel with nice sized rooms and so close to Disneyland!!!  But the Manager and staff makes the real difference at any hotel.  So thank you again for your unending efforts and time on this.  We will be back for sure!!!!!

Summary Heading: Trip to Disney to celebrate Anniversary
Summary: We reserved at this property because of it's location to Disney and the price point for the area. We arrived before their check in time because our flight from Seattle was early. The concierge gentlemen was friendly and informative. Our room was not yet ready so we left our bags and came back later, after 5.   When we returned to check in there were three people behind the front desk, one helping another guest. I walked up to the counter to check in and was curtly told to get in line. There was no line! Once we checked in we got our cookies, given our keys and not so much told to enjoy our stay, thanks for being HHHonors guests and absolutely no mention of our 25th wedding anniversary, which was noted on the reservation. OK, not the best first impression.  We got to our room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. As a Hilton Honors member, you are our most valued guest. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: The hotel's facilities were convenient and clean. The appliances in the room made it easy to keep, reheat, and prepare food for a couple of days.   There are a lot of restaurants and supermarkets in walking distance.

Love the room and everything else.  I enjoyed my stay there.  Only wished it was little cheaper.  Next time I'm in the area I will definitely choose Hilton again.  I will also pass the word to my family about the positive experience I had on my visit

Very nice accommodations and was able to walk to Disney.  The beds and pillows were great.  The cookies were delicious.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The hot tub was inviting after a day at Disney.

Summary Heading: Staff was tentative to additional requests
Summary: Bed was very comfortable. I really liked the layout of the suite. Would work well for 4 people. Gives plenty of space to spread out. Asked for extra coffee creamers and was set each day. Room very clean!

stayed at the DoubleTree Suites by Disneyland. Hotel is walking distance from the park but would recommend using the public buses. Senior price was  just 1 dollar a person- with all the walking in the park the bus ride is nice.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel staff is very friendly and the room is clean. The pool was nice and heated. The outdoor parking lot is very convenient. The hotel is very close to the Convention center and Disneyland. Only downside was the food quality at the hotel restaurant. The taste of the food was mediocre. Overall, my family had a great time at the hotel and we will be back again.   Don't forget to ask for the chocolate chip cookies. So good!

Since the size of the room was that worth the price, it was comfortably able to spend. It was inconvenient that a tiny child did not have a stepping stool to use on a sink. In addition, it was complained that there was no fresh salad in the buffeting of breakfast. All the staff at the restaurant were smiling and friendly, so we had a pleasant morning. Thank you

Summary Heading: Perfect place for our Disney trip!
Summary: Clean, comfortable beds, and easy access to Disney via ART. We had two suites, group of 7, with the breakfast plan. Breakfast buffet was wonderful, with full and varied selection and highly recommend before heading to the parks. The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) system can be accessed right in front of hotel and also across the street. Runs every 20-30 minutes and drops you right at entrance to security. Tickets can be bought at the front desk and Disney tickets can also be purchased in a special area dedicated just for them. Wonderful staff throughout property, with everyone being friendly and helpful. Cookies are amazing and always available by asking at the front desk. Pool and spa were nice, with pool towels available for your use. The only negative is the parking rate

Hotel was clean and staff was great. We liked the suite we stayed in, but we could have stayed in something just as nice closer to Disneyland for less money. Overall we really enjoyed it. The restaurant downstairs was handy.

I brought the family to go to Disneyland and the Doubletree was a great place for us. The hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant. The hotel was within walking distance of Disneyland (about a mile).  I got a good price online for our stay, but there are several additional charges that drove the price up quite a bit. (taxes, fees, $18 per day parking fee, etc.) I have a larger family, so the Doubletree is likely where we will stay again.

The location was close to Disneyland, walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center and next to a Ruth Chris Steak House. Morton's was across the street. 😀 Great accommodations, location superb, staff great. It's cheaper to get your Disneyland tickets there at the hotel $79.00.

I stayed at the Doubletree while traveling on business in order to attend a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. The hotel was an easy short way to the convention center - perfect for me. I had one extra day so I explored Disneyland. The hotel has a Disneyland information center that allows you to purchase park tickets.  The ART bus system for Disneyland has a stop right outside the hotel. A pass for the bus was purchased at the front desk for $5.50 which was good all day. Disneyland is a walkable distance from the hotel but being an avid Walt Disney World traveler, I knew I needed my steps for park exploration and used the bus instead.  One last tip, I used a van shuttle service from the airport.  It was the better part of an hour to get to the airport to the hotel due

I am looking forward to our next weekend getaway.  We will most deffinitly be staying here again.  The bed and pillows were the best part, so comfortable.  I also enjoyed the room, disnt here any noise from anyone else.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Doubletree! What an awesome hotel!  Everyone was so nice and helpful during our entire stay!  Very clean and well maintained!  Excellent breakfast and the staff went out of their way to make sure everything was just right!  Will be back!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel and close to Disney Land and Convention Center
Summary: The hotel was very nice and the staff most helpful.  I enjoyed a very nice room with a great bed.  The appear of the lobby was good and check in and check out were effortless.  I would stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Don't forget anything in the room
Summary: Everything was great but at the very end my daughter left a very expensive pillow in the room her own and the front desk with nasty and intractable and charge me for the shipping back to my home after spending thousands of dollars on a couple of nights stay. This attitude soured me on the Hilton attitude in relationship to hospitality

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when traveling with family
Summary: We love the Doubletree Suites when we visit Disneyland, as our kids are grown and the suites provide so much space.  The warm cookies at check-in are an extra bonus!  Beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are always clean.

Stayed here with Family for a three day Disneyland trip. Everyone was impressed with the hotel and staff.   Best advise is to get the rate that includes breakfast. It is usually only $10/nigh more but includes a great breakfast buffet for two adults and 2 kids. Best deal in town!

I'm disappointed that I have to write this review because the hotel conditions were excellent and so was the location. But I'm so disappointed in Hilton for not looking out for a loyal consumer. I had asked them to transfer me to another Hilton brand hotel closer to my day-trip destination because I had a sudden change of plans. They told me to take it up with Priceline since I booked with them. I called Priceline and they said it was fine to change my reservation as long as DoubleTree was ok with it. Then DoubleTree said they wouldn't allow it.... so why waste my time and have me spend 35 minutes on the phone with Priceline when the decision was ultimately in their hands anyways? They told me that they couldn't refund me for this hotel because they would've sold my room because
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are our most valued guest. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations with the hotel service. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: Room had someone else's trash in the trashcans as well as on the desk. Used bar of soap in the shower. Used glass cup next to the sink. Made me wonder if the sheets were changed. Overall not what I expected from a Hilton hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are our most valued guest. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations with the hotel service. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Your feedback will be share with all Managers. I sincerely apologized for all the inconveniences you had during your stay.

Summary: Family of 6 more than enough room for all of us!! Room service was fantastic! I would say on the moderate side of cost not too pricey, but definitely not too cheap. Great bar downstairs stayed open 1/2 hour later because I wasn't done yet! Great staff and service!

My daughter and I went to Disneyland to celebrate her birthday.  We've been coming to Disneyland every March for the last 4 years.  This was the first time I stayed at this hotel.  The hotel was nice and clean and the shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient. I will stay here again.

This hotel is centrally located to many venues in the Anaheim area, most notably, the Convention Center and Disneyland.  There are many restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, from the basic burger joints to the more upscale eateries.  The hotel room was comfortable, quiet, and clean.  Although I prefer the upper floors, I've stayed on the lower floors and they are just as quiet.

very nice hotel close to Disneyland.  friendly and quiet.  plenty of room in hotel and secure.  I like this place and would stay again.  don't like paying for parking but it is Anaheim.    I have never stayed at a bad Hilton.  This is a very nice hotel.

This place was just what we were looking for! We booked 3 rooms for our family that was joining us @ Disney.  The rooms are a bit dated but they are clean & comfortable.  The kids loved the pool although the weather was colder than normal.  The hotel is on the bus line to Disney so easy on/off.  Fresh cookies daily were a hit for all!  Only con was that the shower water temperature kept fluctuating during showers. That was not so fun...

Nice hotel. Quite, clean and easy to find. It'd be nice if the room window could open. We enjoyed the pool and spa on the roof (not top floor) but $18 for daily parking seems  a little high for the area Starbucks inside was handy too

Overall this hotel and location in proximity to Disneyland was very nice. The lobby and staff were very welcoming. The room was a decent size and decorated nicely for a family hotel. The cookies at checkin were great. I had two issues. 1) there is no way that our room with "two queens" were in fact queen size beds. Be prepared for two doubles! 2) Rooms always seem to have minor flaws but my biggest pet peeve with any hotel is hair that is not mine! I was greeted by strays more than once. Bathtub, floor and also on my fresh towel. Yuck. However the price was great and we were very happy with the service and food at the restaurant.

We have been staying at this hotel annually for at least five years.  It's proximity is close to the Convention Center and the staff are very knowledgeable and pleasant.  We will undoubtedly be back again next year.

Summary Heading: To Suite or not to Suite...
Summary: A room disguised as a suite. Hotel 6 have bigger room, than the " want to be suite" The property is nice from the outside and they charged $18.00 to park. You can park a block away, at other property for free and walk
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are our most valued guest. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely Freddy Cruz  Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Under gilt on doubletree name expectation. Rooms are not good. Air conditioning not working .Especially not heating.2 very cold nights .It seems not only my room problem in the morning a lot of other guests complaining. Breakfast without any cheese option. Under standard hotel. Also the noise of a/c if working! No chance to sleep as well
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. At DoubleTree by Hilton, we promise to do whatever it takes to ensure you are satisfied and hope you will consider staying with us in the future.    Sincerely,   Freddy Cruz  Front Desk Supervisor   DoubleTree Suites by Hilton   freddyc@doubletreeanaheim.com   714-750-3000

Summary: This is a great hotel.  The rooms are large and very clean.  The hotel staff is friendly. They offer a full breakfast buffet with great options which definitely allow you to get your money's worth.  It is within walking distance to the convention center and Disneyland!  Great place to stay!

Great customer service. Delicious cookies and very, very clean. Since we checked in they made us feel right at home.  The room was very clean and had all the amenities we need it. We look forward for our next stay at this hotel.

I travel for work, and stay in various hotels, however, this is one hotel that stood out to me. It's close to many many restaurants and attractions, and isn't a far walk from Disneyland. Such a convenient location, everything is pretty much within walking distance if you don't wish to drive.  The rooms are very nice, and very spacious. Had a drink or two to relax after a long day at the bar downstairs. Overall, enjoyed my stay at this property and the free cookies are always a plus. ;)

The room was great!!!   The entrance and restaurant always had a cigarette smell. Refused to go to the restaurant after the first night as my salmon dinner was tasteless with the smell coming across the room.  Smokers would go outside but they would be by the main door where the smoke would draft in every time the automatic doors would open.  Speaking to the staff they claimed they would inform their management.  Smokers need to be around the corner.    Absolutely loved the room and pool!

The location of the Double tree makes this is avery ideal location to stay when going to Disneyland.  Not too close as to avoid traffic and noise, but not too far as well.  Cab ride to Disneyland for four only 15.00 with tip.  Cheaper than parking at Disneyland.

Beautiful and spacious hotel with nice view from our 6th floor; Queen suite well appointed and appreciate the coffee, frig and microwave.  Here for cheerleading event at Disney. Kind of steep parking $18/day.  Kids-eat-free with a paid adult entree was helpful--a very good idea!

Very Clean, helpful Staff, cookies were great, good food, was greeted and check in and checking out was very good. Close to shops and restaurants in walking distant. Convenient for meetings and conventions.

Summary Heading: Nice looking hotel - Had bad bar experience
Summary: I want to ensure people know that I did not stay at the hotel however I did visit it while meeting with friends for a few beers. Its a nice looking hotel and I found parking easy. I was greeted by a bartender by the name of Morgan and you she is the exact opposite of customer centric. Ever time a friend or I ordered a drink she sighed you could tell she truly wanted no part of being there and was rude/curt. We actually left to go eat after a few drinks when we were planning to eat there just because the service she provided. A table behind us sat and waited for service for what seemed for ever and she didn't care. Overall a very rude person that I cannot understand how management has her as a forward facing person that is a representation of their business and culture.
Manager Response: Dear theortiz12345  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review. We’re very sorry your experience at our property wasn’t up to our usual high standards.  We’ve addressed the problems you mentioned with the service from the bar. Thank you for alerting us to this issue, and we hope you’ll give us another chance to make it right.

Summary: I would stay here agin again. The staff went above and beyond for us. Anything we needed was just a phone call away and was taken care of quickly. The only downside was the parking fees being charged by calendar day instead of 24 hour day when it is a ticket entry/exit system. I could see if it was valet charging daily.

Stayed nearby, but came to the Doubletree for dinner the first night in town.  After a fairly good dinner in the hotel restaurant I stopped by the front desk and although I was not a guest of the hotel, they shared one of their famous chocolate chip cookies with me.  FABULOUS.  The next day I returned for a meeting and the meeting room, service, lunch and set up at breaks were all very well done.  KUDOS all around to this hotel and staff.

How can you go wrong when your stay starts with warm cookies?  Check in was friendly and quick and the room was clean and a decent size.  My room was missing some of the papers listing the amenities and options for food, but that was easily fixed by accessing the Hilton Honors app on my phone.  The gym was on the small side, but had everything I needed.  Overall, this hotel fit the bill for what I needed, and I'd definitely return again if on business travel.

Very clean hotel, close to everything, shopping, restaurants. Hotel employees are awesome and helpful, their in house restaurant is great, breakfast buffet was great. Only downfall was that Starbucks was closed on Sunday

There are a ton of choices in the area so it's all about what's important to you. Having a restful sleep, plenty of comfortable amenities, and the perfect location are important to me and my family on our Disney trips. This hotel seemed like it had it all: the staff is friendly, the walls are pretty thick, and the ART bus stops right outside but the sleeping accommodations are pretty bad. There are two queen beds in one room of their 'suites' and the living area has a hide-a-bed. So first off, there is no chance for parent privacy with this set-up and this is the only room set-up they offer. Secondly, hide-a-beds are notoriously uncomfortable but usually decent enough for a young person's back, well, not at this hotel. The mattress had spring popping out of the surface. When I

Summary Heading: Hotels located by Disney Land, Anaheim, Ca.
Summary: There are many hotels located close by Disney Land  Anaheim, CA. which one has a choice to bed down. Going on line, I selected Doubletree Hilton Hotel, located at 2085 South Harbor Drive ,phone : 714-750- 3000. You will find that most hotels in this area have a price range that varies. However, They seem to all be close in price to one another. I paid $ 120 bucks per night one day prior to arrival. ( Would have saved some money had I booked 2 days ahead of my arrival). Having stayed at a number of Double Tree Hotels across the US of A  and in foreign countries,  I expected they would all be the same. This one of the few I found to be different then the norm, because it is in a resort area.. As an Honors member - example: no social hour.  They may charge you a parking fee of $ 18

Summary Heading: Very nice room and nice staff
Summary: Was in town for a wedding at the Santa Anita race track and this location is perfect.  Room was clean and the staff was extremely friendly.  One of the big selling points is the shuttle that will run you back and forth to the racetrack, so no-one has to drive and risk getting a duii.  Very nice touch to the GM on that amenity.  Will stay again.

My stay was very welcoming starting with the Bellman greeting us and Krystal at front desk doing everything in her power to accommodate our stay. We where staying for a wedding and had to check in earlier then expected. She was able to help us out and gave my friends and I a warm cookie. The room was clean and up to Hilton standards. The Bartender, sadly I don't remember her name, was also an amazing person to converse with while my friends and I waited for our photographers. Overall, the stay was great. Could not have been more happier to stay at this location.

Got a very good rate which made this hotel more attractive. Great location and clean facilities. Very good staff. No issues with parking as a hotel guest. We had great views of Disneyland fireworks. Did not have time to use any facilities, but they look nice.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and proximity to the happiest place on earth!
Summary: This was a recommendation from a friend who has 3 kids and wanted to stay within budget for a Disney weekend.  I must say that having this option saved us tons of money and will allow us to frequent more often.  We had a great suite and bought bus passes to the park although walking is easier (4-5 blocks).    The service was great and the hotel wasn't chaotic with park goers.   The complimentary breakfast was quite a spread and the kids free dinner meal was perfect.   Would definitely make this our go-to hotel for all of our Disney visits!

My room was non-smoking, and was ok during the day, but it smelled like a smoking room from midnight till early morning hours. I don't know it is a ventilation issue, but it made its difficult to breathe and sleep.

Our family stayed at the Doubletree Anaheim and we were very satisfied with the accommodations.  Room was very clean.  Staff were very helpful.  No noise issues.  The onsite restaurant had quality selections for breakfast.  Would definitely recommend.

This Hotel is our favorite - the staff is EXCEPTIONAL at the Restaurant for Breakfast and the Front Desk after Midnight!  We drive in from the San Francisco area and typically do not arrive until 1-2 AM.  The Front Desk is always prepared when I arrive and gets me and the family to our room as quickly as possible.

Summary Heading: Nice moderate hotel with HUGE rooms!
Summary: I don't have much to say about this place except that it has huge rooms! For the price, you get a lot here! Really impressed with the value. Everything seems a bit old and worn but it's clean and it's spacious. It's also walking distance to Disney.

Clean hotel and rooms. The rooms are also very quiet. The staff is friendly and courteous. The only negative I have is that the bartender at the hotel bar was extremely forgetful and inattentive. Find a different bar for a drink or a quick bite.

The Value versus Price is way off the charts at this establishment!!!  Customer Service was equal to the Customer Service we received at Club 33 in Disneyland.  NO JOKE!!!!  Club 33 Customer Service was the BEST we have ever experienced!  Every contact we had with every employee was SUPERB!!!!  I am very picky when it comes to this subject and I would give a much higher score than EXCELLENT if offered.  We will be back and I highly recommend the DoubleTree by Hilton in Anaheim.

Would highly recommend the Doubletree if you have events to attend at Disneyland or Anaheim Convention Center. It is very clean, beds are comfy, and walking distance to convention center or Disneyland.

Quiet.  best thing about it is it is quiet even when you think it shouldn't be. I've stayed here several times off and on and every time I almost can't get out of bed because it's so comfy and quiet.  Did I mention quiet?

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not a good stay
Summary: I want to start this review by saying that I responded with these comments in an email survey and in an email written to a manager at the hotel. I did not receive any response from the staff regarding my comments so I am posing them here for guests to beware of potential difficulties during their stay.   On the final night of your trip, Dec 10, it was my daughters 3rd birthday. After a long day at Disneyland we headed back to the hotel to have dinner. The restaurant was closed due to a private party so we decided to order from the bar and take the food up to our room. It took almost 20 minutes for the bartender to take our order due to the amount of people coming into the bar and she was the only person working. She was very kind and apologetic and suggested that we go up to our

Summary Heading: Great stay in a great location.
Summary: Quick walk to the convention center and activities on Katella. Good restaurants nearby and including the hotel restaurant. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. As always the family loved the cookies upon check-in!

Overall my stay was very nice. The room was large and bed was very comfortable.  I ordered room service for dinner and it was delivered promptly. The only issue I had was that the Wi-Fi signal was very weak.  I am not sure if it's because my room was towards the end of the hall or just a week signal overall. There is no valet parking but they do have self parking for a fee.  I would recommend this hotel for both business and personal stays.

I loved my spaces 2 bedroom. good room temperature, and perfect shower and spacious bathroom. I had requested a small refrigerate for my medical needs and quick to respond. I preferred my privacy  and left a do not disturb sign and it was honored.

Superb hotel, attractive, clean, comfortable, excellent staff, near to major highways and local attractions. If you prefer using quality bathroom tissue take your own, bottled water in room appears complimentary but charged at $5/bottle. Vehicle parking an expensive $18/day. In all, the quoted daily room charge is deceiving because by the time the Anaheim and California Tourist Taxes and Fees, plus parking is added to the bill the daily charge is significantly higher.

Helpful staff and clean comfortable rooms. We have stayed here for 7 years in a row during a convention and have never regretted it. Twice during to family emergencies the hotel management went out of their way to be help us out.

Hotel very nice appearance, good location, easy to find. Have digital keys as well as card keys. Check in ok. Staff could use some additional training on accuracy. Halls clean. Hotel clean. Room was spacious and appealing. Bed was very comfortable! Rooms are very quiet. With our children carrying on being children we never disturbed anyone, also didn't hear outside hall noise. Hotel restaurant was decent. Had specials. Mixed drinks weren't that good. Breakfast buffet was good, convenient. Chefs though didn't know what was in a hotel specialty dish. Room service was satisfactory, personnel very polite.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel. Fabulous staff that cares about your comfort!
Summary: We came to Anaheim, California to run the RunDisney Star Wars Challenge. We flew in early to rest up for the races on  Saturday and Sunday. We were so happy with the DoubleTree Suite. It afforded us plenty of space to have our Race Outfits, gears and nourishment laid out the night before the race. We also enjoyed the comfort of returning to the hotel for showers and naps before heading to Disneyland. Every staff member we encountered was warm and welcoming. They really made us feel welcome. It was a wonderful trip, thanks to the DoubleTree Suites in Anaheim. THANK YOU! WE ARE GRATEFUL TO HAVE HAD SUCH A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

I have stayed at this hotel many times. It is a beautiful hotel with very friendly, helpful staff. Also, the breakfast buffet is very good.  Unfortunately, I will not be staying at this property going forward. On my last trip I came home with A LOT of very painful bug bites.  They must be from bed bugs, but I am not sure if they came from the couch or the bed. I am just thankful that my 7 month old was in a crib and was not affected.  I have posted pictures - sorry if they look gross, but I want everyone to be warned!  We were in room 502 from 01/12/2017 - 01/16/2017

I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton, during my visit to Anaheim. I would recommend it friends. The area was extremely eventful for me since I've never been to that side of California. On my planned return to the area in June, I will make prior arrange to stay at Double tree. The area was always clean and presentable, all areas that were dangerous from wet substance were marked with caution signs on display.

My family and I just recently stayed at the Doubletree in Anaheim because we were going to be participating in the Disney Star Wars run. The girl in the front lobby who checked us in was very polite and helpful. It is so true what other reviewers say about their cookies, they are yummy and warm. My family loved them.   Room was very nice and clean when we arrived. Our towel rack had a bow made out of a towel,that was pretty amazing. The view was not all that because we were looking out and had a perfect view of the Carl's Jr sign and the gas station =) and able to see Harbor Blvd (Room # 333). One thing that was very disappointing was housekeeping. We left our room early on Saturday and did not return till almost 3pm and housekeeping had not come by to clean our room. We heard

My family and I drove up the night before going to Disneyland and the hotel staff did an awesome job in welcoming us with smiles and hot cookies! The hotel was very nice and the rooms were awesome! Thank you for a wonderful experience!!

Summary Heading: Bad Room Service Experience and Poor follow up from staff
Summary: My room service order was incorrect and while I realize that mistakes happen there was no apology and a lack of follow up from management when I reported the issue. It literally took them 90 minutes to get my salad with added chicken and dressing on the side correctly to my room
Manager Response: Dear deborahhQ1605ZY  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: A number of us stayed at this hotel whilst attending a conference in the Anaheim Convention Centre. The hotel is a 6 to 7 minute walk from the conference centre via a short cut through some other hotels and a parking lot (the hotel has a map with the short cut on it).   The staff who greeted us were very friendly and most helpful and provided us with some great tasting cookies throughout our stay.   The rooms are fairly large and comfortable if not in need of a little updating. Mine was keep very clean with different displays of towel-art throughout the week which was a nice touch.   We would definitely consider this hotel for the next conference in this area.

I stayed at this property with my wife and four kids for a trip to Disneyland. The staff was very nice, room was always clean and very spacious. My kids went swimming in the pool and spa and it was great. You can pick up bus passes at the front seat to get to Disneyland. If you have more than four people, might be better off with UberXL. Bus is supposed to come every 20 mins but more like 45.

Third year in a row at this hotel and we will come back again! Close to Disneyland and great rooms.  Friendly staff and great value. The hotel is only a mile from the park and we walked there and back each day, no problem. The rooms are large and have everything we need.  We love this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Nice staff, 15 min walk to Disney Land & Clean
Summary: Great hotel for family travelling with kids. You can take the shuttle bus from the airport straight to this hotel. The service was great, the hotel rooms were large and clean. The breakfast was decent, along with great service. If you're looking for a hotel that's part of the Hilton chain and want somewhere close to Disney Land and food. This hotel is a great option. I would definitely recommend it for big families and small. It was only a 15 minute walk to Disney. Saves on driving/parking/taxi.

I really enjoyed my stay. I felt at home and comfortable. The food was good. I enjoyed the restaurant and the breakfast buffet. The staff very friendly. The conference rooms were a little chilly but really nice.

Good welcome on arrival by reception staff. Hotel rooms are typically American but are comfortable and quiet. It kinda lacks atmosphere in the evening but is conveniently located particularly for the Convention Centre

I took my son to Disneyland between Christmas and New Year and, as a Diamond Hilton Honors member, decided to use points and stay off resort. Unlike Disneyworld in Orlando, I had read that staying "on property" was not as important at Disneyland......and that review was absolutely right. The DoubleTree Suites were literally a 5 minute bus ride each way to Disneyland and the bus stops are at the front of the hotel so no walk.  You could actually walk from the hotel to the park in 15 minutes. Close by are some good restaurant options as well. In addition to location, the hotel has a great breakfast and a nice bar for the end of day winding down and an outdoor pool/hot tub. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Mickey and friends at Disneyland in

Decided that we couldn't go to LA without a trip to Disney for my 2 little ones (4 yrs & 22 months). So the search for a hotel was tough. There are lots of hotels in this area due to Disney, which also bumps up the price. But it has good access to the I-5 which makes it easy for north, south and coastal areas. Needed an onsite car park too.  The main reasons for this hotel was that we got a deal with a suite, so we had a bedroom & separate living room. Which gave us (2 adults & 2 kiddies) space. There is a heated outdoor pool & jacuzzi. Not big though, so we were lucky to have had it to ourselves, probably because it was raining a bit. But when you're wet, doesn't matter...   My only grump is that there is a microwave which is located in a cupboard under the tv above the fridge.

PROS Nice size two room double suite Nightly view of fireworks Room service food very good. (Kolby burger, chicken wings) Breakfast buffet above average Shuttle to Disney Walgreen's & Target within walking distance Had a car. Didn't use it for two days Toilet/Shower separate from sink Microwave & Refrigerator Hotel staff very friendly especially server for breakfast  CONS Living furniture was not comfortable TV remote has no sleep timer (that I could find)  Would recommend hotel.

I liked the hotel in general. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Location was perfect for Disneyland as there is a shuttle every 15-20 minutes for the Disneyland park. I am not giving this hotel 4 or 5 stars because of the restaurant staff during breakfast hours. They were not welcoming and impolite to a certain extent. They just seemed unhappy. I went to the restaurant for 3 consecutive days  as I had booked the breakfast deal but my experience didn't change. On my next trip, I will most likely book a Hilton hotel and not a DoubleTree.

Stayed here 2 nights with my family for a quick Disneyland visit.  Check-in was ok but the front desk didn't put me in the room that I selected on pre-check via Hilton Honors.  That was a bummer since I couldn't see the fireworks.  However, cookie was good as always and to be fair to them, the resulting room was based upon my previous preference request.  The crazy thing was that housekeeping didn't show up at all despite leaving the room for the park from 9:30am- 3pm and again from 5:45pm-10pm.    The suite itself was up to Doubletree standards and comfortable.  Tub was a bit small but good shower.  The hotel restaurant features Italian food and was just "above average" in quality.  Service was excellent though.  The ambiance was definitely 1998 though.  They don't have their
Manager Response: Dear Brad S  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: Great location and excellent property. The room was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The only thing that would improve this hotel would be a contenetial breakfast. Would definitely consider staying here again

The hotel is conveniently located and is perfect for families, room had enough beds for all of us even though it was not very spacious we slept super comfy. Remember to take in account there is an additional daily parking fee. My recommendation for a large family going to Disney is taking an uber instead of a bus it was about $5 cheaper and a lot more comfortable.

The Doubletree staff provided excellent customer service and the Housekeeping staff kept our room neat and clean.  Excellent service by all Doubletree staff.  We will definitely be staying at the Doubletree during our Disneyland vacations.

Stayed for 6 days over the Christmas period. We had a room on the seventh floor overlooking the pool.  The reception staff ( actual ALL staff ) were very professional and friendly. Nothing was to much trouble for them.  On arrival we received a warm cookie which just made you feel that little bit special. Our room had two queen beds, the room was very clean and modern looking. The bathroom area was also very well presented.      These little things make it 10/10. I had asked for extra pillows & blankets when confirming the room via internet and these were already supplied in the room.  The hotel is within walking distance to many great resturants as well as the Disneyland Park  & freeway access. Check out was very quick and  we will be returning to this hotel when on our next

We stayed at a 2 queen bed suite with an adjacent small living room with an extra TV; microwave and fridge. Clean, spacious and as a Hilton Honors member we had a choice between breakfast downstairs or 1,000 points. It is too chilly to use their pool, but it looks nice for a hot summer day. We only gave it a 4 because the hotel is showing its age and a restoration would be optimal.

We walked everywhere!  Great place, staff helpful. Rooms do need updating but still a good clean place. Lots of dining places to go to  stayed over Christmas and were very satisfied. We will stay here again if in the area.

My friends and I have stayed at Double Tree 2 years in a row while going to Disneyland and this hotel is perfect. They offer you a cookie when you arrive, the representatives at the front desk are so sweet, and there is a shuttle that takes you to disneyland that stops at the hotel. Plus there's free wifi which is great if you're out of the country!

Summary Heading: Comfortable Rooms and Great location to Parks
Summary: We experienced friendly,courteous staff and clean rooms. For your convience a shuttle is available out front and for a small fee will take you to Disneyland or you can walk up a few blocks and take the free shulltle that can be found in the Disney land parking lot and this will drop you off at both parks and downtown Disney. We enjoyed our visit and have already booked to stay here again in 2017.

Our family stayed here during my daughters wish trip through Kids Wish Network. We loved our room! We were on the 7th floor and could see some of the fireworks from Disneyland at night. We had the breakfast buffet each morning. The service in the restaurant was always great, and the food was delicious! We loved our interactions with all staff! The ladies at the front desk, guest services, and housekeeping! Great customer service! We loved the warm cookies too! The room looked wonderful on check in! It was all decorated with finding dory for Lacey! 😍 They made towel animals, and such beautifully folded towels that were so cute the kids didn't want to use them! We loved our stay, and were really sad to go home!

We stayed for 5 nights during Christmas time and it was awesome! Our room was clean and the staff was so friendly. It was a great price, too. The beds were comfortable and we couldn't hear any noise from the rooms around us. We took advantage of the shuttle from the parking lot that takes you right to the Disney front gate. So convenient, and it cost about the same as we would have paid for parking driving there ourselves.

Close to Disneyland, shuttles available. Spacious suites and clean.  The lobby could use refreshing.  The carpet and sofa has seen better days and did not look very clean upon entrance.  I would think the facility would like to make a great first impression. Staff ok, no complaints.

We stay at this hotel several times a year when we go to Disneyland! The bus picks you up right outside the hotel, the rooms are always clean and the warm cookies at check in are always a plus! The little one manages to get a few cookies during our stay :-) The hotel staff is exceptional and always very accommodating. We love staying here!

We are frequent Disneyland visitors and stay at this Doubletree as often as available. With two kids, we love the suite. I get my TV and the kids get theirs. The bar and Saturday night bartender are the best. If I have any complaints,  it's the restaurant seems to have gone down hill somewhat. Not bad but not as good as it used to be.

Summary Heading: A great Hotel to stay with family
Summary: This is a great place to stay with the family for your visit to Anaheim either for Disney or someone you are visiting in the clusters of healthcare facilities in the neighborhood.   The best treat was for kids to collect their cookies bags from the reception every evening. A very thoughtful and unique gesture. The kids love this place

Summary Heading: Amazing stay...can't wait to go back!
Summary: This was my family's first trip to Disneyland and we found this hotel at a VERY good price! The hotel itself is super clean and has a very welcoming atmosphere. Check-in was a breeze and the young lady that helped us was incredibly nice. We stayed in a two room suite that was very clean and spacious enough for a family of four. Since the hotel is only a few blocks from the park, we decided to walk to Disneyland from the hotel and actually, it was not bad at all. It took us about 15-20 minutes to get there walking at a leisurely pace. Lots of restaurants and amenities are all around the hotel. Everyday when we would return from the park, our room was made up immaculately and, as we requested, extra hot cups for coffee were on our table. The room was very quiet and we never heard

Had a comfortable time and enjoyed my stay with no distractions and with the help I needed. Easy access to and from the freeway and to Disneyland park. Lots of amenities to choose from and lots to do near area

We have stayed at this location a number of times. The staff is always friendly and willing to help. The pool is a nice touch after a long day at Disneyland. Plus the park is just a few miles away from Disneyland. Highly recommend for parents and kids.

Summary Heading: Service was above and beyond from all staff
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. What stood out from most hotels was the level of engagement the staff provided. Any time we had a question for the front desk, the concierge, the cleaning staff, or the waiters in the restaurant, they were all delighted to help.  The hotel amenities are slightly above average. The pool is an ok size, and although heated, is still quite cool in the winter months. The hot tub was decent, and we found no more than 5-10 people were ever in the pool during our stay so we had it to ourselves a few evenings. Our room was on the 6th floor with a view of the pool. We did not upgrade to a Disney fireworks view room, although I received a dozen emails before our trip asking me to upgrade!  The room was one of 2 typical DoubleTree layouts.

We stayed here to be close to Disneyland. It is so convenient. The breakfast is great so not your typical buffet and the service personnel were so helpful and courteous. Our room was great and a larger size than normal hotel rooms. Great bang for your buck.

Very nice hotel.   We were able to walk to and from Disneyland &  California Adventure.   Very convenient to restaurants and shopping in the area.   The beds were very comfortable and we had a very enjoyable stay!

This is a great property right on the ART line which provides quick and easy access to Disneyland Resort and California Adventures. If you don't want to take the bus, it is only a brief walk away. Amenities are great and the staff is super helpful all the way around. If you are in Anaheim for Disney, consider staying here.

This was our third time staying at the Doubletree by Hilton in Anaheim and this hotel seems to get better and better. This is a great hotel for families. The suites are very spacious and a great place to relax after a long day at in the parks.  Thank you to the entire staff for making us feel so very welcome. Special thanks to Javier, Arianna, Lulu, Maria and Henry. We will be sure to book this hotel on our next visit.

The entire team bent over backwards to make this a great experience for our family. Front desk, bell captains, restaurant staff, room service staff were all fantastic. They made it a perfect place for our family during our Disney trip. We will be back!!

Stayed here for 14 nights recently in a double queen suite.  It was a great base for exploring LA.  Hotel was spotless although maybe a little dated in some areas. Staff all were friendly from the front desk to the coffee shop to the concierge! We walked to Disneyland with no issues at all!  Around 20 minutes depending on your pace but it's a flat easy walk.  Many restaurants within walking distance. Do yourself a favour and avoid the hotel restaurant. It was ordinary at best (I have a separate review for that!). Target is a long block away which was handy.  All tours will pick you up curb side from this hotel.  I travelled with my 2 daughters aged 14 & 17 and found the area very safe at night to walk around. Some rooms have views of the fireworks although ours didn't but I

Summary Heading: 2nd stay and enjoyed as much as the first.
Summary: We just got home last Saturday from a  10 day stay a the Hilton Doubletree in Anaheim. This our 2nd time staying at this hotel and we highly recommend to everyone, especially to one's with kids. The welcoming smiles, warm chocolate chip cookies to the comfortable amenities us just a few reasons why we really enjoy this hotel.

Great staff, great food, great hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for the value and location.  We purchased our Resort park tickets at the hotel along with shuttle passes. It was easy for me who coordinated 15 guests.

First of all, the staff here were very welcoming, friendly, and accommodating.  Our suite was a little dated, for instance, the pull-out bed was worn, but it was very clean and the linens were fresh and new.  The hotel is situated at the corner of two busy collector roads. Our room, 321, was at the back of the hotel and there was a fair amount of traffic noise. It is probably better to stay at the front of the hotel facing the parking lot where you would be able to see Disney fireworks at night. My travel agent requested a room on this side, but it didn't happen.  This hotel is a 1 mile walk to Disney park entrance, which is doable, but becomes tiresome after a few days. Easy alternatives are: transit bus $3.00 per person per way, free bus to Disney parking lot which is still a

This was a great hotel from the comfortable beds, layout of the suites, cleanliness of the rooms and helpfulness of the staff.  I can't think of one complaint.  The hotel is close enough to walk to Disneyland/California Adventure (about a mile) and is close to several restaurants, a couple of drug stores, etc.  We would stay here again.

Always nice place to stay clean and nice for the price. Close to Disneyland. The in room dining is good and the bar is nice. They also have a disney welcome center here.  The nice thing is that you are one of the first stops for the shuttle to pick  up and drop off to and from Disneyland.

This was a pretty nice hotel.  Stayed here while  attending a conference for work.  Pretty nice room, TVs are out dated though. The furniture was pretty up to date. May have to do with staying on the Hilton honor floor. Lobby staff was a little condescending when we were checking in because we had some issues with credit cards going through. Beds were comfy though. Wifi was not that great.

Will go back to this again this was the second time we stayed there and we had a great experience the rooms are great and the food is delicious there is even a Starbucks in the hotel can't go wrong there 😁

This is a very nice hotel I enjoyed our stay for what was needed which is somewhere to sleep in between visit to the park. the warm cookies whenever are a very nice touch as well. We only had one issue which was that we had requested pillows and blankets ahead of time knowing that we would need to use the couch bed and still had to call down for them.

Summary Heading: Family Visit during Disneyland Half Marathon
Summary: We had a great experience at the Doubletree Suites over Labor Day weekend while I was running the Disneyland Half Marathon. Our room was really large and quite spacious. I believe we were automatically upgraded to a suite, so it was so nice to have all the extra room. Love the Doubletree tradition of chocolate chip cookies upon checkin. My toddler was especially excited about this part. The bus stop that went to Disneyland was right across the street, so it was really convenient. That would be my only caution for traveling families. We walked back at the end of the night a couple of times and it was a pretty long walk by the end of the day after a long day of walking at the parks.

Summary Heading: Incredible Service and Great Place to Stay for Business or Pleasure
Summary: Without doubt, the DoubleTree Anaheim Convention Center delivered the best customer service and offered the most luxious accommodations at a fantastic rate.  For a corporate traveler that needs to do work on the road, this hotel thought out all the necessaties and delivered on customer service.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone that like the amenites of a large hotel but the feeling of a small intimate inn.

This is our 2nd stay here with our family.   We are very pleased with our stay.  The check in was very quick.  Our room service was amazing.  Our room was beyond being kept clean....made our stay very comfortable. The brunch in the morning. ..really enjoyed that..service excellent.  The WiFi was very inconvenient especially  for guests staying for more then a couple days.  Also the small coffee shop.....disappointing.  Every time we ordered something besides regular coffee....what we got wasn't what we wanted...water downed.   Rather spend else where and get what you requested.

I loved my stay! The staff were great! The Rooms were Beautiful, Clean, and Great Size. The Cookies they give out were the BEST COOKIES EVER! The Location was also a Big PLUS! I came here with my Family and we all Loved it!

Its hard to find great hotels with amazing customer service  . Thank you all, especially Diego from front desk welcoming . Made my stay a lot faster n smoother. Great place, would def. Recommend it to a friend .

We are a big family, stayed for eight days.... The front desk staff and housekeeping were amazing, cleaned our room thru all our clutter everywhere to perfection, Wi-Fi challenging...but everything else was perfect!

A great place to stay in Anaheim. Easy walk or shuttle ride to Disney. Front desk is always very helpful. They gave us great suggestions for places to eat and order out for dinner. Also, my kids love the warm cookies!!

The staff was great. Whenever we needed something they were willing to accomadate us. Also the location to Disney was also great. You could take the shuttle or just walk. We did both. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Its Okay, just don't have high expectations
Summary: We booked a room after reading reviews on tripadvisor and looking at the hotels website.  Our stay was three nights over Thanksgiving.  We were impressed by the appearance and the the cleanliness of the property. Pretty much ends there.  Pros:  Clean Property is 10/11 years old and still in okay shape Nice room layout, can fully close of the sleeping area from the bathroom and front parlor.  Cons:  Loud: we could here every door slam shut at all hours, rooms next to ours conversations and televisions  Staff: from the front desk to the bar, just not happy or polite. Wifi: not very reliable or strong Location: If you are booking for the parks, you are about a mile away Food: skip it Parking: $18.00 per day Beds: personal choice for many, I have certainly had better Premium

My stay is as warm the staff was friendly and courteous I always stay st the doubletree for their friendly warm staff  the doubletree offers all the amenities I look for   Friendly staff   The one thing I did not know or was the charge for overnight parking  expensive but Disneyland is expensive

This hotel is in a great location from Disney. You can take the bus to Disnelqnd across the street and when you came back from Disney the bus stops in front of the hotel. Hotel is very clean and very comfortable, great hotel I am pretty sure to came back

Chose this property given its reviews and proximity to Disney. Be aware that they charge you for daily parking and the shuttle to and from Disney. Apart from the buffet, this property and its service is underwhelming. We were initially given a room on one of the upper floors so we could watch the fireworks. When we got in there it was near a noisy ice machine so we requested a different room on the same or floor above. They could only accommodate on floors below and promised it had a view of the fireworks. It had a partial obstructed view. The buffet is a good option but the eggs were cold both days. The pull out couch in the suite is very uncomfortable. There were no dual vanities in the rooms which is surprising given the rooms accommodate families. The worst part of our trip
Manager Response: Dear Bob B,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered throughout your visit, and we’re working with our team to ensure the situations don’t happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again and give us an opportunity to show improvement.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property. Nickel and dimed for amenities
Summary: This property was beautiful and well maintained. However, the expensive parking fee, and lack of complimentary breakfast detract from what should be a lovely experience.Also, the staff would not answer the phone when called from the room telephone. When called from a cell phone, they answered promptly. This left the lasting impression that your prospective business was more important to them than your actual visit.

We stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is nice but could use some updating. It was clean and spacious. The beds were horrible however. Felt like an old spring mattress. The staff was nice. The buffet breakfast was not very good so I'd recommend skipping that.

Loved the hotel and its staff. Cleanliness and friendly hotel staff is what we look for and this is the place. My family and I love the fresh cookies too. We're Hilton members and this makes it worth it.

Summary Heading: so happy with my choice to stay here loved it
Summary: We checked in yesterday. Everyone has been super nice. The room is very clean and big. I was so happy. We will stay here again. We have passes to Disneyland so we come a lot. I have found the hotel we will use from now on. I am just so impressed with this hotel and staff. The disneyland hotels are so so expensive and this hotel is price very well and I think much nicer than any of the 3 disneyland hotel . I give them a A++++++

My hotel experience was most relaxing.  We were on the top floor.  The suite was well serviced each day.  Beds were soft.  Noise level from door slams was surprising low day and night despite heavy hallway traffic of other families coming and going.  I will definitely return back!

Summary Heading: Below par compared to other Doubletree
Summary: Chose this property after reading the reviews here. Review is primarily based on location, room as well as service level of staff. Having stayed at other Doubletree in London as well as Australia, I must say that this is by far one that is below my expectation. The suite we got is supposed to fit 5 but the there is hardly any space once the sofa bed is setup. Even with the sofa bed kept, the sitting area is tiny. Bedroom can hardly fit luggage without having difficulty moving around. Breakfast buffet selection is basic and for $15, I would personally look elsewhere if it is not for my Diamond status. Service staff efficient but don't expect any small talk etc. If you are staying here for the Parks, think twice as the walk talks about 20mins each way - this is after taking into
Manager Response: Dear wolfverine,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize that our location was not convenient. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Great stay,  hot tub cleanliness is gross
Summary: Basic hotel with large rooms,  suite style.  Cafe biscotti is nice that it serves Starbucks coffee but was totally out of food by 8:00.  The hot tub is disgustingly dirty.  It has a thick layer of dead skin in the water and around the rim.  So gross that we had to get out.  Makes me think that they never clean it or change the filter.   Rooms are clean but the walls seem paper thin.  You can hear people talking in other rooms and it sounds like someone is always dropping something in the room above us.   Bit of a ways from Disneyland but we are active and don't mind the walk.    Would stay here again though as it's a good value.

This hotel is a great place to stay.  The staff is friendly and it is kept spotless.  Plus it's close by to the theme park that starts and ends with a D.  My family and I stayed on the fourth floor in a two room suite, plenty of space in there for the four of us.

We loved this hotel and were not disappointed by a single thing! The staff is friendly and know their jobs well,  room service food is delicious and quick, the room was clean, location to Disneyland is perfect and target and restaurants are extremely close by, and thats very convenient!! We have stayed at other double trees but this one has been the best. Usually when we go to Disneyland we stay at the red lion but never again, this double tree will always be our Disneyland home away from home!!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Summary Heading: Wow The Best Service and Superb Suites
Summary: We booked a trip to Anaheim from Vegas to visit Disney , arriving at the Hilton at 8.45am . We were greeted and checked in with Arianna we received excellent customer service and our rooms were ready which was amazing at such an early time . Arianna,s greeting and service was superb and the hot choc cookie was delicious. Our suites were beautiful, spotlessly clean and very luxurious with everything you could need . We had a lounge with TV and desk , huge bedroom with 2 double beds and huge bathroom. This hotel was very luxurious we would definitely be back to facilitate all that it had to offer. It is only a short walk to Disney so ideal location if you are visiting. Well done Hilton for providing such luxury accommodation and the best customer service 11 out of 10 from our

The hotel was close to Disneyland so we were able to walk there each day with the option of taking the shuttle. The staff were extremely nice and made you feel right at home. We arrived at 8 in the morning so they were able to store our bags while we went to the park. We will be returning to this hotel for sure.

Booked this hotel due to running the 5k, 10k, and half marathon at Disneyland.  The runs have a 530am race time which means waking up at 3-330am.  While the hotel is quiet at that time of the morning, going to bed early to get enough sleep, 8it is not quiet.  Walls seemed kind of thin as we kept hearing a baby crying and what seemed like someone above us dropping a ball/marble and rolling on the ground (not sure what it was as the hotel has carpet in the rooms).  When booking for future runDisney events I will most likely stay somewhere else and who will grant me a later checkout time, so I have time to get back to the hotel, shower and get out the door.

We stayed during Avengers Marathon Weekend. 2 adults and 2 children, after arriving from a long haul international flight our ids were greeted with cookies even though room wasn't ready. Luggage storage was provided as well as full use of ammenities until room was available.  Rooms were exceptionally clean and beds very comfortable, quiet location within easy walks to Disneyland and Target for local supplies. Used the restaurant every morning for breakfast for which there was an abundance of offerings catering  from full breakfast eggs bacon etc, to healthy options. Restaurant staff were super friendly and very accommodating and restaurant was kept very clean.  The only thing I would suggest improving is the fitness centre, 2 treadmills one which was not working and some very

The room and hotel are maintained well.  The room was comfortably-sized and clean.  The noise from people walking by was noticeable though, as was the uncomfortable couch (sofa bed) making awkward noises every time you moved.  The staff were fine, though not outwardly friendly.  Breakfast buffet was quite sparse and parking was expensive (varied between $12-$18/day).  A bit far of a walk from the resort (about a mile), but close enough to the convention center.

poor maid service, expensive parking, noisy room, they obviously expect only Disney people to stay there, would not stay again, they are not Embassy Suites, hassles on bill and taxes said their accountant was not in-please
Manager Response: Dear Michael T  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: Friendly, helpful staff and a beautiful, clean king suite. The restaurant dining and room service was excellent. Staff took the time to show us a shortcut to walk to the convention center and we got hot cookies at the front desk each time we came back "home" to the hotel. Great experience.

Very good hotel. I like my room freezing when I'm sleeping it was. The cookies are awesome and the staff go above and beyond to make you happy. We got in a couple hours early for check in. I was really tired and the found a room that was ready. Staff is always smiling and ready to help if you need anything.

We had to stay here for a couple weeks and it turned out amazing! Everything was on point and the staffs were amazing! I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends out of state that wanna come and visit!!!

First time stay at this property, and I will stay here again. Room was large, beds/bedding comfy, loved the double sink vanity.  Carpets were clean, as was the entire room. Friendly service and housekeeping staff. Only negative was parking was $18. Walk to Disney took about 15-20 minutes.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at the double Tree
Summary: Great stay. Clean hotel, nice rooms ,friendly prompt check in. Would definitely stay again. Cookies are a nice touch:) Highly recommend. Convenient location to freeway and Disneyland. Didn't have a chance to use the pool or spa but it looked really nice. Oh, and there is a Starbucks on site:))

Love our suite with two t.v.'s. We could see Disneyland fireworks from our room. Very comfortable stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, made for quick meals. Enjoyed the bar at the hotel too.

We have never been to Disney for a Halloween celebration..glad to find a Doubletree close by. We've stayed at a Doubletree before but this one is so nicer, service was great! Only thing I would probably ask is to consider lowering the self parking fee.

Nice hotel rooms with a great location and a helpful, friendly staff.  Entire experience was great except for one small issue (I ordered a movie and it was shown on a standard def channel,  not hi-def like the standard channels).

Love this hotel! High quality service. Beautiful lobby.. close to Disneyland. Staff was helpful. I like the bar and the food quality was excellent! Staff provided helpful tip for my visit to Disneyland.

Stayed 4 nights because of a conference I had to attend at the nearby Convention Centre.   The furniture in the room is old but the carpet and fittings appear to be quite new. Coffee machine provided with supplies from the Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf were nice. Microwave provided as well. Bathroom shower curtain rail was well thought through - it curved outwards so that the shower curtain didn't stick to your elbows during a shower as it would have in a straight, narrow installation.   Had a lovely birthday dinner in the Italian restaurant on the ground floor. Our server, Freddy, provided excellent service and offered a free dessert since it was my birthday that day. Very good chocolate cake that should not be missed!  Overall it was a pleasant enough stay in a clean room with a
Manager Response: Dear Joanne,  Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We truly appreciate it when customers take time out of their busy days to provide us with some open and honest feedback about our hotel and services.  I'm surprised to hear your feedback about the room furnishing as they were updated in Fall 2014.  I will pass along your feelings to the hotel management team.  Once again, thank you for taking the time to let us know how you feel. We appreciate your loyalty and truly want to make your experience as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: My husband and I had a fabulous stay! Greeted us with smiles and warm delicious cookies, but I wish they offered free breakfast. The room was clean and impeccable. Each time we came to the front desk we were attended to on a timely fashion.

Summary Heading: Nice space when traveling for work.
Summary: Stayed three nights.   The room was clean and comfortable.  Nice space that works well if you have to actually do some work out of the room as I did.   Friendly staff.   The breakfast buffet is good except they could do a better job making sure there was enough food out there.   The scrambled eggs were a little dry.  Plenty of parking and you can enter and exit the lot at will.  Within good walking distance to some nice restaurants, mostly chains, but nice nonetheless.  This was m second stay here and will probably stay here again when in the area.

Stayed here for 1 night. Reception area was cold and the bar was too cold to sit there and relax in. Very strange to be given warm  cookies these were chocolate and walnut and given from behind the reception....they could do with handing out other kinds of cookies as no thought to those with alergies. Our room was comfortable, no kettle though. Not sure I'd stay here again

Terrible service. Consierge especially. They also won't call you a cab. Insist on calling expensive and fancy town cars. Pool is in the shade and not great. No pool side bar service and not a nice place to hang out and relax. Lobby is lovely but restaurant has no ambiance and food is mediocre at best, evidenced by the fact that no one eats there. The hotel is very clean and nice, and the beds comfortable. We wouldn't stay here again. Also, the cafe is only open in the morning, which was a pain when we'd get back for a few hours break for Disney and want a cup of coffee.
Manager Response: Dear trevorb952  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: This is THE hotel for families! This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel with our family, which includes our adult autistic son and our 12 year old son.  The rooms have a separate bedroom with 2 queens and a tv. The main room has a sofa sleeper, chair, tv, desk and chair. We buy the breakfast package and everyone is happy with the options available. The ART (Anaheim resort transit) stop is right outside the hotel, it takes you to serval locations around Anaheim. You can buy tickets at the hotel or online.  This hotel is a great way to start and end your day.

Excellent!  Room was great.  Location to Disney was perfect since it was within walking distance.  Staff was friendly.  We enjoyed the hot cookies upon arrival.  Although we didn't have time to use the pool, we had a great view of it.  It looked lovely.

Gracious friendly staff, local bus to Disney stops at front driveway and close to every thing. Good restaurant and clean rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you want to be close to the action but not in a congested area this is a good option. Our six year grand daughter was treated like a little princess and was enchanted by this place as an extension  of her Disney adventure.

Will make this my usual hotel when in this area.  Did a good job of accommodating us with handicapped mother in law.  Made us feel welcomed and proud when we checked in with my just graduated Marine son.

Summary Heading: Too Many Options in Anaheim to Waste Your Money on This One
Summary: Unfortunately, I was forced to stay at this hotel because of a conference I attended there.  When a business emergency forced me to arrive a day later than planned, I was shocked to find out that there was a 72-hour cancellation policy, which I missed by 4 hours.  They were intractable in sticking to this, so I was forced to pay for a night I didn't use.  In addition, we were not offered cookies upon check-in.  The refrigerator in our room did not work, which meant we had food spoil since we arrived near midnight and it was too late to ask for a repair or replacement.  As a silver HH member, I had expected some courtesy in being given my requested room type, which I was not.  When I inquired about a late check-out, it was going to be a half-day's lodging fee for 2 hours' time.
Manager Response: Dear VtaTraveler  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Suite to be near Convention center
Summary: This was a decent Doubletree Suites along "hotel row" and only a few blocks from the convention center. While the Hilton is closer, I had a two room suite here for the price of a regular room there. There is a restaurant that I didn't get to try as well as an outdoor pool. The room was nice, clean and comfortable.

Recent Disney passholders. We try to either stay in Anaheim the night before we go to the park or make it a long weekend as we did this weekend.  Much nicer stay than the last couple of hotels we've stayed at recently (Sheraton and Wyndham). This hotel is clean and comfortable. Nothing beats staying at the Disneyland Hotel, but the Doubletree isn't a bad alternative.

Paid $79 more per night compared to more than 100 others attending same conference as me. Negotiations with Henry, Rev Manager for a fairer rate unsuccessful. Took 3 hours for room to be ready. After the disappointment I checked out one day early but was forced to pay for the extra night $279 plus tax.  Hotel Manager Nielson avoided talking to me. I will find a shelter before I stay at this hotel. Watch your wallet.
Manager Response: Dear Tendani M  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review. We’re very sorry your experience at our property wasn’t up to our usual high standards.  We’ve addressed the problems you mentioned with your room not being ready in a timely manner. Thank you for alerting us to this issue, and we hope you’ll give us another chance to make it right.

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Doubletree for a 4 night getaway. The hotel was clean and seemed to have been updated somewhat recently, at least compared to many of the other Marriott and Hilton properties I've stayed in. Compared to other options in the area this seemed like one of the better choices when balancing price and quality.   We had a king bed which was very comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom were both fairly standard size. Little things like an in room fridge and microwave were really nice to have.  The on site restaurant was okay, nothing special. We had coupons for the breakfast buffet which was adequate.
