Not sure how much it cost but had the standard eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, fruit, and a few rotating items each day. It's about a one mile straight shot walk

This hotel was ok. Staff were pleasant. A little too far from the parks for us - yes there are shuttles but sometimes there is a while between them. Next time we will stay closer. One suggestion about the cookies - it would be great if they could offer a nut free version:)

We stayed here for a convention, which was walking distance to the convention center.  The airlines changed our flight times, putting us in Cali a lot earlier than planned out.  The hotel was very accommodating and let us check in early with no extra charge!  We booked a suite and it was more than enough room for two adults and a child.  Room was very clean.  The pool was a decent size with enough room for the multiple children in it to play.  We did have a view of the fireworks at Disneyland from the pool deck (an added bonus).  It did have a very small gym and a very, very small arcade, but we did not use either.  The onsite restaurant was excellent (best Calamari I ever had).  The staff was exceptional!  There is a small cafe onsite, but we went out for breakfast.  I highly

Solid property...good value. Rooms a little dated but bed comfortable and living area good size. Service was average. Room was near ice machine and noise penetrated room door.  Good location if visiting Disneyland although some adjacent areas a little noisy/busy.

That Guy here. This was a very good Double Tree. Good check in, friendly and helpful staff. All questions answered, and a Disney Welcome Center to buy tickets. Room service and food was good. There is a bar, coffee shop and guest store to purchase things. Housekeeper did a good job taking care of room. Disneyland, 5 minute cap ride. If you take a taxi, its $6.00-$7.00. If you take one of the other cars, it's $10.00 flat rate. Either way its worth it. You can walk to the park, will take 20 minutes. On a long day, hitch a ride. Many restaurants are with in walking distance and next to the Double Tree.  It's safe to walk around, a lot of foot traffic, people going back and forth to the parks. I would stay here again and use as my home base.

This is a 10-minute walk from the Woody bus stop in the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot, and I rarely had to wait long for a bus, as they run all the time.  It's also on a couple ART lines, so you have lots of options for getting to the park if you don't want to walk (which I didn't).  I stayed in a corner King 2-room suite and loved the space.  Everything was very clean, although the hotel is definitely dated (just think of it as vintage).  The breakfast buffet was in line with other Doubletree buffets--lots of options and plenty of food (most of the time--there were a couple times when it took a little while to get more eggs or bacon/sausage, but that was rare).  The pool and hot tub were both nice--not huge, but a decent size in both cases, and I appreciated them being on

We stayed here for 12 nights, have only just checked-out this morning. After nearly 2 weeks staying there it certainly felt like home away from home. The rooms are extremely spacious, I beleve the majority are set out as 2-room suites which is ideal if you've got younger kids that go to bed a bit earlier.  The staff are very friendly and accomodating, special mention to Arianna at the front desk who was very helpful amd assisted with lost luggage when we first arrived and also my wife who needed to see a doctor after falling ill.  We walked to Disney on most days, there's plenty of shade along either side of Harbor Blvd depending on time of the day. It's an easy 20 min. walk and was a good chance to walk-off a big breakfast before hitting Disney for the day.  And how could I

Super friendly staff, clean room with plenty of space, delicious breakfast buffet and great dinner meals! Perfect location by Disneyland. Definitely recommend for everyone :) a very positive experience with friendly and happy staff.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay for a family of four
Summary: We stayed here for three nights in October 2016.  This was our second stay at this hotel, and the service was just as fast and friendly the second time.  The warm cookies at check-in are a welcome treat!  We stayed in a Q/Q suite and it was very roomy and comfortable.  Overall good value and a good place to stay near Disneyland.  However, the 15-20 minute walk to/from Disneyland seems endless after a long day in the parks.  As long as you are prepared for that, then this hotel is a good choice.

Great location, nice property. Only thing I didnt like and found truly annoying was how the headboard and mattress dont line up together. I tried pushing the mattress back against the wall, but it couldnt move. This minor detail led to me waking up in the middle of the night wondering where all of my pillows went haha...all ended up in the space between the mattress and headboard/wall...Other than that, the stay was what I expect from a Hilton branded hotel :)

Stayed at the hotel for a early morning conference at the Convention Center.  Easy 7 minute walk to the convention center. Parking was close to the hotel lobby, which was nice.  Easy in and out of parking lot to freeway access.

Staff was friendly and outgoing. Minutes from Disney Land and California Adventure. Walking is plausible but not necessary there is a shuttle pick up right in front of the hotel. Warm Cookies whenever you walk in is also nice. Was a great visit.

I believe the title says it all but let me go into details about my recent trip:  My daughter and I arrived on Friday, October 7th at about 3pm.  Walked up to the check-in desk to find two people in front of us but no one manning the counter.  After waiting about 7 minutes someone came out from the back room to help the first woman in line.  The woman was taken to another area and the rest of us were left to wait with no greeting or explanation of when someone would help us.  Another 5 minutes went by before another woman came out to help the man in front of us.  He needed a transport ticket.  The lady at the counter didn't have enough change so she excused herself to the back to get some.  Several minutes went by before another woman came out, passed by us behind the counter,
Manager Response: Dear dbabe  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: I checked in on a Wednesday evening and left on Sunday.  The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming.  I am a Hilton Honors member, and was told my complimentary bottles of water were in the room, they were not.   The room was beautiful and very comfortable, the bed I had trouble getting out of.  Housekeeping was very polite and helpful.  I would stay here again, but bring my own water.

Excellent value for the dollar if you need/want a two room suite. If you want to be able to put the kids to bed and still be able to talk or spend time with your spouse or just watch tv at a decent volume, a two room suite is a must. The doubletree has good rooms, a dedicated staff, and a good kitchen. Room service is good and fast. The pool is small and could use some updating. Rooms are clean and staff is quick to accommodate. The breakfast is good. There is a decent assortment of cold foods, there are always scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon and sausage, pancakes, and either French toast or Belgian waffles each day. They also rotate a breakfast special like eggs florentine, egg sandwiches, biscuits and gravy, etc... Kids enjoy the 3 cereal choices, fresh fruit, yogurt

Very nice hotel close to Disneyland.   The staff was amazing!  So friendly!  Loved the warm cookies they'd hand out every day.  The rooms were clean, and nice amenities. Had a beer at their bar, and the bartender was very friendly.  Ate room service once and in their restaurant once, and the food quality was very good and reasonably priced.  I would chose to stay there again the next time I visit Anaheim.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  It was very convenient to have a restaurant, room service, gift shop and coffee shop right in the hotel.  The room was very comfortable.

very nice hotel. cookie at check-in was nice. friendly staff and the rooms were nice and clean.  food was good in the restaurant and they had a nice bar.  felt safe the entire trip.  walked to Disneyland by myself and enjoyed the neighborhood.

As a HH member you expect to be greeted at check in, be presented with a cookie and explained and offered your amenities; however this stay it didn't happen. Not what was expected from a Doubletree hotel. The location is great for Disney and the restaurant staff and offerings are great. Lamp in room was broken but the last day of our stay it was magically fixed.

I stayed here this past weekend due to the great reviews ~ and It was just great ~ One thing that tops this hotel option is the digital KEY!!!! I didnt have to wait in line and was able to check in with HH App ! !   Def will stay here again !

Summary Heading: Great hotel - VERY WORTH THE COST
Summary: The housekeeping staff's attention to detail was impeccable.  The rooms are very nice and roomy.  Overall, my go-to when I'm in the area again.  There was one slight issue with not liking the veggie risotto dish and they immediately changed my order for me, no questions asked, to the burger.... thank you!!!

This was our first location stop off on our California road trip. The check in was easy and the staff were friendly and provided a complimentary cookie.   The room was large and clean with the facilities to make your stay comfortable with ironing board and coffee machine etc. The bed was lovely and I slept reasonably well but did battle hard against the noise of the air con unit (which I switched off) which was problematic.    Only negative to the room other than the air con noise was the windows were caked with mud which really made the room unattractive.   Had both breakfast and dinner at the downstairs restaurant. Both reasonably priced and well staffed but plenty of other choices around the immediate area.   Excellent location if you are wanting to go Disney.  Easy access to

This was the best Doubletree I have ever stayed at. Our room was beautiful and extra large. Everything was very clean. The front desk personnel were very courteous and helpful with my questions. The property is within walking distance to the convention center. Lots of restaurants nearby. Consider staying here if you are attending a convention.  You will not be disappointed.

Came out for Minecon 2016 w/friend and his family. Had a great stay at Doubletree. The cost/value ratio is great. Everything you need is there. Pool. Bar. Denny is a 2 min walk. Convention Center was a 10 min walk. Room are clean and very spacious. Would recommend this place to anyone.

We visited to attend Minecon at the convention center. We chose the property because it has a separate bedroom. The hotel is walking distance to the convention center and right down the street from Disneyland. Our room was clean, very quiet  and comfortable except the pull out couch. Possibly the worst one ever. It is the old metal style and a very thin pad made every metal spring noticeable. The decor is a little dated but everything is in like new condition.

This hotel is spotless and the staff was friendly and informative.  The hotel is four star,and it still went above and beyond my expectations!!! We ate at the restaurant late at night and the service was prompt and the food delicious.  My daughter has food allergies and they were accommodating to her needs! Overall, amazing experience and I would highly recommend!!!

We chose this hotel for its price and location to the Convention Center.  It's a nice 7 or so minute walk to the Convention Center.  It's also a reasonable walk south to Target, Pizza Hut, Jack-in-the-Box, and a Walgreens.  The receptionist was very helpful at check-in and worked extra to help with some issues with my reservations, all the while polite and friendly.  There are free warm chocolate chip walnut cookies for the asking whenever you walk through the lobby!  The lobby is very nice and spacious and feels comfortable.  As for our room, our king room one of the smallest they have, judging by the map on the back of the door.  The bathroom is large and very clean.  There is a full tub and shower and good hot water.  The room comes with a large tv with cable, fridge,

Stayed at the Doubletree Suites Anaheim Resort for a meeting at the nearby convention center.  The rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable, although the decor seemed a bit dated to me.  The hotel is convenient to the convention center - short walk.   Service was friendly. As a HH Gold I was upgraded to a 2 room suite -- interesting -- got the first night upgrade posted to the Hilton app the afternoon before arrival.  I had a separate reservation for 4 additional nights and when I checked in asked if the upgrade would continue.  The agent checked and confirmed the full 5 night stay in the 2 room suite. The restaurant is okay, but not fine dining -- as an HH gold was given vouchers for full breakfast buffet for the whole stay.

The hotel is about a five minute walk to the convention center. The rooms/hotel is clean but I guess you would consider it a bit outdated. The breakfast buffet in the morning is great and has a lot of options. The only odd thing about the hotel is the mirror in the bathroom is not directly over the sink...kind of odd. I took a shuttle to Disney which stops right outside of the hotel and is only $5 for the day and runs until 12:30 am. There is a gas station and liquor store next door and a few steps away from Ruth Chris Steakhouse.

I spent one night at the Doubletree Suites and the comfort of the bedding made me completely at home. I slept like a log for 6-hours and woke up fresh. The breakfast was also matching the expectations. The wi-fi was super fast but I paid it first and they reduced the charge from the room fee.

Very nice hotel.  Breakfast ar other DoubleTree locations are a "hit or miss".  This was a "hit".  I will stay here again when I return in business.  Check in was effortless.  Staff was very helpful and pointed us to an awesome German restaurant (Jagerhaus...go eat there!)

Here for a few days on a business conference and I must say the stay has been enjoyable. The check in process lags a bit and I had some discrepancies that forced me to change rooms, even after I checked in fine and dandy, but the solution came swiftly and was handled professionally. The bar is awesome, and the bartenders are super friendly. A little bummed over the not so "continental" breakfast, but hey, it's Anaheim. Overall not bad visit.

My husband and I spent one night at the Doubletree Suites and had an amazing visit. I'm a Hilton Diamond and we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite. It was amazing! Two living areas and two bathrooms along with a multitude of live plants. We also enjoyed the hot tub and pool area and an excellent breakfast buffet. Thanks, Doubletree! We'll be back!

The service was excellent, room was very large and had a refrigerator and microwave along with coffee maker and all other standard amenities, there was a large dressing area and separate bathroom area, walls were a little thin and hallway noise was a bit of an issues for me at times but overall excellent experience and I would definitely stay here again next time.

No complaints, clean, enjoyed jacuzzi, friendly staff, convenient coffee counter, convenient location to Disneyland for the Disney Run! Lots of restaurants nearby. Walking distance to the park. Safe area.

I have always liked this hotel we came for the Disney 5K run everything was great except for a couple minor things I was charged for parking(18.00) per day but we didn't have a car we flew from San Francisco. The pull out sofa bed is not comfortable and the jacuzzi could have been a little cleaner.

Stayed here for an event at Disneyland Great place easy to get to the park. Parking is simple breakfast is fabulous clean and quiet   Uber to park is under $8. Great place to stay for work or with family. Suites easily sleep six people

My daughter, with four children, and I made reservations for two rooms at the Doubletree Anaheim.    We knew that we would arrive late, so when the opportunity came up on our emails to check in online, we checked in online with rooms next to each other so that at least one of the young children could stay with me yet also be close to Mom.  That would also avoid having one child sleep on the floor. When we arrived, my daughter and I were given rooms on completely different floors. I stood around at the front desk and showed them my check-in email.   The front desk people not only refused to honor our check-in emails but would not even give us rooms on the same floor.  One child did have to sleep on the floor.  It turned out that my room lock was stuck so I had to keep returning
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Cleaning staff removed gifts from room
Summary: Cleaning staff removed all items, including wedding gifts, in my room a full day before my check out date. These contents were not returned to me. This caused me to delay my honeymoon and obviously caused a lot of undue stress the day after my wedding. I'm still awaiting a response from hotel about how they intend on reimbursing me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, worst customer service ever.
Summary: Used Hilton points and the customer service at check in made sure to find ways to charge me for every person in the room. I have never been charged based on occupancy at any Hilton property prior, including this exact hotel. As a Hilton honors member I was reminded about 5 times that they appreciated my loyalty but that appreciation was not apparent during the rest of the check in process. Oh and I checked in online first which was supposed to make the process quicker, but nothing really changed. Now that I have no more points I will go find a better hotel.
Manager Response: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.

Summary: This is a nice choice for a person or family in town to visit Disneyland. The parks are less than a mile away and the hotel is a great value. The staff is excellent and the overall experience was top notch. If you don't mind a little walk this is a great choice!!

Clean rooms, speedy elevators, amazing room service, the entire staff did a superb job accomadating us during our vacation. The Double Tree definitely earned 5 stars. Did I mention the cookies at the front desk....my girls loved them.

Flight centre in Australia booked the wrong hotel. So when the shuttle dropped me off at this my preferred hotel. They did not have a reservation for me. Flight Centre had booked me at Doubletree by Hilton 100 The City Drive. What a nightmare after a long early morning flight from NYC. When I explained that I had wanted to stay at the convention centre Doubletree by Hilton they kindly found me a room I had already paid in advance for the one on city drive. Now I will have to pay again for the Doubletree by Hilton @ convention centre. This Hotel is very tired and needs a upgrade, had to ask for a robe most hotels these days have them hanging in the closet. No slippers or any of the usual niceties. Had a meal in the restaurant ordering a Cobb salad had one at the Hilton Times

Third time I've stayed at this hotel when visiting Disney. Great place more room cos it's suites. Staff very friendly. Good pool area. Over all a great place to stay. Would definitely return when visiting Disney.

The hotel is situated very close to the parks and there is the ART Bus service from right out front.  The Hotel is clean and tidy and service is great - rooms are getting a bit tired and could do with a revamp but we were still very happy overall

The Doubletree Suites was a very nice place to stay for our family vacation at Disneyland.  The hotel is in very good shape.  Room was very large 1 bedroom suite with a nice living space.  Allowed us to relax after a long day at the parks.  Pool was nice and easy to access.  We were able to walk from the hotel to the Toy Story parking lot (@10 minutes) to use the bus service to Disney or an Uber was about $5 one way.  There is also an ART stop right outside the hotel.  The walk directly to Disney was a bit far for us, but there were people doing it.  You could see the fireworks from the pool area.  Staff was very responsive and friendly the entire stay.  Would definitely stay again and don't forget the cookies at the front desk.

Summary Heading: Not as good as last time
Summary: We stayed here about 3 years ago and it was flawless.  Stayed again this past week.  Rooms are still nice, spotlessly clean, and the front desk people still wonderful.  Restaurant, however, gave TERRIBLE service the night we arrived, and since we were the only guests in it for awhile there was no excuse.  Prices were high, food was meh.  And you had to beg to get a table, then to get a menu, then to get water, then to get your order taken.  Very angry about this!

I recently just stayed here for a couple of nights with my 3 year old and couldn't have been happier with my stay.  All of the staff here were super friendly and always had warm smiles on their faces and ensured my little boy was having a great time.   A couple of reviews below someone post about incidentals and not being aware of it. I work for a Hilton in San Diego and this is a standard policy for hotels, especially for Hilton. Especially if he is a HHONORS member, he should not act surprised, nor blame the hotel. Just don't be cheap, you get the money back. The hotel was very honest with me about this and I agreed to it, especially since this isn't the first time I've stayed at a hotel.  Great Job Doubletree! We will be back soon.

Summary Heading: DoubleTree Anaheim is well worth it!
Summary: Lovely hotel and great rooms!!!  Rates were awesome during the summer and the morning breakfast was delicious and very reasonable.  The beds were true queens which I appreciated.  When you book other hotels in the US, you have to ask.... the beds may be double size or oversize twins.

Summary Heading: Great property. Great people. Slow internet.
Summary: Very nice hotel. Clean. Amazing outdoor Fire "pit". Great condition. Great employers. Very slow internet. Chapman is noisy. Near a lot of restaurants and shops. Shuttle to DL. Asked for faster internet and they gave me a code but I didn't use it. Lots of service.

I've stayed here many times.  I've also had to stay at other hotels in the area and this  Doubletree is the best.  We have always had a very nice and clean room.  Their breakfast bar is a full breakfast bar and it is second to none, it is the finest.  The food is great at the Grappa bar and the employees are very good and friendly.  Disneyland is a short walk or a short ride on the bus.

We love staying here for family trips to Disney, also the quality of food at the restaurant is top notch! The rooms are spacious and always clean. The hotel staff is friendly & professional. Walking distance to Disney and some rooms have perfect view of fireworks

I stayed here for a conference at the Anaheim convention center.  Upon arrival I used my credit/debit card. I always use it as a credit card but I was not allowed to do so here.  I was told that they would have to charge me the entire amount plus  $50.00 per day for incidentals which would be refunded within 3 days after checkout.  That's fine BUT there was no mention of this policy when I reserved my 5 night stay.  I think this is deceptive.  I spoke to the manager but she patronized me and turned a deaf ear.  As a Hilton Honors member, I stayed here to be loyal to the brand.    The hotel is one of the older properties in this area.  It is in need of a renovation.  The room was comfortable, flat screen tv in the living room area and bedroom.   The WiFi was unpredictable and as
Manager Response: Dear Bizztraveler,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for the disappointing stay in our hotel.    All guests, regardless of their payment method, are asked to leave a deposit of $50 per night for incidentals in addition to authorizing the full value of their stay. I apologize if this was not explained clearly when you made your reservation and that the interaction with our supervisor did not satisfy.  I'd also like to apologize that Cafe Biscotti, guestroom furnishings, location and wifi did not meet your needs.  I'm surprised to hear the feedback about the furnishings as we refreshed them in 2014.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Disneyland trip: staff was very friendly. Disneyland welcome center on site, which was very helpful.  Check in and check out was quick. At check in, I was able to select the exact room I wanted, which was a high floor and view of fireworks.

We only stayed one night, but we'll be back the next time we visit Disneyland. We've stayed at a few other properties in the area and this one's the best so far. First of all, the room had a much better layout for families (compared to the 'suite' we had at the Marriott Suites, in which there was some wasted space). The living area was separate from the bedroom and the sink area was outside of the bathroom (toilet + tub/shower). The beds and pillows were comfy, there was plenty of lighting in the room, and our 7th floor room was quiet even though we faced Harbor Blvd. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the dining room was spacious - a large restaurant setting rather than the cramped 'breakfast room' at so many other hotels. The only things I didn't like: the pool closed too

Took three attempts by the front desk to get us keys to open our room door upon arrival.  Kids were excited and then had to stand there for 25 minutes while we waited on key after key after key.  Parking is OUTRAGEOUSLY priced.  Then, the parking key they gave us stopped working a day through our three day trip so we had to go get a new one.  Nothing awesome about this place except you can walk to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Sean,  Thank you for posting your feedback  Please accept our sincere apologies for the room key and parking pass issues you encountered.   We take comments we receive from our guests seriously and your concerns will be reviewed with the Engineering team.   Again, please accept our apologies for the inconvenience you experienced. We hope we will have another opportunity to be of service to you.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Very good location, facilities and service
Summary: very satisfied and highly recommend. even so I arrived a day early from the day when the room was booked for me, I was allocated to a better room at the price of my regular booking. Very pleased with additional facilities in the room, such as fridge and microwave. Excellent location, close to everything.

I decided to attend a conference after all rooms in my preferred hotel were booked.  I found rooms in this property available on the Hilton website and decided to try it.  The location was close enough to the convention center that I could easily walk there, to Garden Walk, and to Downtown Disney.  The layout of the rooms was very comfortable for two people traveling because there was a living area with a pullout couch separate from the sleeping quarters with doors that allowed you to close off light and sound from other areas.  Having two televisions was also convenient.

I stayed here for four nights at a work event and five more with my family. 5 min walk from convention centre. 30 from Disney. The rooms were big with, as the name suggests, a separate living room. Overall we were very happy. Only minor quibble bar staff a bit flustered and not very responsive on a couple of occasions. Also booked a drink in room on arrival which arrived 35-40 mins later. After 20 hours travelling I ended up waiting up for the drink. When I called, excuse was they wanted to ensure it was cool. I arrived within 10 mins of estimated arrival.  However as I say generally a positive experience.

The complimentary breakfast was excellent and the room was very spacious and modern room.  We enjoyed the quietness of our room. The staff was very courteous and no waiting to check in; check out was easy as it was online.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a reasonable price!
Summary: Great location, very close to Disney... perhaps a 20 minute walk, or a short cab ride (less than 5-7 minutes)... if you are going to Disney, as I guess most people does in this hotel, and you have a car, do not drive to Disney's parking lot! is virtually on the other side of the avenue, and you would still need to use the very uncomfortable and time consuming bus system from there to the parks... use the USD$18 fee at Disney parking for the taxi or uber fares on both ways to and from Disney... rooms are very comfortable and clean, although furniture looks a bit old and outdated... breakfast is great, but a bit pricey..

Efficient booking through Internet. Ability to change reservation very days before coming without charge. .Kind welcome.  Right location to go to Disneyland but also to attend any activy organized in the Convention Center.  Very good breakfast on buffet: good price/quality ratio

Summary Heading: Surely this hammer blow must be a one off ?
Summary: Several years ago I joined the Hilton Honors program. The more I stay in Hilton Hotels worldwide the better I understand and appreciate this wonderful brand. However, on this one occasion, something disasterous was lurking. It has taken nearly 3 weeks to calm down enough to write about my experience.  I stayed at The Doubletree Anaheim Resort Convention Center on business. It was a 4 day trip to the area. I could not have picked a worse hotel for business. Firstly, like most business travellers I need Wi-Fi access. I thought a Convention Center will have good Wi-Fi. I stayed in room 723 and the Wi-Fi at best could be described as absolutely abysmal. My phone (new Windows 10) and my colleagues phone (brand new I-Phone 6) received equally bad service. This is the first Hilton
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Muxworthy,  Thank you for taking the time to share your concerns on TripAdvisor, in person and by email. I can see by your wording that this stay was bitterly disappointing to you. Please note your feedback was reviewed with the entire team for follow up. In addition, the hotel has been in contact with both Hilton and AT&T to see if any improvements can be made to the wifi.   Your email concerns were addressed within 72 hours of receipt. I have included our GM's response to you below: "I am very sorry to hear of the problems you experienced with the Wi-Fi at our Hotel. I must say you are the first person to complain about the quality of the internet. The complaints we get are for people having problems logging into the system, not from those actually using it. We also offer hard wire service in all guest rooms for free so I am not sure if that may have worked better for you for conducting business. While the internet is free to everyone at our Hotel I would expect it to be a the level you have come to expect at all Hilton Hotels. I have asked AT&T to have one of their technicians come and look into the connection for room 723 to see if they can find out what the problem may be.   We strive to be the best DoubleTree in customer service so again it is very surprising to hear about the way you were treated at the Front Desk. I have discussed the content of your emails with the Director of Front Office and she will be bringing those to the attention of her whole staff at their next meeting.   Our Hotel only provides the two bottles of water at check in as required by Hilton HHonors standards. I believe if you had asked the Room Attendant or at the Front Desk they would have given you some additional waters seeing that you are a Gold HHonors member, as we do not supply them daily as procedure.  Again, I apologize for the issues you encountered and I assure you that I will discuss these issues with my staff to see what can be done going forward to prevent another guest from experiencing the same."  Mr. Muxworthy, once again we apologize that you were unhappy with your stay. We wish you all the best in your future travels.  Kind regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I didn't find any suites in this hotel unless hilton uses the word suites to mean "extremely tiny rooms where you have to rearrange the overly abundant furniture just to move around". At least the room was clean and breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Dear Brian C  Thank you for writing a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We are very sorry you were unhappy with our guestrooms.  We appreciate your feedback, and will keep your comments in mind while we work to improve our guest experience. We hope you’ll stay with us again soon and tell us what you think about our improvements.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for disney downtown stay
Summary: This hotel is very good for family in disneyland downtown area, it is exactly .9 miles from disneyland resort. walking distance is 15-20 minutes and very doable. public transportation is also available for fees

Summary Heading: Visiting Disney? We Recommend This Place
Summary: Clean hotel, good food, close to Disney.  You can walk to Disney (10-15 min) or take a bus (also 10-15 min).   The wife liked this place... clean enough for her  Food - good Room - Good/Above average, clean Staff - helpful Location - very good

Summary Heading: So So hotel, rely too much on guaranteed stream of guests from Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: The hotel is located about 1 - 2 miles from Disneyland and 0.5 mile from the convention center and it shows, as they have more or less a guaranteed stream of guests from these 2 venues. The room I stayed was nothing special, and could really do with a modern upgrade. Also, the fitness center is so small that you only start sweating because of claustrophobia. As a positive note, the breakfast buffet is OK, although not perfect. Some of the staff do make the difference, then again I also encountered some grumpy staff members. All in all, decided to stay only 2 nights instead of the booked 5 nights and move to another hotel, let's hope it's better!
Manager Response: Dear ThomasEMM  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: This is a great location with a 1 mile walk to Disney.  Good rates for this location.  There are many other hotels in this area and this is one of the nicest.  Many restaurants nearby.  Buy your tickets for Disney in the Disney welcome center located in the hotel

Summary Heading: Great location, very nice room, helpful staff.
Summary: The Doubletree Anaheim is just under one mile from Disneyland and I loved being able to walk to Disneyland and back knowing that we had a large, clean, and comfortable suite to return to. When we booked our room we were able to book a rate that included breakfast, which I highly recommend. The breakfast was one of the best I've had at a hotel and it opened early enough for us to eat and then walk to Disneyland before opening (even on an early entry day). Parking was not free but it was convenient. The cookies were free and they were delicious!

Great Customer service! Clean rooms, close to Disneyland. Pool is great! Nice place to stay with family. We could even see the fireworks from Disneyland at the pool area. Complimentary cookie is the best. I kept going back for more. There's fridge and microwave in the room. We had a relaxing stay in this hotel.

I love Double tree Hotels, the cookies are great, always warm.  the Staff is excellent, the location its the best, just a few blocks away from the parks.  you can also take a shuttle from here.  The very Best.

Doubletree is a nice hotel within the Hilton brand.  Though relatively close to the convention center it is a bit of a trek to Disneyland.  I've stayed here a couple of times and each time the service has been very unwelcoming.  The restaurant is ok but pricey for what you get.  The rooms are clean but are usually not stocked with the quantity needed to allow everyone in the room their own towel and in room coffee.  Overall disappointed with service here.

We stayed a couple of nights. Friendly staff, the room was clean, neat and put together. I understood, the meal plans. Such as breakfast and dinner. Plenty of restaurant around to grab a bite to eat. Coffee shop downstairs. You pay for parking, meals and the bar. Very nice hotel.

The Doubletree is one of the nicer hotels in the Anaheim/Disney tourist area.  I was recently there for a convention.  It is well within walking distance of the Anaheim Convention Center.  Nice bar with friendly service.  Restaurant food is not great, but the flat bread pizza was the best of the worst.  (Breakfast was very good!)  Front desk and guest services personnel were all very friendly and helpful!  Beds are comfortable, and the A/C works very well.  You'll enjoy your stay here!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, will return in the future!
Summary: We are going back and forth from Southern California from Las Vegas, NV for my son's dr appointments.  Even with Disneyland nearby, it's much more affordable to stay in this area over LA.   About this hotel:  there is a daily parking rate of $18/night.  I reserved our stay through booking.com and the rate listed there for parking is outdated.  When you arrive, take advantage of the check in parking spots at the front to bring your luggage up as the only elevator accessible to all rooms is located from the main lobby.  Upon check in we received those awesome warm cookies everyone here is talking about.  For our first night we stayed in a 2 queen beds room.  The room was clean, provided a good amount of space and includes a mini fridge and microwave.  I brought a microwave

Great hotel,staff was very friendly and accommodatting BUT the bedding in my room was not changed from the previous guest. I checked in late around 9:15pm. After hanging my clothes and putting everything away(stay for 5 nts), the fireworks from Disneyland started and the view from my bedroom was Amazing, so I decided to lay in the bed to watch the fireworks, Well, I put my head on the pillow and right away I knew that the pillow cases weren't changed. They smell like sweat-Nasty, so I got up ( I was laying on top of the comfortable) I pulled the comfortable off to display the sheets and there were black hairs on the sheet. I was so discussed . I called front desk, they were very apologetic and send housekeeping to changed the entire bedding but I did not think about the bath

Summary Heading: It is very clean and convenient
Summary: It is a little bit expensive, but the price is still acceptable.  It is better than the Sheraton close to the convention center, which asks for similar price, but does not provide free wifi, and some of the equipment are old and nearly broken.  The double tree does a much better job on these.

Wrote a review via the hotels survey but it doesn't seem to have appeared, this has a bit more detail.  Stayed at Doubletree suites last week, got a really good price by booking early for 2 adults and 4 children, I emailed ahead about a Disney fireworks view and when alerted to checking on app they had pre assigned us room 724, the best room for the fireworks  Check in was quick and handed 6 warm cookies, (cookies were available through out the stay) which are delicious. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were spacious enough for all the time we were in them, although sometime there was a queue for the bathroom. Double queen with a pull out sofa, microwave, fridge and coffee maker, my daughter informed me today there was also a kettle in the

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel perfect for bigger families
Summary: Double queen suite was perfect for our family of 6. This hotel is within walking distance of Disney, although the ART shuttle did stop outside we found it an enjoyable walk even at midnight after a full day at Disney. The pool and hot tub were lovely to get into in the morning. Breakfast buffet was excellent value, especially for 2 adults and 4 children, it had a wide selection of hot and cold breakfast and lots of fresh fruit to hydrate before a day in Disney. Children 12 and under eat free. All staff we met were really friendly and helpful, there was also a Disney welcome centre to buy tickets, open from 7am. We also seen a shuttle to the citadel outlets although we didn't use it.  If you turn right out of the hotel there was quite a few shops eg Target which had good prices.

Great location, great service, big spacious rooms, very comfortable beds well worth it for the price. I recommend this hotel to families traveling for leisure. The breakfast buffet so good and kids eat for free with every paying adult great value!!!

Summary Heading: Rooms are huge - otherwise just OK
Summary: This hotel is located a full hour from LAX, so be prepared to pay around $100 in cab fare.  I took a shuttle on the way back to LAX, but that only saved about $20.  There are also no cabs waiting outside the hotel, so be prepared to wait a few minutes for the concierge to call you one if you want to go anywhere.  I really wish I had decided to rent a car for this trip.    I was staying here for business meetings, but with the proximity to Disney, it was hard to miss that this hotel has been designed to accommodate families.  The glasses in the room were all wrapped in paper, the furniture was made out of tough materials rather than being soft and fluffy, and there was a towel animal folded by the sink.    The room was huge – I was in a room with double queen beds, a large

We are all Hilton Honours members, we like the size of the rooms, we had a good time in the theme parks. The housekeeping service is very slow, the room gets done at around 4pm everyday as we get back from the parks with young kids who need a nap. We also had to wait for our rooms to be ready by 4pm checkin, we had to wait til 5pm. And when checkout day came, they tried to get us out early as early as 11am. We tried to negotiate for a late checkout (which they wanted to charge us for) but when we mentioned having to wait for our room upon checkin, they agreed to waive late checkout charges.

To be honest, it didn't start off to well. The aircon in our room was really noisy, all night. We called down stairs , we were moved straight away to a much nicer room. Fantastic breakfasts , great room service!

The suites are very spacious and comfortable.  The bed was super comfortable too.  The staff was super friendly.  Pool was great.  The only negative thing I can think of was that the fitness center had broken equipment.  Of the two treadmills, only one worked, and not all of the features functioned properly.  It was fine for a couple of workouts though.

Summary Heading: Great place to rest after a day at Disneyland
Summary: The beds in this hotel were amazing! Very comfortable and clean suite. The hotel stores your luggage if your flight leaves late after checkout and you want to explore the city, very convenient. Love the cookie at check in, delicious way of welcoming you!

Summary Heading: Great suite hotel near Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: Within walking distance of Anaheim Convention Center. Easy bus ride to Disneyland. Very clean, big, modern suite rooms with sitting area, table, sofa bed, chair and desk and separate bedroom.  Concierge very helpful and friendly. Has Disney booking area in hotel. Bar, restaurant on site. Nice pool area and jacuzzi..Can see Disney fireworks at 9:00 PM each night from pool or room (if on right side).  Great restaurants within a half mile.

Summary Heading: Happy with everything except the fitness center
Summary: Checkin was fast and easy, thanks to the app!  Parking is $18/day so make sure you plan for that.  Traveling this time as a family of 4, so the suites make a difference.  Rooms are spacious and beds super comfortable.  Pleased with the level of cleanliness.  Wireless internet included has been reliably speedy.  The bathroom layout is awkward with the door swings but oh well.   We liked the pool, it's adequate for a vacationer.  I deducted a point for the fitness center. It's tiny, hasn't been updated in some time, and no free weights.  As a traveler with injuries, all I can do is free weights and i've gotten spoiled by the fact that most hotels are responding to fitness needs with better rooms.  One mile away from Disneyland, a 20 minute walk, which is perfectly fine.  And if

This is a nice hotel that is conveniently located to many attractions, Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. Rooms are spacious and they have a nice breakfast buffet as well. Only complaint is the pillows. They are too soft and have no support. Also, expensive daily parking fee.

This is your standard Doubletree hotel.   Rooms were what you expect and were clean and recently redone.  The meeting space and meeting staff were excellent and very good start to finish.  Reasonable rate and good location.   Good choice and would stay again if in Anaheim

I stayed in this hotel to attend a conference at the convention center; my husband tagged along for vacation. While this hotel was a little longer of a walk to the convention center, it was worth it for the accommodations. Staff was extremely helpful, the room was large and comfortable. The close proximity to Disneyland and other areas of Orange County was also a plus.

Average hotel for pricing at $200 per night, especially in the summer the price can go higher. Room is standard, clean and bed is fine. Pool and hot tub are too small to support hotel guest, didn't get a chance to use the hot tub as it good for 5 people at a time. Swimming pool is also short and small, holds 8 people comfortably.

This hotel was newer than I expected. Nice pool, although crowded with kids most of the day. Disneyland is a decent walk. There is also a $5 city bus that everyone relies on, we did not use it. The room was a small living room with pull out and a room with 2 queens. Nice condition. Pay to park.

Summary Heading: Clean, polite staff, close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was a good choice due to its proximity to Disneyland.  The staff was polite and the rooms were clean and spacious.  The coffee cafe service was quick and the restaurant breakfast had many choices.  I would stay here again if/when we next travel to this area.

Great time had at the nice hotel. Good pool, nice bar decent size suites. Ten minute walk to Disney with plenty restaurants round about. Purchased Disney tickets here and they were cheaper than we could have got in the UK. Great view of Disney fireworks from the 7th floor of the hotel. Washing, laundry facilities were excellent too.

Excellent accommodations from the chocolate chip cookies to sundry personal care items provided upon request due to packing oversights.  All the staff members were first rate.  Perhaps the most comfortable bed we have slept in EVER.

The hotel seems new. The room was spacious with two sitting chairs, double vanities, fridge, microwave. Stayed on the sixth floor. I had a view of the Disney fireworks at night. It was clean. My negatives come from the business center. I needed to print tickets for various events and boarding passes and it took forever. Other guests had the same experience in the center. It seemed like they were using dial up service. It was so slow. It would also quick you out. The walls are thin as well. You can hear the people passing by in the hallways. Great location near the convention center, Disney or to watch an Angels' game.

A great facility and close to the convention center when you need a cheaper alternative to the big Hilton and Marriott. Close to many restaurants, Target, and Disneyland. As always, I love the chocolate chip cookie!

Have stayed at this hotel several times, given the amount of traffic travel to and from downtown LA is pretty consistent around 45 minutes.  Even though it is down the street from Mickey Mouse  it is easily accessible.  Rooms and staff are very consistent and friendly.  I usually stay there when I'm in LA for business.  Even though there are a lot of families that stay there it is still quiet enough to get a good night's sleep.

Summary Heading: Not Even a Smile at Check-In
Summary: On our previous stay, we really enjoyed this hotel, but this time on check-in, Jimmy was not friendly, never cracked a smile, and it got us off to a bad start. When we asked if we might be able to get a complimentary room upgrade (we are Diamond members), he said well, if you do that you'll have to wait for a room and this one is ready. When I asked how long he said he never likes to say. Since it was already 3:00, it shouldn't have been much longer. I asked if we could maybe at least have a pool view or view of the fireworks. He acted annoyed, but checked and then said he found us a pool view room on the 5th floor, but it ended up being 4th floor right in the inside corner so mostly looked out at a roof and the side of the building with a tiny bit of the pool visible over to

Our stay was amazing as always! We love this Doubletree. And we are always greeted with our favorite cookies! We will be back for sure! Our room was very clean and we have no complaints. We are Hilton honors member's and are always treated so well.

We booked this hotel solely due to the great reviews on tripadvisor, but unfortunately the hotel itself was a real disappointment.    Whilst we ensured we enjoyed the time there, and met lots of lovely families and used the pool facility, the staff really took away from an otherwise positive stay.  The hotel is clean and tidy, but check-in staff gave little to no eye contact, were unhelpful and uninterested and after a silent check-in process, plonked a couple of paper bags on the bench without saying a word.  Those were the cookies people rave about, but if they can't verbally welcome guests who have just travelled 18 hours to get to that front desk, there's not much point plonking a cookie on the bench.  The only time she looked up was to silently count how many in our family
Manager Response: Dear donandshelty  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: This hotel was very pleasant and clean.  My room was pleasantly quiet- even though the hotel had full occupancy.  I wasn't thrilled with the bed.  It was adequate, but didn't give me the AHHHHH feeling that some do.  Parking was relatively expensive at $18 per day.

I were there for 4 nights and the hotel was great..The staff overall was outstanding...The location was great fro Disneyland..We were able to walk to and from with no problems, even for the little ones.

Summary Heading: Very good experience for me and my family
Summary: Great hotel, super clean, staff is very helpful, large parking lot (no problem finding a spot), room was large, received water and cookies upon my arrival, did the check in via app (but did not had room options), room was quiet and my family had a good night sleep! Thank you

I do not know what I am suppose to add on this line.  Housekeeping was great! Front desk was very nice! Starbucks cashier in the morning was very nice person! B Your bartender was rude! I wIsh I had stayed there longer! You can email me for any special offers! Thanks

We stayed here (6 of us, family) and it is a great place to stay, pricey yes but the accommodations are the best!  Room was spotless, quiet, spacious, no hassle, easy parking, easy check in, easy check out. I've received cookies for everyone, 2 bottles of water and 2 free vouchers for next day breakfast buffet (1 adult + kid, total 4 free breakfast) so I payed only 2 (party of 6). Totally recommend it !

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel for my family of 6
Summary: We stayed here for a Disneyland trip. We used our Hilton Honors points for the room.  The floor we were on was dedicated to the Hhonors and thought that was cool. Our floor had a laundry room which helped a lot. Our room fit all six of us. Two queens beds in one room and a fold out in the living room.  The food for room services was delicious. A bit pricey, but the quality of the food and the amount of food was great. My kids loved it and the room service was quick.  We did have some questions on the fees they charged for room service and no one could really explain the fee. Hmmm? Anyway, the pros of the hotel outweighed this one issue. The fresh cookies at the check in desk were just irresistible.  The pool was nice and plenty of room to sit and towels available. I did find

We were in Anaheim for a convention and the friends I was traveling with chose Doubletree.  I landed at LAX and called the hotel to see if they had a shuttle.  They did not but were very helpful and told me to take the super shuttle.  This saved me over a $100 on a cab ride!  I arrived at the hotel before my friends so I asked if I could store my bag at the bell desk.  They were happy to do it!  Once we were able to check in we were offered warm cookies and water.  Now, up to the room!  It was a clean and spacious suite.  Throughout our stay everyone was so friendly and helpful.  They were even able to set up the shuttle back to the airport when we left.  I enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree and it was within walking distance to the convention center  and Disneyland which made it

Great hotel, great staff special Lourdez the manager she feel me like some of her family she provided the best room view to the fireworks. If you choose eat breakfast the best waitress is Karina she's awesome.

We booked into Doubletree by Hilton in Anaheim at a 3rd of the price of staying in one of the Disney Hotels.  That meant we could spend more on ourselves rather than accommodation. The suites are practical with two rooms - a spacious sitting room which was more than enough for in room dining - and a bedroom with two queen beds. The sofa in the sitting room also converted to a double bed so there is literally enough for six people to sleep. Amenities are fine and the hotel is business like. Shuttles leave from right outside the hotel every twenty minutes direct to the Disney Park entrance for US$12 for two adults and one child for the whole day. There is plenty of places to eat around the hotel including Denny's and IHOP plus a really nice restaurant in the hotel called Agio.

Summary Heading: Usual Fare for Disney Area Hotel
Summary: Hotel meets expectations for what you expect from a major hotel chain near Disney.  The room was a suite with two queen beds so easily sleeps 3-5.  Clean and comfortable.  Close to basketball tournament we were attending and decent price via Hilton app.  Warm cookies on arrival a big plus.  $18 parking fee per day is a huge rip off.  Room service at night was better than expected.  Lack of a decent breakfast setup a negative.  All in all a good stay but not a super value either.

Broke my left toe yesterday morning, and could not stand on my left foot. Then i checked in at this hotel at midnight to find out that this hotel "doesnt have wheelchairs anymore, but we used to have them." Very disappointed at doubletree hilton, because i would expect this prestigious hotel to have a wheelchairs for guests to borrow. I still have 5 nights to stay in this hotel... 😭.
Manager Response: Dear ametisd  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: Very close to the convention center-walking distance. Close to Disneyland-walking distance. Very nice staff. Rooms are perfect for families, separate bedrooms from sitting area. Clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Convenient 4 diamond Suite Experience in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights with Points and Cash and it was a decent experience with slight kinks! Checked-In via the Hilton App 24 hours and selected a corner room on the top floor. Upon arrival, I was presented with a room on a lower level...upon request for a room on the top floor, I was placed by the ice maker/soda machine... :/  Front desk agent wasn't wearing a name tag either...   Property seems to be dated but was pretty obvious that the property underwent a complete remodel not too long ago.  The suite itself was quite spacious and upscale, on par with a 4 diamond property.  Water pressure in the shower was decent on the first evening, but weak on subsequent evenings... :(  Mattress was a lower-end bonnell spring mattress with a mattress-top advertised as a "pillow

If you want excellent service, this is the place. Clean room, spacious and quiet. Location is perfect if you are going to Disney. Staff is very very friendly and honest too. Although parking wasn't free, at least it was safe.

We have used this hotel a few times and never disappoints. My sister always gets the same hotel across Disney but this time she was disappointed, no parking, dirty, bad smell in room, price, noise and the list can go on. The last day we were in Disney, she stopped at our hotel, came up to our room and loved everything about it. Before she left she told her husband that they just found a new hotel on the next Disney trip.

The rooms are very clean and good size. Beds are comfortable and made my 3 day stay feel cozy! My grandson and I stayed on our 2 day visit to Disneyland, and we're planning ANOTHER stay before end of summer. It was an excellent choice for us.

Very easy digital check in. Would recommend buying hotel room directly from hotel because rate would be much cheaper than booking through third party. Had 2 queen suite bedroom, plenty of room for my family of 4. Most comfortable bed:))))

Great location -- closed to Disneyland, each access to parking.  Love the cookies at check-in, very efficient process.  Clean rooms, but could use a little upgrading.  Restaurant understaffed and a bit expensive -- even though kids eat free with adults.

Summary Heading: We love the space of the suites.
Summary: We visit and stay here each year for an event that last about 4 days.  The rooms are comfortable, they are spacious enough for us and our family.  Internet is a bit slow but free.  Like the amenities but don't use most of them.  We are usually pretty busy going back and forth to the convention center and this hotel is close by.  We also visit the Disneyland Resort during this event and this hotel is a short walk to the park.  After a day of walking around the Disney Resort, just walk over to the bus stops and take the #2 Harbor Blvd Line and it drops you right at the hotel!

A good price point. We had a two room suite and had Miss 8 grandchild.  Probably just a block too far to walk there and back each day with the kid, but we managed.  Food options at hotel perfect - buffet breakfast great price. Dinner great again and kids ate free. We were there for the grandkid and the hotel made it easy.  Is it luxury - no, but can you survicve yes.

Nice and clean, comfortable bed and helpful staff!  Close to Disneyland so you can walk-which is faster then waiting for the ART.   My son and I stayed here so we could watch the EHS band perform at disneyland-it was a perfect location, one block from the hotel the band was at and only about 4 blocks from Disneyland.  My son go a warm every night when we came back from Disney at the front desk, staff was super nice I would stay here again!

Summary Heading: First stay won't be my last
Summary: Stayed with DoubleTree for my first time ever in America and was not disappointed. The cookie at check in was a nice little surprise after a long flight. All of the staff were friendly and willing to help and the breakfasts were exceptional. Best hash browns I've ever tasted! Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, there's no doubt you'll be having a fantastic stay! :)

This place is fantastic! We had so much fun around the area. Great place to stay with my family and boyfriend. Rooms were great and relaxing. Good way to start our week-travel vacation from LA-Arizona-Vegas. Will deffinitely book again on our next trip.

This hotel was very conviently located, although I felt rushed when making reservations & the tone wasn't very friendly when I arrived the gentleman that checked me in was very accomodating  with additional towels & warm cookies, the service during our stay was great.

Summary Heading: The only place we stay when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel four times now when visiting Disney. I'll start by saying that for me personally, comfort at the end of the day is more important than proximity. This is not the closest hotel to Disney, there are many more, but at the end of the day the beds are very comfortable and the rooms are large enough for a family to sleep, lounge, and spread out a bit. We always take the ART and haven't had any issues. We were also able to book this hotel with our vacation package from Costco.  The last time we stayed we did have an issue with parking- we had a guest visit us at the hotel and were going to go to dinner. I specifically asked the front desk what we should do with the extra car- could we leave it or should take it. They said to go ahead and park it in the lot,

The furniture is arranged so that you have to walk the whole perimeter of the lobby just to get out. Makes for crowded areas near the check in desk. Just let me walk straight through from elevator to front door. Forget it if u are in a wheelchair. And the toilet paper is a grade less than walmart.

The hotel restaurant serves buffet breakfast, but the food quality was not acceptable.  We had a suite for 6, the room was much smaller than I expected, the two queen beds room have approx. 2 foot to walk around, 1 queen sofa bed in a small living room, once the sofa bed is open, no one can walk around. The room is clean, but 6 out of 8 pillows had bad odor. Hope they will change.

Rooms seems a bit tight but with a family of 3 kids and an adult, where wouldn't. Besides the daily $18 parking charge, location was great and close to loads of eating options, 5 mins from Disney, access to uber $5 or the SUVs downstairs in front of the hotel $10 or $6.50 for a cab to Disneyland.

As a frequent Hilton customer, I had hoped for much better service. FYI- there are nice hotels much closer to Disney and the convention center (Disney is a bus ride away from the Doubletree). We selected side by side rooms during online check-in and upon arrival, we were given rooms at opposite ends of the hall. The front desk told me that I was mistaken and that these were the rooms I had chosen. This was untrue as I know for a fact which rooms I had selected. I also remembered, after the fact, that the hotel called me about 5pm prior to our arrival and asked if we were still coming (the only time this has ever happened to me in the 100s of hotel stays I have had). I believe it was at this point that they changed our rooms. I asked for any other rooms that were closer because
Manager Response: Dear cpt1515  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.

Summary: We were looking for a hotel close to Disney. The DoubleTree had a great price on their website so we decided to give it a try since we needed a room that would sleep 6. We were not disappointed. Excellent front desk service from Titus!  Checking in was a breeze and we were lucky enough to be able to check in early.  We were also given hot cookies which was greatly appreciated after a very long drive. The Queen suite room was large and slept 6 comfortably,  Some rooms face Disneyland and they say you can see the fireworks.  However, we were never in our room when the fireworks show occurred.  The complementary internet worked great for all the devices we had and the beds were very comfortable. The only downside to the hotel is the distance from Disneyland.  They do not offer a

This hotel is about two blocks from the Anaheim Convention Center. It is in a safe location and close to many restaurants. Front desk and Guest Services staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable (we stayed on 7th floor). The hotel does have a restaurant and the food was good but menu is limited.   I would stay here again for another convention.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, convenient ART shuttle close to Disneyland.
Summary: Rooms were clean. The pool and hot tub on the 2nd floor (open until 10pm) is a great way to relax on your first night in Anaheim. Internet was free and worked well. ART 1-day and 3-day passes are sold in the lobby; get yours first thing in the morning (around 7am, so not if you're trying to make it to EMH at Disneyland). If riding the ART 1/2 shuttle to Disneyland, board at the Best Western Raffles stop across the street, then get off at the Doubletree stop on your way back from Disneyland. There's also a CVS about half-way between Disneyland and the hotel, which is a great place to buy bottled water to stay hydrated.

I'm glad I chose this location. Technically this stay was not a vacation. We just moved to the area. Because of the proximity to the parks, within walking distance,  we made a mini vacation out of it while awaiting our permanent home. The staff were all very friendly and personable.  I highly recommend this Doubletree location.

everything they promess was deliver   and plus they fix the wrong  and made right expedia post wrong price but they stand by   thank you very much they give us free buffet for the all stay 7 days and chocholat chip cookie

The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating.  The hotel was very clean and our room was clean and very spacious.  The location of the hotel was within walking distance to Disneyland. We loved the cookies at check-in and the welcome by front desk staff.  We had actually arrived much earlier than our check-in time but were put into our room upon our arrival.  Convenient parking at the hotel too.

The hotel was very clean and convenient to Disneyland and the bus transit was very easy to catch, right across the street and drop off at Disney for $5 a person.  The front desk staff was very helpful.  The pool was nice and not too cold, a little small.  The hot tub was nice and we watched the Disney fireworks from the hot tub.  The hotel is also within walking distance to many restaurants.  I would definitely recommend.

We stayed at the Doubletree for the Vid Con conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. At check-in, you automatically receive a warm welcome by the staff with some delicious, warm, chocolate chip cookies. The staff are well-informed and were even prepared to answer questions about the conference itself.  Our room was equally welcoming. We love the suite-style room with the separate living and sleeping area, it makes a family stay where every family member wants to stay up or go to bed at different times an absolutely hassle-free environment.  The hotel is in an easy access location to the convention center, restaurants, shopping, and places of entertainment and family-fun like Disneyland. The hotel itself contains some fabulous amenities: a cafe, a second area with hotel staff

Summary Heading: Very good and comfortable close to Disney
Summary: Given that most hotels around Disney cost and arm and leg I think this hotel delivered on all aspects. Beds were comfortable, housekeeping do a good and through job. The only draw back is that they charge $18/night for parking which I think its too much. Overall I think its a good stay for couple of nights if you are visiting Disney.You can save money by taking an Uber or taxi from airport so you don't pay for parking.

This is a nice and clean hotel in a good (not great) location. A bit too far to walk to the Disney parks and not much else to do near it. There are some nice, upscale restaurants nearby, but that is about it if you are walking. The ART bus is great, but it is $5 per person/day. Gets you to Disney in about 10 mins and you can get off at different stops (CVS, restaurants). Staff is friendly and rooms are comfortable and spacious. For the adults, try "The Cave" sports bar across the street for a break from the kids and crowds.

We had a great stay from check in to check out! We will definitely be staying here again! Arianna at the front desk is amazing! Mario in the restaurant is very attentive and the value for breakfast was great too! Kids can't wait to go back and even the hubby was impressed with the value!

Stayed here with my family for trip to disney. The suites are very comfortable, quiet and clean. Staff is very nice and accomodating. Short walk to toy story lot and took shuttled to park. Parking is pricey but expected in the area. Would be our next go to when visiting disney. Loved it!

From my first call to the hotel manager to the time we checked out we had professional friendly very helpful customer service.  We had just come off a long flight and requested an early check in , they could not promise anything at the time but by the time we got to the hotel long before official check in there was a room ready for us. When we got into the room 226 I had concerns as the room was facing the pool and was worried about noise and not been able to open the curtains.  Even with screaming kids jumping into the pool we could not hear anything, the blackout curtains can be opened as people from the pool cannot see in.  Housekeeping was amazing , we have stayed in a number of rooms and I must say our room was spotlessly clean each day. Lunch at the bar was tasty and large

Its always hard to find hotel rooms that fit a family of 5.  This one does.  It had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed and we still had some room to walk around.  Also the digital check in was great since we could pick our room before we even left home.

Hotel is well located to Disneyland. About a mile walk or $7 cab ride to Disneyland. Staff is helpful and friendly. Famous Doubletree cookies are always available. Great suite for the price of a regular room. Kids eat free in the restaurant and the price is reasonable for adults. Also lots of great places to eat within walking distance. The only downside is $18 per day for parking. Complementary coffee in the lobby would be nice touch too. Especially after the coffee bar closes. We would definitely stay here again.

My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Suites the first week of June in order to be conveniently close to Disney Land, which a shuttle bus picks you up directly in front of the property. The property is well managed and staffed was friendly. The accommodations are well appointed, modern, and appointed with all that a full-service hotel has to offer. The bed was relatively comfortable and the room service food was very good. Although the hotel charges for parking, I felt it was safe and secure. I would certainly stay there again.

We always enjoy staying here! Clean amd very friendly staff! From check in to cleaning of room to check out always a good experience. After staying at other hotels nearby I always prefer this one overall!

This hotel is close to Disneyland and is very nice to stay at.  The decor is good, beds are comfortable, staff is great.  We have stayed here on three separate occasions going back to 2006 and have been very happy each time.  It is perfect for a family with a separate bedroom and living room.

Staff was very helpful.   They allowed us a very early check in. When I told them I had friends staying at hotel they confirmed  I knew them then placed us near. They did forget to tell us there was a parking fee,  but gave us a handful of cookies to make up for it. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Extremely pleased with our stay here.  Spacious rooms.  High level of cleanliness.  Helpful staff in all areas, the Front reception, the restaurant.  I would like to mention the staff at the Concierge Desk; they were extremely helpful and pleasant.  I would definitely stay there if I visit again.

Great hotel within walking distance of Anaheim Convention Center.  Beautiful property and reasonably priced.  Centrally located for the Disney attractions.  The restaurant also has excellent food, and the staff was warm and accommodating.

The hotel is conveniently located if you are visiting Disneyland. I have stayed at the hotel on three separate trips to Disneyland with the family and have not been disappointed. Clearly I would stay there again based on my return visits and believe it is an exceptional value for what you get.

Summary Heading: Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort  - Convention Center
Summary: Poor lighting and would like to see a lighted makeup mirror in the bathroom.  Very small for a suite.  Couldn't access the refrigerator when the sofa bed was open. The hotel could use some sprucing up as its age is starting to show.  Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Had a short trip with my wife to the area and chose DoubleTree as we had used this brand before.  The service was good and the rooms appeared new and clean.  Will definitely plan to use it again for a Disneyland trip with the family

Summary Heading: Great for Tourists and Business Travelers
Summary: Stayed a week to spend a few days a Disney (tip cross the street to catch ART busses in the area that looks like a bus stop) and a few days visiting family in LA.  The high reviews are legit and this was a great home away from home for the week, helped to have a corner suite.  Room was very clean and filled out survey card to confirm that.  Maid service provided nice added touch with cute folded towels like being on a cruise ship.  Ate breakfast all days except last with Gold level buffet vouchers.  There was enough variety to mix things up each day.  Ordered room service breakfast last day to relax a bit before trip home, food was perfect.    Didn't't have time to use pool or workout room but appreciated that they have these for business travelers and had I been traveling on

The hotel room was spacious enough. It was clean and I felt at ease there.  House keeping did a great job.   The hot tub of course, was amazing. The front desk were polite and helpful with any questions that I had and they helped store our luggage on last day of check out since the conference that I attended was running a half day.   The hotel had restaurant  had good food that appealed to the eye.   This hotel also offered the Disneyland tickets and bus pass for a very small fee and was right by the bus stop to be picked up.

My husband and I stay for 7 nights and had a wonderful experience... From the moment we arrived the staff worked hard to get us an early check in after our flight from Australia and followed through 😊... Our highlight was meeting the gorgeous bar staff Veronica and Norma.. What amazing ladies they are and a credit to ur hotel.... This made us stay in at the hotel most nights for dinner instead of going else where....😊😊 definitely will be returning

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious, friendly staffs, excellent location and close to everything
Summary: The staffs were friendly, room #602 (it is like one bedroom condo) was clean and spacious. The price is reasonable for family who needs bigger space, 2-room suite . The beds were super comfy and tidy! Sofa bed was decent. It would have been perfect if quality soap and shampoo were provided. We didn't have time to enjoy pool but next time. Yes, definitely I will go back even for the warm chocolate chip cookies the staffs handed out.

Great, clean hotel.  Very roomy and well decorated. My family loved it.  I would recommend staying here.  I will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Anaheim.  Plenty of places to eat around the hotel to include the restaurant in the hotel.

Very clean and nice stay. We were pretty noisey in our suite but nobody complained. Unfortunately we missed breakfast buffet because we slept in. But the stay was very calming and enjoyable. We would stay here again for sure!

Excellent stay from start to finish Front desk friendly and helpful , really enjoyed daily free cookies 2 Bed suite spacious and well appointed and quiet  brilliant view of nightly Disney fire works room 714 Hotel has its own Starbucks and little shop for emergency supplies Didn't use the restaurant  Walking distance 10 mins to toy story parking lot for Disney then used free transport Dennys, Carls Jr ,Cocos bakery, jack in the box but to name a few eateries within walking distance also a Target super market , CVS
