Great hotel  The staff is always excellent and the breakfast is fabulous.  It's a full breakfast not just continental   A little far to walk to Disneyland but a very quick drive/uber  recommend for anyone staying in the Anaheim area

Suite is a little bit small, room cleanliness is average, not for 4 starts Hotel, breakfast is below average.  Overall hotel rate is 2.5 starts/ 5. coffee machine inm room is bad. Parking is okey, One good thing is location

Stayed one night before switching to  Disney Grand Californian. Easy check in, friendly staff, clean well appointed room, reasonable rates Walk to Downtown Disney was 1.5 miles so walking to visit the parks  is a bit far away unless you're in better shape than I am :) with small kids would be exhausting at the end of the day.

Summary Heading: Highly recommend for an affordable Disneyland option
Summary: Clean hotel, friendly staff, great price! Comfortable beds and fast room service. All around great stay!  Great option for an affordable hotel in proximity to Disneyland and CA Adventure.  Not the closest hotel, but the cleanest and best price I found in the area.

We arrived early, and found that staff to be very accommodating. Provided access to the business center while a room was made ready, checked us in early, and added the classic Doubletree cookies. The suite was great - well laid out, plenty of room with microwave and fridge. Easy access streetside to the ATR shuttle to Disney. Would definitely return again.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff went out of the way to help us enjoy ourselves. The restaurant was wonderful. The service quick and professional. The steaks thick and cooked perfectly. Wine list amazing.

Conveniently located, clean and quiet.  Staff and check-in efficient and friendly.  Second time I've stayed in this hotel for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center and it is a quick 10 minute walk to the Convention Center.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for Business Travel or Families at Disney
Summary: This hotel is located blocks from Disney. I have stayed twice for business travel and there are lots of families with Mickey ears. The bar and lounge are nice and the breakfast buffet is really good. Despite all of the kids and families the hotel is very quiet at night and there are no problems with noise. The rooms are spacious and provide plenty of space to get work done. Lots of high end restaurants near by. Look forward to my next stay.

Very good location to the Anaheim Convention Centre and Disneyland. Plenty of dining choices in the hotel or adjacent, Plenty of parking on site. Staff is very good. Check in and check out is very quick and easy.  Room size is good. Does not include breakfast. May be rather expensive because of that

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disneyland to walk.
Summary: This was my first visit to the DoubleTree  hotel and I was very pleased with the accommodations.  We had a microwave and refrigerator in the room which is always a plus to store snacks and in my case wine. Thanks to the friend we were staying with whom graciously used her points we could partake of the yummy buffet every morning.  Fresh fruits, egg dishes and other breakfast items were in abundance.  The hotel has a for fee daily shuttle to the Disneyland gates.  Also available is the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation)  for a nominal fee that travels on Harbor Blvd.   It is just short of a 2 mile walk to Disneyland so if you have fitbit by the time you walk back and forth and around the parks be assured you will have an ample number of steps recorded.

The hotel has a nice modern look and feel. Our room was a suite with full living area. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable, clean and the bed was extremely comfortable.  The hotel is very central and is a short 5 minute bus ride from the Disney parks or about a 20 minute walk. It is also a short walk to Katella Ave, with lots of shops and restaurants.    We found that with this convenient location, we didn't need a vehicle, as we just took a shuttle from the airport and used the buses to get to the park. If you need a car to explore, there is a car rental nearby.

Summary Heading: Great place for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Beautiful, well kept hotel.  Friendly staff, Disney ticket center in the hotel.  Room was large and very clean.  The restaurant was outstanding, excellent breakfast buffet and we also had a delicious lunch our first day.  Easy walk to Disneyland and there is a shuttle stop right outside the hotel at the end of the driveway.

I took my husband, 18 year old daughter and 3 grandchildren and I was pleasantly surprised!!!! I loved the hotel. It was clean and quiet. It was perfect for our stay. The kids loved the pool. The walk was a little long  to Disneyland, takes about 20 minutes, but we realized if we walked to the toy story lot a shuttle was always there and would take us immediately to Disneyland! It takes only about 10 minutes. Do not waste your money paying for the shuttle that comes outside the hotel, we waited a half hour and it never came so we just walked....... Wasted our money!  I would definitely stay again! We had the pool to ourself and the hot tub, it was nice!!!! The breakfast buffet was good.

Summary Heading: Great hotel next to Disney parks.
Summary: This is our 3rd time staying at this hotel. It continues to be great in terms of close proximity to the Disney parks, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and quiet, the staff is nice and friendly, and you can ask for as many cookies as you want.  The hotel is super close to many conveniences such as restaurants (for when you don't want to spend a ton of money eating in the parks), the convention center is about a block or two over, there is a CVS down the street for snacks, water and stuff that you forgot to bring with you, and there is an ART (shuttle) stop right outside the hotel driveway. We used the ART shuttle to get to and from the parks every day.  The shuttles come around every 15 minutes and get you to the parks within 10 - 15 minutes depending on traffic. If

We stay here at least once a month. We are annual pass holders and Hilton Honors Members. This place is a very nice place to stay and earn points. It would be 5 stars if they would just spend the money and buy some new pillows. Motel 6 pillows at a nice hotel.

My sister and I each brought our 5 year old grandsons to Disneyland.  My wonderful hubby tagged along to help with the boys. He slept comfortably on the living room couch while we shared queen beds with the boys.  The bathroom had dual access so no one was disturbed during the night. Great location, ease of travel.

Didn't much cater towards rewards members at the front check in. Although the restaurant took great care of us the next day. The room view was great and parking garage was pretty good. Within minutes of walking distance of the parks and local restaurants.

Nice hotel for run Disney race. Overall service was great. Love cookies and water too. Room was nice except there was some hair in the sheets and the toilet ran all night. I'd still stay there again just because of the service.

Wonderful experience at check in with warmed cookies and bottles of water (HHonors member) lovely large suite room and quality large towels and amenities. Beds are super comfortable with quality sheets.  Will stay again.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland and good size rooms.
Summary: Unfortunately the reception was the worst experience of the stay. After the family had endured a 14 hour flight and I had registered for a potential early check in months before, the stony faced receptionist sternly told me that check in was 4pm. There was no recognition of a potential early check in system that I activated on the IHG app. So we went for a long lunch, hoping that the room would be ready earlier.  I called to find that the room was ready earlier than 4pm, thankfully.  The suites include two rooms, one with two double (don't seem like queen size to me) beds and the other with sofa, armchair, desk and chair, microwave and mini fridge. The rooms were quite comfortable and the service at the pool and breakfast was good.   The hotel must be quite old but has generally

This hotel is in a great location and the lobby itself is beautiful, but beyond that I was not that impressed.  My room was rather outdated with respect to decor. It was a very big room and it was clean so they definitely get points for that, but otherwise it was a little disappointing.  I also used the fitness center and was hugely disappointed with the fitness center.  It was very tight and the day I went to use it, there were 3 cardio machines and all 3 were taken.  I wasn't even sure I wanted to stay in the room since it was rather small but I persevered and finally someone got off the treadmill and I was able to get on.    I do appreciate that the room had a microwave and a fridge, an area to sit and watch tv with a desk, so this is a great hotel if you have children and

Best hotel experience ever! I am admittedly a clean freak germaphobe and their room surpassed my expectations!!! Excellent helpful staff that go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and easy. Beds and pillows amazingly comfy.... And who can't love the complimentary warm cookies :-)

I really enjoy staying at the Doubletree! It is very clean and the minute we arrive we feel at home! We have been staying at the Doubletree for many years and visit quite frequently! So often in fact we have built friendships with several employees through the years! Gary is always on top of his game making sure we are happy and is a treasure to the Doubletree. We are always greeted with a smile and are treated like family! Victoria at the front desk is accommodating and very helpful! She has always been friendly and efficient when checking us in. We always use to enjoy breakfasts in Agio! Alejandra, Erlinda, and Karina are also irreplaceable assets to the Doubletree! They are so friendly and helpful and get our day off to a great start each time we stay. We have noticed a lot

We had a great time in Double Tree Suites! The rooms were very clean and quiet, the beds really comfortable and location was also good. Best part about our stay though was the service! Everyone from the front desk, housekeeping, room service, bell service and reservations office went an extra mile in everything we asked them for. Their management did a great job training all their employees well because their service was really something else. We stayed in Disneyland Hotel the night after, and although that hotel had nicer room design and hotel grounds (it is Disney, after all) we were disappointed with the service and thought how Double Tree handled similar requests and situations so much better. Highly recommended if you want a nice, clean and quiet place to stay in Anaheim

The hotel was beautiful, staff was friendly and helpful, room was extremely clean and attractive and the cookies were warm. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. My only recommendation would be free parking but I would still stay here again even with paid parking.

We always have a great experience at the Double Tree in Anaheim. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. Just what we need after a long day at Disneyland. We won't stay anywhere else.

We stayed here for 5 nights on a family trip to Disneyland. The room had two double beds and a sofa bed in two rooms and each room had a TV. The room and bathroom was clean and quiet. The restaurant served a great breakfast buffet that was better value than the Denny's across the street. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. There is a shuttle to Disneyland that is $5.00 per person round trip but we walked every day and it took about 15 -20 minutes of easy walking.

I would not stay here again. Front desk staff was rude to us and other guests. offered cookies to some guests ans told others they could only have them at check in. If you book a room expecting breakfast or relable internet make sure you look at your resrevatoin carefully. Mine said it included breakfast, however the AAA discount actually does not and they wanted $15 for a basic buffett breakfast with not much in the way of choices. Bas staff was very nice.

Quiet room, comfy beds, perfect size for our family of five (2 queen bed suite). The cafe downstairs makes amazing breakfast bagels, and they have a Disney welcome desk on site to purchase tickets and make restaurant reservations!! We had a fireworks view room which was perfect as well. We didn't use the pool, but could see it from our room, and it looked great! Perfect place for our vacation!

The hotel was very nice and the location is great. Not really anything to complain about this stay. I would definitely return especially for the rate we got. We also stayed at they Hyatt Place and I will say the staff there were friendlier & more helpful.

Checked in on April 29th late evening. I was called prior to arrival because it was either getting late and they were providing customer service or wanted to know if they were going to charge me when they rolled the date. We arrived and were greeted by a Friendly desk clerk welcoming.    The following day April 30th was our event, we returned to the hotel and went to the restaurant when all went down hill.  We were seated and the waitress was rushing us to order and I'm quite disturbed why she was so dismissive.  I ordered the salad vinaigrette  dressing, tomato basil soup,  it was delivered without the dressing.  She continued to set tables with coffee cups the restaurant was clearly not busy she NEVER checked back nor were the basic drinks we ordered delivered to my family a

I've stayed at this property many times since it was built. The property is clean and the rooms are quiet. Within walking distance of the Anaheim Convention Center. Great restaurants are within walking distance too.

Summary Heading: Very clean, very comfortable, and good location.
Summary: Wonderful place to stay for Disneyland. My family of 4 were very cozy here. We loved the free cookies and slept like a baby. Super clean rooms. I even let my baby crawl on the floors... Which in most places, I wouldn't allow that.

109 reviews 2.0 star rating 5/1/2016 I booked on expedia. We vended Bats day and asked to check out and hour late. We went to pay and first we got told it was 50.00 bucks. We check in at 3pm and we check out at 12:15 and get charged 50 dollars? Come on that is some serious crap. The ladies at the front counter were rude as hell. They did not care or want to do anything about it.  It said we didn't have to pay for parking and we got charged for parking. Call down to the coffee place to order coffee they won't make it until we are there.  All the customer service there sucked. Front desk help suck the most. When someone is not happy you ignore me to fix it. The front 2 ladies on today 5-1 should not be in customer service. Wifi sucked and was super slow.

We had a quick trip to Anaheim and went to Disneyland and The Angels Stadium. The Doubletree was the perfect location for both events and very reasonable compared to Disney hotels. Very clean and the staff was nice.

Summary Heading: Excellent service, rooms and overall stay
Summary: We were treated with kindness and dignity, very welcomed and well taken care of at check in, check out and during our stay.  Housekeeping was very prompt and accepting of our needs. The pool and hot tub were clean and well stocked with towels.  The room was clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Our family met us there and there was plenty of room for all, more towels were brought by housekeeping within minutes of our request, as well as extra coffee and cups. We shopped downstairs in the little store and purchased our Disneyland mickey ears and t shirts for reasonable prices.  The sales people were very nice and overjoyed when we brought the kids down so they could see them in their Disney clothing.

We stay in a suite whenever we visit as it's easier with our 2 yr old. The staff is always super friendly and the food is great! The gift shop needs some better souvenirs, but overall this hotel is awesome!

Clean, affordable, well staffed hotel. Love the rooms! Beautiful hotel with great amenities! You don't have to go anywhere if you don't want to. Nice restaurant, coffee shop, gift shop & bar as well as a beautiful pool & spa tub.

$18 a day parking? You should be ashamed. The pool was hideous and the building blocked the sun. The rooms were tiny and the maid service was not up to par. The gift shop was not open until 5. We needed emergency supplies and were unable to get them until 5. The back door Did not open at night which is inconvenient for the crowds parking lot- where someone sideswiped my car

We had a most pleasant experience, the check-in was easy, room was clean and staff was friendly.  Location is near Disneyland with local transportation available.  We will stay here again when in the area.

We stayed at this hotel for five nights.  This was a wonderful property.  It was close to Disneyland by bus.  I would definitely recommend it.  The management staff and the restaurant staff were great.  The rooms were very nice.  We would definitely stay there again in the future when we go back to Disneyland.

I was here three years ago. And ı prefered again. Good hotel. So close to disneyland. İt Takes five minutes by walking. Good restaurants are very close to the hotel. Rooms are big and clean. Breakfast is good and staff is helpful

To meeting planners:  do NOT book a socialization event in the registration hall--the noise level is deafening and you cannot hear the person talking right next to you.  Other than that, the room accommodations were just fine; the meals were just fine; and the handling of our convention was just fine.

We were in LA on a stopover before heading to Asia and wanted to make a trip to Disneyland. We used HHonors points and spent 1 night in a suite. The suite was clean and functional, although we felt that the bedroom was a tad tight with little room to open more than 1 suitcase at a time. Granted, the LR part of the suite could be used, however, my husband and I were traveling with another adult friend who was using that part of the suite; we would have liked a bit more space in the bedroom.   The staff was friendly, supplying us with a local restaurant map for the evening of our stay. The location is within (long) distance to Disneyland, but the Disney parking lot is almost directly across the street from the hotel. One can easily access Disney transportation from there. All in

Summary Heading: Awesome stay 2 years in a row
Summary: We loved our first stay in April 2015 so much we came back for spring break 2016.  We used HHonors pts both times and got a junior suite both times - separate rooms for kids and adults to watch tv, etc - pull-out bed in 1 room and two queens in the other.  Staff was great both times - tickets to Disney right around the corner, bellhop for grabbing taxis, city shuttle bus to the park.  The warm cookies at the front desk are fabulous and filling enough to fuel 2-3 hours of Disney fun in the morning.  LA traffic is tough but parking at the hotel is plentiful and convenient.  Central heat and AC is fast and QUIET - I despise wall-mounted heating and AC units!  Put the dial on the temp you want and wait 5 minutes - done!  Why can't they all be like that?  Fridge worked great, not

We were here couple years ago and I gave them an A+ back then. This time,  however,  the front desk put a damper on our family reunion trip.  I had 2 suites reserved and checked in online for the 7th floor with one room facing Disneyland and the other room directly across the hall. We were with our daughter's family who flew in from TX. My other daughter was next door in a regular type room and she had done her reservation separately.   We checked in and the front desk woman was not very friendly or welcoming at all.  She just handed us keys and I am the one who noticed we were no longer on same floor.    While I understand the circumstances (guest decided to stay extra night in the room facing Disney),  I think it could've been handled better.  They did give us a room directly

Summary Heading: I would never stay here again!
Summary: The room was dirty the sink was clogged the toilet from prior guest was not flushed and To top it all off me and daughter got bit by something in the room and the manager Freddy is not very welcoming or helpful and has a bad attitude

Hotel was dean and well maintained, parking was excessive especially for guests on property. The breakfast was minminal and ok.   Would stay at property again for meetings at convention center walk almost mile for Disney land.

Hotel is very dated and hence feels grubby. Walkable to Disney but quite a trek especially after a day in the parks. Breakfast is just ok and staff very inattentive. Overall would not recommend. Look for something closer and more modern.

Traveled to Anaheim to take our kids to Disneyland for a couple days and stayed here the night before hitting the parks and checking into Grand Californian for two nights.  This place was everything we wanted in that it was nice, clean, quiet and centrally located. Even though we used HHonors points (which typically means you get the worst room in the joint) the room was large, well appointed, clean, and comfortable in all aspects. Upon arrival we had time to get the kids down to the pool area for about an hour before dinner and that was pleasant as well. Desk Staff was professional and courteous.  The only reason I can't give five stars is that the bellhop never offered to help with bags ( must not work for tips?) although he did say "welcome to Doubletree" all three times I

Day 1: During our check in our request was not to be close to the pool, or ground floor.  We get a room on the second/ground floor facing the pool. Disappointing!   Day 2: We waited for the Disneyland shuttle for half an hour and finally ended up walking to Disneyland parks. The hotel staff  told us that the shuttle is not owned by the doubletree suits. Understood! However, next time I'd rather stay in the hotel that owns their shuttles, or closer to the parks.   At last, we cut our stay a night shorter without getting any reimbursements. Would rather come back under better hotel stay circumstances.

Hotel was clean, nice, and located in a great part of the city. Bed was extremely comfortable, I will definitely be staying there again. Hotel rate was best value in Anaheim. We were able to utilize Uber for a cheap price everywhere we needed to go.

Summary Heading: Great hotel located blocks from Disney!
Summary: What a great hotel we found here!  This gem of a hotel is centrally located to so much in the area; Disneyland is about a 5 min shuttle ride away. There is an awesome outlet mall within walking distance.   Angels Stadium is within a mile or so.  Oh yeah- and there's an In-N-Out burger close by as well!  Great service from the front desk to the maid staff.  Also a really, really nice outdoor area (outside of the bar) with fire places to warm chilly nights!

We were there for 3 days 2 nights - mainly for Disneyland. Hotel has been renovated and room is spacious and comfortable. We UBER/LYFT to anywhere we wanted to go. Reception was welcoming and helpful - the famous walnut chocolate chip cookie was given which was delicious. Thank you Double Tree!

Jacuzzi not working the 1st day Pool have no towels for 2 of 4 days stay Coffee maker not working at all No sugar refill for 2 days.  With written request. Coffee shop close at 5 or 6 pm.  Not a family friendly hotel.

This was one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. It's very close to Disneyland, and I didn't know at the time, but there's a shuttle to the park from the hotel. The rooms are huge and very comfortable. Love to come back!

Doubletree sent my 1000 cash deposit to their bank and at check out couldn't produce my remainding balance of 300. The staff was completely unhelpful and unconcerned with my problem. They told me I should have used a credit card. I ended up leaving without my 300 dollars and still haven't been reimbursed and have no allusions of ever seeing that money.

this hotel was excellent I would recommend this to anyone but had a great view the dining area was great it was very quiet and comfortable the floor we stayed in was perfect and we were able to see the fireworks from our room the room service was great as well

We stayed three nights in a suite.  I was traveling with my two young adult children and my daughter's friend.  The suite was a nice for our group.  I do agree with the other reviewers, I think the beds were doubles, as well.  My son slept on the couch hide-abed. He thought it was very uncomfortable. He ended up just sleeping on the couch.  The room was clean and the cleaning staff had taken the time make towel animals and cute little touches in the bathroom.  The pool area was very nice.  We enjoyed their breakfast buffet.  Very nice, with lots of options to chose from.  Parking was 18.00 a night, which seemed high, since we were already paying room rates. The parking lot was never full, seems like parking should come with the room.  Close to Disneyland. Over all a nice hotel.

Over all the location was convenient to things. The conference room was nice but fluctuations in temperature  were extreme.  The audio and video equipment should be working before the attendees are sitting down.  That responsibility might have been the organizations. I love double trees and they are always my preference.  The food in the restaurant was wonderful.  I can't believe how smoothly the served so many people at lunch time from the conference!!! Kudos to the staff!!!

Summary Heading: Size of queen bed is actually a double marketed as a queen
Summary: Pleasant experience until I walked into the room and found my "queen bed" to be the size of a double. Was told that our bed was a "standard queen" and that's what it is. Felt bit cheated as I specifically prepaid for a queen bed, for 2 guest, and now had to squeeze into a double. Don't trust the size until you ask for measurements.

We visited with three teenagers and had a 2 queen suite with sofa bed.  Clean and well maintained.  Staff from check in, housekeeping, checkout, and restaurant were all friendly and helpful.  Shuttle bus stops outside and has $5 RT fee to Disneyland or about a mile walk.  Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is about .5 miles from the convention center and about 1 mile from Disney. Both pleasant, easy walks for this 70 year old. The room was clean and very comfortable, I even was able to get a firm pillow with a phone call. The cookies are fabulous as was the staff.

This is a fantastic hotel and close to Anaheim Disney. The Disney shuttle is at the door of the hotel and tickets to the shuttle could be bought at the hotel. We had a family suite and it was spacious. The hotel maybe because of the location is costly and it cost us USD 450 without breakfast or parking. The breakfast is fantastic and the staff there a star but again it was pricey but kids eat free with every paying adult.  There are a number of decent eating places just opposite the hotel and within walking distance. If you are driving it is away from the hustle of the LA traffic and the exit is easy to find. Overall I had a good experience in this hotel and highly recommend it.

The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  One of the nicest features of this hotel was its location. Walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center made it very appealing to us.I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. I would also stay there again when we return to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great stay during our Disneyland vacation
Summary: The hotel was extremely convenient to Disney, the staff very accommodating and the hotel very pleasant.  The in-room dining was very good.  We ordered the chicken wings which came with a great asian-infused sauce.  Very good! We will stay here again with our family on our next trip.

Rooms are small. Customer Service is horrible. They do not honor or are aware of your HHonor Benefits. There are plenty hotels in the neighborhood; stay somewhere else. They even charge for the shuttle to Disney.

Great location close to Disney. Sells tickets to Disney parks right at the hotel great hot cookies every night!!  Also sells bus tickets to ride to parks will stay here again when visiting Disney parks! Titus was helpful

Summary Heading: Staff made the stay worth it.
Summary: Loved the stay. Freddy at Agio was exceptional as our server. Ryan at front desk hand delivered extra cookies to our room, Put a smile on our face. The room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. Pay for 2-room the suite, you will appreciate the extra room.

We've stayed here a few times and each time has been great! Though it is a bit far walking distance to Disneyland, you can always take a taxi or the ART. Rooms are clean and the decor is contemporary. The beds are comfy. The front desk is always warm and welcoming. We will be back!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel And Close To Disneyland
Summary: Stayed at Double Tree March 25th 2016 for six nights. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Hotel lobby was small but the check in process was very quick.  The 2 bedroom suite was large and had plenty of room for my wife and two children and myself. The sofa converted into a bed with plenty of room for two kids. Room was clean and the cleaning ladies did a good job for our entire stay. Shuttle outside the hotel came every 10-15 minutes to Disneyland $5 each per day. We did not eat at any of the on site restaurants so I can not say how their food is but the restaurant and the bar area was visually appealing. Only slight complaint would be with the internet ( free ), slow and would drop several times per day. I would return to this hotel.

Hotel has great two room suites which is perfect for families. Pool is small and the service here is weak. I've been a Hilton  honors member for some time and my profile has specific requests. At check in, the front desk couldn't get it right. Requested an hour later checkout from Eric at the front desk and in between of his mouth being full he mentioned the hotel was sold out for the night. Interesting that I looked at extending my stay minutes before and they offered several options for rooming that evening. I won't be booking here again. Glad there is a Marriott closeby

Stayed here for two nights while visiting the parks.  Save your money and walk to the parks from this location.  By the time you park in one of Disney's $18 lots and walk the distance is about the same.  Room was clean and the staff were great!  Our package didn't include a free breakfast. Plenty of eating options in the area.  I would return here again if visiting the area.

This routine hotel is just one of many similar establishments near Disneyland. That said it was comfortable and reasonably priced. The staff were helpful and the breakfasts adequate. The coffee shop did not stay open very long but the bar served a good coffee and was a fair alternative. Getting to the park was easy as the Anaheim resort bus came every 30 minutes and only cost $5 each person for 3 days ( we were lucky to get discounted tickets). If we come back to Anaheim we would be happy to stay here again.

Great room king bed is very comfortable great rates friendly staff bathroom  was very clean and so was the room it was 2 blocks away from Disneyland with all sorts of different selections of places to eat outside the park definitely would stay again next time I'm in town

Summary Heading: Excellent family hotel for Disneyland visit
Summary: This hotel met all our expectations and beyond.  I was travelling with my kids 13 and 16 y/o.  We got a 2 room suite.  Room was comfortable, clean and the location was convenient to Disneyland via shuttle.  We did have to pay $18/day for parking but I think that is pretty typical.  My kids enjoyed the pool and we all enjoyed the hot tub.

I booked this hotel at last minute , I liked this hotel  because of good and clean room , good and clean pool , hot tub fire works , big parking lot and easy acces , good food , my kids had good time, they liked and would love to  stay again ,

The hotel is nice.  Suite makes a single room do-able for a family of 4.  Location is good, but the real difference here is the people.  They are welcoming and helpful from the minute you walk in, all the way through checkout.  The people are what made me a return customer the first time, and they didn't disappoint on my return.

I received great service with doubletree. Everything was perfect great and affordable room service: breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Free and fast internet, their staff is very intelligent and are fast on their feet. They are impossible to be disappointed with.

What a great place to stay. Decent sized rooms that were extremely clean and tidy. The warm cookies on arrival can't be beaten. Staff really friendly. Lovely breakfast each morning with loads of variety. Nice swimming pool. Best of all just a brisk 10-15min walk to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a great price
Summary: We stay here every year for a cheer comp. I have additional kids that do not cheer and there is a shuttle that picks my teenagers up right in the front and they get to go to Disneyland/CA everyday. It's very easy to go back and forth from the hotel to the park. I'm able to relax by the pool or walk to the convention center to see the comp. This location is perfect. Staff is friendly. Price is affordable. Room is big enough for my family of 5.

Great, clean hotel, walking distance from disney. Only thing, they don't give complimentary water bottles like other hotels. But friendly staff, very helpful. Also, they increased the rates once we asked them to increase our stay by a day, so don't increase your stay. Or book the number of days beforehand. It's got a good pool, good food and great ambience

Summary Heading: Amazing Free Cookies! Great place with kids and close to disneyland.
Summary: We went on our 2nd trip to Disneyland with our twin infants. The place was great, we booked a suite and it was very good size. Clean and distance is about 20 mins walk to disneyland. We could see the fireworks from our room. We also were able to get playpen for our boys...I think we would totally come again. Their free homemade cookies were amazing! They give them to you warm and individually wrapped! It was my boys first ever cookies!  They have a gym and headphones for their machines... I think it was perfect

Very clean. Quiet. Pricey but no surprises. Close to Disneyland.  Starbucks and gift shop on bottom floor carrying anything you could have forgotten . Room service food fairly good! Clean rooms and polite staff.

We recently stayed at this property while visiting Disneyland. We did have a car and paid $18 per night to park, which I thought was a bit high. The property is about a mile from the Disney entrance, and it can be walked, or we were told that a regular bus will pick up right out front. We purchased a three-day pass for the ART bus for $12 per person. The first day we used the pass, we waited about 45 minutes for a bus to come. They were said to come every 20 minutes, but that is not the case. We also waited long periods of time to get the bus back to the hotel at the end of the day from Disneyland. In fact, several times we ended up walking because we had waited so long and there was no bus in sight.  The hotel itself was very nice. The rooms were clean and spacious. The rooms

I  heard about the cookies but was still surprised that they were warm and unlimited! This hotel is clean, beautiful lobby, clean rooms, staff was friendly. The only issue we had is eating at the restaurant. I know hotel restaurants are expensive but we saw a sign offering free kids meals with a purchase of an entree. Turns out a cheeseburger isn't considered an entree so we didn't get the free kids meals.

Summary Heading: Good location and new hotel, but rooms are quite simple and parking is expensive
Summary: We recently stayed there and i think that the colors patterns of the room and the design is not really contemporary for a new hotel. maybe this is part of the overall concept for Double tree but i expected something more modern including the bathrooms that look like they were built in the 80s. beds are comfortable and big tv screen. parking is extra and not cheap.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, priced well, close to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed at this Doubletree on a whim. The prices are competitive and the only downside I found is that parking is not free.  However, the hotel boasts a rooftop pool and hottub, a Starbucks, a restaurant (I forget the name of it) and is in very close proximity to Disneyland. There is a Denny's across the street as well. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Excellent accommodations, friendly staff, cleanliness. Complimentary breakfast. Near to Disneyland,easy access to city transit. To and from park. Would definitely recommend and consider for a future visit.

This is a great hotel in a great location with very large rooms and amazingly large bathrooms. Excellent ventilation in the room. Having just come from an older property with no ventilation, this was really appreciated. Room is well equipped with microwave and refrigerator. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Everything was perfect and front desk was very friendly and efficient

I stayed in a room for business at this hotel.  I did have to move to a new room because my carpet was wet, which they couldn't figure out why.  They made the process simple and moved me quickly into a new room.  Gym was nice and clean.  Parking was $15 per day.  Conveniently located.

This was our first visit to a Double Tree and I was super impressed. This location is so convenient to Disneyland. The ART ( shuttle bus) is outside the hotel .  The suites are big and comfortable. The cookies on arrival are a nice treat ( however may I suggest not putting walnuts or pecans in due to nut allergies!) The staff are friendly we had great service from Karina in the restaurant and Gary the concierge! The breakfast buffet is delicious and offers good variety of cereals, waffles, eggs , meats, fruit , yogurt. So reasonably priced too and kids under 12 eat free. It's not crazy busy at the buffet either just relaxing before you venture out into the abyss of Disneyland crowds!  They have laundry too which was do convenient and it's only $1.50 a load! Starbucks coffee shop

This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in! The staff is very professional, very friendly, even the security guard at 4a.m. smiled! This hotel has an excellent restaurant, very nice lounge and a biscotti coffee shop. The area is very quiet, no street noise. The rooms are perfect and comfortable. Disneyland is 2 blocks down the street, and it is located near great restaurants with a few blocks. This hotel is very impressive and the rate was very reasonable.

We came here at the end of February. This place looked like a ghost town. I hardly saw any guests at the hotel. Check in was a breeze. Our room was huge which was so nice to have with a 13mo old and a 4yr old. Lots of space for them to play. I loved how the room had a microwave and small fridge, so I can warm the baby's milk or snacks.  The pool was small, but heated which was nice. There is a gym and an "arcade". I wouldn't be that excited reading arcade in their amenities because it's literally a small closet room with a pinball machine and two video games, one of which was broken.   We had free breakfast buffet as part of our package. It was average with the basics - eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, fruit, oatmeal, etc. and one "chef special" dish. There's also a coffee stand in

break fast is great. Room is clean and quiet. Pool is wonderful. It is a great experience to stay with this hotel. The service is wonderful, and all staff are well trained. All equipment including internet access are great. It is a great place for family vacation

Overall, we were quite pleased with the accommodations-- comfortable suite layout, very clean, nice staff for the hotel! Good location-- walkable route to Disneyland, bus available, many food choices nearby. We agree that the parking fee is a rip-off.  The lot was only about 1/3 full when we were there, so guests must be parking elsewhere...there seems to be street parking available in the neighborhoods nearby, but we never checked it out, so it may be restricted. The associated "kiosks"in the hotel were a disappointment.... the folks working at the Disneyland info booth had VERY little to do most of the time, and yet could not be bothered to go beyond the " I don't know" or "You have to check with them" response for most questions.  What????? Why not be willing to learn? ( And

This place was excellent. My family of 5 and I stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel is family friendly, clean and offers your normal amenities.  The front desk give you warm cookies when you arrive!  We stayed in a suite which offered a living room and a bedroom with two queen beds. There was a sofa couch and it worked out great. We ordered room service and the food was delicious.  The hotel is close to Disneyland and the shuttle picked us up right in front of the hotel on Harbor drive.  You can buy the shuttle tickets at the hotel. Overall, we will stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Outstanding stay, an I'm a tough critic!
Summary: In town for a 3-day park hopper Disneyland visit.  What an amazing, comfortable stay!  I'm a very finicky hotel guest and I couldn't find one thing to complain about here!  From the super staff (especially Eileen, thanks girl!) the the clean and comfy suite we had (2 room, 2 queens and sofa bed) it was perfect!  Very important aspect also was availability of the ART transit system.  Parked my car on Thursday and checked it out on Saturday! Only suggestion I would have is a more affordable, family friendly dining option.  In hotel restaurant was pricey and the coffee bar wasn't open later in the day.  Would definitely stay here again!

Great hotel  Well priced, very quiet, rooms were large, service was OUTSTANDING!  Parking was a breeze.  Quick drive to the park, it would be a bit to far to walk from here   Breakfast was excellent  Will be staying again in the near future

Best service I have received in a very long time! Friendly, knowledgeable, courteous, kind staff in all areas of hospitality. I will stay there again! The beds were very comfortable. The pool area clean and convenient. The restaurant food delicious and a good price. Try the citrus butter salmon!

I've just gotten around to writing this review - even though we stayed a few months ago in December. We are Disneyland annual passholders who are visiting the parks 4-5 times this year and this time we stayed at the Doubletree. After a long drive - the signature chocolate chip cookies hit the spot and I appreciated the fast and efficient check in process. The room was very clean, up to date and comfortable. If you are traveling with young children who need a good night's sleep and quality naps during your Disney trip - you will appreciate the suite arrangement at the Doubletree. I was able to get up, move around, watch the morning news, and make coffee without ever waking them up. I find this to be impossible in a standard hotel room. I booked this hotel stay through

Our stay at Double Tree in Anaheim was very pleasant. The room was clean and very comfortable. The hallways were quiet et clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant served great meals. And of course, the location was super for convention goers and Disney lovers.

This is my third time staying there, it is convenient and close to the convention center, service was very gfood and checking in was a breeze. Breakfast was good and ss was the lounge( for drinks) also enjoyed dinner at the restaurant. rooms were clean overall experience was great

Summary Heading: Very disappointing start to our holiday!
Summary: My husband and I booked this hotel through a booking agent. This was the start to our 2 week holiday, LA first and then on to Vegas. I have always booked through booking agents so I wanted to try another one. I had all my paperwork with me stating that we are booked and prepaid. i presented it to the lady at reception and she looked it up and said we were not in the computer system. She then rang the agent and was on hold for 21 minutes. My husband and I were very tired after the long trip and just wanted to rest. So my husband asked for the supervisor thinking that we could be given a room till the booking was sorted out. The supervisor (her name was Lourdes) was very unwelcoming and said that  we booked through a third party so WE should be doing our own phonecalls. She didn't

From arrival to departure ... there were no problems.  Gym could be better, its small, but luckily it was not crowded. It is walking distance to the convention center and Disneyland. Unfortunately, I could not use the pool, because of the cold weather.  However, it looked well kept and clean.

The hotel is in a great location and the in-house amenities are nice.  Breakfast was great and the bar in the evening was very social.  There seems to be a shortage of King bed rooms for the single/business traveler.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, friendly. Great Disneyland option.
Summary: Stayed here with my young daughter for 3 nights for a trip to Disneyland. It's about a 20 minute walk to the parks, which saved us some money compared to staying within the Disney complex.  We had a 1 bed suite which was clean, quiet and well maintained. Housekeeping were great and we dined in the in house restaurant one night which was really good.  Every staff member was friendly and they even helped us with organising a car to take us to our next location.  If the 20min walk is acceptable to you, I'd definitely recommend this as an option if visiting Disneyland. There's also a Disneyland Welcome Centre in the building so you can get your tickets before visiting the park and save time.  I'd definitely stay there again.

This place felt safe, looked very clean, and staff was friendly. Will definitely stay at agian. Room Service was good. Not worth the money, but been to a lot of hotels where charge a arm and leg and food is bad. And there is no such thing as reasonable room servive. So won't say that's a negative thing here, but loved the coffee shop down stairs.

Quiet and restful, clean, well maintained. Stayed for a conference. Be aware of additional fees - resort fee etc. Good product for the price we paid. Approximate .5 mile walk to the convention center.

This is a great place to stay for Disneyland! Just take a short Uber down to the park from here for $5- it's perfect.  We have done this for several years straight and have never been let down.  The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly- all good:)

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms, short walk to convention center, gym is terrible
Summary: I recently stayed here for a physical therapy convention.  Pros: Spacious rooms (had a separate living room from the bedroom), comfy beds, nice staff, coffee shop, restaurant/bar, 7-10 minute walk to convention center, free WiFi  Cons: The gym is terrible. Come on guys, 3 cardio machines with one broken?  The gym was the size of a closet. There was no space do even do your own workout if you couldn't get on the cardio machines. I woke up at 530am on both mornings and was unable to workout because there were already 3 people in there taking up all the room. Also $16/day parking is a bit lame since you're still quite a long ways walk to disneyland  Even though the gym was a big letdown, I only took off 1 star because it still is a nice hotel...

Summary Heading: You will be very very pleasantly surprised - super nice!
Summary: Large rooms, great staff, clean clean clean...felt like a luxery hotel for sure...great value for the dollar!  The staff were wonderful...check in was quick and efficient, as was checking out...fast internet service.

A very nice hotel. Suites were very roomy and well appointed.  A Starbucks in the lobby is a bonus.  Staff is very friendly and helpful. A long walk (1mi) to Disneyland for young, old or those who's feet are spent from a long day in the park. Rooms on S.Harbor have  street noise.  I would recommend this hotel for families because the suites are so generous in size.

I choose this hotel to accommodate my conference at the Convention Center. Overall, clean hotel, friendly staff, nice outdoor pool. Be aware that you are charged for parking. I did think the  rooms were overpriced relative to another hotel that I recently stayed at very close to the Doubletree.

Summary Heading: Great location, Great service, Great Product
Summary: We have stayed at this location a few times and love the location.  We walked to Disneyland - quick walk and very convenient.  The rooms are well maintained and clean.  The service was excellent.  The digital check/in was awesome!  I chose my own room.  And of course, the hot cookies at check/in are a bonus!

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Stay Close to Disneyland
Summary: We are not big spenders when it comes to hotels, but we do like to stay in nice places.  This DoubleTree really fit the bill.  We are a family of four that wanted to have a nice weekend away to visit the Happiest Place On Earth.  The room was fit the bill as a suite for the four of us.  Very clean, happy and friendly staff.  The hotel is close to Disneyland without being right next to the park.  Plenty of restaurants in the area and the stop for the ART Bus is right outside of the hotel (very handy).  We were able to purchase ART Bus (Anaheim Resort Transit) tickets and leave our car at the hotel.  The hotel parking lot has a parking gate arm that requires a pass to enter and exit.  Although you have to pay for overnight parking, we definitely exceeded 24 hours of parking and we

great stay , the staff were very courteous and helpful. I appreciated the warm cookies as usual. the hotel is very close to all of the attractions and the rooms are very nice. Very well kept up and meticulous in th ecleaning and room care.

This is a great property close to Disney where the suite aspect really comes in handy with kids. This is not a five star resort but I gave it a 5 rating because it was excellent for what it is.   The property is new, clean and well appointed. Regular Mid-tier suite furniture - like an Embassy Suites or something similar - but the beds were fine, the bathroom is new and clean and the living area was fine. Not great but fine.  If you are going to the parks you can take a shuttle that stops at the street just outside or you can grab a taxi or an Uber. We did the latter each time as I don't like to mess with shuttles but I heard from others it was fine. The property is too far to walk in my opinion but it could be done I suppose. Parking is on site and there is a restaurant which

Summary Heading: I will not recommend Hilton Anaheim
Summary: I used to love staying or even recommend Hilton for business and personal. However, my recent terrible experience changes that. Hotel front desks are not helpful and bad listeners. It seems they are too busy with their personal matter instead of listening to customer and provide the proper customer services.

I had 2 comfortable nights at this property. Beds were nice and internet was good. Breakfast was acceptable and you could get other fare but I choose just to do the buffet. Since I was here on business I am not sure how a family would fare but I did see a couple of families stay here. I think there is a shuttle to Disney. I recommend this property to any Hilton Member or not.

Traveling by myself with a friend and my kids.  Upon check in the staff asked why my husband was not traveling with me.  When I told them I was traveling alone I was told I would not receive any Hilton Honor benefits even though we have a joint account.  The staff said I was lucky to be checking in.  I have a credit card in my name and should not matter.  Very rude and the service was terrible had to wait 24 hours just to get extra towels.  Will not stay here again.

My family stayed here on our trip to Disneyland/California Adventure for my sons 4th birthday. Really enjoyed my stay here! Comfortable and convenient! Would definitely stay here again if in the area especially since I am a Hilton Honors member.

Great hotel for your stay in Anaheim.  Easy walk to some very nice restaurants and casual dining places as well.  Lots of choices for eating.  Hotel dining was good as well. Short walk to Disneyland and Convention Center.  Great place to stay to be close to the activities but not right in the middle of things so you get a peace stay.

Summary Heading: Friendly, Helpful Staff Makes this a Special Place to Stay
Summary: We came back for the second time because this hotel is well-kept, modern and has a friendly, helpful staff. They gave us advice about the bus to Disneyland, provided an excellent breakfast and put our family in adjoining rooms so we could spend time together. When we needed something, it was taken care of with a smile. We will stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

The suites are spacious and nice.  Service was fine.   The breakfast buffet was okay. I loved the fresh fruit selection (incl. yummy strawberries and fresh pears), and I loved the homemade salsa!!  (Across the street is a little Mexican restaurant also with great salsa.). The pastries are low quality. The potatoes were wet and had peppers we couldn't eat.  My husband wanted to just order something plain or an omelet, but the breakfast staff said that wasn't allowed, so he had nothing to eat. Therefore, we left and will not be back.

Summary Heading: Clean, nice BUT FAR FROM DISNEYLAND
Summary: The map on the website is WRONG.  It is deceiving.  This Doubletree is a 20 minute walk from Disneyland.  Yes, it is clean and quiet.  But after a long day at Disney, I wanted a CLOSE facility.  I am disappointed.  Also the front desk staff are ignorant.  They could not tell me about the local tram that goes to all the amusement parks in the city.  It is hard to find the ice machines and they are not listed on the maps on each floor.  My room was not ready as promised and I needed to wait 20-30 minutes.  The beds are very good.

Summary Heading: Free Cookies & RIP OFF Fee for Parking
Summary: Stay here 3 days on a business trip , very nice hotel with large rooms that are clean and comfortable, a lot of Families going to Disneyland and not as quiet as other double trees, did not eat in the hotel restaurant. A little Miffed that you have to pay 16$ a day to park your car - ok stay but a RIP OFF for parking

Summary Heading: Great hotel, bit of a walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland (wife and I and baby).  We stayed in a 1-King bed, 2 room suite, which was fantastic because it has a real, closing door between the sitting room and bedroom so we were able to set up the crib and put the baby to bed and still be up in the other room.  It's a bit of a walk to Disneyland, several long blocks, a 15-20 min walk, but we still did the walk all 3 days.  You pass a couple nice restaurants and a CVS on the way.  There are various public transit options as well if you don't want to walk the mile.  The pool was also quite nice.  Pool was well heated, and the hot-tub wasn't overly hot.

The best hotel to stay at if you are planning a trip to Disneyland!  It is so classy, friendly, clean and comfortable.  My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon when we visited Disneyland and we couldn't ask for a better place!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disney goers, as well as those going outside of Anaheim
Summary: Hotel was very neat and clean.  Liked that Laundry facilities were available on our floor.  The free cookies are awesome!  It is a nice treat that you can get them daily if you want them.  Was a nice treat at the end of a long day in the park.  The hot tub and pool were also kept nice a clean.  It was a pleasure to stay here.  On site food was also very good and reasonably priced.

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was great. We got free fresh chocolate chip cookies any time we wanted. The rooms were nice and clean. Friendly staff. Short 15 minute walk to Disneyland. We took Uber which was perfect since it only cost $4.95 one way. This is definitely a place stay next time we visit Disneyland.

The staff are friendly and helpful, and they accept traveler's cheque as payment. The room is nice and quiet. Breakfast is perfect. Gym is opening 24/7.   The only problem we had was no electric kettle in the room but only a coffee brewer. We have to use the coffee brewer multiple times to get enough hot water.

Summary Heading: very comfy beds, friendly staff, beware $5 surcharge for receiving packages
Summary: Stayed here on biz - a very good hotel experience... rooms were clean, staff were friendly and helpful (thanks front desk service staff Victoria, you are amazing!).   Rooms are large, spacious and beds were very comfy - I had no issues sleeping soundly. Water pressure at the bathroom was superb.   Great location too - Disneyland's front gate is a 5min Uber ride away. Big CVS pharmacy and excellent Mortons/Chris n Ruth steakhouses all within a 5min walking distance.

This has become my hotel of choice in Anaheim.  Stayed there again for the third time while attending a trade show at the Convention Center.  Easy walking distance to the Convention Center. Again, I found the staff the be very friendly and helpful.  Getting directions, taxis to go anywhere was not an issue as they arranged taxis  for you whether if it was to the airport of just around town. The room was very nice, clean, no issue with towels not being replaced.  The bed was great.   I ate mostly in the hotel restaurant.  The selection was ok but what I ordered for dinner was very tasty.  As it was my third time at the hotel there were a few familiar faces in the restaurant.  It was like seeing old friends again, which was nice. For breakfast I choose to have the buffet.  This

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. I chose the hotel because I used my Hilton Honors points to book, but I was very happy with the accommodations and location even though it wasn't right next to the parks.  It was an easy 15 minute walk to the parks.  The hotel has a shuttle that was waiting outside to take you to the park, but we only used it once. I don't know what the official cost is, but the driver asked for $10 for three of us. We also took a cab home one night and it was $8 for 5 of us at 1 am, which was quite reasonable. The rooms were quiet and clean with a lot of space. The rooms we stayed in had two beds in the bed room and a sofa bed in the separate living room. The staff at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful.

Summary Heading: Sub-par breakfast buffet mars this otherwise great hotel
Summary: I've been trying to get into this DoubleTree during a major annual trade convention for years, based on previous experience with the breakfast buffet and close proximity (walking distance) to the convention center.  Finally was able to book it this year, only to experience a mediocre buffet and when I complained, especially about the sub-par scrambled eggs, I was told that they are now made from powdered eggs because "real eggs are expensive"!  $15.50 for a breakfast buffet (which in the past was excellent) at a Hilton property should not include powdered eggs. A few other items offered on the buffet, including daily 'special' items, were also mediocre. Very disappointing.
Manager Response: Dear Gil G,  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel.   I apologize that our server gave you incorrect information about our breakfast buffet. The hotel does indeed use real eggs for the buffet as well as the cooked to order breakfast. We've made sure to educate the server you spoke with.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service and breakfast. Thank you again for your comments.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great stay near the convention center
Summary: Great hotel with a friendly, enthusiastic staff. Easy walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center (5 minutes). Clean rooms, good breakfast, friendly people. Would definitely stay here again. Numerous fine dining options within walking distance as well.

The receptionist is quite nice and very speedy, the whole check in is less than 2 minutes, very good. The room is very spacious but a little dated The bed is comfortable and clean It is good for family to go to Disney land  There are plenty of restaurants nearby
Manager Response: Dear Eric J  Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We truly appreciate it when customers take time out of their busy days to provide us with some open and honest feedback about our hotel and services.  I'm surprised to hear you think the room is dated and too spacious.  We completed a multi million dollar renovation in fall of 2013, updating decor and furnishings.  Once again, thank you for taking the time to let us know how you feel. We appreciate your loyalty and truly want to make your experience as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed in a two room suite, with two queen size beds. We were excited to be part of the Star Wars half marathon weekend. The room was a nice size, very comfortable beds and couch.  Great room, great service, perfect location for Disneyland.

The Doubletree Hotel is about a 30 minute walk from Disneyland.  We stayed just one night for an event at Disneyland.  The employees are very friendly and helpful.  We had a 2 queen bed suite-a bedroom with 2 queens and a living room with a sofa bed.  The living room was a bit small but all in all, adequate for a one night stay.  Parking is $16 per day.  Parking at Disneyland is $18/day.  We walked to Disneyland so we never inquired if they provided a shuttle bus or not.  There a many restaurants near the hotel.  It's close enough to everything you would want but far away enough to be away from all the crazy traffic and tons of people closer to Disneyland.  last but not least-the complimentary cookies they provide is always appreciated!

At this Double Tree I stayed for about a month and have received the most exceptional service one can received. The staff were very professionally and treat you with the most respect. From the parking, lobby, bathrooms and my room were in exceptional order, very clean and outstanding. The location is convenient to get to any place you need to and in addition it offers many things to do nearby. The best part of all, was the excellent food, from breakfast to dinner. I could not believe how amazing the staff were!! David Mora, the manager went above and beyond to assist me. Erlinda Bornan and Karla Islas Provided exceptional service every time I came down to the restaurant.The chef, Cesar Pinacho has great culinary skills because the food was amazing, no matter what day it was.

We chose this hotel for its location next to the parking lot we normally park in when we go to Disneyland.  The hotel itself was very nice.  Very comfortable beds, clean rooms, and nice amenities like a refrigerator and microwave oven.  The staff kind of seemed warn down or something.  Not as friendly as other hotels at check in.  On the last day, I asked for a later check out time, and I got a yes with an attitude.  I also had a problem with my Hilton points that I should have received with my stay.  Overall it is still a nice hotel and a good choice if you are going to Disneyland or the Anaheim convention center.  Its just you also want to have a nice experience without any problems.
Manager Response: Dear Cuaman,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.    Please accept my apologies for the disappointing arrival and departure experience.  The front desk is a key area and I will be sure to share your feedback with the team.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The location is good for Disneyland.  The rooms are nice. We had a two queen bed suite with a gold out sofa. If you fold out the sofa it is impossible to walk through the other room.   Our room was quiet, even though it was on Harbor Boulevard!  The internet worked adequately.   The parking fee is outrageous.  If you can get there without a car:  do it.  $16 a day to park your own car at a hotel is highway robbery.  I would rather you just add the charge into the overnight cost so that there are no additional fees. At least there was no resort fee.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Warm cookies at check in had me from the start. Great rooms and location. Denny's across road for a cheap but decent brekkie, lunch or dinner with other good food options nearby. Disneyland of course easy walking distance. Special shout out to Garry who helped us with our bags who was very helpful and an all round nice guy.   Great bar downstairs and also coffee cafe which has great brekkie buns. Didn't try the restaurant but would think as per rest of this hotel would be on the money's ugly recommend for a family as rooms a big and having the lounge room just gives that extra room to hide away from the teenagers :)

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and ideal for family visits to Disneyland!
Summary: Nice hotel and ideal for family visits to Disneyland! Prices were reasonable given that we visited during the Christmas holidays. Service was ok, The room facing the central air conditioner as the view- was poor. The service desk were polite during check in and really rude during check out.
Manager Response: Dear Sam A,  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel.   I apologize for the disappointing view and the level of service provided at departure.  I will be reviewing your comments with the Front Desk team.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you again for your comments.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Double Tree Suites we stayed at was wonderful and great location. It had great staff especially the bell captains they are very helpful and service was excellent. A short walk to Disneyland and close to good restaurants like Boca di Peppo, Ruth Chris, and Morton.

This hotel was one of the nicest I have ever stayed in.  It was extremely clean, and smelled very good despite having smoking rooms available.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, family, and workmates alike.  The hotel staff as well were very pleasant and helpful.

Stayed here with my best friend on our two day Disneyland vacation. Wonderful hotel about a  20 minute walk from the park. Breakfast is not included, but the buffet looked and smelled great. You can purchase tickets for the ART shuttle from the concierge at the hotel. However, if you don't mind an easy walk you can save a few dollars. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Rate, Great Stay
Summary: I stayed here with my two (toddler) kids and my husband and couldn't have had a more comfortable experience. I was comfortable with the cleanliness and the layout having two toddlers sitting on the furniture and the floor.

Comfortable rooms and beds, excellent staff, terrific breakfast buffet. Great base for a family trip to Disneyland. Hotel is a fifteen minute walk to theme parks, or a quick bus trip when you're worn out a the end of the day. Close to restaurants and shopping. Quality hotel in a nice neighbourhood.

Anytime we go to Disneyland, this is our go to spot! If you have a annual pass, you can walk across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and take the Disney Resort Shuttle.  The rooms are big and clean. We usually get the two room suite. It has two queen beds and a sofa that's a pull out bed.   Towels are plush. Customer service here is great! Recommend this spot for anyone looking for a place to stay near Disneyland.

We stayed here over Christmas for a little trip to Disney and were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious and very clean. My kids loved the fresh cookies every day and the walk to Disney was easy- about 15 to 20 minutes. Beds were comfy and although we wanted to use the pool, we ran out of time. Breakfast at the hotel was rather spendy but there are other options if you don't want to eat at the hotel. I would stay here again! If breakfast was included,  I would have given it a 5. Thanks for a great week.

This is a great location.  Very clean, friendly staff, special Hilton Honors floor.  LOTS of cookies for sweets lovers.  Even offered cookies for the road.  We walked just a block to the Disney buses.  Avoiding the hassles and cost of parking at both the hotel and Disney lots

Booked hotel based on needing a room for 5 people. Had a 7th floor firework view room with 2 queens and sleeper sofa.  Room was comfy and clean and Staff were always friendly.  Great price for a family stay at Disneyland.  Close proximity to a variety of stores by car or a few basics if walking.  Good Wi-Fi.  Disneyland is a 20 minute walk in the morning and a 30 minute walk at midnight with sore feet. ;-)  my parking was free with Hilton honor and Disney booking and so was the upgrade firework room.  Never saw the fireworks since winds canceled every night.  Ice machines and laundry were available.  Would stay again.  If booking on busy weekends might need to book from hotel website vs Disney site.  I had to add 1 extra day that was only available by calling hotel.  We ended up

We had a great 2 room suite for a good price. Staff was helpful and room very clean.  Hotel close to Disneyland and you could walk but they had a shuttle.  They staff was very helpful when trying to locate dining and other stores in the area. Warm cookies are a plus.  Dinning room had excellent food

We debated whether it was worth staying at Grand California but at a saving of $500 per night and our room being significantly larger than GC we decided to save the money. It was a pain trudging back and forth but for the saving it was worth a taxi if u really could not face the walk. Service of a all the hotel staff was excellent.

Even though this hotel was about a mile from Disneyland it was easy to get to via driving or shuttle. The room was awesome because the beds were in a separate room which gave mom a break from the kids. Room service was good, but a free breakfast would have been nice considering you have to pay for parking. The front desk service was a bit rude by rushing the check in process But overall the Double Tree is always a nice hotel with comfortable beds & nice warm cookies!

A nice hotel located just a few minutes from the front gate of Disneyland on Harbor Boulevard. Our family stayed here over the 2015 Christmas holiday and enjoyed our stay. The beds are amazingly comfortable which is a true necessity after a long day of walking at the theme parks. Breakfast is buffet style and adequate. There is a gift shop and Starbucks coffee shop in the lobby as well. This is a good option in Anaheim.

We stayed at the Doubletree Suites Resort five years ago and experienced 100% satisfaction with the hotel services, cleanliness and great staff. We returned to this great Hotel in November this year with two teenage children. Nothing had changed. We were delighted to be greeted by familiar faces whom recognized us and gave us an upgrade without asking for it. The warm cookies were ready for us upon our arrival and the rooms were well maintained. Breakfast spread was great and it was great to have a guest laundry. A short 2 block walk to Disneyland was great or there is a bus stop in front of the Hotel. There was nothing to complain about. We were sad to leave. We will return again. Thank staff for your great service once again.

When you stay at this hotel you are charged to park, when we arrived at the hotel at 9;30 we drove around the parking lot for 15 minutes trying to find a space there were even cars at the ends of all of the rows. we were told when we left that there was a wedding , I DON'T CARE!   As a guest at the hotel your parking should be priority. The TV in the room reception faded in and out.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Hotel (except the In room dining)
Summary: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great wifi. Amazing beds. Quiet location walking distance to Disney. From desk staff are great. Very helpful and happy to help out with any request.  Just duck across the road to Denny's for breakfast rather than dine in room, food cold and too oily.

After a nearby hotel lost our reservation, we booked this one at the last minute, and I'm so glad that we did! We received a great rate, a warm welcome upon our arrival, and after telling the front desk about the headache we'd endured with the other hotel, she was so kind and even gave us complimentary breakfast vouchers for both days of our stay! Our room was very nice, clean and fresh. The bedding was soft and silky and the pillows were comfy. The breakfast buffet was very tasty and everyone we encountered throughout the hotel (employees and other guests!) was so nice and friendly. We caught a glimpse of the jacuzzi and regretted not bringing swimsuits - next time! Transportation to Disneyland and Downtown Disney was easy. We could walk (just over 20 minutes), use Uber

Early December 2 night/2room stay was again comfortable & relaxing for a Disneyland trip. Staff accommodating & friendly, family suite rooms comfortable & roomy. Lobby bright, bar dark; just the way I like it. Bar did not have coffee for a hot coffee drink which was a bummer 😟 But all in all Love this place. Oh and the cookies are plentiful! Thanks again Doubletree 👍

Stayed here 2 nights on business. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Service was great. Quality of food could have been a little better but it wasn't bad. There is no free breakfast but the morning breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced.

I picked this hotel because of the excellent reviews it received and was NOT disappointed. This is one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in and there were 6 of us in 1 suite, which you would think would seem crowded, but it wasn't. We will definitely be using this hotel again in the future.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for the money
Summary: We stayed here with my 2 daughters, 2 grandkids a son in law and our inlaws.  We had 3 rooms at the end of the hall so it was great coming home from being in the park all day, getting the kids bathed and in bed, and then rolling in chairs to one room for a bit of a cocktail party for the adults.  Nice, clean and good value.  We'd stay here again.

Very clean, very pleasant / helpful staff.  Room was nice and clean.  Would definitely stay here again.  Walking distance to Disneyland / California Adventure.  Was able to leave the car at the resort once we checked out and went to Disneyland.  Walked back to hotel and got the car without an additional parking charge - very convenient.  Was able to check-in at 10:30 AM day of arrival.

The rooms were well designed, comfortable & clean, much larger than anticipated. The downside was having to pay ($16.00) to park and paying for the public bus to Disneyland rather than a direct shuttle.

We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. Our family of 4 was pleased with the 2 bed suite. We enjoyed dinner the first night and breakfast buffet the next morning and both were delicious! We walked to Disneyland both days of our stay, it was a bit long but we didn't mind it, with both kids in the stroller. Having a starbucks in the lobby was a plus! and the cookies at check in were yummy! Would recommend this hotel and we would stay here again!

My friend and I had a 2 night stay as we were visiting Disneyland to enjoy all the Christmas decorations.  We had originally thought of staying in one of the Disney property's but found the price ridiculous!  After searching out several other property's in the vicinity and reading many reviews, we decided on The DoubleTree.  Having stayed in a Disney property previously, I have to say that I will be staying at the DoubleTree  when we return to Anaheim.  Our room was a suite that had a view of the fireworks in Disneyland, which was great!  The room was clean, well appointed and the beds were VERY comfortable!!  The staff was great from beginning to end!  I will definitely return to the DoubleTree!

My friend and I were in Los Angeles for a few days and decided to stay here for one night after a day at Disneyland, and we were pleasantly surprised with how good it was. Before we had even arrived the service had proven excellent, we had to change our dates and emailed the hotel unto which we received fast, efficient and responses. Upon arrival we were then told we had been given a room upgrade per compliments of the hotel. Our room was great with all the amenities you need. Similarly the bed was heavenly after a long hard day at Disneyland. The location was great, about a 5 minute drive to Disneyland which made our uber fares incredibly cheap to and from the park. The wifi was also really good! This hotel was definitely value for money, having said that it was actually really

I got a great deal on Trip Advisor for my family vacation to Disneyland.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!  Now, I'm not a very good writer so here are my pros and con's. Pros *Suites are extremely roomy *Super Clean *Complimentary Cookies are amazing! *Staff is very friendly and helpful *Walking distance to Disneyland *Starbucks in the Lobby *Great Rates  Con's *None

The room was spacious and smelled lovely, as well as clean. I travel a great deal, and at many hotels they rely on perfumes and deodorizers to mask what is, essentially, poor housekeeping. Not so at the DoubleTree. My room was clean with a capital C! The linens were so fresh that, even after 3 days of 0 housekeeping (we slept way late), the bed still felt newly made. Speaking of sleeping in, housekeeping is ready and willing to freshen up your room whenever you're ready for them to do it, they match your schedule, as opposed to expecting you to accommodate theirs. Everyone was extremely friendly and pleasant to work with. My only snafu came when ordering room service, however management was quick to clear up that concern. Overall, I would highly recommend this location.
Manager Response: Dear janellemariee -   Thank you for posting your feedback; especially your positive comments regarding our housekeeping team. I will make sure to share it with the department.   I apologize for the snafu you experienced with room service, but am pleased to hear that it was resolved to your satisfaction.
