Once again, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent. We look forward to be of service to you again in the future.   Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Great hotel--beds are very comfortable and rooms are very clean.  Best was that Disneyland tickets were available at the hotel for the same entry fee as the gate.  Hotel is very close to the park but they do not have a shuttle to Disneyland.

Rooms were clean and bed extra comfy! Was quite and got a great nites sleep after (2) days at Disneyland.  Shuttle to Disney across the street - busy to cross. Drop off back at the hotel on - right in driveway.

Stayed with my family on our disneyland trip in three seperate rooms, also stayed in this hotel for business it has great service and the location is perfect. We will always us this hotel for all our Anaheim stays.
Manager Response: Dear BandBValenciaCA -   Thank you for taking the time to write us a review and for choosing our hotel for all your travel needs.   We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.   Warmest Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Perfectly suited what we wanted for while we were visiting Disneyland. Yes its a walk, but literally 15 minutes each way, along the flat - our 5 year old managed it no troubles all week. Also has a CVS between the 2 so handy for the way home :) Room layout was perfect for what we needed. The beds were great and comfy. Room service was awesome, food was all good.  For the $ this was perfect. Would definitely return if we are going back to Disney anytime.
Manager Response: Dear MrsBails83 -   I want to thank you for the kind words of our hotel and services. I am glad to hear that your family enjoyed their stay and will be sure to share your comments with our housekeeping and food & beverage team.   We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know we're doing something right. We look forward to serving you in the future.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree for  twelve nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We booked well in advance and not only got a great rate,  but a large room as well. I would say all our comments would be very positive from the location, convenience of the shuttle/location, and helpful staff to mention a few.The only  negative point, if you want to say that, is the addiction  to the cookies. Would certainly book this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Can't believe I've never stayed here before!
Summary: I have stayed in Anaheim on numerous occasions and cannot believe I have not noticed this gem!  They such a short walk to everything.  The treat their Diamond members extremely well.  Breakfast buffet is great! Awesome staff! Great gift shop!  I will always check this place first.
Manager Response: Dear Subtracty -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. Our Chef works very hard in providing a delicious warm breakfast buffet for our guests. He will be very pleased to hear that you enjoyed it.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The hotel is just what you need if you spend several days at Disney.  Nothing beats being at the doors when Disney open up, spend a few hours before the heat and crowds really take over, go to the hotel (which is not far away), take a nap or just relax by the pool and then go back when it's darker and all the light shows start.  Met all our needs.

Summary Heading: We will be back again and again!
Summary: My husband and I planned a week long trip for our ten year anniversary and my birthday.  We initially planned to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, but decided to go back to the Doubletree where we had stayed a few years ago because of the high-ranking on Trip Advisor.  We are SO GLAD we did!  This is a gorgeous hotel with fabulous rooms that are SUITES.  You get a fridge and a microwave and a little coffee stand too.  We would like to thank Vina and the entire staff for making our stay special.  We didn't want to leave!  We were treated like VIPs by everyone at this hotel.  We will most definitely be back next year!  You will NOT be disappointed if you stay here.  We walked back from Disney each night, (1 mile) and took a cab there each morning for about $10.  Ten stars!
Manager Response: Dear Lena P -   Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We appreciate you choosing us to celebrate such a joyous occasion.   It is our goal to make all our guests feel special. We are happy to hear that Vina at Guest Services, and everyone else you encountered did just that.   Thank you for your loyalty and we look forward to welcoming you back again next year!  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We booked at Double Tree partly because we are Hilton Honours members, partly because we could get a room with a separate lounge area and mainly because of the location near Disneyland. We chose a two roomed suite with two good sized beds and a separate living area. We have an 8 year old so we thought it would be great that she could be tucked into bed a we wouldn't be disturbing her but frankly we were so exhausted each night we were all going to bed early anyway, but the extra space was great. The room was good and well serviced. The check in staff were friendly and helpful and the warm cookies much appreciated. For our deal Wi-Fi was free and parking a reasonable $16 a night. One of the best features, and we were a bit surprised having no great expectation of this, but the

Great location to start a Disneyland adventure. Our double queen suite-was immaculate, comfortable and well designed for morning trafficking amongst the family members.The property offers many upgraded amenities-room service,a sparkling pool, a cozy gym-but also the ingenious ability to purchase Disney tickets on site. It's also walking distance to many other great restaurants in the area. The in house restaurant had great coffee.Stylish and contemporary yet enjoyable enough for the kids- this hotel is truly a fantastic gem.

Summary Heading: Annual Mecum Action with my Son
Summary: This hotel has the best amenities, location and sleeping arrangements for a good price.  If you're coming to an event at the Anaheim convention center like Mecum or Disney, this hotel provides the best value for the money.  The restaurant serves a great breakfast (healthy and buffet options for the kiddos) and a very well prepared dinner for a special moment with your spouse while the kids are asleep! The rooms offer premier bedding and all the comforts of home while your vacationing or attending your event.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: We stayed here for one night with our toddler for a trip to Disneyland and I couldn't justify spending a fortune for a Disney hotel for just one night. I'm so glad we stayed here. We had a two room suite which meant our little one could go to sleep in the bedroom (with 2 queen/king beds) and we could go in the lounge area to watch tv. The suite was very clean and comfortable, couldn't fault that. The hotel is a 5-10 min bus ride to Disney or 30/40 min walk, that may seem like a faff but it really isn't. The buses come and pick up frequently and they accommodate buggies. The hotel has a restaurant but we opted a for a rate without and went to Denny's across the road. There are lots of places to eat nearby. The check in desk wasn't particularly friendly but they did give out warm
Manager Response: Dear Mondler11 -  Thank you for choosing the DoubleTree for your recent Disneyland trip. We receive many positive comments about the configuration of our suites. We're glad you were able to take advantage of it along with the shuttle pick-up right outside our hotel.   Glad you enjoyed our famous DoubleTree Cookies. We will be sure to share your welcome experience with our Front Office team.   We appreciate your review and look forward to serving you again in the future.   Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We were recently in Anaheim to visit Disneyland. This hotel is just down the street from Disneyland and was very convenient for our stay. Check in was easy and the room was basic but very comfortable. The bedroom was separate from a small sitting area with a pull out sofa. The beds were very comfortable. The cookies they offer at the front desk are to die for!!! We also had a few drinks in the lounge and the staff there was very friendly and helpful. By the ART tickets for the bus which is located right outside the hotel. Would definitely stay there again, even if just for the warm cookies.

We stayed in a HHilton room that was a double queen with an adjoining living room. Great set-up with the bathroom as a semi-ensuite that connected to both the master bedroom and entry way through the sink area. Main room had a desk/table, fridge, microwave, pull-out sofa and chair.  Room was very clean. Bedroom was roomy with very comfortable beds. Breakfast was included and was eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, pastries, fruit, juices, coffee, tea. Substantial and nice quality. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Cara P,  Thank you for the kind words about our hotel. Guest feedback is important to us, but we're especially pleased when it's positive. I'll be sure to share your thoughts with the hotel team.  We try hard to provide the best possible accommodations for our guests and their loyalty is our reward.   I really appreciate you taking the time to let us know we're doing something right. We look forward to serving you in the future.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I found hair in my omelet and the hash browns were under-cooked and cold. Dinner was excellent however somewhat expensive.  Otherwise, the hotel was clean, room comfortable, and the staff was polite and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Deanna B,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for the disappointing breakfast experience.    Cleanliness and safety are of the utmost importance to our hotel.  I will be sharing your comments with the food and beverage team.  Thank you again for your feedback. We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Just as Great as Disney Hotel
Summary: I was recently in California for a conference and had a chance to stay at this hotel instead of the Disneyland Hotel, and let me say I'm glad I did. The hotel was more of an "adult" hotel not a lot of kids running around. The staff at the Guest Services desk was very helpful, ensuring that I always had a cab waiting for me at the time that I requested. The front desk staff was very pleasant and always ready to help. The staff at the on site restaurant was very helpful and attentive to my needs while dining there. I only ate breakfast there each morning and it was AWESOME. The buffet only included french toast, but when I asked for a waffle they were more than happy to accommodate me with no questions asked. I did have to travel from this hotel to the Disney Hotel (where the

Summary Heading: fanstastic alternative to expensive disney hotels
Summary: Loved this hotel as it was a cheaper option to visit Disneyland and not stay at a Disney hotel.  The hotel was a very quick bus ride away (bus stops right out the front of the hotel) and you could walk to Disney if you desired.  The hotel itself was nice inside and the suites were very spacious.  The breakfast was a really good set up and the room service food was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again if I ever go back to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Linda S,  Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We truly appreciate it when guests take the time to provide us with some honest feedback about our hotel and services.  Once again, thank you for taking the time to let us know how you feel. We appreciate your loyalty and truly want to make your experience as pleasant as possible.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Average Hotel, Convenient to Disneyland & Convention Center
Summary: The Doubletree Suites is extremely convenient to the Anaheim Convention Center (walking distance) and to Disneyland (just walk to the Toy Story lot and take the shuttle to the park). This is probably the biggest pro of booking this hotel.  The hotel is average -- clean, reasonably comfortable, with good service. However, you can hear the wind coming through the cracks of the room door, so it makes a whining sound all day. And the refrigerator often vibrates and makes loud noises. It is quite annoying and makes it hard to relax.  In general, this hotel is fine. If you are looking for a hotel convenient to the Convention Center or Disneyland, this may be a good choice for you.

Summary Heading: Good Alternative To Disney Property Hotels
Summary: Reasonably priced suite hotel that easily accommodates a family of five.  About 3/4 mile from Disney but an easy walk or shuttle to parks.  Location is close to dining on Harbor Blvd including a Mortons Steak House.  CVS close by to pick up some groceries.  In room fridge and coffee maker always a plus.

My family and I to include my in-laws went for another Disneyland visit.  This is the first time at this hotel.  We booked the hotel through Bookit.com at the last minute because it was a better deal than what we had originally booked.    Upon our arrival there was a hiccup with the booking but by the time we woke up in the am it was resolved. We stayed in a family suite which was just that suite. The room was exceptional, the service was top notch and the warm cookies my kids loved. The beds were extremely comfortable along with the pillows that everyone fell asleep in minutes after their heads hit the pillows.    A few down sides,  it's $16 per day to park your car, it's too far to walk (in my opinion, especially after a long day in the parks) plus $18 to park at the resort.

Beware of being charged multiple times for the security deposit! I was charged twice $178.95 for the deposit - first time on the night I checked in and the second time the day after I checked out. Customer service was worthless. The 1800 number didn't understand what was going on and when I called the actual hotel the person that answered tried to argue with me. She told me they only charged me once and I told her I was looking at my credit card overview that showed TWICE on different days. She said I was wrong and that she could e-mail a copy of my bill. She was incredibly rude and not helpful - just denied that the charges happened. I come to Disneyland a lot and I will NEVER stay here again. I don't care if a mistake was made, but just own up to it, apologize, and fix it.
Manager Response: Dear LaurenW,  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for any disappointment you felt.  I have some additional information which may help clarify how we handle credit cards.  When guests check in to the hotel, the full amount of their stay and a $50 incidental deposit per night is authorized on the credit card provided.  This authorization often shows as a "pending transaction" when you look at the account online.    When you depart, the final amount is charged against that same authorization.  Once that charge is processed, the authorization then drops off of your account.  The speed with which the authorization is released depends on the credit card company.  As a result, the authorization and the final charge may briefly overlap.  I apologize for our failure to explain the credit card process clearly and for the disappointing guest service you received.  I am also very surprised to hear you were disappointed in the Housekeeping services.  Your comments will be shared with the team as part of our ongoing guest service training.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This is my first time here and I enjoyed it immensely. My room was not ready and the gentleman at check in expedited its prep and found me in the business center with my keys, cookie and water, which I very much appreciated as I had a 5 hour plus flight and really wanted my room. I did not get an upgrade and was disappointed to not face the fireworks as I had requested, but the standard room was surprisingly large, contemporary, clean and well appointed. Always great to have a refrigerator and microwave. I ate most meals at the hotel restaurant because it was just that good. Really enjoyed the food and one of the nicest breakfast buffets I have seen in a long time. The business center was nice but have to admit I was disappointed in the small pool given the number of kids
Manager Response: Dear fcrane35,  Thank you so much for your great comments about the hotel.  I was especially happy to hear you enjoyed Agio Ristorante's cuisine.  I do want apologize for failing to provide your requested view but am pleased to see that the room and services fulfilled your needs.  I hope you'll choose to stay with us again when your travels bring you back to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, ok service.
Summary: We stayed 4 nights here while we did 3 days at Disneyland resort. We had a room facing Disneyland and we watched the fireworks from our bed the first night we were there (awesome). Our room was a few floors up for the pool so sometimes we could hear noise from there. The room itself was great, we had a suite. We ate breakfast in the restaurant the two mornings we didn't eat at Disneyland. Food was yummy, service was on the slow side which was inconvenient as it was taking up precious Disneyland time. Also, we didn't find the level of service from the front desk up to the usual standard of a Hilton hotel. We had stayed at Hilton's our entire California trip and were disappointed here. Check in took a long time (we were upgrading from our initial reservation but it took forever),
Manager Response: Dear Kristina M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for the disappointing front desk and dining experiences.    I will be sure to share your feedback with the team to ensure we are providing every guest with exceptional service.  Thank you again for your review and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I have stayed here 3 times now and each time I am suitably impressed. The breakfast was great with huge variety. This time proximity to the Convention Centre was key - it was an easy walk. Also it was very handy to have a Target store just a 10 minute walk away. The rooms are spacious and without exception all the staff were wonderful. Always friendly and helpful. The customer service here is great!

Hotel could not provide an adapter, nor offered a obtain one (shop was less than a mile away) - ended up walking there. Hotel was not helpful nor apologetic. Cleaning cloth was left behind on the desk one day. Food was not tasty, breakfast selection and quality at the buffet not satisfactory considering the price. Coffee was served in a paper cup (in the restaurant).
Manager Response: Dear 962halvardb,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.   I apologize that the level of service and food quality provided did not meet your needs.  I will be sharing your feedback with the Housekeeping and Culinary teams.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you again for your comments.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This hotel stands out for its service.  My family was visiting Disneyland for the first time, and chose this hotel based on past experience with Doubletree Hotels.  The location was convenient for Disney, with a shuttle stop just across the street (and directly in front of the hotel upon return from the parks).  The breakfast in the restaurant is something else that makes this hotel stand out above the others in the area - most just offer quick takeout service in a corporatized atmosphere.  The pool was great for the kids after a day at Disney, and was not crowded.  Everything was very clean.  Mostly, the service was excellent.  Many staff members went out of their way to offer assistance and improve our experience.  One young man from the restaurant recognized me every morning,
Manager Response: Dear David C,  Thank you for the kind words about our hotel and its services. All feedback is important to us, but we're especially pleased when the feedback is positive. I'll be sure to share it with the entire hotel team.  We try hard to provide the best possible service to our guests and their loyalty is our reward.  Also, you were correct - we are a concrete building.    We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know we're doing something right. We look forward to serving you in the future.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed there for 4 nites and it was evident that it is an ideal hotel for both business and leisure travelers.  You can book your Disneyland tickets in the lobby and the hotel provides a free shuttle to the nearby convention center during major events.  Rooms are big and clean.

I had a suite which was really nice. Disneyland tickets can be purchased from the hotel lobby. Lots of fast food places across the street. There is a bus service to Disneyland across the street that runs ca. every 20 min and cost 5€ per daily ticket. You can lasi walk to Disneyland in about 20 min.  The only thing I didn't like so much was the pool area. It was abit crowded at times and one day there were some adults swimming in their full clothes.  Vina at the front desk was very helpful!
Manager Response: Dear Intiajohanna,  Thank you so much for you nice review!  I am glad to hear you enjoyed the hotel & our services.  I apologize that the pool was a disappointment to you, though.  We have a dress code posted & am sorry to hear guests didn't observe it.  I hope you will come visit us again soon.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Booked this hotel via trip advisor rating.  Brilliant location. Good easy  walk to disneyland.  Room was clean and perfectly fine for what we needed. Didnt eat there as ate at surrounding places and disneyland but staff were very helpful and informative.  If you are just needing a place to sleep and then nice walk to disneyland this is the place. Thanks hilton doubletree

We had a great stay at the DoubleTree Anaheim. The rooms are up to date and have a quality feel to them. The set up for 5 people (2 Adults, 3 Kids) was perfect for our stay. The beds are very comfortable and our roomm was very clean each day. Proximity to Disneyland is good. We stayed at 3 different hotels during our week long trip to California and the DoubleTree was at the top of the list for quality as well as price.

Our family of six spent 4 nights.  Most important to us is quiet and clean.  This place passed with flying colors.  Very nice rooms, perfectly clean, sound-proof windows, great view of the pool/hot tub (which is on the room of lobby--very cool), comfy beds, nice shower head.  Our room was cleaned & restocked with towels every day, which was nice to come home to after a long day at Disneyland/beach.  Will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Michael B,  Thank you so much for your kind words.  I am glad to hear you and your family enjoyed your recent stay with us.  We hope you'll visit again soon.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This place deserves a review each time I stay here. However I apparently forgot to write a review until now.   The hotel was amazing as usual, staff were friendly as usual again. With my son being older this time he was able to enjoy everything more. Even with his running around the hotel lobby touching everything the staff just sat and watched laughing.   Clean room, love the separate bedroom style still. Perfect for nap time and I don't need to stay in the same room.   Not much else to say other than this will likely be my go-to place everytime we decide to visit Disneyland.

This was the perfect hotel for us during our stay in Disneyland. Great price, perfect location and friendly, clean environment. We wouldn't want anything more luxurious for a family Disneyland vacation, barely spend any time in the room itself.

Summary Heading: Great Location for Disney but can't really see the fireworks.
Summary: We had a nice roomy suite, but we were told we could see the fireworks from our room.  Turns out, they put us in the wrong corner, the front desk person  was a bit "spacey" on information but she made up for it with lots of pep and heaps of cookies.  We went out by the pool and watched the fireworks, which was very nice and just fine. It was a nice crowd of fellow vacationers.  The property is right on the bus line for Disney, but the front desk folks aren't really sure how all that works.  We were there 3 nights so we figured out that we could actually walk to Disney if we wanted too.  There is an app that will tell you when the next bus is coming so you can decide if you want to wait or just go ahead and walk.  Or, in one case, we crossed the street and the bus showed up 2

Excellent facilities, but beds need upgrades. Food was mediocre and craft beer selection needs improvement, but service and overall experience was excellent.  I would stay at this hotel again.  Fair pricing for this area, but not a bargain.  The registration and bar staff were outstanding.

This hotel was everything I wanted it to be, and I would have enjoyed staying here longer.    First of all, it was our anniversary, and this hotel went above and beyond to make our stay special.  Being a Diamond Hhonors member also probably helped.  When we checked in, we were upgraded to the "Presidential Suite."  The room was beautiful, and we got a great night's sleep since it was also very quiet.  The room was also spotless! I was impressed by the level of cleanliness of this hotel.  They also had champaign and chocolate-covered strawberries waiting when we checked in with a personal note of congratulations.    Breakfast was delicious, and the hospitality at this hotel was wonderful.    If you are staying here for Disney, there is no shuttle.  You can walk (about 1 mile I

We stayed 5 nights as part of our trip to Disneyland. After arriving from Disneyland hotel we were really pleased with the size of our room and bathroom. We had a separate lounge area which we enjoyed after being away from home for 3 weeks. We were extremely lucky to be on the 7th floor and could lay in bed to watch the fireworks at night.  The hotel is a distance from Disneyland. Its a long walk in the heat. We used the free shuttle bus from the Disneyland car park which is a block from the hotel. This was never an issue. Just remember to get on the Toy Story bus back to the parking lot. Alot more comfortable to be in a aircon bus than walking. We saw the ART bus but at $5 per person it can get expensive I think. The buffet breakfast is satisfactory. The pool area is small but

This hotel is very nice.  We had plenty of space in our suite for our group.  The beds were comfortable and our requests were met. Got breakfast at the Starbucks station in the lobby.  We walked to Disney and took the Art buses, although the schedule for those wasn't very convenient.

We loved our stay at this hotel. The staff were fabulous and very helpful.  Short pleasant walk to Disneyland and restaurants. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was big, comfortable and very clean. There was laundry facilities and a great pool/spa that had a view of the Disneyland fireworks in the evening. Our son ate his daily fair share of warm cookies and then some!  Thank you for making our stay in Anaheim an amazing one.

Summary Heading: Great location, great room and excellent service!
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights for bday celebration for my 12 yr old daughter. Great price, get the breakfast package, very good options. Can also order eggs cooked to order with buffet, no extra price. Room big, clean, great bed and pillows, had fireworks view room,  great perk. Pool is good, no towels when we got to pool, called and within 5 minutes fresh towels were re-stocked. Service everywhere was excellent, staff very friendly. Close to parks maybe a mile walk, which was faster than waiting for transportation some days. Can take the ART bus, $5 for an unlimited day pass, good deal. Yummy warm cookie a check in. Bar also good, some great Margaritas are made there. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed to meet with family and enjoyed the cleanliness and of this modern hotel. We always enjoy the Double Tree Hotels and this one did not disappoint! Easy to reserve online and friendly check in service!

My stay was amazing at this hotel. It's very close to Disneyland, the rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. If you're thinking about having breakfast, they have an awesome buffet that changes regularly offering you a variety of different options throughout your stay. The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms were very clean. I would recommend this hotel and I will be staying here again soon!

Hotel is very clean,  very comfortable and very nickel and dime.  Great hotel with a pleasant staff.   The room that we stayed in was clean and spacious.   A few quibbles like a sporadic hot/cold shower fluctuation and bad TV reception on channels like Disney Jr.  for the kids but that's about it.  The nickel and dime part comes from the $16.00 a day to park and the up charge to take the shuttle to Disneyland.

Got a fairly good rate online. It's just a little too far from Disney for walking after a long day, but everything else is near perfect. The rooms are ideal for a family of 4. We had the 8 year old boys stay in the "family" room, with a door separating a very large bedroom. There is a microwave, fridge and two TVs. It would be a 5.5 if it had two sinks, but it's fine with just one. The rooms are clean and updated. The front desk is very helpful. The restaurant is GREAT! Kids eat free (one kid to one adult). The breakfast buffet is above average. Dinner is definitely gourmet and with all the crowds, it is nice to eat dinner in a quiet setting...again, can you say "kids eat free"?  You have to pay for parking (16 bucks per day), but you have easy free in/out. Rooftop pool is

We stayed one night in September at this Courtyard.  Checked in on a Monday afternoon (around 3:30PM).  I was able to "check in" online via the Marriott app and pick the room of my choice, but wasn't quite ready yet. But the wait was only about 10 min. or so.  Gave us time to move our car from the parking spot allotted for check-in to a regular parking spot.  But when we came back to get our room keys, it was a different person that helped us and... we didn't get our cookies!!!  As we wanted to dash over to Disneyland ASAP, we didn't bother asking for them, figuring we'd save the calories for treats while at Disneyland.  We took the advice of other travelers and walked over to the Toy Story parking lot and jumped on the shuttle to Disneyland to the park and back.  Very  handy.

As Hilton Honors members, we booked this Doubletree suites hotel as the first stop on our 3 week visit to CA, for 3 nights while we visited the Disneyland resort. We flew into LAX from Scotland via Newark, and due to a horrible delay at Newark we were several hours late, finally arriving at the hotel around 2am. I'd called ahead to say we were going to be late - I don't think I needed to do that as it wouldn't have been an issue to arrive so late. Our 2 queen 2 room suite was perfect for our needs, service was impeccable, cookies as always delicious, and breakfast was fine albeit not a gourmet experience. We didn't mind - it was free! We didn't pay $5 per person per day to use the ART bus to Disney. We walked for 5 minutes to the Toy Story parking lot & hopped on one of their

Spacious rooms.  Get the family plan which adds 2 adult and 2 kids breakfast buffets for around $20/night.  You can catch a shuttle to Disneyland right outside the hotel.  You can purchase park tickets and bus passes right from the hotel.

Very nice hotel.  Our room was a corner suite with a king size bed and large chair in the bedroom with floor to ceiling windows on two sides and a big flat screen TV.  The sitting room also had a big flat screen TV, another large chair and a couch with a pull out bed.  The room also included a work desk with a large workspace for a laptop and room for papers.  The bathroom was separate from the dressing area and included a large tub shower.  The restaurant served a great breakfast buffet every day with a different chef special each day.  We did not use the restaurant for any other meals.  Staff was helpful and friendly in all areas.  There was a shuttle stop right outside for us to take to Disneyland each day.  $5 for an all day pass.  If you wanted to cross the street to go to

Bed was uncomfortable and I woke up irritated and didn't realize it was because of the poor bed.  The friendliness, helpfulness, and service of the staff was very good.  Location, close to Disneyland, was, since I didn't need to go to Disneyland so soon again, a problem because of the Disney fireworks noise.

Summary Heading: Good Hilton Property for a Disney Visit
Summary: The price is good for being close to Disney. The breakfast buffet was really good,  Different choices every morning. The front office staff was super, the greeting we got when we arrived was top tier. I do not think the rooms have a view of Disney, I was facing the back, room 733 and it was really quiet. All around a good stay.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and we liked it. It was unusually hot and sunny in September for Southern California, we even cut our Disney parks trips from 2 days to 1, but Doubletree provided us a nice cool place to rest. It's a nice hotel, we had no problems with booking, service and our room always been clean. We had 2 room double queen suite  (it's not big, but we had enough space for 3 people) , and our almost 6 year old son was able to sleep on sleep sofa, which was really nice.  Hotel located about 15-20 min away from Disneyland by foot. But we had hard time walking back to hotel after walking and standing in lines at Disneyland. So we just used Uber - very handy (will cost you 4-5$). All kinds of places to eat nearby and restaurant at the hotel is nice place to have

Summary Heading: Really did not like this place.
Summary: Bugs on top of the sheets when we hit the room.  They changed the room without complaint, but oddly didn't seem that interested in the bugs...  Each interaction with the bell desk (changing rooms in this case) was the same--they talk to you but don't carry or move your bags for you.  Just brought us the room key for the new room.  Not interested in doing anything else.  Really??  They also weren't good at getting us a Taxi.  Twice.  Ended up having to arrange our own one time and another just walking to Disneyland.  Which really is a bit far, seemed like a couple of miles.  Breakfast was mediocre as well--good news was it was free.  Yay?  Won't stay here again.  Sad, Doubletrees are generally pretty decent.

Came in unexpected, and was treated as though i had a standing reservation. Clean Quite, well appointed room. I expect nothing but the best from hotel brand. I was not disappointed. thanks to the entire staff.

Very nice hotel.  We had a 2 year old son with us for a 2 day trip to Disney from SD.  This place was little more expensive than we planned to spend for a night, but it had a seperate bedroom which is really nice for a child when traveling and looking to rest after a long day.  15 minute walk from hotel to Disney gate, not long at all.  Parking cost extra, but reasonable.  We'd stay again.

Hotel is very clean and staff very professional. Warm cookies on arrival were a welcome treat for all of us, and every time our boy walked by the desk he was offered another!  Double queen suite great value - would stay here again as not too far from disney and close to restaurants and other amenities

Summary Heading: Upscale near the front gates of Disney
Summary: I found that everything from check in to check out was first class offerings here. My room was nicely decorated with a comfortable bed,was very clean and the towels were ultra soft. Upscale coffee in the rooms along with toiletries being top notch. Price is a little steep but I found on Priceline. They hit you with parking as well which was like $16.00 which I personally think is a rip off..Overall an excellent place to stay....

Enjoyed this stay.  Room had separate seeping quarters. It had two TV so if you wanted to watch something different you could.  We checked in with no wait. I would stay here again. I was able to make last minute arrangement and received a beautiful room.

Everything was great. Clean, comfortable, great location. Awesome beds as well! I recommend this hotel if you plan to visit Disneyland. Very close to the Resort. There's a shuttle every 20 minutes that stops just in front of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Very nice place to visit and stay
Summary: We spent three days there in late July 2015.  Very nice place close to Disneyland public ART bus arrives every 20 minutes outside to take you to the Park.  Has a Starbucks for coffee in the morning and a nice place to eat there too.  Our 7 year old son loved the chocolate chip pancakes in the morning.  Hotel staff very friendly always plenty of parking and you could walk to the parks too.  Many of places to eat up and down Harbor Blvd.  We could see the fireworks show from Disney outside our window at night.

Summary Heading: Very clean, quite, friendly and great priced
Summary: This was a super value for a high quality hotel near Disney. The staff were all very friendly. Our room was very clean, and kept up nicely. When we got home we did not notice that old hotel smell in everything. Everything was as we brought it. We were there 4 nights. The only negative was that the tub was very slippery. They need mats or a texture or something. Really appreciated that our laptop fit in the room safe. Two hints. The coffee stand in the lobby has some decent breakfast burritos for about $4. This is easy to carry on your way to Disney and a bargain compared to park food. There are plenty of other things you can get at the hotel, this was for those wanting a quick grab of something that is not sweet. Second tip. You can buy your bus pass at the front desk. They will

I waited over a week to  post this review in hopes that the sting of the stay subsided.  It has not. My husband and I like to fly under the radar when we travel, unwilling to make waves. We just want to keep quietly to ourselves as much as possible.  We have enjoyed 2 previous stays at Doubletree, and were looking forward to another relaxing staycation. We confidently booked 4 nights in a non-smoking King Suite. Our previous stays had been restful and relaxing, and we desperately needed this to be the same. Unfortunately, it was not.  Our large, well appointed suite 211 reeked of cigarette smoke, so much so that I could actually taste it. It is unclear why the room was released for occupancy before the smoke had been mitigated. We were reassigned to suite 241, a cramped, shabby

Summary Heading: Much better value compared to a Disneyland resort hotel
Summary: Where do I begin.  The suites are well appointed, clean, updated.  Beds are very comfortable but that is as expected for Doubletree.  The pool was slightly on the small side but it was never crowded as most guests are enjoying Disneyland and do not spend too much time at the pool.  The lobby is very comfortable but again, no one is hanging out in the lobby when Disneyland is just down the street.  The internet connection is good, no issues with connectivity.  There is a daily fee for parking but the overall price for the room was such that the added parking fee didn't bother me.  Breakfast was fine, not too fancy but good.  You should take advantage of the Disneyland shuttle so you can avoid parking at Disneyland. It's reasonable and very convenient.  We opted to go back to our

I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I typically choose Hiltons and I travel a lot, so I'm finicky about my room and service. This was my first time at this hotel and I was very pleasantly surprised by the luxury of this property. The lobby is very elegant. Not at all what I expected from a hotel in an area that normally caters to Disneyland travelers.   The hotel was very clean and quiet. I kept wondering where all the screaming children were. Mind you, it was right after the Labor Day in the middle of the week, so perhaps most families with kids have all gone back to school! Yay for me! Although there were still plenty of families and kids at Disneyland/Downtown Disney. Wondering whether they were skipping school or just hadn't started yet.   The staff at the Doubletree were very

Stayed here last night to enjoy Downtown Disney and character breakfast this morning at Disney's PCH grill. Upon checking in, we were greeted with warm delicious cookies and was recognized as Gold HHonors. I was given an upgrade to a two suite room with Disney Fireworks view at room 730. We were asked if we wanted the breakfast, but opted to get the points as were having breakfast with Mickey and Friends. Checking in was under five minutes. Parking was easy, we went in and out several times. On checkout, parking fee was not charged and we were given three more cookies to enjoy while on the road. Staff were all friendly and helpful. We'll book again without hesitation.

My husband and I stayed here the weekend of August 28. We were very happy with how spacious our room was. We stayed in a double queen bedroom although it was just the two of us because they offered a better deal with the double queen room. I was pleasantly surprised with how clean and spacious the room was. The bed was very comfortable and the room met our needs. Over all we were happy with our stay and we would definitely stay here again. Also gotta love the welcome cookies.

Summary Heading: SCRC Conference @ Anaheim Convention Center - Where to stay?
Summary: I bunked with two ladies in one of the 1-BR suites while we attended the SCRC conference.  We drove 2 hours from home.  We experienced the best quality service and our stay at this property was wonderful.  Our room was attended to daily and perfectly, the service staff were courteous and delightful - and helpful.  The pool comfortably warm and the whirlpool spa a perfect 101 degrees.  Comfortable beds... ahhh.   And, only a 5 minute walk to the convention center!  The breakfast buffet was more than satisfactory - even an omelet station geared to the way you like it!  Thank you for a most enjoyable experience.  We will be back next year!

Made a reservation for 2 connecting rooms When I get there they have the rooms on separate floors.  Then the manager whose name is Lourdes tells me there are no connecting rooms although the front girl and the reservation girl said there are connecting rooms.  Would have gone to the Sheraton if I would have known this.  Just to top it off the manager has a severe attitude and is a complete rude disrespectful classless person. She's not even sorry but acts like we are causing her a problem.  Just to top it off she insults my choice of profession.  Will never come here again.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on both TripAdvisor & Google+.  I apologize that your request for connecting rooms was not provided upon arrival.  Requests of this nature are not normally guaranteed and are offered based upon availability.  I am very sorry to learn that this was not communicated to you at the time of your reservation.  Lourdes did her very best to honor your request on an evening when the hotel was fully committed.  I am very pleased to hear the team was later able to resolve the situation to your satisfaction.  Please know that the manner and volume with which you expressed yourself was concerning.  To see that you followed up on your concern by calling our team member a vulgarity in an online review is absolutely unacceptable. This behavior and language is unwelcome in our hotel.  Once again, my apologies for the difficulty at check in.  I wish you all the best in your future travels.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: My Comments of my stay at the Double-Tree
Summary: I was extremely please with the service and the room  I stayed. I would not ever hesitate to stay at the Double-tree hotel whenever I have the chance to stay at a hotel. Double-tree would be my choice to stay. Thank you so very much for your hospitality.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable but chic Hotel, Great Restaurant for dinner or buffet breakfast
Summary: This was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in! I'm pretty fussy so that's a very good revue from me. The staff from reception to concierge to bar and restaurant were all extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was a pleasure to be in, from the roomy and comfortable lobby area to the luxury style bar and the expansive, light and airy restaurant and onto the rooms we enjoyed it all and would thoroughly recommend this hotel We walked to and from Disneyland - it was about a half hour walk - but if you're not a walker then the shuttle bus stops directly outside the hotel and for a $10 per day pass you can come and go as often as you like.

Summary Heading: Rooms Very Nice, but watch out for hidden parking fees and middling service
Summary: Our family stayed at the DoubleTree in Anaheim for several nights to go to Disneyland and area attractions. The rooms themselves were great for a family of 4. Very room and very well kept. The pool and on-site restaurant were average in terms of size and quality level.   I have issue with the hotel never mentioning parking fees until you go to park your car. As an HHonors member, I used the HHonors app to book my stay. It never nothing about the $16/day parking as neither did the front desk staff. You are pretty far from (about a mile) the park entrance, so the idea that you are paying for preferred parking near the resort is bogus. The shuttle bus that supposedly takes people to the park every 20 minutes on the hour was a no show quite a bit (if you want to get to the park, use

The staff was very friendly and diligent at all times. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The fridge in the room, free Wi-Fi (for HHonors members only) and the location are great assets. However, the parking rate for guests should be re-evaluated. I find it a little costly.  The facilities are well maintained and the convenience of having a café, a restaurant and a Disney relations specialist in property is well worth the daily rates (which are a little higher than expected for weeknights).  Highly recommended!

I came to Orange for medical reasons and originally had reservations at a hotel (not a Hilton brand) near UCI Medical Center. Oh. Emm. Gee. Allergic to everything and the musty atmosphere and it was straight out of The Shining. Jack Nicholson was coming with his axe at any minute! We were out. And happened to be driving around and saw this hotel. It's a quick drive to the hospital (I needed pre-op appointments), really close to fun attractions -- as in walking distance to Disney and AWESOME restaurants -- so I decided to pop in. The man at the front desk was so nice and immediately saw what he could do when I explained my plight. We were placed in a perfect room that was great for my needs. I stayed here Aug 24th -26th 2015 and it was stellar. Beds are comfy. Staff were

The staff is great. The location is great.   Apparently there are breakfast vouchers available, which was not made known to us until our last day. Housekeeping does not come until between 4-5 which is the hottest part of the day and when a family with young kids comes back to rest.

In all honesty this is a nice place to stay but there was one major issue we encountered that I'll get to. We stayed here for our Disneyland get away so my experience really revolved around certain expectations for that type of trip as opposed to a convention which is what this property might be more geared toward.   The front desk service was very friendly and helpful. I had booked a double queen suite through Costco as that was the only option available. It was just my husband and I so I asked if they had a single king room and the agent said they have them available but since the room was pre-paid she couldn't make any changes. I thought this was odd since single kings are generally less money than double queens but it wasn't a huge deal and being that it was pre-paid I fully

Summary Heading: Excellent All Suites Hotel Near Disneyland
Summary: Having previously stayed on two previous vacations at the nearby Sheraton, we elected to stay at the Doubletree Anaheim.  Externally, a tall, pristine building with a portico and ample free on-site parking, the hotel is around a 10 minute stroll to Disneyland - or you could use the shuttle bus.  On entering the property, you are in a huge marbled foyer with comfortable seating at its centre.The foyer also has a great bar, a small shop, ATM, snack bar and a Disney outlet from where you can buy your theme park tickets.  Check-in was efficient, we got our trademark complimentary Doubletree warm cookies and were shown to our suite.  Beautifully proportioned, the suite comprised a living room frnished with a sofa and matching chairs, there was also a desk, coffee table, large

This was one of our best stays at a hotel ever. The staff was friendly and helpful. The in-room service was wonderful! The beds were so comfortable we did't want to leave. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here in the future.

Beautiful hotel, convenient location, comfortable queen size beds.  nice pool and hot tub. did not qualify for breakfast by reserving w/Expedia, reserve directly with Hilton and be a Honors guest, otherwise they give you a cold shoulder... and they tell you is $15.00 like if you cant afford it... that's what it costs about at Denny's... I like Mimi's breakfast, lol ...

For our family of 5, the rooms are large and extremely comfortable.  Our family absolutely loved the beds and the appearance of the lobby, hotel restaurant and rooms met our expectations and attributed to our comfortable stay.  Pool is small but kids still had fun.

Stayed here visiting Disney.  The hotel was very clean and up to date.  The staff were all very nice.  Our room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. There is a bus service that runs every 20 minutes to downtown Disney. $3 each way cash, or you can buy an all day ticket from the front desk for $5.  We got tired of waiting for the bus one evening and were able to walk in about 15 minutes. Very convenient.  The pool is small and there is no shade on the pool deck.  I burned the bottoms of my feet, not thinking to wear my sandals to the very edge of the pool.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great location and great hotel.
Summary: This hotel is walking distance from Disney and located right at the heart of the Anaheim resort area. The hotel was very clean, helpful staff and great rooms.  I'm not sure if all the rooms are suites (we had two, one for us and one for the kids) but I assume they are from the name. Parking is an extra charge each night, which sticks in the throat a bit, but it is easy to use and you simply pay when you checkout. I would definitely recommend this hotel for either holidays of business/convention trips.

My husband and I decided to spend a couple of nights here prior to joining a cruise to Mexico from Long Beach.  It had been a while since we had visited Anaheim and decided to try a different hotel this time.  Upon arrival, our room was not ready but we did try to check in earlier than the required time.  The staff tried their hardest to have a room available asap.  We were warmly greeted and given a warm cookie upon check in.  We used the pool, which at times was a peaceful area but later in the day became busy with children (who were attending a basketball tournament and a dancing competition) plus those who took an afternoon break from Disneyland.  The towels supplied at poolside were of good quality.  Unfortunately the phone for drinks etc poolside did not seem to be

The saving grace for this hotel is that it offers its guests suites which my family enjoys.  We arrived at 2pm which was before check in.  There were no rooms available on the Hilton Honors floor so we were offered a room on the third floor that was available.  Since I heard that one side of the hotel offers views of the fireworks from Disneyland, I asked the check-in agent if the room had a view.  She looked puzzled and said that she wasn't sure - maybe the pool.   I didn't pursue it, but looking back I should of asked for a view of the fireworks at Disneyland.  I asked about transportation to Disneyland and she told us about the ART.  The first night we walked to the park - just to get an idea as to how far the park was from the hotel.  It is a fairly long walk, doable but

Summary Heading: One of the Best Places in the Area
Summary: We stayed here for a convention in Anaheim recently.  The service was great and the facilities were nice. It isn't as close to the Anaheim Convention Center as you might think. There is a shortcut through the parking lot.  We had good food and service at the hotel restaurants. They have a nice pool as well.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, below average service with an attitude
Summary: We stayed 4 nights for my sons birthday. They made us wait 30 minutes while they supposedly got the room prepared for a birthday greeting that was promised to us over the phone. When we got to the room there was just a couple of bags of the free cookies. I asked about the balloons we were supposed to get and the put me on hold for 10 minutes to come back and say they were out of them. The next 2 nights we orders taxi's for dinner reservations. We waited for 30 minutes the first night and the cab showed up after I went to my room to get my car keys. The taxi driver told us it was just called in 5 minutes before he got there. The second night we ordered a cab the first one came about 20 minutes later and didn't have a taxi big enough for the 6 of us and said the hotel did not tell
Manager Response: Dear Almasi G,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for the issues you faced during your recent visit.  I have discussed your concerns with the Front Office & they will be addressing your concerns with the team.  I will also ensure that our supply of complimentary decorations is replenished.  We will also be sure to report your concerns about the Taxi Cabs to the appropriate company.  Once again, please accept our apologies.  I hope we will get another opportunity to show you our excellent guest service.  Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Great place to stay, excellent dining, location is great, definitively stay there again, great cookie, close to Disneyland, the only thing they need their own shuttle to Disney other than that no problems whatsoever!!!!!

I chose this place for its location (near the Convention Center - 7 min walk and Disneyland - 20 min walk), also the good reviews about the rooms and finally because of the cookie :)  I checked in and was given a free parking pass, so I saved some money there :) Not sure if that's because I had a suite but that was a neat thing. I was given the cookie but I ate it and so they gave me another one, yay!  My suite was 208. It was a very good size with a desk, sofas, TV with fridge and microwave, nice coffee maker, a large bathroom and 2 queen beds with a wardrobe.  Sadly I only got there to sleep late and left early every morning, so I didn't get to enjoy my room as much, nor did i manage to enjoy the pool or gym. However, parking was super easy, service was always great and

Summary Heading: Great location for CC and Disney
Summary: This is one of my favorite hotels in the area when going to the CC in Anaheim.  It is close to everything and always has events that go along with the Convention Center activities.  I highly recommend that you stop here especially if you are a Honors Member.

Stayed here for an Angels game and also to visit Disneyland.  Hotel staff was very accommodating in transporting me to the Angels game which is about 2 miles away.  My suite was very spacious!  I enjoy walking and Disneyland is about a 15-20 minute walk if the stop lights are included.  It is in a very safe area.  Am looking forward to another stay here.  Thanks to the entire staff for a very nice stay!

This is the third time we have chosen the Doubletree for our family vacation to Anaheim.  Initially we chose it based on a recomendation in a Disneyland Guide book that rated the quality of this property equal to or greater than the three onsite hotels.  Our family of five has continued to return and the hotel and staff have never disappointed.

within walking distance if you are slightly ambitious to Downtown Disney and the parks but a short drive or very convenient shuttle. Clean hotel which did not seem super busy even though it was summer - easy to get coffee in the hotel and easy in and out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking can be tight but always did find a spot.

We've been to Disneyland many times....stayed at the Grand Californian, Disneyland Resort, Howard Johnson and Hampton in Garden Grove. The Doubletree is the largest, cleanest and best stay we've had for a family with teens. The walk was about 25 minutes to the park...did it there and back twice a day, a bit tiring near the end of our 7 day stay but we did it! The best part was the separate sitting area with a soda bed and the two queens in the other room. Having the sink outside of the toilet/shower area also made getting ready much easier. If you want a nice hotel off the resort, I'd highly recommend the Doubletree Suites!

Hotel is truly a four star. Complaints one when guest were returning from swimming pool the elevators were wet and smelling of chlorine.Two Parking is steep and they have no shuttle to any attractions. You can not carry your on luggage have to pay bell men to do that. Rooms were clean and spacious. Also lighting in parking lot was dim.

I did a lot of research when it came to finding the perfect hotel for our families vacation to Anaheim, and the Doubletree Suites was really a great choice. We have a family of four, so we chose the double queen suite which allowed our teenager to have her own space in the living room and the little one had a quiet space in the bedroom.   When I booked I had requested a room on an upper floor with views of the fireworks and was ecstatic when they came through on the request, we had a fantastic room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and facing Disney. Customer service was top notch.  The room itself was showing signs of wear and tear, but it is kept very clean, and I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness... they do a good job. I agree with a previous poster that larger

The Hotel appeared to be recently built and opened for business.  The parking was a little bit of a hassle but compared to New York it was excellent.  The staff was accomidating and the room was clean and fresh.  However the room could of had a balcony or a window to open as the room did smell a bit musky or moldy.  Over all experience was satisfactory and would stay again in the future if the situation presents itself.

Nice hotel close to convention center.  There is also a bus stop for Disney very close. Did not try the on-site bar or restaurant, but they both looked inviting.  Everything was as expected, and the staff was helpful.

Stayed there for 3 nights for a trip to Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  Was close to both parks and restaurants.  Hotel staff was helpful and friendly.  Rooms were spacious for two teenagers and hotel was beautiful inside and out.  Only complaint is no free shuttle to parks (had to take public transportation for a fee) and pool is small and shallow.  Otherwise, had a nice quality stay at this hotel and would go back there again.

The suites are great for an extended stay here, with an ample living area, microwave, fridge, and table. We adored our room and the multiple areas provided a faster way to get ready in the morning and sleep at night. The beds are very comfortable as well! My one con is that at about midnight, the Wi-Fi connection became noticeably slower as people returned from the parks.  Our room was incredibly clean and freshened every day. The housekeepers did a great job making our room a great place to rest after visiting the parks every night. The hotel itself is beautiful and the prices are great. Having visited Anaheim nine times now, this was without a doubt, our favorite hotel.

I'm a frequent Disneyland visitor and have stayed at quite a number of the hotels along Harbor Blvd. I've ended up staying at the Doubletree twice and would highly recommend to anyone planning a visit to Disneyland. It is a walkable distance to the park, but I would definitely advise getting the shuttle service. You can buy a ticket at reception, and the small price is well worth it. For the lovely quality of the hotel and close proximity to Disneyland it easily makes this the best hotel to stay at in my opinion. For families and couple alike.

Arrived;  reservation was not correct.  VERY stingy on the cookies; REALLY?  Took elevator to second floor for pool THEN two flights of steps down to the actual pool which was very small. Shuttle to Disneyland and back ONLY ONCE AN HOUR. really expected much better from DoubleTree!
Manager Response: Dear Mama Clark KC,  Thank you for your review.  I apologize that you did not enjoy your stay with a Doubletree by Hilton hotel.  Unfortunately, I think you stayed at our sister hotel, the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim - Orange County.  I contacted TripAdvisor to move your review to the correct hotel but it hasn't been moved as of today.  I will be sure to share your comments with the correct location.  Once again, I apologize for a disappointing stay.  We hope you'll consider giving Doubletree by Hilton another opportunity to show you excellent customer service.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I have stayed at many hotels and decided on this one because of the great reviews on trip advisor. I was disappointed for a few reasons.  I understand that check-in is at 4, but we had just flown across the country from the east coast and were very tired after getting up at 3:30 am east coast time.  We arrived around 2:30 pm and were told the room was not ready.  The front desk staff did not offered that our luggage could be stored, that we could use the pool...nothing.  I know I could have asked.  She took my cell number and we waited.  After about an hour I returned and there was a second person at the desk who said she would put us in another room as our was still not ready.  It would have been nice if there first person had done this.  The staff were friendly. The bellman

The service was friendly, the room clean and comfortable. The beds are very comfortable, though the pull out should probably get replaced. They should really consider re-doing the pool - it was tiny for a hotel this size and filled with screaming softball teenagers.   The shuttle service to Disneyland is easy and quick - ask for the times for the shuttle stop across the street so that you don't have to double-back on the ride. The breakfast was nice, but kind of spendy for what you get. However, their dinner was especially nice and we loved our server Mario Karate - he was awesome - made us feel like family. There was also a lovely woman in the bar who let us bring the kids in for a late night snack after a long day at Disney.

Stayed 2 nights when visiting Disneyland and we had a pleasant stay, very friendly and service minded frontdesk staff. The room was good sized and clean, the couch (like others have pointed out) was really really uncomfortable and worn. The pool was way to small for a hotel this size, felt really crowded even that there was not a lot of people in it. The breakfast was ok but had better, didn't try the restaurant for lunch/dinner (there's a great Mexican restaurant just across the street).

We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.  Shuttle service was easy going back and forth to Disneyland.  Only bad experience was the bell service was terrible.  Waited way too long and ended up carrying our own bags.

hotel itself is nice but bad customer service.  i had to ask for extra blankets 4 times.  they messed up my room service and after i told the server, he went to go correct it but then called and said it was correct and hung up.  i called front desk and they said restaurant was closed; 15 before posted time.  I was told manager would call but i had to call him the next day.  he did give me some breakfast vouchers but never addressed rudeness of server, which was the real problem.  he said he would take off charge but never did and at check out, he said he never said that and he and desk lady got rude with me. not goo.
Manager Response: Dear Melvin,  Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I apologize that the level of service provided did not meet your needs.  I'm quite surprised to hear your feedback about your room service attendant, Mario.  He is one of our top employees.  It is my understanding that our manager has compensated you appropriately for the difficulty you encountered.   We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you again for your comments.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: 48 mins drive from LAX to the hotel and it's close to Disneyland. nice hotel, room is big and clean with comfortable bed and pillows, suitable for family trip with kids. very convenience even drive to beach.

Summary Heading: Doubletree Suites Anaheim is NOT a Hilton & Does Not Care About Gold Members
Summary: Everyone working the front desk, and manager Lucy went to Orange Is The New Black school of hospitality as they hate their jobs and make guests wish they just stayed home.  Having been carjacked the previous week and needing a staycation with clean beds and pool, room service, the usual Hilton bells and whistles, I phoned this property in advance to request room upgrade and prep for feather-free bedding. I was told to book the reservation and that once in system could be accommodated so just phone back later in the day.   I booked and phoned from front desk Doubletree Norwalk with manager Arturo's help, and even he seemed bewildered by the aloofness of the manager Lucy at Doubletree Anaheim so he apologized to me while we had her on hold a moment, then when I returned to my
Manager Response: Dear Mother,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my sincerest apologies for the disappointing experience upon arrival at the hotel.    I'd also like to apologize that you felt the follow up on your slip in the tub was intrusive.  Please know that the hotel takes guest safety seriously and only wished to ensure you did not need medical assistance.    You comments and concerns will definitely be addressed with the team.  It is my understanding that you were upgraded to a Disney Fireworks view at no additional cost and given compensation at departure.    Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The Double Tree has an amazing staff. Every person we encountered was friendly and professional. We were greeted at the front desk by warm smiles and cookies. Our room was not ready but bell services took our bags so that we could go out. The hotel is located a little over a mile from Disneyland. We walked it several times a day and it was no problem until the end of our trip whenwe were exhausted. Then it was a $4 Uber. The hotel restaurant was great. We had breakfast buffet every morning and dinner at the bar twice. The steak chimmichuri was so great. The service was a bitslow the first night butthe rest of the time was great. The breakfast buffet was standard but free since my husband is a diamond member.  My complaints about the hotel are few but I feel significant. The

The one suggestion I have is to please change your cookie recipe. Although we did appreciate the packaging stating that there were nuts in the cookie but my husband is deathly allergic he can't even be around tree nuts without having a reaction. I did mention this to the front desk staff and she did not seem to care. Please consider changing your recipe because a tree nut allergy is extremely common especially in small children. The room itself was nice but for the comfort of my husband we will choose another hotel next time we go to Disneyland.

Chose the DoubleTree for our VidCon stay.  I was very satisfied with the environment and the staff was top notch.  The only thing I wish was different would be that the cafe would offer bagels in addition to the pastries.

The stay was wonderful. Warm cookies at checkin was a plus. Staff couldn't be  better. Went to the baseball game and drove there, very easy to get to. Took the ART bus to Disneyland they picked us up just outside the door, couldn't make it easier. Very quiet stay couldn't hear a noise. Hot tub was great after a day at Disneyland. Pool was average size, was not overcrowded when we where there. Checkout was quick and easy. We will stay on our  next trip th LA area.

I am a HHonors Gold member and stay in ALOT of hotels each week as the North American Dir. of Ops for the largest Facility Mgmt company in the world; ISS Facility Services.  This is one of the very few hotels that have across the board gone above and beyond customer service. The room is always clean (the maid servicing our room was impeccable with her attention to details and deserves direct commendation to an often unsung position cleaning guests rooms) and the front desk staff welcoming and inviting. (I feel bad that I cant mention them by name but please know they were superb with amazing customer service) An additional special notice goes to Norma the bartender who makes you feel at home in her place. The Long Island Iced Teas were refreshing and delicious as well as her

Let's start off by saying they have excellent customer service Biell service was fantastic we Priceline and this hotel and we were still treated like VIPs thank you front desk staff for that.  The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds were awesome we ask for more towels and the housekeeping staff was so sweet and kind and give us extra shampoo and conditioner as well and we loved the little towel animals.  The pool area was nice and inviting and came in good use since it was very hot the weekend we went and we were able to see partial firework view from the pool area that was a nice treat we were not expecting.  I loved the parking it's all safe secure and we never had an issue trying to find a spot coming back late from Disney and then walking to the reception area they

Summary Heading: A grand hotel for the price!
Summary: The suite was very large, with nice furnishings, and two great beds in the bedroom. It was roomy and well laid-out, not always so with every suite I've stayed in. Great for our family, and even the room service was VERY good. Surprisingly, the prices on room service were about half than at a Hilton Resort so that was nice--and such friendly people super close to Disneyland. Great with our twin 3 year olds.

We have previously stayed at the Sheraton Park for our last three trips to Disneyland but we thought we would give Doubletree Suites a try as I have read numerous fabulous reviews about them. Although the Doubletree is a little farther walk it was well worth it!   Everything was wonderful from check-in to checkout. Before we arrived we requested a particular type of room which the hotel put on our file. I know nothing can be guaranteed but we received exactly what we asked for. We were extremely happy!  Our room was a good size for a family of four and having the separate sleeping area was great as we could stay up a little later and watch TV instead of having to go to bed when the kids do.  The kids had a fun time swimming in the pool and thankfully it was a lot warmer than the

After about two months of researching various hotels, we chose a double queen suite for two adults, two 9-year olds, and a 5 year old on our trip to Disney.  Bedroom & bath size were ample.  Beds super comfy.  Two HD tvs with really good room AC.  While the pool is small, it is big enough since most people are at the parks during the day at the park .  The hot tub after a long day was amazing.    The cleaning staff did an amazing job and the front desk people super nice.     We walked to Disney every day, both ways, except for one night we took a taxi.   To be honest, I really think the ART is a bit of a ripoff for this hotel.   Really, the hotel was near perfect.    Here's two ways they could improve: suites like the one we stayed in are going to be booked by families and yet

I just spent five nights at the Doubletree Suites. This was my third overall and second recent stay at this hotel. As far as Disneyland area hotels go, the Doubletree is hard to beat.  The suites are nice sized and quiet! You can get a great nights sleep without having to be disturbed by noise from other guests.  The restaurant is great offering fantastic food whether it's breakfast or dinner. They serve a grilled cheese that is the best I've ever had! Normally I wouldn't consider eating at a hotel restaurant if I weren't staying there, but I would definitely return just for the grilled cheese. It was that good!  The staff at the hotel is top notch. Erlinda took care of us for breakfast and she is definitely best in class!  The hotel is a mile from Disneyland and about a 20

I was in town for business and was offered the Presidential Suite as perk so I could check out the amenities of the hotel.  Busy hotel, nice, clean and modern enough.  I did like the suite, however, was not happy with the shower as it's small, an actual bathroom with a shower head (cheap) and no safety mat to prevent slipping.

I am completely disappointed about the unprofessionalism and rudeness of the staff at this hotel. Instead of helping us with an issue and going above and beyond to satisfy us, the front staff gave us attitude. Room smells, and it is not clean. Don't waste your money here. Not worth it.

We have stayed at this hotel before and had a lovely time. It is a great location and has nice rooms. However this time around it was the worst experience my family and myself have ever had at a hotel. We all travel frequently for work and vacations so the fact we can all agree his was a terrible experience is pretty shocking.  We arrive to check in at midnight after an extremely long day of traveling and some serious jet lag since at home it was actually 3 am. When we get to the front desk a very unfriendly night manager tells us our reservation was cancelled. We are shocked and demand an explanation. According to him our credit card was rejected. Now this is odd since we used that credit card throughout the day to purchase meals at the airport. We also used that same card to
Manager Response: Dear Samantha,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We appreciate your loyalty to the Hilton Family of brands.  Please accept my apologies for the difficulties you experienced recently.  I've been advised that you and the front desk manager on duty determined that an incorrect expiration date caused your card to decline.  The team did attempt to contact you twice at the phone number on your reservation.  Unfortunately, the reservation isn't able to show us whether the phone number on file is a home number or cell.    Please know we will be reviewing your situation with the team to determine how we can better handle credit card issues as they arise.  Our General Manager is out of the office this week but will be in touch with you soon to review your feedback.  We are pleased to hear our sister hotel, the Embassy Suites was able to provide you with a pleasant stay.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Nice stay for a family of 4
Summary: The hotel was nice. The room, beds, towels and everything was good.  We had a family of 4 and had no problems.  We purchased the city shuttle to/from Disney and it worked out great. Breakfast at the restaurant  was good.  We would visit this hotel again if we ever come back to Disney Land.

I was in town for an overnight stay due to a early morning business meeting. I had stayed at this hotel twice in the past with family and friends when we visited Disneyland. The greeting at the front desk was professional and warm. Very outgoing staff. Room service was quick and the food was very good. I was surprised that my dinner tray from room service was still on the floor in the hall when why breakfast was delivered. This is a very nice hotel, well maintained with a good staff. I would use this hotel again. It is perfect for the Disneyland trip

This was a nice place to stay for recent Disneyland visit. Toy Story parking lot to catch shuttle to DL is across street, no need to walk to DL. . Comfy clean rooms, we had a double queen suite & plenty of room for all. Refrigerator, micro, 2 TVs, comfy beds, nice & quiet. Starbucks in lobby, restaurant on site. Warm Chocolate Chip cookies can't be beat!
