Great customer service. Room was fantastic, very clean, very comfortable. The chocolate chip cookies at check in were dee-lish.  The pool is not a lap pool, but more a lounge by it type. Exercise room has no free weights, but does have cardio and a cable machine.   Will stay here again definitely.

We were very impressed with this hotel. It was easy to get to, close to shops, restaurants and a 10 minute walk from Disneyland! The rooms were modern, clean, spacious and comfortable. Air conditioner worked well, rooms were quiet at night. We had noisy neighbours one night and security were quick to respond. Laundry was clean, cheap and easy to use. Free parking each night, spacious carpark and the complimentary cookies were delicious!! Highly recommend.

Stayed here in Late June 2015. With so many choices for a Disney Holiday it was hard to decide where to stay but we are glad our family stayed at the Double Tree. It is a little further away from Disneyland and after the full days walking around the parks it can seem like a long 20 minute walk back late at night but when you get to your room all that goes away as you rest peacefully.  The staff are friendly, the cookies on arrival are great but the highlight is having a suit, that separate room to watch TV while others sleep in the other room or are watching a different program on the bedroom TV is priceless. Would definitely stay here again  Visited from Melbourne, Australia

I needed a hotel for our first night of a California tour and used some United miles that were about to expire to get this night (including parking) for free. The hotel is close to Disney (walking distance), but our plans were to head elsewhere. We did however make use of the Disney Welcome Center in the hotel and bought our 3 day (to get the Magic Morning early entry) passes here before checking out. The hotel was very clean and modern, the staff friendly and the cookies were a welcome treat. I've stayed near here a few years ago and this hotel was far superior to the previous one I stayed in (Portofino Inn).

Just returned from a three night stay here for a multi generation trip to Disneyland. Having the queen suite was perfect for three people, we each had our own bed.  Very comfortable beds, and I'm picky.  We enjoyed being on the second floor, same as the pool and a quick up and down to and from the lobby. The pool was nothing special, just a rectangle, kind of disappointing to my niece, I think.  We opted not to have maid service, but she was friendly about switching out our towels and trash.   Gary at Bell Services was so helpful about getting a scooter rental for my aunt, providing info about the shuttle bus, etc. Great guy, great attitude.  Of course we met him when he originally unloaded our vehicle, and we later requested him when we checked out.  This hotel doesn't allow

Summary Heading: Less expensive and better alternative to the Hilton
Summary: As a HHonors Diamond member I was given two free nights at any Hilton hotel, which had to be redeemed by the end of July. As a treat for my 15 year old niece/Disneyphile, I decided to book a stay at the Hilton Anaheim, where I had stayed previously on a business trip. However, when I went to book my stay the Hilton was sold out and the reservation agent recommended this hotel as an alternative. She assured me that it was still within the Disney resort district so I went ahead and booked it. I am so glad that I did.   Located about 2 blocks from the Hilton, the Doubletree Suites is a fantastic choice for anyone coming to visit Disney. As I also travel frequently for business, I would recommend this hotel for business travelers. That said, this trip was for fun so my review will

My friends and I booked this hotel back in April for the Star Wars Celebration convention being held nearby at the convention center. There are several pluses to this hotel (cookies included!) and only a few flaws.  Pluses:   1) It was close to the convention center. Yes it was about a block and a half away, and yes that seemed VERY far after a long day of convention attending, but it really wasn't all bad.  2) The suites were a lovely and perfect size! I especially liked the division between the beds and the TV/living area. Another sink would have been helpful though as a single sink was pretty crowded at times.  3) They offer transportation to and from Disney. The trick is to keep track of when they stop running. We got stuck at Disney one night, not realizing the trams

Summary Heading: Great, quiet hotel with close proximity to Diusneyland
Summary: I loved this hotel - it was close to Disneyland/California Adventure at an affordable price.  I had such a comfortable sleep, due to quietness and terrific bedding, that I almost didn't want to go back to the parks the next day.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and far enough away from the parks.
Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable. It was within walking distance to the Parks if you really felt like it (20 min). We walked one day and then bought a 3 day shuttle ticket ($US12) which was worth the money - could get on and off as many times as you like. It was far enough away from Parks not to hear the fireworks of a night! The hotel staff were friendly and the warm chocolate cookie was delicious. We arrived early from overseas and they made a great attempt to get us into the room earlier than check in time. Laundromat across road if you need one. Had a King bed room as there was only the 2 of us. Hotel room was a little on the older side but clean and comfortable. Had free Wifi. Would stay there again.

Good quality Hilton standards, large room for the master bedroom, the sofa bed when extended leave very little room to move around the lounge area. But it's not a major issue, just need to be careful in the dark!

Prior coming to Double Tree at 4 am, we had a horrible hotel experience.  Titus welcomed my family in, gave us our keys, and warm cookies.  We felt on top of the world.  It is the littlest things that make biggest difference!  Having professional people like Titus made our world peaceful and happy especially when traveling with kids.

Hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and room was roomy.  Easy access to Disney via ART and cheap ($5) Uber.  Staff was very helpful in accommodating us.  Hilton service wins again!  Disney Welcome Center on site and Starbucks coffee served in lobby!

A great place to stay when visiting Anaheim, for my wife and me it was close to Angel Stadium and lots of local restaurants for a great time all weekend long! We will definitely be back in the future as this worked out great for us.

We stayed there with our two teenage daughters and their two friends.  The suite was big enough to comfortably sleep everyone and provide some privacy for us.  Clean, comfortable and convenient - only a mile from Disneyland, and there is an official Disney ticket booth in the lobby.  Would definitely recommend and will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Better than stay so close to the parks
Summary: I was in doubt of stay here at this hotel or close to the park in Howard Johson which is just 0,3 miles from the Disneyland. I realize that I made a good choice choosing this one.  Although it´s not so close to the Disney Parks (1 mile), you can try walk or go by shuttle or by car (what I think it´s better). You have to pay the parking in this hotel (USD 16) but you will have a Hilton Hotel with silence, good shower, towels and sheets with good quality. Even the restaurant has a good price if you are with kids because under 12 years they don´t pay if they are with adults.  Inside the room you will find the same furniture and decor that it´s in all rooms of this brand. Enough space with one room with 2 queen size beds and a LCD and another room with a sofa, table and a LCD.

Hotel very clean and quiet, great location for Disney. The hotel does not include breakfast, but we were able to heat instant oatmeal up on the microwave. Don't spend money on bus tickets, instead walk to Disney's Toy Story parking lot and catch bus for free. We did this all 3 days with a group of 5 to and from Disney and nobody questioned us. The lot is to the right at the 1st light from the hotel walking toward Disney on Harbor. Hotel is about 25 min to beach which we drove to our last evening to watch sun set.   Only negative here was last day they came and cleaned our room and only left one clean towel. Not sure how they missed that.   I would stay here again and do recommend.

I usually stay in Anaheim (by Disneyland) twice a year and choose different hotels each time.  This is my favorite so far!  It has a great location, and I was very happy with the hotel.  The price was also very good.  My daughter is usually particular about whether she likes or dislikes the hotel we are at, and she really liked this one.  I hope to use the pool next time.

Immaculately clean rooms with the MOST comfortable beds that I have EVER slept on. The staff were friendly and courteous. I will definitely be staying there in the future. Thanks for the delicious cookies!

Summary Heading: Be advised breakfast is not included
Summary: The hotel was generally a good quality hotel. It was clean with decent sized rooms, but being that the hotel has suites you would think the hotel would cater better to families. I was under the impression when I booked this hotel that breakfast was included in the cost of the room, but this was not the case. One major criteria in choosing this hotel over others in the area was the inclusion of a hot breakfast. I would have booked a different hotel had I known this hotel did not offer a free breakfast.

Good hotel for families travelling with or without car. Plenty of restaurants in the area and not too much traffic. The restaurant in the hotel is pretty good to offering good value for families. Gym and pool area is small but still ok.

I love the location of this hotel, originally we selected this hotel because of the location. However, this hotel definitely exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived the staff were genuinely friendly and attentive. The hotel is clean, the suites are spacious and clean and the grounds are kept clean. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return. Be sure to check out the pool and delicious cookies as well!

We stayed in April. We enjoyed our stay, it's very close to Disney. The staff was friendly and attentive. The room was nice, and the beds were comfortable. We didn't make it to the pool, or to the gym, but they looked nice. We would definitely stay here again.

We appreciated being able to buy our Disney tickets right there on property and, upon going to Disneyland, we were able to go directly to the turnstiles, thus avoiding at least one line that day!  I appreciated the use of the Business Center's computer.  Although the printer worked, I didn't  have time to map out my next destination and print it out (we were late for our breakfast appointment at Goofy's Kitchen)  I had 2 teens who each took a bed and I slept on the living room sofa bed; it was surprisingly comfy and the pillows/blanket supply up in the closet smelled clean and fresh (that's important!).  Your front desk personnel were nice and the man who checked us in was most helpful, as well as pleasant, setting the tone for our short stay ... pleasant!  Thank you DT for an

Summary Heading: A GREAT hotel for those visiting Disney and not staying in the Park
Summary: This was/is another lovely hotel by Doubletree Suites.  I loved the location and the ease with which we could get to Disney Land.  The hotel itself was clean, the rooms were a good size, especially for my family of five.  We had a 2rm Suite with 2 queen beds.  We also used the pull out couch in the main room.  It had a nice 'office' area along with a fridge, microwave, and a coffee maker.  I also liked that the shower and toilet were in a separate room from the sink area (again, with a larger family someone is always needing the bathroom or the sink).  The staff at this hotel was lovely.  When we first checked in we got some nice warm chocolate chip cookies (a wonderful treat that endears me to Double Tree Hiltons.... it's just such a nice touch and it's that extra thought that

We stayed at this hotel for two nights for Disney and were thrilled with our stay. The shuttle bus stops right in front and the hotel is great on all counts, you can't go wrong. The lobby and restaurant were beautiful and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: One of the most friendly staffs of a hotel I've ever been at.
Summary: Any question, any concern - they were on top of it.  Gary, the concierge, went out of his way to answer questions and point any of us in the right direction.  The rooms were clean and inviting and the housekeeping staff was very cognizant of your room needs.  Beautiful views from the rooms topped off what was a very, very, pleasant hotel.  Plus, it is in a 10 min walking distance from Disney.

A great pleasant hotel. Very convenient location for visiting Disneyland. Nice big modern rooms. The rooms are fitted with a microwave oven which comes in handy when travelling with kids. Very good location close to Disneyland yet away from the chaos. Would recommend it

Booked for a convention.  At first was a little disappointed with the distance from where we needed to be, but the quality and service at this hotel quickly made up for it!  Will definitely stay here again if in the area. Not a single complaint!

We made a great choice staying here earlier this month.  The front desk staff were excellent, so friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  There is an easy Disneyland shuttle on the road outside the hotel, but you could walk if this is your choice.   We really liked the breakfast staff.  We were welcomed each day when we went in and when they found out it was my birthday, they prepared a special treat for me.  All in all, we're glad we stayed here, and, if in the area again, this will be our choice.

The room we had was quiet, and well appointed with everything close at hand.  The restaurant on site was adequate and had reasonable food.  Close to Disneyland and California Adventure as well as shopping centres.

We stayed at Doubletree for seven nights in June 2015 for our family Disneyland adventure.  While technically close enough to walk, considering the amount of walking to do in a day at Disneyland it is not practical to do so. Particularly with under 12's.  There is a bus which comes every twenty minutes or so but it cost us around $50 for a family of four over five days. So factor this in.  The hotel had dated rooms, ours had peeling wallpaper which is unacceptable in my view for a hotel claiming to be of this standard.  The pool is small and unattractively presented with shaded areas at a premium. While there is a phone to call for poolside snacks, this was broken. Not a dial tone to be heard.  The friendliness of staff was intermittent. Most were indifferent to friendly and one

This was a last-minute reservation for us so I didn't expect much.  Boy -- was I surprised!  We arrived before check-in and, although our room wasn't ready, Esperanza at the front desk called housekeeping and had our room prepared for us.  It was large and very clean with comfortable beds and quiet, cool air conditioning.  All of the staff, including the cleaning staff, were kind and polite.  Conveniently located, easy parking.  What else could you ask for?

Summary Heading: Great Disney Resort hotel away from the hustle
Summary: I stayed one night here with my fiance and mother. We had a 2 queen suite. The room was clean and had ample space. What I love about Doubletree suites is the ability to have a desk and living room space separate from the bedroom. We didn't have much time to check out other features of the hotel, but the room was extra clean and the decor was not dated or tired like many other hotels in the area. The hotel was quiet and I enjoyed that after a busy day at the parks.   Another plus to the hotel is exiting to drive to Disneyland parking which was our choice for this trip. We took a right on Orangewood, right on West, and then a U-turn at Ball which I find faster considering Ball can back up with traffic at times.   I'd recommend this hotel if you have a car, don't mind be a bit

The hotel itself was as expected for Doubletree.  Front desk supervisor, Freddy, basically called me a liar regarding lost breakfast coupons.  He initially said he could only replace two of the four lost.  When I asked for his managers card, he told me he was going to replace none of them if I was going to talk to the General Manager.  He added I should pay and try to get my money back when I talked to the General Manager.  Stay two blocks away at the Embassy Suites so you don't have to argue of a silly breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Terry R,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.    Please accept my apologies for the disappointing experience with the front desk and housekeeping.  We will share you comments with both departments.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: this hotel was once a great hotel, but not now. Hilton needs to rethink this one. The lobby staff is great but beyond that the rooms are in need of redo badly. Very dated decor for a hotel that charges this much  Beds dont reach the wall and headboard is too high so your pillow falls between the crack.   Window so dirty you cant see out of them on the middle floors, a coffee shop that serves Starbucks but closes on a whim, and the customers wer very angry about that  Service is slow, most maids dont speak english and cant understand you.  Sorry Double Tree but we wont stay here again. Hilton needs to put some money into this one
Manager Response: Dear Ernie S,  Thank you for sharing your feedback.  I apologize that your recent visit was a disappointment.  Frankly, I am surprised to hear your comments about the rooms.  The hotel completed a renovation in Fall 2013 that included carpets, furnishings & more.  I will be sure to share your comments with the housekeeping & maintenance departments.    Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with great service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Pretty quick stay, but convenient, clean, and no hassle service and parking. Liked the Starbucks coffee downstairs - convenient in and out. Would def come back, especially with family & kids. The maid did a cool Pluto dog towel decoration for the bed when I arrived.

We stayed in the Two Queen Bed Suite for five nights.  It had a very large living room, separate bedroom that was good size, and bathroom.  The rooms was very clean, quiet, and the air conditioning worked well. The hotel has a nice large open lobby with places to sit and visit or to meet other people.  The small coffee shop, bar, and restaurant were all good.  All of the staff were helpful and professional.  It's about three blocks from the Convention Center. I would positively stay here again and recommend it to others.

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland and awesome beds
Summary: We arrived from Australia after 1am and were welcomed with beautiful warm cookies which hit the spot. We had a great room with the most comfy beds and a sofa bed in the lounge room for one of our teenagers which was great. The rooms were really comfy and quiet and the beds divine. The shuttle stopped right at the driveway of the hotel and only took 5 minutes to Disneyland so it was all very convenient. The breakfast was good, room was large and quiet and it was close to where we needed to be - so ticked all the boxes for us. Definitely recommend.

Stayed for 5 days. All workers throughout the hotel always had a greeting and made it welcoming.One of the supervisors took the time to listen to my father who requested ashtrays on the outdoor tables and within a day provided them. I saw more guests sitting in the nice evening weather enjoying the tables. The cookies are delicious.

My husband and I and our two young adult sons recently spent three nights at the Doubletree suites by Hilton. We had one king suite room which was well appointed  with living room, microwave, and refrigerator.  It was clean, modern and the bed was extremely comfortable.  Our sons had a similar room with the exception of two queen beds,  but with the same amenities.  Unfortunately we had rooftop views, but no worries as we were not there to spend time in the room we were there to go to Disneyland.   There is a convenient shuttle that picks you up for five dollars a day unlimited trips.  It was punctual, not too crowded, and hurried quickly between hotel and Disneyland.  Fantastic buffet breakfast and hotel bar for that late night drink.  The hotel staff were friendly, helpful,

Decided to take my son to Disneyland for his 5th birthday and for the first time. My intentions were to stay at the Disneyland Hotel but I could not get a room for the dates I wanted. Did some homework on other hotels in the area.. and surprise!!! I found this place. At first looking over previous guests reviews and photos I was a bit skeptical. The rooms did look kind of run down and dingy in others photos but overall the good outweighed the bad so I went for it.   The room I received was a 2 queen bed suite with a separate living area which had a pull out sofa. The room was a great size, very spacious (there was eight of us - two adults, two teens, and four little kids) and clean. Housekeeping did a excellent. We didn't hear other guests or the high school seniors that were

Summary Heading: Won't be ripped off by them twice!!
Summary: My family and I arrived for our vacation a little early and asked if we were able to check in, The lady starts typing on her computer not saying a word to us. She was very unwelcoming!! Finally annoyed she says they can accommodate us, then she tells us there is a $350 deposit on the room!!! My husband shockingly asked what for. She gave me the feeling like I was going to rob the room blind and take everything to my trailer that's on cinder blocks. I am for sure beneath her kind of thing. Anyhow long story short if you don't have an extra $350 I wouldn't stay here. We certainly were not expecting it for there was no warning of it. The bed is not as comfy as other Hilton hotels we have used. They charge $7.00 for oatmeal. We tried the doubletree this year just to see what we
Manager Response: Dear Deanna B,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for the disappointing arrival experience.    All guests are asked to leave a deposit of $50 per night for incidentals.  Since your reservation was for 7 nights, we asked for a total of $350.  I apologize if this deposit was not explained clearly during your check in.  One of our managers will be reaching out to see if he can further assist you.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with excellent service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Our intentions were to stay at Disneyland, they were overbooked went on online to Hilton and booked accommodations. We were surprised to find the hotel was only three blocks from Disneyland. Upon arrival the appearance was awesome. Our room was the hidden gem it was gorgeous with televisions in both rooms. It put the cherry on top of our California vacation float. My wife said she could smell the bleach in the sheet really clean. Customer service was great we were booked on a tour within ten minutes of arrival. Job well done.

Everything is first class,for a reasonable price.Have stayed here many times,and is always excellent.Walking distance to Disneyland.Restaurant has excellent food,and room service.Spacious rooms and clean.

We just stayed at this hotel and it was great. It is clean, and has all the amenities one needs. The restaurant is excellent. It has a great bar. And it even has a little cafe for those early morning risers who want just a cup of coffee and a little treat. The people are friendly and extremely helpful. I would stay here again. In addition, it is just steps away from Disneyland.

Room was clean and nicely decorated, perhaps a little on the smaller side compared to other suite hotels. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Parking is $16 but the cost of the room was so reasonable that we didn't mind paying it.

Summary Heading: Large rooms, great location, friendly staff, good breakfast buffet, great value
Summary: This is an excellent hotel for families wishing to visit Disneyland. The rooms are large and pleasantly decorated. Very, very clean rooms. Close to Disneyland. If you are a walking person you can easily walk to and from Disney otherwise there is a city bus that picks you up right outside the hotel for $5 for adults and $2 for kids for the day pass. I believe the bus service runs every 20 minutes during Disney operation hours until one hour after the parks close. Very convenient and easy. You can buy these bus passes right at the front desk of the hotel. Disney also has their very own counter with park employees that can sell you the park admission tickets right at the hotel! No waiting in line at the ticket counters at Disney. There is no need to pay for parking at Disneyland

bought breakfast package for 6 but they only offered 4.never got towels on time.couple time never came.major delals.a.c not working properly.beds very un confortabe  especially sofa bed.room smelled bad.our car had break in .parking lot not safe.front desk reps very rude.they have bad attitude
Manager Response: Dear 489pravink,  Thank you for sharing your feedback and please accept our sincere apologies for the housekeeping and maintenance issues you encountered.   We take all comments we receive from our guests seriously and your suggestions will help us improve guest safety at our property.   Again, please accept our apologies for the inconvenience you experienced. If we can help in any way, please feel free to contact us.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: The Staff made our stay feel like home!
Summary: We stayed here when we took our children for our dream holiday to Disneyland.  We chose here since it was so much cheaper than staying at a Disney Resort but yet so close (you could walk to Disneyland but we caught the shuttle from right out front of the hotel).  We made friends with two men from the restaurant and bar, Gustavo & Freddy, who each evening would ask our children about their day at the park and made the effort to chat to us.  It felt like having friends away from home and really made our experience.  When we left, our children even mentioned that they missed Gustavo and Freddy.  Their service was the best we came across in our 4 week holiday across the US and Canada.  Thank you Friends!  The restaurant had a 'kids ate free' special on for the duration of our stay,

Summary Heading: Clean room, convenient location, helpful staff
Summary: The value for the room was great, especially in comparison to hotels in the area. Very close to the convention center and a convenient ride to Disney (Take the ART for unlimited rides for $5/day). I had a colleague staying at the Hilton nearby for double the price and not double the quality of the room.   The only constructive feedback I would say is that the bathrooms were small and slightly outdated. They only provided 2 towels, which was fine as a sole traveler, but something to keep in mind if you have a family. My floor had a "party" on it, which I found interesting, but it didn't bother me. The lounge staff was quite inquisitive if I was a hotel guest or not (which I was) and made me feel uncomfortable at first. They ask for your hotel room number out loud, which made me

This place is very family and couples friendly.  It is close walking distance to a lot of restaurants.  The on-site restaurant was nice.  Only suggestion would be to include breakfast as an option, especially for your HH members.

The hotel is located only a block away from the Disneyland parking / buses.  Since you have to pay to park at the hotel, just leave the car and walk north to the next light and enter the parking for Disneyland and pick up the bus there.  It was perfect!  The hotel is nice and clean, staff friendly, no complaints.

May 30 to June 5 my husband and I stayed here at double tree Anaheim for our vacation the Hotel is really pretty and clean the staff is friendly especially house keeping.   upon arrival the offered free warm chocolate chip cookies..Wow i can still taste them very good  the rooms were spacious and clean, fresh smelling  bathrooms were big and very clean plenty of towels and soap  the Halls were well lighted and bright. Very good lighting through out the entire hotel  the pool area was clean plenty of beach towels and everything was up to date, a warm Jacuzzi pool for children and adults  The Bar and Restaurant was elegant, prices were reasonable, food and drinks was tasty   Overall this hotel is very family friendly. One thing though wish they offered free breakfast for there

Summary Heading: Incredible Hotel Near Disney & Much More
Summary: We loved our stay at this Doubletree! There is a huge lobby in this lovely hotel right next to the Anaheim Convention Center. We were on a family vacation and chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland and for the great reviews. We had 2 adults and 3 kids in at 2 queen bed suite and never felt cramped. The bed could have been more comfortable but after a day at Disney, it's comfortable enough. Rooms and linens were very clean and plenty of towels were provided. Although you know this hotel is packed full of families, we never heard noise from other rooms while in our room - nothing from above or next door. The AC worked incredibly well. It's not hot in this part of the country, but a cold room does make for a more comfortable night of sleep.  One important thing to note:

Summary Heading: Great, great hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We spent 5 nights at this hotel recently and loved every night.  We were in town for our first visit to Disneyland and the surrounding area.  Check-in was easy and quick.  Our room was a two-room suite, which I highly recommend for families.  The beds were very comfortable.  Both rooms had TVs, plus there was a frig and microwave in the living room.    The restaurant downstairs offers free meals for kids.  We ate in the restaurant one night and ordered from room service a few other nights.  Each time the food was much more than we anticipated, so we ended up with leftovers.  There was always a taxi downstairs to take us where we wanted to go.  There's other options for getting around as well.  If you're checking in with lots of bags, you'll find that they don't have baggage

My husband and I recently stayed here for our Disneyland trip and it was a great hotel and great location to the park. We are Hilton members and had our own floor for HHonor Memebers. They have a full service bell hop so they kindly helped us to our room. I have to travel to work in LA on occasion and I would stay here again!

Hotel is conveniently located to Disnelyland.  The ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) is a few steps away and just a short walk to Disnelyland and California Adventure park.  Room was clean, however the furniture is beginning to show some wear, however for brief stay and value I would most definitely stay again.

I stayed here on business due to the location, price and brand. The hotel was full of families, but my room was as quiet, clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the grounds looked great.  There is a fee to park each day, but it is reasonable given the location.

Summary Heading: Fantastic breakfasts, great staff and wonderful rooms!
Summary: We had a wonderful 6 nights here last Sept for our family Disney trip, so much so that we are returning this September and we can't wait! The room was wonderful for our family of 5, two queens and the sofa bed. The kids loved the pool and the breakfast each morning was amazing, just what we needed before long days at Disneyland. The staff were so attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them and we especially liked Karina in the Agio restaurant. The cookies were of course a big hit with the entire family and they can't wait to return very soon!

We stayed here for a couple of nights in May, 2015 during a visit to Disneyland.  Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk down the road from this hotel.  The hotel is well designed, nicely decorated with soothing earth tones, and well kept and clean.  The suite rooms are nicely appointed and well kept.  We didn't like the uncomfortable spring mattresses though.  This hotel charges for parking and that's a negative also.  The delicious cookies provided upon check-in are a nice touch.  We'd probably stay here again if the mattresses were more comfortable and the parking was free or a more reasonable rate.

Very nice suites.  Comfortable beds.  Convenient shuttle service to Disneyland.  Nice, newer décor.  Very clean rooms including bathrooms.  Very pleasant and helpful staff.  Pretty good breakfast.  Very impressed with the quality of our overall experience for the price we paid.  Would definitely go back to the Doubletree Suites the next time we visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Probably one of the worst check-ins i have ever been through.
Summary: I called the morning of arrival and assured that I would have a room, and also to tell them i'd be arriving after 1 am. Fast forward 13 hours and after driving 6 of those hours it is 1:15 am I have my confirmation in my hand BUT they did not have it.  and instead of letting me go to my room and get to sleep and they take care of it.  I waited for about 28 minutes of me forward emails, and confirmations.  Once in the room I was called one more time (now almost 2 am) to send another copy of email.  so we finally get to rest and wake up to go to Disney 24 hour event. Put DO NOT DISTURB on door.  Return to find a play pen in our room (we had no children) and when I called and told them this the person that could get the play pen was gone so I put in hallway.  Not a good impression.
Manager Response: Dear 5princesses,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim.   We apologize that your check in was a disappointment to you. We was spoken with the Front Desk team reagarding your experience.  We hope that you give us another opportunity for a better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a great price
Summary: We stayed here for a 3 night trip to Disneyland with our 4 year old and 8 month old. The hotel is really nice and clean, and was very quiet. We had no complaints at all about the room. Was nice having a separate bedroom to put the kids to sleep in and we could still stay up in the living room.

Summary Heading: O.K property. Bad Customer Service. Howard Johnson would be so much better
Summary: Room and Swimming Pool:  Stayed one-night last week which was overall just o.k. We got a corner room and it was o.k; pretty close to the review pictures, but we were expecting little more than that as per 4.5 avg. reviews. Again, it was o.k but nothing more. The swimming pool is actually smaller that what is shown in the pictures.    Front Desk Service:  Jerry at the front desk was very nice. I felt that he really tried to find the bests for our needs. Next morning, there was some issue around our 4-year-old son breakfast charge which was communicated as free of charge when checking-in but then ended up restaurant staff trying charging us and all the conversations between us and restaurant were made in front of my son; which was a bomber. I was pretty frustrated so went to front
Manager Response: Dear EUN0312,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Our guests’ feedback is very important to our efforts to continually improve our hotel & its services.  I apologize that your experience at our property wasn’t up to our usual high standards. We’ve addressed the problems you mentioned with both the Restaurant and Front Desk teams.  We hope you’ll give us another chance if you return to our area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Satisfaction and no tension when you book doubletree hotels! Clean room,bed,amenities .cookies walking in walking out . On my trips a doubletree hotel is a must if it is in the way ! This had a valet parking but not too expensive . Surrounding area is Disney land , but still did not bother me at all . A lot of food and shopping around and a few open late night if you get hungry .Perfect !

I especially liked the suite. It gives a family rooming to spread out. Within walking distance of Disney, but seems too far after all day there. Try using t the the  ART or a cab. Lots of restaurants close by.

This hotel along with the staff can care less about their guests. We were there on Medical project and worked all night, when we requested assistance the 24 hour business center we were faced with any assistance. When asked for the manager we were told that he/she was on a break, but never checked with us. When we requested for a copier they told us they would make them a a ridiculous rate. Overall, I would highly recommend to the readers to avoid staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear 199Buddy,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim.   We apologize that the business center was a disappointment to you. We have notified our Engineers of the issue and discussed your concern with the Front Desk.  We hope that you give us another opportunity for a better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: I Expected More but it wasn't a disappointment either
Summary: Double Tree by Hilton I had been lead to believe was a little higher class than I experienced but for a family trip I wasn't really disappointed.  I was disappointed that breakfast wasn't free for my whole family.  I got coupons because of my status but it didn't cover all of us for more than 1 of our 3 day stay.  It was good but with little kids it wasn't worth the price.   The pool wasn't huge but it was nice. It was above the lobby so people walking/driving down the street can't see you so its more private.  They have poolside service you can order food and drinks. And an outdoor shower to rinse off before heading back to your room.  The 2 room layout wasn't the best and the furniture felt outdated but the beds were comfortable and it was clean. It's close to Disneyland

The DoubleTree has become my go-to hotel for business meetings in the Anaheim Convention Center-Disneyland area of Orange County. Guest rooms are comfortable and designed with both families and business travelers in mind. The banquets/convention services staff is very efficient and responsive to the needs of meeting planners and attendees. It's an easy walk to several other hotels in the area and to the convention center. Several high-end restaurants, including Ruth's Chris, Morton's, and Roy's are also within walking distance, as are Denny's, Hardee's, etc. Self-parking is easily accessible from Harbor Blvd. It's a bit of a hike -- about a mile or more -- to the Disney parks, but the Anaheim Resort Transport shuttle buses stop just a few steps from the front door.  This

Summary Heading: Nice location for Star Wars Convention
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights for the Star Wars Convention in April 2015.  Hotel was within walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was nice when we checked in that the staff gave us shortcut map to the Anaheim Convention Center (about 5 - 10 minute walk). The cookies were a nice touch too.  We had a room on the second floor next to the fire escape stairway.  It was pretty quiet here but it was a far walk from the elevator.  Loved the 2 queen suite room.  It was nice that there was a separate room for the bedroom from the other room.  It was great that there were two TVs, a desk, a microwave, refrigerator, a day bed for use as a couch and a coffee table to put your stuff on.  My only complaint that there was not much drawer space to put your clothes in.  There was a

We stayed at the Doubletree for 5 nights from May 20 - 24 while visiting Disneyland. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Victoria at the front desk made sure that we had an early check in and rooms in the same hallway for the different groups in our party. We had some great conversations with the Bellhop, Gary. He is a great face for your organization - personable, knowledgeable, polite, and always smiling!  Even Randy that delivered the room service was helpful. Every member of your staff made sure that we were satisfied and had everything that we needed. The rooms were great and the beds were very comfortable. We'll definitely make a return visit when we're in the area.

My daughters went to Disneyland on a twilight special event ticket. So I decided to book a room overnight so I could pick them up when the park closed at midnight and not have to drive there and back at that hour. I selected this hotel based on a great rate, good reviews, and availability as I booked only the night before. All rooms are spacious suites, with a separate living room and 2 queen beds. The hotel supplies all you need..coffeemaker, microwave, small fridge, and amenities such as soap, haircare products and lotions. The room was clean, with plenty of towels and pillows. The beds was so comfortable. It was a pillow top and on the softer side; just what the dr. ordered in my case. And of course, we were provided the wonderful Doubletree chocolate ship cookies. A few

We loved our 2 night Disney stop over at Doubletree. We arrived late from Mexico and they made the check in process very smooth and quick. We had been travelling for a month and this was the only place that had the cot set up in the room for our son before we got there. This was a huge plus for us.  It is a short walk to Disney. From other reviews I was a bit worried about the distance but we didn't find it that bad. We are walkers though. We would stop for breakfast on the way down and dinner on the way back.  We had a late flight back to Australia on our last day and they didn't have anywhere for us to shower. They went out of their way to find us towels, washers and soap to freshen up after a long Disney day and before the long flight. This was very appreciated.  I would

We stayed for 5 nights in May 2015 while visiting Disneyland. We stayed with 2 adults and 2 kids (3 and 5 yo).  The room set-up was great for a family.  Room was clean and updated- very comfortable. I always wipe down highly touched areas with disinfectant wipes when I arrive at a hotel (remotes, switches, knobs). You would be surprised how dirty these surfaces often are, however here the areas were already surprisingly clean- I was impressed! Cookies were delicious too! Downside was coffee shop in lobby didn't have many good quick breakfast choices- same day old pastries a few days in a row. We also used the Anaheim Resort Transit which had a stop at the hotel- I know this is independent, but would recommend with small kids to avoid the walk, but often had a long wait.  Would

If you need a tip on just about anything ask any of the staff. They were friendly and totally right on. I am not sure everything is a "SHORT" walk, but everything else was good information. Always a smile. It was like we were at Disney or something.

Summary Heading: Pros and cons depending on what you're looking for
Summary: We probably sullied our own opinion of the Doubletree by spending our first few nights at the Hilton - stay there if you have the chance instead! We then spent one night at the Doubletree and it was quite a drop-off in terms of room quality. A bit more space for families maybe... but those couches in the "living room"? Yuck, who needs them? The layout of the suites are weird and forced, they've not done a great job arranging things with the space they had, the bathrooms feel super cramped and dark. The pool/"beach area" is not nearly as welcoming as the pictures make it seem - we didn't take a dip. The breakfast was delicious but expensive and not included. The shuttle (its much too far to walk) worked, but then you have to worry about timing things, and its another added

The suites are spacious and comfortable. Well kept property. A little bit of a hike to/back from Disneyland but well worth the extra time. Great restaurant within the hotel and reasonably priced. Watch the vending fireworks from pool deck.

Summary Heading: I am a fan of doubletree
Summary: I am never disappointed by the cleanliness and quality of Hilton doubletree hotels, and this one was no exception.  I was in Anaheim for a series of running events, and being able to get into one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in was a huge plus at the end of the day.  The staff at the front desk was always helpful, since I had endless questions.  I just recommend that if you want to stay here and visit Disneyland, either bring your own car or ask the front desk about the bus transportation - it was a very long walk, and not a walk I'd want to do after the parks close at night.  Luckily, there are multiple bus stops nearby, so I never had a problem.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good location for disney and good value.
Summary: We had a king suite and it was nice to have a seperate bedroom to the lounge area. The free cookies were enjoyed immensly! It was a 20-25 min walk to disney but along one long road so very simple and there was a bit drugstore half way along where we went most nights. But you could also walk 5 minutes and get the disney free shuttle from the toy story parking lot nearby, The denny's opposite was great for breakfast.  Wifi worked well.

I went down there for a convention, and to visit disneyland. The hotel is really nice, lots of parking which you pay for, the room was very big, comfy beds, right by the convention center, a mile walk to disneyland, shower was a little short for me as I'm 5'10. I run into that problem in almost every hotel. Very quiet, kind of expensive though. No free breakfast and you have to pay for wifi. I wouldn't stay again if I was going to disneyland.

Going in December, I had one of the best half-weeks of my life.  The large, open shopping centre a stones throw from the hotel was incredible, both visually and in terms of the rock-bottom prices.  The complementary shuttle buses to and from Disneyland were also a treat!

Summary Heading: Too far from Disney for younger kids
Summary: Nice hotel, staff were a little abrupt when checking in but seemed pleasant enough during our stay. The biggest issue is it is advertised as being walking distance to Disney and it is actually about a mile away. No problem for older kids, but some of the younger ones were really cranky at the end of the day. Smart thing for them to do would be to have a shuttle.

Stayed 3 nights for a Disneyland visit.  Positives:  Decent price (though competition in the area keeps all prices in check). Breakfast was fairly good and priced sensibly.  Service was good. Room was in good repair, though decidedly not new. Walking distance from the park, though some would prefer use the bus which stopped just outside.  Negatives:  Rooms were never cleaned before 4PM and only upon request.  Each time we asked we were told "we are fully booked" which can be translated as "we don't have enough staff".  Manager was decidedly indifferent to complait.   Far more a business hotel than a family one.

My family of 4 stayed two nights at the DoubleTree.  The DoubleTree served as our base of operation for our Disneyland visit.  We had a military family rate which included breakfast for the four of us.  We had a 2 x Queen bed suite which suited our family perfect as we normally put our 4 yr old to bed before the rest of us and we were able to do so in the bedroom while still enjoying some TV in the sitting room area.  Another great feature of this suite was the bedroom's isolation from the bathroom so other family members could still make full use of the bathroom, shower and sink area while others were still sleeping.  The breakfast buffet had a great selection of hot and cold selections, in addition to a cook-to-order omelet bar.  The hotel did charge for on site parking at

Location was a little further from Disneyland than expected but the hotel room was very nice, clean and had lots of room.  The resturant served a great dinner meal and was priced just right.  Staff from checkin to check out were very friendly and accommodating.

Stayed at Doubletree in Anaheim which is about a mile from Disneyland.  Used the shuttle for $5 per day to commute back and forth to Disneyland.  The Doubletree has well kept grounds and a very nice lobby.  Check  in was easy along with receiving four chocolate chip cookies for the two of us.  Nice touch.  Room was on a high floor as requested but did not have a view toward Disneyland.  The room itself was nice but on the small side.  It was a standard room not a suite.  We sort of expected all rooms to be  Suite's as the hotel is advertised as DoubleTree Inn and Suites.  Nice bar and restaurant used both.  Overall nice experience and would stay at the Doubletree again.

Summary Heading: Great location, Pleasant staff. Above expectations!!
Summary: We would definitely consider staying here again! Suites were large enough; we got the 2 queens with the pullout sofa. Nice little fridge, and decent size sitting area. Walking to Disneyland is quite doable, but takes about 20 minutes. Nice walk to and from Disneyland, very pretty flowers/plants along the walkway. Location of hotel was also good as far as fast food options, and a couple of drugstores for other goodies/souvenirs. Hotel restaurant was very relaxing & a comfy space with an extremely attentive staff!! The food was very good. Enjoyed the hotel pool... It was big enough & well maintained with a nice little jacuzzi. Ask for a higher level room, as the views are very pretty & you can see the Disney fireworks at night. Very clean room... service was not a bother, but

The look of this hotel , close proximity to Disney , comfortable rooms and friendly staff made this a great experience. There were restaurants within walking distance which was convenient.  The parking area was easily accessible ( no parking garage) and the free cookies every day was a bonus. The price was reasonable as well.

Professional and friendly service with good variety of options  Close to Disney land and nice pool and palms. Concierge lounge is also well equipped. Convention center is convenient located close to the lobby. Making it a. Ice location for a good conference.

Summary Heading: Star Wars Celebration at Anaheim Convention Ctr
Summary: Hotel was a very short walk from the Convention Center. The staff was helpful in giving directions to get other amenities. The breakfast was great, with a full buffet and omelet station. The lobby had very nice, plush furniture to wait on for other guests or travel. The lobby bar was full each night due to the convention, and was a lively place to enjoy time after a full day. Would definitely go back if in Anaheim again.

Our 1 bedroom suite was perfect - 2 queen beds for 2 adults and 2 kids suited us perfectly, and the room plus lounge area was really spacious. Room was clean and comfortable. We walked to Disneyland - totally doable, maybe 15 mins? We were told about the bus there but for that short a distance we were happy to walk. Loved the Denny's Diner across the road, plus other handy stores nearby eg bottle shop and mini mart. I didn't take a note of the name but a gentleman at concierge was very helpful with taxis and transport to the airport. Small negatives - there was no room service menus in our room and after asking a couple of staff (and being directed to someone else twice)', it was commented that a number of guests had mentioned this and they would let housekeeping know. They told

The hotel is very clean and comfortable and very quiet! . The staff is very welcoming and friendly. Overall great experience staying there. The breakfast was great in the mornings! There is a made to order omelet station plus other hot items, cereals, breads and fresh fruit.

Stayed here recently with my husband on our honeymoon whilst we visited Disneyland. We arrived early (9am) after a 15 hour flight from Australia and they were nice enough to let us check into a room on arrival which was excellent! We were greeted with a warm cookie which was delicious and a nice touch.   Location wise, Disneyland is a 15 minute walk and Denny's is right across the street. Perfect for midnight pancakes when jet lag is keeping you awake! There is also a Disneyland shuttle which stops right outside the hotel which we caught when we were too tired to walk. There is a bar in the hotel and a restaurant which we ate at for the first night and the service and food was great. There is also a cafe serving Starbucks coffee which is excellent for the morning walk to Disney!

We stayed at the DoubleTree and it had been four years since our previous stay there, choosing hotels closer to Disneyland on our other visits. We decided to try the DoubleTree again since we had yet to find our perfect Disneyland getaway home.  The hotel is not only beautiful but also very quiet! I think this is the first Disneyland area hotel where we haven't heard hallway noise or other guests which is a huge plus.  The hotel gym is nice but small. One big plus for the gym is that it has a foam roller in it. As a runner, this is wonderful. Having run 14 miles the day we arrived, the roller was a very welcome sight!  The breakfast was great in the mornings! There is a made to order omelet station plus other hot items, cereals, breads and fresh fruit. I absolutely love their

Summary Heading: OK but not that kid friendly
Summary: Booked based on very good ratings and overall there was nothing major wrong but a number of annoying small things. Room was a good size in a 1 bedroom suite. In the bedroom noise level quiet, but if on sofa bed lots of corridor noise from the Disney bound families. An annoyance here is why for a family focused hotel the options for the bedroom are 2 doubles or 1 king. Neither suits a family of 4. Even 1 double 2 singles would make sense. Next was a coffeemachine and microwave, but no toaster. Cafe downstairs had a toaster but did not sell toast. I really don't want to go to the restaurant for 1 slice of toast for 1 child.  Other annoyance was how without saying so kids were not wanted/welcome in the bar. Restaurant mentioned by the bar staff every sentence. This is a Disney

There are several restaurants, a liquor store, disney, and the convention center within walking distance.  The hotel is very clean and comfortable.  The staff is very welcoming and friendly.  Overall great experience staying there.

Immediately greeted and welcomed Warm Cookies nom nom I came in early (around 11am) room was not ready but I was offered to let my children to play in the pool area if we liked. Also when leaving needed to park in lot after check out no problem they just buzzed me out when I asked  Great stay wonderful experience all around

This was the perfect hotel for my girls trip to Disneyland. The rooms are very spacious. The beds are super comfy. They have a small fridge and microwave in the room. It is a short drive to the parks. I love that they give you warm chocolate chip cookies when you check in. The first night we watched the fireworks from the pool area! They would have earned five stars from me, but there is a steep daily charge for parking. When you have a car, have to pay to park at the parks AND the hotel, that can get spendy.  Also, the morning we were set to depart, housekeeping woke us up around 8-8:30am. We had not checked out or closed out our bill. They still entered our room while we were asleep. When I brought this up to the front desk, they acknowledged that this is an issue. Granted

Top quality in all areas. The rooms were very clean and quiet. Staff was attentive and friendly. Walking distance to convention center an Disney. There is an excellent restaurant and  Starbucks on site.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, friendly staff, close to Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I stayed at this property in mid April for two nights. I was greeted courteously, and the room selected met my specifications. The two queen suite provided a good amount of space for two adults and three small children. The room was facing the pool on the second floor and we had a moderate view of the Disneyland fireworks. I was concerned about the noise level, but it was not bad at all.  The rooftop pool was nice, clean, and warm.   The bathroom seemed quite small. The parking price was a little steep for being so far from Disney, but there was ample parking compared to other Anaheim hotels. The price for breakfast was outrageous, and we chose to go elsewhere. I ate dinner in the restaurant once, and the server was absolutely horriible. (I am reviewing the restaurant seperately

Cleanliness and Friendliness was outstanding. Since it is a Disney Friendly Hotel makes it a plus...Buy your tickets right there. Great gift shop with cute Disney souvenirs. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

We arrived at 11 am and we are expecting to check in at 4pm.they accommodated us by giving us a room right away. Staff members are corteous and helpful. Shuttle to Disneyland is always on time. They also let us know if there's any delay. They sell themselves by highlighting the great location of the hotel: near an outlet, Denny's, fwy 5 etc. the interior of our room is not that updated but they are super nice so I'm giving them a 5 star!

I truly enjoyed staying here!  We stayed 3 nights for a trip to Disney and the beds were so comfy, the breakfast was good, and the staff was very nice and attentive.  Cookies at check-in, cafe on site, restaurant open early and late (read 10pm dinner after returning from Disney), and the pool is great for kids.  I have stayed at other Hilton properties and previous trips and this one is the best.

Stay there for 2 night at march 2015, this hotel is great for family who want to visit Disneyland california. There are shuttle to Disneyland from morning till night, so you can go early in the morning to Disneyland, getback to hotel for snap rest in the afternoon, and back again to Disneyland to watch firework at night. Room are quite big, nice bed, and also nice shower. Breakfast are on regularly basis on western, there are fruits, milk, cereal, muffin, etc.... Overall this is well maintenanced hotel. For those who like to shop, there are factory outlet nearby.... there is also a big electronic store and some coffe shop and restaurant nearby. For better view, choose high floor room.... So, will back to this hotel if I plan to visit Disneyland again...

My family and I LOVED our stay at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim.  The hotel is beautiful, staff is friendly and courteous, great customer service, and so clean!  We will stay here again when we visit Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Sweet Suites Make the Doubletree a Great Choice for Families
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for 2 nights with 2 of our kids while visiting Disneyland.  We were a little nervous when we arrived to find out that there were dozens of teenage cheerleaders staying at the hotel but it was very quiet!  It is the perfect hotel for a family.  We really liked the layout of the suite with two queen size beds in one room and a couch, coffee table and table in the living area.  The décor was fine and the beds and bedding were comfortable and high quality.  We paid extra for the breakfast buffet, which proved to be a great decision.  The breakfast buffet included fresh fruit, an omelet station, bacon, eggs, sausage and other breakfast items.  It was a great start to a full day at Disneyland.  We were exhausted after a day at Disneyland and picking up a

I attended the NSBE Conference at the Anaheim Convention Center and stayed two nights at the Doubletree Suites.  This was a great facility within walking distance of the Convention Center.  The staff was friendly, accommodating, and went out of their way to be helpful.  I ate in the restaurant just once, but the menu looked great and the clam chowder was delicious.

Once I entered the hotel, I knew I had come to the right place!  Love the chocolate chip walnut cookie upon check in.  This place is kept very clean and the staff was welcoming.  What really got my attention was how fast the free internet WIFI connection was.  I've been to other hotels, such as the Marriott in Anaheim, which had the horribly slow internet connections.  The bed was super comfortable which helped me get an amazing nights rest.  Thanks again!

This hotel is great for families visiting Disneyland. Close to nice restaurants and tourist attractions. Walking distance to Disneyland and fire and ice restaurant There is a large secure carpark on the premises.

My family just returned from a four-night stay at the DoubleTree Suites Anaheim & couldn't be happier with our stay. The staff was incredibly attentive from the moment we walked through the doors with a travel-weary toddler. She was offered a cookie before we even got checked in, which kept her patient. We had planned to use the Anaheim transit to/from Disneyland (there's a transit stop right next to the driveway!), but ended up walking. It's an easy walk in the mornings, but at night it took about 20 minutes because we were tired & walked so much slower. We were given a room that allowed us to see the fireworks, so the nights we left the park a little earlier we were able to watch them from the room! We got food and beverages to go from the little cafe each morning and the lady

Offers excellent features for the business stay while being close enough to all the attractions. During the height of spring break was relieved to see them place importance on the business traveler as well.

Beautiful suite and wonderful staff. I had some trouble with the parking lot getting too full due to a wedding and a cheerleading conference but the staff was very helpful. The location is great! I could walk to many restaurants and getting to Downtown Disney and local shopping outlets was easy. I would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Well rounded hotel good for Disneyland but great for Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: The rooms are comfortable and clean but not overly fancy. The lobby is decorated well, and the staff is good. It's next to a Ruth's Chris and close to a Morton's and an easy walk to the convention center. It's at a corner but the rooms are well insulated from the car noise.

Got locked out of our room at 12:00 pm even though we are diamond members that had a late checkout prearranged. Then waited by the door to our room for 25 min for someone to open it when the 2nd key didn't work that we walked down to the lobby from the 7th floor to get. Not customer service oriented. We will never schedule an event here again
Manager Response: Dear HandCHT,  Thank you for choosing our hotel on your recent trip to Anaheim.  I apologize that your experience at our property was not up to our usual high standards. We’ve addressed the key problem you mentioned with the Front Desk and Engineering team.  We hope you’ll give us another chance if you return to our area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This was a great valued hotel. With Hilton honours membership level we got free wifi and breakfast. The room was comfortable, staying with 2 teenagers we needed space and with 2 double beds and a sofa bed it meant everyone had their own beds. although with the sofa bed out the living area was a little cramped, it was still good to have own bed. The bathroom was clean, shower over a bath but vanity outside of the shower area was handy as one person was able to get ready whilst another showered. The breakfast buffet had everything you would want for breakfast including vegemite for the Aussies! There is ample parking available but you do have to pay for it. Overall the room was clean and comfortable.  A shuttle bus to Disney stops out the front of the hotel (you do need to pay but

Our family of 5 spend 5 nights here March 14-19. We had a 1 bedroom suite. While everything was nice in the room, it was simply to small.  We stayed in a similar suite at a Doubletree in Lake Buena Vista, FL and it was easily three times the size. As a diamond member, we enjoyed free full breakfast for 2 people per person per night. The buffet was very good. The hotel is about a 30 minute walk to Disney. There is a shuttle for $5 per person roundtrip, but we never used it. We opted to walk or drive. The hotel charges $17 per night to park even for Diamond members. Are one complaint was that the room was never cleaned before 300pm. We typically like to go to the parks early in the morning, come back to the hotel for a nap and then go to the parks later at night. Out timing was

We have teenage kids, and were just staying for 3 days. Choose this hotel because it allowed the four of us in a room. However the noise level was way too crazy. I can agree that this hotel is in close proximity to Disney, BUT still it was just way too much. The pool had all kinds of kids going bezerk without any supervision. No guard. The breakfast was good, actually very good. But you should time yourself and stay away from the time the horde of kids arrive.

We stay here every year when we attend the annual Religious Education Congress in Anaheim and enjoy the roomy suite accommodation. We have never had a bad experience at this hotel and have recommended it to people we travel with.

We had stayed here in 2010 and decided it was so good we would stay here again - we certainly weren't disappointed it was every bit as good from staff to cleanliness - I would have no problem recommending this hotel and very much hope to stay here again!

Great hotel.  Front desk staff very welcoming and friendly.  Given hot cookies on arrival.  Nice touch.  Room was clean, bed comfortable, no noise heard from outside of room.  Made good use of refrigerator and microwave.  Only complaint - microwave was a bit noisy.  Hotel is just a short walk to the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was so nice to be out of the mass of people at the Convention Center and go back to our hotel.  No long waits for the elevator or the Starbucks in the lobby.  I will definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for 2 days with my boyfriend and his sister. It was a nice room. Double queen bedroom with seperate living room. Its close to Disneyland which was the reason of staying here. Also the pool had warm water at night which was nice to go swimming in. I also loved that they gave us warm cookies when we checked in. They were pretty good. Overall it was worth it.

The facilities, amenities and restaurants were very nice.  The two room suites were quiet and had adequate space for a family of 4.  The beds were uncomfortable and needed updating.  If you're heading to the parks it's about a mile walk and the ART bus system is a huge hassle.

This is a pristine top quality Doubletree.  Perfect in every way. Walking distance to Convention Center, Disney and tons of restaurants.  There are many lower cost independent hotels around Disney,  but spend an extra $30 a night and enjoy the cleanliness and service of this Doubletree.

Outstanding stay.  Staff was wonderful. From the minute we booked by calling to the moment we checked out all staff we came in contact with were wonderful!  Room was clean.  Got the romance package, as we were celebrating our anniversary, and it was as described.  Excellent food in the breakfast buffet.  Bar area was nice, quiet and relaxing after a long day.  Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

we had a big party last night in one of their ballrooms, we had a choice of beef or chicken for dinner, i chose steak, food presentation was nice but the steak, when ii cut it turned into like a crushed corned beef, it was very mushy,  i could hardly pick the meat into pieces... and then we were served 2 pieces of cakes fro dessert, we had few bites then went on dancing for few minutes, when we came back to our table, cakes are all gone....
Manager Response: Dear Balat,  Thank you for your feedback and for attending the Philippine DOT Samahang Balayan USA event.  We apologize that the dinner service was a disappointment to you.  I think part of the disappointment stems from anticipating a Steak entree when the group had ordered Braised Boneless Short Rib of Beef for its attendees.  This entree is braised and slow roasted until the meat is very tender, falling off the bone.  I'm also quite sorry your dessert was removed from the table while you were dancing.  We hope that you give us another opportunity for a better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I rarely have time to enjoy breakfast but this was one we did not want to miss.  The omelet bar was a huge hit.  Staff were great, unexpected work issue had me scrambling for a scanner.  Staff was very helpful.  As always I love the quiet rooms and comfortable beds.

All the staff were very nice and helpful. I needed a fan for my room and received one right away. Cookies were always there anytime and always warm. Nice place to stay. thank you and we will come again and stay at double tree if we come back to Anaheim again.

I've had to pleasure of staying at this hotel in the past.  My family and I were so excited to return on the next visit to Disneyland.  Unfortunately, our youngest son became very ill the day before we were to arrive.  We were all so disappointed, but also concerned about losing our money as we missed the 72 hour policy to cancel.  My husband spoke with the manager on duty.  This gentleman couldn't be more helpful.  We are so grateful for his kindness and understanding.  We will, without a doubt, be staying at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim for many many more years to come....so long as we stay healthy:-)  Many thanks!

Very nice experience. Would recommend this Hotel to all my friends. Rooms were clean, all electronics worked, and experience was excellent. Close to restaurants, shopping, convention center, and Disneyland. Have fun and keep the whole family busy. Great experience had by all!

Summary Heading: A bit older than I expected.
Summary: Stayed in a suite and just the door to get in was really ugly. I felt like this room Ahmad so much potential. Only one mirror and it was in the bathroom. Furniture was really uncomfortable. We were here for one night and didn't use much of the amenities. It's a nice average hits with no wow factor.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but a long walk.
Summary: My family of four including two teens stayed here four nights in March of 2015.  It's a great place for our family because of the separate room with a tv and couch... along with the separate bedroom with another TV.  Perfect for people on different schedules to separate and still get a good night's sleep.  The room was clean and quiet, though the maid forgot a rag on the nightstand one day.  There's a minifridge that wasn't very cold, and a microwave.  The staff were good about giving us enough towels and toiletries for the four daily showers!  My only gripes would be the $16 parking charge, and the back door wasn't accessible at nighttime, even with a room key.  Also, Doubletree has to do something about the tiny half garbage can-half recycling containers that are about the

we stayed here with friends also family had a suite. Room was superb only complaint was the parking both the additional nightly cost also lack of spaces. Wife had blue badge they were full as were all other places and people were left parking anywhere.  Room had microwave, separate lounge room with sofa bed and main bedroom had two double beds. Would have appreciated a kettle to boil water, microwave gave it awful taste and the coffee maker left it tasting off coffee,,,,,,, Cookies given on checkin.... be warned they contain nuts.......... for those with allergies

Summary Heading: pricy, but a great place to stay
Summary: Everything about the room and service was great. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and since it's a double tree, they give you cookies any time you ask for one, as well as during check in. The bar and restaurant located in this hotel was also pretty good. I got a chicken bruschetta sandwich and it was a bit dry, but it was delicious and the fries were also good. There's a Disney gift shop located on the premises too, and walking to the convention center take about ten minutes.  Overall, if given the chance, I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a low rate
Summary: I got this hotel because it had a low rate for the area. The hotel is beautiful. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.  There is an overnight parking fee which is common in the area due to proximity to Disneyland.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights along with our 2 young children. Our bedroom was separate from the living room area which was very nice. We could see the fireworks at Disneyland from our window at night. It's part of the Disneyland neighbor hotels so if you're trying to keep Disneyland a surprise, it's hard with the signs in the lobby lol. We really enjoyed our room and our stay!   We drove to the Disneyland parking lot from where we stayed and we were happy to be so close!  We ordered room service for breakfast and it was very good with big portions.   My husband was there for a work conference and we found the conference area to be nice. During the big dinner though, the party in the room next to ours had extremely loud music which we could hear during our

The staff at front desk especially the management, told us that honors program means nothing to them.  If you do a request at time of booking means nothing to them.  The management does not even read the request so they give you what they want.  They have no regard to customer service.  It is what is the easiest for them.  We had booked 4 rooms and no satisfaction.

My wife and I transferred to the Double Tree from another hotel. Therefore, anything would have been an upgrade. However, with Hilton I can feel assured the bed will be comfortable there will be adequate amenities, the facilities will be clean, and the service will be terrific. It was a great choice. Also, this hotel was within walking distance to the convention center which was important to me.

My boyfriend and I only stayed for one day but the experience there was memorable. The location is very convenient from Disneyland. The room was up to date, which was very comfortable. The staff were very welcoming as well. I would recommend and stay again on another overnight trip.

This hotel was excellent! The staff were all so kind and cheerful. The hotel was walking distance to Disneyland aswell as food outlets and supermarkets making it easy for my friends and I. Our room was nice and big with a bedroom, bathroom and lounge area with a tv, there was free wifi, the hotel has a gym, a spa and pool which we used :) Our flight from Australia arrived at LAX at 6am, we arrived at the hotel at around 8:30, check in was at 3pm but the staff at the desk allowed us to check in at 12 which was very nice of them :) would definitely recommend this hotel

Wonderful place to stay. My son and i were celebrating his birthday and he loved it here. The parking is not great. Especially, if it is a busy week. I booked my reservation thru priceline negotiator and we got an awesome deal. They did put us in a room for like 5 people. It was only my son and I but there were no complaints. It did have a refrigerator in the room. There is a shuttle available for those who would like a ride to the parks. We didn't use it since we only stayed for one day.

Enjoyed my stay here near Disneyland. Everything was in nice shape and clean.  The hotel is very convenient and I liked how the parking was controlled with a card you received on check in. I had to go in and out several times a day and found it most helpful.

Within Walking distance to both Disneyland and the convention center.  Rooftop pool and nice rooms.  Very affordable for the quality of room.  the cookies upon check-in are always a nice touch.  Will stay again next time I am in town.

I have stayed at the Doubletree in Anaheim many times and I am always happy to come back.  The food, amenities, and accommodating staff are always top notch.  During this last trip to Anaheim, the Doubletree was booked for all the nights I needed and I booked at another hotel down the street.  After a bad experience with them, I called the Doubletree and they were able to get me in.  I walked in the doors and instantly felt at home.

good location no more than 15 minute walk from Disneyland.  Italian restaurant in hotel was very good. rooms spacious and very comfortable. great value. Staffe friendly and welcoming and attentive, Wish all hotels were like this.

Stayed two nights with our family of six. Room was somewhat cramped, but queen beds very good (sofabed only OK) and email offers to add additional feather pillows and a roll-away bed free of charge helped to make this a good choice; I really liked how this Hilton "subbrand" deals with bookings. Easy walking distance to Disneyland and in a nice area, which includes convenience stores for buying prepacked food for breakfasts and lunches. The room was a very good price given the location and that there were six of us. Self-parking in the hotel grounds was very convenient.

stay here you will love it, and yea great cookies at check in.....YYYuuuummmmm..... if you need a great day off stay here, and if you want a family get away stay here and you will always make it back for more

Summary Heading: Good place with a good price
Summary: Right in the heart of Anaheim.  Good location and close to everything you need.  Close proximity to a variety of food establishments.  Close to shopping for all age groups.  Friendly atmosphere for family and adult accommodation.

The hotel was great and clean! We stayed at this hotel for two nights during the Christmas holiday. The front desk staff were helpful and check in was a breeze.  I really didn't like the selection of the breakfast buffet.  We were able to walk to Disneyland and there's also a shuttle available at a descent price.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable stay and exceptional service.
