Summary: Due to a screw-up with our air travel, I arrived to the hotel at 11:30 p.m. instead of our intended arrival time of 11:00 a.m. The desk attendant was extremely pleasant, and helpful getting me checked in and scheduling my wake-up call and everything (free cookies were an added bonus). She also broke down the bus transportation schedule for a Disneyland event that I was in town for.  The room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. I have no complaints about the hotel. My wife and I did use the hot tub, but did not use the pool (it was a little cold).  The concierge stored my luggage for a couple of hours after check-out and then was super helpful arranging a cab to John Wayne Airport.   I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great hotel, clean and extremely friendly staff. Bed was comfy, sleep like I was in my own bed. Restaurant and bar are fantastic.  Food is very good and the bar has a great choice of all alcholic beverages. Highly recommend this hotel.

Overall very nice, clean, and large room. Located close to Disneyland and Convention Center. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing to stay in the OC area. There is also a nice restaurant, bar, and a coffee place that serves Starbucks coffee as well as a little lobby shop. Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Pay for a night and expect to
Summary: I stayed here on business recently and we had a terrible experience.  The hotel is nice and the accommodations were good. However, we had an experience that was horrible as it relates to customer service.  I needed to be at a meeting early in the morning and asked my wife to drive me there.  We left around 7:30am.  After having coffee and light breakfast, my wife returned to the room at 8:30am.  To her surprise the room was upside down as if someone had broken in.  Everything that we left in the room was missing. We packed early in the morning since we knew we would be checking out that day and removed the luggage from the room.    Unbeknownst to us, the hotel staff assumed we had checked out and proceeded to start cleaning  the room.  I have to be clear on this, that we never
Manager Response: Dear Msmxtoo,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim. We apologize for the confusion with your departure.    Housekeeping based its decision to clean your room a couple of factors.  The first was that your room was booked, signed for & registered as a one night stay.  The second was that your luggage had been removed on the scheduled date of departure.  The hotel has offered compensation for the discarded food items & we sincerely apologize for any difficulty.  It is my understanding that our General Manager has been in touch with you to apologize personally.  We hope that you give us another opportunity for a better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: My husband and I stayed at The Doubletree Suites in Anaheim when we were having work done in our home. We live only 6 miles away. I am a loyal Marriott member, but stayed here due to the reviews. The rooms are large and spacious and look recently renovated. The room looks better then the pictures on line and that doesn't happen often. There roof top pool is large with nice furniture and a Jacuzzi. The bed is also very comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor and could see the fireworks from Disney. This hotel is nicer then the Anaheim Marriott and I would definitely stay here again.

We just loved loved this hotel! Can not say enough good things about this place and can not believe we haven't found it nor stayed here earlier. What a steal to be able to stay here, so near to Disney and in such a beautiful and comfortable surroundings too. We found it through IBM and even though its a higher than we normally paid and was going to change it, once we checked in and they gave us the special Hilton Honors floor, we were determined to stay the extra nights and enjoy it all! The rooms were comfortable and nice-always turned over, well-stocked every night for us. So nice to be able to return late at night to a very comfortable room and beds. This place is perfect for our bigger family since its all suites. We even got couple of free breakfasts. It was delicious with

Stayed last year on business and gave this hotel two thumbs up so I decided to stay again this year.  I am happy to report that the standard of the hotel has not dropped during this time.  You can expect fast check, warm cookie, clean, comfortable rooms.  Last year I had a suite but this time I had a room with a king size bed.  The room has a small fridge, microwave and a coffee machine in the room.  I only used the coffee maker which was a plus very early in the morning.  There is wifi through out the hotel which is a plus. The staff are very friendly.   I was nice to meet with some of the staff that you met on the last visit like Karla in the dinning room. The used the in house restaurant for breakfast and dinner.  Breakfast was the buffet which was good.  You had some deceit

I stayed here for a work trip recently and really loved this place.  The rooms are great.  Probably the size of a 1 bedroom apartment in NYC.  The location is also outstanding.  You can walk to many restaurants, shops, Downtown Disney, Disneyland and the Convention Center.  Taxi's are also readily available as well.  Even though I was there for business, the crowd was heavily Disney tourists.  Families and couples.  All very friendly and happy.    They do charge for parking, which turned me off, but I guess they do this because of its proximity to so many attractions that charge a lot for parking.    The restaurant was better than average.  Not great -- that's hard to find in a hotel restaurant -- but was decent.  The room service was crazy fast.  I received my order in 15

Spotless and classy. Very nice, large suite with separate bedroom. Good beds, flat screens and in- room coffee makers. Nice business center.  Attentive, helpful staff. Very well stocked gift shop with snacks and refreshments. Also a Starbucks, restaurant and small bar. About a mile and a half from Disneyland but the 10 minute shuttle to the parks ($3) stops in front of the hotel every 20 minutes.  We found it excellent all around.  The only negative is that it only has a relatively small pool and it (in January) it is shaded at all times.

Clean rooms. Had a 2 room suite for a family of 5 which was a little tight. Found the room was lacking space for our luggage but it worked for the 4 nights we were there. Warm cookies are yummy. Staff was very attentive. Liked that the sink area was separate from toilet/shower. It's most efficient to take a cab to/from Disney for $10 each way. Restaurant was good as well as room service.

Very satisfied with hotel and service. Everyone was helpful and polite. We found restaurant breakfast was a little lame and inconsistent on a day to day basis for the 15 dollar charge. Overall I would stay again.Very nice hotel

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Convention Center Access
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights in December 2014 while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.    Hotel is very clean and rooms are nice.  Nice bar (although small), restaurant, and Starbucks in hotel.  There is plently of room in the suite, however not as much room as an Embassy Suites (in my opinion).  Beds were very comfortable (as expected), but the furniture comfort has much to be desired.    Most employees were very friendly, except for a few at the front desk who seem disinterested.  A special thank you to everyone who works in the restaurant!  They made breakfast each morning a pleasant event.  As a Gold HHonors members, I received coupons for the daily buffet, and it was fantastic!  This hotel is a very quick and fun walk to the convention center and to be

Attended a meeting at convention center in December and tried to book at Hilton but was full so instead booked at Doubletree instead.  Very happy with the choice made.  I had the two queen bed room.  It is very large (I would say almost twice the size of regular double in other hotel).  The bathroom has double sink with a double size closet.  The shower/tub area is large also.  Check in was smooth and effortless.  The warm cookies was a nice gesture. The walk to the convention center was only 10 minutes so it was nice to be able to walk there and get some exercise in.  The free buffet that comes with the room was awesome with so many variety - omelette made to order, greek yogurt with fresh berries station (I mean Fresh!), many pastries, oatmeal, cereal, hot items options.

Top notch hotel, people, rooms and facilities . what more can we say!   Fresh cookies and upon arrival.  Free wifi that works.  The hotel might need a fresh paint here and there, but main thing is that there are signs of them doing it!  Wish the pool was indoors.

Stayed here in November 2014 for 10 nights with my partner. We arrived a few hours later than our expected check-in time, but the hotel staff were extremely warm and lovely, as were the delicious complimentary cookies. The hotel staff member we talked to provided us with a map and was very knowledgeable about the area.   We stayed on the top floor of the hotel, room 701, which had a view of the main street and a little bit of the Anaheim suburbs, nice to wake up to in the mornings. Even though our room was facing the street, it was quiet and comfortable. Here are some other reasons why I loved this hotel:  - Price: We were staying for 10 nights, so we needed somewhere that wasn't too expensive. We picked this hotel based on its reviews and price. The price for this hotel is very

Summary Heading: Good but not the pull out couch
Summary: It's a solid 4....you can't beat the triple A rate and they let us check in at 0830. The cookies are delicious and the perfect way to start out your day at Disney or any day I suppose! Showerheads are strong and queen beds are comfortable. Coffee and refrigerator in the room. Plenty of space for 4.   They lost a star because we asked the nephew how he slept on the pull out couch and he replied, "Like a baby....I cried every few hours!"

We stayed here attending a convention. Thought the location was ideal - a short walk to the Convention Center but not impacted by the crowds that surrounded the event. It was also close to an up market steakhouse that seemed to be much better than average. The Hotel rooms were spacious, clean and functional for the business traveler. Staff (concierge) were very helpful and price seemed reasonable given the opportunity hotels have to ratchet prices when large conventions are in town.

Stayed here on a trip to disneyland. Close to the park. Very nice rooms, clean, quiet and roomy. Best thing is the cookies that you receive when checking in, hot & chewy goodness (don't feel shy to ask for an extra one you way out.) Restaurant on site, we had the breakfast buffet, make your own pancakes, omelet station, fruit, pastries, toast, bacon & more. Friendly staff. Great 2 night stay.

The family had a great stay at the Double Tree, it very clean, the room was spacious and futurniture was all clean.  The staff at the front desk, conciern desk, store and restaurants were all pleasant.   Also, the hotel was close to Disney which was an added bonus.

Summary Heading: Comfortable retreat from the theme park madness
Summary: Doubletree was a wonderful oasis after a long hard day of the theme park grind over our 5-day Christmas holiday.  The price was quite reasonable ($169/night - booked far in advance), the beds comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful.  Even the convertible sofa provided comfortable sleeping for 2!  Having 2 separate rooms in the suite configuration was brilliant, as the East Coasters could go to bed earlier, and the West Coasters could enjoy the rest of the evening.  The breakfast buffet had a large selection of breakfast items and included juice and coffee as well as an omelet bar.  The breakfast buffet was a bit pricey, but the quality was better than say the IHOP down the road, so it was well worth it.   After a day at the parks, we opted for in room dining.  The children's

Stayed here for 6 nites with family. Paid $375/nite. The hotel was booked out over the holiday. Day 4-5 there was no hot water, Told the housekeeping they came up a couple of times but could not fix it. My kids had to have cold showers in winter - crying , winghing kids.  Next morning I asked we we could use another room for warm shower- they said no - as nothing available. They told me that they would fix the issue and refund me a nites accommodation. When I checked out, the so called manager was cold and pleasantly "Rude". Gave me $100 and said you can take this or call cooperate. Very poor for a Hilton brand. The rooms were small but ok and beddings were good. I don't know if I would return - very poor service Freddy Cruz. (Manager)
Manager Response: Dear Kaushik H,  Thank you for your review. We sincerely apologize for the service that you experienced.   We try our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay, and we are very sorry that we did not achieve that.   We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that next time you’re in the area, you’ll visit us again so we can deliver a higher level of customer service.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at this Doubletree Suites for 5 nights over Christmas. The breakfast buffet was excellent in quality and choices  (e.g., egg station, prepared waffles, french toast, varying egg dishes, wonderful bacon, sausage, potatoes, vegetables, fresh fruit, cereal, breads, etc.), rooms spacious and clean, and wonderful staff, especially Jerry.It is about a mile walk to the Disney entrance, but the shuttle is a short wait and quick ride. For adults who needed to unwind after Disney et al,, it was great to have a bar on premises. Lovely outdoor pool and hot tub. Great value!

We usually stay at the Grand Californian when we go to Disneyland, but since it was full we decided to stay at the Doubletree based on the reviews on Trip Advisor.  We were not disappointed.  Everything was as expected.  The room was clean and the staff was friendly.  We were able to buy our Disneyland tickets downstairs and also shuttle passes. The breakfast at the restaurant was good and the kids ate for free.  Overall it was a good experience.

Very good hotel, nice pool - friendly service - good beds - european breakfast - affordable rates - shuttle service. I only stayed for a couple of nights but would certainly book again. Great experience

I would have given this a 5 had it not been for the parking situation there. We were there for 4 nights this November. Location was great but would not want to walk to Disney from there too often.  Hotel room was excellent, clean and roomy, We had one bed suite came with 2 x double beds also a separate area  with sofa , desk Tv. Microwave and fridge was also in lounge are. Comes with coffee maker, for those wanting hot tea, they expect you to boil water either coffee maker  (and have coffee tang! ) or heat in microwave. far from ideal. Parking even if you have prepaid your room is not included! we had two rooms four nights and twice the bill for parking! On one evening returning not even too late there was no place to park and people were just parking anywhere.! We had blue

Summary Heading: Perfect stay at the Anaheim DoubleTree
Summary: We just finished a four day stay at the Anaheim DoubleTree and it was excellent all around.  We were on a 4-day Disneyland marathon and the hotel provided the perfect launching point. We booked an upper level suite on the 5th floor and it had a great separate bedroom/living room setup for our family. Two TVs, doors for privacy, terrific room service and a great view. The price was right at $169/night, and we didn't mind paying extra for parking or room service with that rate.    For Disneyland, we highly recommend buying the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) ticket which for multiple days provides excellent value and service (go to www.rideart.org to see the map). The ART # 1 and  #2 bus lines stop roughly every 20 minutes at the station outside of the DoubleTree, and if your

Our family of 5 stayed here over Christmas for Disneyland (4 nights) and an Anaheim Ducks game. We got a super shuttle from the airport for $80 one way (5 of us). The cab driver told us it would be cheaper to have taken a cab. There are a ton of cabs waiting so basically the cab driver said if you tell them what the shuttle would charge, they will give you a bit better price so check around. We arrived at the hotel promptly. Super Shuttle was good although we did have to wait a few minutes for a driver stuck in traffic. Upon arriving at the hotel, there is a Dennys right across the street and a Carls Junior down the street. Also, there is a CVS 2 blocks away, an AMPM and a 711. Shell gas right across the street as well.  We checked in with the cookies. 2 rooms (one with air

Summary Heading: Plenty of space, good location, and 10mins from Disney
Summary: This is a great choice for a family looking to stay in a quiet, inexpensive, and roomy hotel near Disneyland. I took my family here for a 5-night-vacation and it was excellent!   Hotel: The rooms here are spacious and very comfortable. Whenever we returned from a full day of visiting Disneyland, it felt like we came back to a small condominium, rather than a typical hotel room. That has a lot to do with the layout of the room and its amenities. Each room has two rooms within it: a bedroom, and a living room. There's a desk for doing office work with included Ethernet port and numerous wall plugs. There's also a small refridgerator, a microwave, and two 37inch TVs, The bathroom includes a full bath, a shower, and a toilet. There's also an attached vanity with a sink. If you need

We had a fabulous time and loved the hotel. Great price for a one room suite for 5 people. The staff were very nice and polite. I will be recommending your hotel to my friends and family and will be staying with you again in the future!

This is one of my favorite places to stay in Anaheim. I was part of 21 people who spent Thanksgiving week in Anaheim in 5 different suites.  I had 4 teenage boys and this place was perfect. I gave them the bedroom and I took the living room. There are two televisions which made it more comfortable for me.  The coffee maker is great and there was plenty of storage for the 5 of us. Gary, a bellman, gave us great service. I really like that they give away hot chocolate chip cookies when you check in. In the morning before leaving for the park we'd grab a cookie and when we came back to the hotel at night we'd grab another one.  The checkin process was easy and fast. This last year I stayed there three times.

We stayed at this hotel for the first time while visiting Disneyland the weekend before Christmas.  I was able to do an e-check in online the day before our visit so when we arrived at the hotel, check in time a breeze.  Our room was on the 7th floor and as I requested, our room faced Disneyland.  We were able to view the fireworks show every night of our stay from the comfort of our room.  We utilized the ART shuttle which stops at the driveway to the hotel.  And picking it up at the park was convenient as well.  We never waited more than 10 minutes in either direction for the shuttle to arrive.  We did not pay for a breakfast package however we did eat in the restaurant every morning just because it was easier and got us off to a good start for the day.  Kids eat free with

Lovely hotel,rooms clean,beds comfy ,linen white,smells nice and no stains.Staff very helpful.Resturant over price and food was just o.k.Daughters vegtables cold ! But other than this we loved this hotel and its 15 to 18 min walk to Disney.

The Doubletree Suites provided a safe, convenient, roomy and friendly location from which to launch our adventure...a Christmas trip to Disneyland with my two adult children and two and a half year old grandson. The staff, top to bottom, from the front desk to the coffee bar and gift shop, were friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to make my family's stay a wonderful experience, an extension of the main event. And they succeeded. I'd recommend it to everyone. Had the weather been nicer, we would have walked to Disneyland. As it was, the in and out parking was simple and painless. I have nothing but positives to report. Including room service...great food!

I stayed at this hotel for the second time in late November, after having stayed there in 2010.  My 9yo daughter and I had an amazing time.  The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the beds are super comfy and the facilities are great.  The staff cannot do enough to help - particularly Victoria on the front desk and Josh and Gary at the concierge.  Victoria and Gary both greeted us by name each time we came in and Gary went out of his way to help us with transport every day.  We ate at the restaurant several nights and loved the food (plus kids eat free)  Sure it is a 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland but there is always the bus if you are not feeling like a walk and we often went by the market to pick up supplies for back at the hotel.  I would not stay anywhere else!

Summary Heading: You will NOT be disappointed - LOVE
Summary: My family and I love the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim! The beds are so comfortable, the shower pressure is soothing, and the rooms are clean! The front desk is very friendly but they somewhat lack concierge skills. We asked them about how often the Disneyland shuttle runs and they had no clue, and we asked recommending surrounding Korean restaurants but they didn't have a clue Korean town was located in the next city over.   Overall though, we LOVE doubletree. It really doesn't feel as if we are staying at a hotel...it felt like home. The hotel is only about a mile away from Disneyland...it's a great walk to get exercise.   The only reason I rate this place a 4 is b/c they charge for parking and there is no free breakfast.

I slept very very nice in the bed which is a big deal for me.  I loved the pillows they were soft and fluffy for my head and hard for my knees.  perfect!  I LOVE THE COOKIE!! The rooms were clean and spacious.  This was a Double Tree Suites so I was not disappointed.  Make sure you ask about the parking fee.  I had some visitors and they paid $16.00 to park for less then 4 hours.  But other than that it was great.

We thought it was a great hotel with an enthusiastic and courteous staff! It was very convenient for us living far away, and not having to drive all the way back home after my company Christmas party.

Upon check-in, was told that I would receive no benefits reagrding being a Hilton Honors member. The chocolate chip cookie did not make up for this. Bathroom floor had stained drips on the floor of unknown origin- never cleanerd during 3 day stay. No ventilation in the bathroom caused the smoke alarm to go off- inconvenient and embarrassing. Not impressed with the level of service/ facilities compared to the price paid.

The staff at this facility is  Great !!!we spent 5 nights , super friendly ,super courteous , super helpful , more than is expected from staff , great food  at the restaurant ,Diego and his companions are great !!!! would recommend this facility very clean, shuttle service to and from Disney land . would stay again !!

We just stayed here from 12/10-12/13. This was our first time. We usually stay at the Hyatt or our timeshare, Worldmark. Both were booked, so we decided on the DoubleTree based on the excellent online reviews. Everything was wonderful! Super clean hotel/room, updated, quiet, comfy beds, decent sized room, yummy food and an awesome shower! Water pressure is usually a big issue at hotels (takes an hour to get the shampoo out of your hair! Lol), but not here. The cookies were a big hit for my son - delicious! When not at our timeshare, we will definitely be back here again! :))

Summary Heading: C is for cookie, D is for Doubletree, and that's good enough for me
Summary: Just stayed three nights on business and couldn't have been happier.  Aside from a small bump on checkin (room not ready, no one called me when it was, although I was promised), this is a very nice Doubletree (and that's not something one often says).  Clean and up to date rooms.  Incredibly comfortable bed.  Wonderfully quiet too even though there were a number of families with small kids heading to the theme parks.   Housekeeping kept things clean and ready.  On the few times I saw hotel staff in the hallways, they were always patching and fixing up things to keep it looking perfect.  In spite of what must be heavy use, this was a terrific stay.  Next time I'm back for a conference, this is on my list.

This hotel was very nice. A walking distance from shops, stores, and eateries. Rooms were very nice and the hotel was in a good location. Close vicinity to Disneyland parks, but quite a walk if you do.

We stayed at this hotel in November in a two room suite for two nights to visit Disneyland prior to a Pacific cruise. Being active 60 year olds reliving our Disneyland childhood we wanted to be comfortable and not far from Disneyland - we certainly achieved this. We decided to not worry about the shuttle bus and walked between the hotel and the Disneyland - about 20 minutes  easy walk - often quicker than waiting for the bus. The breakfast was very good. The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable. Reception staff wee very welcoming and the cookies supplied at check in were very tasty. We were very appreciative of an early check in after our long flight from Australia which allowed us to shower and freshen up to then face the Disneyland crowds. We would certainly

Stayed here seven nights while on business in Anaheim. From the moment I stepped in I felt welcome. I did get the chocolatechip cookie and yes it tasted great. The room (425) is large with a kingsize bed and no less then five pillows. Enough closetspace for three weeks, nice size TV with all the chanels you can think of (ok, maybe not all but at least a lot). Desk to work at, WIFI and wired internet. Large bathroom with bath and shower. Used the buffet breakfast and there was something for everyone. The bar is wel stocked and has a pleasant atmosphere. The best thing about the hotel is the staff! Very friendly, nothing is a problem and things get done in the time they say it's gonna be done.

We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. Check in went very smooth. We arrived early (noon) and our room was ready and available. Not only did we receive warm chocolate cookies upon arrival, but each time my son passed thru the lobby he received a cookie. The gift shop was convenient and seemed to be open every time we passed by. The lobby bar was very convenient and had a decent happy hour. $5 for a Cosmo, yes please! I especially liked having room service for breakfast. The shuttle to Disneyland stops right in front of the hotel. Some days it was right on time but sometimes it was a few mins behind. After a long day at the park we came back to a nice clean room. The maids do an excellent job. Having the extra room in the suite makes for a much more comfy stay. We

What a great find. Having stayed several times at the Marriott and Hilton around the corner the Doubletree offers a quieter atmosphere with better service and value. Rooms are spacious, staff excellent and no waiting for breakfast tables. Within walking distances to convention center and many area restaurants.

We truly received the "royal treatment" staying here. My son who is autistic felt welcome from his arrival to his departure. From greeting him by name to noting his food preferences the very gracious staff certainly went out of their way. We'd happily stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel At A Great Price
Summary: My husband and I had a fabulous stay here.  We came to go to Disneyland.  The staff throughout the hotel was so nice and the location was perfect. The rooms were a nice size with all the amenities you need.  If you are going to Disneyland, it's within walking distance.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here as part of our honeymoon (for disneyland). Was above expectations, hotel staff respected our privacy, kept the hotel clean in unseasonable wet weather and who can go past the awesome cookies on check in?? Great hotel, I highly recommend this hotel. (15min walk from Disneyland too).

Overall we had a brilliant stay here. There was a slight mix up with the hotel as we had been booked into the wrong hotel by our travel agent (not the hotels fault) but the staff were amazing and helped us in every way possible considering the stressful situation. Once we had it sorted out we were put into a room straight away with cookies!   The room was huge for two people and was great with a comfortable king bed. The shower was very powerful but a minor problem for 3 nights. The hotel is within such close distance to Disneyland (20 min walk) which meant that we alternated between walking and using the ART for $5 all day pass.   The breakfast at the hotel was good for the price which isn't included in the room and is convenient when you want to be ready before you leave the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a Disney visit
Summary: Have stayed here three times now and we are never disappointed. Walking distance to Disneyland (around 15 mins) but has a bus stop right outside anyway. Staff are always friendly and don't forget to pick up those cookies each time you come home. Our place of choice now.

Very disappointed with the service.  Restaurant staff was very unfriendly and not very helpful.  Hotel staff was friendly but were not very helpful at all.  Simple request were not addressed.  I am part of the Hotels hours program but no special treatment what so ever.

My husband and I, along with our 8 month old son stayed here for a week over Thanksgiving. We can't think of nothing but pros for this hotel. From the clean rooms and pool area to the delicious food and drinks at Agio Restaurant and the Cafe Biscotti to the shuttle stop right outside the property and so on.  We were there for a week and had absolutely no problems with parking or waiting for anything. Check in was smooth. We asked for a room with a view of the fireworks but it wasn't available until the next day and they called us in the morning to see if we still wanted to switch rooms.  We bought Disneyland tickets right inside the hotel and went there on Thanksgiving day. The tickets for the ART shuttle are $5/person and it comes every 20 minutes. Convenient transportion for

This is a really nice hotel with reasonable rates for such a good hotel. The staff is very friendly from front desk to room service to housekeeping. We really loved our 3 night stay and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

This was our first time staying at the DoubleTree.  I know there were others hotels we can chose from but the DoubleTree stood out and we want to try it.  The price was right.  Nice and friendly staffs.  The room was nice and amazing.  The welcoming cookies were a nice idea.  They were warm and delicious.  I would recommend this hotel.  Plus, it is within walking distance to many restaurants and Disneyland.

Very clean.  Room service was great and very close to Disneyland. Pool is a bit small but mainly went to Disney and didn't need to use the pool area.  Stayed with older son and daughter and he was able to stay in the other room for privacy.  They honored a cheaper rate that I had found online after I had booked my trip.  Very nice accommodations!

This hotel has been my go-to location in Anaheim for years.  They are great whether you are visiting the Disney parks, going to a concert at the Honda Center (as we were for Justin Timberlake) or enjoying an Angels Game from out of town.  They are close enough to everything, yet just outside of the crazy busy Disney corner of Harbor and Katella (they are just down another couple blocks).  Their staff is friendly and makes sure you are on your way quickly.  Plus you cannot beat the cookies!

We actually visited years ago..But definitely wanted to review.  We have stayed here 5 times. Every time was a pleasure.  2 family's 2 kids each..the morning breakfast buffet is really great..a lot of items for picky eaters as with all Double Trees.  You can get your tickets right there at the hotel and a shuttle right at the door.  I would definitely suggest this great hotel to any one on a Disneyland Holiday!

Stayed here for disneyland trip, close to Disneyland. Very clean and staff very friendly and accommodating, would stay here agian if in this area. Part of disneyland package. Rooms are clean, big and very nice. Also close to resturants, gas stations and disneyland.

Our room was a great temperature, really comfortable bed and clean as a whistle. Couldn't ask for more than that! They even gave us warm cookies when we checked in at 8:30 AM! Delicious! They got a room for us early so we didn't have to worry when we went off to Disneyland for a day of family fun. What a relief! The gift shop had things our grandkids were more than happy to grab as souvenirs.

I really liked this hotel. It is located within easy walking distance of Disneyland and is surrounded by restaurants and everything you may need to make your trip comfortable. The staff here were fantastic, they were attentive to our needs and always willing to help in anyway possible. The rooms are clean and a good size with enough room to relax at the end of a busy day walking around. The beds were comfortable and provided a good nights sleep. The pool and spa were great way to unwind at the end of the day Overall this hotel serves its purpose in terms of a nice family friendly place to stay close to Disneyland. The excellent staff topped off a great experience.

I've stayed at other Doubletree hotels, and I wasn't disappointed. We checked in quite late and were surprised at how fast we got our keys. The lobby was clean and beautiful. The suite was excellent. It was clean and spacious. The tv's and lights were on, making us feel very welcome. I am one for conserving energy, but I understand that they wanted us to feel at home. The bathroom was clean with a very nice shower. The beds were clean and very comfortable. The abundance of pillows was so nice. If you book, put any notes in your reservation. I requested extra towels and was informed at check in that they were in our suite. They were there. I was very impressed with their attention to detail. I would definitely stay again. If you stay, I encourage you to fill out the survey the

We have stayed in other close by hotels, such as what was formerly known as the Crown Plaza, now the Wyndham Hotel, and Embassy Suites. They are all about the same level of hotel, although I would have to say that staying at the Doubletree down the road was a favorite of mine. Our family had two executive suites that we liked a lot. The bed was VERY comfortable, flat screen in the bedroom and living room part. One family member used the sofa sleeper and another one used a rollaway bed in the same room and that worked out fine. My primary reason for choosing this hotel was because we were using our American Express points to pay for the hotel and not all hotels in Anaheim will accept those points.  Fridge, no microwave. Little bar area in the room. No coffee maker, but hey,

I thankfully took the time and consideration in where to stay for a special weekend get-a-way to Disneyland because I was able to finally stay at DT Hilton.  Very elegant environment, but not overly formal, great service, tasty complimentary cookies and convenient parking.

The hotel is well kept and the rooms are comfortable and clean.  All staff are professional, caring, and helpful.  The restaurant has tasty food and reasonably priced.  It is a perfect hotel for families that want to put multiple people in one room, but with the ability to separate sleeping spaces.  I've stayed at this hotel twice and will continue to go there!

Summary Heading: Double Tree by Hilton, Anaheim, Ca
Summary: I've done a few of the runDisney races, and each time I've stayed at a few different hotels close by (Marriott, Sheraton, etc), and this time around I booked the Double Tree.  The price was very reasonable, and the location both walking distance and utilizing the shuttle was very convenient and close to Disneyland.  The room was very cozy and clean.  The warm cookies that were given were probably some of the best cookies I've ever had!  I would return here in a heartbeat if I had any upcoming races at Disneyland!

We just stayed here so that we could run the Disneyland Avenger's 1/2 Marathon.  The location was good and close to the parks (0.8 mile).  Lots of restaurants nearby to eat at.  Our room was very clean and the staff was always willing to help in anyway we needed.  We were happy with our stay.  We would stay there again if the opportunity comes up.    Just for other information.  I would rather go to Disney World as opposed to Disneyland.    Also, take a shuttle from the John Wayne Airport in Orange.  This is closer than LAX and the cost of the shuttle is about  $40-50 for a couple round trip.  Better than renting a car.

We previously stayed at The Grand Californian and were disappointed in the size of the room.  The room at the Double Tree was much larger and the beds more comfortable. Not to mention, the price was so much more reasonable.  We really enjoyed our stay.  The shuttle to the park was always on time and clean.

Hospitality awesome.  Beautiful Accommodation, very comfortable & semi luxurious.  Great Location. Staff go out of their way to really welcome you and assist wherever they can. We were treated like royalty. We Will return for a 3rd time when back to USA.

My husband and I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree Suites for six nights in Suite # 211. I was immediately impressed by the hotel lobby which was beautifully decorated and had several sofas on which to relax.  The Doubletree is a 'Disneyland Good Neighbour Hotel' and runs a regular shuttle to Disneyland  for a small fee.  The desk staff were helpful and friendly and make the check-in process easy.  Our suite was located on the second floor at the corner of S. Harbour Blvd and Orangewood Avenue. I did expect to encounter some traffic noise but was pleasantly surprised to discover that double glazing on the windows all but eliminated most of the noise.  The suite was extremely comfortable and nicely furnished with a very comfortable sofa , armchair and

This is the second time I have visited this hotel for a family trip to Disney  The rooms are spacious and well kept , service is good . The breakfast is also good - convenient and kids under 12 eat free. Its about a 20min walk to Disney if you are up for it but only a $8 + tip cab ride.  Since you don't actually spend time in the hotel when visiting Disney this is by far a cheaper option than the resort hotels so I recommend it  - oh by the way it was also very quiet for sleeping

The staff was friendly and helpful. Super clean and accommodating. Great hotel! And perfect location for Disneyland!! A much more affordable option than the Disneyland Hotel. Was able to stay in an adjoining room with my parents. Grandparents were happy, and so were the kids.

Summary Heading: Your best choice if you stay in Anaheim!
Summary: We booked this hotel as the rating is excellent and the price is so affordable. The hotel respected our request even though we did not book with them directly. To be honest, the hotel should update their photos on their website, as the real hotel looks much much nicer than what has been photographed on their own website! And we were shocked as we did not think that the room was THAT nice! We are 100% happy with our room and we definitely will be back if we visit Disneyland again! Even though I haven't unpacked all of my travel luggage yet as we are back home now, I am writing this review because I am so happy with the experience at this hotel!

Took my family for our first trip to Disneyland.  This hotel was perfect.   As is typical for a DoubleTree, we were greeted with warm cookies.   Our room was a two room suite, more like a small apartment, plenty of room.  Having little ones with me for the first time in a hotel, I was a bit concerned about our noise.  Not an issue.  These rooms are QUIET.  Many families were staying on our floor (as we could hear walking down the hall to our room), but once in the room it was virtually sound proof.  House keeping was excellent,  down to the Swan shaped towel and replacing my kids teddy bear on the bed when they came to fix the room.  Disneyland is less than a mile away.  If there is any down side to this hotel, it does not offer a shuttle to the parks, but there is a bus pick up

The hotel room is as expected, spacious suite, beds comfortable and the room is clean. Amazing customer service by Victoria at the front desk. She saw us waiting for our room to be ready, was sweet enough to walk over and let us know when it was ready. She also accommodated my request to freeze an ice pack so I can fly home with my breastmilk. Headed out to explore but happy we chose doubletree for our weekend stay.

Great location and competent friendly service. Prices are good and extra amenities are worth a few extra dollars the hotel charges. Doubletree and Embassy Suite brands are so extra value packed that staying at a regular Hilton doesn't make sense these days.

Summary Heading: Great home base for first timers
Summary: With a family of 6 and first time visitors to LA, this was a great location and hotel. The rooms were just large enough including the fold out sofa, but were clean and comfortable.  The service from the staff was excellent and Anaheim is a nice clean place to stay for the theme parks and access to other locations. We hired a car for the week which was an excellent idea to get around to experience the "real" LA.  The restaurant at the hotel was great value as children under 12 ate for free with a paying adult.  Their tour desk provides great deals and service.

A bit far from Disneyland but close to the Convention Center, this property makes walking to both an easy task.  About 1 mile from door to door for Disney, walking is an option - Uber also picks you up in front and delivers you to the taxi stand on the east side of the park.  Clean, large rooms with great maid service.  They seem to go out of their way to make your stay a comfortable one.  The only gripe is that the pool is on the north side of the building.  With it 90 degrees in November, it would be nice if the pool was on the south but Orangewood Avenue keeps that from being a possibility.

This place is AWESOME!! I've stayed at many hotels, and several Doubletree properties, but this location was SUPERB!  Just stepping out of the car in the circular driveway was a pleasure. Greeted by music, and the most incredible garden, was amazing!  The entry way, and the front desk/atrium are incredible!  Hotel staff are welcoming and accommodating to every need.  Prices are EXTREMELY reasonable, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and well appointed.   The walls and ceiling in this property must be made out of sound proof material, because we never heard a peep from any other room, and it was VERY busy!  STAY HERE FOR AN AMAZING TIME!! (We'll be back!!)

Loved the suite we upgraded to. It had beautiful décor and was at a corner so we had windows on 2 walls that allowed for lots of natural light. The staff was super friendly and courteous. Room service was delicious as well. We will definitely be back!

A very nice hotel and a good location to Disney and the Malls. The staff are very helpfull. The accomadation is of a high standard. The buffett breakfast is very good with plenty of choice with various breakfast food cooked to order. Would certainly stay here again

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable and worth the trip
Summary: Very nice, clean and comfortable.  Had the one bedroom suite with two beds and sofa bed.  Sofa bed very uncomfortable, one queen bed seemed crooked, but comfy.  Restaurant could use some lessons in compassion and needs proper training.  Turned away our guests because 12 year old looked older.  Made him cry and his mother very mad.

Clean rooms, relatively close to everything (nothing is that  close in this area) and very friendly staff.  This was a MUCH better rate than my friends got at other hotels for the conference we were attending.  Only downside was that the pool is on the shady side of the building and by 3 pm, all was in the shade and very chilly (October.)

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but difficult check out!!
Summary: I had difficulty checking out on 10/30/14. I allowed plenty of time for checkout but waited over 20 minutes to be assisted. One person ahead of me and her payment had not been applied correctly. My shuttle had arrived and finally someone else came by the desk and took my keys and confirmed that they would email a receipt. The receipt was not emailed. I called the hotel on 11/02/14 and asked for the receipt to be emailed. There were two receipts and I they emailed the same receipt twice. I called again on 11/03/14 and explained the situation and the employee said that she could not open my information. Finally late in the day the email came with both receipts. This should not be that difficult.

Surprise trip to Disney for my Daughters birthday everyone at the DoubleTree was very helpful to make this an extra special stay for her as well special treatment for not only her birthday but she also needs special care to deal with food allergies. Thanks for a great trip.

very large rooms I love to have a lot of space in the room , excellent condition of rooms very clean, employees very happy to be there. great customer service I will go back to Double Tree Hotel in Anaheim, parking very easy to access the building.

I booked two rooms here for the month of October  at different times which my first room I booked it was a suite and I also upgrade it to higher floor, the second room was a standard room for almost the same price due to I booked the 2nd room later which was fine only of course the closer you get to your stay the higher the price goes which makes sense. I was very excited about my family trip because I stayed here before people were very nice and professional. So as we were arriving my wife called to have the room switch to her bother name due to he got there before I did which she told the rep who picked up the phone that one of rooms was a upgraded one the rep said both of the rooms are suites which I booked the 2nd room as a one bed room, but my wife told the lady one of room
Manager Response: Dear Isaias,  We’re sorry we didn't provide the high quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel as your satisfaction is important to us.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity to make it right.	  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The staff at this hotel couldn't have been more professional if they tried.  I planned a meeting for about 50 people, and all the accommodations were ready with the specific requests individuals had made.  The meetings went off without a hitch, including the food and beverage service.  The restaurant in the hotel is wonderful, but there are any number of restaurants in walking distance from the hotel, and the bell staff are very knowledgeable about how to get to different locations in the area.

Its always nice to have a suite when having small kids to put down for naps, and teenagers to isolate rooms so people can get changed with some privacy. Made getting ready for Disneyland Halloween event much easier.  The staff here was a cut above most. We were greeted and treated very well, and I feel every effort was made to keep us happy.  Although your typical looking breakfast buffet, the food quality was very good. (Crispy bacon!!!) Fresh food and being rotated frequently. The staff was great.  The only downside to me was the pool. Its basic, and being described as a rooftop pool was misleading. Its on the second story above the lobby while all the rooms,(7 story) were erected around it.

This was a very pretty hotel with nice big rooms and comfortable beds.  It was great for are stay to go to Disneyland since it was only about 1 mile away and the bus stopped right out front.  We loved the suite because we could put the kids to bed and we could stay up for awhile.  They have a wonderful breakfast buffet.  The staff was really friendly and helpful.

this was a comfortable place to have a conference. the room was good and everyone on the staff was pleasant and most helpful. \ the only negative was the rooms for the break out sessions -- were very cold. I would bring a blanket next time to toss over me.

Visited again in July 2014 (First time in May 2013), it was again excellent! Cannot fault at all and would stay again when I'm back in LA. I actually like the location, close to Disneyland and close to shops the other way. Looking forward to the check in cookies!

Sure, the property is stunning and clean, the breakfast is delicious, the beds are amazing, and it's in a prime location close to the parks. But the people and service made the experience truly exceptional. I planned a surprise trip to Disneyland to propose to my girlfriend, and I was able to coordinate an unforgettable stay at the hotel via email from the other side of the globe- thanks Deborah. Tremendous communication. We were greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in and it only got better from there. Incredible service by a great staff who truly went out of their way.

The hotel was perfect for our little family, casual atmosphere with friendly staff. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Walking distance to Disneyland and there are lots of surrounding restaurants if you choose not to eat at the hotel. Perfect for a short term stay, would recommend DoubleTree Hilton to small families.

First trip to Anaheim as a family (kids 10 and 11 years), and this hotel was the perfect base. The room and facilities were excellent, we ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning and swam every night. Staff are helpful and attentive without being overbearing which made dealings with them pleasant and easy. Walking distance to the parks was great for the times when traffic was bad and barely moving - we beat the bus back more than once. No hesitation in recommending or staying again.

Great hotel with very nice rooms and excellent service.  Very close to Disneyland (walking distance) and plenty of food/drink choices.  Target is very close so if you need some items for your stay they are handy.  Great bed and very clean.  Very attentive staff.  I will definitely stay again!

We moved from the Carousel Inn (very bad) to the Doubletree.   FANTASTIC...  If you book through Costco Travel they will not help you with your choice of hotels.  This one is PRIME!!!  Clean, quiet.  There was actually coffee and internet (not so at the Carousel)...  be CAREFUL when choosing lodging around Disneyland.

Nice hotel.  Uncomfortable pillows and bed.  TV pretty lousy.  Poor choices for cocktails and wines in the bar. Very nice lobby, nice staff.  Terrible that during the baseball playoffs, Fox Sports channel was not available. Had to leave hotel to eat and drink dinner.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew,  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review. We appreciate your loyalty to the Hilton brand.   I apologize that your experience at our property failed to impress. We usually receive praise for our Sweet Dreams beds & pillows.  Our 32" flat screen TVs were recently upgraded in all suites.  As a sports fan, you comment about the playoffs concerned me.  I've double checked our channel lineup & we do indeed offer Fox Sports in room & the bar.  I'm very sorry you felt the need to leave the hotel for dinner.  We hope you’ll give us another chance if you return to our area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: My wife and I decided to spend a night in Anaheim, CA. for the Harvest Festival and to stop by the Disney parks (we're annual pass holders). This time we tried the Hilton Doubletree Hotel just down the street (Harbor Blvd.) from Disneyland.  Since this is a national brand of hotels, we will not go into detail about the hotel as we're the “seen one, seen them all” type folks. Having said that, the hotel has a large lobby with a restaurant, bar, gift shop, and coffee shop.  The rooms were very nice and the bathrooms large. Beds were comfortable as well. One thing that stood out was their parking.  Compared to some of the other hotel/motels in the area, they have a very large and nicely laid out parking lot (costs extra to park there).  For folks going to the Anaheim Convention

I just came back from my first trip to Disneyland (with a side visit to magic mountain) and this hotel was just lovely! We flew in pretty late our first night and didn't get to our Hotel until almost 11PM. We had been traveling all day and were tired and hungry. We grabbed a quick meal at the Dennys across the street which we were very thankful was there so we didn't have to walk or take a cab somewhere. When we got back to our room we passed out instantly. The beds were very comfortable and provided us with a great nights sleep every night! We took the ART shuttle to and from Disneyland while we were there. The shuttles run the routes every 20-30 minutes and drop you off right outside the hotel which was a life saver after being on our feet all day. And you can buy the passes

We travel a lot as a family and we are generally very satisfied with the hotel rooms we chose.  This one was an exception.  Once we had unpacked all of our bags and started to actually look around the small room, we noticed that the furniture in the room was rather shabby, the sofa in particular.  I wasn't sure whether I wanted to let my 8 year old sleep on the pull out couch.  I then opened the door to the toilet/shower area and the toilet smelled like pee.  It was disgusting.  I considered asking for a different room, but wondered whether the next room would be any different and we had already unpacked our belongings.  I will check the room thoroughly before unloading next time.  Would not recommend this hotel for the rooms, but the staff and the restaurant food and service
Manager Response: Dear Renee,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim.   We apologize that the furnishings & restroom were a disappointment to you. I must say I am quite surprised to hear your comments about the furniture as the hotel was fully renovated in 2013.  I have shared your comments with the housekeeping team.  We hope that you give us another opportunity for a better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Booked a night at the Doubletree for after Disney. I am so happy I did.  Comfortable, clean , quiet room. With all the children staying at the hotel - I didn't hear any of them.   My son passed out the minute his head hit the pillow. We had a long day at the park....lots of fun. I recommend parking at site and taking $5 shuttle to the park.  Staff were great !!!  I'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear RS 1990,  Thanks so much for your kind words about our hotel.    I’m happy to hear that your sonejoyed our Sweet Dreams bed & that you were able to use the ART shuttle.  Please visit us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: What a great location for families, couples and anyone wanting to experience Disneyland.   Me and my partner stayed here for 4 nights in August and we loved every moment.  1) Great buffet breakfast, lots of options and always seemed fresh and healthy  2) Lovely staff, we felt looked after and welcome here for the full 4 days 3) ten minute walk to Disneyland and the Garden walk (which has many restaurants where you can eat great food at cheaper prices than Disneyland.) I recommend Fire and Ice Grill and Bar.  As a travel agent I would recommend this hotel to my clients and definitely stay here if I was to return to Anaheim.

Usually, I want to be as close to the venue as possible. To that end, I booked two different hotels due to limited availability.  After reviewing the shortcut walk to the convention center, I took Double Tree hands down.  It was perfect. Well almost - they actually had a water leak in my room prior to checking in and had to move me from connecting rooms.  However, totally understandable, handled exceptionally well, and they even gave me and my employees free buffet passes to make up for any inconvenience.  It was a great stay and I highly recommend.  Rooms are fantastic and perfect for business meetings in the suites.  I also saved several hundred dollars over the Anaheim Hilton.
Manager Response: Dear 167Stefanw,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim.   I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your visit.  We apologize for the water leak but I am so happy the team was able to recover well from it.    We hope that you give us another opportunity for a even better experience.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Doubletree suites. From the time we checked in (and received some of those yummy cookies)until we checked out,everything was fantastic. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and always had a smile. We stayed in the 2 room suite...the room was great. Very spacious. We enjoyed having a tv in the bedroom and also a tv in the living room. The room also had a mini fridge and microwave. Our room was very clean. A big shout out to the house keeping staff as they do a wonderful job. A few evenings we came back to our room and our wash cloths were shaped like a basket and the soaps and shampoo were put in there. We ate at Agio Ristorante once. We had the breakfast buffet. It was very good and there were lots of things to choose

We originally wanted to stay at a Disney hotel so we could maximise or tickets by not having to walk. We picked this hotel as it was a little cheaper and glad we did. Although it would be nice to not have to walk or bus it, it was nice to escape the rat race of hoards of people and cranky kids and parents. Checkin was friendly although our room wasn't ready however they did offer another room if we wanted to checkin straight away. We opted not to as we wanted the view. They gave us bottles of water for our wait and their yummy cookies. We were checkin quickly when the room was done and it was spacious, clean and perfect view. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean the room was. The hotel was practically full and we hardly heard a noise which is excellent since most of the
Manager Response: Dear PG95,  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review.   I'm so pleased to hear your enjoyed your stay with us.  I'm glad you were able to use the on site laundry facility & the Kids Eat Free oprogram.  They both offer families a great savings.  I was happy to hear you enjoyed the breakfast buffet & the vegemite!  Chef really appreciates our guests from Australia.  We hope you’ll stay with us again if you return to our area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Brilliant Stay at a Great Hotel for Families!
Summary: This hotel has definitely been a true highlight for me on my family's trip around America. The Doubletree Anaheim staff are excellent, very helpful in basically all aspects. Must visit this hotel with kids! Our room, the family suite, was plentiful. The suite had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable, 1 fold out bed, a large bathroom, a microwave, a refrigerator and other great amenities. Each morning my family and I ate at the perfect buffet breakfast room located in the lobby. The buffet does cost for adults but kids have a complimentary breakfast. The pool is very refreshing after a long day at Disneyland. The ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) is a convenient way to travel to disneyland and other tourist attractions located in Anaheim. The bus arrives every 10 minutes

Doubletree Anaheim is a wonderful oasis in a sea of hotels.  Great rooms, great breakfast and pool and friendly staff.  Cannot recommend highly enough.  2nd time we have stayed there with our two boys and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Best night sleep in their heavenly beds.
Manager Response: Dear MudCrab4,  Thanks so much for your nice words about our hotel.    I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed your suite & the breakfast buffet.  Chef has been working hard to make it appealing to everyone.  Please visit us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay if you have to go to Disneyland
Summary: What a great hotel.  Staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean and has everything you need.  The suites are great with 2 queen beds (that are really comfortable) and a separate lounge area with a fold out lounge, which is perfect when you have kids.  Cookies were yummy too!  Great bathroom with plenty of space.  We have stayed here twice and would stay again, if we had to ever come back to the nightmare that is Disneyland.

While billed as the Doubletree Suites, there are actually standard rooms as well at this location.  We stayed in a King non-suite which was quite comfortable with all the usual amenities for a modern hotel including a spacious bathroom with lots of storage and counter space.  It also had a microwave and small refrigerator which came in handy.  The property is well maintained throughout and located in a safe neighborhood along a very busy main thoroughfare which as many have pointed out is about a 15-minute walk to the Disneyland main entrance off Harbor Blvd.  You can also catch the ART (Anaheim Resort Transport) shuttle bus at the end of the driveway for $5 per day per person.  We opted to walk since we observed that by the time you wait for the shuttle and it makes it's

We stayed here for our anniversary and it was excellent! The housekeeper even folded our towels into swans for our second night. The location is very clean and it a great walking distance to/from Disneyland. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the cookies were delicious...as long as they were warm.

The hotel and amenities are great....the staff is very friendly and helpful! The hotel is in a good location and is walking distance to Disneyland and great restaurants. After a fun day it was nice to unwind in the lounge with some great bartenders. If we return to the area we will definitely stay at The Double Tree again.

We stayed here for a family trip to Disney Land, what a great hotel, clean rooms, great staff, cant say enough good things about the Breakfast Buffet. My only grip is we had to check out a day early due to a sick child and had to pay an early check out fee of 50.00, Its also about a mile walk to the parks if you plan on walking to a from, just keep that in mind.

This is such a great hotel to visit Disneyland and the surrounding fun!  Fantastic location, wonderful facilities and an excellent team throughout the hotel.  If you can get a room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks it is fantastic to see.  The in house restaurant is also very good - great pizza!  Always felt welcome and well taken care of!

Really nice room, excellent service staff and front desk personnel.  Restaurant was very good and my waitress was outstanding.  The room was clean and quiet, and the elevators were rapid, I never had to wait long. The meeting room was quite nice and the food at the restaurant was well worth staying at the hotel and not going out to dinner.  Breakfast was also a nice touch.

From the Double Tree it's a 12 minute drive to the Honda Center.  We chose to take a taxi, a good choice heading over to the show. Getting a taxi after the show wasn't so easy.  Taxi p/u locations could have been better organized. It was suggested that we leave the show early to avoid this, but didn't want to miss any part of the show. Otherwise, great hotel experience!

The hotel was clean and well maintained.  The staff went out of their way to assist.  The food along at the restaraunt was excellent, the service was very professional. I highly recommend this hotel if you're planning a trip to Disneyland

Summary Heading: A very good place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree Suites recently whilst visiting Disneyland with my wife and 2 Grandchildren.   The hotel is quite spacious and the staff are very friendly and helpful, and always keen to help with any problems or questions you might have.. The hotel has all the facilities you would expect (bar, restaurant, pool, gym, business centre etc.) and is an easy 15 minute walk from the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney.     Whilst some of the décor may appear a little dated, the rooms are kept very clean and well maintained.   Overall a very nice and comfortable place to stay.   I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again without hesitation.

Stayed overnight while visiting family in the area.  Overall, the property is in a nice location, feels safe, and has colorful vibrant decor.  While I might stay here again, I would probably try another Hilton property in the area before coming back -- simply because the hotel lacked a few items.  First, the hotel didn't seem to fully value my Gold status (e.g., no mention of a room upgrade, no bottled water, etc....however, they did provide me with breakfast coupons).  The front desk staff while nice just didn't seem to care much...no big deal in that it was a quick overnight stay; however, I find that the best hotels in terms of a service attitude are those that go out of their way to acknowledge a frequent customer of the Hilton properties.  Second, the ventilation system

This was our second visit to this hotel & it was just as good as last time. Friendly staff that greet you warmly each time you pass through the lobby. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and we again chatted with Gary at Concierge, we met him on our last visit 6 years ago & he's as friendly as ever - always willing to help. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from Disneyland which was no problem for us - just a nice walk. Car parking on site is excellent & convenient. Washing machines & dryers are available for a fee. Cafe & bar in the lobby provide good service. The only issue we had was the day after we left & arrived at our hotel in L.A. My husband complained to me that the clothes in his travel bag were wet! He went through his bag & found a dirty cleaning cloth &

Would not stay anywhere else in the Anaheim area - loved the Doubletree suites and so did my kids!  Short ride to the park, many excellent restaurants nearby and beautiful suites!  My kids loved the cookies as well!

I was here for a wedding and this was an ideal location for what I needed.  Close to the highways.  For Disneyland visitors, this is also a good place as it is close to the venues but away from the bustle of the crowds.  Rooms were large and spacious.  They were updated without any problems.  Parking is easy but as a guest, you do pay $16 a day.  I think that's alittle steep especially since LA is a driving city.

Summary Heading: Perfect for families going to Disneyland!
Summary: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland AND because we stayed in a Doubletree room exactly like this when we went to Disney World in Orlando.  With 2 queens and a pullout couch in a separate room you can vary your sleeping arrangements.  We put one kid in a bed and one on the pullout.  Also, it was nice to have the kids watch TV in the bedroom one night while we watched in the other room.  Sometimes you need a little space at the end of the day!   Another kid friendly amenity is the refrigerator and microwave.  I went to a local grocery store and bought some stuff that we could pack in a cooler for lunches and snacks at Disney which cuts down on the money you spend there.  Room was clean, staff was friendly and hotel breakfast buffet was good.  5 min drive to

Our stay was very good and comfortable the room were kept clean the beds were awesome the cookies were very good ,Disneyland was in walking distance and restaurant were very close  and in walking distance.

Stayed here with a group doing a tour of schools in Los Angeles. All members of the group enjoyed the stay and recommended staying here in their feedback. Close to everything with the walk (about 15 minutes) to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and GardenWalk Shopping Centre getting the group out for some good walks. Close to freeways and other shopping also.

Great location, friendly helpful staff, beautiful hotel with  nice enviting atmosphere throughout! and most importantly, affordable.  It make our stay very enjoyable, we added another night so we could visit Disneyland and once again our hotel had a shuttle that took us there and brought us back.   No trouble, not worries, we just enjoyed the ride.   Disneyland was Fantastic!

Very nice hotel that is about a 10 minute walk to the convention center.  The rates were good and I was able to stay within the government per diem rates.  The rooms were good sized and spotless.  Each and every staff member I encountered was helpful and pleasant.  Breakfast in the restaurant was well above average and free to HH Gold and Diamond members.  I would definitely stay here again!

Just checked out after our stay at DoubleTree in Anaheim. From the moment we arrived the staff were very attentive, very friendly and helpful. Received a couple of surprises on arrival which we were not expecting (Our travel agent has reserved offers for its guests at DoubleTree Anaheim) and this made the experience even better. Wifi was brilliant, best I have had in any hotel worldwide. Pool was clean, and dont start me on the daily complimentary cookies. Well done guys you should be proud!
Manager Response: Dear kandandt,  Thanks so much for your kind words about our hotel.    I’m happy to hear that your enjoyed the hotel & most importantly, the service.  Sadly, I know all too well how addictive those cookies can be.  Please visit us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary Heading: Nice place near the Disney parks
Summary: Had a standard room here (739 top floor) and not a suite but was very comfy, quiet and clean. The carpet was slightly wet when we arrived but dried fast enough. We had the Bed and Breakfast deal and the breakfast was pretty good as well as being all you can eat, which saves you money by filling up prior to hitting the parks and being ripped off by overpriced lousy food. Service was very good at the breakfast, housekeeping and front desk. There is a shuttle bus service to the parks right in front of the hotel that you can ride all you want in 24 hours for a flat $5 per person which is cheaper and closer then parking at the park. You get the tickets at the front desk.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, close to Disney
Summary: This was our first time trying this hotel and were very happy with the choice. We picked the Doubletree instead of the Hilton because we were looking for a little more room in a suite. The rooms are very nice, check in was easy and it is very convenient to get to Disney. There is a small refrigerator in the room and the beds were very comfortable. Good choice for a family.
Manager Response: Dear KariW,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing our property during your stay in Anaheim.   I'm so glad you enjoyed the suites & hotel services.  I hope you were able to take advantage of the kids eat free program as well.  We hope that you can visit us again soon.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton, Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I can't say it any plainer than that. This hotel is in my top 5. Great reasonable prices, secure parking, great food (also reasonably priced), Starbucks in lobby, pool, workout room, and beautiful rooms.  The room was set up more like a small apartment and had everything we needed (2T.V.'s).  If you don't want to walk the approx. 1 mile to Disneyland you can get the daily $5.00 ART bus pass that picks you up and drops you off right out front from the front desk.  Staff was outstanding, friendly, and helpful.  We will ONLY stay here if we return to Anaheim.

Enjoyed our 5 nights here.  Room was ready early, upgraded without asking to the honors level with fireworks  and pool view. Room spacious, comfortable and quiet. Nice to have the cafe downstairs and nice restaurant where we decided to eat in one night.  All staff very helpful. Approx a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.   Thanks for a great stay. Loved having a separate bedroom so our son could go to bed without been disturbed.  And loved how quiet it was.
Manager Response: Dear BayfamilyNZ,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  Our guests’ feedback is very important to our efforts to continually improve our hotel & its services.  I’m very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  I'm also glad you were able to dine in Agio Ristorante & Cafe Biscotti.  I hope you can stay with us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: This is the second time I stay in this particular location with Double Tree and my family and I really enjoy the staff and our entire stay experience.  We will continue to return to this particular location as long as they continue to have the awesome pool for my girls and the warm cookies waiting for us.

We stayed here for our Disneyland vacation and it was great!  Check-in was easy and we had ten people in our group, they put us all next to each other on the same floor.  The pool and jacuzzi was great.  We had a great view from our room to see the fireworks!  The bed was comfortable and the breakfast buffet was good.  Room was very clean and all of the staff were very nice and helpful.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Rosie W,  Thanks so much for the compliments on our hotel.   I’m happy to hear that your family had a good time with us.  I'm also glad to hear you made use of the breakfast buffet.  Chef Rafael has been working hard to improve it recently.  Please visit us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: This place was great.  Clean rooms, helpful staff, and a free shuttle to Disneyland.  Shopping and restaurants are within walking distance.  We really enjoyed the gentleman who ran the shuttle.  He was very entertaining.  We will be back soon!

Property is a good value and very clean. Good location close to banking, shopping, dining etc. Close to Disneyland. Staff is friendly and parking is secured. AM PM right a cross street for quick snacks or gas.
Manager Response: Dear Jim F,  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review.   I am happy to hear you enjoyed the hotel & its location.  Service is our number one priority so I am pleased the staff was friendly.  We hope you’ll stay with us again when you return to our area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I stayed here for a business conference; their rate was less than half the rate for the host hotel a block away. It was typical Hilton family quality. Keep in mind, I travel for a living and stay in hotels close to 150 nights a year.   Every staff member I encountered was great. The place was extremely clean. The bed was great. The A/C rocked. The TV worked like it should. I ate in the restaurant twice and while the food might not win some 5-star cooking contest it was good.   I’d stay here again in an instant.

I have stayed at this hotel location on a few occasions one being for vacation to Disneyland and other trips were for business, love the location, cleanliness of the hotel, great friendly staff, great up to date beautiful rooms, will definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear Sheline T,  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review. We appreciate your loyalty to our hotel.   I am so glad that you enjoyed the rooms & staff.  I'm glad you mentioned cleanliness - I think we have a terrific housekeeping team.  We hope you’ll stay with us again soon.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed 2 nights, 2 adults, 2 teenage children. From the complimentary cookie to the friendly welcome, this hotel lived up to expectations and more. Rooms are great sizes, clean and are modern. Parking is easy and was included in room rate. Bus to Disneyland almost at the front door. A microwave in the room is an added bonus with grocery shops less than 2 miles away. Highly recommend

From walking in on a VERY hot Friday afternoon until checking out the next morning, everything was WONDERFUL! We were in town for the Women Of Faith conference and needed a place to stay. Doubletree was it! We will be back next year!
Manager Response: Dear Sherri S,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.   I’m sorry about that awful heat wave while you in town.  It was so unseasonably hot.  I'm really happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I hope you had a great time at the Women of Faith conference, too.  I hope you can stay with us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: we recently stayed at the Doubletree Suites on a family vacation.  (Disneyland, of course!)  On arrival at 1am we were offered some delicious warm cookies and the lovely man who checked us in made the fatal error of telling my husband that we were welcome to as many cookies as we liked, whenever we liked.....lets just say my husband consumed a lot of cookies :)  We found the room very clean and comfortable for a family of 4 - two queen sized beds, compared to other hotels that offer doubles. this was a very welcome change when you are sharing a bed with a child who likes to sleep sideways!!  We also made use of the rollout sofa bed in the lounge which was comfortable.  We couldn't have asked for a better stay - thanks for the Cookie Care Doubletree!

Summary Heading: Good but not the best area hotel....
Summary: The room was clean and big. We had a suite with two queen beds. We utilized the pullout sofa as well which was surprisingly comfortable. We had an issue with the air conditioner not staying cool and maintenance fixed it in a timely manner. I liked the hotel and would stay again but there were some things I wasn't crazy about it....
