There was a second TV in the bedroom.  I didn't like having to pay for parking.
Manager Response: Dear Del C,  Thank you for your kind review of the hotel.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed your stay & the size of your suite.  I hope you can join us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: For the amount we paid for our room I felt it could have been nicer.  They brag about the cookie you get but ours was cold and hard.  The bed wasn't that comfortable.  I didn't really like the layout of the room. I don't usually comment on surveys like this but I felt this stay warranted it.  Just wasn't impressed at all.
Manager Response: Dear Annette N,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I apologize that you did not receive a warm Doubletree Cookie upon arrival.  We have warming ovens at the front desk so I am very surprised to hear that yours was cold.  I am also sorry to hear that the bed & suite layout didn't meet your needs.  I hope you will consider giving us another try the next time you are in town.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed while visiting Disneyland with family and must say that while I am usually pleased with my stays at Hilton properties, the DoubleTree Anaheim Resort - Convention Center stands out! The staff was very helpful and friendly in all my interactions with them. Excellent service like I received makes a wonderful difference. From what I saw in our rooms and in common areas the property is kept well cleaned and appears to have been recently renovated. My niece and nephew said they really enjoyed the pool. For those going to Disney there is a welcome center on site and a stop for the ART busses is right out front.
Manager Response: Dear Jose G,  Thanks for the kind words.  I"m so happy you enjoyed your visit with us.  Hilton has an excellent variety of hotels & for you to say we stand out is a huge compliment.  I'm glad you made use of the Disney Welcome Center & the ART shuttle.  They are a big convenience & savings for our guests.  Please visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: The best hotel of our journey
Summary: This hotel was a standard hilton. However the staff we're lovely and caring. They actually listened to us. We got loads of free things as it was our honeymoon, I could not have wished for a better experience. I actually went to see the manger the day we left to make sure he knew how fantastic his staff were.

Well located for the conference centre and local shopping, this place has good sized rooms that are quiet and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Not the Ritz, but for the price, excellent value. Clean and very comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremy C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm glad to hear you enjoyed the service & accomodations.    I hope you can join us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: AAA ratings are understated.  I would rate this hotel as 5 star for both room and food.  Quiet rooms!!!  Food was excellent in quantity and quality and the service was the best around. Very helpful staff in lobby too.
Manager Response: Dear Patronta,  Thank you for so much for the nice review.  We appreciate the compliments very much.  I will share your comments with the entire hotel team.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We had a suite that, while not spacious, it was more than enough for our family of 3. It was clean and nicely furnished with 2 queen size beds (comfortable) and a sofa bed. Although our room faced busy Harbor Blvd, traffic noise was kept to a minimum and we slept well. Room service was a little pricey (as it tends to be), but the quality of the hotel food is very good.

I have stayed at the Double Tree Guest Suites on two different occasions each for my family vacations to Disneyland. The amenities, location and services at the hotel always make my visit so much more stress- and care-free.  The hotel employees are always so welcoming, helpful and operate with a sense of urgency with requests. I couldn't imagine staying at any other hotel when we return to Disneyland!

Convenient, quiet, comfortable, with good-sized two-room suites and easy access to Disneyland transport or within walking distance if you so choose.  An excellent choice for the Disneyland traveller.  Also, there is a wide variety of restaurants in the area, in all price ranges.

We needed accomodations for 3 adults and 2 children.  The suite we had was perfect: two seperate rooms with plenty of space and all very clean and new and nice.  We really enjoyed everything about it.  However, we do wish they were pet friendly!

We traveled to Anaheim for a family vacation.  This hotel more than met our expectations and we definitely plan on staying there again  the next time we visit Anaheim.  The location, the staff and the hotel more than measured up to our expectations.

We stayed here for a quick trip to Anaheim.  The best was not comfortable and we woke to find a bug in our bed.  The room was ok but the walls are thin and we could hear a party down stairs at midnight.  Probably won't be back.
Manager Response: Dear SMTilly,   Thank you for your review of our hotel.   We are very sorry that you weren’t happy with your guestroom during your recent trip and that an event in the ballroom disturbed you.  I apologize for any difficulty you experienced.  We have thoroughly inspected your room and found no evidence of insects.   I hope you will consider giving us a second chance if you return to the area.   Kind Regards,   Deborah Fisher, Manager  Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I often stay in this hotel when I travel to our Anaheim office and have to say the night. Although I must say there are other comparable hotels in the area, I do love this one. Your rooms are extremely comfortable and as a traveler this is not always the case.  The staff is always very helpful and courteous.
Manager Response: Dear Carolina F,  Thanks for the nice review.  I'm very grateful for your loyalty to the hotel.    With so many nice hotels on the market these days, it's great service that ensures guests like you return to us.  Again, thank you.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Wish we had more time to enjoy this magnificent hotel
Summary: We booked at Doubletree for one night as part of our tour within L.A. Although we spent most of our time at Disneyland, we really enjoyed this hotel. We were welcomed with a nice, warm cookies which guaranteed to put a smile on my daughter's face. We booked a double room at a very competitive rate. The room was spacious with two TV sets. They have a Disney shop, and a nice breakfast buffet. A 15 minutes walking distance to Disneyland, the hotel is strategically located to make your trip even more convenient. We loved this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mgitani,  Thank you very much for the kind review!  I'm very happy you & your daughter enjoyed your recent visit to Disneyland.  I hope you can stay with us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Very handy to walk to Disneyland....
Summary: The staff very friendly, the room was excellent very spacious and it is only a 10 min walk to Disneyland ....   the price was excellent.   We ate at the restaurant one night, and that was excellent and great service...  Wouldn't  hesitate to stay there again or recommend the hotel to other travellers.
Manager Response: Dear Anzactravellers,  Thank you for the nice review!  I'm really glad you enjoyed your recent visit.  It's rare we get a compliment on the price - so, thank you!  I hope you can stay with us during your next trip from Australia.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Great room!  Clean, spacious, well decorated.  Our family of five enjoyed our stay.  We prefer hotels that have a free breakfast and free parking.  This hotel had a restaurant (a very nice one, but a bit pricey), and charged $16 dollars a day to park.  That was a downer for us, but the stay was nice all the same.
Manager Response: Dear Jessica C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I hope the suite was comfortable for your family of five.  As an FYI, we do offer some packages that include either breakfast or parking in the rate.    I hope you can visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed here for two nights on a recent trip and loved it. Have always stayed at other HHonors properties in the area but found a great rate for this one and decided to try it.  The lobby is large and very nice. We were given a room on the HHonors floor. The room was very spacious and nice. The breakfast buffet was awesome.  The parking lot is right out front and well lit.  Pool and hot tub were great and had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks from our room. Will try to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Dnrdavies,   Thank you for your kind words.  I'm so glad your enjoyed your visit.    I'm happy you made time for the breakfast buffet - we recently made some improvements to it.  Chef will be excited to hear your comments.  I hope you can stay with us again on your next trip to Disneyland.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Amazing hotel. Staff were super friendly, room was ridiculously awesome. Bell staff was great in arranging a car tour of LA. Only a 15 minute walk from Disneyland plus they had the Disneyland store to buy the tickets saving that hassle. Well worth the price, highly recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jason A,   Thank you so much for your nice review of our hotel!  I'm glad you enjoyed your visit.  I'm so happy you could use the Disney Welcome Center & our concierge services.  They both can do such much to make our guests' lives easier.  Once again, thank you.  Please join us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Greeted with warm cookies and left with more warm cookies. Great experience during stay with great staff, would come back! The more cookies the better! If this hotel provided slipper it would of made the experience way better, but it's not a big deal. Check-in and check-out speed was really fast. Parking was expensive, free would be better.
Manager Response: Dear Minqiang Y,  So glad you enjoyed your visit & the cookies.  Thank you for the suggestion about the slippers.  I hope you can visit us again soon.  More cookies await!  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I was very impressed with the hospitality of the overall staff. The room was great. The cookie was great. The staff was very close to our destination. I like the hotel and I will definitely return again.
Manager Response: Dear Kim M,  Thank you so much for the review.  I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your stay.  Please join us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This is a clean, convenient hotel with friendly service.  Upon checking in I was recognized as a Hilton Honors member.  The purpose of my visit was to visit friends in the Anaheim area and not local tourist attractions.  As with most hotels in this location, this property is family oriented and caters to Disney guests.
Manager Response: Dear LosAngelesRoadWarrior,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m glad you received friendly service during your stay.  I hope you can visit us again soon & perhaps make time for a trip to Disneyland.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: My Wife and I stayed here for two nights June 12 & 13.  This place has so many positive reasons to stay for any visit to Anaheim.  It begins with the welcome feeling you get as soon as you walk into the lobby. The lobby is bright and nicely decorated. You are greeted by the check-in representative as soon as they see you come in. Friendly, and welcoming is how I would describe my check-in process. Oh, and you get a nice warm chocolate chip cookie, which you can get each day.  Yum, Yum!  Forget the kids, get them for yourself!  We had a one bedroom suite, overlooking the pool and facing towards Disneyland. The room was very clean and had a 'good feel' to it.  We could watch the Disney fireworks from our windows. The Wi-Fi was included in the room rate which is a nice bonus, as
Manager Response: Dear Gtylor,  Wow, thank you so much for the great review!  I’m so glad your enjoyed  your visit.  I’m very pleased you tried the breakfast buffet.  Our Chef has been making improvements to it, so I will be sure to share your comments with him.  I’m also happy you could take advantage of the Kids Eat Free program – it offers families a great savings.  We’ve made friendly, professional service a part of our culture at Doubletree by Hilton.   I like your comment about the “pleasantly unpleasant” service some businesses provide – sadly, it’s all too accurate.    Gtylor, I hope you can visit us again soon! Warm cookies await.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great hotel for business or leisure!
Summary: I recently stayed at the Double Tree Suites Anaheim for a business trip. I was blown away by the stellar customer service and quality of the hotel! Upon arrival, the hotel staff gave me a warm greeting with a smile and a cookie! The room that I stayed in way a suite style, and it was extremely comfortable! The beds were very nice and the hotel all around was extremely clean. They were also very accomodating for our meetings that were held at the hotel. All around really nice experience! I hope to stay there again the next time I visit Anaheim!
Manager Response: Dear Celder01,  Thank you for the kind words.  I will be sharing your comments with our entire team.  Our cookies should always be served with a side order of smiles.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed your suites & that your meetings went well.  I hope you can stay with us again soon, for pleasure.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I stayed 2 nights for a Disneyland trip.  The hotel was very clean and pretty.  My room was clean and comfortable.  I wish they had pillows that gave any support, but otherwise, comfortable.  If you use the guest toiletries, know that the conditioner is absolute crap, but it smells good!  The shuttle stop for Disneyland was right at the end of the driveway, which was really convenient.  I only wish there was a bench there.  It's not fun to stand, waiting in the hot sun for 20 minutes, but I'm not sure if that's the hotel's responsibility or the bus company.  I think I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Amyr705,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m happy to hear your enjoyed your stay.  I am sorry that the ART shuttle stop, pillows & hair conditioner didn’t meet your needs.  We do offer down alternative pillows & I have heard that they offer more support than the down pillows.  I hope you will stay with us in the future.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed here 9 nights and was so glad we choose this hotel.It was excellent for the price.Cost $211 NZ dollars per night for 3 adults.The rooms were clean and spacious.The toilet and Bath/shower were in a seperate room from the Vanity/Basin which was great in the mornings when everyone is trying to get ready at the same time.Hotel was very quite even though our room overlooked the pool we couldn't hear a thing.Very Handy Cafe that sold Starbucks coffee was in the  lovely foyer area.Also a little gift/convenience shop and a bar was in the Foyer.Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.Beds were lovely and comfortable.The pool was very nice especially since we were there during a heatwave.Coco's and Target were a 10 minute walk in the right hand direction and Disney about a 15
Manager Response: Dear Savanahmum,  Thanks so much for the kind words!  I’m so happy you enjoyed your visit.  I’m glad you mentioned how the vanity area is separate from the bath.  The door keeps the steam from the shower out, ensuring a good hair day for all.  I’m also happy you had time for Café Biscotti – our Barista Lily makes an excellent latte.  I hope you can stay with us on your next visit from New Zealand.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Since I was here on my own, I had plenty of space. But I would still have had plenty of space if I'd been here with my family: one 'living' and one bedroom all for me! The room  was clean (and kept clean during my stay), quiet, and I slept very well. No traffic noise, good airco, and free wifi. The hotel is close (walking distance) to the Anaheim Convention Center and close to Disneyland. Hotel staff is friendly. Can't tell anything about breakfast , because I went for breakfast to Denny's accross the street and the convention center. I would certainly return here again, no doubts about that.
Manager Response: Dear Arv0,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m glad to hear you enjoyed your stay & found the hotel location convenient.  Hopefully you can try Agio Ristorante during your next visit – they offer a great breakfast buffet.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: A lovely hotel, nice dining room, very friendly staff. Rooms are spacious and updated. The Disney shuttle was very close (a small fee). Breakfast was excellent at the cafe - they also have an onsite Starbucks. We will be back.
Manager Response: Dear RealtorPam,  Thank you very much for the great review!  I'm glad your enjoyed your stay & the breakfast.  Our Chef has been working to improve it recently.  I hope we see you again soon,  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed two nights for Disney trip.  Shuttle bus pick up right beside hotel. Very clean, comfortable and nice breakfast.  Staff were very accommodating especially Erika at the front desk, who helped us out. Thank you Erika for a job well done.  Would recommend this hotel for sure, great coffee in the reception also!
Manager Response: Dear AislingSIreland,  Thank you very much for the kind words.  I'm so pleased you enjoyed your stay & the breakfast.  I will pass your compliments on to the Front Office Manager.  Please visit us again soon.  Best regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Nice clean room conveniently located to Disneyland.  Tram picks you up right outside of the hotel ($5/per person for an all-day pass - buy them at the front desk).  We've stayed here several times over the years but will give another hotel a try next time.  Nothing wrong with the hotel - just want to explore other options.  $16/night for parking.  Bartender in the lobby lounge was pretty lazy and very grumpy (one of the dwarfs, perhaps?) but most of the staff was friendly and professional.  King suite included a decent sized living room and a pretty big desk - worked out pretty well.  I connected to the wireless network (Hilton Honors) and it ridiculously slow.  I called down to the front desk and they told me to connect to attwifi, which was just fine.  I guess the Hilton
Manager Response: Dear BurgerManAZ,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m glad to hear you enjoyed your suite.    I’d like to apologize for the interaction with our bartender.  Friendly & professional service is very important to us at Doubletree by Hilton.  We will address your concerns with the team.  I’d also like to apologize for the road noise.  We rarely receive comment on road noise, so we will be checking the windows in your room.  We do hope you will give us another opportunity in the future.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Couldn't have asked for a cleaner and quieter hotel.  We stayed on the 5th flour and never heard a noise, either from the traffic or the hotel.  Each evening, when we returned to our room, we found it perfect!  No, really!!
Manager Response: Dear John H,  Thank you so much for the great review!  I'm so happy to hear your enjoyed your visit.  I'm glad to hear your room was perfect each day.  Our Housekeeping team is terrific & I will make sure they hear your comments.  I hope you can visit again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Overall the hotel in close to Disneyland.  The rate is more expensive than other hotels close by.  Because of the reputation by Hilton, I decided to stay at this hotel.  However, there is complimentary breakfast and not even offer coffee like other doubletree hotel.  Worse of all, you have to pay for additional $16 parking per night per cars.  I understand management is trying to avoid other people from parking at the hotel and charge them for it.  However, for the guest who is already paying for the hotel, the parking should be included.
Manager Response: Dear Sam T,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay during your vacation to Disneyland.   Our hotel does offer complimentary in room coffee by Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf.   We also try to ensure our parking pricing is in line with what other hotels in the area are charging.  We appreciate you sharing your thoughts with us & hope you will consider giving us another try in the future.  Kind Regards,   Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We all loved the cookies and were pleased to find out you can get them anytime not just during check in. They were yummy! All employees were extremely helpful and friendly and provided outstanding customer service. It is very convenient to Disneyland and Convention Center.
Manager Response: Dear John P,  Thank you so much for your kind review!  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay.  Please visit us again soon.  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Service, Comfortable Rooms
Summary: My experience at this property was excellent.  The service was terrific - a very friendly and accommodating staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff to the engineers to the bartenders.  Having a suite is always nice when staying somewhere for any length of time, so I enjoyed my private space while not feeling cramped.  My only issues were that two of my lamps had seen better days and that there was no make up mirror.  Otherwise, it was very enjoyable, and the location couldn't be beat!
Manager Response: Dear Lisa K,  Thank you for the kind words!  I'm so glad to hear you enjoyed our staff & our suites.  I apologize for the issues with your lamps.  I have contacted our Engineers to take care of them right away.  Again, thak you for the compliments.  I hope you will visit again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at Doubletree for 6 nights at the conclusion of our o/s holiday to the US in May.  I am SO glad we chose this fantastic hotel!  The staff were friendly, the room was lovely, and the choc chip cookie on arrival won over our 7 year olds heart from the first minute.  We used the ART shuttle to get to and from Disneyland, as well as the Outlet stores and we could have easily used it to get to Knotts Berry Farm, though we ran out of time!  The shuttle stops right across the road going to Disneyland and right out the front on the way back.  We used both the hotel restaurant and the convenient Denny's across the road for meals, and it was so handy having a fridge and a microwave in the room.  If you are a family and you like a bit of space after the kids are in bed, the one
Manager Response: Dear Bec A,  Thanks for the great review!  It makes me so happy to hear your family enjoyed their stay with us.  I was pleased to see you made use of the ART shuttle, fridge & microwave.   I hope you will join us again the next time you are in town.  Best Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed for one week for a family vacation to Disney! Excellent hotel, great service, clean and fresh! Can't say one thing bad about this hotel....Love love love it! Warm cookies are awesome! Great staff, very good buffet breakfast and excellent suppers in hotel restaurant. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Daer Colleen P,  Thank you very much for the nice review & compliments.  Glad to hear you enjoyed  Agio Ristorante, too.  Please join us again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Poor resolution to an issue with booking
Summary: Just to make insure all your hotels were suites I called the hotel phone directly to book the reservation.  I requested to book two suites and was told there were suites, one for 1 night and the other for 3 nights.  Once I checked into the room I went down stairs explain I booked suites and was given a regular room.  Instead of the front desk taking responsibility for the issue I was told I didn't actually speak to someone at the hotel to book the room even though I called the physical phone number of the hotel and followed the telephone prompts for the reservation desk.  I was told they would call me if a suite became available and never received a call even though I noticed suites being cleaned out each day.  I followed up on the availability of suite at least twice and was
Manager Response: Brian,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are very sorry that you weren’t happy with your guestroom during your recent trip and that we weren’t able to secure a suite for you. We try to accommodate all reservations but occasionally we can’t meet every room request.   I hope you will consider giving us a second chance if you return to the area.  Kind Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel but no shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a suite. The hotel and staff were amazing. The cookies were fantastic and the staff was amazing to supply my kids with cookies each time we entered the hotel. My only complaint is: no shuttle to Disneyland which is about 1 mile away. Be prepared to walk, we thought it wouldn't be a big deal (we exercise a lot), but it turned out to be with 3 kids. Also parking was $22 a night. I wouldn't mind the $22 if they had a shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel and rooms were always clean and quiet. Staff are very friendly. Great place to stay if you don't mind walking or there for a convention (convention center was close by). We go to Disneyland every year and this would be our "go to" hotel if it had a shuttle. No shuttle is a deal breaker and we will have to get a hotel closer
Manager Response: Dear Benjamin C,  Thank you so much for the compliments about the hotel & staff.  I'm glad your family had a good visit & enjoyed our famous cookies.  While the Disneyland Resort is close by, it can be a long walk after a full day in the parks.  I must admit I’m disappointed that you didn’t hear about the Anaheim Resort Transit system during your stay.  The ART is a shuttle system for Disneyland & the greater Anaheim Resort area.  The ART service typically begins one hour prior to the opening of the Disneyland Resort & picks up approximately every 20 minutes. The ART stop is located at the end of the hotel's driveway, facing Harbor Blvd.  Guests can purchase passes at our hotel's front desk.  Adults aged 10 & up are $5 round trip.  Kids aged 3-9 are $3 round trip.  The ART is a great service & I apologize you weren’t informed about it during your visit.  I’d also like to clarify that overnight parking is $16 per car, per night.  I was concerned when I saw the $22 price you mentioned but when I checked your receipt, I saw that you were charged the correct amount.  Benjamin, I hope you consider staying with us in future.  I think the ART shuttle might be the missing piece to a great stay for you & your family.  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: Loved, loved the hotel, staff, room and breakfast.  Only negative we encountered was that we were not able to use the pool and Jacuzzi because of the amount of guests using them as though they were in their own backyard.  Several guests were fully dressed in the water or would go into the water wrapped in Hotel towels.  It was quite awful.  My daughters were appalled as we looked from our hotel window.
Manager Response: Aimee,  Thank you for the kind words.  I'm very glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  I apologize for your experience with the pool area.  Memorial Day weekend is probably our busiest weekend for the pool & Jacuzzi.  After reading your comments, I went out & checked the signage at the pool.  While there is a maximum occupancy & many safety advisories posted, there is no requirement for swimwear to be used.  This is something we will definitely look into further.  I hope you will visit us again soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Walk time to Disneyland is about 10-15min. Sometimes easier to walk than wait for ART buses. Our suite was great. Big, clean, comfortable, the way to go. We were on the 5th floor just behind the elevators and we never heard them. Laundry was just down the passage way. $1.25 for machines, $1.50 for dryer and $1.00 per packet of powder. The cycles are roughly 30min each, 2 dryers and washing machines. The Hotel is beautiful, clean and big. We had the buffet breakfast each day and it was great. So many choices a definite if you can. Denny's is on one corner, Carls Jnr is a 3min walk away, very cheap but great. Target is a 10min walk away. We would definitely go there again. Oh, the hot chocolate chip cookies are awesome and endless :))
Manager Response: Dear Soni M,  Thank you very much for the great review!  I’m so happy to hear you enjoyed your suite & the breakfast buffet.  I’m also glad you mentioned the laundry - it represents be a big savings & convenience for families.  I hope you & your family will join us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher Convention Services Manager, CTA

Summary: My husband and 2 daughters just returned from a 4 night trip to Disneyland and we were very impressed with the service and quality of the Doubletree.  We arrived early and were able to check in right away which was great.  The Disneyland Welcome Centre is right in the lobby so we were able to buy our tickets without any line ups and they were very helpful. The prices are the same but no hassles.  There is also a Starbucks in the lobby that sells mini cereals for a quick breakfast.  I loved this convenience as the line ups at the Starbucks in the park are crazy so grabbing my morning coffee on route to the park was very handy.  The room was great, very clean, the beds and pillows were super comfy and the guest services folks were very helpful and friendly.  The hotel is about a

Very great hotel and staff.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The suite setup allowed our child to sleep after a long day at Disneyland while we stayed up.  Will stay here again on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear Robert B,  Thanks for the kind words.  I'm very pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  I hope you will visit again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Love this hotel! The proximity to Disneyland is awesome, 10 min walk. The staff are friendly, the rooms are clean & the lobby is beautiful. They offer a food court with great deals on salads and then of course there is a starbucks where we would grab oatmeal for breakfast and a coffee. The line ups can be long but they offer a 'coffee' only spot, so that make it very convenient. This is our 2nd visit to the Hilton and we would definitely stay again.  If you don't want to pay extra for the rooms with the Disney fireworks view, you can sit in the 'meeting room' on the top floor and enjoy the fireworks from there!  We were also pleasantly surprised with the prices of food around the pool area, very reasonable, large portions and yummy! The kids portions were huge and my son ate

Hotel is nice and very close to Disneyland/ The staff is wonderful and very helpful. The morning buffet with the new omelet making feature was great. The gift shop I would avoid. Prices marked were not what she wanted to charge and said that they were marked wrong. Restaurants were close as well as shopping choices. Room was very clean they provided lots of towels.
Manager Response: Dear Deborah M,  Thank you very much for the kind words about the hotel, staff & breakfast buffet.  We recently added the omelet feature & I am glad to see it nice impression.  I'd like to apologize about your experience in the gift shop.  We will discuss the pricing issue you mentioned with the owner.  Deborah, thanks once again.  Please visit us again soon.  Best Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The Hilton brand hotels never seem to dissapoint me. The doubletree here was a great stay. the rooms were nice and large. Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland. Also we had gotten breakfast which was great. This is a great spot to come to.

My sister, nephew and I only stayed for one night before visiting Disneyland. The front desk staff was friend as was the Guest Services attendant. Our room was comfortable and clean. The pool is small, but we enjoyed our short time swimming. We did not try the restaurant, bistro or gift shop on site. We did speak with the Disney Welcome Center staff and he was very friendly with great recommendations for our day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Amy K,  Thanks so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your stay & that you took advantage of the Disney Welcome Center on site.  It's run by Disney & their employees have great insider tips for the parks.  I hope you can join us again in the future to take advantage of the Kids Eat Free Program in our restaurant.  It's a great savings.  Thanks again.  Best Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We were excited to be staying close to Disneyland for a surprise birthday for our children. We had been up for 12 hours and went to check in (4:20pm) and our room was not ready. We were told it would be an hour until it was going to be ready since they were overbooked. Finally they rearranged our room and got us in. We got the kids down for a nap and went to get a drink downstairs in the bar with the grandparents and the 2 beers we asked for were sold out and then we were charged $18 instead of the $12 it should have been for a Stella and Pale Ale. Not impressed and not staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Alyssa J,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel.  Please accept my apologies for your delayed check in.  Unfortunately, the hotel had a number of late check outs and was sold out the day you arrived, resulting in the delay.    In addition, I'd like to apologize for the error on your bar check.  It is my understanding the error was corrected that evening.  Alyssa, we are sorry your stay with us was a disappointment.  I hope you'll consider giving us another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Best Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great property, great location, and great staff
Summary: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure, and it was the right decision from the get go.  The hotel is about a mile away from the parks...a leisurely walk, or you can catch a shuttle right out the front door.  The room was spacious and clean.  The dining room was great with an Italian focus.  The bar was fun.  And, all of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay here on our next visit.
Manager Response: Dear 331PeterS331,  Thank you very much for the nice review!  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed our suites, bar & restaurant.  I hope you will join us again the next time you are in town.  Best Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: THE FOOD is very good, NICE Restaurant also. ALL THE STAFF is really friendly, even the maintenance man that had to show me how the TV was unplugged at the back of the TV. THE MATTRESS was unimpressive BUT I have a bad back & hip currently.
Manager Response: Dear Anne T,  Thank you so much for the kind words.  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed the hotel & Agio Ristorante.    I'm sorry you had to contact maintenance but I'm glad he was a pleasure.  The maintenance & engineering team are the hotel's unsung heroes - they do an excellent job ensuring things run smoothly for everyone.  I hope your back & hip start feeling better in time for your next visit.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The staff was very friendly from the time I arrived until I left. The rooms were clean and quite. The hotel is at a great location for my business as well as entertainment.  I got to spend time at the pool, which was very clean and nice.
Manager Response: Dear Sharon W,  Thanks so much for reviewing the hotel.  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed your visit.    Our second floor pool is a nice little oasis - especially after that recent heat wave.  Glad to hear you had time to take a dip.  Please join us again soon!  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Everthing we expected from the Double Tree.
Summary: my wife and I scheduled a brief stay in Anaheim to go to Disney with my son and his family. The hotel had a great location and all the comforts we want when staying away from home. We will stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Kent M,  Thank you very much for your kind review.  We hope you will visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Hotel was great, staff not quite so much
Summary: I was disappointed to find out that I was not going to be receiving HHonors points for my two-night stay, because I had made the reservation through Hotels.com. The Front Desk Clerk was really in my face about it too, so it made me feel like a second-class citizen for the duration of the stay, even though I am an HHonors member.

Staff very pleasant, friendly and professional. Hotel was quiet and clean. Rooms were beautifully decorated. Sofa bed mattress was lumpy and uncomfortable and I wouldn't sleep on one again if I can help it. Did NOT like the $16/day parking but location of hotel is just steps from shuttle to Disneyland. Hotel's restaurant had good enough food (I'm picky) and worked perfectly for our whole family. I would stay here again if going to Disneyland but maybe find parking on the streets.
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Dreadhead,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm glad to hear you enjoyed many aspects of your stay.  I'm surprised to hear the sofa bed mattress was not to your liking.  We completed a hotel renovation in fall of 2013 & every room received a new sofabed.  I apologize for your discomfort.  We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We recently stayed five nights at the Hilton Doubletree and had a very positive experience. We had a two room apartment - the bedroom had two queen beds and the living area had a sofa bed which suited our family of four perfectly. The beds were very comfortable and it was great to have a living area. We didn't have a kitchen but did have a microwave and a small fridge which was handy. The whole place was very clean and also the hotel was very quiet. If you are on the right side you can also see the fireworks from Disneyland - so make sure you request this when booking!  The breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant was fantastic and kids eat free with their parents which makes it great value. We ate dinner there a couple of times as well and it was very nice. The location of the
Manager Response: Dear Kirsty G,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m really glad your enjoyed your stay.  I appreciate you mentioning our Sweet Dreams beds – they really are heavenly.  I’m so pleased you could take advantage of the Kids Eat Promo as well.  I hope you will visit us again in the future.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great for business travelers & vacationers alike!
Summary: This hotel is very classy looking, super-clean, has a fabulous restaurant & is nice and quiet for working in the room. It is very close to Disney and across the street from Chris Ruth Steakhouse--great place to walk to for dinner if you have some cash to burn through!

We stayed at this hotel only one night. We stayed there to visit Disneyland: it was the perfect choice. We were without a car and we manage to get Disney by walk: only 20 minutes walking  between flowers and gardenia ´s parfum.   Breakfast was excellent with many delicious fruits.  The two room suite with two queen beds was comfortable and  the room has a microwave and facilities to prepare coffee or tea. Gym is small with only three machines but after Disney there is no much need of it. There is a cafeteria in the hotel and Concierge is really helpful.
Manager Response: Dear AndreaF_11,  Thank you so much for your kind words.    I’m happy to hear you enjoyed the walk to Disneyland.  The resort area is quite lovely in the spring.  I’m also glad to see you enjoyed your suite & its amenities.  After a good night’s sleep & a delicious breakfast, you can conquer almost anything – even Disneyland!  I hope you can visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Our family of four had booked a suite at the Doubletree for our Disney vacation. We got exactly what we wanted a nice, clean and comfortable place to rest after long days at Disney. The hotel staff was able to accommodate our requests regarding early check in and getting a room on the fireworks side.  This maybe due to the off season but it was appreciated regardless. Even if early check in is not possible the concierge desk will keep luggage for those that arrive early and want to go and check out Downtown Disney. I have seen some reviews complain about the distance to the parks and have to disagree. We walked to Disney every day.  The distance may be an issue for smaller children so for them I would recommend a stroller. We used our double stroller for our 3 and 6 year old to
Manager Response: Dear Martin M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m very happy to hear you enjoyed your suite and the service provided by our concierge.  I find the morning walk to Disneyland to be quite pleasant but the walk back to the hotel after a long day at the park might be too much for some.    I’m also glad to hear you were able to take advantage of the Kids Eat Fee Program in Agio Ristorante – it’s a big savings for families.  Martin, thank you again for the kind words.  I hope we see you again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Very nice hotel with excellent service, the breakfast buffet was one of the best buffet I have ever had with many special items on the menu . Service in the restaurant was very good . All the staff was very helpful and friendly chicken wings in the bar were good and very hot and spicy all in all very good hotel for a quick stay
Manager Response: Dear Pete S,  Thank you so much for the compliments!  I will be sharing your comments about the breakfast buffet & chicken wings with Chef Rafael.  I know he will be excited for the feedback on his food.  I’m really glad you enjoyed our staff & service.  I hope you can visit us again for a longer stay.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Had a four night stay, room was exellent, staff is exellent. all my needs were taken care of and the staff is awesome, from the front desk to the cleaning staff. I will stay here again without question.
Manager Response: Dear Tim M,  Thank you very much for the great review.  I will share your kind words with the entire team.  I’m so glad you mentioned our cleaning staff – they are the unsung heroes of our hotel team.    I hope your conference was a success.  See you in 2015.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Doubletree Anaheim - perfect for a Disney Vacation
Summary: My family (me, my wife & our 7-yr old daughter) stayed at Doubletree Anaheim from May 01-05, 2014. We found the stay totally relaxing & enjoyable. I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are planning a Disneyland vacation.   Our stay was off to a good start via a warm wecome by Maria (a gracious Filipina at the front desk) as well as a bunch of warm chocolate chip cookies. We stayed in a 2-room suite with 2 queen beds - more than ample space over-all for a family of 3. Aileen (the morning manager) was also kind enough to give us a late check-out on our last day in spite of many new guests checking in.  The daily breakfast choices were always sumptuous and offered variety. It was a big plus that the ART bus stopped right in front of the hotel as it was scorching hot on
Manager Response: Dear CHerokeePH,  Thanks so much for the nice review of your recent stay.  I’m very happy to hear your stay was so enjoyable.  Thank you for complimenting the Front Desk team’s service.  We at Doubletree by Hilton call this “owning the welcome” & I am glad to hear Maria did just that.    Chef Rafael is always working toward improving our breakfast options.  He even goes so far as to offer gluten free & vegan options.  I know he will appreciate your comments.  I hope you can stay with us again when you return to Anaheim.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The hotel was nice the front desk was very helpful. Although I did not know that it was literally around the corner from Disney Land so considering I got there on a Saturday it was pretty noisy.  I was in my room and I was about to get in the bed and a palmetto bug ran out of the bathroom! That was NO bueno! I quickly got dressed and went to demand a new room. Uhhh the place was packed and they could only give me a room across the hall from the other room, again no bueno! I was not happy about that at all however he told me the entire hotel was packed. It was already 1 in the morning and I had just flown in and being that I am from the east coast I was too exhausted to argue or demand anything else. They moved me to a new room and told me that I could come back in the morning to
Manager Response: Dear Ernia E,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We apologize that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of your guest room and the service from our staff. We try to emphasize these areas to our staff because we know how important they are to our guests.   We hope that if your travels bring you back to the area you’ll consider staying with us again.   Kind Regards,   Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Two thumbs up from this girl
Summary: I stayed at this property for 4 nights in April 2014 as part of a business conference. I had a suite, which allowed me loads of space to stretch out and relax. It was nice having a television in each room.  The free Wifi and desk were fantastic for business travellers. The rooms were new and in great condition. Towels, bedding, etc don't show any signs of wear.  I had a room that overlooked the pool, and worried about noise at first, but the windows are thick enough to block any sound, and don't open. A/C functioned well.    I liked the little coffee bar, bar, and restaurant on site. Tried each one once. Service wasn't too quick in the coffee bar but they were hit with a rush of school kids when I was there, so I cut them some slack.  It was my first time staying at a Doubletree
Manager Response: Dear DiscerningDweller,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed our accommodations & dining.  I agree that the suites are an asset to business travelers.  Being able to close off the work area from the bedroom allows for a more restful sleep, in my opinion.  Out of sight, out of mind.  I hope you can visit us again soon - on vacation.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center.

Summary: We stayed for 6 nights four adults and 3 kids (7,8,9) in April - We walked to Disney every morning , caught shuttle back (US$3/1) Recommend the breakfasts as they were great. Close to lots of reasonably priced restaurants - We were on Level 7 which was very quiet -  great beds. Close enough to Disney but not too close for the busyness or expense of a Disney hotel - very helpful staff would definitely recommend
Manager Response: Dear Wendles4,  Thank you for your nice review.  So happy to hear you enjoyed your visit.  Our Sweet Dreams beds really are amazing.  I will share your comments about breakfast with Chef Rafael.  He works hard to keep it interesting & inviting.  We’d love to have you back soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager

Summary: We traveled to Disneyland with our Grand Daughter and her 3 small children,  Went to dinner the first night and all the children ate for $2 each ,if we had a dinner. Nice to be able to save money on kids meals.  Thanks

We stayed here mid April for a week, travelled with a group.   We enjoyed our stay.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.   The service was excellent. It was nice to have a separate TV room and we didn't find the rooms noisy though we were facing a busy street.  The restaurant was very good, we ate there for breakfast, lunch and dinner.   I would definitely stay here again.  Though next time if we are with a large group again, we would take a taxi to Disney instead of the shuttle, if we didn't want to walk,  that would save time and money.
Manager Response: Dear Pocahontas_AA,  Thank you very much for your kind words.    I’m so happy to hear you enjoyed your suite & our restaurant, Agio.  I hope you were able to take advantage of our Kids Eat Free program, it’s a great savings for families.  I agree that a cab can offer a direct route to Disneyland & still offer a savings for large parties when compared to the ART Shuttle.  Please join us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our trip to Disneyland
Summary: Our room was spacious, clean and our beds were very comfortable.  Check-in was simple and fast  everyone we interacted with were friendly and professional.  This is clearly a well run hotel in a great location for visiting Disneyland.     The location to Disneyland is an easy walk but we used a tip we had learned from another guest for our return from the park to the hotel.  Tired legs after 12 hours in the park did not feel like walking the mile back to the hotel.  We grabbed a cab where we had entered the park off of Harbor.  The ride cost $7 for the three of us and with tip we paid $10.  A much better alternative then taking the ART bus as we saved about $20 and got gate to door service.
Manager Response: Dear BluesRamsRock,  Thank you very much for your kind review.  I will share your compliments with our entire team.  Your tip about taking a cab to Disneyland is an excellent one!  For larger parties, the cost of a cab directly to the park is sometimes less than the ART Shuttle.  Again, thank you for the kind words.  I hope you will stay with us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Trip to Anaheim Championship Cheer Showcase
Summary: The Hotel was great as usual. The room was nice and in a perfect location. We stayed on the second floor and the access to and from the room was just great. The hotel was close to the convention center and there was a lot of dining in the area. Our family also enjoyed a few days with Mickey as well attending the Cheer Competition. What a nice trip.

Summary Heading: Good location, but not family friendly
Summary: We recently stayed here for our trip to Disneyland.  My husband for years has been staying at Hilton hotels every month for business travel, so we used his Hilton Honors points for a family vacation to Disneyland.  The hotel was a great location, but if you have kids that still take naps and want your room cleaned before coming back in the late afternoon, forget about it.  Every day we would come back around 3:00 and our room still hadn't been cleaned.  I called down on day 2 and was told they have until 4:30 to do this.  I was told someone could come by around that time.  Around 3:30 housekeeping came by and asked if they could clean & when I mentioned I was told they could come by at 4:30, she said 4:00 would be better for her or I could go without her cleaning it.  Needless
Manager Response: Dear Jenn,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay during your family vacation to Disneyland.   We’re very sorry you experienced an undesirable interaction with our housekeeping staff. The problems you mentioned have been addressed and we will do a better job of creating a family friendly environment for future guests.   We appreciate you alerting us to the issue you had and we hope you will give us a second chance if you return to the area.   Kind Regards,   Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The hotel was within a mile of Disneyland and you could walk or take the ART bus which drops you off near the front gates.  The room was nice and we liked how it was split into 2 different rooms.  Our kids could sleep in the bedroom while we watched TV and had a drink in the living room area.  The restaurant (Agio) also had a kids eat free option as well which helped to save some money.  Overall, our family had a nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear SVLSVL,  Thanks so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m so happy to hear your family had a nice stay with us.  I think the suite layout is a great peace keeper for families.  I am also pleased to hear you took advantage of the Kids Eat Free promotion in Agio Ristorante – it’s a great savings for families.  SVLSVL, I hope you & your family will visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher,  Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Would never stay at this hotel chain again.
Summary: Room was not clean, front staff were not friendly, and their response to complaints were that this hotel is not a 5 star hotel, only 3.5 stars so our expectations didn't need to be met.  Restaurant is horrible, do not eat there, unless it's only breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Parsha,   Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us. We are very sorry that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of your guest room and the service from our staff. We try to emphasize these areas to our staff because we know how important they are to our guests.   We apologize that you were disappointed in our dining experience and based upon your review we are actively working with our team members so this kind of interaction doesn’t happen again.   We hope that if your travels bring you back to the area you’ll consider staying with us again.   Kind Regards, Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The staff at this hotel are extremely helpful and kind.  We had only a few requests, but they were all answered with, "of course," and were taken care of within minutes.  The location and proximity to Disneyland was perfect and the pool was a wonderful respite.

The room was awesome. It was very clean and roomy. It allowed my family the opportunity to enjoy one room and others to enjoy the bedroom. The pool was nice. The people were very helpful. The coffee shop was nice to be able to get a coffee and go sit by the pool. The exercise room was a little small.
Manager Response: Dear Diana W,  Thanks so much for the review.  I am happy to hear the suite configuration worked well for your family.  It’s kind of nice to set the kids up in the sofa bed & then give the parents a chance to rest undisturbed in the bedroom.  I am a big fan of Café Biscotti, too – our Barista Lily make the best Lattes around.  The pool area is also great for viewing the nightly Disneyland fireworks.    Diana, thanks again.  I hope you can stay with us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager, CTA  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This was a superb hotel for our family of 14 to stay in during our trip to Disney and California Adventure.  Accommodations were outstanding and the staff exceptional. Couldn't ask for more.  Would seek out other  DoubleTree Hotels for future vacations.
Manager Response: Dear Janice R,  Thank you very much for the great review. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed the suites & staff.  I will be sharing your comments with the team.  I think you deserve a pat on the back for putting together a successful trip with 14 members of your family.  Wow!  I hope you'll visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager, CTA  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We had an enjoyable stay at Doubletree. The staff were great,concierge was helpful The rooms were comfortable and clean, and amenities good. The welcome cookies were good, although my children didn't think they were fantastic. I think because they had nuts in them.  i think there could've been more tea/coffee since there were 4 adults in our room.
Manager Response: Dear PerthBella_10,  Thank you for your review.  I’m pleased to hear you enjoyed both the staff & accommodations.  Through the hotel’s CAREline, we are happy to provide guests with extra tea, coffee, linens or toiletries - almost anything.  Doubletree by Hilton likes to say about our hotels, “Where the little things mean everything.”  I hope you & your family will join us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I had done a lot of research on the various hotels around Disneyland as I was traveling with family that had never been.  I wanted their stay to be fantastic! I couldn't have been happier with my choice to stay at the Doubletree.  The rooms are comfy, very clean and the beds are a dream!  I had emailed prior asking if they had a fan to use in my room because I am used to sleeping with white noise.  They didn't, but the manager, Deborah Fisher, offered to let me use the one in her office.  I ended up bringing my own white noise machine but was touched when they asked at check-in if I still needed the fan!  Great customer service.  We had the hot breakfast buffet every morning ($14) and thought it was a great value.  Fresh squeezed orange juice... mmmm...  Went to the parks in the

The hotel and property was very nice. Good service.  The major problem - major - is the lack of fitness amenities. I am a traveler who chooses location based on this feature. Your location at City Drive offers LA Fitness passes so I routinely choose that location. The building has only 3 treadmills and I was not able to get a workout in at any point during one of 4 attempts. Overall good building, you need to address the lack of fitness though.

Summary Heading: Our stay at The Double Tree in Anaheim
Summary: I love staying here.  The staff is friendly and professional.  The facilities are clean and fresh looking.  The beds are sooo comfortable, and the cookies are yummy!  Check in was quick and easy, the food was good and the service was great.  The hostess called our room to tell us when our to go order was ready so we did not have to wait in the lobby.

I've stayed at many Doubletrees in my years and found the Anaheim Suites to match the quality I've come to expect. Room cleanliness was great, room clean up was excellent, cookies provided with a smile every time we asked and easy parking arrangements plus a stop right outside for the ART made it an excellent find.  I do have some constructive criticism however as we arrived on a Sunday to find the hotel nearly over run by tween and teen gymnasts with no adult supervision specifically in the pool area.  This isn't the hotels fault that parents aren't monitoring their children but the pool area was packed by girls throwing other girls around in and out of the pool, being loud and essentially causing my 6 year old daughter to be uncomfortable swimming. The hot tub had a stated
Manager Response: Dear Ooter77,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m pleased to hear you enjoyed your suite...& our delicious cookies.  I agree that our Housekeeping team does a great job keeping the suites in tip top condition.  Your feedback regarding the cheerleaders’ use of the hotel facilities is quite helpful & I will be sure to pass along your suggestions to our operations team for future use.  I’m also glad to hear the concierge team was friendly & pleasant.  It’s very important to us that every guest is greeted & welcomed to the hotel.  Again, thanks for your kind review.  I hope you & your family will visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Always a wonderful stay at the DoubleTree Anaheim, CA. The staff is wonderful, especially Martine at the front desk was very warm and welcoming. Very short walk to the Disneyland tram. The amenities and pool are great! If you arrange for a guest room sofa bed be sure to try it when you get there ours was awful.
Manager Response: Dear Anthony T,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review! I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your visit.  I agree with your comment about Martine at the Front Desk, she is very warm & friendly. She speaks three languages ensuring everyone feels welcome, no matter where they are from.  We recently replaced all of the hotel sofabeds as a part of our recent renovation so I am surprised to hear it was uncomfortable.  I apologize for any discomfort.  Anthony, thanks again for the nice words. I hope you will visit again soon.  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Pleasant Surprise for a Convention Hotel
Summary: Based on Trip Advisor recommendations, I choose the Doubletree Suites to attend a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I'm glad I followed the advice--from arrival to departure, the experience could not have been better.  Check-in was friendly and efficient (loved the warm chocolate chip cookie!) and the room was extremely clean and fresh,   Bed was very comfortable, television offerings were to my liking, and the wi-fi was easy to log into and reliably fast.  As other reviewers have noted, the location is ideal for conference goers with a pleasant 7 minute walk to the convention center.  Because we hadn't thought to make reservations for dinner at a restaurant elsewhere, we did have dinner at the hotel restaurant one night, and it was far above the meals in most hotel
Manager Response: Dear BostonBabe,  Thanks for the nice review!  I'll be sure to share your feedback with the team.    I'm really happy to hear your check in went well - it really sets the tone for your entire experience at the hotel.  I'm so pleased you enjoyed dining in Agio Ristorante.  We strive to make everyone feel comfortable & to provide excellent food.  My favorite dish is the Truffle Mac & Cheese.  Again, thank you for the review.  I hope we'll see you again soon.   Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: It Doesnt Get Better Than This Doubletree
Summary: Seriously, if you have the opportunity to stay at this location DO IT!!! Don't hesitate...The pool/Jacuzzi was perfectly neat and tidy as well as inviting. The restaurant bar was AWESOME and reasonably priced....

Outstanding facility - well managed, clean, friendly staff, and close to key meeting and vacation venues. I recommend that you consider the Hotel for your next business and pleasure activity. It is rare for a facility in a well known tourist area to be so well run.

I really enjoyed my stay at the DoubleTree in Anaheim. From the warm cookie upon arrival to the wonderful space and amenities, and Wifi, and room service. It was an unexpected delight! I only had a little trouble sleeping because of the time change, not the room quality. It was excellent.

I spent six nights at this hotel for a conference, and have no complaints at all. The room was very comfortable and clean. The location was great for either the Anaheim Convention Center or Disney Land. The neighborhood is quiet, the restaurant in the hotel has very good food, and the staff are friendly.
Manager Response: Dear sgi10,  Thank you so much for the kind words!  We hope you will visit again soon.  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Just what we wanted: clean, new rooms; a super friendly and accommodating staff; great breakfast and easy access to the park.   Some specifics:  - We were given an early check-in.   - There is a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes  - Our room was large and comfortable for our family of 4  - The lobby and restaurant makes you feel good about checking in.
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey,  Thank you so much for the great review!  I'm so glad you had time to dine in Agio Ristorante.  I hope you were able to use our Kids Eat Free Program.  It's a great savings for families.  We hope you will stay with us again when you return to the Anaheim area.  Warm Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at the DoubleTree for our family vacation to Disneyland, as they had the best reviews for hotels in the area that had family suites. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the service was okay.  Next time I will definitely stay closer to the park. At the end of a really long day, it is a very long and painful walk back to this hotel. Also, when we were checking out, they were tearing the carpet up in the hallway and elevator lobby. Several buckets in the middle of the floor that you had to try to step around.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel near Disney and Convention Center
Summary: I was traveling on business, and booked this hotel as an "overflow" hotel for a convention I was attending. It wasn't the closest to the Convention Center or Disney, but the staff and the hotel itself more than made up for the extra block walk. The room I had was HUGE! Two queen beds in one room, sofa-sleeper couch and two chairs in the living room, and a two room bathroom. Everything was clean and fresh, and of course the wonderful cookie on checkin.
Manager Response: Dear Jclark12020,  Thanks so much for the nice review!  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed our service & our suites.  It’s nice to be able to work or relax without having to use your bed as your center of operations.  I hope you will have a chance to visit us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: As a diamond member I perhaps expect a bit more.   No upgrade, I literally got the smallest room on the floor per the floor plan, 713.    On the last night of my stay my room didn't even get serviced.    On each of the other nights it wasn't until about 3:30 that it was cleaned.   All the reviews were good, thought it might be a bit better.

The suites with 2 rooms are really great for a family of four. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are in great shape. The only downside for some would be that Disneyland is about a 3/4 mile walk. Outdoor parking is available for $20 a day extra.

I booked a 3 night stay at your DoubleTree hotel in Anaheim for my daughter and son-in-law's honeymoon.  However, after checking out on the 1st of April, I found out that not only did the lady who booked my reservation lie to me on the phone but your staff at the check-in area in the lobby lied to my son-in-law after he gave his debit card (as requested and required at check in) incase they purchased anything in their room or at the hotel.  I was told that nothing would be charged to his debit card at all unless my daughter or her husband bought something but his card was charged $172 for nothing!  I called Helen in accounting, as did my son-in-law on the same day they checked out and she told me that the hotel did not charge his card, when in fact her accounting department did

For few years in the past this was my favorite place every time I was coming in Anaheim for business , professional staff and friendly at the same time they make me feel like home evrey time thank you very much . I  personally recommend this hotel to anyone ciao

Stayed here for a couple of nights while crusing DisneyLand. The first night was a suite and very nice. King Bed and a pullout in the other room. enough room for 4 people. small coffee maker and fridge for convenience. Bathroom was a bit small, but we managed. The breakfast was great in the Dining room as part of our Diamond Membership. The second Night we switched rooms because the Hotel was full for start of Spring Break and the Cheerleaders convention. We went to two queens and the room was fine for Points stay. Of course the hot breakfast was a great starter. Overall great stay and Hotel. Did not do much in the hotel as we were there for Disneyland. this hotel is in close walking distance to Disney and you can catch the Art Trolleys just out across the street for those who

This is a wonderful place to stay if you're visiting Southern California. The hotel is beautiful, clean and pleasant. The staff is warm, cheerful and helpful. We thought the welcome warm chocolate chip cookies were not necessary but appreciated the personal touch. Free wi-fi was definitely a thumbs up for us. Our room also had a microwave. We've stayed at over 20 different hotels around Disneyland, and not all of them provide microwaves. That comes in handy if you have small children. The only draw back was the tiny workout room with only 2 treadmills and an elliptical. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

We stayed at the Doubletree to enjoy Disneyland for a couple of days.  My impression was that the shuttle is free--beware, it is not.  You still have to pay per person for transportation--even though you have to pay a parking fee of $16 a day (if you park your car at the hotel).  I don't understand the logic in that--seems like we are paying twice for the same thing.  The walk is not bad--but it is a mile--you need a stroller for the little ones.  Also, the TV channels are limited --no Disney Jr. or Nick Jr. for younger kids.  Again, I don't understand that as this is a hotel that caters to families.  The coffee shop does allow kids to eat free but of course they make up for it in other ways--food was just ok for the price.  Pool is warm but nothing spectacular.  Room was very

After a tiring and rainy day of Disneyland, this hotel made our night better.  Very close to Disneyland. Lots of choices for food nearby. Very spacious rooms and comfortable beds. Clean.  Awesome warm chocolate walnut cookies upon arrival! So good! Should have came with milk.

We stayed at the Doubletree suites for 4 nights as part of a 3 week USA holiday. After landing in LA after a long flight the Doubletree was a lovely respite and the staff could not have been more welcoming. The suite itself whilst a little small overall, perfectly suited us as a family of four although a little kitchen would have made it perfect. The two double beds in the bedroom were very comfortable and the thick curtains allowed a nap upon arrival which was heavenly. The bathroom was simple and clean and the vanity being located outside the bathroom worked well for quick preparations to leave each day.  The living area was small but well designed and the sofa bed quite comfortable. The pool was refreshing and the breakfast at the restaurant very nice.  The hotel is quite a

My daughter and I stayed here for 3-nights and it was a nice hotel.  The staff was friendly and the rooms were large, and clean. The shuttle to Disneyland was right out in front of hotel, and I liked that my car was in a secured parking area only for hotel guests.  Will plan on staying here in the future.

1. Booked a 2 queen bed room and they put the four of us in a 1 queen room. 2. Hidden daily fees for rollaway beds AND parking. An extra $150 for the week. 3. They never moved us to another room and sleeping on the rollaways was horrendous. 4. We unfortunately were here while a cheerleading competition was going on and we didn't sleep 4 nights in a row despite our calling the front desk about the noise (running down hallways banging walls and screaming)  5. Splatter on the ceiling looks very much like blood and or heroin. Needless to say, we received a HoJos experience at a hilton price.

Had to wait until 3:00 and not a minute before to check in.  Had a 2 room suite. Privacy with two rooms and two TV's was nice. The bathroom could have been a little fancier for the price. I guess I'm just spoiled to a separate tub and shower. The furnishings and linens were nice. We would consider staying there again.  We stayed there for the proximity to the Anaheim. Convention Center. I would likely stay there again.

This was our second stay at this location while visiting Disney. We love everything about this hotel, most of all, the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness.  We have two toddlers, and this is definitely a hotel where I let them run around barefoot because I know, housekeeping doesn't miss a beat.  We loved having breakfast every morning at the restaurant downstairs, the concierge service that called for cabs in a heartbeat, and the shuttle service to Disneyland.  We would stay here again, and again!!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney Park, big room, helpful staff.
Summary: There was six of us staying in one room, and it was perfect for us as the only time we spent there was to sleep. Super clean, had a nice little restaurant downstairs, as well as a Disney center based on helping you with your Disneyland tickets and planning. The people at the front desk were also really helpful with finding us an LA tour that fit what we wanted to do. Another benefit was that it was only a 15 minute walk to Target and a bunch of other stores and a 10 minute walk from the Disney parks, which of course is incredibly convenient. Would definitely stay again!

I dont understand how anyone can give this place a bad review. Staff is super friendly. It is very clean. Rooms are modern and spotless. This place is very kid friendly. The only issue I had was the bartender drinking on the job. As a business owner myself thats lost profit and a law suit waiting to happen.

The room was nice in size and provided sleeping arraignments for everyone in our party. However, the air conditioning was not working. The room was stuffy upon arrival. I phone the care line and asked for someone to take a look at it. No one showed up to check it. Was very difficult sleeping in a warm room. Very disappointed for a double tree hotel.

Summary Heading: Slightly characterless, but very good for Disney. Service first class.
Summary: It can be a trial finding accommodation for a family of five. Is it some some kind of puritanical disapproval for having just a little bit too much sex and having the children to show for it?   I couldn't really say.  However, Double Tree Suites take a family of five in their stride without charging the earth. True, the fold out sofa bed was not the last word in sumptuous comfort, but it did the job. The suite was well equipped: plenty of towels, coffee maker, two TVs and ethernet internet access.   Service was generally very good indeed. The staff were pleasant and the restaurant opens for breakfast at 6am, which is very welcome when dealing with hungry, jetlagged children and the walk to Disney (which is why we were there) was a scant half mile.  The only thing that slightly

Our accommodations/experience here were excellent.  We had a corner suite that was huge, great furnishings, and clean.  Having 2 TV's is the best.  Great mattress, pillows, and bedding. We like outdoor parking and it was so easy.  Great location too.

My family spent 2 nights here while visiting Disneyland. The drive to the park was easy and the breakfast buffet was fantastic. We also loved the cookies. The privacy of two sleeping spaces was very nice for our family.

I enjoyed staying at Double Tree at Anaheim, CA. I like the parking, service at front desk, the housekeepers keep the rooms clean and looking fresh. I also enjoyed dining at the hotel's restaurant. I felt taken care of during my week of stay.

Summary Heading: Nice convention hotel with a good restaurant option
Summary: We have been staying at the Doubletree Suites for the past 4 or 5 years while attending an annual conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.
