The staff has always been very friendly and professional and we've found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and situated conveniently close to the convention center. The hotel has a good restaurant and bar with a great breakfast buffet. The pool area is nice. The only improvements I would like to see would be for a better fitness center. Currently it is very small with 2 treadmills, an elliptical and weight machine and I hope that they can find away to expand it. Also, the rooms are starting to show a little wear and tear and I hope that an update is scheduled. Finally, I feel a little gouged with the daily parking rate of $20 but I

The hotel is really nice, great location that works well for Disney travelers.  I don't like to generalize, but we had a significant service issue and discovered that their policy supports it.  On our final day, we desired to sleep in after a couple of long days at Disney.  As we would be checking-out at noon (standard check-out time) we didn't worry about being interrupted.  At approx 0900, we were woken up by housekeeping.  Ok, not the end of the world right?  But you all should know about it.  So, when asking the front desk, I was told that it is their policy to knock on the doors at that time even on those that will be leaving.  Further, I had requested to have a conversation with the manager, and evidently, he refused to call me as desired.  Again, not the end of the world,

I wish I could give this place a negative number. I tried to cancel a reservation here 3 days before my stay  and the person on the phone said they could not find my reservation and to not worry about it. Then I got charged a no show fee and they refuse to refund my money. The worst customer service ever!  Please don't stay here and tell all your family and friends!   THIS HOTEL IS A HORRIBLE REPRESENTATION OF HILTON HOTELS

The hotel, rooms, and staff were excellent.  I made group reservations through the group sales office with Henry Hang.  I would rate Mr. Hang as "Satisfactory".  He was not very responsive to questions and requests in a timely manner.

We stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights while my boyfriend and I visited Disneyland. The exterior and lobby are beautiful. I had never stayed at a Doubletree and after reading the reviews I was hoping it would live up to the hype. Needless to stay this hotel did not disappoint. We booked a standard king room and it was just that, standard. The room was quite large with a very useful fridge and microwave and extremely comfortable bed. We had a pleasant stay and would definitely return to this hotel again.

We stayed here for 3 nights in March for business due tot he good rating on Trip Advisor, the great rate and the previous experiences of staying at DoubleTree hotels. The hotel was clean and modern and ideally located for our work. The rooms are clean and spacious and are ideal for a short stay. The highlight of the trip was Norma, the bar manager with her lively character and great customer service. The downsides were the lack of customer service at checkout and the demand from reception that I bring my laundry down to reception if I wanted it picking up to be laudered. Overall a good experience and I would stay again.

This hotel is the best hotel I have stayed at around Disneyland. ( We have been to quite a few) Rooms are large, clean and updated (which lots of hotels in this area are old and outdated) We got the double queen suite, it actually has a separate bedroom and living area with a pull out couch. Most suites are advertised that way but it's just a pull out couch in the same room. The bathroom has a large vanity outside the bathroom so you can have more than one person getting ready at a time. 2 t.v's in the room also. Great value

Came here as part of a conference with my family.  Nice property, nice rooms with sofa bed, great breakfast (free for hilton gold).  Walking distance to the convention center. Only small nit was that the Internet was spotty.  Nice place.  I will come here again.  Try the Ruth Chris steak house happy hour if you're here. M- F.  Really awesome.

We just stayed at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim for 5 nights. What a wonderful hotel! VERY clean - the housekeeping staff did a fantastic job every day...absolutely no complaints. We stayed in a two room suite on the fourth floor with two queen beds that were very comfortable with soft, clean sheets. The other room had a microwave and small refrigerator (both clean!), and a TV in each room. Bathroom was large and clean. Temperature control was fine. The pool and hot tube area is on the 2nd floor roof - clean and comfortable. You can watch the fireworks from Disneyland from there! The staff was extremely friendly and kind! Check in and check out was a breeze, and we were given warm cookies each time! We ate in the Agio restaurant downstairs which, while a little pricey, was

The staff was very welcoming and accommodating when I checked in.  The warm cookie is always a plus.  They went above and beyond to answer my questions quickly and followed up to make sure I was satisfied.  I have stayed here multiple times and will probably do so again because of the service.  Business and Family trips... I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

We really liked this hotel. Our room was a suite and the price was similar to some others in the area for single rooms, so it was a good deal. Staff was very friendly (have delicious, warm cookies at the front desk) Room was clean, bed was comfy. We walked to Disneyland, just a couple of blocks away. Tired after Disney, so we took a bus back, only $3 per person. As with other hotels in the area we had to pay for parking, $16 per day. This hotel had free wi-fi, other hotels in the area charge for it. Lots of restaurants in the area. Only minor complaint was the couch in the living room area, not very comfy, but we didn't come to stay in the room sitting on the couch. Would definitely stay here again.

Chose the Romance Package during the Valentines Day Weekend. First when we arrived, they forgot to give us the Double Tree famous "Cookie."  I had to call the front desk to bring attention. They also were to call me to verify if we wanted the house wine or Champagne, which I never received a call. Once again I called them. I think they should give free room service with a selection menu for certain items you can order as part of the package. I was not stuck on the buffet. Also when delivering the Champagne offer to serve it to you! I would have preferred my breakfast to be room service with mimosas! This was valentines weekend, need to stress more romanticism to the guest!

Was very convenient to Disneyland which was our main goal for the hotel.  Nice pool - my daughter had a great time at it.  Nice employees.   The refrigerator and microwave came in handy. There is a shuttle right outside that is just a few stops from Disneyland.

The staff is attentive, professional and welcoming. The hotel property is fresh, clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel, with the exception of the wait staff at the on property restaurant, which was less than attentive.
Manager Response: Dear Frank D,  Thank you so much for your review.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed most of your stay.  We endeavor to provide great service in every area of the hotel  & I’d like to apologize for the less than attentive service in the restaurant.  I will pass your feedback along to our restaurant managers.  I hope you’ll visit us again soon.  We’d like to show you our great service throughout your stay.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary: In Anaheim, I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, the Paradise Pier Hotel, and now this hotel.  Although this one is not on the DL resort property (big bummer), and thus does not have the same ambience or proximity to Disney, I'd have to say, in my opinion, the quality of the room itself was better than I've experienced at either Disney hotel.  It was a tastefully decorated, two-room suite (it was great that my hubby could sleep on the living room sofa so his snores wouldn't wake the rest of us in the other room).  I never had a problem with maintaining consistent water pressure and temperature when taking baths (can't say that elsewhere).  The towels are bigger and fluffier than at my Disney hotel rooms.  This hotel has wide halls and I'm guessing fairly thick walls, because we

The front desk staff at this hotel is extremely rude and unhelpful.  When we had an issue with our reservation they were unable to comprehend what we needed and locked me out of my room!  We also had issues with our parking ticket not working.  Three times we went to the front desk to get it fixed. (it had already been paid for) and they kept insisting it was our fault.  Will not stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer B,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserved during your recent visit to the area.   Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we have addressed the issues you mentioned with front desk and parking. We try to make each guest experience a great one at our hotel and your satisfaction is important to us.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity soon to make your stay the best it can be.  Thank you,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: A Wonderful, Peaceful, and Comfortable Stay!
Summary: We have found our new go-to hotel for Disney...the Doubletree Suites!  The 2 room suite was perfect for our family of four.  I am an early riser, so it was great to be able to have my cup of coffee and start my day without waking up the family!    We opted for the family breakfast package. The breakfast buffet was very good, and the service in the restaurant was excellent - very personable and helpful!  Loved that they served fruit and steamed vegetables for breakfast. The organic blueberry muffins were delicious!  Robert at the front desk was super nice and made me feel like I was his only guest.  Loved that!  The rooms were clean, and the beds very comfortable (an absolute must-have and the reason we don't go to less expensive hotels).  The comforters were just the right

My daughter's cheerleading team stays here at least times a year for competitions. The staff is always friendly (knowing that 100+ cheerleaders are involved with our party). Rooms are very clean, spacious.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Suites Close to Disneyland
Summary: Pros: Close to Disneyland - 20-25min walk depending on your speed (about 3 blocks). Suites very roomy - separate bedroom, living room areas, bathroom with sink/vanity outside bathroom. Well worth it if you have some ratty tired kids - close the door and let them sleep it off! Room safe in bedroom with roomy closet space to hang up clothes and store away bags, souvenirs. ART Bus stops right outside. Hotel sells tickets and can charge room. Lots of other restaurants around off premises. Within 10min walk of 7 Eleven shop for picking up smaller groceries - water, snacks etc. 2 vending machines on each floor and shop downstairs Free Internet access via 3 terminals and also a printer is available. Friendly front desk staff, and more than obliging to furnish your kids with fresh

I booked this hotel well in advance. I was about to cancel/re-book the reservation because one of my boy's wasn't feeling well. I was able to speak to Sean at the front desk and the manager of reservations whom were very helpful and polite. Luckily, my son was feeling better the next morning and we were able to keep our reservation. The room was perfect! Super clean!

The hotel was very clean, and suites were perfect with plenty of room and lots of mirrors for teenage girls to 'get ready' away from others. Nice to have the shuttle stop outside the hotel, as it was a little to far to walk, especially after a long day walking in the parks. We never did eat in the restaurant, but the cafe had plenty for a quick grab to take up to the room before heading out. Staff was very courteous and helpful, and housekeeping was excellent. Only wish was that the pool area stayed open later to soak those tired muscles in the hot tub. Though the beds were soooo comfortable after a long day! Didn't hear any road noise at night, nor did we hear any noise from other guests when we were in our room. We will definitely stay here again.

This hotel was a wonderful place for my friends and I. We had 3 days to explore parts of Orange County and LA. The room was gorgeous and the hotel had great amenities including a wonderful pool and chocolate chip cookies at the front desk! It was a great, comfortable, and reasonable place to stay, right in the heart of Anaheim.

Close enough to walk to Convention Center, a little far from Disney BUT the resort shuttles stop right outside.  Good rooms, Excellent attentive and dedicated friendly staff.  10th floor was quiet and well apointed suites.

We stayed at this hotel last week for our first visit to Disneyland, and we couldn't have been happier. The shuttle worked great, the restaurant was convenient, and the staff were wonderful. I highly recommend the Doubletree for a visit to Disney.

This is my second stay in four months there.  The big draw is the suites, plus the Hilton name.  The suites are large and spacious, and the bathroom is separate from the bedroom.  Now I am from NY and I walk alot so believe me when I say it's a long walk from the Doubletree to Disneyland, especially after a long day there.  Fortunately, you can take the ART bus that stops right in front of the hotel (3 line) or the 1 line that will drop you off at the Travelodge across the street that will take you right to Disneyland/California Adventure.  There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse, Denny's, IHOP, AM/PM, gas station, and small liquor store all within 5 minutes of the hotel.  There is also a restaurant in the hotel, where kids eat free when an adult orders an entree, but we thought the

A great location and superior accommodation  made our family trip to Disneyland a real treat. Well appointed rooms with separate bedroom made the extended stay very comfortable. The pool area was a welcome relief from a long day at the parks.

We stayed at the doubletree the first weekend in February and had a great stay! The beds and linens are so nice and comfortable and the rooms are very clean. We took the ART bus transportation to get to the park. You do have to pay for parking but it seems that is the case with most of the hotels in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Hayscrew,  Thank you so much for the kind review!  I’m very pleased to hear your enjoyed our Sweet Dream Beds.  I jope you will come stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary Heading: A nice hotel with good location
Summary: This hotel was conveniently located near Disney and all of the adjoining amenities. Our room was a king suite corner room with a quaint view of Anaheim. It had a nice bar area with coffemaker with decent coffee and in-room refrigerator which was convenient for beer, soda's and waters. You could see fireworks from the hotel in the evening. The hotel had a nice pool and good workout facilities. The bistro, restaurant and bar were very accessible and had the greatest staff. Everybody was so accommodating and friendly. I am from the south and we could learn something from the hospitality we experienced  on this side of the country!!
Manager Response: Dear Terri T,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I’m happy to hear your enjoyed the Disneyland Fireworks from your room.  It’s a relaxing way to end your day at Disneyland.    I will also pass along your comments to the food & beverage team.  I agree with you – they are a great staff!  I hope we can be of service to you & your family again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort – Convention Center

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our 3-night stay in a Suite
Summary: Had 2-room suite (2 queens & sofabed): felt the suite was small, tight squeeze where the 2 queen beds were. Otherwise it was great, no complaints re service or accommodations. Surprise there was no free shuttle to Disney parks from this hotel. Shuttle is $5@day per person.

I was traveling on business & needed a hotel near the Anaheim Convention Center.  The room was wonderful.    Cafe had a good variety & selection if I did not want to venture into the "sit down" restaurant (although the restaurant was equally good).  Staff was helpful.  Hotel was within walking distance of a variety of other eating / dining options as well as extremely close (walking distance) to the Budget car rental.

I have stayed at this hotel several times for work travel, and I have always been pleased with the accommodations and service.  The hotel is in a nice location, which is an easy walk to restaurants and the convention center.  The beds are comfortable and the restaurant's staff and food are top notch.  I will continue to stay here when traveling to Anaheim.

This was our second stay at the Doubletree as a family of 7. The staff are always so friendly and helpful. My sister suffered second degree burns at the Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf at Universal Studios (where the staff did nothing). The concierge at the Doubletree went out of his way to help us with a wheelchair and doctor's service. Despite the injury, we had a fabulous time at the Doubletree. The family suites are so spacious, the restaurant is excellent and transport to Disneyland is quick and convenient. Our stay was over Christmas and the staff went out of their way to make it special every single day of our stay.

We had a wonderful stay for 4 days at the end of Jan/beginning of Feb.  Leo at the front desk was incredibly nice and gave us a room facing the fireworks.  I would advise joining Hilton Honors, as certain floors of this hotel are designated for that program.  The room was very clean, quiet and fairly large (we had a suite which has a bedroom and a small sitting area).  It's about a mile to Disneyland straight up Harbor which was easy to walk in about 20-30 minutes.  You get a great chocolate chip cookie at check in, Wifi is free, and parking is $16/day.  Thanks Tripadvisor for recommending this hotel...I was having major anxiety as our 2 1/2 year old had never stayed in a hotel. We had an opportunity to visit Disneyland with a friend, so we took the chance.  I'm so glad we did!

We were traveling with a family of six including three children.  The rooms were ideal for a family with two queen beds in a separate room and a pull out couch.  There is a refrigerator and microwave also.  The beds were very comfortable and the room very clean.  We did not have a view but it was quiet.  Great location close to Disneyland but I hate to pay for parking.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights while in Anaheim visiting Disneyland Etc,.,  The rooms were a little outdated for the price, the cookies and the free WIFI make up for all this though and make it very worth while. We enjoyed our time here and its only within walking distance of Disneyland and dinning areas. They also have a coin laundry onsite which made it very easy for us..  Thank you

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but be careful making your reservation
Summary: I am currently staying at the Anaheim DoubleTree with my family and so far everything has been as good as expected from reading the reviews.  However, an issue has surfaced that I thought was important enough to share with folks who are considering the Doubletree Suites as well as the management of Hotel and the Corporate Management.  I used Trip Advisor to quickly identify what was the best hotel for me and my family to stay at while my wife and I attended a conference at the nearby convention center before taking our kids to Disney for a couple of days.  On the TripAdvisor Anaheim hotels page there is a "Special Promotions" section which often prominently displays a "Family Fun" deal at the DoubleTree.  Well like most online travelers I took the bait and proceeded to book a

Although this is one of the bigger hotels in the area, the staff was very professional and made sure I was comfortable. Always a nice touch with the warm cookie upon check-in. The room was also very good size with a nice and comfortable bed. Here on business in January but would definitely come back with the family next time.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but couple of annoying things
Summary: Good room, excellent breakfast. But was annoyed as I had asked for a rollaway bed which I eventually never used since the two they offered were in poor condition. They were still charged in my bill. When I asked them to reverse it, they would not believe me and said they had to confirm internally, but the person was not available. So the hassle of later checking / calling to see if they did it. Also, they charge for parcels delivered even if you pick it up yourself in the storage room. Okay, but they should let you know first, not in the end. Other than this couple of annoying things, I had a good experience. Breakfast was great.

Very new and clean hotel.  Grand front lobby.  Friendly staff.  Paid guest parking ($5/day).  No free hotel shuttle to Disneyland.  Same Disneyland ticket price at front desk as Disneyland's ticket booth.  Great restaurant food close by.  Vietnam town close by on Westminister street in Garden Grove.  Korea town close by on Garden Grove Blvd. in Garden Grove.

Summary Heading: Nice suite and close to Disney!
Summary: The room was very nice and clean.  The only complaint is the bed pillows were a little softer than I prefer and the living room couch was a little uncomfortable but other than those picky items the stay was very nice.  The hotel restaurant is also very good!

I had a wonderful time.  I stayed in Jan during NAMM.  I needed to go to a few places and the taxi's were super busy. So I was given this wonderful driver that was very reasonably priced.  He came to my hotel in a private car very clean well mannered and took me out.  His Name is MO and I found him on craig's list.  Need a ride in OC call him 949-385-2174.

My friend and I took a long weekend trip to the LA area because we'd never been and always wanted to go. One of the things we definitely wanted to do was go to Disneyland. This is a perfect location for that. Its about a 15 minute walk to the park gates, and we felt safe walking back at night. The hotel itself was top notch - clean rooms, comfy beds, friendly & helpful staff. While we were there it was fairly quiet also, we stayed on a Thursday and Friday. I would recommend this to anyone visiting the Disneyland or convention center areas.

This location is excellent for the convention center.It was considerably cheaper than the Hilton or Marriott and only a 5 min walk, which in SoCal is really not a problem. I had a suite, which was quite spacious. I had read previous reviews about the noise with the Disney kids running up and down the halls, etc but figured I'd be out of the room by the time that happened. My assumption was correct in that all 7 nights were quiet and comfortable (note I was never in the room before 8pm, though and gone by 9). Room was clean, staff efficient and accommodating. I did find the room layout a little strange with all the doors (2 in the bedroom and one in the bathroom) and they never stayed open which was kind of annoying.  the real kicker was the bed and pillows. I had read one other

We are a family of 6 and stayed here for 3 nights. Whilst it was tight in the room for the 6 of us (2 double beds and fold out sofa) the location and service was excellent. We were only in the room in the evening for sleeping and showering so the small room wasn't a concern. The hotel is very clean, service excellent and the breakfast fresh and well catered. The service in the restaurant is very good. The hotel is a 15 to 20 minute walk from Disneyland or catch the shuttle. Many restaurants nearby too. There are laundry facilities on 2 floors (HHonor floor 7 has one so if you are Honors member ask for a level 7 room). Beds are very comfortable. Great value if you include breakfast (kids under 12 eat free). We would happily stay here again.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disney or convention center visit
Summary: We just returned from a two night stay at the DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim.  This hotel really is excellent - so pretty, comfortable, and fresh/new feeling. The bed, pillows, and linens are wonderful.  The staff is clearly striving to make it the #1 hotel in Anaheim, and I think it just might be. I normally stay at the Disney hotels, but thought we would try something different and after much research I settled on the DoubleTree.  So glad we did....the value is just amazing for the luxury and top notch service that you get.  Very nice breakfast buffet available, Starbuck's coffee, lovely lobby with comfortable and attractive furnishings, and front desk staff that were just amazing.  I will be telling everyone I know, and looking forward to our next stay here. Thank you

Summary Heading: Great holiday stay for our visit to Disneyland
Summary: Our family (all adults) spent Christmas in Disneyland this year.  We wanted a hotel that was reasonably priced and in walking distance to the park.  The Double Tree was great.  Big, clean, comfortable rooms, great staff and less than a mile from the park.  Easy walk for adults and great to leave the car behind.

Yes, its a very large and busy hotel.  Checked in the Sunday after NAMM so everyone was beat but... the staff didn't let that stop them (interacted with front desk, concierge, restaurant staff bot dinner and breakfast)!  They laughed it off as a lot of work, but its only once per year.  The room was a bit small, no room between the desk chair and the bed, but the bathroom was good size (counter space and plugs).  The breakfast buffet was wonderful, something for everyone. The exercise room was small, and not a lot of floor space to use the mats, free weights or balance ball (it was also out of wipes for the equipment).   I was surprised by the $16.00 per day parking charge, don't remember seeing that when the reservation was made.

we stay at this hotel 2x a year.  It works very well for our family of 3.  It's about 1 mile (a very flat walk) to Disney.  We always reserve one of the 2 room hotel rooms.  We put our toddler on the floor on a kid-size Aero Bed that I bring (they always provide us with extra linens for me to make up this bed) in the sitting area.  We pull out the sitting chair and tuck her bed into the corner so she has plenty of darkness.   My husband and I can stay up later in the other room.  The room meets all our needs.   We always use the free wifi and reserve a package with breakfast vouchers.  The breakfast buffet is perfect for us.  They used to have a pancake machine (my daughter's favorite) but they didn't have that for our last visit. The manager of the Dining Room, Christina (I

I travel each week and I usually stay in a hilton branded property.  This Doubletree, by far, is one of the best in their portfolio of hotels.  The property is new and clean, the maid service is above par with special touches and something that I rarely say about a hotel is that I enjoy their breakfast.  They have fresh choices, unique dishes each morning and the service is phenomenal each and every time I eat there.  Take it from someone who usually settles for just a cup of coffee, this is great!

Summary Heading: Stay here once a year for Meeting and Conference
Summary: I enjoy staying here each year and have an easy time working with Deborah on meeting arrangements (banquets). Close enough to the convention center and quieter that other hotels. Beds are comfortable and rooms are a good size. Was put by a trash compactor this last time which was not cool at times. Shout out the clerk who was nice enough to make me an ice pack this year when I injured my foot after checking out. She was sweet.
Manager Response: Dear Jessica D, 	 Thank you so much for the kind words.  Forgive me for the room assignment.  I promise to find you a more suitable room next year.  I’m happy to hear we helped out with your foot & I hope it is feeling better.  Let me know if you need some cookies to help you heal.  See you again in 2015!  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: room was fine...clean and comfy.....beds ok....really wasn't there much...checked in around 6:30 pm....hung out for a couiple hours and went back out til about 11:30...came back and had some chow and slept.....

Stayed here for the Namm show, rooms good, staff good, bar good, the gym does seem to have shrunk and doe seem rather under equipped for a hotel of this size, only 1 elliptical trainer and it was always in use.
Manager Response: Dear Dougal C,  Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay & our service.  I have to agree with you on the gym, we are definitely handicapped by a lack of space.  I apologize that it didn’t meet your needs.  I hope we will see you again for NAMM 2015.  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: First, I made a big mistake on my reservation with a incorrect date. Despite the challenges that come with a full hotel due to the NAMM show, they found me a room without a problem. they couldn't be nicer about it! The hotel is very conveniently located close to the convention center and they serve a good quality and convenient breakfast buffet with made to order eggs. I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey R,  Thanks so much for your kind words.  I’m so happy we could help you out with your NAMM reservation!  As you know, things can get crazy with 100,000 people in town.  I’m also glad you enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Chef Rafael recently added the cooked to order eggs & they have been a hit.  We look forward to seeing you again next year.  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I will start off with the best point: kids eat free! We utilized this every single morning for the buffet breakfast and once when we just wanted a couple of Caesar salads to share for lunch. Some reviewers have said "walking distance to Disney". We did not attempt it as it seemed like quite a distance for a 6 year old and a 60+ year old. Our family of six had no trouble catching a van taxi back and forth to Disney morning and evening everyday for under $10 a ride. That's cheaper than the Anaheim Resort Shuttle would have been for 6 of us, and proved amazingly quick and easy. We asked the front desk to call us a van, and when we arrived downstairs, there it was waiting.  It was also roughly a $10 cab ride to "The Outlets at Orange" for some retail therapy. The rooms were

Room was large, extremely clean and walking distance to Disneyland.  Check-in was quick and easy and the staff friendly and very helpful.  My husband and daughter loved the warm cookie provided at check-in! Will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear LisaB93933,  Thanks for such a nice review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your visit with us.  Check in is so important to the success of a guest’s stay & I am glad we got started on the right foot.  Those Doubletree Cookies are so delicious & tempting.  Too tempting for me!  Please visit us again soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Good Hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Recently stayed at this hotel for the Tinkerbell 1/2 Marathon weekend in January. It is comfortable walking distance to the park as dell as downtown disney (less than a mile), or if you prefer there is a stop for ART (Anaheim Rapid Transit) right outside the door and you can track the arrival times online. We checked in late because our flight was delayed but we had a great experience with the front desk. We also had questions about transit and the race the following day and either the front desk or the concierge was able to answer them all. The elevators are fast, and the lobby is comfortable. We selected a room with the separate living room, very spacious and had a mini fridge where we kept water. Not a great view, but didn't really get the hotel for the view! Comfy and clean

Not great parking. No valet, yet it's $16/night to park. If this is not a suite hotel, the name should be changed! I requested a suite and got a standard room with a rotten view. Not worth it. When I called down to the front desk, the manager was terribly rude! Never again!
Manager Response: Dear Tomzkel,  I’m sorry to hear you are displeased with our parking facilities.  Most people find that the parking is very convenient to the hotel & that the fee is comparable to other hotels in the area.  I am also sorry to see you weren’t happy with your room.  Upon researching your reservation, I show that you reserved & were assigned, a standard room. We like to think the hotel has something for everyone.  We offer a variety of room types with just under 200 suites & 50 standard rooms.    I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us.  I hope you’ll given us another opportunity in the future.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager,   DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I happened to stay here once with a group and fell in love with the hotel.  It is so nice to have 2 separate spaces when traveling so that you can have some personal space.  It is now my number one choice for hotels near Disneyland (yes, even over the resort hotels which I have used many times as well).  What you get for your money is so far above what you can get at many other hotels.  The service here is great.  The ART shuttle stop is right outside the hotel.  It is one of the busier lines, but it takes you right up to the gates at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Katherine L,  Thank you so much for the kind review!  There are some terrific hotels in the area & we honored to be your number one choice in Anaheim.  Guest service is so important at our hotel.  I will be sure to share your review with the entire team.  Hope to see you again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at this property during the Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend. This is a nice alternative to staying on Disney property if you're looking for a cheaper option. They had signs posted in the elevators informing marathon participants about transportation to Disneyland during the marathon weekend which was helpful. I was a little bit nervous about how this room would be in terms of cleanliness since a lot of the hotels in the Disney area are older but I was pleasantly surprised. The room felt clean and there was no visible wear and tear in our room. We had 3 adults and two children with us and the room was quite comfortable with the 5 of us. The kids slept on the pull-out couch and that worked out nicely. It was also great to have two separate televisions  - one in the

Summary Heading: BEST ROOMS BEST SERVICE STAY HERE A+++++++
Summary: I was just out in la on a biz trip and I was on trip advisor all day looking at reviews on hotels.  After seeing the good reviews on here and doing a drive by to check it out I booked a room for 3 nights.  Let me tell you the rooms were super clean and to me that is very important!!!!!! Everything in the room was new and updated.  The staff at the front desk when they checked me in was so nice and I felt so welcomed.  I never take the time to write reviews but after reading so many to find a good hotel and staying at this amazing clean place I just had to review.
Manager Response: Dear Karizma12  Wow, thanks for the great report card!  I agree with you - our housekeeping team does a fantastic job keeping the hotel clean & comfortable.  I apologize for the cliché, but we really do get just one chance to make a great first impression.  I’m so glad to hear the front desk was pleasant & made you feel welcome.  Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We hope to see you again soon.  Deborah Fisher Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Stayed  for 4 nights.  Hotel is very nice, located within walking distance of disneyland (two long city blocks, about a mile).  Staff were welcoming and helpful.  Room (1 bedroom - living area and bedroom separated by door) was clean, had small microwave/fridge, pull out couch was comfortable, small desk/work area.  Restaurant food was decent, children eat free, had traditional child menu with a few healthy choices as well.  We ate here one night and ordered in a great pizza another night from a local spot.  Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) stopped in front of the hotel.  We walked to disney in the morning and took the bus home at night.  ART tickets can be purchased at the front desk.  There is a gift shop and mini Starbucks on site.  Overall, great experience.

Our expectations were exceeded.  Newer venue with tasteful, modern flair.  Clean, comfy pillows, linens and mattress.  Terrific service.  A small store, bar and restaurant on site.  The suite concept is favorable with bedroom separate from dining and living areas.  Coffee, microwave & fridge in room.  Quality toiletries.

Summary Heading: Great hotel within walking distance of Disneyland Resort
Summary: We stayed here over the MLK weekend when we couldn't get a room on property at the parks.  What a pleasant surprise.  We booked a suite for our family of 4.  The room was extremely clean and well maintained.  The front desk service was excellent, as was the breakfasts we had each morning at the hotel's restaurant.  The parks shuttle (run by the city) stops right in front of the hotel, but honestly, we felt it was an easy walk (3 - 4 city blocks) to the parks' main gates.  A great value for the money.

This is the third time we've stayed at this hotel in the past 2 years.  Again we were not disappointed.  Service is always outstanding.  The bellman helped us in getting cabs when we needed one.  Housekeeping was the greatest.  The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful.  We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when in Anaheim.  The breakfast buffet has an ample variety of foods and it was always tasty.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for a Disneyland/Anaheim Holiday
Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites from 28th November, 2013 to 12th December, 2013 (myself, plus 2 teenage daughters).  This is our second stay at this hotel (stayed December 2011 for 9 nights).  We had such a great time - the hotel is always clean and inviting, the staff friendly, efficient and courteous and the rooms themselves are quite spacious and very comfortable - especially the beds.  The rooms noticeably appeared clean and fresh each day on our return to the hotel.  We requested a room facing towards Disneyland both times (so we can see the fireworks in the distance) and that is what we got.  The general overall feel and atmosphere of the hotel is very welcoming and we always felt like we were "home" after a long day at the "Parks".  We especially love the full

Summary Heading: Very good for a family going to Disney - definitely recommend
Summary: We stayed here just before the holidays for 3 nights, during our visit to Disney.  We were a day late in arriving due to flight problems; after a request the hotel did not charge us for the missed night.  Then we received a complementary upgrade to the 5th floor (Hilton Honors) which was very kind and welcome after a 50 hour trip!   The two room design worked well for us, being jetlagged - if some were awake, we could watch TV on the sofa in the sitting room while others slept in the bedroom (we had 2 queens for a family of 4).   The room had a fridge w minibar, a coffee pot with tea and coffee. The one thing we did go out and buy was bottled water, as the bottled water in the room was expensive and the tap water smelt and tasted strongly of chlorine.  Wifi worked.  the hotel

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in the Anaheim area!
Summary: Pros: Bang for your buck Food Quality and Quantity Location Sleep Quality  Cons: Slow elevators (Couldn't think of a major con, but I have to list at least one.)  I've stayed here 4 nights per week for the past few weeks. Check in has always been quick and efficient. The "Welcome Back" gift packs are great surprises and very appreciated.  The rooms are well appointed with multiple TV's, comfortable couches, and refrigerators.  I have always had great sleep quality here. The thermostats are easy to set at cool temperatures, and the fans run all night long for gentle background noise.  The breakfast buffet is awesome. There is a nice selection of hot food, and the selections change on a daily basis. The fruit and pastries have always been quite good, too.  The bar food is quite

A lot of great things to say about this Doubletree property which is deserving of its high TripAdvisor rating.  A couple of minor issues are impacting my overall rating but all in, this is a property that I highly recommend. Details below:  What I liked:  I had several reservations at Hilton properties over the holidays and this was the first property that had all rooms reserved pre-assigned and close to each other, so check-in was a breeze.  One of the room was upgraded to a suite style room, and as I quickly found out had a direct view of the Disneyland fireworks.  The double-Queen suite was spacious and comfortable and the room layout was quite functional.  Beds were extremely comfortable and with the doors closed - calm and quiet. Actual bathroom was a bit small but a

Just came back from my trip to disneyland , and was extremely satisfied with my stay at double tree . check in was smooth and so was the check out . complimentary cookies were great & warm. Hotel is located right next to the disneyland parking lot, lot of restaurant and convenient stores around.15 mins of walking distance to disneyland resort .  One good thing about this hotel is that they dont charge for parking , so you save on that .  Breakfast was reasonable and kids eat free .  The only suggestions which i would like to give is that that they should have complimentary shuttle  service to disney park.  Value for money hotel .

We recently stayed at the Doubletree in Anaheim for a trip to Disneyland. We had 3 adults and 2 children in our party so finding places that would accommodate us all comfortably was a challenge. The room was perfect, lots of room .We used the ART shuttle system which had a stop right in front. The only trouble with that was you never knew if they had just come or right down the road. Some waits were rather lengthy .Room was clean, some wear but not bad. Wished there had been a free breakfast buffet though!

Summary Heading: Doubletree Hotel Resort in Anahein, CA
Summary: It was a wonderful experience, we enjoyed the hotel very much and we will for sure stay at this property again.  The hotel is very nice, with beautiful comfortable suits .  We loved the privacy from the living room to the bedroom; in addition, the service, the clean rooms and the food.  We loved it.  Thank you

I have been going to Anaheim for a trade show for a few years but I thought that I would try a different hotel this trip, even if the hotel was a short walk from the Conference Center.  I decided that I would try the DoubleTree Suites and I do not regret my decision.   The hotel was clean and appears to be well maintained but this is not what makes the hotel.  It is the STAFF.   Check-in was fast and my warm cookie was there waiting for me! I was blown away with the suite. In the past I have paid more and only got a room.  I have never had so much room.  FREE wifi all over the hotel was a great plus as I could keep in touch with home anywhere on the property.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable and supplies were always replaced.   Breakfast and dinner were eaten at Agio

Close to Disneyland. Great for families. Had minor hick ups but they were sorted quickly. The separate room was great for kids. Quite at night for sleeping during peak dates. Pool facilities were clean and suitable for kids. Restaurant was well serviced and the breakfast buffet was a good morning starter to face the crowds at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Keysha,  Thank you for the nice review.  I’m glad we worked out the hiccups early on so you could enjoy your stay with us.    I agree it’s surprisingly quiet at night – especially for a hotel so close to Disneyland.  Perhaps the parks are wearing everyone out.  I’m also happy to hear you enjoyed Agio Ristorante & the breakfast buffet.  I’ll let Chef Rafael know, he works hard to keep the buffet fresh & inviting.  I hope you & your family can join us again soon.  Thanks again!  Deborah Fisher Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The Doubletree Suites are ideally located in Anaheim with it being a short (15 min) walk to Disneyland.  The hotel itself is clean and tidy and the staff are very helpful and friendly.  We booked this hotel as we are travelling with two older teenagers who needed there own room - and while the bed in the main bedroom is a dream to sleep in, the pull out couch leaves a bit to desired.  It would be fine for younger kids but definitely not for older teens or adults. Overall we really enjoyed our time at the Doubletree Suites, but in hindsight we would have probably booked two single rooms at a hotel to get better bedding options.

I have already let several of my friends know about this hotel. Newly freshened rooms, great beds. I am SO picky about where I stay (to the point of losing sleep!). I felt relaxed and happy. My son thought he was a king!
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer G,  Thank you so much for the kind words & the recommendations to your friends!  I'm really glad you & your son enjoyed your stay.  Please come visit us again soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Nice and clean, inside and out
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights for the BCS NC Game.  Very clean and pretty.   Breakfast buffet was overpriced, and just "okay." Went to Denny's the 2nd day.  Parking at $16 is kind of a rip, IMO. If you're staying there, they should provide free parking, for the first car at least.
Manager Response: Dear Chris,  Thank you so much for choosing the DoubleTree Suites by Hilton!  I appreciate you taking the time to post a review.  Please know Agio Ristorante strives to provide a delicious, hot breakfast buffet  to our guests. I will share your comments about breakfast with Chef Rafael.  I hope we have the chance to serve you again soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We have stayed with Double Tree at least six times now and always feel welcomed and well taken care of.  From the warm greeting when you first walk in to the warm cookies as you head up to your room, it is a pleasant experience.  The rooms are clean, staff friendly and the heating system works quietly, water pressure is good and the water gets HOT!

Summary Heading: Wonderful White Wonderland insomniacs experienced PLUR
Summary: The place was expensive but worth it in beauty to be right next too the White a wonderland Experience by Insomniacs my husband J put the whole thing on as a surprise with some friends from EDC and i had a blast would do it again for New Year's

Summary Heading: Great place for a Disneyland getaway with the kids
Summary: Spent New Years Eve and News Day at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim.  My family and I were welcomed at the front desk with the usual warm cookie, which was nice after braving LA traffic to get there.  The lobby was spacious and lovely and featured a cafe serving Starbucks coffee and drinks, bagels, muffins, yogurt, etc.  It was a good stop for a quick breakfast before heading to Disneyland.  There was also an Italian restaurant (kids eat free with the purchase of an adult  entree), bar, Disney info desk (you can purchase park tickets there, get maps, etc.) and a souvenir shop.    We stayed in a King suite. The bedroom was spacious as was the bathroom, but the living area was cramped.  The sofa pulled out into a full-sized bed, which our toddler used at night, and there wasn't

The people at this DoubleTree are friendly and helpful. The TV went belly-up after a couple days of our arrival (ours was a 6 night stay). Not that it was a big deal, we didn't watch it (and the PPV movies were something like $16!). After departure I realized that I left an item in the room and the staff was kind enough to ship to to me (on my nickel). The fact that I, as an hhonors member, had to choose between receiving points or free breakfasts seemed rather odd.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff,  Thanks so much for the review.  Please accept my apologies for your T.V. not working properly during your stay. In the future, please don't hesitate to call upon the staff for assistance.  We respond promptly to all concerns.  With regard to the Hilton Honors benefits, it is correct that as a Gold Member you have the option to receive complimentary breakfast or points. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed friendly and helpful service from the team.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We hope to see you again soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Everything that we expected from a Hilton family hotel. Service at front desk was excellent, very accommodating and suite was very comfortable. It is located on Harbor blvd. just a few blocks from the main entrance to Disneyland, we walked every day and felt safe just around midnight.   I love the warm cookies!!
Manager Response: Dear Daniel,  Thank you so much for your kind words! I'll be sure to share your review with the team.  I'm so glad to see that you and your family were able to take advantage of our close proximity to the Disneyland Theme Parks. The next time you stay with us, consider dropping by the front desk for  some complimentary DoubleTree cookies to snack on at Disneyland or on the trip home.  Thank you for your feeback.    Please come back soon.  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Loved this hotel!! Looked at many others hotels before deciding on this one and I'm so glad that I picked Doubletree. We got a 2 queen suite and it was perfect! Lots of room and the seperate sitting room was such a nice large space. The hotel staff was also really nice and helpful. Great stay for a Disney vacation.

Summary Heading: Clean Hotel, Good Service, Stealing Maids
Summary: This staff was friendly, the hotel was clean, rooms very nice, food good, but the last day of our visit we found the maid had stolen from us while cleaning the room - and she admitted to it!  This made the whole experience go down the tubes.  It is a good place to stay, but watch out for the maids.  Yes, a formal complaint was made to the manager.
Manager Response: Dear Terry G,  I want to be very clear about this:  our Room Attendant did not steal your balloon.    On the morning of your scheduled check out, you room attendant found your room vacant, with the exception of two balloons.  It is very common for hotel guests to leave balloons behind in their rooms when they depart, as they do not make good travel companions.  The balloons were removed & the room was cleaned.  After finishing your room, the attendant gave one of the balloons to a child she encountered.    When the room attendant was advised that the balloons were not intended for the trash, she felt awful.  It’s my understanding you were compensated $8 for your lost balloon.  I apologize that your balloons were mistaken for rubbish.  I’m glad your enjoyed the other aspects of your stay.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This a great family hotel. Excellent rooms and amenities,  friendly staff, reasonable prices, good restaurant, and close proximity to Disneyland. I wouldn't stay enaywhere else when visiting Disneyland.

We stayed here for three nights during our family Disney Christmas 2013.  I can say nothing bad about our stay.  Everything was perfect.  The staff was polite and the rooms clean.We really loved the cookies upon arrival.  Thanks!  We will stay here again if in the area.

This was a very nice hotel, clean and centrally located near the theme park. Parking was excellent, a lot of spaces with room to fit your car. The staff was helpful and friendly. The only concern was on our day to enter the theme park we were running late, so I ask the front desk how to get to Disney Land by car. He told me it was straight down the street. We went where he told us and it was the hotel and no entrance. The attendant said that entrance had been closed for thirteen years. Needless to say, we were late for our early morning. I would assumed a hotel staffer would certainly have this knowledge. Lesson learned, I need to Map Quest for myself. Other than that a good experience.

This was our 2nd stay and it was actually better than last time.  The front desk staff were more personable, and did their utmost to move us to a top floor room.  We were in 747 overlooking the side carpark and it was perfect - the noise was minimal, the room was clean, and the sofa bed was adequate.  We had 2 queen beds, which means there isn't a lot of room to store luggage if you have several suitcases.  But there is enough room in the lounge area to store.  The gym is small but good - a couple of machines, and a weights machine.  We didn't do any dining this time as we found the breakfast to be average last time.  Dennys across the road, and Starbucks downstairs were enough to get us started.  We had a mixup with a package but the General Manager has stepped in and taken

Summary Heading: very nice hotel and good proximity to Disney
Summary: We had a 1 bedroom suite for 2 nights a this hotel.  On arrival we were greeted with warm chocolate chip/nut cookies, which was a nice surprise.  Check in was speedy.  There is Free Wi-Fi.  Parking is $16 per day(unlimited in&out).  There is no Shuttle to Disney!!!!  Bus tickets are about $5 per person, and It's about mile and a half walk to Disney entrance.  So, for couples would be worth taking the bus, and avoiding the parking fee ($16) at Disneyland, plus it took us 45 minutes just to drive into the park and park our cars and walk about a mile into the gates!!!!  So, if I didn't have my two complaining teenagers, we would've just walked from the hotel to the entrance of Disney & been there quicker.  The rooms are very clean, spacious, 2 flat screen TVs, small empty fridge,

Excellent property and management. Front desk personnel very friendly and helpful.  The chocolate chips are almost "sinful"! They charge $16.00 a day to park which is a bit stiff, but considering the price of land it's probably justified. There was construction (new hotel and CVS) in the area however the room we were in we didn't hear it.  It was quite apparent outside the hotel. It is not as close to Disneyland as I'd prefer but it is "walkable" for most people. There is a bus pick-up point right in front of the property.

I can't seem to go wrong staying at the Doubletree so when I was in a last-minute crunch and trying to find a place to stay I stopped here and it worked out great. We were greeted by a friendly staff at the front desk. Even though we didn't have a reservation they were very help in getting us set up in a room with fair price. We enjoyed our room but loved the warm cookies.

done the 3 day Disney passes but stayed here overnight from Tijuana to vegas via la. nice place would consider here for Disney. if so visit the ART bus system. nice place and think the Hilton is a great option. as a 40yo 183 cm 120kg male, I got blisters on my feet from walking Disneyland alone. my 3 boys aged 6-12 were stuffed

My children and I had to quickly scramble to find a hotel close to Disneyland for 4 nights. We found this place, the day before our flight, and there was only one room left. I was apprehensive because of the steep rate but wouldn't hesitate, in the future. Upon arrival, we were exhausted and graciously greeted. The concierge quickly unloaded our large and abundant luggage. The front desk was very pleasant and had us checked in within minutes. The room was very spacious and impeccably clean. The bed was very plush and comfortable. Even the in room coffee was good, which is rare, in my experience. There was Starbucks on site and the restaurant, Agio, had very good food. With the breakfast you could special order omelets and kids under 13 eat free. Within the hotel is a Disney

We were there for a conference from 10 - 15 Dec'13, 7 nights.  The room comes with 2 queen size beds but they were so soft.  It sink in and distubed my partner in her sleep.  Our room also faced the nosiy compressor and do distubed our sleep.  The housekeeper removed our glasses and replaced with paper cups.  Wonder if they want to save some work.  We have to remind them but never replaced our glasses.   There was no bar fridge or any other mugs available.  The TV need not work well and sometime cannot be switch on.  Thank fully we do not need it as often.  The pillows were overly used as they were too soft for sleep.  There were food outletssuch as Starbuck at the hotel but great food need at least 15mins walk to places like Califonia pizza, Panda Chinese food Cheese cake

Summary Heading: A memorable trip and place to stay
Summary: We stayed here twice (total nights -12) during our 18 day holiday to the US.    From the time we stepped into the Hotel (after our long flight from New Zealand) to the time we departed we were made to feel so welcome. The cookies were an excellent start to the holiday and the location was very good.  We stayed at this hotel for all our trips within LA, including Universal Studios and a few shopping trips to South Coast Plaza!  All staff were very friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the resturant staff.    One example of the helpfulness was the effort they went to help find our iPod our daughter left in the room at the end of our first stay.   After one phone call they had found it (down the side of the comfy chair!) and they were very happy to courier it to us in San

after 17 hour flight from Dubai we were warmly welcomed by the friendly Mary at the front desk , Josh & Gary the super cooperative guest relation and concierge agents ,the gentleman at Diseny's welcome centre, and not to mention the helpful housekeeping staff... Literally we felt HOME!  we stayed 5 nights at room 509, the room was generously spacious, the view was spectacular, comfortable beds (you fall asleep immediately) very quite area though it is  almost 10 min. walk to Disney downtown and the theme parks.    Thank you Double Tree Anaheim , our memories in LA wouldn't be made without  you.

We stayed in a king suite, just the two of us. Great location, close to a Disneyland but also shopping and restaurants. Ate at the restaurant twice and room service twice. Both times, good food, great service and inexpensive. Clean, quiet and we will go back.

We selected the Doubletree Anaheim for our 3 day trip to Disney.  We flew Virgin America from PHL to LAX, and what a treat.  It is a wonderful airline and we would not hesitate to take it again.  The mood lighting on the plane does not seem important but it really helped with the jet lag.  The seat back tv/movie programing was so good that the kids didn’t even break out their ipads.  And the seatback ordering of food and drinks was a nice touch.  We landed in LAX and picked up a rental car from Avis.  Just a note- if you are planning on renting through Avis, sign up for their frequent drive preferred club online at least 2 weeks before you need to pick up your car.  The pickup line for the car was about 1.5 hours long (yes, 1.5 hours), but if you are preferred, you got dropped
Manager Response: Dear GNJL,  Thanks so much for your review.  Let me start my apologizing for the bellman you encountered.  Our bell staff are normally quite friendly & I regret you were given a less than friendly impression.  I will discuss your comments with the team.  Thank you for the compliments on the breakfast buffet.  Chef Rafael works hard to keep it fresh & inviting, recently adding the cooked to order eggs you mentioned.  He also offers several options for gluten free diners or vegetarians, like myself.  I agree the breakfast servers are terrific!   GNJL, I hope you & your family will visit us again soon.  We plan to wow you with great service, from start to finish.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: the staff is always friendly and rooms are clean, comfortable and ready for guests.  The hotel is a short shuttle ride away from Disneyland.  Disney Center located in the hotel will assist with Park Hopper Tickets for more than 2 day visits.  Would be nice if they also sold single day tickets.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle D,  Thank you so much for the kind review.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed your stay.  We will be sure to share your feedback about the Disneyland Tickets with their team.  I hope you’ll visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: It is good to have you there
Summary: We booked two suites from 25 till 3rd of November 2013. Arrived a little early and they manged one room while the other was given a little after. The rooms were interconnected and perfectly pleasant although furniture may benefit from revamp. Cleaning was done professionally and hotel were very much friendly. Parking was plenty and reasonably priced. Diseny is only short walking distance and plenty of restaurants around. Very much recommended.

Staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything. The rooms have a lounge area which was great as we stayed for over a week. There is a bar fridge (empty) and microwave in the room. The room service was fast but the food was pretty bland. The ART bus stops right outside the hotel making it easy to get around. Walking distance to many restaurants, target and disneyland. I would definitely stay here again.  I would not recommend the massage therapist that is recommended by the concierge (Cherie) - she is terrible and expensive.
Manager Response: Dear Psychick79,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review.  I’m glad to hear you enjoyed your visit & our guest service.  I will pass along your comments about room service to Chef Rafael.  He takes guest feedback quite seriously.  Regarding the masseuse, I have shared your feedback with the guest services team & asked that they expand the list of massage services offered to our guests.  Thanks again.  We hope you’ll visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This hotel provided a beautiful sanctuary from the hustle of Disneyland for our family. The quality and size of the rooms is excellent. The staff were  very friendly and helpful. Would recommend a stay at this hotel to anyone.

it was a last minute date for me and my husband and receptionist in front kinda have an attitude telling me that it's $149/night and have this look that i can't afford it as i was explaining to her i was trying to book on the app but it kicked me out. on the app it says that parking is $12/car and they charged as $16/car and we had 2 cars. we still stayed and paid as i can afford to stay there. it's just the parking that was an issue for me. and also the bath tub there was certain area that there are black things on the grout. other than that it was good. nice room.

This hotel offers great quality rooms within walking distance of Disneyland.    The hotel is a 20-25 minute walk to Disneyland or a 2-minute walk to the ART bus, which runs to Disneyland every 20 minutes.    There’s an am-pm convenience store across the road and it’s a 10-minute walk to the Garden Walk restaurants.  It also has loads of car parking and it is easy to access the I-5.  We stayed in a suite on the top floor.  It comprised a generous size bedroom, bathroom and living area.  The room had been renovated and included a fridge, microwave and good size in-room safe.  The shower was excellent and wifi was free.  Air conditioning did not seem that effective but it was not an issue.  All staff were pleasant and helpful.  There was a coin-operated laundry on the 7th floor so
Manager Response: Dear Hataitans,  Thanks so much for your review!  I’m so happy to hear you enjoyed the renovated suites.  I’m sorry about the air conditioning – it sounds like our efforts to be eco-friendly may have resulted in too much AC energy conservation.  Doubletree by Hilton really emphasizes guest service to the team & I’ll make sure they hear your positive comments.  Hataitans, I hope you & your family can visit us again soon.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Had a great time for a quick visit to D isneyland.  The Double Tree Suites is an excellent "home base" just minutes from the parks.  You can't beat the 1 bedroom suite set-up for young families.  We walked to the park without issues (my wife is 8 months pregnant) but if you have older, younger, or overweight people in your group you may want to opt for the bus:)

We stayed in a two room suite which was nice but living room is a bit crowded. Front desk service was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job. We had to pay for the ART bus to get back and forth to the park.

My wife, two daughters (ages 7 & 11) and I stayed at the Doubletree Suites Anaheim Resort for 3 nights during Thanksgiving week.  During our previous trip a few years back we stayed at the Grand Californian which is great since it is right by the park and has its own entrance, however the $1000 premium they charge for their location is a bit steep, so we tried Doubletree Suites.  We were all very pleased with this decision as this is a great hotel that offers value to its guests.    Hotel first impression We drove down from LA and arrived around 3:30PM.  First impression of the hotel is that it is well maintained and visually pleasing with many palm trees out front.  We parked out front and unloaded all of our luggage, a bellman came over to help us and he loaded up his cart.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but bad transpo to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was very nice.  I really liked the set up of the one-bedroom suite.  The best feature was that the bathroom had an entrance from the bedroom and the living room.  That is a feature I have not seen in other one-bedroom set ups and was very convenient.  The restaurant was good but needs new management (mainly to improve the service).  I only ate the breakfast buffet at the hotel.  It was good but the service was lackluster.  The biggest problem here was getting to Disneyland.  It is a fairly long walk.  I think at a brisk pace it would be about 20 minutes from the hotel to the gate.  If you have kids with you or walk slowly it will be longer.  The bus does stop right in front of the hotel, but is very unreliable.  Sometimes we got one right away, but several times we

The hotel is stunning.  The rooms are typical of a Doubletree and I love the separate living spaces. Having the microwave and mini fridge with freezer. It's a little beyond walking distance to Disney but very close to shuttles and other transportation.

Family 2A + 1C stayed for 5 nights specifically for Disneyland. Excellent location within easy walk to DL, or catch the ART bus at front door. Target 2 blocks down offers full supermarket facilities, only microwave in room though. Laundry services available. Overall a great experience and perfect for a family long stay. Cookies are wonderful!!
Manager Response: Dear Lyle T,  Thanks very much for your kind review!  I hope we'll see you & your family again soon.  Happy Holidays!  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms are clean and nice. The breakfast was sumptuously delicious with many choices of juice, cereals, breads, danish and a variety of hot food. You can order your eggs to be cooked the way you like. There's also a choice of teas to choose from. The service was good too. Location is near to Disneyland, about 5-10 minutes drive away. Carpark fees was expensive though at $16 per day. There are quite a number of restaurants nearby. We had dinner at Morton's Steakhouse, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Grand China restaurant if you like Chinese food.

OK, I should probably qualify that, since it's apples and oranges.  The last time we visited the parks we stayed at the Grand Californian. As I said in that review, what you are really paying for is proximity. And I will admit, after a long day we did look a bit longingly at the GC thinking "if we were staying there, we'd be home by now." But the difference in value is ridiculous. And frankly, proximity aside, this is probably a better hotel. It doesn't have the grand lobby, but it has better rooms and better food.  We had a car, and so we drove over to the parks rather than taking the tram. We found this to be pretty painless. In fact, we timed our departures to watch the fireworks from the parking structure, which provides a pretty nice venue in some ways. We were not napping
Manager Response: Dear ScholarGentleman,  Thank you very much for the great review!  I’m so glad to hear you enjoyed the hotel.  I’ll be sure to share your comments with our housekeeping team – this may be the first review that mentions their “ninja-like” skills.  I can’t agree with you more, they really are terrific.  I’m also happy to hear your comments about the wait staff in Agio, they are indeed outstanding.  Again, thank you for the kinds words.  I hope we see you & the entire family soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great HQ for Orange County visit
Summary: We stayed here while in Orange County and loved it; we had a 1 bedroom suite. Price was excellent as we arrived the Saturday after Thanksgiving. Room was larger than expected, 2 beds in bedroom and a couch in the living room. Plenty of room for our boys, comfortable to be in, and kept very clean. Great service everywhere we interacted with the staff. It has an onsite ticket site for Disney, has Starbucks coffee at their café, has an in-house restaurant, and has a heated pool. 3 large blocks from Disney but we made the walk twice, but you can catch the ART bus system or take taxis as well. We went to the Medieval Times, to both Disney parks, and to the Pacific Science Museum form here.

Summary Heading: They need to define across the street
Summary: We booked this hotel and was told we would be across the street from the parks. This hotel is three blocks from the parks. This was there only negative, everything  else was great. Room was very comfortable and clean. Front desk staff very friendly and alert to guests waiting for assistance.

My family and I have stayed at a lot of hotels for our trips; this one remains a favorite.  Stellar treatment from every staff member, gorgeous lobby and facilities, incredible room and tons of space to sprawl out.  This hotel, and this BRAND remain a favorite for us.

The best place to stay on Harbor Blvd.  Reasonably priced rooms, friendly staff, handy parking, cookies, super comfortable beds, good size bathrooms with plenty of counter space.  I hate hotel bathrooms that do not have adequate space to leave my blow dryer and makeup bag out, like the Hyatt down the street.  Families and couples alike will be comfortable there.

Wow. The Doubletree suites did not disappoint. With a family of four, I wanted to find a place that offered enough sleeping space, a clean hotel and a breakfast option. Normally, I would have booked Embassy Suites or a Best Western as they offer 1 bedroom options and a nice breakfast buffet. However, for this trip to Disneyland, I wanted to try somewhere new and based on other reviewers, Doubletree Suites seemed like a great option. And it was! The outside of the hotel is well maintained and beautiful, the interior and lobby areas are very clean and very upscale looking. Check in was smooth and warm chocolate chip cookies were offered up upon check in. The best. Our 1 bedroom suite was the perfect size with a sofa bed in the living room area, mini fridge and microwave. The
Manager Response: Dear Shrka_Boy,  Thank you so much for the great review!  Sounds like our Bed & Breakfast package was a perfect fit.  Chef Rafael works hard to keep the breakfast option diverse & inviting.    I’m very happy to hear your comments on cleanliness.  I’m totally biased but I feel our Housekeeping team is just fantastic.    In the future, you may want to take advantage of the ART transit system, an affordable shuttle system that picks up every 20 minutes in front of the hotel.  Thanks again for the nice words.  I hope you & your family will return soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I am high maintenance when it comes to hotels - this location has got to be the number and my favorite for visiting Disneyland.  I will use them from now on.  I have stayed at all the Disneyland properties (all three of them).  Read my pros and cons below:  PROS - The corporate rate was excellent $107/night, but even if we didn't get it, I would highly suggest booking this location - Super clean, I've been at 4-5 star and they are not this clean...you feel stuff in the carpet or dust, nothing here. - Staff are helpful and very pleasant...and don't expect tip, but I do tip them.  When I go to other hotels, I get a sense the employees expect regardless of quality of service. - Transportation to and from Disneyland on ART was so easy, hassle free and on time 90% of our four days
Manager Response: Dear TammieG_1967,  Thank you so much for your kind review of the hotel!  I’m so happy to hear you & your daughter enjoyed your visit. The Disneyland Resort during the holidays is just gorgeous & everyone needs to see it at least once.    I’m glad you were able to take advantage of the Kids Eat Free Program – it’s one of our best kept secrets.  The view on the 7th floor you enjoyed is available to all hotel guests & Hilton Honors guests now have the 5th floor all to themselves.    I’m going to share your review with the hotel team.  I think housekeeping & the restaurant team will be especially pleased with your comments.  Thanks again for the great review.  I hope you’ll come back & see us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We always try to stay at different hotels when at Disneyland. This was our 10th visit in the last 7 years. I saw favorable reviews for Doubletree Suites and thought we'd give it a stay for 3 nights. I was very impressed with how extremely nice and professional the entire hotel staff was from the person who checked us in (with 2 warm chocholate chip cookies), to the gift shop cashier, to the restaurant servers and the cleaning staff. They treated you as if you were staying in a 5 star hotel which maybe they should be considered.  What this did make me notice was how much in contrast their friendlyness was to the personnel at Disneyland. To go off track for a second, it seems to me the Disneyland personnel have really lost their shine and ultra friendly customer service attitude

Summary Heading: Pleasant, clean, spacious and good service!
Summary: This was a whirlwind "overnighter" as we made a 2-day visit to Disneyland Resort.  The rooms were great with a separate living area and bedroom, and very comfortable with  2 TV's and extra amenities such as a small refrigerator and microwave.  The staff was absolutely excellent!  Everyone from the front desk to the wait staff in the restaurant was pleasant and did a great job at making us comfortable and welcome.  This was not our first Disney "overnighter" but this will definitely be the hotel of our choice in the future.
Manager Response: Dear MikePsp,  Thank you for such a nice review! I’m so happy to hear you enjoyed our facilities – but more importantly, our staff.  Service excellence is job #1 at our hotel.  I’ll be sure to tell the entire team about your review. I hope you will be able to join us again for a longer stay in the future.  Thanks again!  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: One bedroom Suite overlooking the pool area. Clean, Quiet well appointed room.  Walk to Disneyland 15 mins Excellent Breakfast first class service throughout the hotel. Nothing was a problem from Check in to  Check out.

Summary Heading: New rooms at the Doubletree Are Super!
Summary: Love the hotel and the service is great.  A huge upgrade from the usual awful hotels across the street from Disneyland.  Worth the drive or trip on the bus vs convenience of walking.  It's that good.  Room service was great and made up for a mistake with a pint of ice cream, yum!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Staff and facilities were excellent.  Inbound stop to Disneyland right across the street.  Outbound stop from Disneyland right in front of hotel. Decent gift shop/supplies store in hotel. Disney Welcome Center in hotel.

the hotel staff were very helpful, courteous, and efficient.  I would highly recommend the hotel for families and business travel.  the location was great for Disneyland, and the surrounding area was nice and we felt very secure

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, just Mae sure you don't get room 239
Summary: We arrived for a 4 night stay earlier then check in time on a Thursday and they  were able to check us in early. We got room 239. Nothing wrong with the room. Very clean, spacious etc. but we found out later at night that it is on top of the guest laundry and yes you can hear the machines spinning all night. Luckily because of the monotone sound you automatically fall asleep. The next day in the  evening there were about 20 girls running around the hallway in their pjs they made so much noise that we couldn't hear the tv anymore. We talked to them a couple of times without any success so we called the front desk. They send somebody up to talk to them which helped for a couple of minutes. Then the front desk call us. They wanted to relocate us because apparently there were 6

We are just leaving the hotel after a four night stay.  Overall it was clean and everyone was very helpful.  We took the ART bus back and fourth to Disneyland from the hotel which was very convenient. The stop is right in front of the hotel.  We ordered room service a few times and their salads were great.  Starbucks coffee in the lobby was a bonus.
