We were in town for the Me um Auction.  Stayed here for convenience and it was.  Friendly staff quick check in walking distance to convention center.  Clean room convey bed great view of Disney and fireworks.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Dave C,  Thanks for the nice review!  I’m glad you enjoyed your stay during the Mecum Auto Auction.  The cars featured were amazing & the Anaheim Convention Center is a perfect fit for an event of the size.  Disneyland does such a terrific fireworks show & I am so happy you could enjoy it from the comfort of your room.  Dave, I hope you will join us again soon.  Have a great day!  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The hotel was clean, friendly and comfortable.  It was close to Disneyland and close to other places.  It was perfect for our family who has two young kids.  We got the suite and it allowed us to put our kids to bed and be able to stay awake in a different room.  Book it you wont be sorry.

Summary Heading: Cost vs Convenience Tradeoff for Disneyland
Summary: We were in Anaheim for 5 nights to attend Disney's D23 Expo and of course visit the parks. The on-site Disney hotels are extremely expensive, and we were having a hard time justifying the price premium. Since we are partial to Hilton family of hotels, this Doubletree hotel caught our attention with its favorable reviews and decent proximity to the convention center & the parks. We were pleased with the hotel itself - clean, spacious rooms, free wifi, comfortable beds. And it's a reasonable walking distance to the convention center which worked well for us. However, after long days at the expo, it was tiresome to then have to walk back to the hotel to freshen up, and walk again to the parks (to do yet more walking!). My feet couldn't take it after a couple days, and so we bought

We have stayed with Double Tree in Colorado before and we liked it, but we really liked it in Anaheim! The room was freshly redone and it smelled great. Close to Disney and even the parking lot seemed cleaner. They had a notice that construction was going on and they apologized for any noise we might here, but we heard nothing.     The layout of the room was great. It was compact but felt spacious at the same time. The cookies at check-in were a big hit with the kids. The property altogether was very lovely. We only stayed for one night but wish we could have stayed longer. The only complaint I have (which isn't a complaint) is that one of our children may have left my husband's sunglasses in the room...if anyone finds some wood-looking sunglasses, let me know! :o)
Manager Response: Dear clmcam1109,  Thank you so much for your kind review.  Boy, am I glad to hear the renovations didn’t disturb your family during your visit.  We’re very pleased with the end results – I am very fond of the new chocolate brown guestroom carpet in particular.  I do have some sad news, though.  We located your reservation but unfortunately couldn’t find your husband’s sunglasses.  If anything turns up, we will definitely get in touch.  We hope you’ll join us for a longer stay in the future.  Thanks again for the compliments.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Just a mile from Disneyland - a great value
Summary: Great couple or family location for Disney fans. This is a designated Disneyland hotel so you can buy your Disneyland or California Adventure tickets hear and avoid the lines at Disney.  If the short mile walk to the park is too long at the end of the day (or the beginning for young ones) you can avoid the cost of parking at Disney by purchasing a multi-hotel shuttle bus pass for the day.  You can use it multiple times/day and its under $10/person.  That being said, the hotel now charges for parking at $16/day - so add that into your overall costs... now on to the hotel.  This is a lovely Doubletree, conveniently located, with a restaurant and bar on site.  You receive your Doubletree warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival.  Valet service to help you with your bags is

Summary Heading: Excellent for Disney at an affordable price
Summary: I loved the stay at this Doubletree on S. Harbor Blvd for a Disneyland vacation.  The hotel is very quaint and the service was fantastic all around.  We were looking for something outside of Disney but close enough to get there easily, and this was the place.  To get to Disney we were only 5 mins away, which was decent.  You can purchase tickets right at the hotel to avoid some line ups at the gate, which I would recommend.  (the only ones they didn't sell were Disney California 1 day passes, for some reason) so I found out that the line ups can be busy at the gate.  We stayed in November, so getting cooler out, the pool and hot tub are located on the roof deck of one of the levels, but they were actually decent temp.  The hot tub was good for kids to sit in, yet there were kids

We so appreciated the two queen beds with the pull-out couch so we could all stay together.  The beds were very comfortable and the room was nice.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful!  We will stay here again when going to Disneyland!!
Manager Response: Dear Natalie H,  Thanks so much for the great review!  Your review is going up on the employee bulletin board with lots of highlighter & smiley faces.  I’m glad to hear you enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Chef Rafael works hard to come up with appealing options for everyone.  Thank you for staying with us.  We hope you'll visit us again soon.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Friendly and attentive staff made this hotel a great choice.  It's two room suites are perfect for families with little ones.  Breakfast buffet had a lot to offer.  We stayed the following night at the Hilton Anaheim and we thought the value and comfort of the DoubleTree was superior to the Hilton at the convention center.  Overall we were extremely pleased with the price, service, and value of this hotel.

We had some issues with Housekeeping, however they were resolved. Very spacious 1 Bedroom two queen beds suite. Overall the hotel was nice.   The beds were very comfortable. We will probably stay here for future Disneyland trips.
Manager Response: Dear Sandra L,  Thank you for your review.  I'm sorry you faced a challenge with Housekeeping.  I can assure you that they are normally the best of the best.  I'm glad to hear you enjoyed the Sweet Dreams beds - they are so comfortable that we employees even buy them for our homes.  We hope you'll choose our hotel again the next time you are in Anaheim.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This place was fantastic. From the cookies on arrival, to the friendly service to the cleaning staff. Not a bad word to say.  We were here for a holiday to visit Disneyland and our excitement was bouyed by such great service from the moment we arrived.   Close to all amenities, food, Disneyland a walk or short shuttle ride, shopping it was a great place to stay.  The extra space of a suite is a added bonus.

Really enjoyed my two day stay at this hotel. I came for business, but this is a great hotel to stay at for business or if you are visiting Disney. Separate rooms for sleeping and watching TV. great view of pool and fireworks. Hotel was CLEAN, staff was so nice and lobby was great.

We stayed in Doubletree for our stay here to head to Disneyland. The proximity to Disneyland was great (we walked with the stroller), but there's always the US$5/adult for the return shuttle.  The room was great. It had enough space for the 2 toddlers to play around and be comfortable too.

I was fully satisfied of the services received at this hotel.  All the staff were very accommodating, very pleasant and they are very patient.  I will recommend this place to my friends.  The Banquet Captain named Jose was very nice and will really do his best to make your event a memorable one.  Thank you to all the staff of doubletree suites

Stayed here on business, and was very comfortable and clean.  It's not a high end hotel if you ask me,  but for my purposes it was great. The suites are roomy, because they have a living area as well as a bedroom. Although they are small in size, the two together works well. The staff was kind and helpful, and who doesn't love those freshly baked cookies upon arrival?! There isn't valet parking, so I think $16 for self park is a bit steep,  but again, since it was business, I wasn't paying.   Overall it was a great place for a quick trip. Enjoy your trip!

With so many options near Disneyland, Ca. it can be difficult to make the best choice. This property is about a 10-15 minute walk from the gates near the Convention Center. We chose this hotel because they offered spacious suites.Yes the seating area could use an update but the bed was very comfortable for a decent sleep. The lobby, pool & restaurant were all clean, well kept & modern.The staff are both courteous & helpful.
Manager Response: Dear LaurieR58,  Thank you so much for your kind review.  In October, we completed a multi-million dollar renovation of the hotel.  I think you will be quite pleased with the changes we've made to our living room furniture, drapes & carpeting.  We hope you'll return to see the updates.  Thanks again.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This hotel was idea for our visit to Disneyland and the Huntington Beach area. Very quiet and comfortable suite for my husband and our daughter and her boyfriend. Room was always very clean and tidy upon our return. No loud noises in the hall to wake us up early in the morning was a big plus. Enjoyed the hot cookies too!

Our family with 2 young children really enjoyed our stay here during our recent trip to Disneyland. We especially enjoyed the warm, chocolate chip cookie at check-in. We upgraded to the 2 room suite. Having the bar fridge and microwave is a must for our family. The space is well thought out with plenty of storage space (shelving) for items if you are making this your base for more than a few days. The beds were super comfortable. It is about a 25 minute walk (1-way) to Disney Maingate which our kids didn't mind (age 4 and 7). Aqio, the on site restaurant served excellent food as well, which was a pleasant surprise because we were the only guests there at first. After previously staying at one of the hotels right across Disney Maingate, which we found was somewhat worn due, we

This hotel was the best value for anyone going to stay in Anaheim for Blizzcon. The room we got was split 4 ways and ended up being only about $40 a night each. The rooms were very clean and the beds were actually quite comfortable, except the pillows kinda fall underneath the headboard.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We've stayed in many hotels in the Anaheim area over the last few years, the Hilton Doubletree is far and away the best. From the moment we arrived til we left it really felt like something special, we must have been down to the front desk 4 or 5 times just to tell them how amazing they were compared to all the other hotels in the area, including the Hilton on Convention Drive.   This will be our hotel from now on when we visit Anaheim each year, no-one else comes close to being as good in our experience.

I had a very spacious King room that was nicely furnished and had been recently remodeled.  Staff was friendly and professional.  I was there for 3 nights and my timing was not the best as the rate was jacked up due to a convention going on at the same time.  Location was great to access the Convention Center and Disneyland.  Even though I thought the rate was a little high, I would still recommend due to the quality of room and overall property as well as the location.

We picked this room mostly because of the price.  We were pleasantly surprised when we got there.  The staff was great, the hotel really nice.  The breakfast buffet was a little pricey but with the kids eat free it was a great deal, might be a lot if you don't have kids with you.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our "No kids" vacation. We had a wonderful time. The hotel was clean, the staff was wonderful, and we will most definitely stay here again.  The first night at the hotel we experienced a group of very loud kids parting in the next room. Once we notified the hotel staff, they were able to immediately remedy the situation.  The next morning the hotel management offered to move us to a different room and move our luggage while we were at Disneyland. When we arrived back at the hotel all that was promised was completed, and we were greeted with a friendly staff member who apologized for any convinced.  Extra Bonus.. The breakfast buffet is wonderful in the morning, well worth the money.   If your there to visit Disney it was a very nice

I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Double Tree by Hilton, Los Angeles, 16-19 Oct. 2013. The room was clean, very comfortable and nice decorated. I enjoy every minute spent there. The staff was very friendly and help me with anything. The continental breakfast was OK, not to many food to choose from, but it was not bad. I would come back there again.

This DoubleTree is great. Rooms are spacious,  customer service is fantastic and the restaurants/cafe are very convenient. I was surprised at the $16/day parking fee upon arrival but am unaware of how it compares with nearby hotels.

My family stayed here for four nights on our recent Disneyland trip. We have four kids.  We were able to have two kids stay with my relatives in another room..so we had plenty of room with the two queen beds and sofa suite. It would have been a little cramped with our four kids in one room.     I was very happy here because I really wanted to stay in a clean hotel. I am paranoid about bedbugs and this hotel had no reports on the bedbug registry. It is also only 3 years old.  The rooms were very clean. I love that the beds have white down comforters that are covered in sheets as well. The pillows are down too. I slept very comfortably each night.     We were right next to the ice machine...but we didn't hear a thing.       We had the buffet breakfast included in our stay. It was

We took our annual family trip to Disneyland in October 2013.  The main portion of our stay was on Disney property but we stayed at the Doubletree the night before our Disney stay began.  We picked this location for its proximity to Disney since we weren't sure what we were going to do that afternoon/evening.  We loved this hotel - from the warm cookies at check-in, to the friendly staff, to the suite rooms, we were very pleased.  Our room had 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a pull-out couch with sitting chairs and desk in the other room.  We all slept comfortably here.  And the shower was the BEST of our trip (which consisted of stays in 4 different hotels) - I love a good shower with a nice powerful water stream and this one did not disappoint. The free internet was easy to

Always enjoy my stay at this Double Tree! The rooms are clean, the beds and pillows are very comfy. The employees are always helpful and very nice. It is also within walking distance to Disneyland and shopping.

Summary Heading: A Great Place if you're visiting Disneyland
Summary: Perfect accommodations if you're a family visiting Disneyland.  We were a family with 3 children and the suite at Doubletree was perfect for us.  The bedroom is completely separated from the sitting room making it quite easy to put the kids to bed early after a big day at Disneyland.  The warm chocolate chip cookies we re a big bonus and the kids really enjoyed asking for one every time we went through the hotel lobby.  It will definitely be our place to stay on the next Disneyland visit.

The Doubletree Suites is perfectly situated for a visit to the Disneyland parks.  Within 15 minutes walking, you can leave your car parked at the hotel, close to shops and restaurants.  Hotel was clean and room was perfectly sized for a family of 5.  We'll stay there again when we return to the area with no hesitations.

Great place to stay and close to Disneyland. Paid for our stay in full at booking. Paid for early check in as well.... no early check in! Was offered another room for an additional $28 a night... really?

I originally booked here because the conference hotel of a conference I was attending was full. I was blown away! The airline lost my luggage and the front desk clerk was understanding and immediately set me up with toiletries, the staff was extremely attentive to detail. The food was excellent. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful with incredible gourmet salsa. Even the way the lemons were put in the water seemed reminiscent of an expensive hotel. The rate was great, especially for a suite. I will definitely come back with my family.

The hotel staff provided excellent service during my recent stay.  My room was exceptionally clean. The front desk staff were very friendly and well trained. The restaurant staff provided excellent service and the food was very good.  I had a great experience using this hotel and I would gladly return.
Manager Response: Dear SadieMT,  I’m very sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your recent stay at our hotel.  Your comments have been relayed to our Housekeeping department for follow up. Guest satisfaction is extremely important to us and we apologize for letting you down. I thank you for your review and I really hope you'll give us a second chance if your travels bring you back to Anaheim.  Warm Regards,   Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: It was an excellent stay & very convenient to nearby attractions & restaurants. This was an family trip to Disney & the beach. Service was excellent, Value good, slept well, Very clean, great location & room.

I really expected more from this property.  The parking charge was exorbitant at $16 night...do not pay it...there is on street parking nearby.  Our room smelled Iike insecticide and the grout in the bathroom was a mess.  The coffeemaker would not make two cups at one time.  The onsite restaurant was a ripoff despite good reviews.  Definitely would not return.
Manager Response: Dear SadieMT,  I’m very sorry to hear that you did not have a pleasant experience at our hotel.   Guest satisfaction is extremely important to us and we apologize for letting you down. I will be sure to keep your feedback in mind as we're always working to improve our overall guest experience.   I thank you for your review and I really hope you'll give us a second chance if your travels bring you back to our area.  Best Regards,	  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Conveniton Center

Summary: We are Disneyland Hotel guests for over twenty years but this DoubleTree Hotel surprised us with their excellent service and friendly staff. And, yes, we can be bribed with cookies. We wish this hotel was just a bit closer to the Disneyland Resort but we loved everything else about our stay.

Visiting Disneyland was as magical as we anticipated, but the stay at this DoubleTree made the weekend perfect.  We were able to watch the fireworks from our room and the breakfast is such a wonderful amenity.  Something for everyone!

Summary Heading: Very small fitness center and rooms
Summary: Calling the fitness center a closet would be generous.  Even by Hampton Inn  standards, this was a poor fitness center.  My King room as really small.  The chair to the desk actually bumped up to the bed.

Much friendlier than other Hilton Hotels I have visited. Immaculately clean, newly refurbished rooms. We had a 2 queen bed suite on top floor (7th). Breakfast was good quality but there is also a Denny's across the road. 20 minute walk to Disney park entrance, bit longer coming home with tired legs! Shuttle is available at 5 dollars each per day. We arrived at 11am - checkin not until 3 - so left our bags with bell service and headed to parks. Can't fault the hotel, others are a bit closer but may not be as comfortable for the price paid.

this is a very clean and modernly furnished hotel.  it is quiet around all the busy disneyland properties. The front desk staff, especially Maria, is kind and professional. they even give you a warm cookie when you arrive. great hotel to get some rest near the attractions.

Summary Heading: Good and bad experience this time around
Summary: First the positives - the location is great, walkable to restaurants and Disneyland. We were able to walk back with our sleeping kids on 2 occasions and transfer them straight to bed. The rooms are a decent size, we had a 1 bedroom suite which was ample space for our family of 4. We also had breakfast included in our rate at Agio Restaurant which was nice each morning. The self laundry was handy ($1.50 per wash, $1.75 per dry).  Now the negatives - we had checked out on Wednesday afternoon as we were leaving that evening. We placed our bags in our friends' room who we're staying on. Unfortunately my son became ill and we had to stay another night. When we arrived back at the hotel, both my husband and son covered on vomit, we were shown no compassion or assistance (ie towels,
Manager Response: Dear Emma1975,  Thank you for your review.  I’d like to apologize for the way the hotel staff handled the situation with your ill son, we should have shown a lot more empathy.  In addition, I’d like to apologize for the difficulty you encountered while extending your stay, we should not have made the process so challenging.  Please know this is not the excellent service our hotel is known to provide.  Again, please accept our apologies for your experience.  Sincerely,

Summary: Good hotel in good location, near the convention center. Excellent facilities, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast with very friendly staff. Good value for money. I know where to stay next time I visit Anaheim.

I stayed here on business for five days.  The staff were very helpful when I needed cab service, a cookie, a newspaper, and simply advice on where to get a good dinner in the area.  The room was clean, very quiet, and the bed was very comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here while attending a conference in Anaheim. The hotel was close to the convention center, clean, quiet, in good overall condition, the staff was great and the beds were really comfortable. There were plenty of restaurants near by and Disney is just a few blocks away.

My wife and I enjoyed a great 3 night stay at the DoubleTree Suites in Anaheim.  Our son, daughter-in-law & 2 grandkids were in a separate room as well.  Easy walking to Disneyland & CA Adventure parks - less than a mile.  Great food at the hotel restaurants and overall service at the hotel was excellent.

We stayed here for my husband's 30th birthday and the Doubletree definitely delivered in making it a special stay. They upgraded us from a standard room to a suite and surprised us with a cheese and fruit platter, sparkling apple cider, cake, chocolate covered strawberries, and even balloons!! My husband felt like the Doubletree went the extra mile to make his birthday special and he certainly appreciated it. We also enjoyed the great location since it was very close to Disneyland. The breakfast buffet was good as well and the staff was very nice. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay and will be back in the future!
Manager Response: Dear MHB B,  Thank you so much for the review!  I'm so happy your husband had a great birthday.  I'm glad to see you enjoyed the breakfast buffet, our Chef works hard to keep it fresh & inviting.  We hope to see you both again soon - perhaps for your anniversary?  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed a couple of nights here and were pleased with attitude, cleanliness and location. The downside is the expensive car park fee they don't tell you about -    $16  a day. I felt this was a cheat as I wasn't told about the charge, just informed to park in the car park . Other than that , don't bother staying at a Disney resort hotel, this is better value Not the hotels fault but ART who run the shuttle are useless, unreliable and tell lies about their service, I ended up walking the  half mile rather than wait another 45 mins

We really loved this hotel. Clean. Comfortable. Suites are lovely. Staff were lovely. Friendly and knowledgeable but professional too. Free wifi.  Restaurant served very fresh food. Good choice and quality and very reasonably priced. Especially breakfast. Not worth going out to a local diner.  Very easy to get to Disney from here. $5 each for a day rover on the shuttle bus.

Summary Heading: What a Pleasure - Glad this was my choice
Summary: I am attending a conference and currently in the third night of a four-night stay at the Doubletree-Anaheim Convention Center.  What a pleasure to stay here!  The staff are extremely helpful and very friendly, especially the front desk staff and the porter staff.  I had to ship two very large FedEx boxes out in advance of the convention and the guys were great about helping me with them.  They also offered to help me ship them back/call in the request to FedEx, without my prompting them.  I really appreciate that.  I also like the housekeeper - very quick and very efficient.  Things that have stood out thus far:  1. Great beds, great pillows.  Very much needed after a six-hour flight and then schlepping to/walking around the Anaheim Convention Center each day. 2. Great room
Manager Response: Dear CoralGablesGirl,  Thank you so much for your kind review!  I have to agree with you about the front desk and bell staff – they are terrific.  We also have a talented culinary team in place and they will be quite happy to hear you enjoyed your room service meals so much.  We’ll look into the closet situation and see if there’s anything that can be done.  Again, thank you so much for your kind words.  We hope to see you again soon.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager,  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: From the time I checked in through out the stay and when I checked out, the staff was pleasant and helpful.  They were quick to respond and resolve to an issue I had in the room.  I enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim.

This hotel, with the suite floor plan - bedroom with separate living (2 TVs!) is perfect for family stays.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  We came dragging in late after 13 hours at Disney, and the front desk staff offered us those great cookies they give away upon check in.  Pretty thoughtful.  The hotel was also very clean considering how many young children stay there.  It was great being within walking distance of Disneyland - no parking headaches.  However, if we needed our car, parking was very easy and convenient at the hotel.  Great stay.

Summary Heading: Better than the Anaheim Hilton Convention Hotel
Summary: If you are attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center I recommend you consider the Double Tree over the Hilton. It is walking distance to the Hilton and the Convention Center but less expensive with better aminities.

I stayed here two years ago and am delighted to see that the standards haven't dropped. The bed is the reason why I stayed here again and oh my goodness did it give me an uninterrupted sleep. The location to Disney is great, the breakfast is tasty and the room is all you'll need for your stay.  I've now stayed here twice and ill be back in the states in may, so I'm sure ill be staying here again. The cookie, the beds, the service. All wonderful. It's that simple.

I stayed in the hotel for 1 week during my visit to Anaheim for Citrix Synergy 2013. The best thing was the hotel is next to Anaheim Convention Center , so it was very for me to come back to hotel in between if required.  Rooms were very good and clean. Beds were comfortable, and I slept well. It was very important for me because I travelled from other side of the world and had jet lag. In all I enjoyed my stay.

Summary Heading: Doubletree in Anaheim Great for Families
Summary: Rented 3 rooms for my family to go to Disneyland and the hotel and staff are wonderful.  Beds are super!  Just far enough away from Disneyland to excape the noise and traffic and close enough to take a short shuttle to the theme park.  This is our second visit as a family and we will come back.

Summary Heading: Nice alternative to Disney Resort hotels
Summary: Stayed two nights for quick trip as passholder. Normally stay at one of three on site hotels but this was budget trip.  Called and told them I was going to arrive late. Got there at 3 am and they had charged no show fee because I wasn't there by midnight.  Oh well, too bad for you response. Why call? Room was a two bed queen suite.  For two the bedroom seems cramped and we didn't really use the separate room.  Should have just got the 2 bed queen for 113 a night. They are very roomy.  This room was132 a night. Bed extremely comfortable. Shuttle to DL was $5 a day and can be purchased at front desk.  This hotel is also a visitor center for Disney meaning you can buy park tickets at hotel (as long as person at that counter isn't at lunch😏). Parking is 16 dollars a day(24hour
Manager Response: Dear Mizejm,  Thank you so much for your review.  It sounds like there were a few missteps during your visit and I’d like to apologize.  We should have made you feel welcome, regardless of what time you arrived.  Also, your room should have been cleaned while you were away at the Disneyland Resort.  I will also pass your comments about the gift shop on to its owner.  Once again, I apologize for your experiences.  I hope you will give us another opportunity to show you the excellent service the Doubletree Suites by Hilton is known to provide.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I had a great stay at this hotel. It was conveniently located close to Disney. The room was good size and I had no complaints. The bed was comfy & I loved the warm chocolate chip cookie upon arrival. I got a great price by paying ahead. All staff I interacted with were nice. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear A_Rick1,  I'm really happy to hear you enjoyed your recent visit.  I was also pleased to see you booked an Advanced Purchase rate, our most affordable option.  I hope you'll come stay with us again soon.  We recently renovated and I think you'll really enjoy the results.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Clean and Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here during the week from 9/3-9/5. The suite was clean when we arrived. New towels provided everyday. We booked the deal through Costco and parking for the two days were included which I didn't know so that was a plus. Staff were friendly and helpful. My room key was demagnetized from my money clipp and staff was quick to replace my key with another one.   The hotel is not that far from Disneyland. I think it is walking distance but some may disagree. I was here for my anniversary and we had dinner next door at the Ruth Chris.  Before heading to Disneyland we ate at the Denny's across the street. There are a lot of fast food joints and a supermarket near by.  I will definitely be returning to this hotel the next time I'm in town.

It's way BETTER than Double Tree Marina @ San Pedro, CA they have a nice view but cleanliness especially bathroom is way too far. Bathroom is reflection of how clean a person is. Remember that bathroom and Kitchen is the most critical place in home, hotel etc.

In town for a quick business trip in Anaheim. Location and proximity to the Convention Center is great. Really nice property, newly renovated. Great rate, service and the cookie is always a nice touch.
Manager Response: Dear Jdentremont,  I'm glad to hear to enjoyed our newly renovated rooms.  I hope you and your family can join us again for vacation when you can really enjoy the Anaheim Resort area.  Thanks for the kind words.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Great Value, perfect family spot in Anahiem.
Summary: We stayed with a family of five, for 4 nights. The staff were all very helpful, the breakfast was a treat with kids eat free for each paying adult. There a many local dinning options also. We walked an easy 20 minute stroll to Disney land from the hotel, however if you are planning a big day at the parks, and coming home late, then the bus which stops right out front is the best option, the hotel sells the tickets, we used this option two days of the three we spent at Disney land. We would stay again.

I have been using this hotel for over 7 years, and have never been disappointed!  The recent remodel is very nice.  The rooms are wonderful, big fluffy towels, very spacious.  The staff is very attentive, warm and helpful.  Ask for the bellman Javier or Josh, and you get amazing service.

This was the perfect hotel for my family of 5 doing and a one night stay in between the two Disney parks. We had a queen suite that fit our needs perfectly. Hotel was clean and the service was incredible. I booked the bed and breakfast option, which I highly recommend. The food selection was perfect for a quick bite before heading to the park. My only complaint is that the hotel does not have a shuttle. Whereas the walk isn't that bad (15-20 minutes), a shuttle would be nice.

Summary Heading: Double Tree by Hilton - Excellent place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed at the hotel 4 days.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.   The room was spacious and very clean.  The hotel restaurant food was excellent and reasonable priced.    Definitely would stay at this hotel again!

We enjoyed the stay very much.  The prior stay at a Doubletree went very badly, so we were glad when the process was so well done.  Nice property, great people they work to fill needs before we needed them filled.  Only negative, was the sink area in our room had no separation from the sleeping area.  When I awoke early, I had to awaken my family to clean up.

I had hoped to keep this place a secret but I think it was so amazing other families need to know about this GREAT option for hotel stays near Disneyland. We are annual passholders and usually stay on property but on our most recent last minute trip couldn’t get in so I apprehensively booked at DoubleTree. I am SO glad we found this place!! I now have a great option for my family of 5, clean, comfortable and felt very “high end”.  We did have to drive (less than a mile) to the park but it was worth it. The pool was quaint, the restaurant was good and they had a nice bar for relaxing after a long day in the parks. This is my new “go to” hotel!

Very happy with this hotel. Very clean, great service and atmosphere. The concierge Josh was extremely helpful.  The room exceeded our expectations.  You can get the ART bus right out the front of the hotel.  The cookie you get, for free, every day is delicious. Feel free to ask for one when you feel like it, we were told that and glad we were =) Would happily stay here again. Thank you for an enjoyable experience.

Stayed for an overnight in a newly renovated room with my family. The room was clean, well designed and maintained. Service was excellent and delivered with a smile!   The room we were in was a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The layout was spacious and fit our family of 4 very comfortably.   Very satisfied with this visit!

Summary Heading: Great location to Disney - not so sure about $16 car parking charge
Summary: Well located hotel - 20 minute walk from Disney, so need to take the car. I am sure they charge the $16 to match Disney car parking fee, which would be our only groan. Not sure why people complain about no free shuttle, the distance is not that great to the parks, there are buses up and down Harbor Blvd for those that really dont want to walk.  As we were travelling from Manhattan Beach and wanted to maximise our time at Disney we managed to get an early check in at 11.00, which was fantastic.  Cookie on arrival was welcome. We had breakfast on one morning, which was good value and after Angels game had a drink and a bite to eat in the bar, which was fine.  Room had only been refurbished the week beofore and there was a pleasant smell of new furniture and carpets.  Would

Last year we had a great time so we decided to come back this year.  Again this hotel is well located, very comfortable and with very good staff.  The parking is convenient and buffet breakfast is very good.  We loved it for the second time.

Very nice facility.  Restaurant was a pleasant surprise.  Pool exercise area looked very welcoming, though we didn't use the service.  Bell person was helpful.  Room service was prompt and personnel pleasant.  Beds were comfortable. Hotel is a bit farther from the Disney, though site restaurant was good.  We used taxi's to go to various places, which was easier than the ART for us.

Many hotels near Disneyland offer suites, but few have a door that creates two separate bedroom areas.  This is why I choose this hotel, but the service was outstanding.  We were traveling with little ones and had lots of baby equipment in room.  Also we ate in every night so empty food containers & every day the maid service, did magic picking up the room.  Front desk people very helpful!  Best Disneyland stay ever and at a fantastic price!

Summary Heading: The Hotel that fits the brief for a Kiwi
Summary: We stayed 10 nights at the Double Tree Suites on 2085 S Harbor Blvd (note there are two Double Tree in Anaheim so it helps to know the address for shuttle bus drivers etc).   After a long flight it was nice to find the check-in process was quick and the chocolate and walnut cookies were as nice as what I read about in other reviews.   We were allocated a room on the 7th floor which had been recently renovated.  The layout of the room was such that we had a bedroom we could close off from our daughter who slept on the fold out couch and each room had it's own TV.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. When the fireworks were on at Disney (Fri-Sun) we got a good view.  Our little fridge in the lounge meant we could stock up on drinks, yoghurt etc from either the 24hr

Great location, clean - well sized rooms.  Staff is very accomodating and met our needs prior to arrival - including a baby pack and play, extra towels, turn down service - A+.    The not so good;  no free shuttle to Disneyland.  Why???  Especially considering the $16 daily parking and $12 day resort fees.   C'mon now...

This is the second time that we have stayed here. This time we had our extended family with us (5 adults and 2 children). We had three rooms next to each other on the 7th floor which has been refurbished. We can't speak highly enough about this hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful and the accommodation pleasant, clean and comfortable. Parking was always available and the location is great. In terms of value for money and overall experience this hotel is in our top three around the world. Coming back to it feels like coming home again.

We stayed here during our visit to the main theme parks and found the experience to be pleasant. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Parking was plentiful and it's close proximity to many restaurants and stores as well.

Summary Heading: Our first choice when visiting Disneyland
Summary: As annual Disneyland passport holders, our family has stayed at this property a few times over the last several years.  Without fail, the excellent staff consistently provide outstanding service and the accommodations never disappoint.  We don't consider the hotel to be within walking distance of the parks, which we usually consider as a positive (less crowded on-site parking, access to nicer off-site restaurants and easier access to other "non-Disney" activities).  Great hotel!!!

I will put it this way...  I am willing to drive over 1 hour in the opposite direction of my destination to stay at this property!    The staff is on point and is very courteous!    The breakfast is homemade and has a healthy offering!    The staff and cleanliness makes this property outstanding!!

Fabulous hotel! Great price for excellent accommodations and service. Would highly recommend to friends, business associates, and family. Spent three wonderful nights there on a Disneyland vacation. Close proximity to the park w/bus transportation.

We stayed at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim for Disney's Half Marathon weekend.  The hotel is very close to the parks - some people said they walked it in about 20 minutes, but considering we had 13.1 miles on the agenda for Sunday, we took the bus service that has a stop right outside the hotel.  Never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to come along and scoop us up to take us to the parks.   The hotel is very well kept, and the staff was great.  Due to flight delays coming from the east coast, I didn't arrive at the hotel until 130am.  They were kind enough to make arrangements for me to pick up a key (and a warm cookie) at the front desk by just showing my ID so I didn't have to wake my friends who had arrived earlier in the evening.  Anytime we interacted with the front

After 4 nights at the Santa Monica Doubletree, we moved to this location for two nights.  We are happy with the consistency of the rooms, the staff, and the amenities at all the Hilton properties. Our room, 225, was on the street side, but we never heard a car!  This room was a bit larger than our friend's room on 6th floor, it may have been a disabled room.    This room was half the price of the Santa Monica location, a 50 minute drive away.  They sell the ART passes at the front desk, and the bus stops right out front.  We will stay here again! Great cookies!

I prefer this Double Tree by Hilton over the nearby Hilton Anaheim.  The Double Tree is more family oriented whereas the Hilton Anaheim is more cold and corporate.  The kids enjoyed the pool, and I got an upgrade to a suite for only $13 which was great.  That was through the Hilton Honors program.

We stayed here in a standard twin room for two nights on a Disneyland vacation.  The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable.  Enjoyed a delicious cookie upon check-in, for which we arrived well before scheduled, but was not a problem for the staff who immediately showed us to our room.  Highly recommended and amazing value for money.

There was nothing to complain about during my stay-- clean, quiet, spacious room, comfy bed and pillows, great service, yummy in room dining. And a great value. Couldn't ask for more!I was there on business and took a cab everywhere we went. If we were going to Disney it would be nice to have been closer, but I still think I would stay there with the family despite the distance to the park.

The hotel restaurant is excellent, the furnishing and room comfort is satisfactory.  The front desk staff is clueless as to what HHonors Gold members benefits include and provided inconsistent service.  With so many other hotels in the area, next time I will likely check out one of the others.
Manager Response: Dear Ilia K,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Doubletree Suites by Hilton. Please allow me to apologize for the inconsistent service you received from our Front Desk. As the most important point of contact within the hotel, our Front Desk usually provides excellent service to our valued guests.  The Gold Hilton Honors benefits should have been clearly communicated to you upon arrival. At this time our hotel provides Hilton Honors points, Comp Internet, Upgrade Upon Availability, 2 Bottled Waters Upon Arrival and your choice of either 1000 bonus points or daily breakfast.  Please know this is not the service excellence the Doubletree Suites by Hilton normally provides its guests. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.  Warm cookies await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while checking out Disneyland and surrounding areas. The rooms were spacious and clean and maintained well throughout our stay. The hotel is a nice walk to Disneyland and Anaheim Garden Walk! The pool area is lovely, we ordered dinner from the pool menu which was delivered efficiently and was delicious as well. Javier at the concierge desk helped us with booking transport to Sea World San Diego, and even took us out to show us where we needed to be to catch the bus. He was most helpful and we were very satisfied with his exceptional service. Overall we were very pleased with our stay.

The hotel and lobby were nice, we were greeted with warm cookies, and the suites were clean. They are not super spacious rooms, but having a separate living and sleeping area is nice with a 3 year old. We will probably stay here again if we go to Disneyland and leave the Disneyland hotel early again.

We just had a 3 day stay at this hotel. The layout of the suites is perfect. Allows the little one to go to sleep and the parents to watch some tv or relax in the livng area. Well laid out rooms, nice amenities. The pool is fine, nothing special but worked just fine for us. There are convenience stores right next store and a Disney shop on the premesis. Easy to get tickets and get to the park on the shuttle bus. Great spot.

Summary Heading: A good hotel for Disneyland vacation goers
Summary: Wanted to get away for the Labor Day weekend and chose this hotel as it seemed to be more on the higher quality side and seemed to get really good reviews.  The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Disneyland and also has shuttle that comes by the hotel if you choose not to walk. If you dont mind the extra bit of walking to get to Disneyland or distance from the park, this is a great hotel to stay in.   When we first arrived and getting checked in I made a mistake with the type of beds we wanted in the room and choose 2 Queen beds instead of King, and they were able to accommodate us and found an extra room with a King size bed. They even gave us a complimentary cookie that was still warm!   The staff was friendly and were able to answer any questions we had. There was even a

The hotel was very nice, the staff was excellent and the cookies at check in were fantastic.  A buffet breakfast is included that adds to the value of the stay.  This is definitely a family hotel to stay at for Disneyland.

This hotel couldn't have been any more accommodating and nicer. The room was super clean, beautifully decorated and spacious!  Got to love those double sinks and plenty of towels. Super great toiletries too and the coffee maker in the room was supplied with Starbucks coffee.  Great value. Nice buffet breakfast at the restaurant for only $13.00 too,  and the warm cookies upon arrival were delicious and a very nice touch. Don't even think twice about not booking this hotel. It is a winner!  And soooooo close to Disneyland you could almost touch it!

We stay at this hotel 2x a year, every year to visit family in the area.  The beds are super comfortable.  The rooms are always clean. The woman who runs the restaurant ALWAYS remembers my daughter's name.   Great reliable service.  We love the suite style rooms, because my daughter can go to bed early and we can stay up a bit later. We will continue to stay here 2x a year!!

Our family recently stayed at this wonderful suite (sweet) Hotel.  Beautiful well maintained place.  The rooms were very comfortable for a family of 4 (2 mid teens included).  The location is outstanding!  The staff from the receptionist to the concierge to the restaurant maitre dee was very friendly and helpful.  If you are in this area look no further!

We were here for the Disney 1/2 marathon and had a two Queen two room suite on the 7th floor (which is the top floor in this hotel).   Apparently the rooms on this floor have just completed being remodeled.  GREAT beds, very comfortable.  Absolutely no noise from adjoining rooms or lower floors.  Sitting room had a sofa bed, chair, table, separate counter, and there was a flat screen with a small microwave and oversize mini fridge in a cabinet below.  Lots of room in this suite.  Everything was immaculately clean and comfortable.  Just a really good setup for four adults (parents and two 20 something daughters).  You could slap a couple of kids on the sofa bed if needed.  After reading many other reviews you could not do better than this or even come close to it for the prices.

We stayed here April 2013 for our Disney trip. It was nice and not too expensive via Priceline $82 night we stayed 2 nights. Unfortunately we lost our first night because we had some car issues on the way. Although it was an issue completely out of our control they told us we would could not be refunded for the first night. Completely understandable so I did not even ask. They did comp our parking which help a bit. Our room was clean and big. We had everything we needed including a microwave, fridge and plenty of room for our family of 4. The ART bus that takes you to Disneyland comes back and forth all day, not sure what it costs. Instead of using the ART bus, we walked a block to the Toy Story Parking lot and took the parking lot shuttle. We just hopped on, no questions asked

An overall great experience at a new property.  Check-in was very quick and we were able to walk to Disneyland in about 15 minutes.  I enjoyed the pool area and its privacy.  Room was well appointed and very clean.  The water pressure in the shower was amazing!  The only slight drawback was the parking fee which I don't remember being informed about it, but it was on my bill.  Despite that, I would recommend this for anyone visiting Disneyland.

Of the many, many, many hotels at the Disneyland Resort, $ for $ the best!!!  The pool is a tad bit small, but everything else makes up for it.  The best pillows of any chain hotel which of course means the best sleep.  Great Fitness Center, I just wish that we had the time to experience the restaurant - next time!!!

We stayed here on our honeymoon after a day at Disnyland.  As we drove from LA in the morning we went straight to Disney and were planning on staying until the end for the fireworks, we were about checking in so late, therefore rang ahead to let them no and it was not a problem.  When we finally checked in after midnight, there was a lovely warm cookie waiting for us which was great after an exhausting day. The staff all seemed very friendly and helpful, although we didn't have any problems whilst there. The room was large and the bedroom was separate from the rest of the room with a door which was nice. Everything was clean, including the bathroom which wasn't the biggest, but fine for our needs.  The location is handy for Disney and although it's on a busy road, we weren't
Manager Response: Dear Jenniebunce,  Congratulations on your recent marriage!  I hope you enjoyed your honeymoon in sunny Southern California.  Thank you so much for your kind words.  I’m so glad to hear you enjoyed our famous Doubletree cookies and the breakfast buffet in Agio Ristorante.  We wish you much happiness in the future.  We’d love to see you and your husband again on an anniversary trip – the champagne will be our treat!  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager  DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Had everything we needed, the only thing we would change would be single beds in our family room for the kids. Location excellent for Disney. Suite was great for using fridge and lounge area. Very quite in the rooms. Pool was small but nice. Very clean everywhere and excellent staff.

We decided to stay in Anaheim for the weekend (a quick 35 minutes away from home) to go to the Disney parks and for the Harvest Crusade at Angels stadium. I wanted to check out this hotel because I thought the pool was on the roof (it's on the 2nd floor) and I thought that would be cool, plus I have always had a nice stay at Doubletree hotels. Upon check-in we were welcomed with warm chocolate nut cookies. The rooms were decent, but the view wasn't all that. The lobby area was nice with a gift store, a restaurant and a little coffee area where besides coffee you can get pastries and snacks. The staff was very welcoming and cordial.  The walk to Disneyland was less than a mile away (20 min. walk) and very close to the convention center. Many restaurants nearby (check out

Very pleased with staying here. The employees were all so friendly and accommodating. I was able to check in early, which is rare...The restaurant food and service was also good. The location is perfect for walking to the convention center, Disneyland, or nice high end restaurants. I am a happy camper!

Excellent hotel.  Very large, clean rooms.  Close to eveything.  We had an excellent view of the fireworks each night at Disneyland.  Nice little coffee shop serving Starbucks in the lobby.  Parking is a little steep at $16 per day for self park.

This hotel had everything we needed. Microwave, refrigerator, separate room from bedroom. Room with a view of the pool. Restaurant was descent. Bar descent.  Located walking distance for whatever you need. Mortons restaurant just down the street.

Good price for a suite in a local hotel to Disneyland. However the rooms are getting a little tired and they are smaller than the usual Doubletree suites. The walk back is a little far after a day in the park, but you can either get a taxi or local bus. Next time we'll try for somewhere a little closer - perhaps the Sheraton or the Candy Cane Inn (which has its own bus service).

This Double Tree all suites Hotel is a wll run facility.  From arrival to departure, the service and staff were fantastic.  Hotel was clean top to bottom.  Rooms clean, well layed out and well furnished. The property is with in walking distance the the Anaheim Convention Center.

Summary Heading: This hotel handles special requests with a smile!
Summary: After reading reviews that make this little hotel sound like the Ritz, I have to agree with reviers that this hotel is really special.  I often make special requests when I travel.  I have stayed in many 5 star hotels and some of the best Hilton properties in the world and this little Doubletree Suites Hotel is the "little hotel that could! "  Just like the little engine that could, this steady  and convenient property is prepared to go the distance, running like a wel-oiled machine.  Great service, smiling and friendly staff and it has everything you need to make your trip comfortable.   By the way the Hotel was fully booked to capacity during the Disney D23 convention and the  staff managed everything so well, and they were as nice to other guests as they were to me.  Despite

I waited four months to write this review (waiting in vain for the Hilton Corp. to respond to our letter) no one bothered to write, call, or apologize - so here was our less-than-great experience.  Five years ago we stayed at this hotel and had a good time; the room was clean and in good shape and the pool seemed fine so it seemed a natural choice to stay here again.  In April 2013, we stayed during a trip to Disneyland and found a very different hotel.  Both times we rented a suite with two rooms and a sofa bed but this time the room we were given was cramped and some of the furniture looked somewhat worn/shabby.  All of this would have been okay (we can survive a bad hotel room) if not for the subsequent problem.  The pool and hot tub were being heavily used during our visit
Manager Response: Dear Europe69,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.    I am very sorry to hear about your son and his friend developing a rash while staying with us.  We take pest concerns very seriously at our hotel.  Our housekeeping team is rigorously trained to spot any signs of pest infestation.  The sofa bed was checked for pests during your stay.  After your departure, a pest control company was called in and they verified there was no sign of pests.  I hope this offers you some measure of comfort.  In addition, the hotel been listening to feedback regarding the guestroom furniture,  As a result of feedback like yours, the hotel began a refresh of all carpets and furnishings in August of 2013.  Finally, I’d like to apologize that the letter you sent to Hilton Corporation went unanswered.  The Hilton Family prides itself on providing timely responses to all guest communications.  Again, please accept our apologies.  I hope you’ll give us another opportunity to show you the quality accommodations and service guests expect from Doubletree Suites by Hilton.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We booked this room through another site and were pleasantly suprised. We got a great rate. The hotels staff was excellent. We were upgraded to a suite, which was WONDERFUL. It was VERY quiet for being a hotel close to disneyland.

We stayed at the Doubletree for the D23 Expo held at the convention center. The expo was within walking distance, especially once you realize how to cut through the Courtyard's parking lot. The staff will give you a map of the short cut. The hotel was wonderful. The staff were so polite and helpful. We ended up in a suite because we used Hilton Honors points during a busy weekend. The rooms are so quiet. Can't hear your neighbors. We opted for the free breakfast which was so much more than just a simple continental spread that you usually get.  Everything was clean. (wish the tub faucet wouldn't leak). There was an ART bus stop in front of the hotel but it goes in the wrong direction and doesn't arrive as often as scheduled. I suggest just crossing the street to the ART bus

Stayed here for last 3 nights of our trip to West Coast. Convenient to local activities and freeway access!  Beds super comfy and bathroom clean and well stacked.  Really didnt spend much time in room because we were busy but was great to get back to comfort and convenience! Didnt have time to use pool but was a nice area!

Stayed for one quick night in August.  The grounds and the room were in very good shape. I slept quite well and would stay here again. I slept very well and found the room to be very comfortable.  The bar staff was very friendly and drinks were very reasonably priced.  Two very minor complaints, if you could even call them that...  1. Several in our party did not receive invoices under our door. We all had to line up at the front desk in order to check out. 2. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was sub-par. The pastries were good, but the hot food (eggs, sausage, potatoes) definitely left something to be desired.  All in all, I'd definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Aww3583,  Thanks so much for your kind words.  I’m pleased to hear you enjoyed our Sweet Dreams Beds by Serta – they are, well, dreamy.  I apologize for line at check out.  We no longer offer invoices under the door because the security of our guests’ personal information is extremely important to us.  We have learned over time there is no way to ensure that what is slipped under the door, stays under the door.  As an alternative, we now offer our guests the option of checking out via in room Television or over the telephone.  I’m also sorry you encountered our breakfast buffet at a bad time.  A quality buffet is very important to our Executive Chef, Rafael.  I will share your comments on the hot items with him.  Again, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to serving you again soon.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed here for our Disneyland adventure.  We had to check in at 2am because of a flight delay.  The check in at that time was no problem, staff were around and parking (need to pay for it) was just outside.  The hotel was super clean, spacious and the breakfast buffet was great.  The shuttle to Disney stopped just in front of the hotel, made things simple for us with 3 kids.  I would recommend that hotel to anyone, especially those wanting to visit Disney!,

Everything was entirely as advertised and expected.  Good location, great staff and very comfortable.  The location made it easy to visit Disney World and city bus stops right outside their door.  Walking distance to several good restaurants and the hotel restaurant was very good as well.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but quite a walk away from Disneyland
Summary: I booked this hotel after reading a few reviews that said this hotel was much cleaner and nicer than the ones that were much closer to the park. In that respect I was not disappointed. Its a nice, clean and fairly newish hotel. I got the room right next to the pool and did not hear any noise. The pool also had a partial view of the Disney fireworks. We booked a Two Queen Bed suite and it came with all the standard bells and whistles. The pool was clean and very usable. Its a little far off from Disneyland though and for a hotel of this size, I do hope they'll invest in a complimentary shuttle. I also wish they had a complimentary breakfast to help start off our day. Apart from that I dont have any complaints and had a pleasant two day stay.

Summary Heading: Favorite place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: This hotel is my favorite place to stay for a 1-3 night stay visiting Disneyland (and we've stayed in a lot of different places including the Grand Californian). Basically for 1-3 days while we're focused on the parks we don't spend too much time at the hotel, so paying for the Grand Californian seems senseless. However, the Doubletree provides superb rooms and amenities at a price that doesn't make you feel like you're wasting even 1 cent.   The rooms are spacious - we generally get a 2-room suite - and very nicely furnished. The staff are very accommodating. Parking can get a little hectic (but reasonable) and breakfast is crazy but that is the norm for any hotel in this area.  This is not a hotel that you can easily walk to the parks from if you have younger children (mine

Summary Heading: Great hotel and close enough to Disney to walk.
Summary: Chose this hotel for a 3 night stay. Rooms were large with 2 double beds, enough to accommodate 2 adults and 1 child. Separate seating area, fridge, coffee machine, safe and tv. Very clean and well presented. We had breakfast in the main restaurant for 13.50 dollars, which was good value. It was a buffet style breakfast, with a wide variety of food. Also children under 12 eat for free.  We walked to Disney, which was about 25 minutes, but was on wide, tree lined pavements, so not too hot. Even walked back at night, around 11pm and felt quite safe. We did catch the bus one day from outside Disney. It was an ART bus no 3 and cost 3 dollars and dropped us outside the hotel.  Overall I would recommend this hotel, even though it is a little farther than some others. Staff was very

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with a 9 year old
Summary: Great hotel and good price.  I have a 9 year old son so the suite was great.  He felt that the living area was his with the T.V and ref/micro.  The pool was nice a little too warm..it was heated and it was 80 degrees outside.  They do need to have a shuttle to disney or get on the ART route.  Overall I would receommend this hotel to any family that wants a  little more living space while vactioning.
Manager Response: Dear Joiluv,  Thanks for the nice review!  I’m glad your son enjoyed having his own space.  Sorry the pool was a little warm – we’ve been having a very mild summer until recently.  Our ART Shuttle stop is at the end of the driveway & the shuttle picks up every 20 minutes.  You can purchase both ART passes & Disney tickets on site, limiting time spent in line (until you’re inside the parks).  Thanks again – we hope to see you again soon.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: The location was perfect. You can walk to the Disneyland main entrance in 15-20 mins or take the ART bus which stops at the hotel. The hotel doe not offer a shuttle to Disneyland. Staff: extremely courteous and helpful.  Always a warm greeting :)  The waitresses at the restaurant are excellent and made us feel welcomed each day.  Room: 2 Queen beds extremely comfortable, bedroom room separated from living area.  Good size bathroom.  Daily maid service leaving the room fresh and clean. Plenty of towels. Only negatives: carpet could use a good cleaning, furniture showing wear and tear. Pool: heated, on the small size.  Clean and plenty of towels. Restaurant: Breakfast buffet $13.50 and offers a good variety and eggs to order. Kids eat free with each paying adult!
Manager Response: Dear Frank,  Thanks so much for the kind words!  We’ve been listening to feedback like yours regarding the rooms and I’m pleased to share that in late August we’ll be completely refreshing our suites.  New carpets, sofabeds and more.  I’m also glad to hear you took advantage of the Fireworks view room - some things are better from the comfort of your room.  I hope you’ll visit us again soon to check out the changes.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Had a 4 night stay at this hotel, ideally situated in a lovely area with lots amenities within walking distance. The lights round the trees on the main road were really pretty. The reception staff, concierge and bell staff were all professional and friendly. We ate breakfast in the restaurant - great selection and the service was excellent, however we went the next day and it took 10 mins to get seated and then we sat another 10 mins and no one had come for our drinks order, I wouldn't mind if they were busy.... We ended up walking out.  I begrudgingly paid the parking, I do feel that if you are staying at the hotel parking should be included.  The pool area was lovely and quiet and the hot tub was very welcome after a long day on your feet.

This hotel worked perfectly for my recent concert at Angels stadium.  I was able to walk to the venue without worry about safety.  THe room was nice, staff friendly, pool was clean and the parking fee reasonable.

Food was excellent and the staff was wonderful and it was so comfortable.  Room service was quick and provided us with great food.  Especially the Meat Lasagna....we ordered it twice.  The Bellmen were so courteous and very friendly...especially Gary.

We were in town for D23 so I wanted to pick a hotel close to the convention center.  This hotel is close to the convention center as well as Disneyland.  Disneyland is only a 15 minute walk away or you can take the ART shuttle. The shuttle stop is right outside the hotel entrance.  It's either $5 roundtrip to the park or $3 one way.  The service at the hotel was excellent.  The staff was so pleasant and very helpful.  Our room was very spacious and clean.  Overall the hotel had a newer freshness about it as opposed to some of the more dated, older hotels in the area. Bonus....the delicious Doubletree cookies!!  I would absolutely stay here again and I totally recommend this hotel.

My bill included a daily charge for parking, and I did not even have a car AND the room rate was higher than the rate at original booking! I had documentation of original room rate and they reduced the rate - after some persistence on my part.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience.  Doubletree by Hilton offers flexible pricing based on a number of factors, including length of stay.  Unfortunately, it sounds like the pricing flexed in the wrong direction during your stay and for that, we truly apologize.  I hope you’ll give us another opportunity to show you the great service guests have come to expect from the Doubletree Suites by Hilton.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher, Manager DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: I booked this for our family of 5 with breakfast. It's the first time I stayed at a double tree and I was impressed for a three star hotel. Friendly service, nice rooms and good value to have two rooms and including a full breakfast for all of us. My son went to 'Vid-Con' and it was walking distance to the convention center. Quiet hotel which I was grateful for after 2 long days in Disneyland. Disneyland is very close though we still parked there. Out door pool is a bit small and basic but we didn't need it with so much to do in the area.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel near Disneyland and convention center
Summary: Attended a conference at the convention center.  This hotel was a pleasant, quiet respite from the mad house of the convention hotels.  Nice facility, clean rooms, good AC, easy walking distance to convention center, local restaurants and Disneyland.

Nice clean rooms. Friendly desk staff.  The warm cookie on arrival was delicious!  About 15 to 20 min walk to Disneyland.  Travelled with my partner and was fine to walk for us but not sure about walking there for a family with small children. Disney centre near the lobby so you can buy your tickets at the hotel before you go to the theme park. Denny's restaurant across the road which was handy for breakfast and dinner.

This is the place for your Disneyland stay! We had the 2 queen suite which worked perfectly for a family of four. Service was exceptionally friendly, food in the restaurant very good, walk to DL easy. Resist the urge to stay at a fleabag motel closer to the parks, have done that before and it is not worth it!

This hotel continued to impress my family from the check in process, with the warm cookie, all the way until we checked out 10 days later.  The rooms (suites) are very big. The bedroom is seperated from the living area by two doors. This allows you to put the kids to bed while still being able to watch TV without disturbing them. We closed both doors and we didn't hear a thing all night long.  The restaurant in the hotel has fantastic food. On top of the food they offer one kid eats free for every adult meal purchased. Fantastic value and amazing food quality.  The last thing is the staff of the hotel. They excelled with every request and interaction we had during our stay.  My family has stayed at several hotels in the Anaheim area and I can easily say this hotel was hands down

We wanted more than 2 queen beds in a room and chose the Doubletree suites. The room was great, having the living room and separate bedroom was so spacious, perfect for our week in Anaheim. We had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa in the lounge, great for 2 adults and 2 kids. Most people mention the free cookie on checkin, I can see why, they are delicious!  The hotel is in a great location, the restaurant has great food and is cheaper for breakfast than most of the local chain restaurants. Easy 15 min walk to Disneyland and plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area. Car parking was $16 per day. Overall we loved this hotel, the kids loved the pool and we would stay again if we were to return to Anaheim.

My wife and two teenage children took two rooms in August as a base for Disney and before travelling to Beverly Hills.  Check in was simple and quick - overall the building and grounds were really clean and very nicely kept and the  lobby area was beautiful. Self-parking was no hassle and to be fair, it's not the sort of location where bell hops will be all over you - I think many guests were looking for a nice place to stay whilst visiting Disney rather than a more 'formal' welcome  Rooms were huge and ours were either side of the pool area which was small but very neat.  My only two criticisms of the hotel was that there were too few sun beds in the pool location and there was room for many more. And the Cafe Biscotti had too much choice with a queue we really couldn't be

Summary Heading: Great spot and close to Disney
Summary: I chose this hotel based on the good reviews- not disappointed. Hilton suites work well for us with three teenage children. Lots of space for everyone. $16 parking is reasonable - we paid $32 for one night in Santa Monica which, to be frank is robbery.  This hotel is only 15 mins walk to Disney - my advice is to walk and not pay shuttle charges.  Had a wonderful day at Disney and then a very comfortable and quiet night's sleep. Would recommend.

We like the value of the small suite. We are a family of 4 including a teen and a pre-teen.  We could stay  at the Doubletree for 3 nights for the price of a comparable size set of rooms inside the Disneyland resort for 1 night and there is a free shuttle to the park.  The room included 2 queen beds and a queen sofa bed.  It was separated into a bedroom and a living room area.  Both rooms had their own TV so there was no arguing between our teens over the remote and both had their own bed/sofa.  Also included fridge and microwave so we could have breakfast and snacks in our room if we wanted.  The hotel lobby areas are beautiful and well maintained.  Only complaint was that guests from a wedding party on Saturday night on the first floor around 11 pm went into the parking lot

My family of four spent four nights at this Doubletree as my teenage daughter was attending VidCon at the Anaheim Convention Center.  We wanted to stay within walking distance of the convention center so she could come back to the hotel on her own.  Based on that criteria, we picked the Doubletree based on reviews and really enjoyed ourselves.  The staff were all very friendly and professional.  We spent a chunk of one day in the room, so put out the Do Not Disturb Sign, but called when we went out to have the room cleaned and it was done immediately!  Very quiet, no noise problems.  And most of all, we loved having a suite.  We had a suite with a bedroom with two queen beds and a living room with a couch, comfy chair, and desk and chair.  I think this is an even better

Summary Heading: Nice Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: This is a really nice place to stay. Nice suite accommodations and extremely helpful staff. The cookies were a nice touch (you can ask for one each night at the front desk). Although, having to pay for parking ($16/day) and no free shuttle service to Disneyland was a bummer, it turned out to be best for us to take a taxi ride for about $10 each way. Parking in the Disney parking lot was a mess and the bus cost more for my family of four than to take the taxi. We were a little disappointed that the room smelled musty and the carpet was dingy (first time we every experienced this). But, overall, this is a great alternative to the Disneyland Resort hotels. We'd go again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and feedback.  I did want to share with you that the hotel will be starting renovations on all of our guestrooms.  I hope, in the future, that you will have an opportunity to stay with us and enjoy the newly renovated guestrooms.

Summary: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and had an issue with the aircon on the first night as it wasn't cooling.We complained the following day and they sent the maintenance guy to fix the problem. He was such a nice man but unfortunately the aircon just wasn't cooling enough. We requested to move into another suite and he organised it with the front desk. They were very apologetic but it wasn't their fault. Our 2nd suite was better than the first room as the room is not as outdated as the first one.There is a laundry room on our floor ( 4th) which was handy and the reception downstairs are happy to change for coins. Breakfast selection is basic. We had dinner on our last night at Agio Ristorante and were very impressed. Reasonable price and tasty food. We asked Xavier the concierge
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and feedback on our hotel.  We are happy to announce that we will be renovating all of our guestrooms.  We hope that if you have an opportunity to visit Anaheim again, that you will be able to experience our newly renovated guestrooms.

Summary: We love the doubletree Anaheim.  The service is excellent from check in to the restaurant to bellman.  We come to Anaheim every year.  We have stayed at other hotels but once we stayed at the doubletree we were so impressed we have return every year.  Thank you for the exceptional service again this year.

We stayed there for about 8 nights. It felt like home. I genuinely grew fond of it. The bed is comfy. Even the kids enjoy the sofabed. The room is outdated. But the service and cleanliness make up for it. It's very drafty in the halls. We covered the lower parts of the front door with a towel, because the sofa bed is right opposite.  The breakfast is complimentary because we have hilton honors. But usually we don't bother. It's not fantastic. Kids love ihop near disneyland instead. Overall we get what we came for. Namely the doubletree suites' spaciousness.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, close to Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: Nice location. I stayed there for a conference in the Anaheim Convention Center, it is only 5 minutes of walk. It's very close to the Disneyland, you can see the fireworks right from some of the rooms, or at the pool side. There is also shuttle bus to Disneyland. It is also easy to find grocery stores nearby.  I got a suite at the end of the hall way, it is nice, quite and clean. You can see some of the fixings are not so new, but well maintained.   After I left, I had a question on my bill, called, left a message and got call back within half a hour.  In general it is a very nice hotel to stay and easy to access the places of interest nearby.

My family and I went to Disneyland on our first family vacation ever (July 15-21). We chose the Doubletree Suites at Anaheim based on what others have said here on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed!  Every hotel employee we encountered, and I mean every single one, were the nicest and most helpful people ever! The room was nice and clean but the air conditioning just didn't get cold enough for us...of course we are from Alaska so any heat over 70 degrees can get a bit rough.  The room was nice and spacious and the beds were ridiculously comfortable with tons of comfy pillows. The only thing that needed to be looked at is the mattress on the sofa bed as it has a huge stain on the bottom of it. Don't know what it is...but it's there...and it's kinda ewww. (FYI, we were in

The staff were all exceptional! Special thanks to Albert the bellman who helped get our  lost luggage to us and was so very polite and helpful. But ALL staff were the bet I've ever encountered.  The rooms were large, spacious and very clean and super comfy,great for large families.  Facilities were all great and the buffet breakfast was good value for money and great selection for all tastes.
