Location was alittle far to walk to Disneyland but the art shuttle was cheap and ran all day $5.00 for adult ticket you se all day. You can buy from concierge t hotel.  Definitely recommend and definitely stay there again.

If you are looking for a great deal, with location, breakfast, good service and cleanliness, this is the place for you.  We only stay 2 nights but it is perfect! No need to look further! Plus they give everyone a warm welcome cookie when you check in!  Yum!!! Beds are comfortable too!

Our holiday started well and then my wife got ill with pneumonia. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful--recommendations on the doctor to call (an external service but terrific--make sure you have insurance). The staff also customised meals for my wife as she was poorly and were generally fantastic and attentive. Many thanks to Pavel, Christian, Erlinda, Karina, Karla, Gary, Chad, Albert, Wade, Xavier--apologies if we did not get all of the staff names.   Due to the curtailed vacation we didn't get to spend much time in the bar but Norma is lovely.  The Disney part was excellent but a bit curtailed. But there is always the next time…

Summary Heading: Our new favorite in Anaheim. Best Breakfast for Plant Based Eaters
Summary: We've stayed at the Disney Hotels during past visits to Disneyland but this time we chose the DoubleTree and I am so glad that we did. I booked a Bed & Breakfast special with a King Suite and we loved the room! The front desk and dining staff were very nice and accommodating. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and well maintained.   Since we don't eat meat or dairy any more, the oatmeal, homemade granola, and muffins were delicious.  They even had Soy Milk.  The coffee was really good too.    The shuttle service wasn't reliable (which wasn't the hotel's fault) so we drove to the Disney parking lot.  All in all, this was a great experience at the DoubleTree. We will be back next year for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Anita,  Thank you for choosing our hotel!    As a vegetarian myself, I can relate your need for meat-less breakfast options.  Chef Rafael is very creative and open minded when it comes to our menus.  He’s been known to offer Soyrizo for veggies and even Vegemite for the Aussies.  We also have a number of options for Gluten Free guests.  Our coffee in the restaurant and room service is Starbucks’ Verona blend and I agree, it’s really good.    I’m sorry to hear about the shuttle service.  Our management team will ensure your comments get passed along to the right ears.    Speaking of ears, I hope your trip to Disneyland was fantastic!  We hope to see you again soon.  Warm Cookies Await,  Deborah Fisher Manager, DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: Had a great stay here.  Hotel room made up of two rooms, one with 2 Queen beds and the other with sofa, tv and mini fridge.  Great for families, can put the kids to bed and adults can stay up in living area without disruption.  Rooms facing pool have a better view.  Buffet Breakfast is extensive, cereals, hot food, toast, fruit etc.  Some great family friendly restaurants on W Katella Ave, 10 min walk -Cheesecake Factory, California pizza kitchen etc.  Nice pool and spa.  The last night of our stay there were noisy guests staying in the two rooms adjacent.  I notified the front desk and they dealt with it immediately.  Very impressed with this hotel. Definitely staying here for our next Disneyland trip.

We recently stayed at the resort for one night, the rooms are nicely appointed, great location to Disney. The only issue we ran into in the evening there were no towels on the pool deck we had to call the desk twice before they were brought up. We will be looking to stay there again as it is a great location the disney but close enough to other eating places in the area

Rooms.  Our room 247 was recently renovated. Spacious with separate sitting room.  Right on art bus route.  About a 15 min walk to Disney keep in mind I have young kids who walk slow.  Definitely would stay here again

Summary Heading: Glad to have stayed here. Friendly hotel
Summary: Stayed here with my wife and 9 year old daughter for 3 nights in July and was very pleased with the overall service of the hotel. The rooms are  large and you could actually see the fireworks from the Disney which is 2 miles away from the room( if you opt to get a firework view room which comes up with additional cost, but worth it)..  You can buy the Disney tickets at the office located right in the hotel. Had a friendly woman at the desk.   If you are not driving, take the ART , loop service. Get the tickets from the reception. But please be prepared for an average wait time of 20 -25 mins, if you missed one before you.  Breakfast was good and good spread and good friendly staff.  Would have given a 5 star but they missed out cleaning my room on one of the days  and had to

This hotel is great!  Comfy beds, quiet, clean.  Highly recommend.  The staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of.  It is about a mile from Disney, but is definitely walking distance (especially the beginning of the day!)  We will be back!

Summary Heading: We love the two room suite
Summary: We stayed for 6 days in this Doubletree hotel.  Location is good.  It is close to Disneyland.  There are a few restaurants within walking distance.  We like the layout of the two room suite.  In the living room, it have a flat screen tv, a mini-fridge, a microwave, a big desk and a comfy couch.  The sink is outside of the bathroom.  There is also a flat screen tv in the bedroom too.  Self parking was easy.  Breakfast in the hotel was pretty good too.

Nice suites hotel at reasonable prices. Always nice to have the extra living space. Clean and quiet. Queen size beds rather than doubles-Yeah!! Very friendly and helpful front desk staff. About a mile to Disneyland (we walked it... fine going, a bit tiring walking back after a full day at the park).  Housekeeping was a bit slow and some days did not replace all toiletries and towels. Additional $16 parking per night if you have a car. There is a cafe in the lobby for Starbucks coffee and snack items, but very slow service.

Quite, clean, comfortable.  Our suite was reasonably spacious, I like the fact that folks sleeping in the living area (pullout couch) don't need to come through the bedroom to get to the bathroom.  The cookies are delicious!

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great location
Summary: While I stayed at the Doubletree because my regular business hotel in Anaheim was booked, this property was a very pleasant surprise and I will consider staying here again. From check-in to checkout the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located within walking distance to Disneyland (although that wasn't the reason I stayed there) and many restaurants and convenience stores. In essence, you could park at the hotel and not have to use your car if Disneyland is your destination. My room was HUGE and could easily accommodate a family of four. There is a pool, restaurant and Starbucks in the lobby and the only negative, the "fitness center" is a joke (but if you've come for Disneyland working out may not be a priority...).

We had a very comfortable stay at the Doubletree Suites.  Clean, reasonably priced and excellent value for the amount of space.  We have 5 in our family and it was nice to all be able to sleep in a bed for the price of a regular hotel room. Would definitely stay again!

Enjoyed the hotel. Would look into staying at another Double Tree in future travels. The staff, food, and amenties were great. Long walk to Disneyland with young children. Wish they offered a shuttle. Overall Great Experience.

We came to Disneyland to celebrate my niece's 4th birthday so we chose the Doubletree since it was close to the Resort.  This is my very first experience with Doubletree so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I am someone who prefers nice hotels and excellent service and have stayed in places like Ritz Carlton, etc.  Doubletree is very reasonably priced.  We were pleasantly surprised and so excited to receive A+ service at this hotel!  From the minute we booked to the time we walked in and throughout our entire stay we were treated like VIP guests. They seemed to truly CARE about making sure we had a nice stay.  They were so friendly and when we mentioned my niece's birthday they brought her a bouquet of balloons and the smile on her face was so precious.  Everyone from the top

Summary Heading: Great for Family Fun or Business
Summary: Not only was this hotel close to my business meeting but also to Disneyland and a great outlet mall. The hotel had a shuttle to Disneyland that ran every 30 minutes or so and the staff were very helpful in answering my questions about the park, the outlet mall, and nearby restaurants.  I wasn't there long but the stay was quite comfortable and the room was huge. There was only one small issue. My room wasn't far from the elevator and there was a mini wind tunnel between the elevator and my room door. This produced a faint whistling sound through the small crack in my door. Still, the overall stay was pleasant and I would return to this hotel again.

Our 6th stay here for our Disneyland vacation, and the only hotel we would ever consider staying at in the area. Great stay, front desk staff very helpful in directing me to the nearest Best Buy. My husband sent us with the wrong camera charger, and a Disneyland trip with no pictures to show for it was not an option. Kudos for their assistance with options/information on local businesses that might have the right camera battery charger. A 20 minute round trip to Best Buy, and crisis was averted, with plenty of time to relax by the pool before heading to Downtown Disney. Restaurant staff is excellent, we enjoy seeing familiar faces with each stay. The hostess (manager?) who seated us is phenomenal, (my apologies on not being able to recall her name.) Her warm and sincere greeting

We booked this hotel for a one one night stay arriving from Australia on an early morning flight. We arrived at around 8.30 am. After using a friends room to shower and change then breakfast in the restaurant downstairs we were able to check in around 10.30 am to our room. We had booked a one bedroom queen suite. The suite was a generous size with a separate sitting room. 2 super comfortable queen sized beds in the bedroom. Excellent value for the price we paid. The breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was good value for money and the servers were extremely professional and friendly. Over all we were very pleased with our room, the standard of the hotel, and the efficiency of the staff. There is a shuttle bus to Disneyland right outside the hotel. It costs $5 for the day.

Got a really good price here with parking,but there's not a lot going on in the hotel itself.  It's very formal and the bar while well stocked with your various beers/liquors is very open and has no atmosphere whatsoever if you fancy a few late night drinks. There are a couple of bars in the area however, but might be a bit hard to find as they seem to be in a shopping mall/area.  There's a starbucks in the lobby and  a 7-11 2 mins walk away on the way to the parks.  The hotel itself is very clean, we had a lovely large corner room with views. Facilities are excellent with laundry area and swiming pool, though we didn't use it and only saw it when we went to do some laundry. Staff were friendly and we had no problems whatsoever over the 4 days. I'd stay here again no problem.

As you drive up to this hotel it looks like your standard tower block hotel, but when you enter the lobby it is bright, airy and clean. Check in was very quick and as no rooms were available for the class we had booked (king double) we were upgraded to a premium king room. The room was on the 17th floor, huge room with large comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom with Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, big TV, comfy chair and footstool, writing desk, safe etc. the warm welcome cookie was lovely and much needed as we were starving after a long journey! The reason for our visit was to go to Disneyland for the day, the shuttle was brilliant, very efficient and always space for everyone, saved the hassle of driving and parking up at the Park. The only thing to be wary of is the premium

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Value Near Disneyland
Summary: Pleasant staff, great rooms and close to Disneyland. Price was very competitive with other hotels, but this hotel included more with the stay.  Staff seemed to be happy we were there. Nice to have restaurant on site, as well as room service which is hard to find at many hotels.  Felt very safe and secure at the hotel.  Would highly recommend this hotel for individuals, or entire families.

Sometimes staying in a hotel is not all about the size of the room, the amenities or the view. It’s also about the quality of service and how you are welcomed. After all, a hotel is your home away from home for a few days. And even if you spend most of the day outside, visiting Disneyland for example, it’s good to go back to a place where you know people care about their guests and where you will be able to rest peacefully.  The DoubleTree Anaheim Resort is that place. This hotel is far from being perfect but offer a great value for your money. The quality of customer service is excellent:  Front desk, housekeeping and concierge are all very good. We had a noise issue one night and they did an excellent job at resolving it. Our suite was a little bit outdated, but very clean and

No regrets in selecting this hotel for our 3 nights stay in Anaheim. Before our trip, I had requested where possible if I can check-in early as I was on a very early morning flight. The prompt email reply advised that they would try their very best as it was the peak holiday season in the US. Upon arrival, the front desk reception was already aware of my request, and suggested that I get breakfast & come back an hour & half later while they try to get a room ready for us. True to their words, a room was prepared for our check-in, and the best part was we got an upgrade to a suite!  The suite was spacious, clean & fairly quiet (noise came from a couple of kids running down the hall in the middle of the night). A courtesy note was advised that due to upgrading being done in the

The suite was roomy, clean and quiet.  Our time in the room was relaxing after the long walks to and around the parks.  The area was centrally located to food and entertainment, within walking distance to the parks and other activities. A car was broken into during our stay in the parking lot, so just a reminder to not leave anything in the car.

ThIs is one of the best hotels I've been to! It is near Disneyland, just a 15-20 min walk or a short taxi ride. During my stay in Los Angeles I had the city pass and went to sea world, Disneyland and universal studios. While there, the double tree inn was the best hotel I had been to. It is very clean and has great service. The quietness is nice and the staff are very nice. I had enjoyed the complimentary cookies... Hehehehe. My family and I enjoyed it!

Parking at the hotel is USD$16 a night and Hotel charges renovation costs through the Resort Assessment Fee USD$6 plus tax and Anaheim Tourism Fee totalling additional USD$7.02 a day.  Apparently, though my onlne reservation says it includes all estimated taxes and service charges, the Resort Assessment Charge is not part of these charges.   Apart from these, the room is spacious (with 2 queen beds) and clean with good internet access.

I am shocked this hotel got such high reviews especially since there are 4 star hotels (Marriott and Hilton) are right down the street. This hotel and staff are are not great. Please Note: If you are  Hilton Honors Gold or Diamond and you get the free breakfast vouchers for 2 adults, the kids eat free does not apply to you. The front desk staff was very snippy with me when I asked about this. We were also paying rack rate for the room. We did not receive the cookies at check in and i didn't dare to ask.  Pros The rooms are suites Lots of resturants in the area Less than a mile to Disneyland  Cons Rooms are old and need an update badly staff was not great - very surprising for Hilton standard breakfast buffet was awful for the price. they were always out of food and we were there
Manager Response: Dear RomaM,  Please accept my apologies for a less than impressive stay at the Doubletree Suites by Hilton.    While it is correct that the Kids Eat Free promotion doesn’t apply to the complimentary Hilton Honors breakfast, it does sound like the Front Desk may need to improve how they share this information with our guests.  I’m very disappointed you did not receive our famous Chocolate Chip Cookies upon arrival, as this is a cornerstone of the Doubletree by Hilton brand.  I’ll be sure to discuss these issues with our Front Office management right away.  Based on feedback like yours, we will be updating our guestrooms in September 2013.  Everything from carpets to sofas to chairs will be refreshed.    I will also discuss your thoughts on the breakfast buffet with our Executive Chef.  He strives for a hot, plentiful & fresh buffet every morning.  RomaM, thank you for your review.  We hope you’ll give us another chance to show you the excellent service and accommodations the Doubletree Suites by Hilton normally provides its guests.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher Manager, Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We chose to stay at this hotel because it was in somewhat in close proximity to Disneyland.  Our conference was at the the Disneyland Hotel.  The hotel is a short taxi ride or a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.   The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Housekeeping staff kept our room very well. They made sure our room stayed stocked with towels. I only have one complaint. Our room temperature would get uncomfortable during the day. I didn't bring this to the attention of the staff because we were in out of the room so much.  The food in the restaurant is very good and well priced. I also recommend walking to the Garden Walk and trying out Roy's Hawaiian Fusion.  If your traveling with Teens, I recommend Downtown Disney, Gardenwalk, and the Outlets at Orange.

This was second stay at this hotel in the past year.  The rooms were clean and the service was very good.We had a suite for ourselves, which was spacious and adequate.  Our daughter had a regular room which I thought was very small, especially for a longer stay.  The breakfast buffet was tasty with with a large selection of hot and cold foods.  Unlike some breakfast buffets, this offered a different selection of hot foods on various mornings.  The room service was phenomenal.  Even our smallest, not on the menu, requests were acknowledged. For example, our granddaughter got sick on the drive to Anaheim.  We asked for saltine crackers for her that evening and even though they didn't have saltines, they provided a variety of dry, white crackers.  The housekeeping,  concierge,

Obviously budget has a big play in choice but the rooms here are comfortable although the hotel shows some signs of its true age. The hydraulic elevators are old and clunky. Its a $5 bus shuttle to Disneyland and sometimes a 20-30 minute wait. Breakfast was excellent and Mario was a great server. Quiet room air conditioning and comfortable bed. Its $16 a day parking but very convenient on lot close to hotel. A generally well maintained hotel

Summary Heading: Hotel is starting to feel outdated!
Summary: This is my second time staying at this hotel.  This time we stayed for 5 nights.  I think just about every hotel around Disneyland endures high traffic and abuses from kids.  This hotel definitely showed signs of wear and tear since a year ago when I last visited.  In general, the carpet is starting to look dirty.  The room doesn't have a fresh feel to it and the furniture looks worn.  The breakfast is still average at best.  I got free breakfast from my Hilton Honors membership, and I would never eat there if I had to pay.  Previously my four years old kid was able to eat for free, but this time they charged him $7.  I did try the room service this time and the salad and pasta we ordered were delicious.  It's weird that the hotel has Disney ticket office inside, yet they don't
Manager Response: Dear Nstar612,  Thank you for your review.  Please know we do listen to our guest reviews and it does affect change within the Doubletree Suites by Hilton.    As a result of feedback like yours, I am pleased to share that we have a guestroom refresh scheduled for September of 2013.  We will be updating the guestroom sofas, chair, carpets and more.  We’ll also be reducing the nightly Resort Fee to just $1.21 per night.  I’ll be sure to share your thoughts on the breakfast buffet with our Executive Chef.  He is always looking to improve the quality and variety of the breakfast buffet.  Nstar612, thank you once again for your feedback.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to show the service and accommodations the Doubletree Suites by Hilton is known to provide.    Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher Manager, Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We booked a suite at the DoubleTree to accommodate my wife and I, plus our daughter and son-in-law.  That worked out very well for all of us. My wife and I took the master suite (of course) and the kids got the fold-out bed in the sitting room.  The suite was quite comfortable and offered everything we needed for our short two-night stay.  My wife was complementary of the bath products and we all enjoyed the warm chocolate chip cookies offered to each guest at check in.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and provided my daughter with a detergent packet so she could do a load of wash.    I would encourage going with the breakfast package.  I'm generally not a fan of hotel breakfasts, but it's worth it here because you can eat and be on your way to the Disney parks quickly and

We arrived at the hotel early, and was treated to early check in, followed by a warm chocolate chip cookie! Yummo.  The room we were provided for 2 nights was huge.  A separate sitting room, and 2 Queen Beds gave us plenty of room to spread out.  Not too far to walk to Disneyland.  The only disappointment was the service provided in the restaurant when we utilised this facility after an all day bus tour.  Staff seemed tired and not engaged in their job.  The food was nice, but would not visit the restaurant for an evening meal again.

We stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights in early June.  The rooms were great.  The staff was very helpful.  We loved having the Starbucks in the lobby for a quick coffee before our walk to Disney.  I would recommend this hotel

Great handy location which is walking distance to Disneyland and handy to food and shopping. rooms clean and tidy and pool whilst small adequate for a quick dip on a hot day. the gym is size of a shoe box and the equipment is limited but you can get a basic workout in.

We went to Disneyland with our daughter and her family and needed two rooms. Sean at the DoubleTree was wonderful in arranging our reservation for two side-by-side, 2-room suites on the top 7th floor. We overlooked the swimming pool and had a clear view of the Disneyland fireworks every night. The rooms were perfect for our needs - each had two Queen beds plus a sofa sleeper in the living room. Doors separated all the rooms and the bathroom. Upon request each morning, housekeeping made up our rooms early so our grandchildren could nap mid-day. The warm chocolate chip cookies were such a wonderful treat. As a Hilton Gold member we all got free breakfast every morning which let us get up early and be at Disneyland when it opened (absolutely essential to avoiding crowds and lines).

Great, clean hotel.  About 3/4 mile walk from Disneyland!!!  Room was quiet and the bed was comfortable.  We really enjoyed our stay.  We will definitely stay at another double tree!  Crib was already set in our room when we arrived as I requested.  Large rooms, much bigger than expected.

This has  a regular shuttle to and from Disneyland. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Free wifi in the lobby and a starbucks too. This was handy to grab coffee on the way out for the day. Lots of parking and a free cookie on check in. Look online to get a deal to stay at this hotel.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree Suites.  We were there for 9 nights.  Front desk were very helpful and efficent  The hotels location is within great walking distance to Disneyland about 10 - 15 min walk and a very enjoyable walk.  The rooms were very clean and tidy -- We ordered room service a couple of times and really enjoyed it.  The beds were very comfy.  We would return to the Doubletree Suites in the future.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable Disneyland area hotel
Summary: The parking lot is fenced and the grounds are in good shape. The hotel and Harbor Blvd area are well lit at night, and I never felt unsafe walking  alone even though I walked back from the convention center after 11pm one night. Note: If going to the convention center, you cannot walk through the parking lot to the Courtyard lot and on to the Marriott lot.  You have to walk up Harbor to the Clarion and then down Convention Way.      Check-in was fast and friendly.   HHonors was recognized as being "on file." (I never did get the bottles of water in my room or offered to me.) Throughout the week the concierge greeted me each time I entered the hotel.  I did not use the restaurant.  The bar is small but the service is decent. The pool area looked small but nice, though I never

I stayed with my daughter while we visited Disneyland. I got an awesome deal on Hotwire. The location is wry convenient easy walk for my 7 year old. The bus stop to Disneyland is steps outside. The restaurant on site was delicious. The room was clean, pool and jacuzzi were awesome. Very big room, bad view of gas stations but awesome service. I would definetly visit again. The front desk was so helpful in callings cabs etc.

Nice. quiet rooms. Clean and comfortable. Good value for the money. But wish they would get rid of the "Resort Fee" that is added to the room cost. I was traveling on business and did not use any "resort" amenities

We chose this from seeing good reviews from Tripadvisor and was a very good choice. Great hotel, not too far from Disneyland and close to restaurants, very pleasant experience. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I simply rate how good they were by the number of things to comment negatively about, I can't really name one. Would recommend to all.

EXCELLENT. I want your beds in my home! This hotel is the best hotel we have ever stayed at. The girls at the desk gave us all the info we needed, found the perfect room for us. EVERYTHING is PERFECT.

Summary Heading: Stayed during visit to Disneyland. Great hotel - walking distance!
Summary: Family stayed - 2 rooms (suites). Everything we needed to get going in the morning (Starbucks), gift shop, clean rooms, great cleaning service, friendly staff.  Straight shot walk to Disneyland - with convenience store on the way.  Great for the evening bottle of wine, or waters for the room.

My family stayed at the DoubleTree and had a great time. The rooms were nice and clean and all the areas around the hotel. The staff were very helpful and kind. We were greeted with a warm cookie. Best cookie ever. Thank you for making our stay so great. I would tell my friends and family to stay at the Doubletree any time. Thanks Eric Cridland

Stayed at this hotel over the busy Christmas season and they were great! Extremely clean and accommodating. One day it rained so hard and there was a message on our phone informing us they had organized "rainy day activities" in the lobby for guests. Disneyland is a very easy walk. Takes about 10-15 mins. We didn't use the shuttle as we found it was easier to just walk to the park so we could get there before opening. Would defiantly recommend this hotel.

This is the perfect place to stay if you are visiting Disney Land. The location is ideal, the staff are extremely friendly and let us check in hours early. They were very very friendly and helpful upon check in. Our room was lovely and clean and the bed was amazing. We will be back. thank you

had to check in at 10Am and the found a room that was ready. Room was clean, well appointed, and fairly quiet. The business  center is free and really well done. Restaurant had a variety of food choices. Bed is comfortable, bathroom clean and well appointed. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I choose this hotel after reading the great reviews on TripAdvisor. We were looking for a hotel close to Disneyland with access to transport. We booked the package which included breakfast directly with the hotel and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived to have a complimentary bottle of apple cider (see photo). The staff in the restaurant were very helpful and there was no difficulty accommodating our request for a gluten-free meal at breakfast. We would certainly stay here again.

Stayed in the hotel recently. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Special appreciation got to go to the staff such as Josh and Albert who provided invaluable support and advises throughout our stay there. Will definitely stay in this hotel again in the future.

Summary Heading: Will stay here the next time I'm in Anaheim!
Summary: I usually stay at the Embassy Suites a couple blocks a way, but I really LOVE my room at the Doubletree. I stay at a lot of Doubletree hotels across the country, but this is one of the nicer properties. The furniture is updated, the decor isn't tired and dated, and I really like the unique layout of the room. It's not your typical suite layout. If only Doubletree would include a Manager's reception, it would be my 'go to' hotel...although I am partial to the Executive Lounge in the full service Hilton's (especially internationally)....  Oh...one advantage over Embassy Suites is that you don't hear a lot of noise because of the open atrium concept, and I have a fear of heights so not crazy about seeing how far I could fall over a flimsy rail.

Summary Heading: BEST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED AT
Summary: My family and I stayed here in June 2012. The hotel was extremely satisfactory. Hotel has a grand entrance with friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were fabulous and had lots of space. Conveniently close to Disneyland and other restaurants like Joe''s Crab Shack. Also you get the best cookies at the check in desk you will ever have for free. We saw people from other hotels coming in and asking for the cookies. All in all one of the absolute best hotels I have ever stayed at.

My friends and I stayed here in November 2012. The hotel booking was a package deal. We got a suite with two double beds.   Pros - convenient location - has a safe in the room - decent pool, hot tub and fitness centre - has a sleeper sofa - has free wifi - beds were comfy, clean rooms - got free cookies at check in - close to car rental locations and walking distance to disneyland  Cons - small suite, expected it to be larger, space was tight for four people - open style sink area - not part of the enclosed tuba and toilet room - friendly staff  I would stay here again.

I stayed here with my husband and two year old daughter while we were visiting Disneyland. The two queen bed suite was perfect for us. The hotel provided a pack and play for our daughter to sleep in as she still refuses to sleep in a bed. The separate bedroom allowed us to have some adult time after our daughter was asleep. We chose to walk to and from Disney each day as it was only about 10-15 minutes. Even after walking around the park all day the stroll back to the hotel was not an issue. We took the ART bus one day as it's our daughter's favourite mode if transportation. It conveniently stops right outside the hotel and then it's a quick run over to the park. We're going back to Disney again in January and won't even bother to look for accommodations elsewhere!

Nice hotel, walking distance to convention centre and therefore close to disneyland. Pre room check was not complete as various room components were faulty. Front desk folks were very good but behind the scenes?

Great hotel, good walking distance to Disneyland, or you can get on the shuttle bus, for $5 a day. We chose the hotel as it was close to everything we wanted in Anaheim, Disneyland & the Angels Baseball stadium. The man on concierge was OK, I enquired about getting to the baseball stadium,a nd he said it would just be a $10 taxi fare, and we could get a taxi easy enough out the front, he didn't tell us we needed to call one, which was a little bit annoying. A good stay overall. Buffet breakfast is great value $15

I stayed here saturday through monday, I'd suggest staying away on saturdays! Very loud due to all the weekend activities. Sunday was SO quite:-) The beds were comfy, of course, the room was a little dated, but a few modern appliances make the room great!  This Hilton is not as nice as the Hilton in Salt Lake City (down town), but I'd stay here again. The shuttle out front goes directly to Disneyland park! There's a target near by and good restaurants. I wish Hilton wouldnt make guests pay for WIFI!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! That's annoying. Staff was very friendly, always a plus!

Great value.  Good Space.  One bedroom suite.  Children can sleep inside the bedroom as the parents talk and have quality time in the living room.  Clean hotel.  5mins from Disneyland and an arm's throw from numerous dining options.    Stayed in a non-smoking floor.  Unfortunately, a guest in the hallway was smoking and nobody noticed.  The whole hallway smelled like smoke.  But if you do not open your door, the room is fine and smells clean.

I have stayed at this hotel 4 times and have been very happy with everything from the cleanliness of the room, the helpful staff, the cookies and the comfort of the bed. It is worth the extra walk to Disneyland--I think it's about a mile. I'll stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay For a Disney Vacation
Summary: The Doubletree Anaheim is a great place to stay if you are looking to put on some mouse ears and visit Disneyland. The rooms are large and well maintained, and the living room and master bedroom are far enough apart that one light sleeper (me) could get some zzz's while my accomplices watched television loudly in the other room. The bathroom was also large and sparkling clean and the pool was great for an afternoon dip.  I will say that the hotel was not quite as close to the Disneyland entrance as I had imagined (maybe a mile away). There are shuttles and taxis willing to take you the distance at set rates, but I simply walked as the entrance tickets were expensive enough as it is. There was a Sheraton hotel between the Doubletree and Disneyland, but it was far more expensive

We enjoyed four fantastic nights at this hotel.  The first night we walked to Downtown Disney, which took only about 15 or 20 minutes.  The next few days, however, we took taxis.  For the three of us, they were always cheaper and more convenient than the ART.  I admit, I really liked the flexibility.  Check in to the hotel was easy, the cookies were amazing, and our room was comfortable.  We just had a standard room, which was just fine for us.    We only used the pool briefly, but it was nice.  And we enjoyed quick breakfasts at the cafe... and one long, leisurely one in the dining room.  All were good.  The little gift shop was useful, too, with a nice staff.    I would be more than happy to stay here again.

The pool was to small & in the shade. seems to be wrong to be charge for resort fee's and for parking. I don't want to be nickel & dime with fee's. I would  probably would look for a hotel with less fee's and complimentary breakfast.

This was by far one of the best stays that I have had for family travel! The suit that we had was well laid out, very clean and comfortable. We were here to visit Disney with our two younger children, so having the living and bathrooms seperate from the bedroom was important. Others have posted the distance to Disney was too much... We had a rental car and it literally took 2 mins to get from the hotel lot to a parking spot in the main Disney lot. We usually had a visit to the park in the morning come back for a nap and a swim and head back to the park. The hotel staff were amazing from the room keeping to front desk and restaurant they all bent over backward to make the stay great.  Kids eat free at the restaurants too which was awesome!
Manager Response: Dear Jay G,  Thank you so much for your review!  We hope you returned from your visit to Disneyland with some terrific memories.  I really like your idea about returning from the park for a nap and a swim - many guests aren't aware that Disneyland parking allows re-entry at no additional charge.  Again, thank you for your review.  We hope you'll visit the Doubletree Suites by Hilton again soon.  Warm regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: This hotel was rated very high and I can certainly see why. We were thrilled with our stay at this Doubletree. The front desk staff and concierge were quick to help and to offer suggestions to improve our stay. The buffet breakfast was a great way to start off our day and with the 'kids eat free' policy - this place can't be beat.   The beds were so comfortable and the room was very clean. We had no issue with noise or room temperature.   We really can't say enough about the hotel and its staff. We look forward to our next stay! Oh and the cookies are AMAZING!

Summary Heading: Good hotel but way tooooooo far from Disneyland
Summary: Ok we picked this because we couldn't get into the Disney California hotel for a reasonable price. This looked liked a nice hotel on the net and it was. The only problem is it does NOT have a free shuttle and you waste time getting to Disneyland and back and because you are walking so much at Disneyland you are exhausted by the end of it and to wait for a bus or taxi or walk is just way too time consuming. You are hardly in your hotel so stay closer to Disney in any hotel if you are time poor.   We ate at the restaurant and had room service all was good, the pool and spa was great. We had a suite overlooking the pool which was lovely however we had asked for a view of the fireworks and we were put on level 3 this is impossible from my opinion to see the fireworks unless you were

The room was clean and quiet. It was perfect for my family of five. I was able to put my children in the bedroom and close the door at their bedtime. I would definetly stay here again!!! No complaints at all.

Summary Heading: Huge rooms, and a lovely old world feel.
Summary: The Suites are approximately a 15-20 minute walk from Disney. It isn't easy. Especially the walk back after a 10 hour day on your feet! There are buses/taxis which will be able to get you there if this is a problem, but if it is really that much of an issue, perhaps consider one of the hotels across the street from the Entrance.  We were able to get a taxi from Anaheim Amtrak Station to the hotel without any hassle for $15. Note that this is the AMTRAK station, and NOT Anaheim Metro station, which is actually Anaheim street in Long Beach, which is NOWHERE NEAR DISNEYLAND! We figured that out just in time.  Anyway, the hotel is beautiful and refurbished, and give you the feel of being in an era gone by. It is serviced by a gift shop, a 'grappa lounge' and a small cafe that serves

Our four person family, ranging in age from two to 60 something, recently spent four nights at the hotel  during a vacation at Disneyland.  We selected the hotel due to the high marks it gets on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed.  The staff were consistently impressive: great customer service skills, friendly, helpful and responsive.  Titus at the front desk was a stand-out.  Housekeeping was efficient and effective.  The hotel is obviously well-managed and runs very smoothly; it is clean, well-appointed and in good repair.  Rooms are large (depending on which configuration you select) and nicely furnished.  Beds are comfortable.  Air-conditioning is relatively unobtrusive and effective.  The hotel has a nice pool and hot tub. The buffet breakfast was bountiful, diverse and

We booked this hotel for our family of four to stay at while visiting Disneyland.  It was absolutely perfect.  The hotel itself was very clean, newly remodelled and the staff were very nice and helpful.  The room was bright and spacious, perfect for our family.  We had a view of the pool from the 5th floor which was nice.  We could also see Disneyland from our room.  We would have been able to enjoy the fireworks had they not been cancelled due to high winds.  The beds were also very comfortable.  The restaurant was very family friendly.  Kids eat for free which makes it very attractive compared to the other nearby options.  We had the breakfast buffet each day (included as a Hilton Honors Gold perk) and it was very good.  Something for everyone.  The Disneyland visitor center

Summary Heading: Spotless, spacious suites - perfect for families
Summary: This hotel is great for families. Our room was sparkling clean and huge with a separate living area, large bathroom and bedroom. Bedding was plush and comfortable. In-room coffee was delicious.The check-in was quick and easy. The pool area was clean and the service was top-notch. We will definitely return to this hotel when we're back in the Anaheim area.

We booked this hotel because they offered suites that accommodated five people. Very pleasant and helpful staff throughout our stay. The room was clean and modern. We have nothing to complain about this hotel. We'll definitely stay here again.

Attended a meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center. There are several hotels closer to the Convention Center but found the short walk invigorating. The hotel is quiet...I suspect an excellent strategic placement by the front desk. This is well appreciated.

Summary Heading: The Place To Stay Near Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel gives consistently excellent service. The rooms are clean, and the service is always "world class!" Special kudos go to Gary of the Bell Staff and Martine and Freddy at the front desk. I always feel as if my business is appreciated.  They have an excellent (and friendly)  bar/lounge which also serves great food. It is apparent that this property is extremely  well-managed and does everything possible to make the guest experience pleasant. In the morning Starbucks is available at the coffee bar-a great way to start the day,  and they have recently extended their hours so you can grab a cup of coffee into the evening hours as well. All in all, the Doubletree Suites by Hilton  Hotel Anaheim Resort-Convention Center is a winner!
Manager Response: Dear Elliot B,  Thank you so much for the compliments!  I will be sharing your review with the entire hotel team.  I will also be sure to thank Gary, Martine and Freddy for excellent service they provided.  I'm really glad you visited Cafe Biscotti, where I get my non-fat, triple, one Splenda latte everyday. Thanks again for the kind words.  We hope you'll be back again soon.    Regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for five nights as part of a package through Allegiant Airlines flying out of Bellingham. This hotel met and exceeded all our expectations. We were greeted with a friendly hello and welcome from the concierge and received the same from the front desk staff. We were checked in quickly and handed a fresh, warm chocolate chip cookie at the same time - yum! The room (226 as we asked to be close to the pool and this was on the same floor as the pool which was just a short walk away, the window actually looked onto the pool but we never heard a peep due to the excellent soundproofing of the windows) was very spacious, modern and very clean. Wonderful comfy duvets and pillows. The room was always made up by the time we got back from the parks. It was so quiet at

Summary Heading: Highly recommend - would definitely stay again.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights when accompanying our daughter, son-in-law and 2 grandsons. I agree 100% with her review below (gracie5star). From the welcoming warm, choc-chip cookie on arrival to our trouble free check-out we had a fantastic stay. All staff were friendly and very helpful - no exceptions. Despite having the 2 boys with us, the restaurant staff were more than happy to cater for us all - and the menu was great. There were many good choices (including for the kids) and all at very reasonable prices. Location is perfect. The bus to Disneyland from right outside the front door lands you at the hub of bus transport to just about anywhere. The bus to Angel Stadium and the Honda Center were included in our ART ticket - and it was only $2.90 for a bus directly to

Pros:  friendly staff, 24/7 fitness center, quiet rooms (I stayed on the 2nd floor and did not hear the traffic outside), tv has HBO, large restrooms, AC works well, room service food was actually really good (pricy however)  Cons:  $16 dollars a day for parking, pool was closed, $7 dollars a day resort fee (whatever that is), soft beds (some people might like this, but I prefer firm beds)

Great choice for a visit to DisneyLand.  We stayed here while visiting DisneyLand and were extremely pleased with the accommodations.  The room was very nice and a good value for the money.  Also, a shuttle runs every 20 minutes to DisneyLand and is reasonable.  Would stay here again.

Doubletree Convention Center is just as good as their Orange hotel, which we stayed in last Disneyland trip.  They have a great lobby, lots of parking (no valet and it is $16/day), and room service.  There is free wifi, which is great!  Here is the breakdown of our stay so far:  Cleanliness inspection was conducted throughout the hotel room.  There were not signs of dust, stains, hairs, dirt, grime, etc.  The only things slightly dirty are the room service menu and the amenities booklets in the desk.  The restroom was immaculate, and I appreciate that the pipes from the sink are covered with a nice vanity.  The coffee maker is clean inside, no smells or mold.  The phones and remotes were decent (usually the filthiest parts of any hotel room).  No dust or dirt behind the beds, on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such an informative review, and I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. I found your observations to be helpful, as I am sure other people will also.  As to the roof noise, we were installing new guestroom valances and had to drill into the concrete...sorry! We have also been to your room and can't get the shower to duplicate the rattle but we will keep an eye on the room . Again, thank you for staying with us and we look forward to serving you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Very Pleased. Would book here again. Nice staff.
Summary: This Hotel exceeded our expectations. The Staff was very welcoming and attentive. We have no complaints. Very glad to get the recommendation from friends. Clean rooms, bathroom smelled like flowers!!! The free cookies are amazing too! I'll be thanking my friends for the tip and will pass it on to others as well.

The Double Tree Hotel near Disneyland is one of the better hotels in the area.  Of all the Hilton brands, this hotel is my favorite.  It's clean, updated, and you get free cookies every day!  Kids also eat free at their restaurant which helps to save some money.

My son and I stayed in Anaheim at 2 different hotels during the same week - the Hilton and Doubletree.  The Doubletree's staff were very attentive, parking was much cheaper, rooms were much larger, and had refrigerators and although there were a lot of teenagers in the hotel (big convention) it was much quieter than the Hilton.  Plus - can't beat the free cookies.

Extremely happy. The staff were very friendly, rooms very comfortable and clean. The bellman organised a taxi to Hollywood cheaper than the normal fare. Only a 15 -20 minute to Disneyland, straight up the road. My wife left hef belt behind. Sent an email, they found it and sent it to us in Adelaide South Australia for no charge. Not sure if we will get back there but if we do we will definately be staying there again.

We've just left the Doubletree Anaheim where we stayed for 8 nights while visiting Disneyland. I don't have a bad thing to say about this hotel. It was fantastic & we had a great stay. If you are travelling with children, I can't recommend this enough!  We were travelling with our two kids - 3 & 5. One of the big reasons we chose this hotel was we could get a suite at a reasonable price. This meant we could put the kids to bed and my husband and I still had somewhere else to sit without having to worry about waking the kids.   The room was lovely & quite large. The bedroom had two queen beds that were very comfy. There was a clean decent size bathroom with a good size vanity area outside the bathroom. The living area was a good size with a large couch, individual chair & table
Manager Response: Dear Gracie5star,  Thank you so much for the terrific review!  Your comments will be sure to make the hotel team smile.  Your review is so detailed and thoughtful; I think you may have stumbled upon a new profession... travel writer!  I appreciate you mentioning the Kids Eat Free program, which can be a big savings for families.  We hope you and your family will make a return trip from Australia to stay with us again one day.  Warm cookies will be waiting.  Thank you for choosing the Doubletree Suites by Hilton!  Best regards,  Deborah Fisher, Manager Doubletree Suites by Hilton

Summary: Nice hotel for family.  We are pretty happy with our 1 bedroom suite.  Room is spacious.  Hotel staff are very helpful.  They answer our questions patiently.  It's not far away from Disneyland but we choose to ride ART.  The route 3 stop is just outside the hotel and it takes 10 mins to Disney entrance.  We would come back to this hotel while visiting Disneyland again.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel near Disneyland and good eats
Summary: I went with a friend to Disneyland and California Adventures for the weekend and we decided to spend one night there so we wouldn't have to drive home the same day. The hotel was only a few blocks away from Disneyland proper and only a block away from the Toy Story parking lot which has regular shuttles to and from the parks. The room was great; we opted for a 2-queen bed non-smoking room. It had a separate lounge area with a comfy couch, a desk, and some chairs, a small HDTV, and I believe the room also had a fridge and microwave. The bedroom portion was also nice, had its own HDTV, and the beds were comfy. I liked that for the bathroom, the shower and toilet had their own door so I could be brushing my teeth while my friend was in the other portion and vice versa. Also, the

We returned to this hotel for the last two nights of our holiday having stayed nearly two years earlier. And we remained impressed with the standard of accommodation both size and cleanliness. Once again we paid extra for the top floor but had the luxury of no noisy guests above us. Indeed, I think this was the quietest room we had on the entire trip - I cannot recall hearing a single noise from adjacent rooms.  The suite was perfect for the three of us and the reception staff along with the concierge staff (I especially commend Xavier) were excellent. When I had some problems checking in online in the business centre, one of the reception staff very kindly sorted me out at the desk. Unfortunately I did not take  a note of his name.  We ate in the restaurant once and my wife

We chose this hotel due to reviews and proximity to Disney and weren't disappointed. It is located along the ART route which is handy if you plan on going back and forth to Disney on the same day as it is $5 for the pass per day rather than $5 per trip on the shuttles.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The rooms were decent sized suites and very clean. Outdoor pool was clean and a way to chill after Disney. Great buffet breakfast that even helped us pack pastries for snacks for the day.  You can also buy your Disney passes at the hotels which may save you from lines at the park.  Parking at the hotel was $16/day.

We stayed here free with hilton points. Staff friendly and helpful. Liked the cookie on checkin. The suite was nice and clean. The beds were comfy. Couldn't beat the breakfast buffet. $13 with juice and coffee and the kids eat free. It is about a mile walk to Disney. They run a shuttle but we were told that it was $5 a person which really didn't make sense as cab only cost $5.55. They also charge $15 dollars a day for parking. Those were the only negatives. Overall we had a good stay and would return

Loved this place. It was great and accommodating for my family of 5. Good service, the rooms and everything else were very clean. I did notice a few things that werent cleaned properly but I couldn't fault the cleaning staff for them as they were easy to notice things.  Also loved that they had in house laundry. Huge bonus.  I would definitely bring my family back to stay here. Ps the amazing chocolate cookies they give you on arrival are an awesome bonus.

This resort is great for families, the rooms are great. The staff were all very helpful and friendly apart from one Bar lady. The pool area is good for kids. The breakfast was just average but kids eat free which is good for families. The shuttle was right out the front so made getting to Disneyland very easy and was only $5 for adults a day and $3 for children, you can also walk it is only a 15 minute walk.

One of these days I will stay at a Disneyland Resort hotel. However, if I need to book 3 rooms again, I will definitely come back to Doubletree. There were1 of us all together and it was perfect. Everyone was very comfortable (the one bedroom suites rock). It is a bit of a walk to Disneyland and there are shuttles to take you back. It is definitely a great hotel if you just need base camp for Disney adventures and don't want the whole family on top of one another. The restaurants were nothing exciting which is fine since there are tons of food options in that area. The check in went well and everyone was very nice.

I stayed here while traveling on business. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious. Great location convenient to Disney parks and restaurants. Would definitely return with my family.

We stayed in a one room suite.  Accomadations were small, but clean and comfortable.  They cleaned the room, folded some of our clothes that were left on the bed.  They only replaced towels when we threw them on the floor in a pile.  The staff was friendly.  Enjoyed the breakfast buffet for $13.50.  The staff was very good in the dining room and the food was good as well.  The price of the room does not include a shuttle, which is $5 per day per person.  We found it a lot less expensive to take a taxi to Disneyland.  (Around $7 for one way).  You could walk too...but you always do a lot of walking while at Disneyland.  Usually the rooms have local info and things that are going on.  When we finally found it, there was not much info.  All in all we would stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel during Spring Break/Easter Weekend...  We were given a 2 room Suite on the 3rd floor facing the back of the hotel....  Check-in was a good, however there was an issue with the number of breakfast coupons given out (since I'm a Diamond Member) it's usually not an issue, however the front desk consultant, said that they are very picky about the coupons and that she would have to check with her supervisor (4 days later that had never happened)  The hotel is located along Route #1 or #3 Anaheim Resort Transit which has a stop directly in front of the hotel (on the sidewalk) or you can hop across the street as to not have to do the whole loop...A typical 3-day Adult pass is $12 per person, a 3-day Child Pass is $5 per person..this is for unlimited rides with a

I was on the fifth floor and overlooked the pool area.  First, the positives:  1) Spacious - having stayed at other hotels near Disneyland, I found these hotel rooms had plenty of space. 2) The cookie at check-in - OK, this is silly I know, but we had a long flight and I was starving so I really appreciated the fresh cooked cookie. 3) Restaurants - it is close to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Morton's for better dining, and Denny's and fast food for simplier fare. 4) Noise level - the hotel was full or near capacity, but I found it quiet and I am a light sleeper. 5) Bathroom setup - OK, this might also be silly but I liked that the sink was outside the toilet/shower/bath area - when someone needed the sink you didn't have to wait if someone was using the shower. 6) I like that

This is a long awaited review for this hotel (stayed here September 2010). I had such a pleasant experience that I think it is fair to leave a good note on this hotel. Every time I visit LA and stayed at other hotels, I kept on comparing this to them. I am a Hilton Honors member and used my points during my stay and happy to say that I never regret using my points here! Breakfast was really good and being close to the freeway was desirable. Easy to find and shuttle service was on point. Will recommend staying here and will definitely come back one day.

I have stayed in this hotel couple of times, and the recent stay was during the week of 04/01. I should admit, that the recent stay was not quite as pleasant as it was before. Clearly the service quality was sliding in the hotel. There was no room cleaning one day during our stay, when I called the front desk, nobody really offered apology, instead, I was blamed for putting the "No disturb" sign out of the room, although the sign was only there for an hour. I was told that an hour was good enough for the cleaning lady to skip cleaning our room, which is totally unacceptable to me. when I checked out at the front desk, the gentleman didn't even care to ask how was my stay. I asked for both the hardcopy and soft copy of the statement, and unfortunately, I never received the soft
Manager Response: Dear CA Mom,  Thank you for your review.  It sounds like we definitely let you down.  You are correct, the level of service you received is not the excellent service we are known for offering.   The hotel team looks at all reviews as a learning opportunity.  Your comments will be shared with both the housekeeping and front office teams.  Since you did not receive an apology during your stay, I'd like to say it now.  We are very sorry.  I will also follow up to ensure you receive an email copy of your receipt.  CA Mom, we thank you for your repeat business.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to show your family the great service you've come to expect from Doubletree Suites by Hilton.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Doubletree Suites by Hilton

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Orange County
Summary: Went in April to visit a local college. There was good selection and availability at the time, picked the Doubletree mostly because it was a suites hotel and had a very good price point. Was not disappointed--lobby area is very nice and spacious, great business center, plenty of parking space and the suite as promised! Breakfast was a good surprise--staff felt bad we didn't have a coupon (booked low rate through Expedia) and charged us less than list and didn't charge for our daughter. Overall great experience.

This hotel was recommended by a friend.  Overall, I was satisfied with my stay.  We arrived at close to 2am and were given warm cookies and were able to get assistance with luggage to our room.  We purchased our tickets to Disneyland in the hotel lobby which was extremely convenient.  We had dinner at the hotel one night.  Food was very good and kids eat free.  Rooms were spacious for a family of 4.  The only complaint I have is that housekeeping did not arrive until after 4:00 each day.  We were out of the room by 7:30am every day and didn't come back until late afternoon so I was very disappointed that the room hadn't been cleaned.  I wish they had a "service please" hangar for the door.  I never said anything.  We decided to walk to Disneyland each day and it is FAR!  It took

Summary Heading: Places to stay next to Disneyland
Summary: Best place to stay close to Disneyland- best value for the price.  My family and I stay here frequently.  Clean, large rooms and the best service.  To top it off, a free cookie at check in.  Also, with 2 small kids its nice to park so close to the front door of the facility and not have to walk far with all the gear.

Have stayed at many Doubletree hotels from Dana Point CA to Torrance CA as well as the ones near Orange County airport and Irvine.  Have also stayed at each of the Hilton family hotels surrounding Disneyland (i.e. Hilton Convention Center, Embassay Suites, Hampton, Homewood Suites, etc etc).  Based on the spacious and clean rooms, the food, and close proximity to the main gate of Disneyland, this hotel really stands above the rest if you are not considering any of the Disneyland resort hotels.  I wish we had tried this hotel a lot sooner but now that we have, we will continue to stay here each time we go to Disneyland in the future. My husband and I stayed in a corner King suite on the 7th floor while my daughter and her family stayed in the suite with 2 queen beds.  Both rooms

I Am here for the Audiology Now!!13 convention. I arrived early, but was unable to check in before 3:00pm. That is  the only complaint that I have. However, the front desk was gracious, and they checked to make sure that I could get in ASAP. The rooms are spacious, clean. I stayed on the street side, seventh floor, and could still hear the street noises. However, that was not a distraction. At home I hear the trains. Room service was good. Rather beds a comfortable. The water pressure is great. All in all a good place to stay that is in walking distance to the convention center. The hotel is also filled with Disney Land families. So it is also in a great location for DL!

Found a decent price for this hotel however did not find anything special about it.  Took about 20 minutes to walk to Disneyland, no shuttle is provided from the hotel.  Having stayed in numerous other hotels around Disney would probably not choose to stay here again.  Didn't find the staff very welcoming and the rooms are in need of a little updating.
Manager Response: Dear SuperScaryMiss,  I apologize that you didn't feel welcomed during your visit.  It is an crucial part of our business and we will discuss your thoughts with the entire team.  While the hotel does not own a shuttle, we are a part of the Anaheim Resort Transit system which offers service to Disneyland and area attractions for a nominal fee.  We've also listened to feedback from our guests and will be updating our rooms this year - carpets, sofas and more.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to show you the great service and accommodations Doubletree Suites by Hilton usually provides.  Sincerely,  Deborah Fisher, Doubletree Suites by Hilton

Summary: I enjoyed my stay very much. When I checked in, I found that there was hair on the wall in the shower from a previous guest. I removed it with a washcloth and left a note for housekeeping. The room was spotless everywhere else and continued to be kept that way.  The room was large and pleasant. The bed and bedding was very comfortable.  I ate dinner in the restaurant and it was very good. On the last day, I had breakfast there, too. I was sorry that I hadn't had a chance before because the breakfast buffet was very nice and had a wide selection.  I was there for a conference and it is quite a hike to the conference center, about 1/2 a mile. The only thing that they need to improve is having a lighted makeup/shaving mirror on the wall. There was a large mirror over the vanity but

Summary Heading: Doubletree never fails to make me feel at home
Summary: We attended Wondercon during our stay last on the weekend of the 29th. We love the vicinity of it between the convention center and Disneyland.  The best part of our stay was the 13$ buffet breakfast. That deal is a steal compared to other hotel breakfast offers. I also noticed that the rooms accomodate for smoking and non smokers, which is a plus if you have a member of the family who smokes.  I've always been a DoubleTree fan and higly recommend this location to anyone and everyone.

We chose this hotel from the Western Vacations brochure, based on its ranking and reviews here.  We were not disappointed!  Be sure you are looking at this site, however, because there is another Doubletree which is at the convention centre (100 The City Drive), this site, at 2085 Harbour is NOT the convention centre location, and also does NOT include a free shuttle to Disneyland that the City Drive location does. We were traveling with our 2 teenagers and requested a one bedroom suite. It was kind of a goofy configuration-- the separate bedroom had 2 queen beds, and the main area had a pull out couch. (I had assumed 1 bedroom = 1 bed, and the other bed and pull out would be together).  However, one quick phone call to the desk, and they sent up and set up a cot, so everyone
Manager Response: Thank you for saying so many nice things about our hotel, and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay. I just want to point out , for the benefit of our Trip Advisor followers, that our hotel at 2085 South Harbor is the one thats closest to Disneyland and the Convention Center, while the Doubletree at 100 City Drive is closer to Angles stadium. Hope to see you again soon. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Nice, but never made to feel welcome
Summary: This hotel is nicely appointed and served our purpose of staying in a higher quality hotel near Disneyland, but we were never made to feel welcome. We arrived a little earlier than check-in (around noon), and although they had rooms available, the front desk seemed to scold us for checking in early. Then, we were given the smallest room in the floor plan, which was obvious from the fact that the bed filled the room, and the site map on the door showed how small it was in comparison to the others. Then, when we stored our bags for a few hours, we tipped the bell staff to help us take our bags to the curb, but they didn't lift a finger to help us get the bags beyond their desk near check-in. They shouldn't have taken our tip if they weren't going to lend us a hand. They were
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear that you were not made to feel welcome, as that gets to the very essence of what our business is all about. I will be reviewing your observations with our staff, to reiterate the importance of being friendly and welcoming. While I don't want to make excuses, you were here over a very busy period [Spring break] and had reserved one of our standard rooms vs a suite, hence the size. I value your comments as you obviously travel a lot, and hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of service. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Beds very comfortable , had top floor room and very quiet, even with a hotel full of high school  cheerleaders!  ( cheer leading national competition at convention center). Hotel staff very helpful.  Went to Disneyland and rented a car, used the parking lot at Disney very long walk, there is a parking lot a block from hotel with a shuttle that drops you off at front gate, if you have a car use this lot as,e price and quick. Had an awesome stay. Did not eat at hotel, but had drinks in the bar, very nice.

We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway to see a baseball game and go to Disney.  The location is unbeatable!  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was quiet, clean and comfortable.  The bed was comfortable and made for a good nights sleep.  It was not luxurious, but the room met all of our needs.  I would recommend this to others and stay again.

Just got back from Disneyland and spent the couple of days there staying at the Doubletree.  The Doubletree-Convention Center is pretty consistent.  We've stayed there each time we've visited Disneyland and always found it to be a clean and relaxing place to stay.  We were traveling with our 15 year old and her friend, so we had adjoining rooms which worked out great.  We each could unwind separately and in our own way.  The rooms were comfortable and very clean.  Another plus, even with all the families in the hotel, it was very quiet!  After a noise filled day at Disney, coming back to quiet was nice.  We recieved complimentary breakfast, which was nice to start the day off with.  Overall, a pleasant stay.

Whilst the hotel is average to good, it is a far cry from our previous stay in Anaheim, when it was fashionable for the locals to be reasonably red-necked. The hotel is very clean and more than acceptable without being ostentatious, and the beds are actually quite excellent.  Proximity to the Disney options is good - nearly a mile, although you can take a bus, and the dining options for families are good but not fabulous if you are seeking fine dining, albeit being reasonably priced.  Anyway, you can always stroll across the road to Denny's or one of the ubiquitous Mexican fast-food joints nearby.  Recommended for families, which I imagine is its raison d'être.  BTW, the included breakfast is limited but excellent.

Summary Heading: Great home base for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: We stayed at this hotel as a home base for a Disneyland visit with a toddler.  First of all, the location was ideal for this, almost exactly a 1 mile walk to the front gates, or a quick shuttle bus ride right outside the hotel.  The lobby is spacious, clean & welcoming, and the free cookies at check-in were a huge hit with the little one.  We had a 1 bedroom suite which had a ton of space and was ideal for having the little one sleep in a separate room from us.  DoubleTree even provided the crib, so one less thing for us to pack and travel with.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and did I mention roomy?  A very nice place to come back to after joining the crowds at Disneyland.  We took advantage of the outdoor pool area which has a large deck with chairs, but a pretty small

Summary Heading: Great cookies, great room, great location
Summary: We wanted to stay near Disney and truthfully looked for a doubletree because my husband loves the cookies. We found this doubletree suite near Disney in Anaheim and it was great. It's perfect for families that want 2 rooms for the price of one.  The rooms were large in size and could comfortably hold 4.  We checked in very late,  almost midnight and the cookies were fresh and warm and te room was clean. What more could ou ask for.

I made a last minute reservation when every other hotel was full, and had a very pleasing one night stay. Everything was very clean and well cared for, I thought the hotel was very visually attractive. There is an authentic feeling to the architecture here, with lots of stone. Every interaction with the staff was consistently professional and friendly. I only stayed one night, but I would do it again. I paid more than the lowest rates advertised, so I may be extra critical, but I find no faults.

It's kinda like they don't try too hard since they are close to Disney World and hope you will be under the influence of Mickey Mouse.  It has a pretty lobby, but the rooms are pretty standard.  Not all that exciting.  Fortunately, I was only there one night.
Manager Response: Dear Kuwells,  Thank you for your review.  You are correct, Disneyland and Mickey Mouse can be quite intoxicating.  While Mickey does cast a spell, it is our service that should make the biggest impression.  I'm sorry we missed the opportunity to Wow you.  I'd also like you to know our suites will be getting a facelift this year.  Everything from carpet to sofas, chairs to bedding will be updated.    I hope you will give us another opportunity to impress with our usually excellent guest service and a refreshed hotel.  Sincerely, Deborah Fisher Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced!!
Summary: Let me start off my saying that I'm writing this review a month late hoping that I wouldn't have to write a poor review of this hotel. The grounds are lovely and rooms are ideal, but after my last stay I'm EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED in this hotel customer service and management.    On the day I was to check-out, I discovered when I was packing that I was missing my wine glass from my recent trip a week earlier to Napa Valley. I called the front desk to let them know that my item was missing and to see if it had been found due to the housekeeper taking it by mistake. After about three hours I went to the front desk and asked if my item had been found. I received the "I'm sorry ma'am we looked in the lost and found, talked to the housekeeper and staff and couldn't find it." There was
Manager Response: Dear Amanda,      Please let me apologize for the red tape and frustration you encountered in attempting to get your wineglass back.  Our managers are usually quite accessible and I am so sorry this was not the case for you.  We will be discussing your situation with our management team.     Our Director of Front Office should have been in touch by now with the tracking information for your replacement glass.  In addition, she will advise you of some additional compensation for the unneeded difficulty you encountered.     Once again, let me apologize for the challenges you faced.  I want to assure you this is not the level of service the Doubletree Suites by Hilton normally provides.  Sincerely, Deborah Fisher Doubletree Suites by Hilton Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

Summary Heading: Disappointing; You'd Never Know We Were There
Summary: I chose this hotel because of a few comments I read from other guests, such as "we were upgraded and the view was wonderful." Also, I was told that every room in the hotel was a suite. Our room had nowhere to sit with a mirror, no privacy for the bathroom sink area, and the view we had was of the back roof of the first floor. It was literally the worst room in the place. I noticed that the group in front of us were upgraded, and quickly taken care of while we had to wait for the next shuttle because they took so long to take care of us. And when they did, it was that back room that really no one would want. We did not complain, but we were not happy with it.   The hotel is about a mile from the park, if you include the walk from the street. We bought the shuttle tickets every
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, I am sorry that you ran into so many problems during your stay, but appreciate your bringing them to my attention. Let me first address the room... while we are primarily a suite hotel we do have 50 standard rooms, and it appears that is what you chose when making your reservation. The room in question, while on the pool level is one of the largest standard rooms that we have, but perhaps one on a higher floor would have been preferable. As for the pool, we did have it out of order for three days to do some resurfacing, and I apologize for not informing you in advance. The closing  hours of operation both here and at  the other hotels in the area, is typically between 10PM-11PM. While a dip after a long day at the park might interest some,  most of our guests simply want to go to sleep and object to the noise that a pool can generate. Finally, there is no excuse for indifference, and the waitress in question wants you to know she is very sorry. We pride ourselves on guest service, but learn from our mistakes. Thank you for staying with us and I hope we will have another opportunity to serve you. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: I am from Alabama but will be visiting California for the first time in May. I will be attending a international training event for my company for a period of three days. I was online trying to figure out the best hotels in the area and I came up on your hotel. I did call after reviewing some information. The first representative I spoke with was in a call center and was not very helpful. I then proceeded to call back and spoke with Katie at the front desk. She was wonderful! She answered all of my questions will accuracy and proficiency. I have 3+ years of hotel front desk experience and that is what I call "great guest services!!!" I can not wait to come and visit your hotel and I am also recommending my coworkers that are coming to Anaheim to stay with you all, as well. I

Great service from reception to check out.  The room was great, clean, and comfortable.  The restaurant was excellent.  I had a little difficulty with the HVAC, but nothing that reduced my comfort for the night.

Summary Heading: Great for our family of five.  Classy hotel!!
Summary: Our family of five (2 adults, 2 kids plus 1 infant) had a wonderful 7night stay here Feb27-Mar6, 2013.  We stayed in a queen suite facing the pool (north facing) and enjoyed the Disney fireworks from our room.  Housekeeping did a great job; in fact, the staff was always friendly and hotel was clean and welcoming, we have no complaints about the hotel at all!!  Kids loved the heated pool and hot tub.  Across the street (south), there is a Carl's Jr which was very convenient for dinner (yummy Oreo malts!).  Hotel is approx. 20min walk to Disneyland, straight north on Harbour Blvd.  We mostly took the Disney shuttle from their Toy Story (Woody) parking lot to save our feet, the lot is about a 5-8min walk from hotel.  This was FREE (as compared to ART) and the shuttles were always

Just spent 2 nights at this hotel and wished we had stayed longer.  From the time we arrived until the minute we left we were very welcomed and found the high level of service extended from reception to all areas of the hotel; guest services, housekeeping, bar and restaurant.  Genuine staff who understand customer service principles; so refreshing.  We were made to feel very welcome and comfortable in this hotel.  The hotel room was a little outdated but very comfortable and immaculately clean and the personal touches when the room was serviced were lovely.  We will definitely be recommending this hotel to others.

Summary Heading: Beds were the quality of maybe a 2 star hotel
Summary: No where was there notice that the pool would be under construction during our stay; that was an important ammenity for our family.  We thought this hotel would be Hilton quality, but clearly no updates have been done to the rooms.  Older, not bright rooms and the beds are horrible.  Never once got a good nights sleep.  Other issues, but over all this was a two-star hotel pretending to be better than it was.  Walk to Disney was 25 to 30 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear Wendy H, Your right about the swimming pool.
