We needed to do some minor resurfacing to the coping stone, and while we made arrangements for our guests to use an adjacent hotel pool, we failed to notify you in advance, and for that I apologize. If you will contact me directly, we can discuss this further. As for the guestrooms, we typically receive positive comments, but respect your opinion. I will be inspecting the room paying particular attention to the mattresses. Sincerely yours, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Just as good as last time!
Summary: I stayed here 4 years ago and have to say I loved it every bit as I did then.  Decor hasn't changed but you would not know there is 4 years wear and tear as they obviously maintain everything so well.  Warm cookies were just as welcoming, staff just as friendly if I head this way again it will definitely be my hotel of choice!

This was our first stop on our first trip to the USA. We stayed in a standard room and was amazed by the service and facilities for the incredibly cheap price.   Very close to Disneyland along the main road) and an array of cheap eats and shops close by. We could either take a walk to the parks or jump on a shuttle their for a couple of dollars (a ticket return was something like $4).   Warm cookies on arrival and very prompt check in & out The business centre offered us free internet use where we were able to efficiently deal with some matters back in Australia. One night I was feeling unwell and the conscierge bent over backwards to ensure I was ok. The next morning I was even asked if I was feeling better and if there was anything more I could do. There is a genuine care

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland trip!
Summary: Our trip was February, 2013. Our group had three rooms; regular room w/kingsize bed, and two suites for seven of us. One of the suites was an upgrade from our original reservations and the two suites were connected; ours was a corner suite. WOW, talk about some serious space with two connecting suites! I almost needed a GPS . . .  Rooms were done very nicely, nice bed, great linens on the bed including doing the comforter being covered. YAY! Granite in the bathrooms, clean carpets, 2 flatscreens per suite. Fast service at the front desk, beautiful huge lobby, AND WARM CHOCOLATE CHIP WALNUT COOKIES UPON REQUEST!! We loved this place!   Another plus is that this is a hotel with a ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) at the front door. (It's not free, but I felt it was worth the

Three adults and one child stayed in the 2 queen suite. The seperate living area was awesome and afforded privacy and quiet. We had groceries delivered and the wonderful concierge (Javier) delivered them to our room and put the cold items in the mini-fridge because we weren't there at delivery time. All staff were friendly. Location to Disneyland was fine - the 20 minute walk felt safe and there were many restaurants close-by. The pool was heated and clean.

Very clean. Very comfy beds. Friendly Staff. Great size rooms.  Shuttle picks up/drops off right in front of the Hotel.  The breakfast buffet was not only tasty, kids ate for free.  Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff were extremely nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We decided at the last minute to surprise our little ones with a trip down to Disneyland and knew we wanted to stay in a place that had a bedroom separate from the living area. After a quick search on the Internet we found the place we stayed last was renovating their pool area (this would have been totally unacceptable to our kids) and we found the Doubletree. We stayed 3 nights and we are so glad we did!  We arrived After a 6 hour drive at 2 pm and they checked us in quickly and handed us warm cookies (yum!). The pool and hot tub were perfectly heated. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. We enjoyed the restaurant each morning with a free hot breakfast and the kids ate free in the evening. The food was very good and the service was kind and attentive. The bus to

Summary Heading: Great location - Close to Disneyland; You could walk!
Summary: For those who don't mind a little walk -- you are close enough to walk to Disneyland -- with all the great features of a Doubletree -- yes, includes yummy cookies at check-in. Family friendly - Easy parking.

Summary Heading: Good value - great location away from the crowds
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for three nights with the sole purpose of visiting Disneyland. Two things before I talk about the hotel: First, the hotel is a little too far to walk to the main entrance. Pro: it's quiet. We drove the first day - mistake. We ended up walking more from the parking lot than if we had walked from the hotel! Tip: take a cab. It costs between $5.50 and $7.50 each way, depending on traffic and which direction you're going. A few bucks for the tip and you're at $10-$20 for the day - compared to $15 at a parking lot, and 20 times  faster, especially in the morning. Second - the hotel's restaurant is great. Take advantage of the free breakfasts, and the dining room at night. We ate there three nights - it was always good - better than good- we never tired of
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and I am glad that you had a pleasent stay. While the bed may have appeared small all of the rooms have either two queen or one king bed. Irregardless, your suggestion to snuggle up is a good one. Regards, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Very Friendly Staff especially in the diningroom
Summary: I loved the servers in the morning I was there 5 days and had breakfast each morning.  I was greeted as an old friend and the server brought me cranberry juice instead of orange after the first morning they filled my water bottle and coffee cup which helped my morning at the conference.

We're here as I write this.  There was some confusion with our reservations (mostly due to a communication error between my Husband and I) But once here, we requested a high floor and ended up on the second floor in a handicap accessible room(?). No we didn't require or request this type of accommodation. Room is clean, spacious and we have a view of the pool; which is next to our room. Earlier we had breakfast here (Agio) and it was very good! Jerry at the front desk is very helpful! Every staff member that we have encountered has been top notch.

By far the best Doubletree service I have ever recieved. Say hello to Marcson and Michelle at the front. The room is very clean and the service was very good. I came here because my friend had his wedding at this location so when I was on business I naturally chose this one.

Summary Heading: Good deal for the price & close to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree on a short trip to the LA area recently. Picked this hotel since we were hitting Disney for a day. It is an 8 min drive from the Disney parking lot (though traffic when the park closes is quite heavy - at least when we were there).  The room was big, pretty normal decor. We were upgraded to a suite. Big bathroom. Tile on the floor had seen better days - but seemed clean. I liked the shampoo, conditioner, and soaps.  Gym was small but contained nice equipment - an elliptical, treadmill, medicine balls, bosu ball, and weights/pulley tower. Towels and water were available in the gym (pool was right outside near the gym).  The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The best part was the breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel (there are plenty of

This hotel's charging policies are not correct online or with the reservation line. We made reservations for 2 rooms 5 months prior to our visit. We printed the confirmation and cancellation policy.  We did have to cancel 1 night of our 5 night stay. The policy states no fees within 72 hours which we upheld. We even specifically asked the reservation clerk and were told there would be no charges. However, upon checking in our rates for the four nights were raised to be the same amount as the 5 night stay an extra $300. After a lengthy discussion with  Henry the manager telling us they couldn't help what the reservation company told us the charges were reduced to $116 which is the fee for early cancellation.I understand now the rates were probably based on the 5 night stay but
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you had a problem cancelling one night of your reservation, and I have asked Henry to call and be sure that the matter of your rate and or cancellation charge have been adequately explained. Since your stay was over a busy convention period, most hotels will typically charge either an early departure fee, or quote a higher rate for the shorter period of time. If this wasn't adaquetly explained when you changed your reservation I apologize.  Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: This is close to Disney and they were able to accommodate my family of 5.  We drove to Disney instead of using the shuttle and it was short and easy to get there.  The rooms have a mini fridge and a micro that came in handy.  There is a Target and several restaurants nearby as well.

Spacious room (for 3 of us), walkable to Disney (about 20 minutes) and overall good value. We stayed for 3 nights and found it very comfortable and reasonably quiet. Having a separate room where kids can sleep on the sofa bed is so good.

Doubletree Suites Anaheim was a terrific choice for our Disney vacation.  The suites are well appointed, the staff always helpful, and the distance was Disneyland was perfect.  We did not need a rental car because Disney was within walking distance or, if too tired, there is a convenient and inexpensive shuttle that makes a stop right outside the hotel.  The pool looked very nice, but did not get afternoon sun so it did not meet our needs.  There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse next to the hotel which always offers a great meal.  Also within walking distance to the hotel were many less expensive restaurants, a Target store, and drug store.  The neighborhood was very safe.  Once again, we enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree Suites Anaheim.

Recently stayed here for a few nights mid week and was very impressed.  The rooms are roomy and service excellent.  The rates, around $150 mid week including taxes.  Pretty good rate and they have a good in-house restaurant, too.  Booked through Expedia

The hotel offers gluten free toast and cereals to accompany their breakfast buffet. They also had soy milk and other alternatives. If you are a sugar free family as well this is a little more challenging but in my experience that's the case anywhere.  Comfortable hotel, easy access to Disneyland and close walk to restaurants and other amenities.

We recently stayed at the Doubletree Suites whilst on a short stopover from Australia to visit Disneyland. We have a three year old so we booked a two-queen room suite which was great as it allowed small person to sleep and we could stay up without disturbing her. The separate lounge area was much bigger than I anticipated (and bigger than the photos showed). We were on the third floor, facing the street and traffic noise was very limited, nothing to worry about.  Only noise we had was the last night when the aircon suddenly got noisy but we just turned it off and didn't worry about it.   There is no mini-bar but there is a fridge and microwave with two service stations directly opposite the hotel. Room service I think was 24 hours and is extensive.  We were really fortunate to

Summary Heading: Great rooms, professional service. Excellent quality and price.
Summary: Great location. The staff is very professional and the rooms are excellent. Stayed 3 nights and the location was very convenient for walking to the Convention Center and many good restaurants. I felt safe and the breakfast was excellent. I will definitely stay here whenever I am in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice location; friendly staff; clean facility
Summary: I have stayed at the Doubletree in Anaheim several times and have been happy each time.  I highly recommend staying there and would go back again.  The beds are extremely comfortable, the rooms are spacious and clean, plus have just about everything you need.  The staff is always friendly and willing to assist you whenever needed.  The exercise facility is weak though.  Only one treadmill that works well and an elliptical.  Some weights as well.  People were waiting to use the equipment and getting frustrated.

Hhonors Diamond member.  They will charge an early departure fee if you get done with your meetings a day or two early so may not be a great spot for the business traveler.  The rooms were large and nice but the parking was a pain and the food was so-so.

We stayed for three nights and since a member of our family is a hilton honors member, we were upgraded to a two queen suite. We checked in a little late but it didnt take long for us to get our keys. The hotel is a little far for us to walk with a 5 year old in a tow so we got the shuttle day passes for $5 a day, can't imagine walking back from the park after playing all day. I am impressed with their customer service, overall excellent staff. Room service was great too, our late dinner didn't take long to arrive to our room. Breakfast buffet was great, our server gloria is very friendly and made sure we have enough coffee on our table. I would love to stay in this hotel again on our next disney trip.

Alberto at Reception was warm and congratulated us on our honeymoon trip. He went beyond to delight us by giving us 1 more complimentary breakfast coupon as our package includes only 1.  Breakfast crew was warm n friendly. Though there was no made to order egg station, they have a good spread and a pancake machine ;)  Concierge was friendly and pointed us to the shortest path to Disney gates about 15-20 mins walk.   Room is clean, spacious and comfy but carpets and wallpapers looks dated. The aged feel, seems in line with other Hilton's we stayed in.  Parking is free and they have a counter to purchase Disney other theme park tickets at the lobby floor.   Will return ;)

Summary Heading: Always clean, helpful staff and comfortable beds!!!! Walking distance to Disney.
Summary: This was our 4th stay in this hotel.  The 2 room layout is perfect for us since we have a toddler in a pack and play (they always provide with fresh linens).   Rooms are always clean and lots of towels! The team is friendly and we will stay here again in the fall.

We arrived at the Doubletree at 9 am after a long flight from Santiago, Chile and were received with open arms at the front desk. Though check in is at 3 pm, we were immediately given a room and even better, without asking, the one with the view of the pool and Disney fireworks. The concierges were very helpful with making reservations for taxis, shuttles and booking trips around LA and we could buy the tickets to Disney at the Disney Welcome Center downstairs. We had booked a double queen suite, which was fantastic. Two tvs, a fridge, a microwave, great for having a nice snack after being out and about all day. There is an am/pm store right across the street from the hotel where you can buy milk, cereal, etc. and a Target about a 10 min walk down the road. We actually never

This hotel is very nice. As an employee of the Hilton brand, who has worked front desk and is currently in the sales department- I was 100% satisfied with the quality of service received here. The room was beautiful and clean. The bed was delightful, I slept wonderfully. Michelle at the front desk was super nice and helpful during the check in process.  I was not here for Disney, but its very close and would be a perfect option for a family travelling to Disney.  I will definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood!

Summary Heading: Clean, everyone was professional.  Great value for money spent.
Summary: Clean, everyone was professional.  Great value for money spent.  Will stay here again when I am in the area. Right in the hub for Disneyland, and has fantastic choice of resturants very close by.  Parking is $16 per night with unlimited in-n-out.

We ended our 2 week whirlwind holiday staying here for the first weekend of Feb. After being in new york and getting less than average service, it was great to be welcomed basically with open arms by the lovely staff. The room was spacious and super clean, and felt homely and not too hotel like in a good way. We opted to have the buffet breakfast the last day of our stay, and it was cheap and delicious, and the staff went out of their way to help my dietary needs, and it wasn't a problem unlike some places we've stayed.  It was a fair walk to disneyland, but not impossible, it was nice to not be so close to the hustle and bustle of downtown disneyland. the concierge went up and beyond their job to help us. If we're ever in Anaheim again, we'll defiantly come and stay here again!

Staying at a convention can get on your nerves, so one of the best things you can do for yourself is book the right hotel near a convention center.  I have stayed in many of the hotels near the Anaheim Convention Center over the years.  Note that most of these also serve guests who are in town to visit Disneyland as it is just across the street from the Convention Center as well.  The Doubletree Suites fits the bill as a place to calm oneself and get a good rest each night during convention time.  The service is quite good.  I was greeted this last time by a very pleasant person at the front desk for check-in.  The concierge was extremely helpful in locating restaurants, getting taxi reservations, booking transportation and more.  The room was clean and neat, and what a pleasant

Stayed here to be close to Disneyland and also the Honda Centre (2 miles) as we were going to a show there.  15 mins easy walk gets you to Disney and you pass a 7-11 on the way so you can buy stuff to put in the room fridge or heat in the microwave. $5 gets you a ticket to use on the shuttle bus that stops at the entrance to hotel and can be used as much as you like all day (buses every 20 mins).  Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, rooms spacious, clean and well equipped with very comfortable beds.  Can't comment on breakfast as we ate at Downtown Disney or at Denny's across the road from hotel.  Stayed in 3 hotels on this trip and this was our favourite.  Didn't have time to use pool or fitness rooms but other people looked like they were enjoying them!

Tidy clean and very friendly staff.  Some of the carpet is worn in parts of the corridor, but who cares, it's only for walking on.  The pool area was amazing, great for kids and adults, an awesome place to relax.  The food in the restaurant was great, never got sick of it.

Summary Heading: Great hotel within (long) walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: The Doubletree Suites was a fine hotel for our Disneyland vacation.  1) Facilities - Great. The kids enjoyed the pool and the parents enjoyed the hot tub. Fitness facility looked great but small. Pool hours could be later than 10pm but it is in the courtyard so would likely disturb other guests. 2) Room - We had a 2 Queen suite. Good, compact room design. Wish the hide-a-bed was better quality. Put a kid on it and that was fine but I wouldn't wish that bed on an adult.Clean rooms. 3) Location - Not bad but a longish walk from Disneyland. Might choose a closer location next time. No shuttle provided either which was unfortunate. You can take the Disneyland shuttle to the "Woody" parking lot and then it is about a 5 minute walk to the Doubletree however. 4) Staff - Friendly and

I found this hotel by chance last summer for the weekend we arrived in the USA from melbourne. Three block walk to the Disney resort which was great, the hotel itself is very clean, the beds have to be one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on in the USA, it has an in house Starbucks. The rooms are a decent size with your standard bathroom amenities. I love that upon check in the give you a hot cookie. We arrived a few house early and asked if we could check in earlier as we had just flown 16 hours and they were so accommodating. We went down the street and got a bite to eat and came back to a fresh room for us. Great hospitality. If I ever go back to Anaheim, this will be my hotel of choice.

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly and Convenient for Disney
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights mid-January and had a great stay. The staff were incredibly friendly, the complimentary cookies were delicious, and the housekeeping staff were very accommodating as well.  Our king-sized bed was incredibly comfortable, and the addition of the mini-fridge and microwave was very useful for our early morning breakfasts before Disneyland in the morning.  The hotel also provided a buffett breakfast in the morning, which we tried out on our last morning and were surprised with the selection available.  We enjoyed being able to hook up our ipod to the alarm in the morning, the internet worked for us, as well as the air conditioning.   My only complaint was that the windows in our room did not open. This was by no means a deal breaker for us,

Checked in here for two nights for business. Was surprised they charged $16 per day for parking. Had a little bit of a challenge checking in as a colleague made the reservation for me. This shouldn't have been an issue as we do this all the time and it's never a big deal. Room was nice. Spacious suite and comfortable. Bed was lumpy and didn't allow for a good night's sleep. Overall, a decent hotel. Not exceptional, but the cookie is always a nice treat.

Very nice hotel, staff were helpful and the facilities were very good. When the staff found out it was our honey moon they gave  vouchers for the buffet breakfast that was very nice. The room was extremely clean and well presented. Position of the hotel was helpful with a walk of only ten minutes to get to Disneyland.

I have stayed here twice in the last 12 months for events at Disney.  The rooms are large and quite comfortable, the staff is friendly and it is a very easy walk or shuttle ride to the Disney parks.  A couple of issues my last trip (1/17 -1/19/13).   There was a room service tray placed in the hallway while we were there  - and it took almost 10 hours for someone to pick it up.  This was not an overnight situation - the tray was there early in the morning and not picked up until late in the evening.  It got progressively more disgusting to walk by it over and over again.  Also, we attempted to eat in the restaurant and were unable, after waiting for approximately 10 minutes at the door, to even get someone to acknowledge our presence.  We and a couple who had already waiting

Summary Heading: Comfort of Home with Toddler and Baby
Summary: We enjoyed a 5 night stay here back in November on our family vacation to Disneyland. We chose this resort based on the reviews we read on tripadvisor and its close proximity to Disneyland. We had a 2 Queen Suite and loved everything about it. Our room was immaculately clean and the beds were ever so comfy!! My husband and I traveled with our 3 year old, 14 month old, and my mom. We had plenty of room for the 5 of us. It was so nice they provided a crib for the baby and we were able to keep her separated from us in the living area away from our bedroom at night to sleep which made for much happier mom and dad come morning time. This way we could tuck her in bed early away from us and the rest of us could stay up late enjoy a glass of wine and watch TV and rest those achy

Loved this hotel - it was so spacious in the room, the beds were super soft and it was the perfect location for Disneyland.  We did park our car at Disney each day because we didn't want to walk after a long day at the park.  The bed was so comfy and the standard suite was super spacious - much more space and a less expensive than staying at a Disney property.  Totally recommend for families.  We have an 8 year old and 16 year old, so we all had plenty of space.

Summary Heading: not close to legoland its a quite a little walk
Summary: we stayed here to go to disneyland but its clean! they do charge for parking and give you warm cookie when u check in. i guess closer you get to disneyland entrance hotel becomes older and dirtier? but this hotel ws clean and friendly and got a upgraded room too.

We stayed here one night to be close to Disney.  The staff was very friendly, and the chocolate chip cookies were a delight.  The breakfast buffet was very nice.  We had dinner in the restaurant, and they had a nice selection for the kids and the adults.  The bed was very comfortable.  The rooms could be freshened with new carpet, but that would not stop me from staying there again.

Summary Heading: Great choice for a young family headed to Disney!
Summary: The separate sleeping and living areas were exactly what we needed when travelling with our 3 year old boy. We had a higher level floor, so street noise was non existent, and the pool, even in January, was pleasant. It isn't the closest hotel to the park, but transportation isn't an issue, and the hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was also excellent. Very affordable as well.

stayed at the Doubletree suites when going to Disneyland  loved the warm cookies at check in  staff was extremely friendly restaurant very affordable with children (they eat free) and food quality was better than expected room was clean, comfortable and in decent repair approx 15 minute walk to Disney gates (for those driving- the hotel is across from the Disneyland parking lot) i did find the air quality ventilation system noisy- but appreciate that the air was not stale

On our visit to disneyland we chose to stay at doubletree suites Anaheim.  That was the best decision we made. Friendly staff, warm cookies on arrival AND they upgraded us to the bigger suite FREE of extra charges. The concierge recommended a person named "Nate" for airport transfer from LAX, he was fantastic, we used him to drive us around and saw all things possible while in LA. This hotel is just a very short bus ride from Disney land, has restaurant and great room service. Expess checkout, we just left in the morning - hassle free. Free wifi kept the kids happy. Totally recommended by myself.  Would stay here again. The suites are so comfortable - lounge room with tv and separate bedroom with tv. Stayed 5 nights and was so much cheaper than staying in the Disney land resort

Definitely first time at a Hilton, figured I could finally start earning points since we go to Disneyland quite often, but never stay at the same hotel. Used my Corp disc the first night. Went to Disneyland and found out the Grapevine was closed so I had to book another night. But they wouldn't give me my discount, said it was "unavailable." Asked to have them verify again when I checked in and the blonde refused.   Room was clean, a great nights sleep as well. But the fact they couldn't.t give me my corp disc and verify knocked them down to 4 stars.

An impressive building, we saw it first late at night after arrival from Europe.  Checkin was pleasant thoughtful and quick.  Say "yes" to the Welcome Cookies.  The Suite was luxurious, though the coffee not actually a gourmet delight but it was fun.  Down in the restaurant a great breakfast, not expensive, and a good dinner menu.  Staff in restaurant and reception were all very helpful and genuinely friendly withut overdoing it.  Disneyland a 20 - 30 minute (max) walk on S Harbor Blvd, very pleasant exercise, though there is bus transport.

Stayed 1/7-1/10, with my daughter and with another friend and her kid.  Rooms were very clean and spacious.  Front desk staff was exceptional.  I had some trouble at first making the reservation--I wanted to use HHonor points for one night, and the first person wouldn't let me--but I called back, asked for a manager, and the situation was resolved quickly.  I would stay here again quite cheerfully.

The rooms are clean and quiet.  It's located a very close walk to Disney's free parking lot tram.  They have a great bar and restaurant downstairs and a pool/spa for post Disney relaxation.  Good choice for a Disney get away!

We just stayed here for ten days, Dec 22 to Jan 01.  What can I say...it was perfect.  The staff was excellent..all were so friendly and courteous.  The restaurant staff were great as well.  The checkin went without a hitch, the cookies were a nice touch, the staff at this hotel was fabulous.  There was not one member that did not say hello or greet us.  Glad to find a hotel where everything was great.    The buffet breakfast was good value.  We had dinner here once and it was very yummy!!! We stayed on the fifth floor and had a perfect view of the fireworks.  Room was the perfect size for a family with two teenage sons.  Would highly recommend this to a family with older children as it is a 20 minute walk to the park...no problem for us...but I can see this being tough on

The hotel was better than I expected.   It was a very nice touch to receive warm cookies at check in.   Hotel staffs are very nice.   Room service meals were very reasonably priced and  very fast delivery.   I wish it is little closer to Disneyland, it is about 15 mins walk but taxi is only $10 to get to Disney.   We didn't have problem to get taxi back from Disney except New Year's eve.   The room was nice as it has a separate sitting area.   It also has a small fridge and microwave.   There is a Target a mile down the road if you need snack and drinks.   The gas station next door has food items but very expensive.   Overall we had a great stay here and we like this hotel better than the 5 star hotel we stayed in Beverly Hills later last week.

Summary Heading: Good Choice Helpful Staff Nice Room!
Summary: We arrived and discovered that we had made an error with the online booking and that there was no reservation in place. In spite of the fact that the hotel was clearly packed with the pre-Christmas Disneyland rush, the staff at reception went out of their way to find a room for us and even worked out a credit for the incorrect booking. The hotel is pleasant, clean and very well maintained. Comfortable beds, two TVs, double sinks, separate bath/shower. Only complaint for me was that like all of the large hotels in LA, there is no way to open a window and get fresh air. The ventilation system was distributing fresh air but for me it's just not the same. Still it would have been the same anywhere in the comparables and at least this hotel was well-maintained so their ventilation is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on our hotel and I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. I am sorry that the bed seemed small, however all of our mattresses are either king or queen. Hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: I fail to see how this hotel ranks as number 3 in Anaheim on trip advisor! I have stayed at several other hotels in the area (Hilton convention center, Disneyland hotel, the Grand Californian...) and any of them should be ranked higher than this one. We are very familiar with the Hilton brand of properties, my husband being a Diamond level member.   The suite is average size, nothing overly spacious, but was fine for my husband, myself and 2 young boys. However, the rooms we have had at the Hilton down the road had spacious rooms as well. Not to mention a better view. This hotel needs updating, badly. The carpet is awful. Furniture old and didn't really use the couch in the living area because not only did it look worn down, it felt that way.  Housekeeping is not up to standard.
Manager Response: I am sorry that you were unhappy with our hotel but appreciate the comments. The deficiencies you pointed out are embarrassing, and I will be reviewing them with our housekeeping department . I can honestly say  that a glass with what appears to be mineral deposits on it , and a worn towels are an exception.  As for the desk clerk, her comment was innapropriate, and I apologize.  Respectfully yours, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree Suites in Ahaheim Dec 31-Jan 3rd.  We reserved the 2 queen bed suite that included a sofa bed.  We also paid an extra $9.00 a night to be on a higher floor, overlooking the parking lot, not the pool, which eliminated the pleasure of seeing the fireworks from the Disney resort at night.  Oh well, maybe next time we will be in luck and face the pool!  All in all, it is a nice hotel.  We were able to buy our Disney tickets in the lobby of the hotel, which was very helpful and convenient.  We took a cab to the Disney resort on the morning of Jan. 1st, very efficient and speedy, not a bad price either, about $11.00.  We walked back to the hotel in the late afternoon, a distance of about a mile, a 25 minute walk. Perhaps the only negative would be the size

The hotel was convenient and spacious for a family of five, however  the rooms in  our suite were very smelly from the previous occupants. We left our door opened for ventilation. We had traveled from London and were too tired to complain, as the airport was a long drive from the hotel, and we arrived late at night. Universal Studios was a very long drive too, as was downtown LA. The hotel is really only convenient for Disney. The restaurants locally were very busy and needed to be booked in advance during peak times. Breakfast was very good at the hotel. All said, the hotel was convenient for Disney, the parking was easy, and the facilities were good. We picked up our Disney passes at the hotel itself, as it was a last minute booking. Would recommend.

We had originally planned on staying at a different hotel for our trip to Disneyland.  Instead, for a little more money, we stayed at the Doubletree Suites.  What a great decision!  We booked a 2 room suite.  The bedroom had 2 queen beds, and the main room had a sleeper-sofa, desk, another chair, and lots and lots of room for luggage and room for kids to play.  The bathroom was nice (and clean).  The hotel's staff was top-notch.  There is a shuttle to Disneyland right outside the hotel driveway ($5 per adult and $3 per child, per day).  AAAA++++

Stayed two nights here on a quick Disneyland trip with our 1-1/2 year old daughter. This property exceeded all expectations. First of all, it's ~20 minute walk to the Disneyland gate, which didn't bother us at all. There is a Disneyland Welcome Center on-property where you can ask questions, purchase tickets, make reservations, etc.  The lobby is elegant and beautiful. Check-in was fast, smooth and the staff was very friendly. Our room was spacious, super clean and the beds were comfy. They provided a pack-n-play quickly to our room, upon request.  We only enjoyed the breakfast buffet one time (paid a little extra per night to include it), and it was more than adequate.   Overall, I think it's a wonderful property, conveniently located to the parks and spacious enough for

positives: - clean bathroom  - large room - extra bed (sofa bed) - an additional $30 will feed a family of 4 abundantly (a.k.a. breakfast buffet) - easy parking  - free wifi  - fresh chocolate chip cookies every night  - an outdoor swimming pool - two TVs  - good response from house-keeping service  negatives: - the carpet looks torn & old  - couch looks old - no slippers - furniture looks old - $15 for parking (just like other hotels, I guess)  overall, we're pretty happy with the money we spent there.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel! Would definitely recommend it!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days Dec 2012 with my teenage children... friendly staff, modern and stylish rooms, great location within walking distance of Disneyland.  We were provided with warm chocolate chip cookies upon arrival.  On of the Concierge staff was so friendly that he gave us a wave and a greeting whenever he saw us passing through the lobby, remembering the activity we had asked him about the previous day and enquired as to how it turned out for us.  Will definitely stay there again when in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Place for Families at Anaheim
Summary: We recently stayed at the Doubletree on the first leg of our trip from Australia.  We received the warm cookies on check in and as we hardly slept a wink on the plane the beds were like sleeping on a cloud.  I thought that was only because we were so tired, but that is how they felt every night after.  Had a quiet room on the 3rd floor, used the internet options in room and in the business centre to print flight to next part of our trip which was handy.  Used the fitness facilities one morning which were fine.  Great speedy service to grab a coffee in the morning before heading off.  Free parking which was a bonus.  Would stay here again for sure.

We recently stayed at the Doubletree Suites for a week long Disney visit.  This is the 3rd different hotel we have stayed at in the area, and I would have to say the best choice so far.  The front desk staff was very helpful all the time, the restaurant is very good and the suite rooms are perfect if travelling with children, as you can put them to bed and relax in the extra room for a bit.  We were on the 6th floor overlooking the pool.  The only issue I had with the hotel was that it is time for room upgrading, especially the carpets.  The furniture is a bit worn as well, but the beds were very comfortable.  The distance from Disney is not too bad, as long as you are not walking with very young children.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay and explore Disneyland and Disney California Adventure
Summary: Based on the many positive reviews on TA we decided to stay at this hotel for our first trip to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure.   We took the Disneyland Resort Express (by Grayline) from LAX which picked us up under the green sign (as explained on their website) just outside the terminal (Tom Bradley for us but it also stops at the other terminals). It costs $22 per person but we had a $5 off coupon form their website. Reservations aren’t required and the trip took a little over an hour (mainly due to the pick up of other passengers from all the other terminals and also our hotel being the one of the last ones for drop off. But it was a comfy and cheap way to get to our accommodation. Highly recommend them.  The lady who checked us in was very friendly and made us

We stayed at Double tree suites, 24th Nov-5th Dec 2012. Clean and comfortable . We had a suite and there was plenty of room for my adult son and my husband and myself. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were always kept spotlessly clean. The Art service was a bit hit and miss, but we were all adults and it was an easy 20minute walk for us. We also found if you caught the Art that went to The Hilton and Marriot it was just a matter of cutting through a couple of car parks and a 5 minute walk. The guys at the concierge Javier and Gary and Josh were very helpful. They were always pleasant and help us with collecting our packages or booking taxis or tours. Thankyou. The front desk staff checked you in but wheb coming back into the hotel wouldn't even look up to welcome

With many of the Disneyland Good neighbour hotels you don't know how nice of a room, service or noise you will get - you can feel pretty sure that you will be happy with everything here. That is unless the desk person is having a miserable day or some obnoxious people are also staying at this hotel. We travelled with friends and I wasn't sure about staying anything other than a short walk from the Disneyland entrance, but I'm really glad we did. The hotel is clean and the rooms are very very comfortable with lots of room.  We skipped buying the resort bus passes and used taxis or mini vans to go back and forth. For only a few dollars more it was worth arriving in comfort and not having all the hassles of those buses.  When you look at the price remember that you will have to pay

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay with family for Disneyland visit.
Summary: This hotel definitely met my family's expectations.  We were a family of 9 (5 adults and 4 kids) and booked 1 suite and 1 regular room.  We had plenty of space.  The single room with 2 queen beds was enormous, with lots of room to run around in.  The suite was nice as it gave us the option of putting the kids to sleep in a quiet space while the adults watched television in the other room.  Check in was a breeze.  Parking, though expensive (this is the true of all hotels within a mile of Disney/convention center), was easy and not too far away. The hotel has 2 dining options. We only bought food from the quick service cafe for breakfast (mostly pastries, bagels, coffee, and a few pre-made bagel sandwiches).  It met our needs for the morning.  With kids, we had brought plenty of

Almost worth a 4 star rating.  The hotel was decent.  The rooms are large, though we’ve stayed at a few “suite type” places in the past and I’d likely go back to one of them next trip.  Pro’s – the Hotel lobby was clean and comfortable with the couches as a nice place to “meet up” with family.   The hotel is within walking (long walk – 15 min) of Disneyland.  The rooms are clean upon arrival and the beds were WONDERFUL.  The front desk staff was friendly and we loved the welcome cookie.  The pool and spa were also very nice.  The rest was average.  While the room was clean upon arrival, during our stay is was obvious the maid staff was rushing through the process and wasn’t very concerned about the cleanliness of the room during our stay.  We slept in one morning and when I

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best place to stay for a family going to Disneyland within the neighboring hotels category.
Summary: Great rooms, big enough for a family of six.  This is the second time we have stayed here and it won't be the last.  We can't wait to get back to the park and this hotel.  The only thing I wish they would change is to get rid of the $16 a night parking fee...

I am stuck between Average and Very Good for this hotel.  I didn't love it like I have another Anaheim hotel, but I didn't hate it.   POSITIVES - the large king bed was extremely comfortable, and the block out curtains great.   - view to the fireworks perfect without the hotel shaking (like some others & frighten the kids) - one bedroom suite sizeable, and allows privacy when using both the bedroom and the sofa bed - Starbucks coffee bar in lobby - distance to Disneyland, and decent restaurants (Ruths, Mortons) nearby - clean and tidy - request the 7th floor as it is above all the noise (unless you get noisy neighbours which we unfortunately did) - fridge and microwave convenient for snacks NEGATIVES - for us, we weren't greeted by the Concierge - we had to bring our luggage in

We went with our two children and booked a suite with two queen beds, room was very clean, and it was great to have the bedroom separate from the living room/tv area. Living area a little on the small Side but not a problem. Room was spotless, very quiet and comfy. We liked the hotel as it was not overrun with kids, we always had the pool to ourselves, elevators came quickly etc. had a good meal in the hotel restaurant and kids ate free, so it was reasonable. Friendly front desk staff, quick check in and as others have mentioned, fantastic cookies upon check in! Cafe is not a "real" Starbucks, so although you can get some of their products, staff on the two occasions could not make a standard drink, and could not steam the milk to proper temp so actually I refused to take my

We stayed here for 4 nights before Thanksgiving and everything was wonderful.  We had requested a fireworks-view room and were on the 7th floor where we enjoyed the fireworks each night.  Our check-in was smooth and the pack and play we had requested was already set up in the room.  The room was immaculate and easily accommodated our family of six.  We brought a white noise machine for our toddler, since we use one for him at home, but even when that was off we did not hear noise from outside the room. It is a bit of a walk to the main gate, but we had a stroller with us and our other children (7-11 years) had no problem walking.  (One day we were there from opening to 8:30PM and the kids were very tired--we grabbed a cab for under $6 before tip).  We had Starbucks from the

We stayed here for two nights for our sons 5th birthday celebration at Disneyland. The location is great.  Where we stayed in the hotel (on the 7th floor) it was quiet from any street noise and there were no rowdy patrons either.  The hotel does not offer it's own shuttle to Disneyland, however you can buy a bus pass for the ART bus and take unlimited trips to and from Disneyland.  The bus stop is right outside the hotel, so it is very convenient.  The breakfast buffet is just okay, but the bonus is that kids eat free!!  Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

We stayed in October and were pleasantly surprised. The room was beautiful and clean and everyone was very helpful. Josh at concierge was beyond amazing and just wanted to say a huge thank you.  The cookies each day were delicious. (You get one on arrival but after that you just need to ask). The cafe opening at 6am was perfect, a light breakfast before we headed out for the day =) Well priced. Get the ART bus, you can purchase tickets at the reception or if you're a wheelchair user purchase them on the bus for a discounted rate.) Would not hestitate to come back.  Thank you for a very enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, WAY cheaper than DLand Resorts.
Summary: We stayed here because it's about 2 miles from Disneyland and was WAY cheaper than staying at a Disneyland resort.  We rented a suite so our kids could stay in their own room.  We saved hundreds of dollars doing this rather than renting a regular room at a Disneyland Resort!  I mean a suite vs a regular room AND saving money?!  :)  In the evenings we went to the resorts for dinner in their Disney themed restaurants and walked around on Disneyland Drive, so I we got the whole Disney resort feel without the cost.  This hotel was the perfect choice for us.

This hotel is great for visit to Disneyland not too close but easy to transfer 15 min walk or shuttle transfer. The rooms are spacious and clean Beds comfortable .the staff were always pleasant The rooms are quiet for sleeping before the next day at Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for family Disneyland Trip!!
Summary: After a few miserable stays at a fleabag motel across the street from Disneyland, I was so disgusted with the area lodging that I almost contemplated NOT staying and just driving home instead. Then I found the Doubletree. This property changed my mind!   Everything about our stay was positive. The lobby, staff, rooms, restaurant/bar... were all great. The staff was courteous, friendly, helpful and professional.  Our room was perfect for a family of four, clean, comfortable, bright and well appointed. There was a coffee bar in the lobby which was convenient for a quick drink on the run. The restaurant offered a nice breakfast buffet that was enjoyed by all and they were even happy to accommodate a gluten-free diet.  The bar was a nice stop too on the return from a long day at

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family visiting Disneyland
Summary: We just came back from a 5 day trip to Disneyland (Nov 3 - 8, 2012) where we stayed at the Doubletree Suites by Hilton. I choose this hotel because it was a suites hotel and I wanted two separate spaces for me and my family (me and my husband and two children - 8 and 4). I bought it as part of a package that included flight and hotel/.    Location The location was about a 20 min walk away from Disneyland (20 minutes for us and our 8 year old son at a decent clip; our daughter who turns 5 in a month would have slowed us down significantly - she was pushed in a stroller). You can also take the Anaheim Resort Transit which has a stop right in front of the hotel making it very convenient (it's the number 3 bus). The only problem is that it doesn't really have a schedule. They say it

Summary Heading: Great Rooms and Nice Roof Top Pool
Summary: We found the rooms perfect for a family vacation to Disneyland!  Beds are comfortable and room set up nice for kids.  Hotel is walking distance (4 blocks or so) to Disney.  We really enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree!

We're a family of four, two kids ages 6 & 9, and stayed here on a multi-day trip to Disneyland.  Really nice hotel, staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly, rooms clean and nice.  Would definitely stay here again!

The hotels has a very good location, rooms are spacious and fabulous for kids staying in room with parents.  Breakfast buffet is complete and offers kids eat free.  Parking, internet, rooms, staff.  In general staying at this hotel was a great experience and it is a great hotel in Disneyland area.

The Doubletree Anaheim Suites was a fab place to stay - close to Disneyland, GardenWalk and with plenty of space to stretch out and enjoy the sun around the pool.    The room layout was really good with a queen sofabed in the lounge and two queen beds in the bedroom.  As we were traveling from NZ for a month we had a lot of luggage and the room easily coped with it.    We chose to purchase a room rate that included breakfast and it was definitely worth doing - fab breakfasts and friendly servers.  In afct on the morning my eldest daughter and I were trying to get into Disneyland early the servers helped us pack a breakfast and snacks to go!  Including juices etc in takeout cups - way beyond our expectations!!!  The only issue was the level of chlorine in the swimming pool which

We arrived very late from a flight from NewYork and didn't get to the hotel till 1am.  The front desk person was lovely and even at this time presented us with warm cookies for our family of five.  The room was perfect for our family and great for our quick trip  to California Disney after a 5 week trip traveling before flying home to Australia.  They even allowed a late check out.

My family went to Anaheim to visit Disneyland after doing our homework on resorts in the area we chose this property since it had everything we were looking for and such a high rating from so many. They were right, it was clean, the staff amazing, the rooms so comfortable! We enjoyed being able to make coffee every morning in the room. The 2 bedroom suite was perfect for us since we have a teenager that likes his own space, bed, TV... We were on the 7th floor and it was very quiet. The dining room was very nice and the food very good, they even accommodated my gluten free diet easily. It is about a 20 minute walk to Disney so depending on the soreness of your feet at the end of the day you can walk. A special shout out to Alberto at the front desk who took great care of us and

Summary Heading: Have stayed at the Anaheim Doubletree multiple times and have never had an unpleasant experience.
Summary: I strongly recommend the Anaheim Doubletree! It is an excellent hotel for the price. Always clean and in good repair and staff is always pleasant and helpful. Rooms are laid out nicely and the location is convenient with Anaheim Resort Transit stop right out front at the curb on Harbor Blvd. It's about a 20 minute brisk walk from Disneyland main gate if you don't mind the exercise and most of that time is spent waiting at traffic signals. Regardless, the hotel is one of the best in the area and you won't be disappointed staying there.

Great property at a great price! Loved the cookies at check in! Close enough to Disneyland to walk but shuttle stops right in front for those days of tired feet. Pool a little chilly for our toddler but he enjoyed dipping his feet in the hot-tub. Foo was good in the restaurant and rooms were clean.   Would stay again for sure!!

I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived, lots of space in the 2 room suite, very nicely decorated. The staff are lovely, service is faultless, and the restaurant is delicious with kids eat free! We're so happy to have gotten such a spacious well serviced suite for our Disney trip. We have cancelled our next hotel to stay here an extra two nights! There is a small grocery store and eateries nearby if you need anything.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this fabulous hotel. I usually stay across the street from Disneyland, but I decided I had had enough of the tired, loud, aging hotels and took a chance and booked the Doubletree. To say I was impressed is an understatement!   The staff were always very polite and helpful. The suites are huge. The mattresses, pillows and linens felt very luxurious. We have never slept so well in a hotel! The housekeeping was immaculate.  Although we chose to walk to and from Disneyland, there is a bus stop right across the street, and there is a shuttle which I believe was $5 per person, per day.   We will definitely be back, and will be recommending this hotel to all our friends and family for their Disneyland vacations.

Summary Heading: Affordable - beautiful, spacious rooms - convenient location for Disneyland
Summary: We have never been to Disneyland and if you've read any of my other rooms, I've mentioned I'm a hotel snob. I like newer hotels with higher end decor (you know, granite bathroom counters, etc.). I researched many hotels. Sure, there are hotels closer to Disneyland (across the street even!) but they are heavily used so I could just imagine myself being unhappy. This hotel had many positive reviews so I took a chance and boy am I glad we did! There is an Anaheim Resort bus stop right at the curb, takes you right to the front entrance of Disneyland. We ALWAYS had a seat on the bus and even if we did have to stand, it's a really short drive. We didn't get in our car once after we arrived. The lobby of this hotel is impressive, I knew right away that I would love it. We had requested

ROOM DESCRIPTION; 7th floor, corner room near laundry and soda machines, 1 room suite, 2 queen beds, view of pool, hide-a-bed couch in living room, small fridge, microwave, large tv. Clean bathroom and linens. No problems checking in.  THE GOOD: Nice, quiet-no hallway noise, clean hotel. Very comfortable beds. Good breakfast-numerous items in the buffet. room service is available but I didn't use it. NOT SO GOOD: 1) If your a late sleeper (til after noon), then plan on having a phone call by the hotel staff because they want to clean your room...it doesn't matter if you have the do not disturb sign on the door. 2) Bar doesn't stay open late.   Would return again.

We stayed here for 5 nights. We stayed on the 2nd floor never had to wait for the lift the room had a seperate lounge and bedroom with 2 bouble beds. The linen was lovely and bathroom product excellent. The room was very quiet we never heard anyone outside the room. It was very clean and well serviced every day. After a long day at the Disney parks it was great to come back to each night. The restaurant was excellent for breakfast only $13.50 for a full buffet hot breakfast. We had dinner and lunch in the restaurant all the food was excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and bent over backwards to make our stay enjoyable. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay. We walked to and from the Disney parks about 15-20 minutes.

We arrived around 10:30pm only to find out they did not have our reservation in the system. We had prepaid and booked with Allegiant Air as part of a package. After waiting around for 5-10mins they stepped up and put us in a room and were going to contact Allegiant in the morning. I thought this was great, although if no rooms had been available it could have been a different story. Allegiant's phone hours ended at 9pm...   The downside I thought was we ended up on a room on the second floor facing away from Disneyland. In addition I am a Hilton Honors member and that usually gets me a better room.  Other than one delayed day of house keeping we had no issues. I ate breakfast at the little coffee stand in the lobby and we took the ART bus that stops right out front to the theme

Stayed with my mother-in-law and two small kids. Had a suite room (separate bedroom) with sofa bed. Nice hotel, family-friendly, kids ate free with paying adult in restaurant downstairs. Room was nice, modern, clean, updated, and quiet. Staff so friendly. Bus to Disney right at corner.

Summary Heading: In the Disney area, one of the best
Summary: There are a lot of hotels around Disneyland, and most of them are just OK and overcrowded, but at the Doubletree in October, it seemed half business, half park goers and made it just a little quieter.  The cleanliness was better than most.  The room quality was good and I had a decent time sleeping - I'd call it average in another area, but having visited so many hotels around Disney, I'd have to call this one very good by comparison.

We recently stayed here for a grandchild's 4th birthday and trip to Disneyland.There were 7 adults and 4 children in our party.  The room  configruations were perfect for our group.  We needed the ability to put the babies down and have another room to visit in and rooms were set up perfectly for that. The rooms were very clean and  quite comfortable, We arrived early so we were not able to check in right away.  Most hotels where I have stayed in the past have asked for a phone number so they can call us when the room as ready. The desk person, who happened to be the desk supervisor, did not so  ask us that question so I asked him if he could call us when our room was ready.  He promtly replied " That won't be my prioity I have other things to take care of"  and  added that I
Manager Response: Dear Christitay, I enjoyed reading your recent review , and am glad that for the most part your family enjoyed their stay. I am very concerned however by the way one of our supervisors spoke to you, and I want to apologize. It was not typical, and not appropriate. We have already reviewed our procedure for tracking guests that check in early, and hopefully this will never happen again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Superb hotel, everything I could have asked for. From the moment we checked in everything was great. Stayed 14 nights, got a great room (room 724), top floor overlooking the pool and able to se the Disney fireworks. Room was spacious, and perfect that there was a seperate area to sit in the evenings after our little fella had gone to bed. Ideal for Disney, ART transport tickets available at reception, TIP if you miss the number 1 bus going to Disney on the other side of the road stay on the same side of the road as the Doubletree and catch a number 3, it turns round and heads back to Disney just down the street. Food at the hotel was excellent good choice for breakfast and kids eat free !!! good room service and very prompt. Pool area was small but ideal, the pool was not deep

stay at Double Tree for 6 days very sad to leave what a great place and great location the  staff we first class no question or request was to much the room was always fresh and the the restaruant was very good after staying at the Double Tree Down Town Disney in Orlando I was a little worried at what I might here but from the moment we stepped inside all my fears where gone thankyou for making our last leg of our holiday very happy.

As a family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids), staying off-property is the only way to go to be able to afford 6 days at the parks without cashing out a 401K or pension. This was our 5th time staying here, and by and large I was pleased with our trip. Many attractive updates since our last stay here in May 2011, most notably the restaurant.  Check in was pleasant and uneventful, we appreciated the help with our (numerous!) bags and boxes up to our room.  Our room (645) was just on the other side of the ice and vending machines, and I was a little worried that it would be noisy, but it wasn't. That said, late-night or early morning use of either of those machines would have indeed been disruptive. Plus, the view from the windows faced a back parking lot and side street, but we didn't

We stayed for one night last Saturday; Myself, my husband and our 2 children (2 and 3 years old).  We stayed on the 3rd floor in room 333.  The good: -We were booked in a 2 room suite - the sitting area was nice.  Comfortable couch and a nice easy chair.  There was also a desk with a business-type swivel chair.   -The bedroom had 2 queen-sized beds (which my husband said were "short").  Linens were nice & soft -There were 2 LCD TVs - one in each room, each with their own remote -The A/C was quiet -Plenty of extra towels in the room (we usually have to call for extras) -Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries -They give you warm chocolate chip cookies when you check in -They brough us toothpaste (which we had forgotten)  The bad: -Pool area is very small -Coffee pot in the room didn't work.
Manager Response: Dear Sierrapup, We are sorry that we didn't provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues in your room and we will be working with our maintenance team to ensure the situation doesn't happen again. Your feedback regarding pricing and fees is greatly appreciated and will be considered as we work to enhance our overall guest experience. Thank you again for your review. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Very good hotel and great value
Summary: We stayed 3 nights and found the hotel to be very good value and good quality.  The room was comfortable with a seperate living area.  Beds were comfortable and room was very clean and comfortable.  The lobby area was very nice and spacious with free WIFI.  Staff were helpful and friendly.   It is approx. 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland but there is a shuttle bus which stops right out the front though we did have to wait about 20 minues or more each time for it to arrive.  It was way too hot to walk and when we were there temperatures over 40 degrees celsius on both days.   It is easy to walk to various restaurants and fast food places.  It is also approx. 10 minute walk to Target if you need to stock up on anything.  Breakfast was included in our rate and it was more than

Stayed here for 4 nights to visit Disney and had a lovely time. Bedrooms good size and beds comfortable. Having lounge area good too.  Breakfast very average. Fruit good, hot selection lacks appeal despite interesting dishes. Pool area pleasant and comfortable. 10 to 15 min walk to Disney or lots of rEstaurants. Or resort bus stops at hotel for easy transfer to parks or key sights.

this hotel is located in the same side of the street than Disneyland making it very convenient to walk. It is however a 1.5 mile walk to Disney so be prepared. You can also take public transportation and the shuttle but we didn't' since it cost extra. We had a two bed room for our family of 4. I felt the room was was a bit small. Even though it is separated by a door you really cannot move very freely and I just felt a bit constricted. We couldn't even find space for our youngest toddler inflatable bed. We used the gym (small but it provided the service we needed) and the pool (located in the second floor above the lobby). Food was delicious for any time of day. We had b'fast and dinner. Lunge has great drinks and coffee shop is convenient.

We stayed here with 2 children and had a great stay. The welcome warm cookie was lovely after a long drive. The suite was very spacious and having the bathroom sink area outside the toilet/ shower room was great for efficiency in getting ready.  We came back at lunch time one day and had a swim before returning to Disney and that was a great day.  Very quick for getting to and from the park - a must as an early start is necessary for getting lots of rides in.  You can either walk or get the ART buses to the park. The no 1 goes straight to the park and you cross the road to catch it. The number 3 coming from the park stops right at the door.  The only down was that the rest if my family didn't like the breakfast and didn't think much of the hot options. I found it fine for cereal

Summary Heading: Good hotel but crappy management... Dissapointed due to unresonable charges
Summary: Well my experiance at the hotel was good. i stayed with my family just for a night. My Disappointment was afterwards when i saw my Credit card statement. my original invoice for a night was approximatly total $158 but i was charged twice for different prices. one for $198 and another for $175. i Called in to ask why i was charged extra and that there must have been a mistake. There reply was that i was charged for smoking in the room. First of all i am not a smoker and secondly i have 2 kids, 5 and 4 years old. It kinda dissapointed me for them charging me for something that i didnt do. well it was resolved after i had to express my disappointment.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Afridi, I am very sorry that we assumed you had been smoking in your guestroom. Since so many people are sensitive to smoke we take our no smoking policy very seriously. Since your room had a strong odor we assumed that someone had been smoking. Our mistake... I apologize... I am glad that your money was refunded and that overall your enjoyed your stay. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for four nights towards the end of September.  The location is great if you want to visit Disneyland, only a 10/15 minute walk from the hotel.  To visit LA itself is expensive unless you have a car as there is no easily accessible public transport and private transport is approx $39 each, however we arranged a tour through the hotel concierge ($65 each).  We didn’t eat in the hotel, but there are plenty of good places to eat locally including the Cheesecake Factory and lots of opitions in Downtown Disney.  For breakfast there is a 7 Eleven close to the hotel on route to Disney which serves a decent breakfast at a reasonable cost.  Room was clean and spacious, all the staff were friendly and the cookie at check in is always appreciated.   The laundry facilities are

This hotel is fantastic. From the warm cookie on arrival to the efficient checkout, we could not fault it. The food was wonderful, staff friendly and the concierge (Gary) could not do enough for us. We stayed 11 nights in total, and both rooms were clean, beds comfortable and it was quiet. It is a 15 min walk to Disneyland and located right in the heart of other hotels around the Disneyland area. The ART shuttle stops right outside the hotel for people with small children or others who do not wish to walk to Disneyland and you can buy the ART tickets from inside the hotel. We felt safe and secure and quite happy to walk around after dark along the Anaheim Disney "strip". Breakfast was great - a wide variety of hot and cold foods and kids eat free which is a real bonus. We would

Just spent the weekend here with my husband and two children and will not be coming back. This will be the first bad review I have written not usually being one to complain. We checked in on Friday evening after a day at Disney. We booked on hotels.com for a non-smoking room. Called to confirm that it was non-smoking and upon check-in was told that it was "non-smoking". But we were given one of the three smoking rooms on property. After complaining we were moved to another room that smelled just as bad, had hair in the shower, and the sink did not drain. Upon complaining a second time we were moved again and given breakfast passes. The third room still reeked of smoke but by this time my two year old was beyond meltdown so stayed in this room for the night. The following day we
Manager Response: Dear Stempfam, I am sorry that three of the rooms you were given smelled like smoke. While we do have only three "smoking" rooms, non of the rooms you received were so designated, and I personally checked all three this morning. They smelled fine to me and I don't smoke, but I understand that some people are more sensitive then others. We make every effort to thoroughly clean our rooms, but from time to time a guest will sneak a cigarette, and a slight residue can linger for a while. Thank you for sharing your observations with me. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for 1 night on arrival in Anaheim. I used rewards points and so the only thing I paid cash for was parking and tax. We arrived at about 10pm so didn't spend very long at the hotel.   Our room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable, which was the most important factor after a 10 hour flight.   We got a good nights sleep and checked out in the morning after breakfast. We had the buffet which was fine - although not especially exciting.   We would definitely return if we are in the area again.

Summary Heading: Great property to stay at for Disneyland visit
Summary: We recently went on a family trip to Disney and chose this hotel to stay since it was a suite.  The suite was a pretty good size for us.  The kids liked having a living room to have breakfast and snacks.  Since there were 4 of us, we caught a taxi to and from Disney and it was only a $1.00 more or less (depending on traffic) and we did not have to wait on a shuttle (full of tourists).  I had a few packages delivered to the hotel and the concierge called as soon as each arrived.  The complimentary warm cookies were great too at check in!

My family and i recently went on holidays to L.A. And decided to stay in Anaheim. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to stay at the Doubletree Suites...and i`m so glad we did!!! I think we found our new place to stay when visiting the Anaheim area. I tend to be a bit of a hotel snob,especially when it comes to cleanliness,but i`m happy to say i found very little to complain about. Upon check in we each recieved a delicious cookie:) We stayed in a suite and it was very spacious. We liked the fact that the living room was seperate from the bedroom.There was a tv in the living room and also one in the bedroom. The room was very clean with nice comfy beds. There was lots of hot water. There was a fridge and microwave in the room.The hotel was very quiet during our

The doubletree was a great place to stay! Not too far from Disneyland with good shuttle service. Nice rooms with friendly staff. Great food in the restaurants, complimentary wifi which was great! After a long flight from Australia they upgraded our room so that we could relax as soon as possible. Thank you doubletree we will stay again.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but need to pay for shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: Better than average standard of accommodation although we did encounter significant problems when trying to extend our booking - these problems were all due to the centralised call centre for Hilton and do not reflect on the hotel.   Clean rooms, friendly service, pool small but adequate.  Disney is about a 20 minute walk and the shuttle is a paid service. Standard of food for breakfast and dinner is pretty good - not gourmet but absolutely acceptable.

Excellent service, cleanliness, overall accommodations and value. Spacious suite - was there alone on business but my family of four would've been quite comfortable as well. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Only two issues were 1) carpet could've been a bit cleaner - it had been well vacuumed but there were a few spots of that type of glue used to hold credit cards to paper stock when they arrive in the mail - frustrating to step on when barefoot. 2) internet connection  was slow at times.

Great looking hotel from the outside, lobby of the facility was also quite nice.  The rooms are dated, the rooms could use some upgrading.  Bit of a hike to the parks but the local transit was available at the end of the driveway and was fairly inexpensive.   Specific to our experience... the first room we were given (room 421) had wall paper coming off the wall near the windows and it sounded like an aircraft was landing in the bathroom.  You could not have a normal coversation with someone in the 'Suite' with the bathroom door open. Front desk sent an engineer named 'Jesus' to the room within 10 minutes of our arrival to check the noise when we called down.  On arrival he agreed it was 'very loud' but sadly could not be fixed as it was a HVAC unit on the roof directly above us
Manager Response: Dear Jason G, Thank you for sharing your observations with me. I am sorry that there were so many issues with your room, and I have brought each one to the attention of our engineering department. While there are no excuses for enything less then a perfect room, I am happy to say that a cracked granit counter top [looks like it had once  been repaired] and worn mattress have both been replaced and are not typical of the remaining rooms. As for the noise in room 421, while we haven't been able to replicate what you and Jesus heard, we have re-checked all of our ventilation fans. Again, sorry for the problems and I hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Our family of four stayed at the Doubletree Suites for a few days while visiting Disneyland.  Overall we were very impressed with this hotel.  As other reviews have mentioned, the Doubletree is a large hotel, but you do not encounter masses of people like you do with the Hilton by the Convention Center.  We were told that the hotel was full, but we really didn't see a lot of people in the common areas so it didn't 'feel' full.   We checked in late the first night and the check in process was very smooth.  We learned that there was a varsity football team having a conference at the hotel and we saw them on our floor, but they were very quiet and respectful.  Our room overlooked the hotel pool and we had a partial view of the fireworks.  We did not have a suite, but the room was

We just got back after a one week stay at the Doubletree while visiting Disneyland.  I have nothing but great things to say about our stay all the staff were welcoming and helpful in everyway,  Our son is gluten intolerant and the restaurant located in the hotel was more than accomadating with meals.  I spoke with the restaurant manager the first night of our stay to make sure they had something for him.  Was I surprised to find out they had everything pizza crust, pasta, bread, bagels and were knowledgable on how to prepare eggs, bacon, hash browns and other items all freshly made they even went out and purchased chex cereal for us!  The concierge helped us book our Seaworld trip and arrange our shuttle pickup for departure.  The space in the room was plenty for a family of

Came to visit the Disneyland Park and Downtown Disney. Location of the Hotel was perfect, easy to get around to and from Disneyland. Rooms were nice and clean, maintenance was fast responding to the "one" issue that I experienced. Front desk was courteous and genuine. Decent price.

Just got back from a Disneyland weekend with our grandson and family.  This was our second stay at this hotel.  We signed up again after comparing other prices and locations.  It is within walking distance of Disneyland but there is a city shuttle stop right in front of the hotel which is about $4 a day for as many rides as you would like to take.  Shuttle bus comes by every 20 minutes.  The hotel is clean and attractive and the suites spacious.  I was pleased with the warmth shown by the staff.  Everyone smiled and was friendly.  We signed up for the breakfast-included option and the buffet, while pretty traditional, was very good.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on business trip
Summary: I stayed at the Double Tree for three nights in Aug, very friendly staff. The room was very clean and had everything and more that I needed. The gal at the bar in the lounge was so fun to chat with. This hotel is within walking distance to many great restaurants and near Disneyland if you have kids. The breakfast was great, they have a buffet in the mornings or you can order off the menu.

This is an older property that has had significant upgrades and is in very good overall condition, but it’s not a 5 star hotel. I stayed in room 441 a two room, king suite.   PRO's:    •  VERY friendly staff and they seem to be everywhere. Well staffed.  •  Has micro/fridge combo in room •  (2) 32” flatscreen’s in suite •  Clean, even the fire escape stairwells are spotless (I often take the stairs instead of elevator for exercise.  Shocking how filthy some are) •  Very nice work area •  Solid surface counters with tile floors in bathroom. Bathroom was clean •  Very good beds with excellent pillows and duvet.  •  Near Disney (I was here for work though) •  Pool and whirlpool on second floor  CON’s:  •  Older property means dated layout •  Pricey, but many things in Anaheim are

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  I do like hotels that run like clockwork.  No fuss checking in, room well appointed and comfortable, good coffee and service.  My partner and I were surprised (and delighted) to receive a warm chocolate chip cookie on check in.  Very odd but yummy.  Parking was an extra cost and was opposite the main entrance in an open air car park.  Everything worked well, it was quiet. We checked out in no time having grabbed a coffee from the small cafe on the ground floor to have while we continued on our tour up the coastline.

I love this hotel! I have stayed here multiple times, and I have never had a bad experience. My family and I use this hotel whenever we do overnight trips to Disneyland. The lobby is well lit, comfortable and welcoming. The polished stone floor shows the attention to detail that many hotels overlook. My kids love that we're greeted with a chocolate chip cookie when we check in. I always get the two room suite which works out great for me since i get up early and I am able to watch TV without waking up the rest of my family. I have recommended the hotel to friends and family, you will not be disappointed with your stay here. I had a very bad experience with the

Doubletree Anaheim This review describes our experiences during our stay at Doubletree Anaheim from October 28 through November 1, 2011.  Front Desk/Check-In My family didn’t necessarily need the services of front desk with the exception of checking in and checking out. Our limited experiences with them were positive.  Common Areas I didn’t personally experience many of the amenities that the hotel offers (pool, exercise room, arcade, etc.), so I wont speak to that. The lobby and other surrounding areas are quite nice.  We scored free breakfast and took full advantage of that perk. We were quite satisfied with what was offered in a buffet style setting. Automatic pancake makers, juices, cereals (great for “on the go”), an assortment of eggs, toasts, bacon, sausage, etc. Can’t go

My husband and I stayed here for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was a short walk and was more cost effective than the Marriott or the Hilton adjacent to the center.  I like the more intimate feel of the hotel.  The lobby staff was always smiling and helpful and the hotel was clean with a  bed that was incredibly comfortable.  There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room which was great for leftovers which when we found out that our fridge was not cold and they changed it immediately.  The warm cookies available at the front desk are great and a great welcome. We found the room to be quiet and were never disturbed by other guests.
