If you are a coffee drinker, there is a Starbucks in the lobby to go along with those delicious cookies.  We would stay here

Summary Heading: Close to the Convention Center, but not really.
Summary: Very nice hotel, clean and efficient, but over a half mile walk to the Anaheim Convention Center, assuming you take the shortcut through the Ruth Chris Steakhouse parking lot. Not too bad going, a real struggle on the way back after spending four hours on the trade show floor.    Suite rooms were comfortable but small. The sitting room was well appointed with a sofa, desk, comfy chair and coffee table, but probably only 8 feet wide.   Refrigerator, microwave and LCD TV round out the room.  The double queen bed space was also small with barely two feet between the bed and closet/chest of drawers wall.  Big closet with in-room safe, but difficult to get to with the door to the sink space is open blocking the closet.  The bed was very comfortable with nice linens.  My room faced

I stayed here for three nights on business, got upgraded to a double queen room which faced the pool. It was a very pretty room and the bed was super comfortable. It was very clean and quiet. The shower was great, the fitness room is small, but very clean and there is a water cooler in there so you can fill your water bottle. The front desk staff were wonderful and helpful. I felt like I was on vacation even though I was working. It was nice to be able to leave the car in the parking lot and walk to dinner after work. There were many good dining options very close by. The breakfast buffet looked good, but I just had the oatmeal. There is a "starbucks" in the lobby, it isn't a real Starbucks, they serve Starbucks coffee. It was okay... I had it once and the other times went to

My husband and I stayed at this property with our three children (ages 5-9) last week.  This was our first trip to Anaheim and we read several reviews of the property before we booked.  We were not disappointed!  The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  The chocolate chip cookies upon arrival were a delicious treat!!  When we arrived, we were early for check in and the room that we requested (facing Disneyland to see the fireworks) was not yet available.  The front desk staff offered another room available right away or, if we chose to wait, they could hold our luggage for us.  We opted to wait and ended up walking on the street in front of the hotel.  Within a very short distance (max 20 mins walking)there are several good restaurants, fast

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, relaxing. Great staff, great location. What more could you ask for. Family loved it!
Summary: My family stayed here on our recent disneyland visit. Room was always clean, staff promptly provided what we needed even a forgotten toothbrush! Great location was always quiet. One morning we didnt get up early to head out but chose to sleep in a little. We were not disturbed by other rooms noise as was not the case at some of the hotels we stayed at in the past. My family has made this the first choice for future vistis. thank you

Visited Disneyland with my sister-in-law this weekend.   Stayed at the Doubletree.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Lobby was very nice.  Room was clean and comfortable.  I admit that I was concerned based on some of the other reviews that I read, but my experience was a good one.  I want a nice, clean location (no mold in the bathroom) with a professional and personable staff, plus a little bit of luxury.  I got that at the Doubletree.  I have a reputation for being a 'hotel snob', and our stay at the Doubletree made the grade.    I have to mention one person by name, Mario, our waiter at the hotel's the restaurant.  He was so attentive and nice.  He went out of his way to take care of us.  We went back another time just because of the service he gave.

Summary Heading: wonderful front desk staff and great location
Summary: we loved the hotel ,it is excellent for families, very close to disney.park and the garden walk. there is a variety of Rests. something for everyone in the family. the hotel is clean and quite,with a nice cafe at the lobby . I would love to go back.

After reading reviews of all hotels near Disney, I settled on Double Tree.  I think it's the best choice.  First of all, we drove in from San Diego at 9am, expecting to drop off car and luggage, but our room was ready to check in early!  Very clean, great value, double queen room suite slept everyone easily (family of 5) for $119!  We added the breakfast, kids loved it.  Pancake machine was their favorite.  Shuttle to Disney very easy put front.  Took a break and came back to the pool.  Pool is not main attraction, but let's face it, if you don't have a pool, kids are happy in any body of water.  It was small, but clean, had fresh towels and plenty of chairs and shade!  It was pretty quiet all night.  A bit of noise from a few loud people heading to their rooms, but not bad at

Summary Heading: Stay closer to Disneyland, or farther away and save the parking
Summary: This hotel covers all the basics that an all suite hotel should provide (clean, comfortable) and the suites provide a separate sleeping area, but it doesn't do anything to go beyond that. If you are there for Disneyland stay at one of the small hotels closer to the park for an easy walk, if you are there for a convention stay at the Hilton.   The walk too and from Disneyland isn't a long one (1.1 miles) but at night after being on your feet all day it feels much further. It is too far away to come back for a nap IMO. The hotel charges $16 for parking, and a resort fee of around $7 a night. Since the hotel is only marginal for walking to Disneyland, and the ART is slow and sporadic, I would recommend staying further away and driving to Disneyland or staying closer at Katella and
Manager Response: Dear teCH0010, I am sorry that you were not happy with your stay. As to our location,  we have found that as many people enjoy being away from the hustle and bustle that engulfs the smaller hotes and crowds at the Hilton during a convention, as do not. Our parking charges are typical of all the branded, full service hotels in the resort district. As for the noise, I think it has something to do with the number of families staying with us this time of year...and the "running water" will need to be checked out?? Finally, all HHonors guests are special and we do everything we can to earn their loyalty. Gold and Diamond members are entitled to  [2] complimentary breakfast coupons and in the spirt of  brand consistancy we try to abide by the policy. We do however allow children to go thru the buffet at a discounted price and in the example you used, we would typically consider those two items as part of the parents plate. Sorry to be so long winded, but just want you to know that we appreciate the feedback as it helps make us better. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Stay at garden inn or hampton inn if you're a hilton fan. They have hidden policies enforced !
Summary: Stay at garden inn or hampton inn if you're a hilton fan. They have hidden policies enforced ! Read carefully before signing the registration card. I never seen any hotel management so strict in my 40 plus year of hotel experience. Be prepared to pay $50 early departure fee although not mentioned in reservation confirmation.! This hotel is 2-star once you past the entrance !
Manager Response: Dear zkart, I can understand your frustration with paying an early departure fee, however we were sold out during your stay, and had benn turning people away hence the charge. I am sorry that you are upset. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Pros: Very close to Disneyland - $8 single trip by Taxi to front gate Room is quiet and clean Like the suite - very spacious Buffet breakfast is tasty and a lot of choices Hotel lobby is huge and grant Front desk is helpful and polite Kids (under 12) eat for free 2 LCD TVs Wi-Fi is at acceptable speed safe, small fridge and microwave included  Cons: Furniture kind of look old While 2 TV are watching HD channels, 1 of them has a lot of pixels due to not enough bandwidth from telephone line.  There are about 18 HD channels and 18 standard channels A little noisy with my room facing the main street starting 8:30 am when traffic starts

Summary Heading: Very comfortable stay at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim.
Summary: Rooms were clean.  Beds were comfortable.  Kids loved the outdoor pool.  The on-site breakfast was very good and the service there was excellent.  Although the hotel is close to Disneyland (10-15 minute walk) it is still quite the walk at the end of a long day (especially for kids).  Lots of restaurants close by.  Overall, very comfortable stay.

Summary Heading: Noises from hallway and walls - difficult to get a good night rest.
Summary: I like their parking $16 for in and out privilege, comfortable bed, free internet. However they slap a $6 resort fee, but there is nothing resort like at the hotel. Just every average hotel. So I guess you can kinda say the parking is $22, they hit you one way or another.   The major problem with this hotel is that the doors and walls are so thin at this hotel that your room vibrates every time other guests shut their doors. You can hear everyone talking/walking outside your room.   I was awakened several times through out the night 10 pm - 2 am due to the vibration/noises. I am a big traveler and have stayed at over 20 hotels the past 6 months. This one is the worst in term of noises.   I called the front desk, but they said they cant do anything about problem and "sorry". I
Manager Response: Dear CloverlsSweet, I am sorry that your room was so noisy. While the hotel was built out of concrete and block, to the latest sound attenuation standards, a noisy family just back from Disneyland can be a challenge. Fortunately this is not a common problem, and unless we were full, the front desk should have offered to move you to a quieter room at either end of the hallway.  Since you didn't get a good nights sleep, I would like to make arrangements for you to return as our guest, so that we can make amends. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Has all the amenities to spoil patrons!
Summary: Upon entering the suite you know it's not a run-of- the mill room. We had a little sitting room wit a nice desk, couch and flat screen tv. The bedroom had comfortable queen-sized beds, great pillows, an abundance of towels, & another tv. Had a pool with a view of Disneyland fireworks plus a gym. A great place to be pampered!

Summary Heading: Very Good for a Disney Trip
Summary: This hotel is very conveniently located 15 mins walk from Disneyland.  It's very clean, comfortable, but the rooms are a little bit small for a Doubletree.  As a Gold member at Hilton, I'm used to bigger rooms at Doubletrees, but as you spend time in your room only to sleep when in Disneyland, the size of the room doesn't matter.  The morning breakfast was good and the service was also very attentive.  Our morning waitress (Elinda?) was very kind and gave us excellent service.  On the downside, I was really NOT impressed by the staff at check-in.  The lady that checked us in was abrupt and was not in a mood to give us any indications.  1) I asked for a Gold upgrade and she didin't even bother looking in her system;  2) I asked for Disney maps and indications and she replied that

Stayed at double tree while attending a trade show at the convention center. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, 5 min walk to convention center and many restaurants. Quite reasonably priced - I would highly recommend it.

We really enjoyed our time at this hotel during our trip to Disneyland.   Check-in was the only negative experience.  We arrived at 1:00 and were told that our rooms would not be ready until 2:00.  At 2:00, we were told that the rooms were not ready until 3:00.  Eventually, they switched us into rooms with a view that wasn't as nice.  (On a positive note - the receptionist gave us a bunch of bananas and gave us access to the swimming pool while we waited).    The rooms were very nice.  I believe that nearly every room is a suite with a fridge and microwave.  Internet is free.    The pool was great.  There were always people at it (mostly families with young kids) but it wasn't overly crowded.  Towels are provided and there are plenty of sun tanning chairs.   The Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: great hotel in a great location
Summary: Hello again we stayed here by mistake we were to stay at the other doubletree close to the Hospital it sure turned out to be a good mistake.The Staff and hotel were excellent the service and food in the restaurant  was excellent location as well. We caught the hop on hop off bus right out the front door that took us to LA for a tour of the city. The rooms are very nice and not to noisy considering this is close to Disney a very good and comfortable hotel for the price

My wife and I just returned from a three-night stay at the Doubletree Suites while visiting Disneyland with our son, daughter-in-law, and two grandsons.  I earned lots of points from the family for my "awesome" choice of hotels.    As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is extremely clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the location, at least for Disneyland, is excellent.  We used the ART shuttle, which stops at the Doubletree approximately every twenty minutes, to Disneyland each day.  Although the shuttle costs $4 for adults and $1 for children, tickets are good for unlimited rides during the day, making it easy to return to the hotel for some breaks during the day.    We had the bed and breakfast plan and were very pleased with the breakfast buffet

As we arrived via shuttle from the airport we were encouraged when our driver remarked you are staying at Doubletree..."very nice hotel"....what a great start to our eight night vacation. The lobby was spacious and the decor was professional and upscale. Check-in was seamless and the warm cookies were a great treat upon our arrival. Our room was a two queen suite and we really enjoyed the bedrooms being separate and apart from the the desk (work area) and living room....the space was terrific and having two newer large televisions (one in bedroom and one in living room), worked well for our son and for my wife and I.  There is so many other positives about this hotel: - The elevators were fast and very accessible - Staff were friendly and said hello - Disneyland welcome centre

I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip to Anaheim. I was in a "suite" and although the room was large, there were so many doors and walls that it made the room seem cramped. The rooms were very clean, however. The staff was top-notch; very friendly and eager to please. Room-service was fast and the food was good. Parking is expensive (anywhere in Anaheim) but it is very convenient to go in and out. Hotel is within walking distance to the convention center, GardenWalk and many restaurants and shopping. I would stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Nice stay near Disney
Summary: Very much enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree in Anaheim.  Free wifi, nice extremely clean suite type rooms, nice staff.  My daughter left her cell phone, and they mailed it back to us!  Bring flip-flops if you want to use the pool; the deck gets very, very hot.  Also, check the towel situation; late in the day, all were used.  Would love it if they had multiple day ART tickets for sale; make sure you pick yours up if you're going to Disney.

This is the place to stay if you want a more quiet setting compared to other hotels near the parks. Superb service and facilities. Large, spacious rooms . Like a "living room " adjacent to the bedroom. Very convenient perks: small workout room, good pool, most of all there is a Starbucks cafe in the hotel lobby...one of the few resort hotels with a Starbucks.

We really enjoyed staying at Doubletree Suites during our brief visit to Disneyland. It is a mere fifteen minute walk to the Disneyland Parks Entrance (although after a day of walking around Disneyland and California Adventure Park, it may seem a lot longer!) Staff were friendly and helpful with all of our requests - from the location of the nearest place to buy supplies (which was Target - a 15/20 minute walk in the opposite direction to Disneyland) to organising our transportation out of Anaheim. Rooms were spacious and clean. We will certainly consider staying at Doubletree Suites again!

This hotel does not disappoint. Check in was a breeze. The room was clean and spacious.  Great pool and shuttle to Disneyland was easy to access, however they do not offer free shuttle service. There was an incident with guests in a room next to us, screaming and yelling, but after a call to the front desk, security was called and the situation has handled immediately.  The Doubletree is our new go-to hotel for future trips to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Top Notch Hotel for Disneyland travelers!
Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel 8/8/12-8/11/12, as we were going to be visiting Disneyland and California Adventure park. We were very pleased with the entire experience and will most definitly stay here again when we go back to Disney. The check in was very quick, the front desk staff was knowledgable and friendly. We presented our HH rewards number during the reservation process, so they had upgraded our room for us to a suite for no charge! Such a wonderful surprise! The room was clean, spacious and comfortable! My only complaint is that the bathroom did not have an exhaust fan, so it got a little humid in the whole bathroom area after showers. The pool area was also very nice- smaller then other Doubletree's we have visited but it was very warm water and lots of chairs

This hotel had a great location and had excellent rates. You need to keep checking the rates online since they change almost daily. I would also recommend a room overlooking the pool since outside rooms are subject to street noise. The furnishings appeared a little worn but the rooms were attractive and kept clean. The parking was an extra charge  All of the staff were pleasant and accommodating. Loved the warm cookies on check-in.  I would definitely recommend this hotel as your base when visiting Disney.

This is the second time my family and I have stayed at this hotel and we still love it. It is a suite, so the living area doubles as an extra bedroom with a sofa bed and can be totally closed off from the main bedroom by 2 doors; one leading to the bathroom and one leading to the bedroom. There are 2 TVs so no one has to fight for it. All wonderful.  The Wolfgang Puck coffeemaker and coffee pod that is provided in the room is a little sad. If you are a coffee drinker, don't even bother with it. However, just off the lobby in the hotel, they brew Starbucks. Starbucks is not my first choice but it is better than what they have in the room.

Summary Heading: Great place to Stay our First time to Disneyland
Summary: This was our first time to Disneyland and we made a great Choice staying here.  We arrived on Monday august 13, 2012 and checked out on august 15  At our arrival we were greeted by a great receptionist her name was Ashley.  She was very polite and really helpful with a fast check in and answered all our questions we had.  She made our long drive down there nice to be greeted by someone so nice and having a big smile.  The guest services had Javier and Josh.  They were very polite and very helpful and also answered some questions we had about transportation to and from Disneyland from the hotel.  A++ hotel Staffing here.     The parking, outside hotel grounds, lobby were all very clean.  The room we were able to get was very clean and great view where for a little more $$ per day

I was extremely impressed with this property! The employees were all very nice and helpful with any questions I had. While I am a HHonors Gold member, they said they normally upgrade to a suite, but they were sold out for the night, so unfortunately, no upgrade. I was hoping to at least get a room that faced the fireworks from Disneyland, but no such luck. The room was very clean though, and it was fairly large. I walked to Downtown Disney one night and it was a nice walk, with a straight shot down Harbor Blvd. While I would have walked home, it was late, so I took the shuttle which was $3 and dropped me off directly in front of the hotel. The bar employees were fabulous and all made good, stiff drinks. The food was just okay, but seeing as they weren't many options in the area,

A nice clean,friendly hotel with all our family's needs. the buffet breakfast is better than anything you'll find in the area never mind the Ihop or Denny's . Drew and his team are happy to book any tour of California you need and you're in great proximity to everything.

Cant say one bad thing about this place. When checking in, you get a complimentary baked cookie for every guest; theyre so good! We got a suite and it was spacious and clean. Rooftop pool is great. The hotel is in a convenient location, it's minutes away from Angels stadium and Disneyland. We felt safe both in our rooms and walking the streets at night. No complimentary breakfast, but there is a restaurant; didn't seem to have things appeasing to children though. You do have to pay for parking, but it's not a hassle and its California. You have to expect to pay for parking everywhere! Not a bad thing I could say; it was enjoyable!

We stayed here for 7 nights in May 2012 as we visited Disneyland with out 2 year old daughter.  It was fantastic having a separate bedroom where you could close the doors.  The decor was pleasant and we were on the top floor as requested and had a great view looking back to Disneyland.  Staff were great, particularly the concierge - we had lots of deliveries from online shopping purchases and they all arrived without any problems.  Location was excellent, we walked to Disneyland one day and used the ART buses on the others, the stop is right outside the door.  The laundry facilities were great and very reasonably priced.  Great value for money, would highly recommend.

We stayed here for two nights to tour Disneyland. The hotel room is very nice. The sofa bed is comfortable. Bedroom and living room are completed separated. The only thing to note is that there is not a real kitchen. There is a fridge and microwave though. There is also a small pool and spa on the 2nd floor.  The staff was very nice. My child accidentally pressed pay per view and we got a charge of $14.99 on the bill. After explaining to the staff, they took off the charge.  The hotel is within walking distance to disneyland. They also sell disneyland ticket at the lobby.

We had a very good experience at the Doubletree in Anaheim, nice hotel and very nice staff.  This was our third time in Anaheim and this was our best hotel experience.  Two things that would make this hotel get an excellent rating with me is a shuttle to and from the hotel to Disneyland and more security when the hotel is full.

This hotel is a gem. It is clean, comfortable and has all the amenities a hotel should have. The staff is absolutely outstanding, very proffessional and very friendly. It is also reasonably priced. If we are in Anaheim again we will deffinitely stay here. The only thing that would improve this hotel is a hotel shuttle to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: good hotel, learned a few things
Summary: This was a nice hotel with good customer service.  A special thanks to the waiter Mario in the restaurant.  The hotel was nicely decorated, updated with some of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. We all loved the warm cookies.  The things I wish I knew before we went.  This area seems to have horrible tasting tap water. We saw others bringing bottled water into the hotel, good idea ans we did end up buying some just down the street.  The first two days we walked to Disneyland but it really is a bit far if you are walking around the park all day it makes it a long walk back with sore feet. The third day we finally used the ART and it was more convenient than I thought it would be. There is a Denny's across the street but it is way crowded and not the best food or

My husband and I recently did a mini honeymoon in Anaheim.  We stayed at the Doubletree Suites.  We flew into LAX and it was about a $100 cab ride to the hotel.  We drove right past Disneyland.  It's within walking distance from the hotel which meant for a lot of kids and families at the hotel but we hardly noticed as they were always gone through the day.  We were there before noon and able to check in right away.  We got this awesome, warm, cookie ... nice treat!  Starbucks right in the hotel! (they have really great breakfast sandwiches!)  Great lounge right in the hotel too which was nice and quiet.  The room was amazing, very nice and spacious, beds were super comfy.  Pool on the second floor was smallish, but we were there every afternoon and it was pretty quiet and we

We stayed for two nights using Hilton Honor points so I cannot comment about the price.  Our suite was clean and spacious and we had more then enough room.  The room was quiet too and the beds comfortable.   Easy access to Disneyland makes this hotel a perfect stay.

We booked this hotel due to it´s large room and closeness to Disneyland. Regarding the room, yes it was large and comfy for a family but without any of the luxury or "little extra" you would expect from a Hilton chain-hotel. The standard was more motel/hostel style. The pool was very small but it was nice to go swimming after a hot day outside. Breakfast was very basic. Pancakes you made your self and they always got burned in the "pancake machine".... Disneyland was within walking distance but prepare for a good 20 minutes walk. There are other hotels much closer I would go for the next time instead.

This hotel is just a 10 min walk to Disneyland.  Keep in mind that after a day at Disney, you might not want that 10 min walk but the ART shuttle is not reliable.  Take the Disney Resort buses instead.  The hotel lobby is awesome and the staff are helpful for the most part.  You get a warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in and whenever you ask during your stay.  The room was very clean however, the carpet was a little warm.  We had a standard king room which came with a micro and fridge which helped with snacks.  There's a Target down the road a few minutes and also the gas stations on the corner had snacks and drinks that were cheaper than the hotel.  There's also a 7 Eleven close to Disney that was reasonable.  I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel at a good price.
Summary: We stayed here with our 2 kids on our recent trip to Disneyland. The location is great. Just about 1 mile from Disneyland. Lots of restaurants around. Parking is not free but is specious and safe. There is a shuttle to Disneyland and back every 20 minutes.  We got delicious, warm chocolate chip cookies at check in. That set a good tone for our trip. We had a suite with 2 queen beds. The suite itself was extremely clean and comfortable.  It had a living room with a comfy couch and a lounge chair and the bedroom with 2 queen beds and yet plenty of room to move about. It had a microwave, mini fridge, iron, hair dryer and all the little things you expect in a decent hotel. The beds were very comfortable and allowed us to have very restful sleep all the nights we were there. There

Summary Heading: You take the good with the bad
Summary: We planned a family trip to Disneyland with adult kids and grandkids. Booked the hotel months in advance. Change of plans and had to go a day before- very difficult to get a room. Finally got one. When I called I was told I had a King instead of 2 Queens like for the rest of the reservation. Unfortunately not correct it was a King room smaller than my bedroom at home for nearly double the price not a suite. Somehow when some of the kids arrived we all squeezed into this tiny room. Next day we were moved to our suites which were very nice. They were supposed to move our luggage to the new room, did not. No coffee left in room for the morming. etc, etc. Very small pool where this guest insisted on cigar smoking. No central coffee station in lobby, no free breakfast. When we

Summary Heading: Management made the difference for us
Summary: My family and I just spent a 2 night 3 day stay here at the Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center for an extended trip to the Disneyland Resort for my and my sons' birthdays the week of July 18th. Overall our experience was a very positive one not perfect but most pleasing.  We booked here for its proximity to the park, its family friendly accommodations and my perception of value for our money. Being a single income family of six, I can assure you value is high on our list in these challenging economic times. There was only one real sticking point for me in that regard but more on that later.  First off: Management made the difference for us and it is why I am rating 5 not 4. As I alluded to our trip was not perfect but the Management's swift and

If you are looking for a spacious,clean and kitchenette hotel for your Disney trip for a family this will be a good choice.After spending a full day at the PARKS its nice to retire into a clean and comfy room.The kitchenette was basic and good to serve my family with their breakfast.

I stayed here for business and the room was great! I love that the bedroom was separated from the living room area and would be very nice for a family. I plan on staying here when I come back with family to Disney. The staff was great the room was very clean and the price was decent for hotels of this caliber in the area. Probably one of the nicer hotels in the area.

My husband and I were staying for two nights for a big concert in Anaheim.  Our first night in the hotel, the air conditioning broke at 3am and flooded the floor next to the AC unit and proceeded to make loud clunking sounds the rest of the night as the unit tried to come back on.  When we spoke with the hotel rep at the desk, she just told my husband they would send maintenance up to look at it (I guess to check to make sure the floor was actually soaking wet before believeing us).  No apology, no consideration for the lack of sleeep.  We checked in again before we left for the day, and she handed us two free breakfast buffet tickets for our "trouble."  We asked her to call us while we were out if they needed to change our room while fixing the broken AC unit.  No calls.  We
Manager Response: Dear Bowers Family, From what you have said I couldn't agree with you more and we have had a lively discussion this morning about how things should have been handled differently. We will be reaching out to determine if you were given the parking credits as well as reimbursement for the chocolates, and an invitation to return at our expense. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and we look forward to serving you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse.

Summary Heading: The sleeping beds were very Good.
Summary: No matter what people have said my family of five had the best stay experience in double tree. We highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel location was great. Near so many good restaurants. House keeping was great, room was so clean when we come back with so many personal touches, towels folded in the shape of animals. Maintenance was great , they changed our TV to a new one at 12 AM. front desk staff were not friendly and very cold. cookies were available but had to ask for them and not like our previous hotel where on the front desk with coffee and tea. The coffee make in the room was terrible. They really should change them. 2 spacious room for a good price and good location. $16 for the parking hurts especially for a long stay. pool was very small and not appealing to put a foot in it, but it was cold for this time of the year so we did not need it. having said that I would stay there again and
Manager Response: Dear Blanco70, I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay and that you would recommend our hotel to others.I was able to identify the employee that checked you in and have shared your comments with her as well as other members of the staff. It helps  to reinforce the importance of being warm and friendly. Thankfully we get it right most of the time, but when we don't we learn from the experience. I know what you mean about having a platter of cookies always available at the front desk along with coffee. While it's a nice touch, it would be impossible to keep them in stock given the number of children [and cookie addicted adults] that we have as guests. We will however, gladly give out additional cookies whenever a guest has the urge. Not sure what was wrong with your coffee maker, but I will check. Thanks again for sharing your observations and for the kind words about housekeeping and our restaurant staff. Hope to see you again soon. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: This hotel is within walking distance of Disney as well as several restaurants and bars.  Our suite was clean and a good size and included two queen beds and a separate living area as well as fridge and microwave.  Wi-fi was included but parking was $16 per night.  The pool area is fairly small but if you hit it at the right time is ok for a cooling off period either before or after hitting the theme parks.  The breakfast is standard buffet fare, but if not included in your rate then there is a Denny's directly across the street that offers a better deal.  The hotel bar is ok-but nothing special.  Would definitely stay here again if the price was acceptable.

We stayed in the hotel for 10 nights.The house keeping never cleaned the floors or dusted the room.The bedding was never changed in the 10 nights we stayed.Very poor service from house keeping made the stay bad.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremey D, I am sorry that you were not happy with our housepeeping department. Typically all of our rooms are thoroughly cleaned each day, which would include vacuuming, dusting, changing towels, etc. As far as the bedding is concerned, to conserve water and energy we change  sheets every third day, for guests staying four days or more, UNLESS, you request that we change them more often.  Thank you for sharing your comments. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We spent three nights at the property quite recently, and we left extremely satisfied. The property is very well maintained, the rooms modern, fresh, and clean, and the staff professional. You can't beat its location, either...just a short, inexpensive bus ride to the Disney parks. We stayed in a suite with two beds and a pull-out sofa---all for a very reasonable price during a busy time of the year. Parking is a bit pricey but the price buys you a spot in a very nice and safe lot. We definitely recommend this property for families.

Hotel was fantastic. Staff was great. Hotel was clean and within walking distance to Disneyland (0.8 mile). There is a shuttle service right outside hotel for $4 a day per person. Pool was nice. Food was very good. Highly recommend for families. Thanks Hilton for a memorable stay

We are a family of five and we're very happy with the Doubletree. The room was clean and comfortable with nice bed linnins. All the staff were very helpfull and kind. We would stay here again for sure!!

Summary Heading: Very nice option for Disneyland visit
Summary: Family of four, including one teen and one pre-teen, stayed comfortably in a two-queen two-room suite.  Seems to be one of the newest hotels in the Disneyland area.  Rooms were clean and bedding was very comfortable.  Front desk staff was very helpful, courteous and accommodated all requests.  About a mile to the Disneyland entrance ... could have walked but would not recommend (you're ok going to the park, but leaving the park you're wiped out).  Either take the bus / shuttle or hop in your car to park in the Disney decks, where you catch a tram to the park entrance.

Summary Heading: Great location and service   Room needed an update
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights on a family trip to Disneyland.  Within reasonable walking distance to Disneyland, but on the outside edge of what a 9yo can do coming back from a full day.   Rooms spacious.  We rented a two room suite with two queens and a sofa bed.   The staff provided extra towels and pillows promptly on request.  This was one of the few places our family of 6 could stay without an extra room.  Sleeper sofa and decor needed an update.  It was not comfortable at all and the sheets and blankets were very thin.  The regular beds were very nice and quite comfortable.  Overall excellent value for the distance and the Dollar

I had gone to Anaheim with my family.this is a very good and clean hotel.the staff is also vey cooperative .the hotel is well connected with Anaheim resort transit buses.it is in the main location.We had purchased Disney passes and so enjoyed each and every moment there.it was a memorable trip.

The hotel was very clean and really beautiful.  They have an onsite restuarant, Agio, where we ate breakfast daily and kids were free.  We tried it for dinner the first night we were there, and weren't impressed.  But the breakfast buffet was amazing, and normally I hate buffets.  It's really close to Disneyland and the area was beautiful to go walking around in the evening.  I was really pleased with our stay in every aspect.  Just an FYI, it is $16 to park each day.

This is a very nice hotel indeed! We stayed for a night to go to Disneyland, and everything just worked out fine. The hotel is nice, well appointed, well located. The room is very nice, the bathroom is clean, the parking lot is not that expensive. We used the shuttle service, and everytime we got it, the driver seemed to have a smile on their face! Just loved that! The only con I have about this hotel is the concierge desk! We asked information twice about how to get tickets to Disneyland, and both times got the wrong information (first concerning the availabilty of tickets at the hotel; second, about the ticket prices). I think they shoud take Concierge Service more seriously, about apart from that, all went well. I would recommend this hotel to others, but try to buy your

Our family of 13 had 3 (2 room) suites and 1 king room.  The location was close to Disneyland.  The hotel staff was very friendly and rooms were nice.   We loved the beds, they were so comfortable.  The breakfast buffet, thought not free, was very good.   Parking was $14.00 per day, but, was very convenient and secure.   I would recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel, close to Convention Centre and Disney
Summary: Lovely 2 room suite, stayed for a conference at end of June 2012, the staff are amazing and friendly, so willing to help out with anything.  The breakfast was buffet style, for $14, or could be picked from the a la carte menu.  The buffet was lovely, and plentiful, and had different hot dishes daily, all of which was very nice.  The Grappa Bar was a nice place to spend an evening after dinner, the bar tenders were incredibly friendly and chatty.  The front desk staff did everything to answer any questions we had.    The pool is outdoor on the second floor, and was incredibly quiet.  It was a great suntrap and was a great place to spend some relaxation time.  Altogether, would definitely go back here anytime we are in the area.

Stayed at hotel for a conference with my wife, who was also attending, and son.  Friendly staff with nice selection of breakfast foods in small coffee shop and also a gift shop; right next to a Disney welcome center.  Room service delivery was very friendly and food was good.  Hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Convention Center.  Also had a rental car and overnight parking was quite reasonable with in-and-out privileges with temporary keycard.  Nice 2 room suite; looked like it had been renovated in recent past.  Bathroom had toilet and shower in one room and sink in the other; worked great for us because we had different timed obligations and we're able to sleep (bedroom had doors for both entrances) while other got ready or finished getting ready while other

I just stayed at this hotel for work.  This hotel was fine for me.  The maid came to my room as soon as I checked in to put in a new shower curtain.  She was very nice and very helpful. The rooms were very clean.  I spilled some water on the floor and cleaned it up with the white towels.  The floors were so clean the towels didn't show any dirt on them when I wiped the floor.  Very impressive.  The room was nice and the beds were very comfortable.   I give this a 3 only because there weren't any real wow factors that would make me want to rate this higher.  I didn't see the pool, but i think it was inside.    The restaurant was pretty good.  The staff there was fantastic.  I asked about getting breakfast somewhere outside the hotel and was told there wasn't anywhere really,

Walking distance to Parks, restaurants and for a quick breakfast Denny's is across the road.  Lovely, well maintained Hotel.  Amenities are super.  Had breakfast in Hotel Restaurant, highly recommend buffet.  They give you the best hot chocolate chip walnut cookies when you arrive I have ever eaten!  The Snappes bar is a lovely spot with awesome friendly staff.  Overall, this Hotel has the charm and atmosphere of a very high end Hotel with very reasonable prices.  Would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Quiet with spacious rooms and excellent service
Summary: I spent 3 nights here for a convention, and had a great experience.  I had a suite on the 6th floor which was very roomy, and had 2 flat-screens, fridge and microwave. Housekeeping did a fabulous job and the front desk staff members were friendly and helpful. I was worried when I checked in since my room was directly across from the vending/ice machine area, but I never heard a thing. The rooms are SO quiet, and I know the hotel was fully booked during my stay. Very convenient for the convention center and there are shuttles to Disneyland. If you are traveling with kids ask for a room that faces the Disney fireworks, but you also get a great view from the pool deck.  I got room service one night and the food was very good.

This is an excellent hotel for both business travelers and families.  The suites are spatious and full of amenities, such as a microwave, fridge, and free wireless.  The beds were comfortable and our housekeeping service was excellent.  Front desk staff were friendly and answered all of our questions.  The breakfast buffet (pricey if you don't have a voucher ~ $14) had a large variety of delicious items that rotated daily.  There is a coffee shop with Starbucks coffee and bakery items.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of the convention center and it right on the ART bus route, so it's easy to hop on at the end of the driveway and get to almost anywhere in Anaheim you'd like to go (Disneyland! GardenWalk!).  Every time I looked out at the pool it was empty; not overrun

The Doubletree Suites was the perfect choice for visiting Anaheim.  Our family of four visited last week and had a suite which included one room with Two double beds with Flat Screen Television and then another decent size room with a couch, chairs, desk, Flat screen television, microwave and small refrigerator.  While there was only one bathroom, the sink and counter outsdie the bathroom was a very nice size and allowed for multiple female teenagers to get ready for the day. This layout was perfect as it allowed for children to have some space away from the adults.  Additionally the hotel is fairly new and extremely clean. Housekeeping was exceptional.   All employees encountered were very friendly and willing to help with directions or requests.  Additionally, the hotel is

Large suites. With the kids getting older the space was much needed. We ordered a room with two beds in the bedroom and the fold out in the sitting area. Front staff were GREAT. We were there for our daughter's graduation. Front desk, concierge, and Starbucks person always congratulated her when we walked in and out with her MICKEY MOUSE graduation cap on.  Close to Disneyland. Some people were walking, but a bit far after walking the park all day. Parking is not included. It is a bit high.  We were aware of that before we got there.  Only little problem. Is I wish the cookies were nut free. I had to make sure not to be near where the cookies had been.

I usually enjoy staying at Doubletree Hotels (can't beat those cookies!), and this one was okay, but nothing special.  First, I was expecting a "suite" in a "Doubletree Suites", but our room was just a standard room ... I'm assuming that there are larger "suite" rooms in the hotel, but we weren't offered one, and it wasn't worth changing rooms once we got to ours.    The reason we chose this hotel was proximity to Disneyland, and it was a very short drive (or there is a shuttle-bus, but that seemed to be a very slow way of going ... get your Disney tickets through AAA and you'll get free parking at the Disney parking structure).  A breakfast buffet was included in our room rate, and it was large, but the food was not great ... no better than a budget hotel's breakfast.  Parking
Very Nice,and Clean. Parking Fee not good S/b only $10 not $16

Summary Heading: Very nice alternative to pricy Disney hotels
Summary: I stayed here with wife and kid for three nights to visit Disneyland.  Being a HH Gold member, they upgraded me to a suite upon arrival.  The suite is quite spacious and has all the amenities you need.  My wife had minor complaint about noises from the street.  The hotel is very conveniently located.  There are restaurants and convenience stores within a block of the hotel.  There's also restaurant and cafe inside the hotel.  We also got free breakfast which we enjoyed daily.  We took the ART shuttle to Disneyland, which turns out to be cheaper than paying for parking at Disneyland.  The Disneyland parking lot is across the street form the hotel.  Walking to Disneyland only took me 15 minutes.  I would definitely come back to this hotel again on my next visit.  I also had stayed

We have just arrived home after spending 12 nights at Doubletree Suites. We had a fabulous time, and met some fabulous staff who made us very welcome.. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children so chose to have a suite which was a real bonus. The rooms are very well maintained and clean. The location is great as it is only a short walk to Disney and there are restaurants close by. We chose to eat in the restaurant at hotel most nights and food was wonderful and service was good. It was also very reasonably priced and children ate free which was a bonus. I would definetly choose this hotel again if visiting the area as it is good quiet location and the service more than met my expectations. A very specail mention to staff members Christina, and Jerry, who were just wonderful and

This is a very nice property. It has a Disney planning center where you can buy park tickets and learn about Disneyland and a Starbucks on site. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet.  The only drawback to or stay was that we could here the band below (esp the bass) into the late hours of the evening. We stayed on the third floor

As far as I'm concerned, a family visiting Disneyland can't do better than the Doubletree Suites.  Our family of five (three kids under the age of eight) stayed for five nights.  The room was clean, and the separate bedroom was a great feature for us.  The small refrigerator and microwave in the room was a great convenience.  The pool and hot-tub area were clean and just what we needed to recharge after a day at Disneyland.  The breakfast buffet was very good; the kids loved the "do-it-yourself" waffle machine.  There is a small gift shop, a Starbucks and a Disney information kiosk on-site.  The lobby also had an interactive video screen that allows you to look up park times and many other details about what is happening inside the parks.  I clocked the distance from the
Stayed in the Doubletree suites in February.  Loved the room, location and amenities.  Breakfast was great.  Location was convenient.

We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Anaheim Doubletree Suites. We typically stay either at one of the Disneyland Resort Hotels or at one of the cheaper motels/hotels across the street from the front gates of Disneyland.  The motels across the street are often noisy and the beds can be uncomfortable.  This hotel is a bit further up Harbor Blvd., but it is a much better class of Hotel than the ones directly across the street from Disneyland.  We got a 2 queen suite, and the room was so clean and comfortable.  The beds were amazingly comfortable!  The bed was so much more comfortable than the one we had at the Grand Californian in December!  And there were no screaming kids or maids to wake us up in the morning.  This hotel was almost silent when you got into your room.

My husband and two daughters (ages 10 and 5) stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland. We used Hilton Honors points for our stay, so we didn't pay out of pocket for our stay. We found the rooms to be spacious and very comfortable - nice linens, good assortment of pillows, living area had a comfortable sleeper sofa. It was nice having a suite as it allowed my husband and I to relax with a glass of wine after a long-day at the park without disturbing our daughters' sleep. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast buffet (perhaps only to HH members?) and we all enjoyed the quality and variety of the food. In addition, kids eat free in the restaurant for lunch and dinner, which is a nice option after spending so much at the park. We requested a top-floor room, away from

This was our first time to visit Disney with our son and we truly enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree.  The hotel was affordable, convenient and a really nice place to stay during our time there.  We enjoyed the morning breakfast at the Asiago and also the convenience of the ART shuttle pickup at the end of the driveway (you can buy your tickets at the front desk).  The shuttle to and from Disney takes about 5 to 10 minutes and drops you off at the front entrance.   Most importantly, the staff was really helpful with all our questions as were able to assist us quickly. We will definitely return to this hotel for future stays.

We stayed for Disney on Saturday with a child. We hopped  on the weekends and compared to the Hilton Anaheim. There are a lot of positives. This hotel looks like brand new and very clean. The rooom was prepared as we requested. Larger and upper level room than the Hilton Anaheim with a less room charge. Generous to HH gold or diamond members giving us 3 free buffet breakfast ( We usually receive 2 continental breakfast. ) The hottub on the 2nd floor rooftop was good to use at night avoiding a lot of kids. The breakfast Orange juice was delicious.  A few drawbacks are the waiting time for the shuttle by the hotel entrance that was about 45 minutes.( You will arrive to Disney Downtown in 30 min if you walk.), quality of buffet and hard to find a parking spot at night. There are no
Manager Response: Dear Osakamt, Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments. I am sorry that you had problems with the resort  shuttle...it is supposed to pick up every 20 minutes, so I will be contacting them as to what happened on Saturday. Your suggestion about some sort of bench, or waiting area is interesting, although our guests typically do not experience such a long delay. As for the breakfast buffet, we usually get a lot of good comments and if you don't mind our Food Manager will be reaching out to you for suggestions. Thanks again for so many positive comments, and I hope we have a chance to serve you again in the future.  Respectfully yours, Jeff Morse

Summary: this is very good hotel ,we stay for 4 nights it;s close to Disney land the room was very clean and very nice , outstanding friendly staff. Delicious breakfast

We stayed here for two nights, one before and one after our day at Disneyland. The rooms were clean and very nice. Access to the park was somewhat less than desireable on a $4 shuttle that picks up out on the street every 20 minutes. We ended up taking a cab. The pool area was pleasant, especially after a long day at the Park. Parking was an additional $16 per day, which is average for the area. Overall a good value.

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel for Disneyland. A+++++!
Summary: Our travel agent put our package together and recommended the Doubletree for 8day stay. We had a party  of 5 so we got the suite with two queen in one room and the living room had a pull out bed, 2 flat screens tv.  The room was perfect for us. The beds were so comfortable,  the mini fridge and microwave came in handy with 3 kids. Also LOVE how the sink area is outside from the bathroom area which made getting ready much easier and quicker. After everyday of walking kids enjoyed splashing in the heated pool and hot tub outside.   The hotel is very well maintain and extremely clean. The staff are very friendly, they do anything to make your stay enjoyable. The cookies that you receive when checking in are soooo yummy!   The location is great. Our family had a blast in Anaheim! I

Has coin laundry, is very well mantained, spacious rooms, oustanding friendly staff. Delicious breakfast with automatic pancake machine. Has a Disney transportation stop in the entrance(if you prefer walking you can, I think is a 15 min walk to Disneyland) , and a disney center inside were you can buy the tickets there. Very good option for families

This was the first time I'd stayed here, but my daughter, who was with me, had stayed here twice before. Every time we were using my husband's Diamond Level Hilton rewards points.  The room that we got this time was fine, but my daughter said that the other times she'd stayed there, the room was much bigger.  When I asked the front desk, the man said, "Oh yeah. We are renovating that room now."  (Just that one room??) Anyway, the room was a suite with a king bed in one room, which my daughter & her boyfriend used, and a living room with a sofa bed which I stayed in. There was also a refrigerator and microwave in the room(which I'm always happy about), and a TV in each room.  The toilet and shower were in one room and the sink outside that room in the hallway, which made it good,
Manager Response: Dear jainsea, Thank you for sharing your comments with me and I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. As to the room you received, on the prior two visits your daughter was given the Presidential Suite, of which there is only one, and from time to time we do put it out of order for special cleaning [this may have been one of those times] As for the cookie...I can't tell you how dissapointed I am that one of our employees would be anything but hospitable and super friendly. Because of the timing, I think I know who it was and we will be speaking with him this evening.   Please accept my apologies and I hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of service. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Stay on a floor higher than third if your hearing is good and you want to sleep ae night.
Summary: We stayed on the third floor and had difficulty going to sleep at night for two nights straight due to the sound of a bass guitar we could hear playing in a band in the ballroom below. The hotel was gracious enough to comp us a breakfast buffet the next morning and the breakfast was fabulous but I wished a higher floor had been available.  Otherwise, the location, the cleanliness of the rooms, the friendliness off the staff was tops!

we had a suite,  one room with two queen beds - dreamy beds,  bathroom and then a separate lounge with sofa, chair and desk - great size room - although no balcony - pool on level 2 was nice but no other outside area around at all.  All staff we encountered were fantastic,  bar very dark and uninviting - terrible meal at the restaurant,  felt it was a block too far from the action.

OMG! What can I say?! My family of four stayed at this Doubletree between May 24th - 28th while attending a wedding at Disneyland.  The hotel was very nice and the staff very accomodating.  They were very prompt with our request for extra towels and housekeeping.  The hotel bar and restraunt was a nice amenity to have and the food/drinks were good. There is a Denny's acrossed the street, which we did eat at on our last morning.  We had a 2 room suites with a sofa bed and 2 queen beds.  The beds were very comfortable and surprisingly enough so was the sofa bed in the living room area.  Having the seperate room was excellent as we didn't feel like we were on top of each other.  The kids had their space and the adults theirs when it came to to relaxing and watching tv.  The outdoor
Friendly staff and good value for the location.  Really liked the comfort of the suite. The cookies they give you at check-in are warm and delicious.  The work out room was small but was fine.
Does not honer what they quote as the final total.  Adds more charges upon check in.

Summary Heading: A great hotel in a superb location
Summary: Stayed here for three nights in Early May. Staff very helpfull, couldn't do enough for you. A very large suite, Breakfast buffett superb. Walkng distance to Disney  15 minutes. Would definately return Good value

I chose this hotel because I was really worried about cleanliness, bed bugs etc and I was very pleased with my choice. The hotel is kind of new, so everything looks nice and clean. Good taste furniture. Breakfast (not included) offers many options of breads, pastries, cereals, hot plates etc. Restaurant also offers good dishes with reasonable prices. Room service ordered 3 times worked perfectly. Delicious warm cookies everyday upon arrival from the parks. Front desk staff very polite and helpful.  Negatives are the charge of parking - USD16 per day and resort fee of USD7 plus tax since the hotel is not a real resort with many pools, courts, recreational activities etc. I was told the charge is to cover usage of pool, towels and business center!

I stayed at this hotel with my husband a 3 kids (ages 22, 17 & 3). We all enjoyed it. The restaurant/bar/Starbucks staff were absolutely wonderful and went out of their way for us. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool was great. The location of this hotel was perfect and we not only visited Disneyland, we did Universal, San Diego, PCH and beaches along it - great access to freeways and Target was close for those little things you may need.

Summary Heading: Loved hotel for Disneyland family vacation stay.
Summary: We loved the hotel.! We stayed for four night with our 5 year old daughter.  The hotel was very clean and the service was great!  We took the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) Bus 3 to get to Disneyland and it was a short ride.  It was $4/adult and $1/child per day.  We ordered room service one morning for breakfast and one night for dinner and the food was good.  The cafe downstairs also had great coffee and quick breakfast food.

I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two little girls and it was fantastic! I have been in the hospitality field for 15 years and this hotel is doing everything right. The rooms were very clean, extremely comfortable and how can you disagree with a warm cookie upon check-in? My little girls loved it and we appreciated the proximity to Disneyland without having to pay Disneyland prices. The food was also excellent for breakfast!  I also want to point out that the manager has responded to many of the reviews on this site and offered to rectify any disappointing situations. This is not standard and I tip my hat to him for being willing to offer his apologies; that's fantastic service! I am planning a trip right now to take my girls to Disneyland in October and plan on staying

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Disneyland Vacation
Summary: Stayed for 5 nights with 2 children (3 and 7 years) in a suite. Cookies on arrival were delicious. Suite was a great size. Location to The Disney Parks was excellent. Just far enough away to be out of the crowds.   We used the local bus transport to get to Disney each day (4 days of theme parks, $4 p/p p/d). It was a quick trip on the bus most of the time. Late at night it was much more convenient to just hop on the bus back to our hotel. We left our rental car parked in the hotel lot for most of the time. The parking price was cheaper at the hotel than Disney. It was more hassle to park at Disney like we did on the first day. The Disney car parks are a long walking distance from the Park entry and require you to hop on a shuttle from the car park to the entrance of the parks.

I stayed here for four nights with some friends while we were visiting Disneyland. When I checked in, they gave me a warm chocolate chip cookie (and it tasted amazing!), and the front desk agent was very nice and answered all of my questions.  Our room was a double suite and was gorgeous. It was the right size and had enough space for four girls and all of our stuff! We were given a room on the front of the building (facing the parking lot) and you could see Disneyland in the distance. We were never in the room to see them, but apparently you can see the fireworks if you're on that side.  The location to the parks was great, we were content to walk every morning, but at night the walk definitely seemed like forever! There were a couple nights when we were too tired to walk back
Manager Response: Daer Shorty808, Sounds like you had fun and enjoyed your stay with the exception of the grumpy desk clerk. Not sure who the culpret is, however I have posted your comments for everyone at the desk to see. As for the parking fee, most of the hotels in this immediate error charge from $12 to $20 dollars per night. Thanks for staying with us and I am sorry for the incident over parking. Hope to see you again soon. Jeff Morse

Summary: We had a very enjoyable stay here. Stayed for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. Suites were lovely and staff were amazing. Would recommend it to anyone.

What a great place.  With a quick checkin you get hot chocolate chip cookies.  The room was a surprise when we walked in.  We saw a living room and I really thought the bed was a sofabed.  What a great surprise to discover it was a suite with a large living area and a large bedroom,  both with large LG TVs.  Our room faced the street, but never heard the sounds from the street.  We enjoyed a wedding reception at the hotel and that room was beautiful.  The lobby was elegant.  Just wished I could have stayed longer. Did I mention the pillows, so soft and 4 of them on each bed.

Summary Heading: beds were poor and did not provide a nights sleep, the food was an insult, dry or soggy and just plain poor
Summary: need new beds, need new fresh menu for morning meal
Manager Response: Dear Gary F, I am sorry that you were so unhappy with your stay, and if you would contact me directly I will make arrangements to refund your money. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a big walk from Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here for two nights whilst visiting Disneyland. We originally had just a standard room booked but for some reason when checking in they upgraded us to a suite.  The suite was lovely and very clean and the room service we had was good. All the staff were very friendly and helpful whilst we were there, although I left my mobile phone at the hotel and they have been less than helpful with arranging to have it sent back!  The only downside to the hotel is that it is quite a big walk from Disneyland, especially if you had children with you however if that is not a problem then this is a great hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Faye L, I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay, but am sorry  you encountered problems retreiving your phone. I have spoken with our housekeeping department, and apparently it was mailed to you last week and hopefully you will receive it soon. As for the walk to Disneyland, while it can be very pleasent first thing in the morning, the return trip can feel longer after a day of walking around the park.  I hope you were told that the city operates a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes and picks up at the end of our driveway. Thanks for staying with us and I hope to see you again next year. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: My (adult) daughter and I spent two quick days at Disneyland.  Prior experiences with hotels in Anaheim we not so great so we were so pleased to stay here.  From the lovely grounds to the staff and that delicious warm cookie (we went back for another one!) the experience was great.  This is where we will stay for all future Disney trips.  The restaurant was very good, and dinner portions large enough to share.  Very convenient breakfast, egg bagle sandwich and Starbucks coffee!  What more could you ask for before heading out to see Mickey?

We had a great experience with this hotel and would highly recommend it. We were greeted with a warm smile by the staff and even warmer freshly baked cookies upon our arrival.  Our check-in took less than 5 minutes and we were on our way to our spacious and super-clean room in no time. Every staff member greeted us with a smile throughout our stay. The requested services (crib in the room and changing the in-room safe batteries) were handled in a timely fashion. Our one-bedroom suite was cleaned spotless every day.  But what impressed me the most was the following: The housekeeping staff realized that my wife and I drink a lot of coffee, so on our third day we had a small basket full of extra coffee pouches, tea bags and coffee-cream left for us. What an amazing service! Thank

Summary Heading: Great place for Families up to 6
Summary: A well managed place, clean in good repair and up to date. The Doubletree Suites in Anaheim has great rooms for up to 6 people. Our stay was very pleasant except the open non closeable doublesink area infront of the bathroom, which is a privacy issue. Somebody sitting on the sofabed can watch you. Otherwise great room, with a wonderful really quiet ac/heater unit and two televisions. Disneyland Shuttles are provided, you can walk but it is a stretch since you probably walk all day long in the parks. There is a very nice italian restaurant and a snack place inside the hotel.

Booked a 4 night stay with this hotel for business. Location was perfect. We were able to enjoy Disneyland for the entire day because it was so close to the hotel and convention center. We didn't feel the need for a car- the hotel was around plenty of restaurants and stores to keep us entertained. We walked everywhere (2 adults in decent shape -- it was an enjoyable walk).   The staff was great and extremely helpful. I believe his name was Gary, at the concierge was more than helpful. He suggested a fun night tour of LA / Hollywood that provided transportation from the hotel. It was perfect for our needs (limited time at night wanted to sight see as much as we could while on business).  Room Service was fast and prompt. Food quality was good. Ate breakfast in the restaurant

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay for the theme parks
Summary: As part of our honeymoon we spent three nights at the double tree in anahiem.  The hotel is within walking distance to disney land and the concierge organised our pick up and return trips to Universal studios and you can even purchase your tickets for Disneyland at the hotel.  Our days were very busy with Disneyland, Universal studios, and the Citidel Outlet Mall so we really only slept at the hotel as we were stuffed.  The room was very comfortable and a decent size.  The TV was large and a good range of channels.  The bathroom was fantastic and the bed was massive.  It is easily the best bed I've slept in and I had amazing sleeps.  If you want somewhere to base yourself while visiting Disneyland/california Adventure Park you can't go past the doubletree.  It is of the highest

We stayed at the Doubletree for our very first Disneyland vacation this year and it was a perfect location. We took the shuttle to the parks each day, which travel approximately every 20-30 mintutes to and from the park. You can walk from the hotel to the park, however we found it would have been too far with young children. The breakfast buffet each morning was fresh and delicious with nice variety. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. It was great to have the suite with a separate bedroom for comfort. Great stay!

I traveled here with my daughter and her 2 children over Easter week.  Our room was ready upon our arrival even though it was before the check-in time which was a big plus for us.  At check-in the clerk gave us 2 additional certificates for the buffet breakfast although we had only paid for 2 on our room rate.  Our room was very clean and comfortable and enjoyed our 3 night stay.  The breakfast buffet was outstanding, the best I ever experienced in my travels.  We were offered items from the kitchen as well as the buffet, everything was replenished on the buffet in a very timely manner.  The bus that took us to the park was at the entrance to the driveway and was easy to manage with 2 small children.  Advice buy the bus pass at the front desk to save some money.  We purchased

We stayed at this hotel for five days over the Easter long weekend. Everything about this hotel was terrific. Our room was ready even though we arrived early, and the room itself was spacious, comfortable and very clean and quiet. We didn't hear noise from the hallway or other rooms at all.  For a family of four the suite was perfect, with plenty of room for us to spread out. We were also able to let our youngest child settle down in bed while the rest of us stayed up later. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. We filled up at the breakfast buffet every morning before heading to Disneyland. It was very good - lots of selection, well prepared and served. The best part of our stay, though, was the staff. From the front desk to the wait staff and even housekeeping staff, everyone

The rooms were clean, quiet and well equiped. It is a bit of a walk to Disneyland, but not that bad. About 3 or 4 long blocks. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  We signed up for the daily breakfast buffet, and it was outstanding. Very fresh eggs, pancakes or waffles made to order; steel cut oatmeal, Greek or regular yogurt. fresh berries (strawberries and blueberries), plus all the usual pastries, bacon, sausage etc.  And the coffee was delicious! Better than Starbucks! Last but not least, don't forget the daily afternoon homemade cookies.

We recently stayed at the Doubletree Anaheim with 2 adults and 3 children under the age of 5.  Upon check-in, we were told that the website we used to book our suite, had actually booked us into a standard room with the option of either 1 king, or 2 doubles.  Since we have 3 small children, one of which is 9 months, we needed to have the one bedroom suite...for our own sanity as well as to abide by the fire regulation.  Although the weekend we booked was a very busy one for the hotel, the front desk staff moved many things/people around so that they could accommodate all of us.  It looked like it was a lot of work, but they did it and they also handed us the most delicious warm chocolate chip cookies, which my children devoured.   When we got into the hotel room, it was

My family and I recently stayed at this property for 2 nights while in Anaheim to visit Disneyland and CA Adventure.  While the property wasn't really close enough to walk, they do offer a reasonably priced shuttle.  We opted to take a cab which ran us about $7-$8 each way.  The bar/lounge area was very nice with great food! We were shocked at how good the food was.  I highly recommend the quesadilla.  The hotel staff at the front desk and in the lounge were very nice and extremely helpful.  Our room was on the 7th floor and was a suite with a living area and bedroom. Was very nice to have the extra space.  We were also close to the laundry facilities which was very nice since I had clothes to wash. I would definitely stay at this property again if in Anaheim.  Property also has

Summary Heading: Fantastic! Perfect location and 1st class service from all staff.
Summary: I am still staggered at how little this hotel cost me. My family stayed for 5 nights while on holiday and from the moment we arrived all of our needs where attended to instantly and in some cases before we even new we had a need. Hot cookie on check in, love it!  Without doubt this chain sets the benchmark fro mid priced hotels and I only wish European hotels took note of how service should be.  Thankyou Doubletree.

Summary Heading: Not close enough to Convention Center, Rude staff
Summary: This hotel does not make it convenient for you to walk to Convention Center. We actually ended up walking through the Courtyard next door cause they had a sidewalk with access to the Convention Center. No shuttle service to Disney or Convention Center. Breakfast was good but expensive. Front desk staff was very rude and not helpful. Our first day they told us we could go through the back by the parking lot since it was raining. When my 3 children arrived at the back doors in the pouring rain, the housekeeping staff stared at them and sent them away. I would have unloaded in the front if I knew they weren't going to let us in. The second day we had our Do Not Disturb sign up because we had left things in the room, they still came in. My debit card on file was also charged $400

Summary Heading: very quiet,request was honored for room location,long walk to Disney
Summary: spacious room,missed having no breakfast included. The two TV's were conviently located-loved the safe in the closet. great accomadations except the coffee pot did not work,we only had one coffee drinker so he went downstairs and bought starbucks-again missed not having the breakfast!  Everything else was super,felt very private.

After my stay here at the Doubletree Anaheim Resort Guest Suites I am actually wishing I didn't have to leave.  It didn't matter that I hadn't been able to leave the facility because of all the rehearsals I had been involved with as a contestant for the Ms America Pageant finals for four days straight--coming into the lounge to see Norma was the icing at the end of my day!  She was the BEST! Always with a smile and a joke (or a laugh at my silly ones) she exemplified what I came to understand as Doubletree's standard: the highest in customer service, a lost art in this country it seems.  Thanks Doubdletree!  Jami Michael Ms. Western States America 2012

Summary Heading: Everything was great, except checking in.
Summary: One of the staff members was EXTREMELY rude. Other than that, great stay!

Stayed here for 2 nights for our Disneyland trip. This hotel is recommended for families. There is a small living room with big flat screen TV. This hotel is comparable to other namebrand hotels as far as cleanliness, room size, and linens. There are hundreds of hotels around Disneyland but Doubletree made our stay very comfotable. Oopsss. There is one bad bad thing. When you check in, you need to pay for daily parking. Its $14 per day per car. They will give you a parking card and you need to insert that to the reader everytime you go in and out of parking area. AND they will charge you $2 per swipe. So if you go out 5 times, its $10 extra charge to your bill. So next time, you may want to leave your car and just take a walk to nearby area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about our hotel ,and I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. Relative to the parking, you should not have been charged an additional $2 everytime you swiped your card. The dailey fee allows you to come and go as many times as you would like. Hope we get to serve you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for trip to Disney Anaheim
Summary: Have stayed here a number of times when coming to Disney with our family.  The hotel is well priced and well maintained.  The suite style rooms are spacious, and the staff is gracious , attentive and friendly. We have always had great experiences here with our family of 4.  Love the fresh baked chocolate chip cookies too! Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: One of the best choices near the 'Happiest place on Earth'
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights at the tail end of the Holidays this year.  One thing that set it apart for me is the fact that they have reasonably priced suites.  Putting the kids in one room while being able to converse normally in the next is pure gold.  The fact that this facility is quite new compared to its neighbors is also very appealing.  The rooms themselves are very modern, comfortable, well appointed and well sound proofed.  Beds were very comfortable.  A short bus ride down to Disneyland could be walked, but given all the walking you'll do in the park, you probably will be happier with the bus :-)  If you are attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center, it is also an easy walk.  I will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families yet focused on pleasing corporate groups over regular young families
Summary: We have been regular guests at this hotel for the past three years staying at least once or sometimes twice a month to enjoy Disney. We decided to book a longer stay for 4 nights with our 4 year old. We checked in on a Wednesday and received one of the smallest rooms with the couch bed practically touching the other side of the room. So narrow and not even centered to watch TV. Front Desk could not help us saying they were saving other rooms for a group. This was not the way to treat regular guests. Would not recommend Room 405 to those who need the space for their kids. Awful and narrower than others. Hotel is overall well kept and staff are friendly. I was disappointed that new logo equals catering to corporates over the needs of families with young kids visiting Disneyland

Summary Heading: A comparison between DoubleTree and Embassy Suites
Summary: We just stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Disneyland with my 2 and 5.5 year old. We are die-hard Embassy Suite fans, but for a change, we decided to give Doubletree a try for this vacation. I have been pretty happy with this hotel so far. There are pros and cons to the two, and it's a matter of preference, but just to help other people who are choosing between the two, here's a detailed comparison.  - The Doubletree tries to appeal to both corporate clients and families. The lobby is grand, spacious and beautiful, but the aesthetic of it, and of the rooms in general, caters to the business traveler. There is no beautiful atrium with koi fish, waterfalls, glass elevators or an arcade downstairs. My son's first reaction was "I like the other hotel better because it has a

Summary Heading: Great value, nice, clean, good for families
