Summary: Stayed here as a base for Disney, had a 2 Queen suite, great for families, Disney $6 in a cab, orange county outlet $11, great clean hotel, nice rooms, views of fireworks if requested, laundry facilities, would recommend for a family, especially after those long days at the park, staff were lovely and very helpful, buffet breakfast was included, if you get a good deal, would highly recommend, even if you are only there to sleep! Free wifi Hilton honors

Summary Heading: Super comfortable and convenient for a three-day Disneyland stay
Summary: Room was great with a very comfortable bed.  Bathroom was clean and shower tub was great for my family, which includes a 2 yo.  Parking was available after long nights at the park. The downstairs cafe was just as good as Starbucks for a pre-park espresso drink.  Free ATT wifi (or included with resort fee, not sure) that was easy to log into and fast.  Hotel guest services were great and fast to respond.  Target was the next block over for last minute necessities, as well as a carl's jr that was open late (if not 24hrs).  We parked at the Toy Story lot less than two blocks away. The shuttle buses from that lot to the park are big transit buses, great for transporting strollers (still have to fold them) but roomier, faster and easier to load in and out of compared to the trams

This property is clean, beautiful and tastefully appointed, a welcome relief after a series of down-at-heel hotels in the area.  The photographs actually don't do it justice!  While appropriate for families, it's still a lovely spot for a romantic weekend.  We were visiting family in Orange, not Disneyland, but we still chose this hotel because we can depend on a good experience from big, QUIET rooms to competent staff to a really excellent breakfast.  While I'm not crazy about the parking charge, I can't think of anything else that I don't like about this hotel.  I'm done trying to find someplace decent in Orange, I'm sticking with this DoubleTree!

Wonderful hotel, from the beautiful lobby to the large suites.  We stayed here while visiting DisneyLand and loved this hotel. There was a shuttle which took at most 5 minutes to get to Disney right at the hotel driveway, which was easy. My kids enjoyed the hot tub and we ate breakfast at the resaturant which was great. There were 2 flat screen tv's which always helps to divide up the kids and the room had plenty of space. If you don't like to add more walking to your vacation ask for a room near the elevator.  Tip- We went to Disneyland on a monday and we heard it is their busiest day of the week, ugh. They said Sunday and Tuesday are the least busy, wish I had done my homework better, it was mobed.

We spent just one night at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim in conjunction with our trip to Disneyland.  We were impressed from the moment we walked in.  We had a one bedroom suite, and I was impressed with layout, size, decor and cleanliness.  We enjoyed a late night trip to the pool & spa, and appreciated that only the lights in the pool area went out at 10pm and the staff didn't kick us out (there were 3 or 4 families at the pool, as well).  Location was very convenient to Disneyland.  Would definitely return!
Saff was nice, rooms were clean nd fairly quiet.  This was our 2nd Year at this hotel the kids like the pool.  We like the size of the rooms.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Four adults and 1 five year old shared a two room suite which featured 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed. We're there for a 2 night three day stay to visit Disneyland. The room was clean well appointed after visiting D-land all day we'd hit the beds and pass out. The suite was an excellent value and recommend hotel for family travel.

A very decent hotel but average rooms.  The hotel's staff are professional and courteous, freshly baked CC cookies are awesome, std room (king) was plain, a bit musty (only noticable for the first few minutes upon entering the room) and tight, the all you can eat breakfast (kids are free) is excellent, the gym and pool are small, Disney center just off the lobby makes it easy to get Disney passes, the walk from the hotel to the entrance to the Disney theme parks is too long -- we did the walk with our 9 y/o daughter and it took about 30 minutes to reach the Disney security check point walking at a brisk pace (the Sheraton is about 10 minutes closer).

For under $150 we were able to stay in a suite as a family of 6.  The rooms are luxuriously appointed, impeccably clean, and the hotel is very sound proof (unlike most all other hotels in the area where we have stayed). Food in the restaurant was excellent:  very copious and inventive breakfast and much better quality than the usual buffet.  Everyone from the servers, to the front desk, to housekeeping was very accommodating.  We could not be more pleased!

We stayed 5 nights at the Doubletree for our Disneyland vacation. We were really pleased with the whole experience. The room was so spacious which was very welcome when staying that many nights in one place. Plenty of room for my husband and 3 boys. Two tvs was great for the boys, there was a desk where we set up our laptop with complimentary wireless. My husband needed to print some coupons for us to use at Disneyland and the business center was easy to use and no additional charge for printing. The beds were so comfortable. We have a memory foam mattress at home and sometimes find conventional mattresses uncomfortable, but these were great! House keeping did a fantastic job! With 5 of us in the room and often times eating breakfast and snacks in the room, it could get

Summary Heading: Great Value for Family of Five
Summary: My husband, myself, our son of 9 years, our Rotary exchange student and her friend from High School 16 and 17, drove from Vancouver, BC Canada to Palm Springs, then to Anaheim for Disneyland before we drove back home. I booked the Doubletree about 8 months in advance and got a great deal with parking included. When we arrived at the Doubletree in Anaheim I was not expecting much as last time I stayed in a hotel near Disneyland it was an old motel that was updated but smelled of the 70s, cost a lot of money but was run down, not very clean. I guess i expected more of the same, but when we arrived the Doubletree had that Hilton feel to it, much better quality and more of what I was use to when travelling for business.We picked the hotel because it had a one bedroom suite with two

This a wonderful family friendly hotel. The hotel is well kept and the staff was always very helpful. Agios has great food and servie, the prices are good as well. Definitely will stay here again on our next trip to Disney Land.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, lack of food variety though
Summary: PRO: very good and helpful staff, good cleanliness, good hotel facilities. They provide free internet access (awesome!). oh, they gave awesome cookies during check in!!!  CONS: breakfast meal variety is very limited. Parking fee is USD 16.
Manager Response: Thank you for recognizing our great staff and  the free wireless internet . That is something  we recently introduced due to popular demand. As for our breakfast variety, I am sorry that you found it deficient. Perhaps you could share with me where we could improve. In addition to fresh pancakes, two egg dishes, breakfast meats, potato dish, fresh fruits, juices, yogurts, home backed muffins, etc, I thought we had covered all the bases. I can be reached at 714-383-7016 and would enjoy speaking with you. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for three nights in February.  It is by far the nicest Anaheim hotel we have stayed at.  The room was large, well equipped and very clean.   Our coffee machine broke down but was replaced by a brand new fresh-out-the-box unit within 20 minutes. Very impressed.  The pool area was nice, although in shade all of the day (perhaps this changes in summer months).  The pool and lobby are the only places we managed to log on to the free wi-fi but it worked fine (no point in paying for in-room use, as it should really be free throughout, having free areas and charged area makes them seem miserly).  It’s a comfortable 4 block walk to Disney. You can save yourself time by picking up tickets from the Official Visitor Centre which is located within this hotel. We checked, and

The Doubletree was a pleasant retreat in the busy Disney resort zone. The staff were helpful and polite at check in and gave us a free upgrade to a large suite. Our room was spacious, quiet and very clean. The beds were comfy and there were plenty of pillows. We had a great view facing Disney and saw the fireworks from our room each night of our stay. The room service breakfast was prompt, hot, delicious and generous. It was very well priced to boot. The hotel restaurant was surprisingly good as well. There is a Disney welcome center in the hotel which made ticket purchasing easy as there was no line. A local shuttle service to the  parks stops right at the hotel entrance which was convenient as well. The only drawback was the pool on site. It was very small. Other than that, it

Summary Heading: EVERYONE smile when we passed and said good morning.
Summary: I stayed there based on tripadvisor ratings and WAS NOT disappointed. The staff  - from the front desk - to maid service - the the lounge for breakfast was perfect.  Beds were comfortable.  I travel a lot, and this was a wonderful family experience

The staff was friendly and spoke English : ) Beautiful lobby, large rooms. Everyone from the bell hop to concierge to front desk personnel were helpful. They do charge to park in their parking lot, something that we feel is a complete rip-off, but that is the trend around Anaheim/Disneyland. I miss the good old days of free parking and free shuttles to and from the park!

Summary Heading: Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim
Summary: It is a friendly hotel. Walking distance to Anahein outlet stores
Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting some friends in Santa Ana last November. The hotel was very nice, room was very comfortable and service was great! I would stay here again if I'm in the area.
I loved the cookie and the customer service is the real reason for enjoying our stay.

Because of our last stay at Doubletree Modesto, our family of four, (2 young children) decided to book another Doubletree Hotel. Even though it is about a mile from Disneyland, we absolutely loved it!   When our family arrived at the hotel, we parked at guest parking, and the valet quickly asked us if we needed help with the baggage. We arrived an hour before check-in, and unfortunately, there were no rooms available, yet. The staff apologized, and we said it was fine. We kept ourselves busy at the Disney Welcome Center in the hotel. I loved how Doubletree has this place, because we were able to buy Disneyland Hopper Tickets at the hotel, at a discounted price, rather then buying it at Disneyland. The only issue we had was when we checked in, we asked if there was a room where

Had a good stay at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim. The service was good and the front desk staff were very helpful in organizing taxis and directing us to the shuttle buses to Disneyland.  The rooms were great. Clean, good view, sound proof, beds were very comfortable and we had 2 big screen TV's!! Restaurant food was very nice.  The only downside to this Hotel is the distance from Disneyland. We booked it thinking it was a "short walk" to the theme park but it wasn't really at all. It was at least a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. So it kind of forced you to buy the tickets on the shuttle bus. In saying that, the buses ran very frequently.  Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel and would definitely stay again.

I stay in SoCal many times a year and usually stay in Anaheim or San Diego. By Far, my favorite property on Harbor Blvd is the Doubletree. Good location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, and spacious quiet rooms. Since it's a bit more upscale, it's also not overrun with screaming kids like some of the other hotels on Harbor.  If the Anaheim Hilton and the Doubletree are exactly the same price, I would stay at the Doubletree, no question.
Room was big and clean the staff was lazy and not helpfull be aware of extra charges at check out.
Manager Response: Dear MR. S, I am sorry that you did not enjoy your stay but appreciate the comments. Since you had also filled out a Hilton survey we were able to review your reservation, to determine why you were not made aware of the extra charges [parking, resort fee and tax]. From what I can tell your confirmation noted the charges, so I am not sure why there was a misunderstanding. As to the staff, while I can assure you they are typically very helpful and friendly, I can only apologize if we dropped the ball at check-in. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for GOOD sleep after a long day at D-Land!
Summary: Perfect place to sleep and relax after long days at Disneyland and CAL. COMFY plush beds!!! Rooms were quiet!  Upgraded us to a bigger room/suite for no charge.  Staff was wonderful and attentive.  Dont be turned off by it being a couple blocks from the parks...after all that walking, I was happy to take a quick ART bus ride back to the hotel @$4 a day (unlimited rides)...of course you could walk, but why..close to other restaurants which also offset D-Land food costs. :) I will not think twice about not staying there again.

Summary Heading: Not worth your time or money.
Summary: I am a diamond member staying at least 70 nights a year, and this hotels staff is by far the worst. They never did anything they said they would do. No extra pillows towels, help with out bill...don't go

Summary Heading: Good quality family hotel on Anaheim's main strip
Summary: We stayed at this hotel whilst visiting Disneyland. We booked a suite with 2 queen beds in one room and a fold-out sofa in another, plus a portacot. The suite fitted our family of 5 very comfortably and allowed us to put the baby down for a sleep whilst still being able to watch TV. The furnishings were modern and in good condition, and the beds were very comfortable.  We appreciated being given warm cookies on arrival, but would have preferred to have been warned that they contained nuts (rather than finding out by accident). It wasn't a big deal (not an allergy issue), just one of taste preference. A nut-free alternative would be a nice option if possible, as the cookies looked and smelled delicious.  The location of the hotel was good for Disneyland, although it certainly

Summary Heading: Very comfortable efficient and friendly hotel.
Summary: Rooms great, location great. was in Anaheim for a business convention. very comfortable and friendly. free wifi in lobby excellent. only issue I would say was breakfast service was poor on the peak rush of first day of trade show - staff seemed totally unprepared. nothing major, just a slight blemish on what was otherwise an almost perfect stay.

Would have gotten five stars had the internet worked better. ATT internet is very bad at making first time connections.  Took about 30 min to get it to connect with my Lenovo laptop.  Don't have problems elsewhere except where a hotel uses ATT.  It's all about ATT, wise up Doubletree.

Summary Heading: One of the best ever of all Hilton family properites.
Summary: I am a Hilton Diamond member and this hotel ranks at the very top of all the Hilton family properties.  Every member of the staff was friendly and willing to answer questions and offer assistance.  The shuttle to Disneyland stops at the end of the driveway, thereby making it easy to get to Disneyland.  The rooms were immaculate and the housekeeping service was exceptional.  Our two room suite was spacious and comfortable. During our four-day stay, there were no hassles, complications, or problems with the hotel, bar or restaurant.  Because everyone was so accommodating, kind, and caring, this was one of our best hotel stays ever.  We would definitely stay at the hotel whenever we are in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Family friendly, all-suite hotel near Disneyland
Summary: We spent 4 days at the Doubletree Anaheim and couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. We always travel with our 5 year-old son, and as such prefer suite accommodations.   The Doubletree offers spacious, well appointed, and tastefully decorated rooms. Ours had 1 bedroom with a pull-out couch in the living room, where our son slept very comfortably. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, and there was a tub in the bathroom for my son's nightly bubble baths.  Their breakfast buffet is fantastic, and we ate there each morning prior to heading to Disneyland. We were so full from breakfast that we didn't get hungry until dinner time, so we didn't have to spend money on food at the park.  Service at the hotel and in its restaurants is excellent, and you can buy

Summary Heading: Terrific Hotel in a good location
Summary: Great hotel and doing the online prepay provided a real savings. We had a two room suite. It was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We ordered the room service breakfast the night before and it was on time and very good. When we come back to Anahiem this will definitetly be the place we stay and how could anyone pass up those amazing, warm, choclate chip cookies.

Summary Heading: This was a great hotel for our family trip to Disneyland.
Summary: This was a nice hotel the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  It's a little bit of a walk to Disneyland but I do believe there is a shuttle.  A very nice experience.

We don't live far but were attending an event and didn't want to drive home late and decided to stay  here. It is a very beautiful hotel that is basically next door to Disneyland, the convention center and Angel's stadium. The staff was very friendly and helpful.   Sometimes it is nice to unwind after a day but when you are with children you can't very well go relax in the lounge. My only complaint would be that their little gift shop where you can purchase beverages didn't carry any sort of beer or wine like many other places do.

Summary Heading: amazing - but a not a convenient walk
Summary: Love this property - staff, cleanliness, everything is beautiful.  Reasonably priced considering the brand.  It was however, a little bit of a walk to find local restaurants with reasonable prices or just a quick bite.  That is my only negative about this property, everything else was impecable.

We surprised our kids and went on a last minute trip to Disneyland. This was my 1st time staying at this hotel. When I checked into the hotel the man that was helping me was very nice and upgraded us to a suite without even me asking for an upgrade. Then he gave us all a warm chocolate chip cookie to eat. The room was very nice and very clean. One of the reasons why I picked this hotel was that they had a restaurant and the kids eat for free with a paying adult. It made it nice in the morning to go downstairs and eat breakfast before you went to Disneyland. The manager in the restaurant overheard my daughter asking me for watermelon and they didn't have any out with the other fruit. The manager surprised her and brought out a huge bowl of watermelon. You can either walk to

Summary Heading: One of the better convention hotels
Summary: I’ve been staying at this hotel for the last 4 years when I attend the NAMM show in Anaheim. Since my company books this room as a group reservation, my choice is limited to the two double queen suite, although I am the only occupant. I think the hotel only has a few King rooms, and they are not suites.  It’s a two room suite. 2 beds with a flat screen TV in one room, and in the other is a desk, a nice desk chair, comfy sitting chair, and couch (with pull-out bed). A mini-fridge, microwave and another flat screen TV. The bathroom is large – separate sink/dressing area, and then shower/tub/toilet with a door. I would imagine that if I were visiting Disneyland with a family, this would be an ideal set-up. For business, it’s great. As a Hilton Diamond member, I receive free high

Summary Heading: Great Family Place to Stay Near Disney
Summary: I stayed here one night with my son during a trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is located close to Disney (walking distance, but I recommend walking only to the parks because you'll be tired after all the activity at the theme parks).  I've stayed at several hotels in the Disney area and this is one of the better options.  I got an upgrade to a suite.  It was comfortable and very  nice for traveling with kids.  The beds are comfortable and the room was very dark and quiet.  In general, the service was excellent.  When I could not get the WiFi to work even when talking to their contracted IT help, the front desk called me back to see if there was anything they could do to help.  Also, my son was a little sick and I needed some Children's medicine.  The operator told me the gift shop

Great hotel, stayed there many times on family trips to Disneyland.  The suites are always clean, quiet and comfortable.  Perfect for taking your kids and a couple of their friends to the park.  Refrigerator and microwave are great.  Hotel is about two blocks from the Toy Story parking lot pickup and is an easy walk to the hotel, so there is really no need to pay to shuttle to, or park at Disneyland.  $14 a night parking is a bit excessive, but no different from anywhere else down there.  This is our fifth time staying there and we'll definitley be back.

Nice hotel, like the frig & microwave in the room.  You can walk to Disneyland but save your feet and talk to the front desk & get an all day pass for the bus, it's $4.00 well spent. Nice quiet, clean hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay - Near Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. The room was great. It was actually divided into 2 rooms. This was very nice since I was tired one night and went to bed early. My wife closed the doors to my room, went into the living room and watched TV there while lying on the sofa. It had a working area where I plugged my PC into. Since we are Gold members of Hilton Honors, the internet was free. We also received free breakfast while we were there. The buffet consisted of eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, potatoes, cerials, bakery goods, fruits, and juices. The orange juice is freshly squeezed each day and was very good. We also received free parking due to being a Gold member. If you are not, you'll have to pay $14 a day to park there. It is very

Summary Heading: Would have gotten 5 stars if not for the rudeness of front desk rep, Eileen Yara
Summary: This was my second stay at this particular hotel.  On both occasions i got 1 bedroom suites.  The suites are very clean, spacious, and comfortable, with no sign of wear n tear.  The location is within walking distance of Disneyland, but after a long day you can take a bus home (there is no hotel shuttle.)  There is also a Disney desk in the hotel (although opening hours and break times are random) so cross your fingers they are open and don't complain to staff if they are not.  Eileen Yara, a front desk rep, told me sarcastically 'so we should allow any of our employees lunch or bathroom breaks to cater to you,' when I suggested that they have predetermined working hours-I had waited over an hour in the lobby hoping  that it would open soon so my family could start their Disney
Manager Response: I am very sorry that one of our managers was less then  professional in their dealings with you.  Unfortunately we do not have complete control over the staffing of the Disney Center, as Disney leases the space from us. From time to time they may have a last minute replacement who  is not 100% familiar with all the procedures, and fails to put up the sign identifying when they are on a break. Of course this should be easy enough to explain and I am sorry if it was done in a sarcastic manner. I have already spoken to Eileen and she wishes to apologize.  Thank you for pointing this out, and we look forward to your next visit. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: My husband and 3 friends stayed here 1 night, while attending a hockey game at the Honda Center (not within walking distance!). There are several bars and restaurants close by.  The rooms are large, comfortable, but with dated decor. The balconies are large and a nice feature. The stay was pleasant, with the only negative experience being the morning service. Our friend was woken up at 7:30 with a staff member pounding on the door, and then slipping our bill under the door. Not sure why they felt they had to knock like that, but it woke everyone up. The rest of the staff was helpful, and check in/check out was painless. Parking was $11 a day (self park). Would stay here again, if in the area.

Summary Heading: DoubleTree Guest Suites Anaheim - LOVED IT!
Summary: Stayed at the DoubleTree Guest Suites Anaheim for 9 nights in December, 2011 (recommended by a friend who stayed there in 2007 and 2010).  Travelling with my 2 teenage daughters, we found the DoubleTree to be of excellent quality, service and was reasonably priced.  The staff were extremely knowledgeable and friendly and the overall styling, cleanliness and hotel facilities were great.  It was just a short bus trip to Disneyland and Gardenwalk area (ART buses coming every 20 mins) which was very convenient. Had beautiful buffet breakfast every morning which had a great range and service staff were very friendly and accommodating. Beds were very comfortable and rooms very spacious. Highly recommend this hotel as a good all-rounder and would definitely stay there again.

Great experience.  After reading some of the negatives, I wasn't sure that this was a good choice, but everyone can find fault if they look hard.    Pros:  safe area, 1.4 mile walk to gate of Disneyland (or small fee shuttle operated by Anaheim), very friendly staff, very clean, excellent management, new carpet in halls and new flat screen TVs (but no HD)  Cons:  Slight wear in the room on carpet edges and floorboards, fee for parking (gated and secure, though), fee for internet in room  One of our travel party had a need for a very clean environment due to a medical condition, and a manager named Eileen returned my call that inquired about possible special housekeeping prior to our arrival, then made a great plan with housekeeping to get the rooms impeccable.  This is a level
Manager Response: Thank you for saying so many nice things about our hotel and just wanted you to know that we will be receiving HD signals by the end of the month. Go Badgers!!

Summary: We've stayed here a few times and have never had a bad experience. We usually get the two room suite, which has a separate bedroom. Nice when the kids want to watch tv and parents need a nap after a day in the parks.   We've only eaten in the restaurant once for breakfast. It was a bit pricey and the buffet was a bit limited. That being said, the coffee was hot & strong and the food was tasty.   The rooms we've had have always been clean. We've yet to have a problem with noise in the hallways or from adjacent rooms. could be luck of the draw or could be good construction. Your mileage may vary as they say.   The staff has always been great. Help with a smile. There is a place to purchase Disney tickets in the lobby if you don't arrive with tickets in hand.

We spent 6 nights at this hotel in mid December and were very impressed with it. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a suite and were given warm cookies...both were a hit. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. (Jerry at the front desk was a personal favorite) The rooms are comfortable and clean and we enjoyed relaxing in the outdoor hot tub in the evenings while watching the kids swim. Our room faced Disney, so if we chose to stay in our room for the evening, we could watch Disneyland's fireworks from the room.  We often stopped by the concierge to get his advise on our plans and found him to be knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Warm, friendly service & our family of 5 had a wonderful Christmas experience!
Summary: Just returned from a much needed family trip to Anaheim & Disneyland. Yes, it was a very busy time to go but our stay at Doubletree was wonderful. We were checked in quickly (it was about 2pm) and our room was clean and ready for us. It was a good price and we were pleased with everything from the room to the location. We have stayed in hotels rated from 3 stars to 5+ stars and this hotel's service was one of the best we have experienced. We enjoyed the buffet EVERY morning. We did not have pre-paid vouchers included in our package but we still chose to eat there because the service was very friendly & the buffet had everything we could want for a reasonable price. Fresh fruit? Check. Bacon & sausage & eggs? Check. Starbucks coffee? Big CHECK! (needed that caffeine to keep up

This was our 1st time staying at the DoubleTree, and we were all very pleased. The kids really liked the free cookies too. Lol. The beds were comfy, as we always expect from the Hilton family of hotels. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly. The kids also enjoyed that there was a TV in the living area and a TV in the bedroom area. Rooms were spacious as well, and we are a family of 5.

Stayed here for two night on a brief Disneyland stopover with my wife and two teenage children.  We had two connecting rooms.  All in all, I think this is a terrific hotel.  It's never going to appear in "World's Most Luxurious Hotels" but it delivers on everything it promises.  The staff are friendly and efficient, everything was clean and comfortable, the rooms were a good size, and the included breakfast was very good with a wide variety of foods on offer.  The cookies we received on checking in were some of the most decadent choc chip cookies I've ever tasted - we loved them!  It's a mid-range walk to Disneyland (about 15-20 minutes) but there's an Anaheim bus you can catch for $4 a day if you don't want to walk.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel as a base for a Disney

This Doubletree Suites has a desirable set of features for families visiting Disneyland.  The location on Harbor Blvd. is close enough for the energetic to walk to Disneyland (we did on our first morning) but it is also on the Anaheim Resort Transit route and easy to ride the shuttle when your feet are tired.  There is plenty of parking for your car at the hotel (yes, they do charge but so do all the other hotels).  You will pay to park your car at Disneyland and you will still have to ride a Disney shuttle and be just as far away from the Parks.  The suites are great.  Our suite was in very good condition so it must have been renovated recently, given the abuse most Disney area hotel rooms endure.  Our room had a bedroom with two queen beds and a flat screen TV.  Closet space

Summary Heading: Fresh cookies, comfy beds, great location.
Summary: We recieved this room after being overbooked at a similar hotel. Check in was fast, lobby is large with couches and attached bar. Room was so comfortable with a great view. Walking distance to Disney. Staff was really helpful and stored our luggage after we checked out.

Summary Heading: Not within a bullsroar of a Hilton!!!
Summary: I have stayed at many Hilton Hotels throughout the world and also where possible we stay at Doubletree where a Hilton Hotel is not available.  The location of this Hotel to Disneyland and the Adventure Park is excellent with a small two block walk which wont hurt anyone and is a great walk both of a morning and of an evening back along the well lit streets framed with all of the trees adorned in Christmas Lights.   The Hotel itself is modern enough however cleanliness is not in the top 10 of things that the management appears to focus on. We had two suites which were not cleaned properly at all.   On Day 2 of our stay one of the teenagers dropped his wallet and when he bent down to pick it up foundf half a Wizz bin full of crap bene4ath the bed. Two empty juice containers, three
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I have been waiting to hear back from you  before responding  as I was hoping you would tell me that he had the wrong hotel, but no such luck.  There is no excuse for the debris under the bed and we have spoken with the entire housekeeping department about this , and are using it as a learning moment.  I am sorry that breakfast did not appeal to you, but am happy to hear that you enjoyed your dinner experience.  As for the incident with the Concierge, I would like to think that there is an explaination for what transpired, however I wasn't there and I have never received a similar complaint. What I do know is that the Concierge/Bellmen are required to collect a nominal deposit [$4] from certain transportation and attraction vendors. The $45 cost of the lemo seems about right, and a $400 per day cost seems reasonable, assuming you wanted him to wait all day whily you were shopping?? Sound like there may have been a missunderstanding.  Irregardless, I want to apologize for not meeting your expectations, and wish you and your family a Happy New Year.  Respectfully,  Jeff Morse

Summary: I picked this hotel due to its high ranking on TripAdvisor and I must say I was a little let down. If your a family that is there for Disney its a great place but they do have some issues. I stayed in room 639 a corner room and it was smaller then I expected. Even my guests all remarked at how small the room really was. Then there is the parking! If you have guests over to visit or join you for a drink make sure they park only in areas where it says "Guest Drop Off". Because if you take a ticket from the machine and park in normal guest parking you will be hit by some really outrageous fees.   I had a friend come to visit and we spent 70 dollars at the bar drinking and taking and he was still charged 14 dollars for 3hrs of parking. It was going to be 19 but the night manager

Summary Heading: Good For Business & Good For Sightseeing
Summary: Had previously been unfavorable of Los Angles from a business trip a few years back to Pasadena, but Anaheim is a totally different story.  Excellent area for business and play (Disney, Angeles Stadium, hockey, etc).  Very impressed, and plan to return for vacation

Here for a conference.  The Doubletree was a great stay. Had the amenities I like; separate bedroom, frig, microwave, great bed and pillows, quiet, etc.  I had a corner room with a lot of natural light but it also came with a lot of traffic noise (day and night).  I would rather stay at a hotel with a little more room and have to walk than at a "conference" hotel next to a convention center in an over priced box.  Very clean and not worn.  Staff was pleasant and helpful. The walk to the convention center is about 10 mins and in CA weather was very nice.  My only complaints were the extra charges for parking and the internet-but that's Anaheim area!  Cookies were a bonus.

This was my third time staying here.  I love this place, the staff is friendly and the rooms are great.  This time we spent 3 days there, the rooms are large, a separate living room and bedroom so you feel like you're coming back to an apartment, not a cramped hotel room.  We spend our time at Disneyland and took a bus back and forth to the park.  When we checked it we received a 6th floor room and were able to view the fireworks at the park when we came back early to our room one night.  It's always very quiet which is amazing at how busy it can be there sometimes.  I will keep coming back and I recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Stayed during Thanksgiving.  Had 2 queen suite and pull out sofa for my family.  Rooms were very quite, nice accomodations.  Less expensive than other alternatives, but parking gets you.  Previously stayed at Candy cane, which have smaller rooms.  Main benefit there is the shuttle.  I would definately come back next time for this Disneyland trip.   Stayed at Grand California prior with young toddlers, recommended then or for first timers.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, bad customer service experience
Summary: First of all this is a beautiful property, very nice location close to Disneyland and the Convention Center. I was here for business three nights. The check in process was terrific, great friendly faces at check in and warm cookie. The room was excellent very clean and big. The hallway was very quiet, more than I expected and the bed is like sleeping on a cloud... For breakfast I went downstairs to the restaurant, very nice buffet with a variety of hot and cold foods for a reasonable price. The waitress was very sweet and kept checking on me making sure I was doing fine, she even offered a coffee to go! The business center was very nice, got to print all my papers before heading to my meeting. The souvinear shop was also very nice stocked with everything you could think of at at
Manager Response: Dear Erick N, Thank you for saying so many nice things about the hotel; it's just unfortunate that you had a bad experience with room service. While we have many bilingual employees, we only have those that speak conversational english in guest contact positions. Sometimes however, an employee who doesn't understand a question will be embarrased and just nod, rather then say they don't understand.  In any case, there is no excuse for being rude and thats out of character for our people. We will be reviewing your comments with the staff in an effort at improving our service. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for a conference recently and it was delightful. The suites are large and clean and the bedrooms are very comfortable. Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk away so it's an ideal location and would make a nice family hotel.  Staff were very helpful. The internet cost at $10/day is too expensive so use the business centre and save some money. Buffet breakfast is a steal at $12.

Gorgeous room and extremely clean. The staff is incredible and eager to help. We really enjoyed our stay and cannot recommend this hotel enough. We called downstairs and told them our hairdryer was not working right. They promptly took care of it. That was the only issue we had.  Visiting Anaheim? This hotel is a must!

Located less than a mile from the entrance to Disney land, this hotel has suites that could easily fit most families.  Watch out, they charge for parking and there aren't really any other options nearby.  One nice thing is that they are next to Ruth Chris Steak House (if you can afford it).  I stayed the week before Thanksgiving so it was the low season there and quite affordable.  I had breakfast in the restaurant and, as you might expect, it was a bit expensive.  But right across the street is a Denny's.  There is a Disney shuttle stop right outside the hotel.  The rooms were clean and the bed was fine.  Basically, I had no complaints.

Room was comfortable and clean, lighting was terrible, made it very difficult to see what you were doing.  The bedroom had one single lamp which was on a wall switch and a switch on the lamp so at night when you switched it off on the lamp you couldn't turn a light in the next evening.  The closet is in the corner behind a door and it was nearly impossible to see inside the closet, the bedrooms definitely requires an overhead light.  The living room area is a little small but will do.  The garbage cans are split in half, recycle on one side and garbage in the other but again because of the lighting you can't read which is which.  The beds are comfortable, there are no robes in the room so be prepared to bring your own.  The shower pressure isn't the greatest but the hot water is

Smaller hotel with very personal service.  I felt like I personally knew everyone when I left, and that they knew me.  Restauraunt food was delicious and the service was exceptional!  Rooms were clean, comfortable beds, living room seperate from bedroom so great for familys-not everyone has to stay up or get up at the same time!  Easy walking to the conference centre, Disneyland, Downtown Disney, nearby shopping and I felt safe walking even at night.

I was in the area on business but wanted to be close to a few local attractions. This Hotel was great - rooms were awesome - very comfortable and clean. Only ate a couple of times there but breakfast and dinner menu  was very good. Can't fault the service of the waitresses - one lass in the morning was exceptional (wish I could remember her name). Would love to return and bring the family with me as so close to all the fun stuff as well. Many thanks to the concierge - very helpful and friendly. Front desk staff - was service with a smile!

Was in Anaheim for a convention and was very happy with the Doubletree- very friendly front desk staff at check in and through out our 4 night stay. The room was very comfortable and quiet- great bed, large lcd tv and a good desk with ethernet connection and wi-fi. Bathroom was nicely appointed but a little small and the tub was very shallow- either a walk-in shower or a deeper soaking tub would have been better. My room had one king bed, bar fridge & microwave. Room was very well cleaned each day. Easy parking but there was a fee. Didn't use the pool. Ate in the Restaurant one night and no complaints from my group of 6.  One member of my group couldn't get enough cookies and I thought that the front desk staff were very accommodating. Easy 10 minute walk to the Convention

Everything about this hotel is nice - they charge for parking and Internet - but they gave me free net due to Hilton Honors membership. Parking was $14.  The room was only $99 so it wasn't a big deal.  I was here for work, not Diisney.  The room was big and spacious.  The buffet - not too good for $14.  The Doubletree I stayed at the night before was less expensive for breakfast and it was a lot better breakfast.  When you pay $14, you should get an omelet - and not get your pancakes from a machine. All in all, this was a good hotel.

I was calling from Canada and after reading reviews for this hotel, thought we would like to stay here.  I needed specific info on the rooms as 3 beds were needed.  I called, was transferred, spoke to someone who put me on hold and never came back.  This is enough to make me look elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear Katsmeow, [I like the name] I am sorry that we missed the opportunity to serve you as I think you would have enjoyed the property. I am not sure what happened, but intend to review your comments with our reservation center as well as on property personnel. Thank you for bringing this to my attention, and I hope you will give us another chance. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Wow!  I'm not even sure where to begin.  There are only a few hotels that hit it out of the park, and this was definitely one of them.  We were pampered and fussed over from all the friendly and helpful staff from the moment we entered the lobby until we left.  Marcson at the front desk went over the top in meeting our every need.  He even remembered me later in the day when he saw me again in the lobby.  All staff we encountered asked how we were enjoying the hotel, our trip, etc.  The room was large, lovely, comfortable, and well appointed.  My only suggestion would be a small makeup mirror near the sink - but that's the only suggestion I could even think to make.  The breakfast was outstanding!!!  There were a few dishes that were so outstanding we want the recipe!  Again,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay. I will be sharing your comments with the staff and I know it will make them feel good. Have a great day and come back soon. regards, Jeff

Summary: I checked in on 10/26/2011 and checked out today 10/30/2011. The hotel is great. Clean, conveniently located and the staff is professional and friendly. Very convenient to Disneyland. I was especially happy with how quiet it was and how great and quickly the staff responded to requests. The rooms were spacious and the beds were super comfy. The rooms come with a separate living room and sleep area as well as a microwave and fridge. Its located right across from Denny's for convenient and affordable breakfasts. Target is just a couple of blocks away. Overall great experience and I will be back. The only con- you have to pay for parking.

Summary Heading: Stayed again but ditch the internet charge
Summary: So you know when you stay somewhere you liked a lot and you hope someday to make it back but are also worried it won't live up to your expectations when you do? How can they? Was it really that good or was it just because I was on vacation? Were those cookies really warm?   Well for my second stay at the doubletree I can say, it is still great even with the newness of novelty cookies worn off.   Service - all around excellent. Concierge helped up find shopping/directions. We got extra cookies when we asked. Front desk was always nice and attentive. Housekeeping was always thorough.   The beds are "like sleeping on a cloud" as another reviewer mentioned. Seriously I love sleeping here, it's so comfortable. The food was still good and the atmosphere still lively but quiet when you
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued support and kind words about the operation. As for the internet, we have just completed the installation of WIFI throughout the hotel and in the process more then doubled our bandwidth. Unfortunately, while you were here the city was hosting a convention of computer gamers [Blizzcon] and it seemed like every computer in Anaheim was running slower then usual.  As for the $10 charge, I know it's annoying and I know some of the independent hotels provide it free, however most if not all of the brand properties continue to charge. It's a source of revenue that’s hard to give up. I am sorry, and believe that sooner then later all hotels will be providing it free, but just not right now. Thanks again for your patronage, and we look forward to your next visit. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: My one night stay for business was great and I intend to book this hotel again for both business and pleasure.  All of the staff was very friendly and accommodating from the moment I checked in at the front desk and from when I ordered room service.  My room was comfortable and exactly what I had requested.  The bed was comfy, the room was quiet and clean.  Room service was great.  No complaints at all.  I stayed on the 4th floor in a room with a King bed.  Internet speed was fine and the room is equipped with a nice size TV.  The lobby to this hotel is also very pretty and clean.

Staff were friendly (warm cookies when you check in!). Room was nice, furnishings were in great to new condition. Basic amenities, including flat screen tv, mini fridge & coffee maker. View from 7th floor was nothing exciting, a view of the street. Pool & hot tub were okay, average size, outdoor, not busy. Self-parking a decent price. Close proximity to Disneyland, we took the shuttle which stops in front of the hotel (on the street).  No real complaints, only a minor issue of having to walk what feels like across the hotel to get to the ice machine. Other than that, no noise issues or problems with staff. I would stay here again & recommend it to friends.

We have visited this property twice with our adult children & grandchildren, and have another visit booked for Christmas Dec 2011.  We were able to connect a king suite with a one bedroom family suite which was excellent for all of us.   Grandma & Grandpa very much enjoyed visiting the Morten Steakhouse one night, and Ruth Chris another, which are practically next door. The hotel restaurant is very family friendly, and the staff was great with the kids.   The shuttle to Disneyland was a little slow at night, but it is quite walkable if you are not too exhausted.  The drop-off & pick-up spot at maingate is an excellent option if someone wants to tromp back to get the vehicle and fetch the rest of you.  Great choice if you like consistent quality and comfort.  From Calgary, but

I stayed here for four nights in the one bedroom suite with a view of the fireworks at Disney. The staff was SO nice, the room was beautiful. It was quiet, the beds were really, really comfortable and the location was great. I have no complaints!

The purpose of our stay was mainly to go to Disney Land before going to LA.  We only stayed one night and had a baby with us.  Area was safe and lots of resturants near by.  It had a clean hotel room with a comfortable bed.  Bathroom was clean. Tub area bit old but fine.  Hotel was extremely close to Disney Land.  Could walk there (hotel said it was a 10-15 min. walk and looked close when we drove) but since we had a baby, we drove.  You can pay for the hotel shuttle which is cheaper than parking but we didn't because of the baby.  You can also buy entrance tickets at a discount at the hotel.  Resturants looked nice but we didn't try it as it was a short stay and we chose to eat at Disney Land instead.  Have to pay a mandatory resort fee which includes use of internet and gym.

Summary Heading: Very nice Double Tree close to Disney
Summary: Spent two nights at this Double Tree.  This is my second stay in the last year.  This is a very well maintained property close to Disney - about a mile to the gates and parking.  Staff is professional and friendly.  The rooms are of a nice size with comfortable beds and good lighting.  The room had a nice flat screen tv.  Only negative are the shower stalls which are the pre-fab fiberglass type.  The roon was spotless.  The gym is more than a disappointment with only one treadmill and elliptical machine.  I would have thought hotel of this size would have more equipment.  There is a small pool and deck on the second floor.  We ate a couple of meals in the restaurant. Prices were relatively reasonable for a hotel.  They do take into account that many families stay here - kids eat

New, very comfortable and with a very good cost... this hotel for me reinforced the view I have from teh chain - reliable, cost efficient, comfortable and effcient. Check in process was effcient, room was new and always clean. Convient parking right in front of the hotel. 15 min walking to Disneyland parks - but not far from Disney´s own parking, so although it´s not the closest option, for me it´s my pick.

We had booked to stay in a vacation villa in Anaheim, which turned out to be a complete nightmare, so we went to talk to the people at Double Tree after reading the excellent reviews. We were not disappointed - the customer service at this hotel is absolutely awesome. They were very understanding about our nightmare scenario, and checked us in straight after breakfast. They even cooked food every day for my one year old that we could take with us during our days out. Christina, the restaurant manager, was so very helpful and keen to provide exactly what we needed. I would, without hesitation, recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.  Some "higher starred" hotels could learn about customer service from this hotel. Just fantastic - thank you so much.

Pros: - Rooms are SUPER clean - Toiletries are good quality, Neutrogena - Bed is like sleeping on a cloud, most comfy bed ever  Cons: - Hotel is very far from the parks, in my opinion. My friend and I dreaded the two mile hike back every night when we'd already exhausted ourselves trotting around all day. You can drive and park at Disney ($14 for parking there, $ for parking at Doubletree) or take the shuttle. Only, with the shuttle, you are at the far end of the route so you'll be waiting 20 minutes or more as the bus picks up guests from other hotels, cutting down on park time. Nooo!  - I wish I'd gotten this front desk rep's name because he was a really awful customer service rep. I asked him if it was possible to get another cookie (thinking if they sold them in tins, I'd
Manager Response: Dear Josephine, I am so sorry that you were embarrassed by one of our front desk emoloyees, as there is no excuse for that kind of behavior. While it's true most of our cookies are given out at check-in, we will gladly provide additional cookies, and do so all the time. "Someone must have been having a bad day" and as a result I will be sharing your comments with the staff to ensure that this does not happen again.  As for the distance to the park, I know it must have felt like two miles, but it's actually one; however who's counting when you are tired.  Once again I want to apologize for a less then perfect stay, and hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of service.  Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary: I had never stayed at a Doubletree Hotel and didn't know what to expect.  Excellant service at the front desk and the room was wonderful.  I'm a "hotel snob" in the business so I'm very particular and would highly recommend this property. The line to check in was long due to the convention in town and the front desk staff with big smiles on their faces passed out bottled water and cookies to make our wait more pleasant.  I can guarantee that the next time I'm in the area, I will stay here.

I was disappointed by a lack of wireless internet access as this was a business trip. The other item was my room was not recently cleaned. The location was good and rooms were reasonably sized. Probably good for the family visiting Disney less so for the business traveler expecting modern facilities.
Manager Response: I understand your frustration with the lack of wireless service in the guestrooms. I wish we had installed it prior to opening, however I am happy to report that it is going in as we speak. Hopefully you will give us another opportunity to serve you, as we have a growing number of business travellers who like the property, when compared to the larger Convention hotels. Respectfully, Jeff morser

Summary: Enjoyed the stay in this hotel.  The suite was convenient and the location was perfect.  Very close to restaurants and the business center in Orange, CA.  I'll definitely be back for business and may bring my family next time--right across Disneyland.

We stayed here for the Disneyland Half Marathon & were so pleased with the hotel.  The price was great (under $130 for Labor Day weekend), the hotel is clean, modern and very quiet, and it is in a great location.  Breakfast is included; the buffet is 1000 times better than what you find at typical free hotel buffets.  Parking is a bit pricey ($15/day), but that seems to be commiserate with the other hotels in the area.  I'd definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best place I've stayed near Disneyland
Summary: I'm not willing to pay the price to stay at the Disney properties, but enjoy a bit more than a motel style place to stay in the area.  The Doubletree Suites fits the bill.  Definitely more luxurious than comparably priced places just a bit closer to Disneyland.  And the room was spacious, nicely furnished. We had 2 q's in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room.  2 TV's, a small frig, microwave. The rates don't include breakfast, parking or a free shuttle, unless you get a package.  However, once parking is paid , your car can stay  all day, even if you check out.  The pool area was fairly nice and open early enough for a quick swim before the family got up.  The hotel has a Disney concierege, so it's easy to get schedules, info, etc.  I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good experience, would go back again!
Summary: This hotel is a few blocks from the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks.  There is the ART shuttle that takes passengers to the park leaving every 20 minutes.  It is best to buy an all day pass at the front desk as needed.  This came in handy going to watch the fireworks later in the evening at Disneyland.    The hotel itself was very comfortable and the layout of the suites was just perfect for us a family of 6.  There are 2 rooms with the room with the queen beds completely closed off if wished by 2 heavy doors.  The beds are the best this side of heaven!  Thank you for that Doubletree.  Of course, the complementary cookies are a nice welcoming gift especially for the children.  The rooms were clean, the bathroom spotless.  We did order pizza for room service

When I called to book the room, they told me the parking was free. When we checked out they charged us for parking. I don't mind paying for parking but I don't appreciate being lied to. As well it wasn't very clean and the furniture was very old and dirty! They also charged us a resort assessment fee of $6 per night. They had alot of surprise charges that they tacked onto our bill! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone!! on top of that they also told Me that Disney was directly across the street from them.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you were given so much wrong information about the hotel, and I can appreciate your frustration. I am not sure what to say as I would hope all of our employees realize that we are one mile from the entrance to Disney and that we do charge a Resort fee as well as for parking. Since most of our reservations go thru a centralized system, perhaps someone not familiar with the property, misrepresented the facts. Rest assured that it was not intentional. I am also sorry that you felt the hotel was dirty. We place great emphasis on cleanliness, and I am happy to report that in the past month we have renovated the restaurant, bar and guest corridors.  Thank you for sharing your observations, and hopefully we will have another opportunity to serve you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: After several stops on our tour of california when we all had to share one room, it was a delight to have a reasonably priced suite so our 11 year old could go to bed at a sensible time for her and we could relax a little. Standard of accommodation was good, though they could have made some changing facilities available at the pool. This cauht us out and we had to change in the toilets then drip over the floor on the way back to the room.  Paid a little extra for top floor but it was worth it not to have noisy guests above (as we hd done in other hotels). Views of Disney fireworks from top floor lift lobby were excellent.

We ended up staying here for two nights when we took a trip to Disneyland and had a pretty good experience with it.  The hotel room was clean, and the front desk was very friendly.  We really only slept in the room, as we were gone all day, but the bed was comfortable.  Our room had a microwave and fridge, which we didn't end up using, but nice to know it was there if we needed it.    We knew about the parking fees when we got there, so that wasn't a problem for us.  Would have been nice if they had free wireless, but like I said before, we were only there to sleep so that really didn't really matter.  We had free breakfast, I never tried it, but my fiance did and he said it was good.  I would definitely stay here again, it was a good value for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write Trip Advisor, and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay.  You will be happy to know that we are in the process of installing WIFI in all the guestrooms and should be completed by the middle of October. We have also installed new carpeting in the corridors, and they look great. Come back soon. Regards, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for a 3 day Disney trip, we had the two room suite, and it was amazing!  Very comfortable - we were 2 adults and 3 kids, and both rooms had their own TV, very clean hotel, breakfast was amazing!  Very friendly staff!   We will be back again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel and amazing sleep in those beds!
Summary: A great hotel for visiting Disney and everything within a 15 minute walk.   The breakfast buffet is good for a long day in the parks and the hotel is good value for money.

We had an overall good 4-night stay at the Doubletree while visiting the Disney parks with our kids. We wanted to stay closer to the park, but we traded that convenience for a quieter hotel (much needed after the noise and crowds at Disney) and a larger room to stretch out in.  We had a one bedroom suite at the Doubletree with a separate living area. We paid $120/night, which was less than the regular-size room we were going to book across the street from Disney.    Pros: Friendly/helpful staff, cozy pillows and beds, great housekeeping (to my kids delight one day the housekeeper had arranged their stuffed animals in cute poses on the beds), kids eat free.   Cons: The hotel pool was small and crowded.  One night a car alarm in the parking lot went off four times and while this

Summary Heading: Great value, large rooms and close to Disneyland.
Summary: We loved the large room with 2Queen beds, comfy mattresses, down comforters and pillows. The bathroom is large as well, and everything was very clean and nice. The outdoor pool on the second floor is nice and you can see the fireworks from Disney, a great surprise!  The staff at the front desk, the bar, and the restaurant were friendly and very accommodating. The hotel is very close to the Disneyland entrance and there are Disney buses that come by the hotel frequently to take guests to the park if you don't want to drive.   Downsides: The $14 parking fee per day. The doors are loud when they close and you can definitely hear it in the morning as people are leaving their rooms.

Summary Heading: Nice Stay at the Doubletree Suites
Summary: We decided to try the Doubletree Suites because of its location near the Anaheim Convention Center.  We were attending an event at the Convention Center and were thankful for the 10 minute walk (using the "shortcut" path between the Courtyard by Marriott and the Marriott Hotel) as we could we travel back and forth between the Center and the Doubletree with ease.  Our suite at the Doubletree was clean and well appointed and we like the floor plan which we thought made better use of space versus the suites of other hotels we have stayed at.    The breakfast buffet was ok with the highlight being the self-serve pancake machine which was slick.    Access to Disney was easy by a walk across the street to the Toy Story Parking lot and a short shuttle bus ride to the parks.

Summary Heading: Glad we chose to stay here
Summary: Made the decision to stay here after consulting Tripadvisor-and I am very glad we did. We chose to book a suite -with had a separate living room, bedroom and bathroom-and this worked out great for our family with two little ones in tow. The room appeared clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Although our room was near the elevator, we did not hear any noise at all during the night. The on site Disney ticket office is great - saves time! In addition, we loved being able to walk downstairs and grab a coffee, muffin,etc from the cafe.  The Park was only a 10 minute drive away, and there were plenty of restaurants around to choose from. This is a great choice when visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: I would not recommend this hotel to a friend
Summary: My family of 4 stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in Mid August while visiting Disneyland.  I choose this hotel becuase of the good reviews and becuase we could get a suite with a sofa bed for our 2 young children.  I debated staying at a Disneyland hotel but figured since we would only be sleeping in the room I would save the money and stay at the Doubletree.  Maybe I should have splurged.  The Doubletree is about a 12 minute drive from the Mickey Mouse Parking Garage at Disneyland so distance (if driving) isn't an issue.  The hotel was also fairly quite which was a plus.  The downside is that the carpet  throughout is horribly dirty, the room decor is dark and dingy, the pillows were as flat as pancakes and the beds weren't the most comfortable.  The entire place felt

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay away from so many Disney giers
Summary: Clean very nice and very great price.  Do stay here for business or pleasure.  Not too far from Disney, bur cathc the shuttle and it'll have you there in no time.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights to visit Disney.  We had a room with a separate bedroom and living area which was perfect for our family.  The room was huge and it was more than adequate for our family's needs - it was also very quiet.  The walk to Disney was a pleasant one and we did get the ART bus on some days which was good.  The breakfast at the hotel was great and the children ate free so it wasn't too bad.  The pool had a good view of disney fireworks too.  I had to use the laundry and this was all adequate too.  All in all I would happily recommend this hotel.
Pro's - Location, clean and comfortable beds, friendly staff, great breakfast buffet.  Con's - $14 parking, no wireless internet in rooms (wired only).

We stayed here for 4 nights in late July and thought it was a great hotel.  We had one of the queen suites that was more than adequate for our family (two adults/two children).  The fact that it had a separate lounge room was great.  It meant that the adults could stay up once the children had gone to bed.  The hotel was clean and our room was serviced every day.  The staff were extremely helpful and the business centre was free to use for guests.  We only used the pool once, but it was clean and the kids enjoyed it.  Two TV's were also helpful!. The hotel is about a 15-20 min walk to Disney - we walked and used the shuttle bus (ART) during our stay.  Tickets for the shuttle bus could be brought from the hotel. We only had breakfast at the hotel (kids ate free) - the breakfast

The lobby is impressive and the location is great.  On the Hilton site, it states the hotel opened in March, 2006.  Maybe they bought it then but there is no way this hotel is only 5 years old!  The carpet needs replacing (worn, wrinkled and dirty) and the walls need cleaning/updating.  The plumbing was some of the worst for a hotel.  Toilet did not flush properly, sink backed up and it took a long time to get hot water.  The pool and hot tub are on the second floor above the lobby – okay but nothing fancy, if 10 people are in the pool, it is full.  The people that booked on Priceline for less than $100, probably believe the hotel is worth that.  With taxes, fees and parking I paid $220 a night for a 2 BR Suite including breakfast booked on Hilton website!  Bad information and
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you did not enjoy your stay with us and will be the first to admit that our hallway carpeting needs to be replaced. We had hoped to have it done by now, however because of a late start we were only able to complete the 7th floor before the summer guests arrived. We are starting again the week of 8/29 and hope to have all the floors completed by the middle of September. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Some good, some not so good
Summary: Room was adequate, but somewhat cramped.  Strange configuration.  I brought my 13 year old boy and a buddy of his and we were primarily looking for a place convenient to both the Angels ballpark and Disney.  That was the plus.  It was within walking distance to Disney and a very short cab ride to the ballpark.  Otherwise the hotel was just average.  Could have been much cleaner, but I imagine that is the case with every hotel on this Disney Land strip during the Summer.  So many kids in and out I don't know how you'd keep the place clean.  Staff was very accommodating from the front desk to the bar/restaurant.

Rooms are spacious with the two-room suite being perfect for families traveling with children whose bed time is earlier than the adults.  Restaurant, location, and staff are all wonderful.  We've stayed several times at this property with family for this reason.  Spend the extra dollars beyond the other Disneyland hotels to maintain peace within the family around bedtime.

Summary Heading: A great hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for two nights for a Disneyland visit.  We got one of the rooms with two queens and a sofabed which worked perfectly for our family.  The room was very nice, the staff was helpful, and the hotel itself looked great.  Disneyland is a 10-15 minute walk or there is a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place After a Day at Disney
Summary: There were so many choices of hotels that I had a hard time deciding, but am so happy that we chose the Doubletree. It is very close to the parking lot for Disneyland Park, but there is a charge whether you park at the hotel or at the park so you may want to save your energy. The hotel is super clean and quiet, the outdoor pool is warm and relaxing, the restaurant is great in both service and food quality. I would stay again here on my next trip to Disneyland just because it's away from all the madness, and after a full day at the park, just what I needed. The rooms are large, the bedding plush and the entire place very clean. All in all, a great stay.
Great rooms and breakfast The staff was helpfull The location is good.  Opposite to the main parking area of dineyland

My husband and I stayed three nights while we were visiting Disneyland and it was perfect. Check-in was a breeze and the one bedroom suite that we had with 2 queen beds was clean and the beds were super comfy.  Loved the cookies on check-in and loved the showerhead in the shower with really great pressure.  We bought our Disneyland tickets in the lobby center which was really nice--no line. We walked to the Toy Story Parking lot and took the shuttle to Disneyland with no problems. Although, we came back very late one night around 1:00AM and we only felt somewhat safe walking back to our room. We did take a taxi from the Grand Californian Hotel once which was $10 to the hotel, including tip.  We walked to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner one night which is at the Garden Walk:

My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree for our summer vacation.  We learned about it from relatives who had also stayed here and gave it great reviews.  We were first impressed with the cleanliness of the outside grounds when we first arrived.   The lobby was inviting and very clean.  We were greeted by the friendly desk staff and were both given these irresistable, warm, chewy cookies to welcome us!  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  Large bathroom and good sized hotel room.  The coffee bar in the lobby was great in the morning to grab a coffee and some fruit for our walk over to Disney.  It took us about 15 minutes to walk to Disney with a scenic view of trees and flowers the whole way.  This hotel had an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub, but closed fairly early at

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Not perfect, but  nice
Summary: We were doing Disneyland, so we basically just needed a place to eat and sleep. This hotel was fine. Room was clean, front desk service was ok (nothing over the top, just ok). The room was nice and large, so it was nice for a family of 4. The bus that picks you up right outside the hotel was late each time we road it to Disneyland. The front desk clerk informed us it could be late. We waited 30 minutes one day. It is not a bad walk in the morning, but at the end of the day, with little ones, you don't want to have to walk back. If we couldn't get a good deal at one of the actual disneyland hotels, I would consider staying here again.

This hotel is not whithin walking distance of Disneyland. The ART shuttle does pick-up every 20 minutes. The ART has it flaws (especially later in the evening) but I know hotels can no longer run their own shuttle. So what can you do?  The lobby was nicely appointed. Breakfast was free with HH's. The food was hot and mostly good. Sends you off with nice hot breakfast.  Pool- Was outdoors and very small for such a large hotel.  Everyone that entered the pool area commented on how small the pool was.  It got very crowded, very fast. Making it not fun and we had to leave.  The pool towels were very large and soft.  Arcade- 2 very old (Pac-Man) game machines in a smelly room.  The first few nights we had a 2 bedroom suite, with a sitting room area that had a sofa that made into a

Summary Heading: Great Service but further than we thought.
Summary: We stayed here from July 9th to July 14th, 2011.  We selected this hotel based on the great trip advisor reviews.  I am somewhat conflicted as to my stay here.  The room itself was very nice.  It was divided into a living room area with sofas, desk and refrigerator and a bedroom area with two comfortable queen beds.  There were doors that closed off both areas, great for getting small children to sleep!  Both rooms had nice flat screen tvs and blackout curtains.  The best part of the room for me was the towels.  Magnificent!  They have to be the largest, thickest, softest hotel towels I have ever had.  They had stocked us with 6 of them in the shelves under the bathroom sink.  They were wonderful.  They also provided nice toiletries although we had brought our own.  There was a

Summary Heading: Nice hotel near Disney; would stay again.
Summary: This is a very nice hotel that is pretty close to the Disney parks although we drove to the parks; it would still be a long walk. Our room was very large with two seperate rooms; one with two beds and the other with a sleeper sofa. The bathroom was also a good size and the room was very clean. The carpeting in the hallways was showing some wear, but that's about the only thing that could use updating. The beds were comfortable. Our room overlooked the pool area which we did use and enjoyed the hot tub. Staff was friendly and helpful and we bought our Disney tickets right at the hotel which had a Disney desk which was convenient and fast. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but they looked nice. We would definately stay here again.

The hotel was very clean and had good and spacious rooms!  It had a lot of great resturants to eat at and had the grocery store Albertson's which was about a two minute drive from the Doubletree!  It's about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland from the Doubletree, but they have a shuttle outside that runs every 20 minutes I think.  There is the option of driving, but it would be faster to walk or take the shuttle because you have to drive, park, and then take the monorail in to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: liked it, a few things to know
Summary: The hotel itself has a great location, pretty good amenities, staff is good, and rooms are comfy. The good - great location as it is just a 10 min walk to Disneyland/CA Adventures, clean hotel, large rooms (liked having a separate bedroom from the main room and having more than one bed so the kids could spread out and the 2 tvs were great too).    The front desk staff is great!  Our third day there my daughter got sick.  The gentleman at the front desk went out of his way to give me a map and specific directions to the local ER. He even checked in on us to make sure all was ok after we returned.  Thoughtful.  They were also great on suggestions for great places to go for dinner/brunch/etc. As we were checking out, I gave the mailman some postcards to mail out and he literally

Pro - Rooms were very clean.  We stayed at two queen suite.   - Great location.   - Friendly Staff  Con - Fees (parking and resort fee) we stayed two nights and we had to pay around $50 extras on fees - sink (slow drain)  they came and fix it right away - refrigeration  (does not keep stuff cold too well)

We had a suite with two double beds on the 7th floor.  The suite was very spacious.  Refrigerator and microwave.  Pullout couch and chair in the living area along with a desk.  Sink and vanity separate from shower area.  Room was clean, but several things needed updating due to wear and tear.  Carpet dirty and a big tear in the living area.  Hall way carpet was horribly dirty and several areas were sticking up and not attached to the floor, tripped over the carpet several times!  The last two days we were there, they started replacing the carpet in the hallway, so good for future vacationers, but not so good for the people on the 7th floor at that time.  The other thing that needed updating was the furniture.  The desk chairs had ground in dirt on the upholstery.  Looked like
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your observations, and I am sorry that you were not completely satisfied with your stay. I would like to know what room you stayed in so that we could check out the upholstery, however in the mean time we have asked  our housekeepers to pay special attention to their furniture. Our breakfast buffet consists of pancakes made to order, six hot dishes, and a variety of fruits, juices, cereal, and pastry. Most people seem to enjoy it,  but i am sorry you did not. As for your concern with transportation; the resort operated transit system is scheduled to stop in front of our hotel every 20 minutes. If for some reason traffic is particularly heavy they might run a little late, however as a rule they are on time. As to the distance...we are one mile from the park entrance, and while it's a nice walk in the morning, the return can be a little much after a long day at the park. Again, thank you for your imput as I find it very helpful. respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We have stayed in several hotels near Disneyland and this beats them all by far!  We have a family of 5 (2 ad/1teen/2children) and space in hotel rooms is always a problem.  The set up of this suite was great.  It was pristine and our floor (6th) was super quiet.  They have an onsite restaurant with a breakfast buffet.  They even offered kids eat free with paying adult!  Food was good but not really warm enough.  They should find a better method to keep food warm in buffet trays and it would really be great.  Bellman, Javier, was a delight to speak to and he gave us several coupons for local restaurants.  Sadly, Javier was the only friendly employee we found.  Restaurant staff was grumpy, front desk staff were professional but never smiled and not once were we greeted upon

Summary Heading: Not a bad walk to DL, but get the pass.
Summary: Hotel showed signs of age. The carpets need to be replaced through out the entire hotel, very worn. The front desk was very accommodating whenever we had a request. Having our kids eat free was great for breakfast, but I would go elsewhere for dinner. Not worth it. The walk to DL wasn't bad but walking back and forth more than once a day, it does get long, especially after walking the park all day. The pool is nice, however when we where there, a group of volleyball youths were staying at the hotel at the same time and commandeered the hot tub.  Also the they were very loud in the upper halls.  But a phone call to the front desk was all it took to rectify this situation. All in all a fine hotel.
Manager Response: You are right about certain areas of the hotel showing signs of age, but i like to think of it as being cuddled by too many people.  I am happy to report that we just completed a renovation of the Restaurant and Bar, and as soon as business slows down a bit, we will be installing new corridor carpeting. This is in addition to the flat screen TV's that were acquired last month.
