Please rest assured that we are committed to providing a superior product to go along with our wonderful staff, and that you will enjoy your stay with us as so many others have in the past. Regards, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Great decor, good service, fantastic music
Summary: We stayed here the night of April 22, 2011.  We had driven to Anaheim from Yucca Valley where my friend lives, and went to California Adventure that day and decided it would be awful to drive all the way back to Yucca Valley just to drive back to Anaheim the next day for Disneyland.  The lobby was really nice as soon as we got in.  The room was nice too, with a very nice view of Anaheim.  To be honest the thing I'll always remember this place for was that they played extremely good music over the PA.  I went to the bathroom and ended up sitting in the stall for ten minutes or something just to hear the music.   They were playing some chill stuff like Leona Naess and stuff.

Aside from the fact that you have to use a public shuttle bus to get to Disneyland, and the reception staff aren't overly helpful, this hotel was the worst place we stayed at over a three week trip. The rooms are cramped and the decor is outdated, surprising considering the website boasted a multi million dollar renovation that was just completed - we saw no sign of that. I consider this false advertising. The service is below average, the restaurant is pitiful, possibly the worst stale waffles I've ever come across. The breakfast buffet is very sad, and there is no atmosphere in the place. There are so many great hotels in the area, I suggest staying as close to Disneyland as possible, and look for hotels with good restaurants within walking distance, especially when traveling
Manager Response: I am sorry that your stay did not go well, and this morning we went over your concerns in great detail. While I don't want to appear defensive, I am wondering whether you have us confused with the Doubletree Anaheim/Orange County? I say that because we have not had the need to renovate, as our hotel is relatively new, where as our competitor does make mention of their "renovated guestrooms"?? Needless to say "Doubletree" owes you an appology, and I hope that going forward you will give the brand another try. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary: We booked a room in this hotel back in October 2010 and had to cancel it immediately due to my mother's emergency surgery.  We received a confirmation number and confirmation that a refund would be processed within 6-8 weeks. The staff at guest assistance were all very friendly and ensured me that the refund request had been made and that we would receive a full refund as soon as head office processed the request.  Unfortunately it was not processed, and we have been following up with and dealing with multiple people at guest assistance for eight months now.  We have received multiple email and phone confirmations that the refund would be processed, but it still has not been completed.  What was supposed to be a wonderful trip to Disneyland with our children and their
Manager Response: Dear Guest from Vancouver, I am very sorry that it took so long to process your room credit. It appears that our corporate guest assistance department dropped the ball [not that it matters since we are all one company]  We were personally made aware of this issue about a week ago and have been assured that your refund will be expedited. If you do not receive a check within a week, please call me at 714-383-7016 and i will personally issue the refund from here. I don't blame you for being angry, but hope that you might give us another try. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay for our family's first Disneyland trip
Summary: We stayed here last week with our family and loved it! We have a five-year-old and eight-year-old and needed a place at least somewhat close to Disneyland but that offered a suite. Our room was really, really comfortable and we learned through travel afterward that it had a particularly awesome sleeper sofa (not all sleeper sofas are created equal ... the Doubletree's was nice and flat and comfortable for our kids). The bedding in our room was amazing ... slept wonderfully! Nicely appointed room.  The walk to Disneyland in the morning was about 15 minutes. It's a bit of a trek but goes quickly in the morning. The kids did fine. Walking back after a long day, though, it feels like miles! I'd recommend walking in the morning and taking the shuttle back at the end of the day. The

Overall we enjoyed the hotel. The gym was very small for the size of the hotel. Had we not been on our feet all day at Disney we would have been disappointed.   The staff at the hotel were all excellent. We specifically chose this hotel based on its proximity to Disneyland but ended up being disappointed. While you could call it walking distance, I wouldn't want to walk back to the hotel after a long day at the park. The Disney entrance on Harbour Blvd is now only for shuttle drop offs and is no longer an entrance for the parking ramp which greatly increases driving time. Due to that, we have booked a much closer hotel that is a very short walk for our next visit.

Summary Heading: Lovely stay .. wish we were there longer
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night only visiting the Disney California adventure park. The hotel is beautiful and we stayed on the top floor (7th floor) in a Queen suite. It has 2 queen beds + a sofa bed in the lounge area. The beds were so comfortable. Our child slept at the sofa bed in the lounge area and he has his own TV. The room with 2 queen beds has it's TV. The cookies at arrival was a nice gesture and all the staff at the front desk were very helpful. Breakfast was nice and have lots of choices.  Given the previous review, we chose to drive to the theme park and park there. Its $15 per day with multiple entries. Catching the tram back from the theme park to the car park was a hassle though after the night show. The queue was so long and it took us nearly an hour to get

My family and I had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree Guest Suites during our Disney Family vacation. We had a great stay. The staff was very nice and very courteous. Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by many staff members. We had 2 rooms to fit 4 adults and 3 children comfortably. No complaints! We booked through travelocity and received a special deal of free buffet breakfast  with the purchase of 3 nights or more. It worked out well. The restaurant had delicious food and the parking was convenient. The walk to disneyland was not as bad as many other reviewers make it out to be. The hotel has a Disney center to help purchase tickets before arriving to the park, so that was convenient. We have a little one that requires a stroller, so we opted out of the shuttle

Summary Heading: Nice place until the sucker punch resort "tax" extra hotel fee
Summary: We arrived here after a couple of nights in the drab brown dump (see Hilton Anaheim review) and it was so refreshingly bright.  Room was pleasant staff very nice.  Breakfast was very good and location is a good compromise between Disney (far enough away to avoid) and local shops.  As per other reviews the elevator is quaint (mechanical bell announces floors) but seems like an antique compared to the rest of the hotel.  What really got me upset was the bill posted to the room this morning for a $7.02 resort tax.  This is not a tax, it is an extra stealth charge purely set by this hotel.  None of the other 4 hotels I stayed in charged this tax.  Annoyingly I prepaid this room and it was not taken off at time of booking.  I was all set to make this my hotel of choice for future use

We used this hotel as our base for a family trip to Disneyland. We weren't disappointed. The rooms, though not large, were clean, functional and well presented. The beds were very comfortable and accommodated our family of four in the one room. We didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the street.  There was a rather uninspiring rooftop area with pool and spa, which still offered a nice way to unwind at the end of the day. The warm chocolate chip cookies which were always on offer in the lobby are still remembered fondly by the kids.  The buffet breakfast was decent enough and certainly was better than that offered as part of a character breakfast by one of the Disney hotels (we won't make that mistake again!).  I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: We loved it.......would definitely go back!!!
Summary: I stayed here with a friend in September 2010 at the end of a month long trip around California. We booked a 2 room suite and thank god we did!!! After a week long shopping spree we needed all the room we could get!!!! The hotel was lovely, room was fantastic, staff were more than helpful with our tours and general info, food was great - both room service and the restaurant, and the location was fantastic. It was about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland or the bus picked us up right out the front. The outdoor area was great too, we spent plenty of time in the pool and spa as it was 40C most days!!!! I would definitley recommend this hotel to families, friends or anyone looking for something special whilst your'e visiting the happiest place on earth!!!!

The rooms are big compared against disney´s hotel, the suite have a sofa bed in the living room with TV,  the beds are great, very clean with free wireless internet. Nice location a little far from disney parks with a lot of choices in the same street to eat and shop. The only downside is that you have to pay for the parking, but i think is the same in all the hotels around disney

Referred by friends who stayed here last summer.  Something major must have happened between then and now.  Run down hallways and rooms.  Restaurant filthy carpet and poor service.  Will never stay here again.
I found this Doubletree slightly better than the one on 100 The City Drive, Orange, CA.  Nice room, nothing to complain. I will return. Many food options in the area.

Summary Heading: Will have second thoughts next time..erroneous billing
Summary: Hotel room was not really impressive compared to what we were expecting based on the photos..kinda smaller than portrayed. Hotel charged for an extra day of resort fees and taxes and was quite arrogant about the mistake while trying to rectify over the phone..wonder how many travelers they charge the "resort fees" of $7.00 for extra days and escape not being questioned..surely an extra source of revenues.  Only positive was a good hearty breakfast - try to get free coupons as part of the hotel rate deal (I went through expedia).

Summary Heading: GREAT hotel. Would be back in a heartbeat!
Summary: This is a fantastic place to stay.  Yes, it's a bit of a walk to Disney, but well worth it.  The staff was amazing, the room was great.  I honestly can't think of anything negative to say.

Summary Heading: Our hotel of choice when we go to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here from May 15-20, 2011 for our annual Disneyland trip. My husband and I have four children, so Disney hotels are automatically out due to the exorbitant cost and the size of our party.  This was our fourth stay here, and it was good, as usual. We always drive down from the Seattle area, and we like that the parking lot is well-lit and easy to maneuver around in.  Not nearly as crammed with Disney-goers as some of the closer hotels, which was nice.  The 2-queen bed suite was clean and quiet, and in good condition. Housekeeping service was good, the only complaint was that we didn't get a new bar of soap during our stay, it was down to a sliver by checkout time.  The breakfast buffet was great, and since 3 of our family members eat for free (one free child per paying

Summary Heading: Always a good choice when going to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at this DT several times and have always have wonderful service. The staff is pleasant and very professional. We booked a double room and were given a king by mistake which the staff quickly rectified. The rooms are well appointed and quiet.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel (beds are super comfy!), No problems during our short stay
Summary: We stayed here for only 2 nights on our recent trip to Disneyland. We found the hotel very comfortable. Staff in the restaurant / bar were very friendly, we had breakfast included with our package. Front desk staff were polite but not overly helpful or friendly... Beds were extremely comfortable and we slept really well!! Toiletries were good quality too. The hotel is in a great location for the convention centre but not an ideal location for Disneyland, esp if you have young kids - it would be a 20 min walk I'd say... there is a shuttle for $4 per person that runs every 20 minutes to Disneyland. Free Wifi in the lobby but not in the rooms which was a shame.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a hike to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here specifically to go to Disneyland. The suite we had was very nice and worked well for my husband, 19 month old son, my mother, and I. The only issue was mold in the shower. I let the front desk know about the mold on our way out for the day and it was gone when we returned in the evening. As for going to Disneyland, we opted to ride the Anaheim Resort Transit instead of walking the 15-20 minutes to the park. The shuttle was very crowded and only arrived every 25 minutes. One night we opted to walk back instead of waiting the quoted 15 more minutes for the shuttle to arrive at the park. We walked the entire way after a long day at Disneyland and we never saw the shuttle. If you are looking for a nice place to say this is it, but I would be reluctant to stay here if

Summary Heading: Nice stay if you don't mind the walk to Disney
Summary: My family usually stays in a Disney hotel when we visit, but decided to save some money this time by staying at the Doubletree.  We stayed 4 nights.  Our suite included 2 queen beds and a sofa bed in the living room.  Room was clean.  Beds were really comfortable.  While I didn't need to use it, the bedding included a lightweight down (maybe down alternative) comforter between the two flat sheets.  Air conditioner was quiet, you could barely hear it.  TV in both rooms.  Fridge and microwave appeared standard.  We had a problem with our fridge and the they swapped it out with another within the hour.  Shower head in bathroom was really high up.  Great for taller folks.  Not too many spray options though.  No wi-fi in the room, only wired connection for $10/day fee.  Free wi-fi in

Just returned from a family vacation to Disneyland and San Diego and felt the need to create an account here and write a review for this hotel. Our stay here was well worth the money and the service was top notch. Our double queen room was spacious and beds were comfortable. Our kids enjoyed the pool and the food delivered via room service was delicious and quickly delivered. The man who delivered our food both nights was named Randolph and was very polite and provided great service to us during our stay.   We skipped the hotel shuttle to Disneyland as their wasn't any cost savings for us and decided we would rather just take our car. The walk to Disneyland wouldn't be too bad, but after a day of walking around the parks...I wouldn't want to have to walk back to the hotel.

My husband and I thought that our 2.5 year old is finally old enough to enjoy Disneyland, and decided to stay in this hotel.  The room was small (about 300 square feet) but very clean with refrigerator and microwave to heat up milk for our daughter.  The windows do not open, so the fan is on 24 hours to circulate fresh air, but this made the air kind of dry.  I think that the hotel charges a lot of extra (parking, internet, Anaheim tourism fee, occupancy tax, fireworks view, breakfast, etc) so there is about $30-40 per night extra tacked on to your final bill.  But there is probably Anaheim tourism fee for all hotels  in the area.  Overall, the baseline price for the hotel room was so great compared to Disneyland hotels, we still saved money and had a good time.  I think that

Best thing about this hotel is the location.  It's about a mile walk from the entrance to Disneyland or you can get a shuttle for $4 per person from right outside the hotel.  The breakfast was great too and the pool was handy, though not that big for such a large hotel.  Other than that, it's a bland Hilton-family hotel.  We had better value in the cheaper motels we stayed in on our trip from San Francisco to LA (at least they don't charge you $5 for the bottle of water in your room!).  We'd probably look for something with better value next time.

Summary Heading: Great place to use as your Disneyland base
Summary: We arrived here after a 5 year break from travelling to the U.S. and the last time we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel with our kids.  Well, in 2011 they are old enough to look after the house while my wife and I went over to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and we were very glad the Doubletree suites at Anaheim was a part of our trip.  Friendly staff (right down to the maintenance guy who fixed one of the coin-fed washing machines for us and then gave us some warm cookies into the bargain!!), spacious modern rooms and a simple 2 block walk to Disneyland (but take the bus home at night when the legs are a little weary).  The Disney service info centre located within the hotel is a very useful point of reference too for planning anything "Disney".    We would comfortably

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for Disneyland accommodation with teenagers
Summary: Travelling with two teenagers, my search is always for a suite that will accommodate my family of four.  Gone are the days when I can put my two children on the fold out sofa bed together in our room.   Having stayed at the Double Tree Guest Suites in Times Square NYC, I was happy to try their Anaheim hotel.  It's located near the Convention centre which is an easy 10-15 min walk to Disneyland.  I spent hours online reviewing and costing hotels closer to Disneyland but I kept returning to the DTGS Anaheim.    The standard of this hotel is superior to those closer to the maingates of Disneyland.  This is a four star hotel compared to the 2 and 3 star hotels closer to Disneyland and at the time I booked, I was able to get a two room suite for my family for less than the price of

Friendly and attentive staff.  Great location in safe area.  Clean property inside and out.  Nice large room, great for families or roommates.  Comfortable beds and nice pool area.  Workout room a little small, but at least it was free.  Hotel catered breakfast for our large group for three days and each offering was very good.   One mile walk to Disneyland was easier than waiting for shuttle, but I did not have kids in-tow.  Great early morning run through Downtown Disney and Katella Avenue.  If they don't leave cookies in your room, ask at the front desk.  Yummm . . .

We checked in at this hotel after checking out of the top rated Trip Advisor hotel after two horrible nights sleep.  We made the reservation and checked in within an hour (it was before noon).  We appreciated our early check-in and the delicious cookies.  We requested a quiet room and we definitely got it.  They placed us in the very back corner of the hotel, away from the street.  The room was exceptionally quiet, great blackout shades, and comfortable beds.  We did have a suite (kids slept in the living room on a not so comfortable sleeper sofa), and it  was a bit tight in the living room.  Since a good night's sleep was our top priority, we were happy.  The hallways are dated, the breakfast buffet food was o.k., and there are an excessive number of fees for this hotel.  Also,

Summary Heading: Nice suite room in a good location
Summary: We spent 4 days here and at Disneyland and we really liked the hotel.  We had a 2 queen suite and we were also lucky enough to have an adjoining room with the grandparents as well which made it even more convenient.  The room was just the right size and the separation from the bed room was nice and needed.  We would put the kids to bed and close the doors while we relaxed in the "living room" area.  The beds are just like any other Hilton hotel and are very comfortable. Blackout curtains help keep the kids asleep in the morning too.   The pool was nice as well.  Nice hottub, but it was a little small.    The restaurant was nice too.  Kids eat free with a paying adult.  For some reason, the restaurant was empty every time we looked in there and when we ate there.  But the food

Huge rooms - well lit And appointed. Very friendly and helpful staff - particularly guest services. Great pool area. Good restaurant with excellent food. About 1 mile walk from Disneyland. ART shuttle stops right outside hotel with tickets available at hotel reception

This is the hotel of our choice every time we visit southern California.  Close to Disney and lots of wonderful restaurants.  The suite is great for our family of four.  Rooms are so clean and the beds and the sheets are super comfy and luxurious.  We had excellent sleeps every night!  And the cookies, oh the big chocolaty cookies were delicious!  They gave us cookies every night.  A couple of things we thought they could improve: #1. Lower the on-site parking for Hilton Honors members would be really nice.  $14 a night is quite steep considering that Disney charges $15 to park at the theme park.  #2.  Some extra umbrellas for the guests to borrow to visit near by restaurants during raining weather would be a sweet and thoughtful thing to do.

Summary Heading: Stay again on a package deal perhaps?!
Summary: Firstly, let me just say we used our points for our 3 night stay here.  So here are the cons: 1. no free wifi, except in lobby 2. you pay for parking 3. only 1 guest laundry room in the entire hotel (only a precious amenity when you come in with wet clothes) . And the pros:  1. safe in room  2. our room layout  3. facilities and room looked fresh 4. large array of toiletries by Neutrogena 5. beds were comfortable 6. the heat/ac system is one of the best low-noise systems that we've come across in all the hotels we've stayed in over the years.  Usually, these air control units are soooo noisy, it's a challenge to get a good sleep.  Because of this, I'd had to give it 4 stars.  Although, I would probably give it a 3.5 if I had to pay for my stay and a 4.5 if Doubletree didn't

No wifi in the rooms 10 dollars a day for wired Internet when everywhere in disneyland has wifi free Internet Old tvs Local calls are a dollar each plus 10 cents a min Parking 14 dollars a day for guests.. ( most other hotels have free parking )  Great looking hotel but with all the fees it isn't worth it

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Shortcut Convention Center, Nice Suites
Summary: I stayed here for 4 days for a Conference at the Convention Center.  The suites were very nicely appointed and roomy.  Large living room and work desk.  Nice wet bar and counter top with microwave (no mini-bar).  Room service for breakfast was excellent.  The rooms already have a gourmet coffee maker with actual real half-and-half!  The bathroom had a sink area separate from the tub/shower.  The bedroom was large (a King) and had two windows (this was a corner room).  The living room was large and comfortable.  Housekeeping was excellent.  The room was quiet for being on the 4th floor.  The lounge was very nice at night for drinks.  Restaurant wasn't so great in terms of selection.

Summary Heading: looks like some slipping in customer service!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel last week as part of a small business convention.  I was happy to read here that over the years there seemed to have been a concerted effort to improve customer service, e.g., from 2006/2007 to present.  However, after staying there last week, I do have some concerns to share.  After making the reservation, I received an email from Doubletree asking if I wanted "upgrades," e.g., a room with double sinks, a higher floor, a 1-bdrm suite, etc.... It fairly listed the prices per amenity.  The email also stated that to have a better chance at receiving the upgrades, to choose all of them.  So I did.  I explained this all to my husband.  Upon arrival, my husband checked us in while I waited with our two kids in our car.  He came out and said we didn't get the

This was our 3rd trip to Disneyland this year, and our first time staying at the Doubletree. I was very happy with the size and cleanliness of the room. After check in we decided to get lunch at the hotel due to the kids eat free promotion. The food was good and so was the service we received. That afternoon we spent some time at the pool, which was well heated and very clean.   We returned to the hotel that evening after a short trip to Disneyland. It was too crowded so I told my daughter we could order a movie in our room. After unsuccessfully trying several times to order Tangled I called the front desk to find out what was wrong. The said they would call me right back. After 30 minutes I called again and they said they had forgottten but would take care of it. They fixed
Manager Response: The problems you encountered in the restaurant should never have happened and I am VERY SORRY. It's obvious that I need to revisit our policy of offering "Kids Eat Free" in the restaurant only. One would hope that that in cases like yours [sleppy child] we would make an exception. Afterall, families make up the majority of our business, and we pride ourselves on exceeding their expectations. As for the issue with room service, that should never have happened!! Again, I am sorry that your stay was less then perfect, but I appreciate your bringing these issues to my attention. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, long walk to Disney, poor restaurant, lots of additional fees
Summary: The Anaheim transit bus to this hotel was terrible. We waited an hour the first day, they crammed us like sardines going and coming. The next waits all exceeded thirty minutes. We decided to stay here because of the suites and the kids eat free promotion. The suites were a nice set up. The restaurant was terrible. Upon our arrival the only other lunch guest being served happened to be friendsbof ours from AZ. They warned us of the poor service, but we were hungry and too tired to walk anywhere else. We had three adults, one child, one toddler and a baby in our party. We ordered three entrees and two childrens meals. Early on my two year old got really bad diareaha and my sister took her up to the room to bathe and lay down. When our bill came she had charged us for the kids
Manager Response: I am sorry that service was slow in the restaurant and that we were inflexable with your bill. Thats hard for me to understand since all of our staff are empowered to do whatever it takes to make the guest happy. In this instance we obviously dropped the ball. As for the resort fee, the money helps offset public area expenses. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with me, as i plan to speak with several department managers, on what we should have done differently. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Room was spacious enough for our family of four. Have not much to add since the previous reviewers have mentioned whatever needs mentioning! Loved the choc chip cookies! You can take the free shuttle to Disneyland from across the road at the Toy Story Lot Disney parking structure, abt 10 mins walk away. Otherwise, the Arte bus stops right outside the hotel.

My Husband and I traveled around the States for a little over a month and this was our first stop. We were so happy with the Doubletree, everything was perfect and the staff were so helpful - nothing was a problem and they could answer all our queestions.  The Hotel is really not too far from anything, we walked a lot and when we didn't feel like walking (after a long day at Disneyland) we took the shuttle which took us dirrectly out the frount and was always reliable.  The rooms where really nice and very clean, the warm cookies on arrival are a lovely touch. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites near the convention center on Harbor Blvd.  When we arrived - we were given a complimentary upgrade.  The yummy chocolate chip cookies upon arrival were a sweet treat.  Our room was very comfortable.  Nicely decorated and clean.  The beds were some of the most comfortable I've had the pleasure of sleeping in at a hotel.  We have a few different tastes when it comes to beds (firm, soft, etc) and these pleased us all. We bought our Anaheim transit passes so that we could get a ride to Disneyland Resort.  The quick trip and easy access both to and from the resort were incredibly easy.  I would most certainly stay at this hotel again:-)

Liked the room's size for a 1 bed suite. Good amount of room for our stuff,  especially with our little ones' extra bags and tandem stroller. My 4 y.o. was happy to have a separate living area to play in while her baby brother slept in the other room. Bathroom floors could have used a good scrub. The only complaint was that they never brought the pack n play that we requested. If we hadn't brought our own sleeper/rocker we might have been bothered. The breakfast buffet was average, but if you don't want to eat there...there is a Denny's across the street. Restaurant food was not the greatest quality for the price. Joe's crab shack and Outback are about a few blocks up the road across from Target.

Summary Heading: Great stay except pool not available
Summary: We stayed at Doubletree Feb11-16, 2011.   When we arrived the warm chocolate cookie was perfect after a long day of travelling.  The check in was quick and were up to our room ready to head to Disney.  We loved the room layout and the concierge so helpful.  The rooms were very clean and it was a very quiet hotel so it was restful.  The restaurant was very reasonable with kids eating free and were happy our breakfast was cheaper than the IHOP!  For a much better breakfast so ate the rest of the time at the hotel.  Other websites had mentioned that this hotel was too far to walk to Disney but found the walk enjoyable.  It was only 15-20 mins.  We only used the shuttle once as my impatience is to rather walk than wait!  The only downside of our stay was the pool was under

Summary Heading: Your best bet for staying over at Disneyland
Summary: Having been a regular visitor to Disneyland for many, many years, I've stayed at most of the hotels surounding the park.   I remember the week this hotel was first opened; ever  since it has been my favorite place to stay while on 2-4 day trips in the area.  The hotel is still newer than most; and it's got a very nice lobby along with clean rooms and well appointed suites.  Most recently I asked for a suite on a top floor, and a few pre arrival requests: that bottles of champagne & Perierre be on ice, and that chocolate covered strawberriesbe pressent when we arrive, along with 2 additional large pillows be in the suite.  My partner walked in and was very pleased with the suite.  It was nicer than the website's pic, I'd say.  Oh, and my arrival requests?  Everything was done

The hotel was fantastic, our room was amazing and the service was great. Couldn't complain at all! We had to organise quite a complex transfer and the concierge was so helpful and made our lives so much easier - it things like this that make a stay a breeze!

This hotel is not very close to Disneyland, but that's not a huge factor unless you want to go back to your hotel in the middle of the day.  The rooms were very large and the beds were comfortable.  We booked multiple rooms and they were all clean.  The only glaring omission was service.  There was a woman at the restaurant who spent all her time chatting so I eventually asked another fellow who was able to help me immediately.  Also, there was a woman at the front desk who gave me the wrong information about what to do to get an ART shuttle to Disneyland.  The shuttle is not really visible from inside the building, despite what she said.  You also have to pre-pay, which she also did not mention.  Minor annoyances, but quite sloppy and unprofessional.  Due to the poor service, I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your observations with me. While I am glad that you liked our accommodations I am sorry that the service you received was not up to par, and would really like to speak with you directly. My private line is 714 383 7016. I hope to hear from you. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Home away from home at Disneyland
Summary: This is the third time we've stayed at the Doubletree Anaheim in as many years.  The service is excellent and the suites are perfect for a family visit.  Additionally, the restaurant is very kid-friendly and welcoming (the waitstaff remembered our kids by name and what they liked to eat...even how dad likes his coffee!).  Disneyland is a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel.  The one downside is the nightly parking fee, but it is not uncommon in a high-demand tourist location; I'd like to see that waived for HiltonHonors members.

This is the perfect place to stay when visiting Disneyland and California Adventure Parks. The location is an easy walk to the parks, and and easy bus trip home if tired at the end of the day.  Breakfast was amazing, a great start to the day.  Staff all very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again if visiting DIsney.  You can't go wrong staying here:)

Summary Heading: YOUR BEST hilton property around Disneyland
Summary: I'm a Hilton Diamond and wanted some place to stay for a Disneyland trip. Just about every Hilton brand is located in the area so I had lots of hotels to choose from. I selected the Doubletree Guest Suites based on feedback here and I have been very pleased with the hotel over my 10 night reward stay. The trip started off with a very late arrival Friday night after room service had shutdown (at 11pm). Julio the bellman was super nice and brought all our bags up. Hearing we were hungry, he brought us menus from the Denny's next door. Then he took our orders and delivered the food to our room! That's really AMAZING service and it's quite common here. The rooms here are VERY quiet. The quietest of any hotel I can remember. You never hear anyone in the hallway which helps you sleep

On previous trips, I've stayed at two other hotels in Anaheim. The Doubletree Guest Suites was far and away the best. The service was great, the rooms were clean and quite large. The beds were extremely comfortable so we all managed to get really good sleeps. Our room was on the Disneyland side of the hotel which the kids liked. We pre-purchased the package with buffet breakfast and found that we didn't really need to eat again until dinner time. The only negative was the distance from Disneyland. In the morning, the walk was fine. At night, though, my wife and I became convinced that they kept moving the hotel another block further out! Still, the ART goes right by the door so distance needn't be a problem. We would definitely stay here again (but try to avoid the US holiday

Summary Heading: Very good stay at this hotel I found on tripadvisor
Summary: Had a good 2 night stay in December 2010. Room is pretty large, and pullout couch was better for my daughter than small rooms that need a rollaway bed. Location is very good, but not quite walking distance to Disney (about 1/2 mile) if the kids are small or tired from a long day. However, the $5/day shuttle comes right to the hotel every 20 minutes. Disney ticket counter in the hotel was convenient. Food there was not bad for a hotel. My daughter left something in the room, and they called me right away and are shipping it back to us, so they get points for honesty too.

Summary Heading: The Place to Stay if You're Visiting Disneyland
Summary: Absolutely loved this hotel!  Warm chocolate chip cookies at registration; clean, beautifully appointed suites including microwave, frig, great coffee, and so comfortable beds; room service; great food; nice pool and jacuzzi; gift shop; Disney Center; on site laundry facilities; and location.  We made the tragic mistake of visiting Disney while southern CA was experiencing the worst rain storms in ages.  Would really rather forget the whole miserable Disney experience, but the stay at this hotel made the trip great!

I normally stay at the Disneyland hotel when I travel as a single dad with my four kids.  Trying to save money I stayed at the Doubletree  this time and will not be going back to Disney hotel.  Thet room  was the perfect set up for me and my four kids.  The room was immaculate and looked brand new unliked the more worn and smaller Disney Hotel rooms.  The lobby was beautiful and had a very nice restaurant and Disney welcome center.  We paid a third of the price that we pay to stay at the Disney Hotel and we got a very nice breakfast for four each morning.  The lay out of the room was perfect for me and allowed me to only have to book one room for my family of five.  The kids shared the two queen beds in the separate bedroom and I had the pull out coach that was suprisingly

We stayed on our trip from Dec 17-20th. Great cleam comfortable rooms.  Perfect for grandparents and us with our 2.5 year old.  Made even better since you can't hear anyone snore in either room when the doors are closed. The ART stops right outside which was perfect for our trips to Disney.  By far best place to stay unless you are planning on walking.  But the distance is compensated by the ART.

My family and our friends each had a suite at this hotel for our trip to Disneyland. First of all, we got a GREAT rate for a suite at this hotel, which was about 1/3 of the price of the official Disney hotels. It is one mile away from Disneyland, literally around the corner. We loved the fresh baked cookies upon arrival and were very pleasantly surprised at how unbelievable nice this Double Tree was! The room was terrific. Our baby slept in the living room and we hung out in our bedroom which also had a big TV and very comfortable bed. Our room included breakfast for all of us and the hot buffet was fresh and great, and was a great deal even if we had paid separately for it. We highly recommend this hotel!
Decent-sized suites great for traveling with children. Clean and comfortable. Beds and bedding were super comfortable.  Great value for location.

A great hotel on Harbor Blvd 10 minutes down from the gates of Disneyland. Big rooms, big bathroom, great staff and service, free internet and an atm in the lobby. There's a Disney shuttle stop literally on the corner of its driveway. Very affordable, would definitely stay there again.

Great location for the Convention Center (about 12 minute walk) and decent location for Disneyland.....not to close, and not too far.....about a 25 minute walk from front door to front gate.  There is a local shuttle (which we did not use).  We are mid-50's and found the walk to Disneyland  to be no big deal.  However, small children would not negotiate the walk very well.....especially the walk back at night.  Staff was generally friendly and helpful.  Hotel public areas and our room were clean and reasonably updated.  Our king bed was very comfortable with nice linens.  Be aware there is a daily parking fee......$11/day (I think it was).  We flew into LAX and took Primetime Shuttle which was $30 pp/roundtrip......much cheaper than renting a car and paying a daily parking fee.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Disney Stay
Summary: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and thought I'd book because of all the good reviews. It was just as good as rated! We booked a queen suite which was great as we had a nice space to hang out after the little one was sleeping. Hotel was clean, comfortable with all furnishings in good condition. The pool looked great but it was too chilly to check out in the evenings. Laundry room was useful and clean. Staff was friendly but not over the top. Housekeeping did a great job everyday in tidying up the room and leaving clean glasses etc.  Yes, there is no in room WIFI but there is an office/ business area in the lobby that has computers with internet and there is free WIFI in the lobby if you want to hang out there with your laptop (very nice lobby). Also, we found the walk to

Summary Heading: A very nice choice for any Disney traveller
Summary: Stayed here for 4 days this past week as part of a trip to see Disneyland and found the experience to be very good for any Disney traveller.   Pros: Reasonably sized rooms that are in good condition, they appear to be only a few years old. Very friendly staff from front desk to housekeeping to waitresses, you'll feel welcome anytime you run into them. Disney welcome centre is in the hotel to help you plan your trip to Disney out - they know when all the special shows are on etc and can really help you get the most out of your trip. The breakfast buffet is reasonably priced with decent selection - it's the best bet to start your day.  Cons: No flatscreen tv? Boo! No free wifi in the rooms? Boo! There are other hotels near Disney that are about a half-star worse that cost a fair

Summary Heading: All Around Great Hotel for Disneyland
Summary: Our family of four (young kids) stayed here the first week in October for five nights visiting Disneyland. We very much enjoy our stay each time we book here. The staff is helpful and the rooms are clean & elegant. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with lots of hot and cold choices. The servers even pack a fresh cup of Starbucks to go. The only downside for us is that the distance to Disneyland is a little far (to walk), though you can catch the wonderful Toy Story shuttles across the street. Also, I wish they would offer complimentary breakfast, free internet, and free parking with their rates. If they always included these options at a reasonable rate, we would stay here every time we visit Mickey!!!
We stayed with young children when we were in Disneyland.  Newer hotel, with good service and great restaurant.  Nice room and would recommend this to anyone

I can not say how much I loved this hotel. They did everything right in my books. From the warm chocolate chip cookie at check in to the wonderful in room dining. We loved our stay at this hotel and will be looking for more doubletrees of this standard!  My husband and I stayed here three nights and we wished we could have stayed longer. The staff were very helpful, courteous, efficient and friendly. The room we had, had a seating area outside of the bedroom which is always nice if one person wants to watch TV and one is still sleeping or wants to sleep. My only one improvement would be upgraded TV's.  We loved the business center so we could check our emails and print our boarding passes. We had drinks at the bar and also dinner at both the restaurant and bar. We have zero

Stayed here twice in one month-once for a convention and once for disneyland with friends. both times had outstanding service-the second time came from a different hotel with no reservations and they were able to offer me a discounted rate. And have to love the warm cookies! Only problem was the expensive parking.

This is a good alternative to the Hilton or Marriott directly across from the convention center. Although it is a bit of a walk (about 3 blocks or so), it one of the nicer hotels in the area. There is not a whole lot around close by but there are several restaurants a bit of a walk away. The hotel could be updated but overall is in fine shape.

Summary Heading: A Shuttle or Free Parking would have made it perfect
Summary: My family and I loved this hotel!  The suite setup is perfect for a family with kids and the extra space is much appreciated.   The pool is a little understated for a Doubletree....but it was nice enough and heated (but not warm).  My only complaint is the fact that it doesn't have a free shuttle (most high end hotels do) since the walk is probably 20 minutes and ART sucks.  A resort fee ($6) seems a little out of place too.

I went to anaheim with my DH and 2 DD. The first night we stayed we had two double beds. This was standard in the hotel and you had to pay extra for a roll away. This was not big enough and I had to pay extra. Also our tub took forever to fill. It was clean and nicely furnished, but not the nicest. Oh and they charged for parking and the spaces were small!!

We stayed here for 3 nights in October.  The rooms were clean, comfy and quiet.  The chocolate chip cookies were delicious and the hotel had all the amenities that we needed - restaurant, bar, coffee bar, gift shop, pool, spa, computer room and Disneyland Welcome Center.  Disneyland is a healthy 20 minute walk from this hotel.  Our early morning walk to the park was do-able, but after a long day at the park I would recommend taking the ART for $3.00 per adult.  The 20 minute walk feels like a 40 minute walk after being the the park all day.  Although the hotel is 2 large city blocks from the park, we did enjoy the respite from the crowds after long days at the park - no one at the pool or restaurant when we got back to the hotel to RELAX!  We plan on going back to the Doubletree

We had moved here from another "shocking" hotel down the road so it was late and we were very tired - the professionalism of the staff and the cleanliness (and spaciousness) of our room was enormously appreciated - we had only originally intended to stay 3 nights before going to LA for 4 nights but enjoyed the hotel so much we decided to stay put!!!  We absolutely loved our stay here - from the staff (a special thanks to Jonathan (front desk) , Kim (restaurant) and Pavel (doorman)) to the rooms - I can only reiterate the positives others have spoken about....  The rooms are immaculate - housekeeping prompt and efficient, the buffet breakfast was fine - repetitive but plentiful with a reasonable selection - for dinner the kids eat free deal was great - position of the hotel was

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel few minor issues but great stay overall
Summary: Stayed at the doubletree anaheim for 5 nights in october 2010. Stayed with family of 5. Check in was a breeze, received our cookies (that were yummy) and got a nice room with a view of "disneyland". The view is actually of the car park area, but you can see the other hotels and at night you can see the disney fireworks which are amazing. Beds were really comfortable, we had two queens and a sofa which was surprisingly comfortable, the rooms were really spacious, there were 2 tv's  and the bathroom was nice. The only disappointment was the shower curtains smelt (like humid) and it did not go away during our stay. Housekeeping was great for the first 2 days, then they would forget to put sugar, and they dropped a few of our things and did not bother to pick them up which was
Manager Response: First let me thank you for spending so many nights with us, and i am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. While I shared  with housekeeping your concerns about the room, I want to resssure you that our hotel is safe and that we take security very seriously. From time to time people will come in off the street that arn't registered guests, but our staff is usually quick to notice and  ask them to leave. The other incident that you wrote about happened just that one day and we are still trying to figure out how the call was placed to your room. We think that someone checked into the hotel and began making random phone calls, then left after we made the announcment. We have not had a similar incident since that day. Needless to say we are very concerned about our guests privacy, and am sorry that you were made to feel uncomfortable. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Awesome stay at this hotel with 3 kids!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and the beds were very comfortable, the service was very good. The housekeeping was very accomodating with our nap time in the early afternoon. The restaurant had a buy one adult meal, get a kids meal free. This was absolutely great! The buffet was nice, the service was quick and the food was good. The ART bus to disneyland comes right at the driveway, sometimes the wait was long -25 minutes, others was short but it was nice and especially coming back - to be dropped off steps away from the lobby. We will stay here again.

Second stay here and just as pleased as with our first stay.  The room was spotless.  Beds are really comfortable with lots of pillows; got really good sleep. Excellent black-out drapes.   If you ask for a room towards the back of the hotel, it is extremely quiet there as opposed to being by Harbor Blvd where you can here some street noise.  Even the elavators arrived quickly as they have 3, unlike the ones at the Paradise Pier hotel that seemed to take forever.  Even with Disneyland's hotel rooms being offered at 30-40% off in October, we still saved over $100 a night.  So over 3 nights that was enough to cover all our food, drink and extras at Disneyland.  Plus, you get a suite with two rooms and two TV's so you can relax at the end of the day with a glasss of wine while the

Summary Heading: Excellent location; paid for non-working internet
Summary: If you plan a Disney trip, the location of the hotel cannot be beat except for staying on the Disney grounds. The price was very reasonable and the rooms were OK, not great, but there are much worse. My problem was with the internet service or should I say the lack of internet? The room only had wired internet and it did not work. I will commend their technical people who called me three times but they finally admitted they knew there was a problem with my side of the hotel and could not fix it. I had pre-purchased the power option and the "free" internet was part of it. So, my fix to the problem was to sit in the lobby at 5:30 am and use the wireless (I was told my room did not have this option) so I could finish business work and still enjoy my vacation without any unneeded
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you had problems with the internet while staying with us. From time to time the system acts up, however the problem is usually limited to just a couple of rooms and our IT support is able to fix it quickly. Needless to say you should not have had to pay for an amenity that you didn't get. Typically, our staff should have offered you something else [since you were on a package] or compensated you in another way.  If you would be so kind as to contact me directly I will see to it that you are given a refund. Aside from the problem with the internet, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: As soon as we arrived (very quick check-in) we were treated with their special chocolate chip cookies which was a hit for the kids after a long drive from LA into Anaheim because of the traffic-jams. We spent 3 nights at this hotel in one of their 1 twin-bedrooms and loved it. The room was modern, clean, quiet and spacious. We are a family of 6! (2 adults and 4 children) and we easily fitted into this room (2 twin beds in the bedroom and a sofabed in the sitting area). A large TVin both area's,  so everybody happy;-)  The hotel is about 2 kms (~ 1.2 miles) from DisneyLand/California Adventure Park  which is the only attraction in that area.  There is a city run shuttle which goes down the main strip picking up passengers at the hotels and bringing the to DisneyLand, so you dont

Summary Heading: A great way to end a long day at the Park
Summary: We arrived early on the day of check in and staff was more than accommodating in allowing an early check in for  myself and my 4 year old granddaughter.  The room was clean and more than spacious enough for us.  She loved the fresh baked choc chip cookies they gave us on check in.  The shuttle service round trip was $5.00 and conveniently had a stop right across the street and upon return left us right in front of the hotel.   On our last day, staff comped my parking.   We have found our local hotel for trips to the park.

Summary Heading: Housekeeping Have A Great Sense Of Humor
Summary: After visiting theme parks all day it's lovely to retreat to a clean, spacious hotel suite.  Housekeeping not only service the rooms immaculately - but add a little fun by placing the kids teddy bears over lamp shades, propped up on pillows and peeking out from behind the television!   Very nice touch after a long day of walking....families won't be disappointed staying here.

Summary Heading: An excellent choice, loved the breakfast and larger rooms
Summary: We read a lot of reviews before booking and we were very pleased with our choice. We caught the shuttle to Disneyland and found it convenient. The hotel is close enough that you can return during the day for a siesta and then go back to Disneyland for the afternoon and evening.  Comfortable rooms and the breakfast and room service was of a good standard. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Service, Amenities, and the little extra's
Summary: We travelled to Disneyland for the past 2 years.  The first year we stayed across the street in one of the motels, it was horrible and noisy, and expensive compared to what you are getting at the Double Tree Anaheim.  This year we decided to sacrifice location, and go with the reviews of this hotel.  Well, all we can say, we are already booking for our trip in 2011.  Check in was fine, our room was very clean and well stocked.  We had a 1 bedroom suite and it fit 5 of us comfortably.  The beds are amazing, and clean classic decor.  We very rarely heard  anyone above or beside, only when watching TV at night in the living room area, those guests that let there door slam when leaving or entering there rooms, other than that very quiet.  We have stayed at Marriotts and Hyatts and

Our stay was a total of two nights. This hotel by far exceeded our expectations and quite frankly, I am a very very picky person.  Check in was very fast and easy.  The front desk was very polite and pleasant and without requesting anything, we were upgraded to a suite with double room, two queen beds, fridge, microwave, coffee pot and complimentary news paper in the morning.  The room was squeaky clean and the beds were super comfortable.  The living room with the desk and separate TV along with a sofa sleeper was great!   The living room is on the side of the bedroom which has a two door access one to the vanity area and the other to the living room.  Since we are California residents we also received complimentary free parking and breakfast.  The breakfast was fantastic!  The

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family trip to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and 2 year old son stayed here with my parents and brother and his family Aug 14-18.  This hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland (about .7 miles) and there also shuttles that will take you there (cost around $3 per person for round trip).  I really liked this hotel for the friendly staff and 2 room suites that are setup better than an Embassy Suites because the living room is side by side to bedroom instead of the front and back of an Embassy Suites.  As a diamond member I received free buffett breakfast and the breakfast was really good with a great staff working there.  They are really good with kids.  This hotel still feels new and only downside is pool, which is nice but not a resort pool (aka no frills and not large).

A really lovelly hotel. Clean, comfy beds, huge bedroom with two beds and a living room both with huge TVs. Lovely pool, boiling hot tub, warm cookies. It was our kids favourite hotel of our holiday. Very immpressed. Not really walkable to Disney with kids but good location as still very close.

This hotel was great and just what we were looking for.  Spacious room, immaculately clean with lovely efficient serivce.  We were able to check in as soon as we arrived at 9am which was fabulous as we had just flown in from Australia.  The beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was good value.  It is a little walk from Disneyland but we didn't mind.  Just wish the cafe didn't close so early.

I really loved this hotel.  From the time we checked in to the time we checked out.  When we checked in they had warm cookies for us.  The rooms are fantastic.  Big enough to accommodate me, my husband and a 5 year old.  We weren't right on top of each other.  The concierge was very helpful.  The only complaint I would have, which is not the hotels fault is it is a very long walk to Disneyland.  If I just wanted to go to Disneyland, I would probably stay closer.  Maybe on site.  All in all this hotel is an awesome hotel, just drive to the park.
Great location. Clean, well maintained, good service and excellent value. Would highly reccommend.

We just spent 2 nights at this hotel in one of their suites and loved it.  The suite was modern, clean, quiet and spacious.  The hotel is about 2 kms (~ 1.2 miles) from DisneyLand which is the only attraction in that area.  There is a city run shuttle which goes down the main strip picking up passengers at the hotels and bringing the to DisneyLand, so you dont need to drive there.  The shuttle was something like $4 per adult and $2 per child but you could go back and forth as much as you wanted to.   There's a restaurant in the hotel which was very good, the food was good and the prices were reasonable, especially when you consider that kids eat for free with a paying adult.  Theres also a Denny's right across the street which has good breakfasts.  I definitely suggest this

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Near Disneyland and the Convention Center
Summary: We stayed at the hotel on August 19 for one night.  We reserved a king room and that is what we received.  While we did not reserve a suite, I believe that the King room that we did receive was on the smaller side.  It was fine for one night, but i would have either gotten a suite, or chosen a different hotel for more than one night.  The staff is friendly.  As Diamond VIP members with Hilton, we did get full breakfast included.  That was a nice touch.  I am not a fan of hotels that nickel and dime you with parking, but that is the trend in this area.    Also be aware that there is a $6 plus tax RESORT FEE.  This is another one of those nickel and dime charges that irritates me.  To be fair, it is clearly stated that you will be charged this when booking on the Doubletree

My husband and I have 4 kids with us (3, 9, 14 and 18).  They all felt in love with the room as soon as they walked into it.  The suite was so clean, tidy and spacious for 6 of us to walk and run around.  The hotel's location was perfect from Disneyland.  It might be too far to walk to Disneyland from the hotel since we had 4 kids.  But when we saw Disney's parking lot that offer the shuttle buses were only couple minutes away from the hotel, we hop onto the shuttle bus and head to and from Disney without any problems.  By the way, our kids loved the fresh and delicious cookies that were given when we check-in!!!  Thank you Doubletree Hotel and we can't wait to head back there for a wedding in next June.

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to Stay for Disney
Summary: If you are looking for the consistent quality of a large national brand, this Doubletree did not disappoint.  It had the knowledgeable staff and quality accommodations one would expect   I originally wanted to stay in a local suite hotel, but after reading the Tripadvisor reviews, replete with photos of bugs in the shower, I opted for the Doubletree instead.  We got a suite with two queen beds for a $125 AAA rate for two nights.  It was great to have two TVs after spending five nights in a single room with our 11-year-old.  The bedroom was huge and the bathroom was very roomy as well.  The hot tub and pool met our needs and the Disney office in the lobby was handy.  I read a lot of discussion about the shuttle bus service from the hotels to Disney.  But, we wanted to be there 30

Summary Heading: Good hotel to stay in the Anaheim-Disney Area
Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites on a recent trip to Disneyland beginning of August for 3 nights.  We stayed at room 643.  Checking in and out was fast with friendly front desk people. Pavel, who helped us bring up our luggage was very friendly and showed us around our room.  The decor of the room was a little dated but was clean- except for a bit of chocolate wrapper stuck to one of the trash cans in the washroom.  We had to call the front desk though after around 1 hr. of checking in as the bathtub and the sink were both clogged.  Since it was already almost midnight, the hotel came in at 7 a.m. (which was a time we agreed upon) to fix the clog.  There is a microwave oven and a small fridge in the room.  We noticed though that the fridge is not cooling very well.  The

Summary Heading: Good Choice For A Family In So Cal.
Summary: My son and I accompanied my girl friend to a convention in Annaheim and chose to stay here from a large list of area hotels. We chose it because of the suite accomodation, location, reputation of the chain and positive reviews here on T.A. We were not disappointed. The check in was smooth, the bell staff was efficient, the parking is convenient and safe, and the decorum is stylish and clean without being ostentatious. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that was just big enough for our needs and came complete with a fridge and microwave. The bed was very comfortable and my son(15) spent six nights on a pull out couch without a complaint. The maid service was efficient  with ample towels and no early morning knocks on the door. Room 530 is a good choice as it was a short stroll from

Summary Heading: This Hotel lived up to its reputation
Summary: After making the long journey from Sydney Australia we were looking forward to a relaxing 3 days in Anaheim. From the moment we arrived at the Doubletree Guest Suites we were overwhelmed at how friendly and accommodating the staff were. The hotel is in excellent condition, the rooms were clean and the food was good. Having two young children with us, they were happy to swim in the pool while we relaxed and enjoyed the hospitality. I'd definately stay here again as its just far enough away from  busy Disneyland but not too far from the action. Make sure you ask for a room overlooking the pool so you get a good view of the fireworks at Disneyland at night.

Great hotel, great staff, reasonable buffet breakfast (kids free when adults eat). Pool OK but not the best we've seen.  Walking distance (just - 25 mins) from Disney parks.  Given it max rating because friendly helpful staff made more of a difference than we would have thought. Useful to have official Disney ticket booth on site. Free wireless internet in lobby useful.

Summary Heading: Great location with hourly shuttles to Disneyland
Summary: Great location with hourly shuttles to Disneyland.  My son loved going to Dave and Busters at the Block at Orange mall right around the corner. They have a special for dinner and unlimited game play for the entire day for $40. It was a great way to spend the evening the first night we got there before heading to Disneyland the next day. We had a nice adult dinner and leisurely conversation while he played as many video games as he wanted without worrying about running out of credits.   The hotel accidentally charged us for parking even though we didn’t have a car. When I mentioned this at check out they removed the charge without looking at the computer or checking anything. I suppose someone with a devious streak could get the parking charges removed if they denied having a car

We stayed for two nights in this hotel while visiting Disneyland. We walked to the main entrance of Disneyland in about a quarter of an hour. We arrived in the hotel two hours before the official check in time and were very pleased by the efforts of the staff to clean and prepare our room in just one hour. Our room was large, breakfast in the hotel was very good and we liked the small business center in the lobby. For us, this was very convenient because we could print our boarding passes for the flight back home.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and good value for money.
Summary: Stayed at the Doubletree for two nights. We found the rooms spacious, clean and comfortable.  We found it reasonably priced. It's an ideal place to stay for a night or two. However we wouldn't recommend a long stay there as it has a very business like feel to it.

Great value and in a fantastic position for Disney Parks - about a 15 minute walk. Oposite a good Dennys but also a good restaurant in hotel - had good buffet breakfast here. Room service was excellent too. Rooms very well equipped - we had a 1 bedroom suite, which had a big bedroom and a separate sitting room, with a microwave , fridge and coffee maker - great coffee too. Would definitely use this hotel if we visit area again.

This hotel is a good choice if you are doing Disneyland or going to the convention center.  It’s an easy drive or walk to either.      The property is clean and looks like it’s taken care of.  The pool is nice but a little on the small side for a “family oriented” hotel.  My room was clean and comfortable.   I had no complaints and would recommend this property for family or business travel.

The first thing I would have to comment on was the staff. Not just one but all of them from the front desk to the restaurant.  The attitude and willingness to help were exceptional.  Someone in Management is doing a good job and it is obviously filtering through this hotel in a very positive way. We loved the warm chocolate chip biscuits to start out stay.  The location is close to Disneyland which was the reason for our visit.  We had several very large items which had to travel ahead of us.  Doubletree stored them safely without a word about being inconvenienced.  Nothing was too much trouble.  The food was excellent and breakfast generous.  We appreciated a laundry being available.  The rooms were large and adequate.  Would not hesitate to stay here again if traveling to

Summary Heading: Magic begins before you reach Disneyland
Summary: We stayed one night at the Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim Resort last weekend to celebrate my daughter's 6th birthday at Disneyland. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is courteous and very knowledgeable. Check in was a breeze and our room #643 was clean and comfortable with a great view of Anaheim. My daughter received a balloon bouquet and gift which completely made her day (nice touch). I did not have the opportunity to visit the restaurant or cafe but I have heard great things. We had plans to use the swimming pool but never made it. At the end of the day it was wonderful to fall into a  nice, soft, comfy bed and recharge for the next day. Noise factor is non-existent (big plus).   I would like to offer one suggestion: I purchased two tins of the deliciously famous
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words, and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay. As for the cookies, they are bagged in the kitchen by employees wearing sanitary gloves, then placed in special warmers at the front desk. Since we don't sell that many tins of cookies, we fill each order with the freshest cookies from the warmer, but in the process must remove them from their bag. This should be done while wearing gloves, and if it wasn't that is certainly a no-no. I will be reiterating our policy with all the clerks this morning. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Stayed here last week of July for one night to take my wife and two young daughters to Disney. I'm very choosy when it comes to places to stay, safety and cleanliness are very important to me and this hotel excels in those  categories. Nice area, close to some chain restaurants and other chain hotels. Room was nice , first time in a long time that I stayed at a hotel and never heard a peep from room neighbors. Staff is very nice and helpful. Check in was a breeze and getting someone to help with baggage took no time. Excellent customer service from Marcson and Javier. I will stay here again.

We stayed recently at the Double Tree and our general impression was very positive. Our room was much better than the pictures on the website (1 King 2 Room Suite - 631) Also little things alwaays make it enjoyable: . yes we did get our warm cookie on arrival . beds are plush and we slept very well . our room was very quiet . thick towels and above average Neutrogena products were good . swimming pool was not overcrowded . maybe the general decoration is not breathtaking but still very pleasant . staff was always very helpful . Disney is within 15/20 min walking distance and just fine (be sure to have a stroller at the end of the day on the way back) . neighbourhood offered many restaurants, good shopping opportunities We will definitely return if we come back to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great place but don't let the word get out :)
Summary: After reading many positive reviews I changed our 2 night reservation to Double tree ( I originally booked at one of the convention hotels but opted for DT because it's smaller and newer).  My husband and I stayed here in California (from Texas) on a long weekend. We were the only guests at the counter upon check-in which went really smooth (received the famous chocolate chip cookies, Yum!). I asked for a Disney view but was told the King room I reserved wasn't available with that view ( from the room we were given we could see the Crystal Cathedral). We arrived around 7pm so Disney view/Kings may have been given out already or there may just not be any at all. It didn't really matter b/c we weren't in our room when the fireworks went off any way, we saw them from Downtown

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice but rather generic
Summary: The hotel itself was nice, a good quality hotel what you would expect from a Doubletree.  My only disappointment with the hotel is that it isn't nearly as kid-friendly as you would expect for a hotel so close to Disneyland.  If I were staying at the hotel on business it would meet all the requirements for a 4-star business hotel.  The rooms and the hotel facility were very good and service, particularly from the gentleman who bought up our room service requests, were terrific.    The negatives were that neither the bedroom or bathroom doors locked, anyone who travels with children can appreciate the need to lock those doors sometimes.  Parking was also pretty expensive and wifi was $10/day.  Food from both room service and the restaurant breakfast were very good.  Hotel pool was
Manager Response: I am glad that you thought the hotel was nice and understand why one might think that we were not "kid friendly". It's true that we do not have locks on the bedroom doors, nor do we have as large a pool as we would like; however families are a very important segment of our business and I would like to point out a couple of things that you may not have been  aware of. We have a "kids eat free" program that allows a family to eat in the dining room at a discounted price. Aside from most of our employees being kids at heart, our housekeepers will arrange stuffed animals" just so" when making the room...if we know of a childs birthday, or that they are under the weather, our staff will deliver baloons along with the appropriate card, and we have three childrens channels on the TV...Nick Jr, Disney, and Cartoon network. At the same time the design and feel of the property appeals to the business traveller and those guests without children, who can sometimes be overwhelmed by a strictly "Disney" experience.  Hopefully we are able to appeal to both. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: This hotel was beautiful, convenient, and the staff was superb.  From the beginning at check in when they upgraded us to a one-bedroom corner room to the end when we checked out, it was a terrific experience.  The rooms were huge and all new.  The staff from the housekeepers to the wait staff in the restaurants and bar were top notch. My husband liked it so much that we have already booked it for another trip.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Restaurant in Hotel and great stay
Summary: The restaurant Agio was fantastic.  The service was excellent! They have a morning buffet and it is great!  The manager came around every morning to greet us at the table and made sure we had what we needed.

We spent two nights here in July.  The rooms were filthy!  The hotel needs a major renovation.  The carpets were the worst I have ever seen in any hotel, and I travel quite a bit with my family.  I made all of my kids wear socks in the room.  Two of the towels in the bathroom were "wet" when we arrived.  This made me believe that they were not changed from the previous guests.  The tub had black hairs in it.  I cleaned the tub myself before we showered.  Every time we stood by the sink to brush our teeth, there was a stench of sewage that made us gag.  The hotel seriously needs to address these issues.  I am not sure how this hotel has gotten these reviews!  If you are concerned about the cleanliness of where you sleep, this hotel is not for you.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you had such an unpleasant stay at our hotel. Would you mind calling me at 714- 383- 7016 so that I can get some additional information from you? Our housekeeping department is beside themselves and would love to know what room  you stayed in. Thanking you in advance, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree two years ago on a visit to Disneyland.  We loved it and decided to try it again. We were not dissapointed.  We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 a.m. and asked if there was any way we could check in early before we went to Disneyland.  I was shocked that they said we could!  Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable.  We dropped our bags and headed to the park.  My only complaint would be the wait for the Anaheim shuttle is very long.  We ended up walking to the park on most days.  The drivers were so busy answering questions that they were not able to help the customers boarding the shuttle.  I ended up putting $20 in before I learned that the shuttle doesn't give change! The food at the hotel restaurnat was excellent and the wait staff very helpful.

Summary Heading: A Great Stay for Our Grandchildren and Us
Summary: We've just returned from a five-night stay at this hotel with two young grandchildren. We're Hilton Diamonds who've already requalified for 2011  and we were very impressed with this property.  The staff uniformly are genuinely welcoming, friendly, and helpful. We can't speak highly enough of them and offer special thanks to Joel and Ed in the restaurant, who were so nice to our grandkids that they insisted on dropping by the restaurant to leave goodbye notes to them on our last day.  Our room accommodations were more than adequate, the hotel is well maintained, and we were quite impressed by the restaurant. The breakfast buffet was above average, and the wisely limited all-day menu offered variety at reasonable prices. The kitchen cheerfully prepared a customized meal for our

We went to Disneyland.  This is a nice hotel. Close to Disney. Comfy rooms! Food downstairs pretty good... Staff was super nice! Pool gets packed fast.. Kids everywhere! Fun time though! Rooom Service was great as well.

Summary Heading: Overall a good experience but a long walk too
Summary: Its taken me too long to write this review but since I still saved some info on paper about each hotel, I better write it anyway!  We traveled to Anaheim the week of Thanksgiving & stayed at this hotel for two nights.  We were in a suite with two beds in the bedroom and a separate living room with sofa sleeper.  The hotel room amenities were good, the rate was really good for what we got ($125 per night) and there was a Disneyland Center right off of the hotel lobby where we were able to purchase our Disneyland Park Hopper tickets.  We were also able to park all day at the hotel even on the day we were to check out.  A couple of not so great things about this hotel (getting picky here) would be that the sofabed was very hard for sitting on, I would have liked to see some free

Summary Heading: great Staff; nice hotel; mediocre food
Summary: This is a nice property.  The rooms are as advertised, though seem a bit smaller than in the photos!  The pool is kind of dinky and the fitness room is the size of my closet.  Those minor issues aside, we had a nice six day stay here for a visit to Disneyland and to see family.  It was very quiet at night and the beds are comfortable.  I thought it was very clean all around.  My main complaint is with the restaurant.  We had breakfast there twice and dinner once, through sheer convenience.  The kids eat free with a paying adult, but you get the sense the prices are a little high to cover that.  In three attempts to get an eggs benedict off the buffet over the course of the two visits, the eggs threw off such a strong vinegar smell as to make them unappetizing and they were
Manager Response: Ouch...not sure how to respond, other then start off with an apology and thanks for sharing the problems that you encountered. Since just about every employee is tuned into the Trip Advisor web site, they are all well aware of the shortcomings you identified and they are not happy campers. Rest assured that we will be focusing more attention on the breakfast buffet during high volume periods and will check the guest laundry vending machine more often. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Back to Embassy Suites for us
Summary: We had previously stayed at Embassy Suites but decided to give Doubletree a go after reading reviews on Trip Advisor.  Upon arrival, the entrance looked fantastic and the lobby was lovely.  Check in was a breeze and we were given nice warm choc chip cookies, which our daughter loved!    Unfortunately as soon as you leave the lobby it's pretty much a budget hotel.  The elevators could sure do with an upgrade/replacement - they were old, slow and small.  Our room was in a corner and was a very odd shape.  We had a booked a 2-room "suite", but it was more like a standard room with a door half way to make it seem like a suite.  The bedroom side of the room was a decent size, however the living area was very tiny.  The room seemed like it hadn't had a good clean for some time and
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. We have six corner suites with the layout you describe [one on each floor] and while it didn't work for your family, some people prefer them because they are bright, with two walls of glass. As for the furnishings and overall condition of everything above the lobby, I don't quite no what to say. The hotel is only four years old, and we are continually refreshing areas that show signs of wear. Your comments however are appreciated, and we will keep them in mind. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Very comfortable rooms at a great price. Loved it.
Summary: I did a lot of research on where to stay and settled on the Doubletree. I'm so glad we did. We were in Anaheim for a combined business trip for my husband and a family trip to Disneyland.
