The location was great for the convention center but a little far for Disneyland, more on that later. The rooms have everything you can possible need to be comfortable. Great beds, good towels, plenty of storage, fridge, microwave etc. The coffee was even pretty good!  The decor was very nice as well.  We had a view towards Disneyland and the pool. It was nice to be able to check if the pool was crowded before heading down there.  The pool and hot tub were nice and both were good temperatures.  The hot tub felt so good after a day of walking around Disneyland. My daughter slept on the sofa bed
Manager Response: It sounds like for the most part you enjoyed your stay, which is a good thing. As for the ART shuttle , I am sorry that you had problems with their schedule [they are supposed to pick up every 20 minutes] and particularly concerned that you had to deal with a grumpy driver. I am on the ART Board and will be sure to share your observation with our operations manager. As for the cell phone charger, we have a computer docking device that sits on the desk, which is somethimes confused with a charger...we also have a large box of every kind of charger imaginable that guests have left behind. While the maid didn't report finding your charger, it still may have found it's way to lost and found. Perhaps you could e-mail back with the name and model of your phone and we will see if we have the matching charger. Thanks again for staying with us and we look forward to your return. Regards, Jeff Morse

Summary: My family and I were extremely impressed with the Doubletree Guest Suites and with the employees.  Also, we really liked the manager during the morning shift of the Agio restaurant.  He was very pleasant to visit with every morning we were there.  The experience was great and you need that when traveling with small children.

Summary Heading: I see how this hotel got its ranking
Summary: To start off with, we stayed at 3 different Hilton brand properties in CA this past week.  I can’t help but to compare and contrast them.  This is the hotel we stayed at the middle 2 nights of our trip.  We were traveling with our two children (ages 1 and 4).  We got a 2 room, 2 queen suite and requested a crib from our baby.  Double Tree had the crib in the room before we arrived, which earned them extra points in my book.  Overall, the layout of this suite was the best we had all week.  The bathroom is outside the bedroom, which makes it easy to access while the kids are asleep in the bedroom.  There are TVs in both the bedroom and living area.  The living area has a mini fridge and microwave.    We got the fireworks view room for $10 extra per night, which worked out nice for

Summary Heading: Perhaps the best hotel near Disneyland
Summary: I booked this hotel for a week-long stay while at a conference at the Convention Center.  My son and Mom came along to play at Disneyland, while I worked.  I think this hotel serves both the business and vacation traveller very well.  We had a 2 queen bed suite in the northwest corner of the 5th floor and it was great.  The beds were lovely and there was good storage in the bedroom. We had groceries delivered and made use of the fridge and microwave, both worked well.  The bedroom had two doors which was made getting around easier when the hide-a-bed was open.  There were lots of towels and pillows.  Away from the room --the second floor pool was nice and got good sun in the afternoon, and there were lots of deck chairs and loungers.  Gym was a bit small. The laundry was a nice

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC Disney Stay- if only they had WiFi in the rooms would have been perfect!
Summary: Fantastic hotel. Not super Disney-themed like other hotels in the area, which I liked. I've stayed in dozens of hotels in/about Disney area, this was by far my favorite. Efficient, professional staff. I pre-ordered some extra pillows, etc. online before I came. Everything was in my room. Cleaning staff was pro, didn't even see them, but the room was perfectly in order. The lobby is nice, but unlike other hotels I've stayed in, the room was JUST AS NICE. What a relief! Very nice to have the 2 rooms- living for eating- OK, the fridge was not very cold when we got there, but when we cranked it, it worked fine- and the beds/bedding were really nice. Not very noisy considering it was a Disney hotel. I slept great both nights! They had 1/2 recycling, 1/2 trash waste baskets (too

This is a newer hotel and the rooms are nice and well looked after.  The Food and Beverage team is great- and the F&B Mgr was very engaging and looked after us well.  One word of caution unrelated to the hotel, the ART is very unreliable for timing, we found we waited a lot.  Not sure what other options are...could walk to Disney but we had very small kids.

Summary Heading: The one stop stay for everyone.
Summary: I have stay at the doubletree now a few times for business and leisure, and have always been very pleased.  Ed, one of the manager's is wonderful. His staff is always on top of everything, and I can assure you there won't be any Norma's (staff who are RUDE) on his watch. Thanks for the great stay.

This hotel was beautiful and the staff were all so friendly.  Ed, manager of food services was especially helpful in giving directions and tips for our adventures.  He went out of his way to make sure that we were taken care of and that our stay would be the most pleasurable experience. The rooms were clean and comfortable but could use a little maintainence. The location of the hotel was perfect for our Disney trip. The only complaint that we really had was the hidden parking fees.

Summary Heading: Stayed at doubletree on our recent family...
Summary: Stayed at doubletree on our recent family trip to Disneyland. The rooms were clean & we enjoyed having a living area and bedroom both with tv's for us and the kids to watch what we wanted to. Location was great being about a mile from Disney and great shopping and dining. The bus to Disney made stops to hotel every 20mins making it easy for us and our young children to go back as needed. Would definetly stay there again when in the area!!!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel to Stay in Anaheim !
Summary: Like most of you I spent hours searching this site for the best hotel in the area, chose the Double Tree and it DELIVERED!! . Great service, nice lobby, great rooms. I always look for suite type hotel when traveling with the kids, I like getting back at night and watching some TV while they are sleep. I had a car rented for the time of the stay I took it to the parks, is is not a short walk to Disney, but there are street shuttles that take you there on Harbor Drive in front of the hotel. I took the package that included free parking and free internet in the room. The only thing I wish they will improve in the future is that the free internet in the room, is (1) cable on the desk, there is no WiFi on the rooms, only at the lobby. My kids were always asking me to take them to the

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this week and loved it!!  The rooms were very spacious, perfect for a family of 4.  Love the separate living room and bedroom.  Also loved the microwave and refrig.  The pool, was great (the kids loved swimming on the second floor).  Convenient to Disneyland, 5 minute drive.  People say it is walkable but with 2 young kids, it would have been too far at the end of a long day.  We had a view of the Disneyland fireworks from our room.  It was perfect!!!  You can also see them from the pool or the windows by the elevator on each floor.  The hotel was very quiet.  We never heard a door slam, a toilet flush, or people walking around in the room above you!   I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Good second stay for Disneyland family vacation
Summary: We stayed at the same Doubletree in 2008 and had another good experience with this hotel in May 2010.  We have young children under age 5, and our primary purpose was to visit Disneyland. We do not smoke and appreciate cleanliness. We traveled on a budget, but also wanted to experience a bit of luxury and not all Disney character and kids mania, which is why we chose the Doubletree, outside of the park. The day we arrived, I walked to Target (LONG walk with a big stroller; consider taking a cab back) to pick up snacks, diapers, etc.   Regarding:  ROOMS We liked the king suite a couple years ago. So I was initially disappointed when there was a glitch (via my travel agent and WD vacations) and only a queen suite was available. We were tired so I took it. I quickly discovered that

Summary Heading: This hotel lives up to its outstanding reputation!
Summary: We visited Disneyland in April and spent 8 nights at this hotel. We chose the Doubletree based on the great reviews we read here and on another website as well as for its affordability. We were immediately impressed with the amenities and hospitality. We arrived late in the evening and although the restaurant was preparing to close they happily ushered us in and catered to us and our two children. We continued to see this outstanding hospitality throughout our week-long stay, especially in the restaurant. We actually ate a good portion of our meals there due to convenience, pricing and of course the service. It also helped that our package deal included complimentary breakfast each morning for our family. The restaurant manager was also very friendly and gave us numerous

Summary Heading: Second times the charm! Perfect for RE Congress! Never thought I'd stay here either!
Summary: Now thats what I call a sweet suite! This was my second time staying at a DoubleTree hotel, except now that we are in a warm and busy resort area near Disneyland Resort, rather than in cold Missouri at seventeen degrees windchill! We only stayed the final night of the 2010 Los Angeles Archdiocese Religious Education Congress (spent the first two nights at the Anaheim RV Village), and for good reason, there was a dance for young adults nearby at the Marriott, and it goes on until midnight, and the RV park was not in a safe area. We were going to choose the Hilton Anaheim, but the Hilton was out of vacancy, so the people over there referred us to the DoubleTree nearby, since it was part of The Hilton Family. So we took that instead. I have heard of this all-suite hotel before, but

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay at the Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim Resort/Convention Center
Summary: Despite the ongoing threat of flight cancellations due to the volcanic ash clouds descending over UK airspace from Iceland we managed to fly out from London to Los Angeles and stay in Anaheim for a week.  We stayed at Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim Resort/Convention Center from 26 April until 3 May 2010.  We did a lot of research on Tripadvisor before booking and I must agree with other reviewers on this site that it is hard to find an Anaheim Hotel that has all positive reviews.   We found everything was as we expected.  The hotel is in a superb location with great transport and conference facilities all within walking distance. There were 2 adults and 4 children in our party.  The check-in process was quick and the hotel staff members were very helpful.  The hotel room was

Summary Heading: Nice Room. Nice View. 20 Minute Walk to Disney. Restaurants in walking distance
Summary: Had a 5 night stay here after a 7 night stay in the Universal/Hollywood Area. I always research thoroughly before booking and it was hard to find an Anaheim Hotel that had all positive reviews. But this is as close to it that we could find. Check in was easy and we were able to get our room a couple of hours ahead of check in time. Warm cookies were a nice gesture.   Room was great. Had a separate living room area with microwave and refrigerator.   Bedroom had two double beds and nice ceiling to floor mirror on the wardrobe. The Windows were nice and large. The Sink area was separate to the shower and toilet area. You could access the sink area from both the bedroom and living room area. Maid service seemed to be at different times everyday but if not done on return to the room

We're a family of 5 and for the past 10 years we've gone to Disneyland 2-3 times a year.  We've tried many of $150/night hotels in front of the Disneyland gate, but never returned to any of them. In 2008 we tried the Doubletree and haven't stay anywhere else since.  Although its hard to do the walk after spending all day in the park,  the quality of the room and the sleep makes it worth it.  The room is so quiet and comfortable.  Room service menu is decent.  Breakfast buffet is good.  When you make a reservation get the deal that includes breakfast in the room rate - well worth it.   Also ask for a room facing the park to see the fireworks.  Downside is the parking and internet fee - $11 each per night.

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms, at a reasonable rate.
Summary: I really like this hotel, as a reasonably priced place to stay in a good location.

Compared to the Hilton, the Doubletree is such a bargain.  The room we stayed in was a double queen, 2 room suite and it was perfect for our trip to Blizzcon.  My boyfriend hung out at the pool while my son and I went to the convention.  The pool is awesome and so is the restaurant and bar.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning on staying in Anaheim.  Also, don't forget the cookies!  yum.

Summary Heading: Great option for our Disneyland visit
Summary: We were so happy with our stay at the Doubletree.  The staff was so friendly, the restaurant had great food plus our kids ate free.  The manager of the restaurant stopped by our table several times during our visit to see how our food was and if there was anything he could do.  Our room was great because we could put the kids to bed and then still have the living area to watch tv and talk.  Our room was clean, the beds were very comfortable and the entire staff was pleasant.  Plus, it was just a short shuttle ride to Disneyland.  We'd definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We just recently stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim, and really enjoyed our stay. We were there for seven days to visit Disneyland. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We had a two room suite, it was very clean and comfortable. Plus the rates are very reasonable compared to staying on Disney property. The beds are so comfortable and we had a great view of the fireworks from our window. The restaurant has great food and staff. Plus kids eat for free!! The staff in the restaurant was so friendly and helpful. We traveled with my 18 month old and he loved eating there. Its about a 10-15 min walk to disneyland but the bus comes all the time if you dont want to walk. Its worth the few extra mins of walking to stay in such a nice hotel for a great price. And had no

The Doubletree Guest Suites in Anaheim is a wonderful hotel. We have stayed there many times and have always been happy. The staff is always nice, polite, and accomodating. They always do everything they can to make our stay as nice as possible. The rooms are awesome and we always get the exact room number that we request. The beds are so comfortable and the room is always very clean! The bathrooms are nice and have granite countertops. There is an in-room safe. The hotel's food is great and so is the service. They provide neutrogena products including shampoo, conditioner, soap, and lotion. There is also a hairdryer and iron. The TV has premium chanels and you can order movies. The downfall to this hotel is that it is not located directly accross the street from Disneyland. It

Upon arrival to Doubletree we felt we received red carpet treatment.  Customer service was excellent, room was available early .  The food and service at the hotel restaurant Agio Ristorante was superb as well as the Restaurant Manager!  Would stay again, but next time spend more time at this great hotel.

we had been elsewhere near Disney, and our hotel was not what we wanted at all, nor was it possible to sleep well in it.  At 6:30am, we called Doubletree, and they were willing to check us in then, without fuss or extra cost.  The room was well maintained, the hotel in good condition, and everyone we interacted with was pleasant and helpful.  The head of food services (whose name has temporarily left my brain -- sorry) was very very kind; he exemplified the overall attitude of wanting to be sure that we had whatever we needed to be comfortable.  All requests made at the hotel were met promptly and cheerfully.

New Zealanders highly recommend this hotel. Rate it A++++++++++.Everyone was very friendly and obliging. We arrived off a very early flight from Vegas and were in our room by midday even though check-in time wasn't until 3pm. Really appreciated that! The bar had a great atmosphere and the quality of the food and service at the restaurant was excellent. We dined there every night it was so good. The breakfast was included in the price and was of good quality and lots of selection. The rooms were quiet and very clean, with comfy beds. It was only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, so very conveniently located. Would most definitely stay there again. Enjoyed our stay immensely.

Stayed at this hotel for an event in their convention center and a trip to Disneyland, and I just wan't all that impressed. The room was nice enough, but the food in their snack bar was on the expensive side. In my opinion, the hotel is too far from Disneyland if that is the reason for your trip.  Also, I am sick of going to hotels that don't have free wifi in the rooms - why can I stay at a Best Western and get free wifi but Doubletree wants to charge for wired internet? It was impossible for us to hook up internet for more than one laptop with the setup we had.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good restaurant, a little far away from Disneyland
Summary: My mom and I went to Disneyland for a long weekend and booked at this Doubletree.  The hotel was nice, they upgraded us to a suite (separate sitting room and bedroom) which was really nice to have the extra space.  We ate breakfast at the restaurant 3 times, it was great.  10 bucks for the 2 egg "American" breakfast, I thought it was a good deal.  2 eggs, 3 pieces of bacon a whole pile of potatoes and toast.  Not bad for hotel restaurant prices.  We also ordered lunch once and room service once, both were excellent.  It is about 1 mile to Disneyland - a little far but it's totally flat (no hills) which was nice.  You pass several convienence stores (7-11) so we stopped for water and snacks.  It was a little bit of a walk if you had little kids but since it was just my mom and I,

Summary Heading: Decent hotel--good rates, but nickels and dimes on the incidentals
Summary: We just got back today from a 3 night stay at the Doubletree Hilton.  My husband and three children, ages 7, 4, and 1 stayed there mainly to go to Disneyland.    Description:  We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite (separate bedroom and living room quarters), equipped with 2 queen beds, a small refrigerator, and a microwave.  A coffeemaker, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, closet-safe, 2 televisions, and daily USA Today newspaper, were also included.  Walking distance to the gate of Disneyland is approximately 1 mile.  Pros: 1)  Great service:  The bellman, wish I knew his name, but Hispanic and in his forties, was really nice.  He gave us discount tickets to some of the area restaurants, and showed us how to get to Disneyland, as well as how to find the free parking for Downtown

Summary Heading: Great hotel and close enough to walk to Disney
Summary: Stayed with my wife and two girls (13/10).  The location is convenient - close enough to walk even though we drove most days.  We did catch the Toy Story Parking Lot bus back one day.  That lot is close by and saves a few steps.  Parking in the morning at the Mickey and Friends lot took way too long so we walked other days and drove back later in the night after we changed into warmer clothes.  The rooms were huge.  Bathroom was OK but I really like having the shower separate from the sink.   Breakfast buffet was very good and slighly different each day which was a nice change.  Staff was super friendly - especially in the dining room.  Congrats to Ed for running a nice shop.  Very clean.  Extremely quiet.   HINT - Don't park under the trees.  They dripped some sort of sap on my

This was our third stay at the Doubletree and we'll continue to come back, every time we visit Anaheim. The rooms are lovely and the location is excellent. Not only could we walk to Disneyland, but we also walked to Target to pick up some food for the room (hooray for a fridge and a microwave!). As usual, the cookies we received at check-in were warm and delicious. Since we checked in late and checked out early, we avoided the rush that seems to plague some travelers. Really, though, when you're checking in or out at a peak time, do you expect instant service?  The room was lovely, with a comfy king-size bed, soft linens, and lots of pillows. The water pressure was excellent and the towels were very soft and fluffy. The rooms are quite large, which was especially handy when my

Summary Heading: Great Disneyland Hotel, especially if you have toddlers or infants!
Summary: This hotel worked great because it was a suite and therefore we had an extra room so our baby could sleep soundly while the rest of us stayed up later.  The rooms aren't huge but that's fine, we really just needed a separate area to put the crib.  I love the warm cookies upon arrival and their breakfast buffet was pretty good.  We are vegetarians and although the potatoes they served at the buffet have bacon, they got us a separate plate of them even though we ordered the buffet.  They also cooked us our eggs as we asked even though the buffet technically included scrambled only.  The restaurant manager checked in with us, which I thought was very considerate.  The beds were very comfortable and the pillows/comforters were quite nice as well.    They don't have Nickelodeon which

Summary Heading: Good Price, Great Hotel, Great Rooms
Summary: For a Hotel nearby a place called Disneyland, I was shocked to find a place that was spacious and clean.   The front room had a safe, refrigerator and microwave along with a sofasleeper.    The bedroom was larger than imagined and it had seperate doors leading to the front room or bathroom.  No going through our bedroom to reach the bathroom for the kids.  The only downside from this property is the noise from the street that will disturb your sleep.  Try to book a room that faces away from the street.  If street noise doesn't bother you, your going to like room 711.  We would stay here again.

Went to this hotel with colleagues for a conference.  What I liked the most: restaurant staff, porter staff, location What I liked the least: front desk staff, internet connection  Was sent an e-mail upgrade voucher by Doubletree. When I arrived the front desk agent (Soobin) told me that she could not honour the upgrade because the hotel was full. Why not notiy me ahead of time? I asked if breakfast was included and Soobin said it was not. Asked how much it would cost to include breakfast. She stated that the computer could not generate a rate because the hotel was full. For the next five days at breakfast, the restaurant staff asked me if I had a breafast voucher. I said I did not and could not get that package. Erlinda the server was great and explained that it could be done.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that our front desk agents were not more accommodating and I have spoken to both at length.Hopefully you have received an apology letter from our Front Office manager, along with a refund of $76 for the cost of breakfast during your stay.  For those of you that are reading this review to get a feel for our hotel, let me explain what happened. This guest was sent a standard voucher offering an upgrade on a space available basis [key words "space available"]. Due to a large convention, we didn't have a room that we could upgrade the guest to.  As for breakfast, unless you have purchased a special package, breakfast is not included in the room rate.This guest happened to be part of the ICEED convention and their reservation was part of a "block" that couldn't be readily changed. Had our clerks been a little more creative, they could have found a way to accommodate the guest, hence the refund. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Absolutely Wonderful Hotel -- Exceeded our Expectations
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Suites this weekend and thought that it was a wonderful hotel. Due to a large convention and sports competition in town the hotel was full both nights. We never had to wait more than a minute or two for an elevator and parking was always available. Our room was perfect. We had a corner king suite, and the layout was great for families. There were two entrances to the bathroom and bedroom area, and the sink was separate so several people could get ready at the same time. The room and the rest of the hotel was spotless, and we never heard any other guests. The staff was very eager to please and made the entire visit great for us. It was an easy 10 minute walk to the convention center, and was more convenient than trying to fight for parking

If you can get past having to walk approx. 10 minutes to the gates of the park, then this is the best choice in Anaheim.  The staff is incredibly friendly, the rooms are very nice and in great condition. The area is quiet and the facilities are top notch. This is one place you'll look forward to go back to after a long day, and have a great rest.  I think the quality here is superb, not only for Anaheim, but anywhere else.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with top of the line service!
Summary: We brought our family on a Disney vacation.  We usually stay on the Disney resort property.  The rate we got at the Doubletree seemed to good to be true with all of the reviews that have been written.  We decided to give it a try.  We were truly glad that we did.  The rooms were lovely and spacious enough for our family.  The beds were so comfortable that I did not want to get up in the morning.   Around the hotel you can find many options for food with the typical chain restaurants at the Garden Walk mall.  We did eat in the hotel at the Agio restaurant for breakfast and dinner.  The breakfast buffet was very good as was the dinner. On both occasions we were waited on by servers with poor english skills.  For breakfast this really was not a big deal as it was a buffet and we

This was my 2nd time staying at this property, and once again they managed to exceed my high expectations.  I got an excellent rate ($80) on the Doubletree website by pre-paying my hotel bill - this was about half the price of the room posted anywhere else!  We stayed 6 nights and enjoyed the comfort and size of our 1 bedroom suite.  The room is very clean and nicely appointed in furniture.  The beds are very comfortable, and I like that the shower is seperate from the vanity area so more than one person can get ready.  The restaurant is outstanding in both quality and value of the food.  Also, the service is exceptional.

I recently  traveled to Disneyland with a 5-year old, a 4-month old, my husband and mother-in-law, and this hotel truly delivered for our 2-night stay. We got an incredible rate on a 2-room suite with 2 queen beds and a pull-out sofa (+ a crib supplied by the hotel). The room was very comfortable for all of us. There was a frig and a microwave and a convenience store within walking distance so we could have snacks/drinks on hand. We loved the cookies, and took advantage of the great room service for dinner and breakfast. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub one night and were able to see the Disney fireworks from the pool. The 15-minute walk to Disneyland was easy (the weather was good). The staff was great, the room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay

Stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites for a couples trip to Disneyland.  Booked hotel strictly because at the time of our stay, back in 2007, it was practically brand new and the price was right at about $120/night.  Checked in late, around 10PM after a long day of travel delays.  Arrived up to the room, which was absolutely massive.  It had a king bed in one room, a giant living room, with desk area, coffee table, sofa, two arm chairs, and dining table with 4 chairs.  I thought surely we were given the wrong room for the price we paid.  Not wanting to pay for an upgrade, I called down to the front desk to confirm we were given the right room, and the front desk lady who checked us in chuckled and assured me we were in the right room.  They must get that a lot.  Hotel was a
Manager Response: I am  glad that you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms comfortable. We could have made the toilet/tub enclosure a bit larger, however opted for a bigger vanity area seperate from the toilet so that two people could use the bathroom at once. Thank you for your feedback and I hope we will have an opportunity to serve you again. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Quietest hotel I've ever stayed in
Summary: I never heard another room's toilef flush, or shower run at 6 AM, or kids, or doors slamming.  I slept well for all 7 nights.  Also, my DH could watch the Olympics in the other part of the suite while I slept.  I could retire to a room like this.
We had a great stay. Super location: 5/8 mile from Disneyland entrance. Very clean hotel. Good service. Hot breakfast included.

We stayed at the the Doubletree from 30 Nov to 6 Dec and couldn't have been happier.  Arriving at 10.00pm after 20hrs of flying we were warmly welcomed and checked-in quickly.  Received an upgrade to a fireworks view room which was fantastic.  The 2 Queen Suite was a great size and kept very well presented throughout our stay by housekeeping.  We ate at the restaurant a couple of times for breakfast and found a good selection of choices.  Also it was great being able to eat meals in the lounge either from the bar menu or restaurant menu.  Whilst we walked most of the time to DL we did catch the bus occasionally.  Didn't realise about the bus stop at the driveway entrance initially as its not that well posted, but you can also catch a bus from outside Denny's across the street.

We stayed at Doubletree for 4 nights in December.  We chose this property as we have stayed with Doubletree before and they are always clean and well maintained.  The beds were really comfortable, there was plenty of room for a family of 5 (which includes 3 teenagers).  The breakfast was lovely and reasonably priced.  We needed a taxi a couple of times and they arranged for one particular fellow to look after us during our stay.  He was always on time and a lovely person to deal with.  My only thing about the property (especially if you are travelling with small children) is the distance from the hotel to the Disneyland entrance.  For me personally it was an OK walk, however, after a long day with tired children you would not want the walk back to the hotel.  My youngest (even
Manager Response: I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay and I will share your nice comments with the staff. Unfortunately, we are about a 10-15 minute walk from the Park enterance  and that can be a little much when you are tired. As for the local shuttle service, it should pick our guests up every 20 minutes. I sit on the transportation board and will be sure to see if there were any special problems during the time you were in Anaheim.  Thank you for staying with us, and taking the time to share your observations. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary Heading: We can't wait to stay again, very impressed!
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites, Anaheim for our first Christmas and New Year at Disneyland and we could not have been happier with our choice of accommodation! We have been to Disneyland other times and stayed at other hotels around Disneyland but we will definately be staying at the Doubletree when we return!  The service was great from the moment we arrived. All of the staff were very friendly and the  warm cookies we received at check-in really topped it off! We were very impressed with the room - we chose the 2 room suite with 2 beds - which had more than enough room for our family of four (and all of our luggage!) and was very clean and comfortable.  The restaurant downstairs where we had breakfast each day was great. We had the buffet a couple of

Summary Heading: Given the $$$, perfectly average hotel.   Nothing more nothing less.
Summary: Our stay was fine.  It was an average hotel.  I am not quite sure why it has received all the glowing reviews.  We stayed for 7 nights 12/24-12/31/09.  We had two suites for a family of two adults and three children - one king suite and a one queen suite.   Not particularly spacious accomodations, but not overly small either.  Everything was fine, though nothing special relative to any of the other hotels we have stayed at over the years.  Breakfast buffet was fine too, though again, certainly nothing special.  If we had not gotten the package with "free breakfast" it would not have been worth the cost.  The breakfast buffet did make it easy to get an early start to our day.    We had a couple of decent dinners in the restaurant.  Joel was a great waiter.  "Guest Relations" was
Manager Response: I am sorry that you found our hotel only average because we try very hard to be better then that. In going over your comments I note that you stayed with us during the Christmas holiday along with 1,000 other people [when you count all the children] and as you can imagine it puts a real strain on our housekeeping staff as well as laundry facilities [99% of the time it is more then adequate]  Obviously we need to find a way to do a better job during these busy periods and we will. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks (dec22-jan5), overall I would rate this hotel very good.  Cleanliness: The hotel lobby is spotless.  As we were coming and going for our room during the day at numerous hours , we noticed a lot of people would order room service and put the dirty dishes in the hallway, it was noticed that some of these dishes sat in the hallway for the whole day.  As for our hotel room it was cleaned just ok, not the greatest,  the maid a lot of times forgot to put new glasses to drink from and washcloths in our room.    Location: We loved the location, we have a 4&5 year old and walked to disneyland everyday.  It was about a 10-15 minute walk and we walked past a 7-11 everyday where we could stop and pick up water to put in our backpacks.    Rooms, The room

Summary Heading: Don't Stay here, a rip off.....
Summary: This hotel is a rip off.  The free breakfast is a joke, food was so bad and so greasy I couldn't even eat it.  The restaurant chairs, floors, and furnishings are filthy dirty, dingy and old even though this is a newer hotel.  No Valet for the car, had to park a long ways away and tote 3 children 2 infants and all their stuff to the hotel.  And we had to pay for parking.  We asked for a crib in our room and didn't get one. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone....ever and I am a Hilton Honors member.  Oh, and the cookies are nasty, dry and old tasting.

Summary Heading: Good choice for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We gave the kids (14 and 9) a trip to Disneyland/Universal Studios for their birthday/Christmas present and decided to stay close to (versus in) Disneyland. It later turned out that the Disney hotels were booked anyway, but the price difference for a week stay was pretty significant.   As with our other bookings based on reading TripAdvisor first, we got what we expected here. The suite with 2 queen beds in one room and separate living room was a good space for 4 and the 7th floor overlooking the fireworks meant that we saw them every evening without having to be at the park at 9:25pm.  The room was clean and housekeeping was thorough (I made tea in the coffee maker and they always cleaned out the tea bags I left in there). My daughter did find an empty vodka bottle under the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your observations, and I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your stay. Obviously there is no excuse for anything to be left under the bed or for the nightmare you experienced with room service. Our Food & Beverage Manager will be contacting you, and hopefully he can determine when you stayed with us and who was working that night. Needless to say we are embarrased and intend to find out what happened. SORRY Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: We (wife and 2.5 year old daughter) recently stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Anaheim for a long-weekend getaway, and to visit Disneyland during the holidays. We stayed for 4 nights in a non-smoking one-bedroom suite with a king bed. I booked my reservation on their website and after reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor, I requested a room on one of the upper floors to hopefully drown out any street noise. We arrived on a Thursday at around 1:30pm, and despite the (typical) 3pm check-in time we were able to check-in right away. I know checking in before a hotel's stated check-in time slot is pretty much related to room availability (and not so much how nice the people are behind the front desk), so in this case I'm sure we got lucky that our room was available at

Summary Heading: excellent service and fresh clean rooms
Summary: Arrived in Anaheim after a 13hour flight from Australia.  The welcome from the front desk was fantastic and they quickly checked us in and advised that if we needed anything we just had to buzz.   The room (in our case a suite) was clean and the beds were comfortable and welcoming after such a long flight.  True to their word the "care" line was available for all our needs - even a fresh box of tissues at 12.30 at night !    We used room service on the first night due to jet lag and although expensive was the same as room service prices all over the world.     We found the walk to Disney a comfortable distance but could understand it could be difficult with toddlers after a long day in the park - Taxi is only $5us + tip Housekeeping service was the stand out for this hotel as
This was honestly one of the best stays at a Disney location hotel, the staff was courteous and the rooms super clean, free shuttles to disneyland and a great room service!

What a wonderful hotel! I stayed here after travelling around Europe, I had stayed in many hotels on this trip, and the Doubletree Guest suites was by far the best.  The staff were very flexible, it was no problem to change my room to a twin bed so my brother could stay with me.Huge, clean rooms, absolutely friendly staff , special mention must go to Garry on the tour desk, who organised an excellent trip to universal studios for me. The location is great, short walk to Disney, and a shuttle nearby provides easy transport to a huge shopping centre. I will be recommending this hotel to all my friends, and will definitely stay hear again!! Thank You for a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: best deal for disney with kids
Summary: Comfy beds and rooms, friendly staff and room service went above and beyond.  This is an ideal hotel for families heading to Disney for a fraction of the cost of a Disney affiliated hotel.  Shuttle picks you up and drops you off at Disney.  Kids loved the outdoor pool and spa.  We (the parents) loved putting the kids to bed in the bedroom suite, and hopping over to our living room suite to decompress from the day.  By the way, Chris is the best staff member on this Double Tree team.  Thank you Chris for making our stay so enjoyable!   We have stayed at the Grand Californian when our children were smaller for convenience and for family reunions, but this Doubletree offers better service, better food and more money in your back pocket for the same park experience.

Summary Heading: Second Visit as Good as the First
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim 2 years ago and enjoyed it very much.  When a return to Anaheim in 2009 became necessary, we wondered if we'd find the same hotel with good service, nice/clean rooms, and warm cookies as a check-in treat?    The answer is YES.    Thank you management for doing a good job in a tough business.

We had booked a King Suite, but upon arriving at the Suite we realized how loud the outside noise was.  All King Suites are located on the corner of a major intersection. The traffic noise was deafening.  When big trucks went by you felt like the room was vibrating.  We quickly asked to change to a quieter part of the hotel and were moved to a 2 Queen bed suite, which was fine and much quieter.  We really enjoyed this hotel, the restaurant for breakfast and the location.  The walk to Disney is a quick one.  My only suggestion for improvement would be the fitness room which had very little and outdated equipment.  Furthermore, there were children in the fitness room everytime I went in and they were treating the equipment like "toys".  I was afraid that they were going to break
Manager Response: OUCH...I am very sorry that you encountered so many problems during your recent visit and be assured that I will be addressing them with my staff. I am not much on excuses so will pass on that ,while still addressing two of the issues. I was not aware that the king suites were excessively noisy but will ask our chief engineer to monitor them ,and if necessary we will install an additional layer of glass.   As for the health club, we have budgeted to replace all the equipment  next year and will more closely monitor the use by children.   I am glad that for the most part you enjoyed your visit and hope that you will stay with us again.  Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: From Sydney Australia. Stayed here in October with teenagers. Room was good size with 2 queen beds & queen sofabed. Very clean & quiet. Hotel restaurant was available but we walked over the road to Denny's for breakfast. Free WiFi in foyer & business centre for email etc. Hotel parking was $11 day. Onsite laundry available. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Hotel is about 45min drive from LA airport. We visited Disneyland which is 5 min drive or 20 min walk (shuttle also available from front of hotel). Disneyland was very crowded and seemed to get busier after 6pm when California Adventure park closed. Fireworks show every night at 9.30. My teenage boys would have prefered Cal Adv Pk because they have more rides for older kids but we still enjoyed Disneyland.

Spent three nights here to do Disneyland. Nice room, good staff, overall great experience. Only improvement would be to move the hotel a half mile or so up Harbor Drive toward Disneyland, since the walk was a little much with a five year old. We walked up to Disneyland in the morning and then took a cab ($6 plus tip) back at night. Being able to see fireworks from our room was a real plus. Walking to Disneyland took about the same amount of time as driving to the Disney garage, parking and taking the people mover to the park, so if you don't have little kids and are of average fitness walking is the best option.  Room was clean, spacious, and quiet. No complaints, and I am picky. Hotel staff were terrific. Parking is $11 per day with unlimited in and outs. The distance between

We stayed three nights at this hotel during our recent Disneyland vacation (to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday). Our kids had a suite, and we were in a regular room. (The hotel staff nicely arranged for our rooms to be next to each other.)  The Doubletree is not inexpensive (although it's downright dirt-cheap compared to lodging we paid for this summer while in Greece). For the extra price, though, we had nice rooms that were very clean, comfortable beds and excellent service.  We twice ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant. The buffet (~$15) had plenty to offer, both hot and cold. It seems a bit overpriced, but is comparable to the nearby IHOP restaurant.  Disneyland is about a 15-minute walk away. Our kids are sufficiently old (24, 21 and 17) to comfortably handle this

This was the second time we had stayed at this hotel, with the last time being two years earlier. We were very pleased with our stay both times, and had similar experiences both times. This is a fairly new hotel (only 2 years old). The decor is nice and the facilities are modern and clean. When I arrived at 1am, the Front Desk representative greated me by name when I told him I was checking in with a reservation! I must have been the last reservation to check in that night? We had a small but very adequately sized room for two people, with a king bed. The beds are comfy and the hotel is quiet. The staff always said hello as we passed them in the hallways etc. The fitness center  has a treadmill, eliptical, stationary bike, and weights, and was very clean. The only downside to

Summary Heading: Ranked too high in this list
Summary: Just returned from 2 night stay at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. First time we've stayed near the park as we live in Socal and usually just come home. There are so many choices - at least 20 - that would be more convenient to the park than the Doubletree. It's too far to walk, and there are plenty of other hotels that are very walkable. Disney is all about figuring out how to get in, have your day, and get out, while minimizing the constant waiting and walking. Doubletree doesn't help with any of that. Also, especially relative to other Doubletrees I've stayed in, the suites are pretty small and unremarkable. Nothing to get excited about. The service however - as always with DT - was impeccable. If you do stay here the parking at the new Disney-related mall on the Harbor

The hotel was so nice!  The suites were very well laid out and gave us plenty of room to expand and not feel smooshed together.  I liked the nuetrogena bath supplies and even plan to go buy some! :)  The eatery was very nice, almost too nice for children, but instead they catered to our daughter and the chicken strips and fries were the best we have had.  We called for a crib late at night and were able to get one within a half hour.  It was very helpful and it wasn't a "cheap" crib that you are afraid to have your child sleep in.  So that was a bonus.  The pool and hot tub were wonderful.  We asked for a view of the fireworks and were accomadated with a wonderful view of the fireworks.  The ART picks/drops off right outside the hotel and that was ever so convient.  I really

Summary Heading: Overall good and close to Disneyland
Summary: We had 2 nights at the Doubletree this month at the start of a 2 week trip to California and Las Vegas. Our room was a good size and clean but not much of a view. We ate dinner both nights in their restaurant which was good in variety and quality. Breakfast was a  buffet - which had a very small selection of hot dishes. Staff were all friendly and helpful and you get a free warm cookie when you check in. Overall a good clean hotel to use for a visit to Disneyland, but get breakfast elsewhere.

I've stayed in 100s of motels in my time, and this one ranks up there in the top 2-3.  First off, they allow me to check-in early (11 a.m.) after a long flight into LAX.  Secondly, as soon as they know my name at the front desk at check-in they say, 'Welcome Back!"  This really makes me feel that I am a valuable customer, that they take the time and effort to keep track of repeat customers.  The cookies at check-in are a nice touch, but guests with food allergies should know they contain nuts.  The rooms are spotlessly clean and loaded with amenities.  Little things count, like a little tube of sunscreen on the counter in the bathroom, great tasting in-room coffee, outlets everywhere (even on the base of the table lamps!) for recharging your cell phone and ipod.  The bath mat is

Hotel was a pleasant surprise! Rooms were clean and spacious and service was good. The only complaint I would have is the walk to/from Disneyland...but there are shuttles that come like every 30 minutes. Overall it was a good experience and would we would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Best decision we made - would definately stay there again.
Summary: Found it on-line in New Zealand and advised Travel Agent it was the one we wanted.  She was a little dubious but we loved everything about it - great people, very reasonable restaurant & room service costs, excellent with the seperate bedroom with kids and Denny's right across the road.  Right on the 20min bus route for Disneyland and hourly bus to The Black at Orange.  Gary the Bellman was such a great help.  No complaints and will certainly stay there when we come back.  Have since recommended it travel agent for others too!

Summary Heading: Overall it was a very pleasant experience
Summary: When we arrived from Australia our room was ready. The room was clean and spacious and the beds were the most comfortable I have slept on in a hotel. The staff were friendly and pleasant. We would certainly recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Stayed 2 nights whilst visiting Disneyland last week and found the room comfortable (especially the pillows and beds) and convenient (took us 10-15mins to walk to Disney entrance). In fact the suites are ideal for a couple with child(ren) as the split bedroom area means you can put them to bed and stay up until you're ready to go to sleep.  The staff were friendly and helpful, the pool area was always clean and stocked with towels, and the restaurant was quite good for breakfeast, if lacking a little in the fruit/veg departments - I love a fresh banana or apple in the morning. That's America I guess, fancy growing up on pancakes, french toast and maple "flavoured" syrup! Room service was quick and efficient.  All in all I recommend the Doubletree and would return next time I'm

Summary Heading: Great value Hotel in Anaheim for families
Summary: Room fantastic - separate living room and bedroom, good quality and clean.  3 blocks from disneyland - 15-20 mins walk , bus service available closeby to disneyland or the block shopping at orange.  Would recommend to any family needing space, separate living areas and access to the theme park.

Summary Heading: Recommend this Hotel to anyone - Fantastic Value
Summary: we recently stayed 10 days at the Doubletree in Anaheim and can only repeat what many have already said on here, fantastic value for money, great room service and lovely big and clean rooms. We are a family of four, two adults and two teenagers, and needed a hotel with a decent size room/rooms, so after looking on trip advisor, decided to plump for the doubletree as it has two separate rooms which seemed ideal for our needs and gives a bit of privacy for everyone concerned. When we first walked in the hotel room we were very surprised by the size of the second room with tv, large sofa, table, chairs etc. I had imagined it would be a very small room tagged on to the double bedroom but it was equal in size to the large bedroom and seemed fantastric value for money. The rooms were

The next time you visit Disneyland, I recommend staying at the Doubletree on Harbor Blvd. The customer service was excellent. Especially in the Grappa Bar and Restaurant. The bartenders, waiters and the Manager were extremely friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Doubletree Suites recently for 5 nights, mainly influenced by the very favorable ratings of this hotel. While a clean and well located property, I am unsure why people like this property so much. The physical assets were all fine and as expected, but service was terrible. They failed us on service every time they had the opportunity to provide some. I have received much better service at some very ordinary hotels.  Specifics -  - The rooms are nice (we stayed in the 2 queen bedroom suite) but as one would expect. I for one thought that there were too many huge doors to get around all the time.  - Called in first night about setting the in room refrigerator to its coldest setting. House keeping told me how to set it to the warmest.  - Bought coffee at the
Manager Response: Way too many issues for one guest to endure, and for that I apologize. I have shared your review with the staff and we would all like an opportunity to make amends. If you would identify yourself by calling me, I will arrange for you to be our guest the next time you are in the area. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Doubletree with a few exceptions
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree on Harbor over Labor Day weekend from Sept 4-7.  This place is everything that you read about.  I’m not so sure about the people who say that it takes about 30 minutes to walk to the Disneyland main gate as we clocked ourselves at 20 minutes each time we did the walk.  So either you caught every “don’t walk” sign or you walk pretty slow.  The hotel was great.  We had a 2-room suite with 2 queen beds.  We have twin 1-year old boys who loved the layout of the room.  They were able to play hide and seek in the room through the 2 doors.  My wife and I loved the beds and the pack ’n plays were very cozy for our boys.  there were a number of kids on the floor and we NEVER had any issues with noise.  These walls are thick.  We stayed on the top floor and had
Manager Response: Thank you for so many nice compliments, and for verifying the time it takes to walk to the park. As for the problem with the Cribs not being delivered on time, it would be great if you could e-mail me at jeff.morse@hilton.com and let me know who you are so that I can find out what happened. Our records show that a crib was delivered to room 712 at 1:49 PM but that may have been the wrong room or the wrong time. As for the keys, we have been buying from the same vendor for 3 years and to my knowledge there isn't a systemic problem...but again having more information will help. Regards, Jeff Morse

Summary: We stayed here for a few nights between Christmas and New Year.  We arrived at LAX and took a rental car to this hotel.  Parking was an extra charge but hey, if you want to travel around the LA area, public transit is not an option in this area, I'm sorry to say.    The hotel is well located for Disneyland; about a 30 min walk away.  I notice that some reviewers actually drove to Disneyland from the hotel but this is quite unnecessary really.  Except that, after a day walking and standing in lineups at Disneyland, you might be happy to drive back to the hotel.    Since we never ate at any of the hotel restaurants or ordered room service, I can't comment too much on the service.  However, check in was fast, efficient and done with a smile.   The room was spacious, comfortable and

My family and I visited Disneyland for 3 days in August and chose to stay here based on the reviews.  We were not disappointed. My mother and younger sister shared a room and my husband, 22mos. old son, and I shared a room. The suites are perfect because we would come back to the hotel in the middle of the day so my son could take a nap.  We put him to sleep in the bedroom and we enjoyed a couple hours in the living room.  Per the advice of previous reviewers, I requested a north facing room on a higher level.  The first night we arrived we were able to watch the fireworks show in the distance (the following nights we enjoyed watching the fireworks in the park).  The lobby is clean and inviting and the staff is so welcoming. Every time we entered the lobby we were greeted by

First impressions mean a lot and when we arrived at the beautiful lobby we were immediately greeted by the staff who were probably the friendliest I've ever encountered.  We had a two room suite with two beds - and yes they are true queen size.  The room was absolutely spotless with towels perfectly arranged and bed linens crisp and also perfect - I mean the room could've been used as a model for a photo shoot.  The bath towels were huge and soft, unlike most hotels.  And for those of you who have whined about the water for sale in the room for $5, there were 2 500ml bottles of Sparkletts provided for us by the hotel. Nice.    This hotel is 0.7 mi from the Disneyland gate.  We usually stay in one of the Disneyland Resort hotels (prefer the Grand Californian which seems to always
Manager Response: WOW...what a nice review and great way to start our day. I read your comments to the staff, and after accusing the housekeeper and I of writing it ourselves, they left feeling a little better about the job they are doing. Thanks, Jeff

Summary: After researching hotels on this site, I opted for the Doubletree.  I was with two teenage girls and needed a suite with a separate bedroom.  The room was perfect, overlooking the pool and a view of the fireworks.  Had dinner at the bar one night, Salmon over greens, it was excellent!  The only down side to the food is the breakfast buffet.  Tasteless, but I guess it works for the kids. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful.  It is about 1 mile from Disneyland, we walked and took the bus, worked out fine. My only complaint is there is no free internet in the rooms and every time I went to the business center it was filled with kids, even thought it specifically says "Over 18 Only". After staying at other hotels in the area, this is the best one out there, QUIET,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review and for the wonderful rating. I would however like to respond to your two concerns. Unfortunately during the busy summer months, we get a lot of families and it's a challenge to control the usage of the free internet in the Business Center. We recently added two additional computers [bringing the total to five] and hope this will alleviate the problem. As for the breakfast buffet, I am meeting with the chef this afternoon to discuss your feeling about the food. We try to appeal to all ages by featuring seven hot items, a variety of fresh fruit, juices, yogurt, hot and cold cereal, assorted pastries, bagels, and toast, however as with everything I am sure there is room for improvement and we welcome the challenge.   Respectfully yours, Jeff Morse

Summary: Stayed here for an extended period for work and personal business. Excellent value. With my business rate got free parking and internet. Romm service was very good. The best pizza we had was from room service (better than Pizza Hut and CA Pizza Kitchen. Refrigerator could have kept things a little colder. Nice suite so someone could rest while others watched TV or played cards in the other room. Walking distance to Disney, but we drove every time. Can buy your Disney tickets at the hotel. Pool and hot tub are nice. Gym is adequate. Arcase has 3 video games of which only 2 work. Only 1 worked when we got there but I let them knopw and they fixed one of them. Quiet hotel. Orangewood side has traffic but from 5th floor it was background noise. Lower floors may be noisier. Hotel

Summary Heading: Quiet, clean hotel for 3-day Disneyland Trip
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at the Doubletree Anaheim.  It is about a 30-minute walk from the Disneyland Park entrance.  We walked each day up/down Harbor ave. with the kids in a double stroller.  This is a safe, easy walk, but just at the limits of what is reasonable for walking in my opinion.  The hotel does have shuttle service, but we didn't use it.  The hotel has modern restaurants and a Starbucks!  The hotel is at the border of the new, remodeled area for Disneyland vacationers (along Harbor Ave), and it was very modern, clean, and quiet.  We spent an evening at the hotel pool which was very nice (free towels, shaded sitting areas).  Parking was $11/night.  We drove to "Downtown Disney" one night for dinner, which was very nice and an easy drive from the hotel.  Our room was on

Summary Heading: Orangewood side of the hotel can get loud at night
Summary: We loved this hotel, room and service.  I called the care line to ask if anything could be done about the music in a local bar playing across the street (Saturday night).  They explained they knew that could be a problem and it may be out of their control, but the hotel called the bar and it did make a difference in the noise level.
Manager Response: Thank you for pointing out the noise coming from a bar across the street. This is the first complaint that I have received since opening the hotel three years ago,but intend to investigate [just walked over but no one is there yet] It's a small, local, nondescript bar thats been there forever. Needless to say we will speak to the owners and or city, to insure that their business does not interfear with ours. Sorry about that!!! Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Great value, good service, decent cleanliness
Summary: We stayed here on TripAdvisor user recommendation and we were again pleased with the outcome. Great price for a suite, reasonably close to Disneyland, and really friendly service. A few things were slightly "off" but nothing severe and we would stay there for sure next time. Off things: next door room service dishes sat outside their room for the whole day on the floor, family movies in the room were $14/15, and Agio, the restaurant had one server for the whole restaurant.  Things we loved: nice pool, great service, large rooms, great value, clean, great cookies. :)

I have stayed at the Doubletree twice in the past month.  Once for a wedding and another visiting a friend from out of town.  Both times we had exceptional service.  We were given a cookie at check-in and on our way to the elevator an employee stopped us and gave us more cookies.  Every person greeted us with a friendly "Hello and have a nice day".  The hotel is very classy, but it was the employees that made me want to come back again.

Summary Heading: Always our first choice in Anaheim
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times, and will return for our 4th stay this October. And we would not consider staing anywhere else when visiting Anaheim. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice, pool a bit small but still nice and always plenty of towels. Lots of shopping and dining options within walking distance. 10-15 mins. walk to Disneyland. The staff are always nice, smiling and willing to help.   During a previous stay we forgot an envelope with several hundred dollars in our room when we left. And when we returned to the hotel again 3 weeks later, they had kept the envelope for us, and of course not a single dollar was missing.  The only thing that puzzles me is the parking charge. I know that other hotels in the area charge for parking. But when you browse the 200+
Manager Response: Thanks for putting me on the spot "EUTraveller"...ho...ho... but also for having so many nice things to say about the hotel.  As for the parking charge , you are correct in pointing out that most of the other full service hotels in the area charge for parking. They do so because of the high demand for parking spaces around Disneyland and the Convention Center. By charging everyone, it makes controlling the lot much simpler. Now I would be less then honest if I didn't say that it is also a source of revenue for the hotel. We could build the charge into the room rate, but when people compare hotels, one of the things they look at are the rates, and just like with the airlines we want to appear as competative as possible. So the fact that my rates include free parking and another hotels doesn't isn't always taken into account when decisions are made. To those of you considering our hotel, we do charge $11 per night for parking, but I promise we will do everything possibe to make your stay the best ever.  Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Exceptional Hotel for a special occasion.
Summary: We were fortunate to spend one night after a wedding,rather than drive back home.On entering our room on the 7th floor,we were fascinated by the view and it's closeness to Disneyland and the hot cookies.We were astonished at the reception dinner,the food and such coordination in serving the dinner to the people at their tables.We heard many comments by others who also were as impressed as my wife and I regarding the manner in which the dinner was served,so well organized.We were impressed with our room and the service which we received in checking in and out.The hotel possessed all the qualities one could expect in such an establishment.

Our family of 5 stayed here for a wedding. We booked a queen suite for a great price through AAA. Check in was a breeze. Cookies were delicious. Room was very clean, spacious. Great to have refrgerator and microwave for kids.   My only complaint with this hotel is the nickel and dimeing. Don't make people pay extra for parking every night, up the price of the room $10 if need be. No free high speed internet? Really? In this day and age? And $5 bottle of water in the room? Once again, up the price a few bucks and put some Costco water in the room. People would love that. It's irritating to be charged extra for every little thing.

Summary Heading: Queen suite doesn't have queen sized beds - otherwise great stay
Summary: We selected the Doubletree Guest Suites over other nearby hotels such as the Hyatt and Marriott specifically because the Doubletree offered "queen suites".  Don't be fooled like us, as the queen suite doesn't have queen sized beds.  The queen suite is nice however.  Spacious enough for our family...  The service was exceptional, and the cookies - delicious.  In fact, we were given cookies anytime we asked.  This really is a nice hotel, and we'd stay here again should the opportunity present itself!
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you had a good time at our hotel. I would however like to point out that all of our Queen mattresses are in fact "Queens" measuring 60"x80". If you are accustomed to a King bed it will look a little smaller. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Stayed four nights on a business trip. Felt a little lost in the sea of families enjoying Disney attractions, but the hotel met all my travel needs comfortably. The complimentary (HHonors Diamond) breakfast was decent. There is a Denny's and Ruth's Chris less than half a block away. Another block or two gets you to a few dozen restaurants and attractions. Parking was $11/night.

This was the 3rd time I stayed at the Doubletree Anaheim.  As a matter of fact..the 2nd time this month.  I had originally planned on staying at the Clarion next door, but they did not accept my gift card I had so I left and went back to the Doubletree.  The staff was so awesome as always, and I really enjoyed the cookie.  After explaining my situation at the Clarion, the front desk clerk offered me a free buffett breakfast to "welcome me back".  For that I will always stay at the Doubletree - Anaheim.

Summary Heading: had a few front desk issues
Summary: Arrived at hotel at 10.00am after travelling for approx 20 hrs from Australia. Despite this girl at front desk was very unhelpful in assisting us with an early check in and we were basically told to come back in 3 hours when there MAY be a room available. She said that checkout time was 12 o'clock and to allow 1 hr for room cleaning. Surely there must have been someone that checked out prior to our arrival and a call could have been made to house keeping to service a room?? We were in our winter clothes due to different season and anyone who has travelled for this length of time can appreciate how tired (and smelly) we were and in desperate need for a shower and lie down. We were finally checked in 2.5 hours later by another person who hardly spoke to us and basically just
Manager Response: Boy can I relate to your predicament having recently travelled a long distance myself... and your right, you would think that a room could be made available sooner then later. Unfortunately, without your name I can't research the reservation, but hopefully thru a back channel you can provide it to me. Our desk clerks have been told to do everything possible to accommodate early arrivals and I am sorry that in this instance we dropped the ball. As for the breakfast coupons, again I would like to look at your reservation.Typically a Queen/Queen room accommodates 4 people and thats the number of coupons that are issued.To the subject of shuttles, very few hotels still operate their own since the city has mandated that our guests use the ART system. It picks up at the end of our drive every 20 minutes and costs $4 per adult and children 3-9 can ride for $1. The pass is good all day for as many trips as you want.  Again, I apologize for the problems you encountered and hope that I can obtain more information to better investigate your initial problem in getting a room. Respectfully yours, Jeff Morse

Summary: Not going to say much as this was our 4th stay at the doubletree (says it all) in the last 5 years. Very nice suite, very clean nothing to complain about, Great location, 10 mins walk to Garden Walk, 15 to Disney. Only grumble is that there is no wifi in rooms but did manage to pick up Travel lodge access so didn't mind that much.

As in most Doubletree’s, this one was nice. Even though my party arrived three hours prior to check in, we were accommodated by the desk staff. The rooms were nice and well cleaned. The only issue I had was with housekeeping neglecting to stock the bathroom. You will learn if you stay here, the housekeeping and maintenance staff has a little bit of an issue on getting your request handled correctly. For instance, one day a guest traveling with my party was delivered towels when she had requested wash cloth, and one day I requested wash cloths and never received them without a second phone call. Besides those issues, the remainder of the staff was extremely nice and accommodating. If you need anything arranged, see the Concierge. One day he was able to arrange transportation for

We have been to Doubletree recetly. We booked Sweet Summer Deal offered by hotel, it looked attractive but it was expensive. I booked it as we have two young kids in family and summer seet deal offered free continental breakfast to us and kids eat lunch & dinner of their choice at no charge if adults buy entrees in the restaurant. We paid $189/night. Room was nice, big & clean. It is around a mile from Dinseyland. Hotel lobby has a disney desk & starbucks.   Best thing in the hotel is SERVICE in Restaurant...great guys, always go extra mile for you. Hotel offers free lunch & dinner to younger kids (when adult buys an entree) at Ajo restaurant anyways to everyone so I am not sure of the value of Summer Sweet Deal, we booked. Worst part of hotel was pool. It is not well maintained
Manager Response: I am sorry that you experienced problems with our swimming pools. Without knowing more specifics, I am guessing that you could have gotten in the spa after it had been drained and refilled. We do this quite often to assure that our guesta have the cleanest water possible, but it does take serveal hours to reheat. I am not sure what to say about the  skin condition that your children developed as we check all chemical levels several times a day, and would close the pool should the water be out of balance. Perhaps you could tell me the day and time that you used the pool. I am glad that overall you enjoyed your stay and hope that you will return ,to give us an opportunity to make amends. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Let me clarify one thing that seems to be off with these reviews, I specifically timed myself walking from the front door of the hotel to when I arrived inside Anaheim Disney (actually inside the park, not just approaching from Harbor Blvd) it took about 18 minutes for me by myself and with my pregnant wife and two kids (in a stroller) it was closer to 30 minutes.  Sorry, there seem to be some discrepancies here, just wanted to clarify.  With that said, I enjoyed the walk from the hotel and I consider 18 minutes to be well within walking distance of the park.  The hotel was very nice, the staff were cheery and welcoming and the room was clean.  Nothing overly special about the hotel other then the free cookies, but it is a great place to stay new Disney.   The one downfall, as

Just returned from a 2 night stay with husband and our 2 and 1 yr old sons for their 1st trip to Disney.  Our check-in was quick and courteous and the warm chocolate chip cookies definately lived up to their reputation.  Entering the lobby and elevators you feel as if you are in a 4-5 star hotel.  Entering our room we were just as happy.  The 2-room suite was very clean, comfortable and spacious enough for our little ones to run around.  The furnishings were more modern that what they appeared on the picturers. The two seperate living areas with doors on both sides are very nice for those travelling with older kids or parents.  Also, the seperate shower and sink area is nice so that two people can get ready at once.  The bedding and the several pillows were extremely

Just got back from two night stay with 50-ish parents, 10 yr. old nephew and 4 yr. old son.  All enjoyed the stay -- suites were roomy, modernly styled and neat w/ adequate towel service and Neutrogena toiletries.  Kids enjoyed the pool (though a bit small); parents enjoyed hot tub; I enjoyed the bar.  It's not the Hilton or The Disneyland Hotel, but it's a nice place to "live" in and return to during the Disney experience.  And the signature warm chocolate chip nut cookie sets the stay off right.

Our experience at the Doubletree was excellent. We surprised our 8 year old daughter with a trip to Disneyland for her birthday and our stay at this hotel was perfect. We had a double queen suite and it was nice to have the 2 separate living spaces so that the kids (8 year old daughter and 15 year old son) could have their own TV and couch while my husband and I could relax in the separate bedroom. The kids loved the pool area where they spent most of their time when we were at the hotel, oh and the cookies are amazing! I am very particular about the hotels I stay in and I was very impressed with this hotel. It was clean, the linens were comfortable and the towels were clean and fluffy. If we are ever in the area again, the Doubletree is where we will stay.

Summary Heading: go past the budget places and stay here
Summary: My husband and 8 year old daughter and I stayed here in May - our first time to Disneyland. We had an opportunity to spend less and stay at the budget places right outside of Disney, but opted to spend a little more and stay in a nicer hotel, and get a nicer room. Wow, did it pay off! We booked a one bedroom suite - it had two queen size beds, full living room  and nice large bathroom. We loved it! It made a huge difference to have the room. Hotel is lovely, great food, beautiful lobby and it has a Disneyland off site office/contact person right in the hotel. This was great for info and maps. We asked for a room facing the grounds, ask for floor 6 or seven, and you can see the fireworks every night! We moved the couch over to the window, shut off all the lights, made popcorn,

We have stayed here two times and both have been very satisfactory. Rooms/suites are spacious, staff is very friendly and helpful and rate is resonable. You can take a walk to Disneyland park - it is less than a mile away.

Summary Heading: SLUMBER PARTY HEAVEN FOR 12 YEAR OLDS!!
Summary: This hotel was WONDERFUL!!  Luxury rooms.  Carpet had great padding.  Felt squishy beneath bare feet.  Granite counters in bath and on tables.  Beautiful lamps, furnishings, super comfy beds.  We had a double queen suite.  TV's in both rooms. Games for the kids.  Big, roomy, rooms.  You could actually move around.  We had 6 people in our room and it was very comfortable.  Pull out bed was even comfortable.   The staff were very attentive.  Cookies for everyone... so good!  At check in, I told the employee, her name was Alice, that it was my daughter's birthday and that we were having a slumber party at the hotel.  Alice immediately had a bouquet of birthday balloons sent up to the room, so that when we walked in, they were waiting for my daughter.  She also sent up extra towels

Summary Heading: Everything you want and need but no 'extras'
Summary: We had a four night stay here which was overall great. The location is not the closest to Disneyland but if you don't mind a 20 minute (ish) walk, then it's fine. The rooms were clean and roomy, and the staff were good.  The pool was nice however the gym equipment was a bit old.  We didn't have any problems and would stay here again.

We stayed for 4 nights at the end of May as we visited Disneyland, leaving June 1st. We had a 1-bedroom suite, which was nice for the 5 of us. The safe was a great addition, and the fridge and microwave.  The beds were so comfortable - that is why we booked the Doubletree and not something closer to the park. It was absolutely worth it. We took the ART bus - if the 6 wasn't coming, we would take the 5 or the 14. We didn't wait long after the first night, once we figured out we could take different routes. We swam the last evening we were there since the weather was in the low 60's all week (not what we were expecting!!). The pool was nice - tons of towels. The room was totally quiet - we didn't hear anything in the halls or outside. We ordered room service once - it came fast,
Very clean, good food, 24hr Denny's across the street.

I was attending a conference centered at the Anaheim Hilton and, based on the TA reviews, I decided to stay instead at the Doubletree.  It was just ok.  I was a little disappointed in that it was nothing special, but the rate I got was much better than even the conference rate at the Hilton.  I’m a Hilton Honors member so either would have been fine.  I was surprised to be so close to the elevator as that’s one of the benefits I’ve enjoyed as a HHonors member.  BUT, they did give me a snack welcome so I didn’t have to pay the $5.00 for a bottle of water !  One thing I noticed right away when I entered the room was the mildew smell.  Granted, I’m super sensitive to molds and mildew with my allergies but the room just smelled musty.  It was clean though and I soon found the
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you were dissapointed in your recent stay as it's our goal to exceed our guests expectations. I hope you are able to respond to my inquiry as to your date of arrival and room number. Theoretically we have a "fail safe" system in place that insures we follow up on every guest request within five minutes. Obviously something happened and I would like to investigate. At the same time I will be able to determine why you were not given a choice of rooms, as we try very hard to honor all special requests. Housekeeping will be checking all rubber bath mats today to be sure that there are no others that smell musty. As for the restaurant being over priced, I am not sure how to respond as our menues are actually priced a little lower then most of our competitors. We do charge for the internet and parking, again the same as the Marriott, Hilton, Sheraton, etc...but I also understand that there are some hotels that don't and your point is well taken.
