Before signing off, let me thank you for telling it like it is and invite you back ,so that we might have an opportunity to make amends. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary: Had been looking for a hotel near Disneyland for a weekend getaway and read the reviews of the Doubletree.  It did not disappoint us at all!  Staff were very friendly, and as the norm at check-in got the cookies.  We had heard that the north side of the hotel could see the Disney fireworks, but it turns out that most of the rooms were doubles, so we were on the south side.  The room was nicely appointed and although our window was facing a street, there was no noise.   We enjoyed the jacuzzi, although the pool was a bit on the small size.  The lounge was cozy, and I was a bit shocked that a Cosmo was $10, but it was bigger than average and had good quality vodka.  We didn't eat at the restaurant, but walked next door to the Ruth Cris Steakhouse. The reason why we chose this

You simply can't beat this place for value, location, service.  I'm a Hilton Diamond member so stay at Hilton properties a lot. This property has one of the best, most hands-on and attentive managers in the business in Jeff Morse. We spent a week here as we took our toddler to Disney Land for the first time. The spacious, tranquil well-lit room allowed me to have the best of both worlds -- to get a lot of work done in between my Disney visits, and to relax fro a long day of work and fun. It also has a sumptuous breakfast buffet, with fabulous selection (my one wish would be they'd also have a lighter roast coffee to choose from, since the coffee was incredibly strong/bitter).  We'll be back here in July and already look forward to it!

Summary Heading: staff are friendly and helpful, 15 to 20 mins walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here early May 09. Our reason for staying here was to visit Disneyland. We stayed at 2 different hotels in the Anaheim area over our visit to Disneyland and this was a very nice place to stay the staff were friendly , the hotel was clean and the pool was very nice to swim in.  We had a package deal with breakfast included, so each morning it was nice to go down and eat a full buffet breakfast. At night we ate at there restaurant, it was good value as kids eat free. The walk to Disneyland was easy and you walk though 3 sets of traffic lights along the road. It took us 15 minutes at a fast walk. There is a Target store near by and Shopping at Block at Orange not far away aswell. We enjoyed our stay here

Summary Heading: Very nice, newer, clean hotel, great value.
Summary: Stayed at hotel with mom and uncle as we went to and enjoyed Disneyland.   Selected hotel based on reading many excellent reviews.   Hotel was wonderful, pretty new and very clean with excellent service.

We stayed 5/5/09 thru 5/10/09. We all loved the hotel, it is new, nice and the staff was very helpful. We all commented what great hotel. We all just wished it was closer to Disneyland. The Anaheim resort tranist was okay, but you have to plan your day a little.  Each room has a mini frig and microwave. Parking is $11 per day, which not unusual in the Anaheim area.   We used Vons delivery and were able to save money on snacks in the park.  The hotel restaurant "Agio" is a 4.5 star. The prices are decent, but there is a Denny's across the street.

Summary Heading: Disney isn't the only place that is Magical...
Summary: This is a lovely hotel and the service is outstanding. From the check-in staff, to the bell service, to the cookies, to the bedding. to the neutrogena products, to the breakfast buffet... this is a great venue for adults, families, business people alike. We had a great stay and the proximity to Disneyland Park couldn't be more convenient. After a couple of trips to the park, we decided to take a taxi which worked out the best (and about the same cost as the bus for a group our size). I would come back to this hotel in a second. GREAT STAY.

Summary Heading: a very comfartable hotel and very nice and clean
Summary: we stayed in the hotel for 4 nights - a family of 5 .  The hotel's welcome was with very tastey cookies . The room was big , convenient and clean. A lthough we didn't go to disney , it is very convenient to stay there (with a car) and  the surrounding is very pleasant and safe to be even at night.   I would suggest the hotel not to take an extra charge for parking.

The Doubletree was very clean. I liked that the sheets didn't have a smell - often that keeps me from sleeping when in hotels. Check-in was a breeze. Parking was expensive, and I actually paid too much because my boyfriend ended up leaving early to go back to work and I still paid for another day of his parking. The room was a little noisy - traffic below was loud even on floor 6, and my neighbors had kids. Apparently they fixed the door so the kids could go in and out of the room without letting the door lock, so it kept banging and making my room shake. This wasn't the hotel's fault, though, just evidence that families do stay there. Room service was fast and good. Employees were courteous when passed in the hallways. And checkout was a cinch because they had my credit card on

Summary Heading: Great last night to our vacation!
Summary: We decided to stay here due to the reasonable proximity to LAX.  Although we were traveling with young children, we did not go to Disneyland but what a perfect hotel for those that are.  We were welcomed with the trademark cookie and quick and friendly service.  After checking in and driving 2 hours in a car with small children, we decided to head to the bar.  The lovely bartender Norma was great with the kids (thanks for the extra cherries!) and made us feel welcome.  We left Easter Sunday for our flight home and we were greeted by the Easter Bunny himself!  What a nice touch for the kids who would have otherwise missed out. (very hard to hide Easter eggs on an airplane!) If we ever head back to that area I would most certainly stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel - comfortable - good choice for Disney-goers
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for Washington State spring break (3/31-4/5). Check-in was a breeze. We rec'd warm cookies. There is a latte stand serving starbucks coffee, and restaurants but we didn't eat there. We used the parking, which is $11/day and a charge I'd rather do without. Wireless internet only available in the lobby. We had a two room suite with 2 queens and a sofa bed. Seemed average size. The beds were SO comfortable. Granite countertops and nice furniture. 2 TVs was nice. We had a mini fridge and microwave, and stocked up on basics at Target, about 1/2 mile south. (Cereal and milk, popcorn, water,etc). Water in the park is like $3 bottle so we saved by bringing our own. The pool was super as well as the hottub. We watched the fireworks at Disney at least 3 times

Summary Heading: "Comfy beds, warm cookies upon arrival and friendly staff"
Summary: My husband and I stayed here after reading many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. After a long trip to Anaheim we were cheered up immediately when we entered our room. I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and would choose the Double tree again in a heart beat! There was no long line up to check-in--it was fast and easy and we were treated very nicely and given warm chocolate chip cookies. We dove onto the two queen sized-beds (with sweet dreams embroidered on the pillows) and relaxed in our room before walking to Disneyland. If you have a lot of kids I would recommend taking the ART over walking as it took us about 15 minutes to walk there at a fast pace. This was fine for us but late at night with kids you will be too tired to walk back. However the ART comes every 20 minutes

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disney, but a good value
Summary: I stayed one night on my own while on a business trip to LA.  I was there mostly to visit Disney and wanted a nice cheap hotel within walking distance.  It was about a 15 minute walk, which was fine with me.  Hotel itself was nice, exactly what you'd expect from DoubleTree.  It was not unusually elegant or anything, and was more of a business class hotel than tourist.  I got my cookie at check in (ok, every time I walked through the lobby), so I am happy.  Parking was free, which was a nice feature in LA!  There was a pharmacy store right across the street that was handy for snacks.

This was our second time staying here so we knew what to expect as far a distance from Disney, etc (a few long blocks, we took the shuttle).  Service was excellent and the pool area clean and inviting with a view of the fireworks (we sat in the hot tub one night, only slightly blocked by another hotel).  Some new tips I learned were the following:  I asked for a room on the north side, high floor and was accommodated with a room on the 4th floor (highest available when we were checking in).    It had a great view of the pool and the fireworks which we watched from bed the first night!  Denny's directly across the street for breakfast to save a few bucks (though the hotel breakfast is reasonable and good).  Coffee bar is great for a breakfast on the run (yogurt, pastries, fresh

Just got back from a 4 day stay at the Doubletree Suites with my wife and 2 teenage children, and really enjoyed our stay.  The hotel was very clean, well maintained, and provided a very comfortable home base for our time at the Disney Parks. We had a 1 bedroom suite which had 2 queen beds in one room and a fold out sofa in the seperate living area.  The bathroom was large and was well designed...great shower pressure also. My 19 year old son slept in the sofa bed in the living area which allowed him to stay up later if he wanted to and did not disturb my wife, daughter and I who stayed in the bedroom area which worked out very well. The elevators were very efficient.  The Cafe' Bistro was great for Starbucks coffee in the morning and the $5 Breakfast Bagel with egg, canadian

Summary Heading: Not As Good As I Expected
Summary: The cookies were great--you get a warm one at check-in--but the front desk gal who checked us in and gave us the cookies gave us no warm reception. I guess the cookie's the warmest thing you should expect there. Her attitude was arrogant bordering on indifferent; I figure she should be working behind the scenes rather than in such a visible position.  The room was beautiful--a one bedroom suite--but it had its shortcomings. First and foremost was the slow-draining vanity sink: soap scum galore clinging to the sink after every use. Then there was the ice dispenser outside that was audible everytime it was used.   Across the street is a gas station with a 24-hour mini-mart/liquor store. Some of the patrons were less than desirable in appearance and demeanor (think intervention).
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that one of our desk clerks was not very hospitable. That is totally unexceptable and unlike the 99.9% of our staff who go out of their way to treat guests in a warm friendly manner. Thank you for sharing your observations with me as it helps me in managing the hotel. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary: We stayed here just one night, and did enjoy the comfortable bed.  This is not a luxury hotel, but it was a good choice for a good night's sleep.  The breakfast in the hotel dining room was below average, and we had to sit in the lobby for wireless service, but it is only a few blocks from Disneyland.

Stayed from 3/11 to 3/14 on a family vacation to Disneyland. It is too far to walk to the theme parks if you have young children (about 1.1 miles). For adults it would be okay to walk, but perhaps too much after a full day at the parks. The Anaheim Resort Transit works well enough from this hotel. There is an ART ticket kiosk across the street in the Travelodge. Also, the nearby Denny's sells ART passes for 50% off. The pool was great. The room was clean and nice.   There are several food options within walking distance:  a Carl's Jr. and a Taco Bell within one block, Denny's across the street, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse next door.  My only complaints are the $11 per night parking charge and no WiFi in the rooms. The parking charge makes me want to stay in a property closer to the
I had a very good stay. Nice spacious 1br suite. Free coffee. Solid service. There's a bus I could hop on to go to Disney land. Would go back if I go to the area.

We stayed for one night on a girl's overnigt trip to Disneyland.  We walked there from the hotel.  It was not too far at all!  We took a cab back that we picked up at Downtown Disney because we were so tired.    Rooms were immaculate and decor looked new, no wear.   Check in easy.  Evan Smith is a manager and was very helpful, friendly.  We had two vehicles, they charged us for only one just to be kind and graciously didn't bother to mention that they had done so.  Suite had a microwave and fridge, comfortable beds!  Happy!

I stayed here for six nights on business, booked the room as a walk-in.  Was supposed to stay at Cortona but got a weird vibe so I headed to the Doubletree.  I didn't realize it was a Doubletree Suites, which was a bonus.  My room was next to the elevator, but the bedroom was tucked in back so I didn't hear a thing.  Very very clean, large and comfortable room.  Nice service.  Warm cookies.  Fridge and microwave.   Only complaint was there were gnats at the bar which I constantly had to swat away.  So when you come to this highly recommended hotel and want a drink just sit at a table rather than at the bar.  Very walkable to convention center.  Good fitness center, open 24 hours.  Game room with Ms. Pac Man.

This hotel has lived up to its very positive comments.  I almost don't want to tout all the good things --almost like Orange's best kept secret that I want to keep to myself!  I'm a frequent business traveler to Orange and have tried many hotels in the area.  To date,  my favorite has been the Doubletree on City Drive but this property meets/exceeds expectations I have built at their sister property.    Rooms are spacious, quiet, professional and immaculate.  I'm a single, business traveler so I try hard to avoid the rundown family hotels that are de riguer in this part of town.  This hotel is excellent for a frequent business traveler!  They could comp wireless in rooms but that's a minor  "complaint".  Staff is extremely efficient and pleasant.  Self-parking ($11/night) is

We recently stayed here from 2/14-2/17 and found everything about this hotel great.  The location to Disneyland was nice, a bit out of walking distance but you have other options to get there.    The room was a suite and had a nice seperate living room.  It was great for us being able to put the kids to sleep and sit up and enjoy some quiet tv relaxation time after sepnding all day at the parks.  The room was very clean, essentially spotless.  It looked rather new and the beds were great, including the bedding.  I don't think I have a single complaint about this place, it was a great experience. Upon checkin you get the doubletree cookies, which were warm and delicious :-)  My birthday is on V-Day so I decided instead of going out that we would hit up the hotels restaurant Agio.

Summary Heading: Fabulous Service - have stayed here repeatedly
Summary: I  have been back and forth between Ohio and CA many times in the last 6 months, and have always chosen to stay at the Doubletree Anaheim when in LA.    I spend 3-4 nights a week, 40 weeks a year in hotels, usually Hilton-brand.  I have never been let down by the Doubletree Anaheim.  The property is lovely, but what stands out the most is the service.  The room service staff is fast, efficient, and so friendly.  The food is delicious, and not *once* has my order been delivered incorrectly (which often happens with room service!).  Every time I talk with a staff member of the Doubletree, I'm asked, "Are you having a nice time, are you enjoying the weather," etc.    As I checked out during my last visit, there was a customer at the front desk who was upset about something - the

Summary Heading: Very comfortable hotel for family stay
Summary: We chose the Doubletree Guest Suites based on its high trip advisor rating and we were not disappointed. The suite was very comfortable for our family of 4, staff excellent and the ambiance was really nice with a lovely christmas feel for December. Range of complimentary toiletries was great as was the welcome cookies. This was a good location for Disneyland - it was about a ten minute walk however the shuttle bus collects guests directly from the front of the hotel every 30 mins so quite convenient. Lots of nearby dining options.Buffet breakfast was great with good quality and choice. Loved the french toast and bacon. A great hotel!

Summary Heading: Best Anaheim Hotel for the Business Traveler
Summary: I have been booking the DoubleTree for several years now, for a yearly convention. I have stayed at sereral different hotels in the Anaheim area and I have to say, I have been the most pleased with the DoubleTree rooms and the quality of service they offer. The hotel and staff are truly a blessing for me and make it easy to book my block of rooms. They make it an easy choice for when I come to Anaheim area.  They are about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the convention center and the hotel never seems crowded during the conventions. The Anaheim Resort Shuttle picks up and drops off right at the hotel so no need for cabs to get a bite to eat. You are also within walking distance to many great restaurants. The hotel bar and restaurant are great. Morning breakfast in the lobby is quick

We (a family of 4 and my 83 year old Mom) just visited the Doubletree Guest suites in Anaheim for my 10 year old daughters birthday trip to Disneyland. The hotel is fabulous. At check-in we were greeted warmly by the check in staff and even the bellboy spoke and welcomed me even though I had left our luggage out in the car. Check in was a breeze and when I asked for a view room to see the fireworks over Disneyland, he quickly changed my room number and gave me a great room with a full view of the Disneyland area. We also were given the yummy warm chocolate chip cookies we love at the Doubletree hotel chain!  We stayed in a 2 room-2 queen suite. The room was perfect for 5. Plenty of room with a small living room area with hide-a-bed couch and TV area. Small fridge and micro in

Summary Heading: Great hotel!  Need wifi in rooms!!!
Summary: We've been staying at this hotel every year the past few times we've come to Disneyland.  It's an easy 15 minute walk to the gates of Disney.  The rooms are very nice, with granite countertops, etc.  The only thing that I would ask is that they provide wifi coverage in the rooms!  The only place that you can pick up their wifi is in the lobby.  It's really not that expensive to provide wifi throughout a building of that size, and with a hotel of that calibre I would expect it.

Summary Heading: it's a long walk to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed in a 2 room suite.  The room is very nice and large, and the hotel is nice too. Unfortunely it's a looong walk to Disneyland, specially after a long day in the park, or if it's cold.   But it's a great option if you are attending a convention.   Next time i'm trying a hotel closer to the park gates.
Manager Response: You are right about the walk, particularly after a long day at the park [15 minutes] but I hope we made you aware of the trolly shuttle service. It runs to and from the park every 20 minutes and only costs $4 per adult and $1 per child. Thank you for sharing your observations and hopefully we will have another opportunity to serve you. Jeff Morse

Summary: Great hotel. We checked in here for two nights at the start of our trip round California. We were pretty jet lagged and it was the perfect crash pad to catch up on sleep and re-energise before hitting Disneyland. The suite was huge with a seperate living room and large bathroom with neutrogena bath products. Just  a short walk from Disneyland and all the major eateries. Didn't use the pool but it was ample if you just want a quick swim to unwind. You can also watch the fireworks from the hotel which is handy if you have tired legs after walking round the parks all day. The breakfast was a bit pricey but had a good selection of continental and cooked food. The warm cookie on arrival is a nice touch.

What can I say?  The Doubletree certainly lived up to its number 1 ranking on Trip Advisor!   After a long 14 hour flight from Melbourne we (2 adults and kids aged 9 and 7) arrived at the Doubletree at 9.00am, they knew we were coming early, but we did not expect our room to be ready until after 2pm - however, much to our joy, it was!  Fantasitc way to start our holiday.  The staff on check in were warm and friendly, the concierge very helpful.  The room itself was clean, comfortable and well maintained.  The bed was awesome - so comfortable, sheets soft and warm, we slept so well!!!  Now we are home, our own bed just doesn't cut it!  The room set up was great, we had the suite with seperate living area which was so nice, we could put the kids to bed and still stay up watching

Great hotel! Nice big clean rooms and very kid friendly.  This hotel exceeded my expectations.  The staff from the front desk, agio restaraunt and the bar were all super friendly and very helpful.  The ground were always very clean and staff seemed to be always in a good mood.  I have stayed at the embassy suites down  the road and I would rate this hotel definately a step above. If you have any specific questions you can email me at mjhutee@hotmail.com.

Summary Heading: A little disappointed but still great
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites 12/25-12/29 for our annual Christmas Disneyland trip.  Normally we stay a little bit further down the street at the Embassy Suites, but this time we had grandma and two nephews for a total of 7 and needed two rooms.  Got a decent price for connecting suites through Hilton Honors.  Very clean comfortable suites w/ separate bedroom and living area.  Living area has fold-out sofa which is adequate for small children.  Staff was great and lobby spectacular.  Liked the cleanliness and updated decor. Disliked and disappointed w/ the overall size of the suites.  The bedrooms were nice sized, but the living areas were narrow and cramped.  A lot smaller than the Doubletree Guest Suites in Orlando, which we stayed at in Feb 2008.  The real problem

I picked the DoubleTree based on the top rated reviews from this site. I have to say that I was very impressed with this hotel. Check-in was a breeze, parking was easy to get. And let me say that it's not a close walk to Disneyland, but it was actually nice to be kind of AWAY from the closer hotels near Disney. They offer the shuttle to Disney which is fantastic to use, because it drops you right off in front of the hotel. We had the 2 queen double bed 2 room suite, and I just want to say that this is one of the nicest places I have stayed at. The room was so spacious for FIVE PEOPLE! Big bathroom, big rooms, and just overall clean and NICE. We never had any problems with anything, and I have stayed at other DoubleTree Hotels in different cities, and this was the best one yet!

Our family group of 10 stayed at the doubletree suites for 10 nights from 26/09/2008 and it was fantastic.The rooms were large , very clean & comfy.The separate bedroom & living areas are excellent .All the staff were great & Gary Love the concierge went out of his way for us many times.Agio restaurant in the lobby serves great food, very large servings at great prices.The pool area is set out well& there is lots of room to relax.The location of the hotel is fantastic disneyland is 10 min walk in one direction & target is 10 min walk in the other,denneys , taco bell etc. are all close by.If you are going to disneyland you must stay at the doubletree suites.

I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at over 50 different properties run by Hilton. I always stay at this Doubletree when I am working in Santa Ana it is very conveniant right on Harbor. The room is clean and nice, starbucks in the lobby. The food is not great but a nice bar area. No wifi but if you don't want to pay from some rooms you can pick up free signal from one of the neighboring hotels (worth a check) there is connected internet which is ok. Short walk to Disney, not a lot of reasonable food choices (Ruth Cris, and Mortons close by). If you have a car you can go stright down the Harbor to Newport there is great food there (about a 20 minute drive) or down the coast to Luguna which is a great out trip if you had enough Disney well worth the ride.
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you are a regular guest and I appreciate the feedback. Perhaps the next time you are in town we could have coffee, or something stronger, and we could discuss your comment about the food. We are always looking for ways to improve. As for our internet connections, we provide our own free WiFi in all the public areas, just not the rooms as yet [they are hard wired] Hope to meet you soon. Jeff Morse

Summary: We recently stayed at the hotel for a short trip to Disneyland.  We chose the hotel because of its high TripAdvisor rating.  The hotel was very attractive and the room was clean and well-appointed.  The staff was professional and welcoming.  We walked to and from the park.  It is about a mile to the main gate.  We certainly got our exercise.  Good stay.  Good hotel.

I was prepared for a satisfactory stay based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor, but when we arrived at this hotel, I was pretty much blown away.    The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the general feel of the hotel itself  is  fairly upscale; it is very tastefully decorated.  The property is located fairly close to Disneyland -- maybe about a 15-20 min. walk,  and about a 10 minute walk to the Anaheim Gardenwalk, where there is shopping and a good selection of restaurants that would appeal to most people. Target is located about a 10 minute walk south on Harbor Blvd, which is good for water/snacks.    Also, the signature Doubletree warm chocolate chip cookies were great and extras were freely and generously handed out by the staff.  Another great amenity
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share you observations of our hotel, and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay. As for the evening temperature, I would love to know which room you were in so that we could check the unit. We have both hot and cold water circulating at all times so you shouldn'd have had a problem cooling the room, but you did?? I would also like to check on the water pressure in that particular room, as I am not aware of any problems. Thanks again for sharing your comments and for choosing the Doubletree Guest Suites.Happy New Year!! Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Great hotel -- 15 minutes walking distance from DL
Summary: Great hotel with wonderful all-around service.  Every day, the room was cleaned impeccibly.  The front desk answered all our questions with a smile on their face and the bellhop was there to load and unload our numerous bags with care and speed.  ART stop in front of the hotel was nice although we decided to take the 15 minute walk a couple of times from the DL entrance to the hotel as the ART is not very dependable in the afternoon/evening.

After reading the reviews on Trip advisor, we decided to spend that little bit extra on getting a room at this hotel. We wish we hadn't bothered now as it was over priced and mediocre. We have spent nearly three weeks traveling around California, Nevada and Arizona and this has had to be the least value for money we have had. They charge for everything...bottled  water in the room, internet access in your room (no wifi), parking and breakfast. The only plus side was that it was a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.   When we arrived the bathroom and coffee machine had not been cleaned properly. Hair was in the bath, there was left over coffee grinds in the machine. They did send up housekeeping when I complained however but with some reluctance. I also found one of the

The DoubletreeGuest Suites in Anaheim was the first stop on mine and my girlfriends LA / Vegas / San Fran 16 night tour. Was absolutely shattered after the trip from the UK, however was very pleased that we chose this Hotel.  Really nice Hotel, in a great location; not too far from centre of LA + quite near to Newport Beach. Ideal Anaheim location for LA Angels Baseball and Disneyland.  Hotel was very clean, good amenities, great comfy room, with superb bed. Not a bad thing to say about this Hotel.  Would 100% stop their again. Great start to a fantastic trip.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree.  When we stayed in Anaheim 3 years ago at the Disneyland Hotel we were less than impressed.  So this trip I was determined to do the research and get better value for our money.  After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we decided on the Doubletree and we were not disappointed.  The standard of the rooms were excellent and the location was very good.  We walked to Disneyland a few times, but mostly we used the all day pass on the shuttle bus.  We were forwarned by the previous reviews about the irratic schedule of the bus, so knowing this we didn't get too upset if we had to wait.  As it does a loop we knew it would come eventually.  The restuarant in the Hotel was very good, we had a dinner and two breakfasts there, but the

Our family of four (us and two kids aged 2 & 5) just returned from a 10 day stay at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Anaheim.  We are seasoned travelers and have traveled to the Anaheim area many times and have stay in many of the hotels in the area.  We prefer to stay at nicer hotels (4 or 5 star).  This was our first time staying at the Doubletree.  We picked this hotel based on the excellent reviews and the excellent rate that we got from the hotel website.  We paid an unbelievable $104/night for a two queen bed, two room non-smoking suite.  The hotel property is very nice and well kept.  It is a newer hotel and it still looks brand new!  It is conveniently located about 1 mile from Disneyland (probably too far to walk).  You can request a room that faces Disneyland so that you

Just leaving after a three night stay and loved this hotel so much I had to write a review before I left.  Free internet - a big plus!!!!  Rooms are fantastic, perfect for a family as there is a separate lounge area.  On the main boulevarde in a perfect position for Disneyland.  Staff are friendly and helpful , rooms are extra clean.  Cannot say a bad thing about it.  Would highly recommend to anyone.  We stayed on the 7th floor (top one) and had a great view of the fireworks.  Restaurant and food is wonderful.

My friend and I stayed at the hotel while taking a Disney vacation.  The hotel staff was very professional and courteous.  The lobby and the entire hotel was very clean.  The room exceeded our expectations to what we were expecting.  Everything was in working order and did I mention very clean?  The beds are comfortable.    Forgot your shaving cream?  Hotel takes care of that.  Forgot your toothpaste?  Hotel takes care of that.  Just call and it's free!  The bus comes around every 20 minutes or so to go to Disneyland.  Only a couple of stops in between.  Totally worth the money!

My family of 4 is becoming fairly seasoned hotel guests as we enjoy our stay in the USA. Compared with the UK this type of hotel is just so wonderful. It also ranked as one of the best we have so far experienced in the USA. We went for the two queen bed suite which also had a couch in the lounge. Lots of space comfortable and best of all the kids can go watch tv in the lounge and give parents some privacy. We used the gym, and modest outdoor pool which was warm enough during cool November days. The restaurant was adequate but service was not up to the standard usually experienced in USA. The only minor complaints would be the extra charges for parking ($11) and internet but even when including these the room worked out very reasonable. Overall very clean modern, and friendy

I was just in Anaheim, travelling alone, for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I am very particular about where I stay and went by the reviews on this site. This hotel was perfect. Spotlessly clean. I had a large 1 bedroom suite.  The living room had very nice furniture. The bedroom had 2 queen beds with wonderful mattresses, duvets and high end bedding.  The bathroom vanity area was large and had a granite top.  The toilet and tub/shower were in a separate room. The entire suite was spacious and quiet. The staff were wonderful.  It was very close to the convention centre and Disneyland.  Great location, the area nearby was well lit and felt safe. I would definitely stay there again. The only drawback: the pool was on the shady side of the building.

Summary Heading: We will not go anywhere else....ever!
Summary: This was the best decision we made on our trip.  Outstanding hotel with great staff.  Sure it was just a few dollars more than the others on the Blvd but well worth the added $$$.  We traveled with 2 other families who opted to save $$$ and stay at a Ramada. I don't regret the added cost at all.   For $20 more each day we had fatastic sleep on comfortable CLEAN beds, the separate living room gave us the space we needed to relax and break away from the Disney crazy. Convenient location across from Denny's for the quick breakfast (no crowds), Micro and Fridge perfect to keep those late snacks and unfinished meals for later.  We will definitely be back and the other families will be joining us next time I am sure of that.

Summary Heading: Going to give it a 2nd try
Summary: I had called the hotel to advise of our late arrival with an infant & toddler in tow.  We arrived @midnight to hear "your room isn't quite ready".  After driving for 8 hours, I was not pleased.  We finally were in our room at 1:30am ... and up at dawn with our toddler who could not contain her excitement to visit Disneyland. While the staff was not "friendly" about rectifying the situation upon our arrival, I made it clear that I book over $10k in business travel at their hotel every year and that this was wholly unacceptable so they finally relented and "comp'd" our parking and gave us free breakfast passes for our 3 days there.   We are going to give the hotel another try this year because the hotel itself was so perfect for our needs and because we never encountered another
Manager Response: I would love to know who checked you in last year and was so unpleasent, fortunately thats not typical of our staff. Appreciate the fact that you are giving us an opportunity to make amends, and I hope you have a wonderful stay. If there is anything I can do to make your visit more enjoyable, please do not hesitate to ask. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: Pretty Good Place in Most Areas
Summary: We believe this hotel fits the essential needs of most folks with kids. We (family of 4) had a suite with 2 queens in Br. and hideaway sofa in the sitting area. Fridge/micro is perfect for saving a few bucks on restaurants, and convenient snack storage. A Vons grocery is a short drive south east of the hotel.  We had requested a north facing room on a high floor to view the fireworks. We were told we had a partial view room The rooms/building has a horseshoe shape. If you are in the middle of the horseshoe facing north you will get a great view of the fireworks. If you are on the sides (as we were), you can see if you paste your face against the glass. Another option would be to wander down the hall and view from elevator area which is in the middle of the horseshoe.  Our room

I booked this hotel in July 2008 at 104.00 per night.  From what I could tell, this was the best price I could find for this hotel.  Parking is 11.00 per night, but for whatevery reason we weren't charged for parking (maybe because it is the off-season in anaheim?).  We flew into Ontario International Airport and drove the 40 miles or so to Anaheim (about the same distance as LAX) and checked into the hotel at 2:00 PM.  The requested rooms were just as requested (two adjoining rooms with a fold out bed.)  Basically, it gave us a four room suite for the entire time we were there for about $210 per night +tax.  The check in experience was one of the best I have had, very friendly, fast and efficient.  Location: The hotel is less than one mile from Disneyland and California
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and for being so kind despite the fact that we dropped the ball in a couple of areas. I would really appreciate your calling me so that I can identify the dates that you stayed with us. This will help to determine where we have  problems, as it's our goal to exceed every guests expectations. Just for the record; our pool is supposed to be heated all year round  and all of our managers, particularly myself, know the importance of returning every telephone call in a timely manner. I would also like to be sure that you have been reimbursed for any over charge. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary: Doubletree Anaheim near Disneyland has a great combination of everything.  This hotel is one of the newest in the area with clean and comfortable rooms, impressive lobby, and a nice restaurant.  The bedroom is not super big but the living room area of the suite is nicely laid out and provides enough space for work and relaxing.  The hotel is within a mile of Disneyland and the newly developed Anaheim GardenWalk.  There is also a Target store less than one mile away.  For people interested in local microbrew, try Oggi's brewpub 1/2 mile away.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but not if you are celebrating a special anniversary!
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Doubletree for our Disneyland vacation and 10 year wedding anniversary. We made our decision based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. Overall our stay was nice but we did end up with a room with a dirty bathroom and bathtub. We notified the front desk and they were very kind and offered to switch our room immediately.  The other issue was the restaurant Agio. The service was very poor. We had a group of 13 people for breakfast and ended up waiting over an hour for our food. When the food did arrive it was cold and tasted like it had sat under a heat lamp for a while.  With regard to celebrating our 10 year anniversary at the Doubletree, it was a lost cause. Months prior I notified the hotel to inform them of our special date and asked about having

We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children (12 & 10 yrs).  Booked the Doubletree Guest Suites as part of a Qantas travel package.  Our choices were limited to only a small number of Anaheim hotels and our first choice HOJO's was unavailable.  All the rest on offer had terrible reviews except for the Doubletree, so we went with this hotel and were more than happy with our decision.    Check-in was smooth & efficient (cookies were a nice treat) and our room on the third floor was fantastic.    The separate bedroom from the living area had the most comfortable beds (2 x queens) we have ever slept in.  The living area was spacious and we had a corner where we could store all the luggage we weren't using.    Housekeeping did a great job and made a point of arranging our children's

We picked this hotel because of the trip advisor rating but we cannot believe that this is the number one hotel in Anaheim. It was ceratinly clean, comfortable and close to Disneyland, but so are many others, and this one was lacking in some basics. Housekeeping was erratic and one day we came back tired from Disneyland at 3 pm to find the rooms still not done. The laundry machine soap dispenser was down and it could not be fixed in time nor could they provide us with a little soap when we asked so we could do our laundry on time. There is no complimenatry breakfast like many hotels in this area and there is a charge for parking and for wireless internet, which adds up to not make this hotel as good a deal as it first seems. Most hotels give one or two bottles of water per day

My husband and I were in Anaheim for a convention, and stayed at this hotel because it is within walking distance from the convention center and also because of it's #1 standing on Tripadvisor.  We requested an early check in, and arrived at the hotel around noon.  Our room a/c did not work properly, and the room was stuffy and hot.  We called front desk, and was told that someone would be up to take a look.  After about 20 - 30 minutes and another call, I went down to the reception desk and asked to be moved to another room.  The 2nd room was fine.  Bedding is clean with fresh duvet covers, and bathroom is clean.  There is no in-room wireless internet.  The hard wired in-room internet charge is the usual $9.95/day, and there is only one connection per room, which is

We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites for 5 nights after staying 5 nights at a Disneyland Resort Hotel.  The Disneyland Resort Hotel was great but you can't beat the value for money and cleanliness of the Doubletree Guest Suites!  We received an early check-in of 12 noon, as we were transferring from another hotel.  The cookies on arrival, are to die for!!  The kids wanted to go back for more.  Staff were always freindly and accomodating to our requests.  Our room was always found in an immaculate state on our return from Disneyland each day.  It is around a 15 minute walk to Disneyland from the hotel or you can take the Anaheim Resort Shuttle which picks you up outside the hotel.  The pool and spa were lovely to return to each day.  We had dinner at Agio's Restaurant which

Summary Heading: The place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed at Doubletree with our two daughters 13 and 11.  The room layout is great with seperate bedroom and the beds are extremely comfortable, in fact I couldnt get my daughters out of them!!  The room was of a good size for 4 people with good amenities.  The fridge and microwave are very handy especially for storing supplies bought from the store just down the road for breakfast and supplies of bottled water.  We were so tired one night we ordered room service and the meal was excellent.  I can also recommend The Cheesecake Factory for a great family meal.  We had a vehicle and were not charged parking as it was included in our room rate??  We did have to call maintenence on a couple of occassions and both times they responded within 10 minutes and fixed the problem.  The

The DT is a nice hotel with decent sized rooms and the front desk is friendly, but the rooms are warm because the AC appears to be preset to a warm temperature which cannot be controlled via the room. We had two rooms and both were like this.
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear that you were not able to adjust the temperature in your guestroom. Our thermostats are not pre set so their must have been something wrong with the unit. If you would be so kind as to contact me I would like an opportunity to make amends. Respectfully, Jeff Morse

Summary Heading: A great hotel, close to Disney
Summary: We arrived a little early from our drive from Yosemite and we had to wait to get our room – this was fine as the onsite bar/grill was open and was reasonably priced to get some dinner. The rest of the time before check in allowed us to sit in the lobby and use the free wi-fi to e-mail home, etc (wi-fi isn’t available in the rooms we were told, but on our second visit a few days later, we could access it from our room on the first floor!)  There is a three-computer office room guests can use for free, with Internet access and printers, which was a great benefit for us as this enabled us to do online check-in before our flight home and print boarding passes.   The front desk staff were polite and helpful and we got double helpings of the free cookies for our wait!  The room we had

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our Stay, but not Parking Pay
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree because of Trip Advisor and we don't regret it. It is a beautiful and clean hotel. We were pleasantly surprised by our room layout which is perfect for a family. The location of the hotel was great, right on the 'strip' and near many restaurants.   We drove to Southern California so we had to pay for parking at the Doubletree $11/day! Since we were Disney goers we either had to drive to Disney (which is another $12/day parking) or take the shuttle - which was extremely convenient - picking up right outside the hotel, but costing $8/day for our family.  That was basically the only downside...except that my husband thought the pool was way too small, but it was never crowded and is a salt water pool - which we love. There is also a "Disney Welcome

My family of three (me, husband, three year old) stayed here for two nights while visiting the Disney properties.  In the past, we stayed at the Grand California, which is definitely a more convenient location. This time, however, we wanted to try a two room suite, and felt outpriced at the Grand.  Our suite at the Doubletree was the 2 room/King combo.  It was very spacious and well appointed.  Our room was clean and quiet, and had all the Neutrogena schwag as noted by previous reviewers.    The staff was incredibly polite.  They had a decent check out of 12:00 noon (instead of 11:00 a.m., like most hotels) and even granted us a late check out - which is unheard of at the Grand California.  We tried the shuttle bus on our first afternoon, and it was a good value ($3 for an all

Summary Heading: Fantastic rooms at Doubletree Guest Suites, Anaheim
Summary: My family stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews on your website.  Although we expected the hotel to be good, we were very surprised by the size of our suites and the overall quality of the hotel.  We recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim.  We had to catch the shuttle bus to Disney but this was a small price to pay for our stay at Doubletree.   We travelled on to San Diego and stayed at the Doubletree, Mission Valley.  Although this was also a very good hotel, the size of the rooms were a disappointment after our stay in Anaheim.  Very good value!

We stayed at this hotel the last week of August and everything I had read in prior reviews was pretty accurate.  The hotel has a large very pretty lobby, and checking in went very quickly.  The chocolate chip cookies given to us at check in were warm, fresh and delicious, they were a nice greeting after a long day of traveling.  Our room was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and we walked there one day with our two children 13 and 5, although it was a bit too far for the 5 year  old to walk the whole way.  There are shuttles but we did not have a great experience with them when we wanted to leave the park.  We ended up waiting a long time and none showed up so we decided to walk back to our hotel.    The

We stayed for a total of 4 nights at the end of August and were very pleased with the hotel.  Clean and well maintained with comfortable sleeping arrangements.  we had a corner room on the 2nd floor, same as pool, so convenient with a 4 and 6 year old.  Kids slept fine in the living room section of the suite and we had the king bed in the main bedroom.  The front desk was compitent,  most of the time.  We did have one clerk that tried to tell us that our credit card expired in 1999 and wanted clear it up...as we are trying to buy bus passes and get to our early admission morning.  Came back later and they had no idea what he was talking about as everything was fine.  I would say the distance to Disneyland is about as far as I wanted to walk.  Not a bad walk in the morning with

This was a good hotel and I have no complaints!  We stayed here for one night while we checked out Disneyland and it was great.  It was within walking distance to the park, and we were able to buy tickets at the hotel so that we didn't have to wait in line (plus, the agent at the hotel gave us a discount so we paid about 4 dollars less per person).    The rooms were comfortable and the bathroom had lots of counter space.  I loved that they provided neutrogena products for free, including a small tube of facial sun screen, which was a nice touch!    Now, let's discuss the cookies.  They certainly deserve their own paragraph.  In case you do not know, Doubletree greets you with warm chocolate chip oatmeal cookies upon check in.  They were AMAZING.  And the lady at the front desk

This was our second stay since August 2007.  I am a very, very picky traveller with many years of experience.  I research extensively before booking any accomodations.  The hotel atmosphere has an upscale feel throughout.  During our stay we were treated with respect and each request was handled promptly and with care.  The staff is most accomodating on the whole.  Love the beds!  They are like sleeping on a cloud of freshness!  The suites while a bit on the small side provide plenty of room to spread out with a family of 4 or more.  The breakfast buffet is quite delicious in the restaurant and kids eat free.  The pool while not very large is clean, not overly crowded, and serves its' purpose.  Nightly fireworks can be seen from upper floor rooms facing Disney.  Beware the ART

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel, Great Location for Disney
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights in July with teenagers. Very nice hotel, large room, staff very helpful. Great location for Disney and for the Baseball at Angel Stadium. Not so good for Universal studios and Hollywood. If we did this trip again I would change hotels half way through. It was a pain driving across LA.  My teenagers preferred Universal to Disney and we bought front of line passes at Universal. Worth every cent.

This hotel is top of our list!  They have a beautiful hotel but most importantly remember to appreciate their guests.  Everywhere we went we were greeted with smiles, helpful employees everywhere, clean room, chocolate chip cookies you name it.  Special appreciation out to Henry who went of his way to fix a bad reservation we had with a nameless online company.  Thank you so much!  We are definitely returning customers!  Refrigerator was ample size to keep milk, veggies, drinks, yogurts cool.  Suites were awesome!  Kids slept in the 2 queen beds and my husband and I had the whole front to ourselves.  Pool - good size too.

I am sitting in the "office center" of this hotel as I type.  My husband is attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center, and I have accompanied him.  We like to have a two room suite when we travel which is why I chose the DoubleTree Guest Suites over other hotels in the immediate vacinity.  Thought we prefer Marriott hotels, we are Hilton Honors members.  Having just spent three nights at the Marriott Residence Inn in Westlake Village, CA, I am finding the DoubleTree coming up short.  Though the staff at the desk is friendly and, for the most part, they try to be helpful, their lack of English as their native language has hampered communication.  Though I spoke with several desk staff, it was impossible to get an explanation of how the Anaheim Resort Transit system
Manager Response: I appreciate your sharing your observations and am sorry that we were unable to meet your expectations. If you don't mind I would like to address a couple of points.  1] An additional charge of $.75 will not appear on your bill should you decide to receive the USA Today newspaper, as it's included in the price of your room. We will however refund $.75 if you would rather not have one. 2] I am sorry that you had trouble understanding some of our desk clerks.To many of them, English is their second language, however they are all going to college [one just left for Cornell and another to USC] and make a real effort to speak perfect english. I will however make a point of being sure that they all know the location of local retail stores. 3] Typically we have a nice mix of guests and seem to appeal to the business traveller as well as families. Your stay was over a time when we had an unusual number of conventioneers. Respectfully, Jeffrey Morse General Manager

Summary Heading: good quality modern family friendly hotel
Summary: melamanic - uk scotland  We enjoyed a lovely holiday here at Doubletree - the hotel did not disappoint.  It is situated about 15- 20 minutes walk from Disney which is a breeze when weather not too hot or it is very handy to use the ART shuttle which runs about every 20 minutes from hotel to Disney.  This means it is quite easy to visit Disney during morning, return back to hotel in afternoon and then visit again for evening fireworks.  The suites consist of 2 rooms - one ok sized lounge with tv, microwave and fridge and another room with two large very comfy beds, which guarantee you a sleepfull night and another tv.  Both had the usual channel selections plus pay tv for movies etc.   The bathroom is good sized with toilet, and bath/shower and there is a coffee machine which is

This is a good suite hotel, but I'm less enthusiastic than many other reviewers.   On the upside it's very clean, modern, comfortable with fridge in your room and friendly staff (so what else could you ask for ?)  Well, on the downside the suites are considerably smaller than you would probably imagine and the swimming pool, located on the 3rd floor, is very small for a large hotel located close to Disney where you can obviously expect lots of guests with children. Afternoons is standing room only with everyone (primarily kids of course) fighting for their 6 inches of space.  Exactly why they elected to build such a small pool is a mystery to me as there is a ton of room for expansion where it's located.

Summary Heading: NOT convenient enough for young families going to Disneyland...
Summary: We have been to Disneyland several times and usually stay at a hotel across the street or on site at the Grand Californian or Disneyland Hotel.  Since many of these hotels were booked full, we decided to try out the Doubletree since it is currently ranked #1.    The Pro's- -New Hotel, nicely decorated... -Nice Rooms, Suites with a Narrow Living Area with sofa bed, chair, fridge and microwave, table with 2 chairs. Bedroom had 2 double beds, nice linen, very comfy beds and pillows. Nice bath with granite, lots of storage, nice toiletries. -Front Desk was pleasant, helpful, cookies upon arrival. -2nd floor outdoor pool- you can see part of the fireworks from here- but the smokers kinda ruined the evening puffing away- I'm very sensitive to smoke, nice hot tub, nice outdoor shower

Great hotel in Anaheim.  Fresh-baked cookies on arrival and comfortable, spacious suite - very clean - 2 queen beds, lounge area with sofa, tv, fridge etc.   Room service menu good and fast delivery of order.  Very slight niggles -- paying for parking although not expensive, and wi-fi internet not in bedrooms but easily available in lobby / public areas.   If you are thinking of booking this hotel versus the Marriott Maingate Residence Inn (currently no 2  rating on trip advisor) , book the Doubletree - it's a no-brainer, we have stayed at both and there is no comparison - for the same price they are worlds apart.  Oh, and the concierge on duty was extremely helpful with maps, driving directions and information.

a pretty good place to stay. as per other reviewers watchout for 'resort fee' I think this is allocated via your room card and my children activated it just by looking at pool when they arrived. I don't have a problem with hotels charging this fee, just be upfront about it (which they aren't, I didn't find any mention of it any the room directory even though other 'nominal fees' are disclosed.  It is a  bit too far too walk to disney so you need to use the ART, just be wary that it runs about every 25 mins rather than every 20 as suggested by hotel staff. Also it goes in the opposite direction to start off with. It can also get quite crowded after the fireworks at disney.  its a very clean, new, family friendly hotel that is reasonably priced.

When we arrived at the Doubletree we considered ourselves lucky, it was a beautiful hotel.  The front desk staff treated us so well and they gave us a nice warm cookie when we checked in.  The bellmen were so helpful, Gary made sure we were well taken care of.   We had breakfast in the hotel and it was a buffet with so many good choices.  Our server Alejandra was delightful.  The manager Bambi was very pleasant and she assisted us in getting a taxi to our destination.  We had dinner in Agio and the food and the service was superb.  This must be the best kept secret in Anaheim.  Not many diners.  We had a night cap in the lounge.  The bartender was very good although she was getting heckled by an older gentleman on the bar wanting her to go out to dinner.  The manager came in and

I stayed at the Anaheim Doubletree Convention Center from July 13th to the 18th and was very impressed.  I was in town for a conference being held at the Marriott but I got a rate for a suite at the Doubletree that was better than the conference rate for a room at the Marriott.  The Doubletree was a pleasant 10 minute walk from the Marriott which was a nice way to gear up/unwind for the conference.  My suite was very clean and well maintained, the staff was friendly and very helpful when I was having trouble printing out my airline boarding pass in the business center.  The pool was well maintained and clean.  I also liked having a Disney Welcome center in the lobby, staffed by someone from Disney who could answer questions and sell tickets.  Much better than just a kiosk.

This was the best value for us in the Anaheim resort area (to the previous posters who complained about the "resort" fee, it's a small fee/tax charged for all hotel guests in the Anaheim resort area, not just the Doubletree.)  Yes, we had to pay to park, but it wasn't much and all the other hotels charged for parking as well.  But it was convenient having a car in the area, especially for daytrips.  We only had a car for a few days and then afterwards used the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) which is also convenient and picks you up right outside the hotel.    We ended up with a great rate for our room.  The room itself is very nice with a large television and comfy beds.  Wonderful Neutrogena products in the bathroom.  Fridge so we could store yogurt and milk to have cereal

Spent a number of nights here a few weeks ago, and cannot say enough about the service and staff.  The last time I encountered such personable staff was at the Ritz Carlton in Maui.  Everyone in the place is delightfully friendly and helpful.   I stayed with a friend, and on the first night ordered room service, which is generally a pretty bland experience.  But on the phone was Oscar, whose smile simply came across on the phone.  We were amazed, but it just continued everywhere in the hotel.  Norma and Kim, bartenders, Joel, roomservice, Helinda restaurant server....Sergio in the restaurant, all were so exceptional that you felt at home and almost like you were staying among friends.   And the food and beverage manager, Ed  P. stopped by at breakfast one mornining to inquire if

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Upset at Charge for Resort Fee
Summary: This is a nice hotel, within a long walk or transit, to Disneyland.  The studio room was very clean, mid-sized, including a very comfortable bed and bedding, large bathroom, in-room refrigerator, desk and television.  The lobby is very nice, the staff were friendly and check in was quick.  As with previous guests, I feel there is no need to charge for parking ($11) though parking was simple through card access.  There is no guest parking that is without charge (this seemed to be true for other hotels...everyone charges and the only way for this to be waived is to have a drink or meal at the hotel).  I am, however, especially upset at paying a $6.00 resort fee per day (+ tax) at the Doubletree.  The hotel pool is extremely small.  There are no umbrellas by the lounge chairs (only

Summary Heading: The Doubletree was Wonderful for this Family of Four
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for three nights in June while visiting Disneyland. The location is good, but too far for my 4 year old to walk to the parks.  We took the ART buses everyday and never waited more than 10 minutes to board.  The room was wonderful as it had a separate living and bathroom area away from the bedroom.  The room was very clean and the maidservice was very good. The refrigerator and microwave came in handy and the two televisions were great for a family who doesn't always agree on what to watch.  We did not realize but it was "Grad Night" at Disneyland meaning they closed the parks early for regular folks and were open to seniors all night long. This was OK except we had several rooms around us full of rowdy, loud, obnoxious teenagers. I had to call

Summary Heading: Perfect for a good nights sleep!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a few nights as a quick stop. I have to say, the beds were great! The linen was clean, the pillows were fluffy and the rooms were made up every day. The rooms were spotless and the bathroom had fresh towels (and plenty of them) changed daily.  Check in was hassle free, and were given the famous doubletree cookies. A nice treat on arrival.   The room walls were a bit papery thin, though we were lucky we had no noisy couples or children around us, but I have a feeling that may be a problem for some - being the disney area.  I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel, we had breakfast once, and I nearly threw up. Everything was dripping in oil. The fruit was brown - and minimal selection. Buffet was mostly bacon, sausages, more bacon and bacon! It looked

Summary Heading: Great for family and Disney access
Summary: I read the positive reviews and found them to be true.  Great family hotel, 20 minute walk to Disney (bus available).  The rooms were large (two sections), the beds great, pool refreshing, and staff friendly.  Kids eat free in the hotel restaurant.  We thought we were being economical by eating at an IHOP one morning.  Well, the hotel food was far superior, and about half the price for a nutritious, huge selection breakfast.  Only negative point in whole stay was $11 daily parking.  I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites from the 19th-24th of June.  I have to say that I have never seen a better, well trained staff...and really NICE!  Every staff member (including the wait staff at Agio)  with was NICE!!! Extremely helpful, happy crew.  The cookies were a great treat and set the mood for the stay.  We were able to check in early, and the free internet (and printing capabilities) was a great convenience.  The shuttle was a great way to get to Disney, but waiting for it got a little old after the first couple of days, and next time I probably will try to save to stay onsite for the convenience.  The room at the Doubletree fit our family of 5 just great and was great to have a little extra space.  The pool...way too small for the size of the hotel.  Happy

this hotel is only about 2 years old and it is a BARGIN! Really a very nice lobby that reminds you of a big name, big property hotel. The rooms are very clean ( I felt like I could walk anywhere in my bare feet and not get that "wonder what I'm walking on" feeling.0 Great breakfast , free if you are a Hilton Gold member. The hotel is only about 2 blocks from Disneyland and an easy walk, but they have a shuttle stoping every 30 minutes out on the street and for $3 each you can get a day pass with unlimted rides. We stayed for 3 nights in early June and paid only $120/night for a 2 room suite!!!! Micro wave, small fridge, safe, 2 TV's and very comfortabel beds! Nice pool that isn't "kid" crowded until mid afternoon AND the best cookies you can get anywhere for free.

There are many great reviews of this hotel and I feel I'm being redundant so I won't make this too long. We stayed 4 nights with our 3 young kids and had a great time!  Our room was on the top floor with a view of the fireworks.  We were next to the elevator  but never heard any noise from it. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.  We ate at the hotel's restaurant once for dinner and twice for breakfast and it was fine. The hotel is conveniently located near restaurants like Buca di Beppo, Bubba Gump Shrimp, PF Changs, etc... The shuttle (ART) to Disneyland was convenient - I believe the longest we had to wait for it was 10 minutes. The set up of the room worked well for our family and I would definetely stay here again!!

Great hotel; looks like it was remodeled recently and the bed was very comfortable. I was very impressed with the decor and how nice everything looked. We were even given these really good cookies when we checked in and the room had a microwave and a     refrigerator.  Will stay here again when we go to disneyland next.   Negatives: slow elevator(but looked nice inside) and the view wasn't that great

Summary Heading: It's true what everyone is saying
Summary: It's pretty difficult to write a unique review when all of the past reviews pretty much capture the essence of this hotel.      The rooms were very clean, modern, and everything in the room and bathroom was in good working order.      I had booked 7 rooms for me and my staff while attending a conference at a nearby hotel.  All raved about their rooms and the cleaning/maid services.         I can't comment on the restaurant on-site as we didn't eat there.  The menu looked good though.      All in all, I would definately stay here again if I needed to be in the Convention Center area.  It's a bit of a walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland (about 30 minutes).

Its all been written before, but I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.  It really is great and would stay here again without hesitation.  A quick run down:   +VE's Great location, close enough to Disney to walk in approx 15-20 mins Superb staff at reception and the bell desk - really friendly and always helpful Huge suites with all the amenties you could want - 2 tv's, fridge, microwave, games console Very clean rooms and hotel overall Near to lots of restaurants and bars Good value for money Free internet available 24hrs  -VE's We had to leave to come home  If you're going to Anaheim - stay here!!

The Doubletree is so nice compared with some of the cheesy hotels near Disneyland. We felt so welcomed by all of the staff there. We were greeted warmly each time we came & went and they were very helpful when we had questions. The "welcome" cookies are unbelievably good, our room was spacious, well laid-out, and extremely clean. I believe the rooms are inspected after each cleaning. The beds are sooo comfortable (like home). We ordered room service for breakfast one morning and they exceeded our expectations in that area too! There is a shuttle bus to Disneyland from the hotel. Sometimes you have to wait a little while for it - runs every 20 minutes or so. The restaurant looked nice, and there was a coffee shop with Starbucks in the lobby. The pool & hot tub were average-size

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Great Staff, Great Location, Excellent rate
Summary: An excellent hotel at a great price in a superb location.  Only 10-15 minutes easy flat, straight (you can't get lost) walk to Disneyland.    We had a 2 room suite for half the price we normally pay for a standard room. The suite had a seperate bedroom and sitting room area.  The sitting room area had a couch that turns into a pull out bed and a work desk.  This allowed me to work at night while my toddler was asleep.  The Large rooms, both with TVs are large.  The sitting room has a microwave and fridge (suitable for heating toddler meals and milk).   The bathroom was adequate with a seperate basin outside the bathroom - which works well (great for washing baby bottles etc).  The staff at this hotel were excellent. From room service to bell desk I had nothing but friendly

The Doubletree is a new hotel built on South Harbour Blvd. It has an impressively large reception, and a very friendly welcome. We were noth given our cookies upon arrival. Room was superb. Two large queen size beds with a sperate lounge room. Both bedroom and lounge had large TV’s with the standard US hotel channels. Beds were super comfy. Lounge room had a sofa bed which proved just as comfy when snoring became an issue! Lounge has a fridge and microwave. We stocked the fridge with water and pop from the 24-7 just down the road.  The hotel has a sizeable pool and Jacuzzi, both well maintained with shower facilities, towels and plenty of sun loungers. The pool is open from 6am until 10pm and is located on the roof of the first floor, so it provides plenty of privacy from those

The night before we arrived, I called the front desk and advised that we were arriving at 10am the next morning.  I wanted to know if it would be ok to check in at that time.  I was told that it was a little slow, so it was not a problem and I did ask if there were any rooms on a higher floor facing Disneyland.  She found the perfect room and to my surprise, it was a 1 bedroom with 2 very comfortable beds facing Disneyland.  We were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room and it was beautiful!  The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable which was great after a long day.  We never heard noise from our neighbors except for the occasional voices from the hallway.  The design and decor of the rooms were carefully thought out.  The first stop after

Nice hotel, you'll definately have to get transportation to Disneyland. If you park a car there it's around $11 per day plus parking rate at Disneyland. A Cab is roughly $8 each way, the shuttle is $6 for a day pass. If you have kids in strollers it can be a hassle taking the shuttle, plus, it'll take the longest that way to get into the park, but if you're thrifty you may find it worth all the fuss.   Rooms were nice, big enough and updated with comfortable beds. There's a pool and hot tub, that's always a plus. Free Chocolate chip with nuts cookie at front desk. Starbucks downstairs and mini fridge in my room so you could save on food prices if you try. No real complaints.

We checked in Friday afternoon at 3 pm for three nights at the Doubletree.  We were given warm gooey chocolate chip cookies that were really good.  We went right up to our room to finish the cookies and changed to lounge around the pool for a few hours.    We found the hotel to be perfect for our families’ needs.  We had a two-room suite that contained a bedroom with two queen-sized beds, a living area that contained a pull-out couch, chair, desk/table with two chairs and a TV/bar area.  The bathroom was perfect for families as the toilet and tub were in one lockable room while the sink and vanity was just outside, making it easier for everyone to get ready in the morning.    Although the size of the unit was a smallish one-bedroom, it felt bigger because of it's efficient

Since I was attending a business conference, I needed a place to stay convenient to the convention center.  After researching rates and amenities at the various hotels close by, I decided to give Doubletree a try.  I was very pleased with my overall experience.  The reception staff were friendly, helpful and finished processing my check in after only  five minutes.  The warm chocolate chip cookie they welcomed me with was a nice homey touch.    The man at the concierge podium was always helpful and knowledgeable when I asked him for area information.  The self parking was convenient, close, and well lighted.  The room I was in was tastefully decorated with some extra amenities like a microwave, mini refrigerator, and two cup coffee maker.  There was also a safe, ironing board,

We stayed at a 2-queen suite here for 3 nights here around Christmas in 2007. Our room is on the 4th floor, facing the west or the pool, near the end of the hallway. This is our 2nd time staying here. We had a pleasant stay. With the door to the living room closed, the suite bedroom is probably one of the quietest. When we slept, we didn’t hear anything like kids running in the hallway, neighbors’ voices (it was full house then), TV sounds, neighbors taking shower, outside noise, and the refrigerator noise (it’s in the living room). It was very quiet. I think it’s very worthwhile to pay the extra for the suite, as I could hear people in the hallway from the living room. I believe the building structure (like thick wall) and design contribute to the tranquility. I also noticed

This hotel was great for Disneyland vacation--the room we had was a 2 room suite -so perfect for us and our 2 year old.  The beds are sooo comfortable--fluffy towels--extra pillows--chocolate chip cookie at checkin---there is a nice restaurant with a breakfast buffet and kind of pricey italian food for dinner---also a small coffee bar and giftshop in the lobby--really nice pool and gym too---the only con was the shuttle was suppd to be every 20 min to D-land and then it takes 20 min or so to get there so it took too much of our park time waiting and riding the shuttle---the walk is abt a mile and not doable in 100 degree weather--but if it were cooler we would have just walked---but it was a really nice hotel and great price we got online ahead of time

Summary Heading: This hotel is wonderful! Great for Disney!
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for 7 nights at the beginning of May and really enjoyed our stay.  We booked a suite and were very impressed with our room.  We had a corner suite - which was great.  The suite had three large windows and the room was the size of many small apartments.  You could easily fit 4 people in this room.   The room was clean and well maintained.  The cleaning staff did a great job.  The bed and pillows are very comfy and equivalent to any other 4 or 5 star hotels we have stayed at.   We walked to Disney and found it to be a 15 minute walk - which was fine given that we did not have children with us.  If we had children we may have taken the Anaheim transit or cabs to the resort.  The pool area is nice and the hot tub is great after a day at Disney.  We didn't

Summary Heading: Very Overrated Compared to the reviews; yet still a decent place.
Summary: When I am usually in the area, I try and stay at the Embassy Suites. The reviews of this hotel are VERY overrated. However it is a nice clean place.   X The rooms are very very small for suites. I would not call this a family-friendly sized room if you were to bring a child or 2 to stay on the pull-out. Not that this is unachievable, but it would be very cramped. The suites at the Embassy Suites down the street are much much bigger.  The Hampton Inn and Hilton Garden Inn rooms are not that much smaller either, and you can easily find rates at both of those, rooms that are suites that have similar rates.  X Parking costs 11$ per day. That is so silly considering you are in a suburban area and not downtown. All three other Hilton Co. Properties provide free parking 1/2 a mile down

Fabulous!  My little family of four came here for our first Disneyland trip.  I have stayed in many hotels, 5 star, etc., but this was my favorite hotel to date.  The service was amazing!  I needed to find a drugstore at midnight and the front desk spent considerable effort trying to find the closest one that would have what I needed.  The rooms were quiet, very clean, and the best beds and pillows I have ever slept on while away. The layout of the rooms (two-room two queen suite) works perfectly with little ones because the bedroom portion is seperate from the bathroom and living area so little ones can sleep while grownups prepare for the next day/watch tv, etc.  The housekeeping service was outstanding (even folded my toddlers 'blankie' and put his stuffed monkey into fun,

Summary Heading: The best hotel to stay at if you're going to Disneyland!!!
Summary: We stayed at the Disney's Grand Californian the night before our stay at the Doubletree and have to say this hotel is by far better than Disney's.  No I don't work for Doubletree...or have anything to do with the travel industry.  I paid double to stay at the Disney's Grand Californian, and the Doubletree provided the better experience.  The room is brighter, double the size of the Disney's Grand Californian, cleaner, front desk and room service extremely helpful and friendly....  truly after a long day of walking and riding on the Disney rides it was like coming home.  From the moment we walked into the room, and throughout our stay we were impressed with the quality.  The towels were first class, great coffee maker, good quality bed, sheets, blanket,  nice touches throughout

Summary Heading: Currently here HIGHLY recommend you stay here
Summary: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor, I am from Australia and was going to book another well known Sheraton Brand.    I have to say this hotel is excellent, currently staying in a 2 room non smoking queen suite, paid internet rate in full.  On check in arrived early, gentleman booking us in allowed us to check in early. Cookies were lovely and a really homely touch.  The room is fantastic, big, roomy, love the two rooms separate toilet and shower to wash basin etc. Room is very new.!  I will never again use hotels from well known travel agent, I will do my own research and am so glad that I chose this hotel to stay in.   Stayed at Anaheim Marriott Suites Oct 2006 and that was good this is better or just as good!   Staff friendly and helpful!   Definately recommend this hotel and

My husband and I arrived anaheim very sick.  We had relatives staying at the Disney Paradise Pier Hotel but decided to stay at the Double Tree due to significant cost savings and past relative reviews of this hotel.  And they couldn't be more right!  The rooms were very nicely appointed and the customer service was through the roof.  While the kids and I toured the parks, my husband stayed behind to get better.  He called room service and ordered a $8 sprite...ouch.  But when room service delivered the sprite, they realized how sick he was and quickly followed up with complimentary soup and crackers.  Well beyond our expectations for a double tree hotel!  The front desk staff was very helpful and accomodating when we needed to check out a day early because his health wasn't

Great Hotel, Wonderful staff and VERY comfortable rooms. Walking distance (for the able bodied) to the park and ART access right outside the hotel.  Note: Beware that ART is hardly a reliable transportation system. Often late and slow.

Just finished up a 4 night stay at the Doubletree with my husband and two girls (ages 9 and 4). I had decided on the Doubletree mainly from the reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed.   We had a two room suite. The bedroom was large and the beds super comfortable. The living area was a good size and along with the couch and comfy chair it included a huge desk - great if you need to get any computer time in or the kids need to do a bit of homework on their trip.  Very clean and good housekeeping service.  Fridge was very small, but had enough room for a few beverages and some leftovers we heated up next day in the microwave.
