The hotel is not what I would call walking distance to the Disney Parks but it is a five minute bus ride and we never had any issues with the

After staying in another Doublteree I was sold on their beds, which are heaven.  Again we got warm cookies when we checked in.  The room was perfect.  A couch in one room and two beds in the next room.  The set up was great with kids. Nice bathroom and even a fridge.  The pool area was wonderful.  It is quite a walk to the park, but you can purchase a pass on the bus system that will take you to Disneyland.  This is worth it, but it sometimes takes a while to wait for the bus.  The restaurant was really yummy and a little pricey with kids.  But the staff was super nice and actually opened early for us one night.  There is a coffee stand with danishes which we did for breakfast in the mornings.   It was nice to have quality rooms not too far from the park.  Very reasonable if you

My wife and I booked 2 nights at the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim.  We checked in our first night and the front desk was very friendly.  The property itself is very nice with spacious and clean rooms.  We were very active during the day so it was nice to come back to nice rooms.  The first night we attended the Angels baseball game and took a cab for about $10.  The hotel is fairly close to the ball park which was nice.  The following day we spent at Disney Land parks.  We walked their in the morning, which was about a mile away.  We spent the day at the parks and walked back at night.    We were impressed with the friendliness of staff, close proximity to activities, the size and comfort of rooms.  We would stay at this hotel again if in the Anahiem area.

The kids decided this year that we just had to go to disneyland on vacation. We decided that if we were going to go we would do it in style. After reading many reviews of hotels in the area, we decided on the doubletree, my daughter especially wanted the cookies. Was a little hesitant about the 11 dollar parking on top of the package price we got through our travel agent. When we checked in, imagine my surprise when I was told, because we went through a travel agent, who went through disney travel, we did not have to pay for parking. We were very impressed with the help and the cleanliness, quietness, and overall atmosphere of the place. We would definately stay here again.

This is the best place to stay if you cannot stay at a Disney hotel.  I have been Disneyland several times and have stayed at all of the Disney hotels and at several other local hotels.  The only reason to stay at a Disney hotel is because of the location.  There is something to be said for not having to take a shuttle to the park.  The Grand Californian is the best, but for me personally, the price isn't worth it.  The rooms at the Doubletree are just as nice, if not nicer, and the shuttle is easy and convenient.  The rooms at the Doubletree are clean and new.  The linens and towels are upscale and the decor is upscale as well.  The hotel does not have the cheap and worn down feeling that so many of the hotels in the area suffer from.  For a little extra money, you can book a

I spent two days and nights in a regular, king size bedroom and was quite happy with the visit. Received their warm cookie after a quick check in. I stopped in, expecting to leave my luggage as it was three hours before check in, however, the room was ready. I had made a request, at the hotel's own site, for a bathrobe (free) and it was in the room when I arrived. So, a good start.  Later that evening there was a problem with a taxi coming to take me to dinner...never showed...and Javier, at the Valet Desk, drove me to the restaurant himself! Great Guest Service!! The bed and pillows were comfortable and the room was clean. Bathroom comes with standard bath products, so that is several items you don't have to pack. Only complaint was housekeeping didn't empty one trash can (had
Excellent location, great attention, nice areas, good food.  My only complain was the $11 parking fee for the day, the rest was Wonderful!

Went up for a couple days to Disneyland.  Tried to check in early, room was unavailable.  So we went to CA Adventure until it was ready.  So call to see if room is available.  When we got there we were greeted with warm cookies that were very good.  The hotel had tickets ($11 a day to park) to enter the parking, which seemed unnecessary, but I'm sure they have a good reason.  Place was very nice and accomodating.  Since we're Hilton Diamond members we chose to get free breakfast (there were other benefits to choose from).  Our room seemed small, but it can be due to the layout.   The room had no DVD player, but it did have a coffee maker, microwave and small refrigerator.  They charge $5 for FIJI water.  Bring your own (we brought a small cooler with us) We got room #728 where

The only good thing I can say about the Doubletree is that the beds were comfortable.  The rooms were small for a suite.  The staff were extremely rude at check in and at check out.  Our roomservice was cold, greasy and we were over charged repeatedly.  When we questioned the double charging on one order of french toast and on one glass of orange juice on our large order the first morning they adjusted our bill.  BUT, when it happened again the next morning, I thought it was a little strange and took it up with the general manager.  We waited for a bellman for over an hour at check out and then when we wanted to use the carts instead of waiting any longer, we were told that it was a company policy that we couldn't use the carts.  But, we did finally find all 5 of the bellmen,
Manager Response: As I was reviewing your comments I bacame quite concerned since it appeared we had not provided you with the type of service guests expect from a Doubletree. It wasn't until the end, where you referenced 5 bellmen standing in front of the hotel smoking that I got to thinking you may be referring to our sister hotel just down the street. We only have two bellmen on at any one time and none of our bellmen smoke. On the other hand the Doubletree in Orange has twice as many bellmen plus a number of valet attendents that hang out in front of the hotel. Needless to say you should have received better service from any Doubletree Hotel and on hehalf of the chain I apologize. Jeffrey Morse General Manager

Summary Heading: Joining the Choir of Positive Praise
Summary: Just back from 3 days in Anaheim.  This is a very nice hotel for both Disneyland trips and business brings  to Anaheim Convention Center.  Hotel is only 3 blocks from Center and about 20 minute walk to Disney.  It is on Disneyland ART shuttle route, too. If you walk toward Disneyland one block further from shuttle stop at the hotel, you'll find a shuttle stop that is serviced by a lot more routes and your wait will be less than 10 minutes.  The staff was  friendly.  The cookies are good.  My room wasn't a suite. The bed was great, with lots of nice pillows. I also liked the duvet cover, which a preprinted note said was washed for every guest.   The bathroom was clean with bigger than normal towels.   Internet downstairs is free, as is a small business center  with computers and

When we travel, I love staying in plush hotels.  But, I think like a lot of you out there, I am always looking for a deal too.  I could not justify the cost of the hotels inside the park.  So, after researching this site, we decided on the Doubletree.  It was perfect.  The room (suite) rivaled some of the 4 star hotels we have stayed even though this hotel is rated only 3 stars.  Perhaps the lower rating is due to the hotel having less amenities than the larger hotels.  The beds were super comfy.  Loved the down comforters and the plush pillows.  The bathroom was also very clean.  We loved the suite setup because that meant someone could stay up late watching TV without disturbing those who wanted to sleep.  The front desk was very accommodating and gave us a high floor room

Stayed here with the family and we had a great time. We enjoyed our stay and thank all who contributed their input. We chose the hotel based on cleanliness, price and reviews. Hotel is VERY clean, rooms and halls smell fresh, staff is friendly, bathroom amenities is from nutregena and beds are wonderfully soft and comfortable. Roms are modern, comfortable and secluded enough from the public walking in the halls. This hotel is NOT near Disneyland (about 4 LONG blocks). The area is quite and away from the crowds and hoopla. There is a local bus that travels along S. Harbor as well as the Anaheim transits (ART) which stops at Disney bus drop off.  The ART buses travel every 30 min and tends to be off schedule, however, once you get on it only stops twice. I recommend you take any

The good:  1.Convenient location to all attractions in Anaheim.   2. It's great to get cookies, especially when travelling with 4 kids.  They're hot and delicious.  3.  The beds are good, the rooms are clean and dark.    The bad:  not much, but:  1.   A little annoying  and strange that they charge for parking, in an outdoor lot immediately outside the hotel.

During our stay the staff was exceptional, friendly and non-obtrusive.From the most recent reviews it sounds like they have changed staff. Suite was large, clean and a great value. The hotel had an enjoyable atmosphere( quiet).  The walk every morning, was a good 'warm-up' and the evening walk was a great cooling down period after a long day at the parks.  I never understand people who complain about the fifteen minute walk when the spend hours in line-ups and rub shoulder to shoulder at each of the parks all day long.   have fun!!!!!

Good value  - $149 over holiday for a 2 room king suite decent. Would prepay $132 next time. Good service. Friendly staff.  Nice property. Two room suite is excellent way to stay with toddler. Naps and bedtime were easy. $11/day parking. Walk to Disney (.6 mile). Starbucks cafe serves weak coffee.

I booked 3 rooms at this hotel; one for my parents, one for my sister, and one for myself, husband, and 2 kids.  All 3 rooms were perfect.  The staff was very nice and responsive.  I am extremely picky about clean, and this hotel met my standards.  The only problem is that it didn't include breakfast.  Everything else was fantastic!

Stayed from November 17th through the 19th. Excellent Hotel, loved the chocolate chip cookies upon check-in. Staff very friendly and nice. Close to many restaurants, took the shuttle to Disneyland. Rooms are clean and decor is beautiful. Highly recommend it.

I stayed at the Doubletree for 10 nights from 3 December 2007 with two teenagers.  I chose the Doubletree because:  * It was far enough away from the bedlam of the parks but close enough to walk - which we did a number of days (probably 15-20 minutes); * ART Shuttle stop out the front for the other days - and for the trips home from the parks; * We had a two-room suite which included two (very comfortable) double beds and a sofa in the 'living' area - this meant one bed each of us and no sharing.  The two TV's were a bonus; * A fridge and microwave in the room; * A guest laundry; * Heated pool and spa (we were lucky enough to have a couple of days which were warm enough to swim; * Starbucks coffee on-site; and * Internet access in the business centre for keeping in touch.  All

Our family stayed at the Double Tree for 3 nights. We go to the Disneyland area about once a month, this was our first time at Double Tree. VERY comfortable beds, helpful staff, and great food. The pool was nice and the workout room adequate. Kids eat free, but the parents pay a lot for meals so we saved eating in for really tired days. Tip: We bought ART tickets. They are $3 dollars and run every 20 minutes back and forth from Disneyland to your hotel. What they don't tell you is that they are good for anywhere the ART goes. We went to the mall, Jo's Crab Shack and Target all by riding the ART and without paying extra. Fun little extra!

Stayed here over the weekend and had a pleasant experience. Staff was courteous and room was clean. It's close to restaurants and a few minutes from Disneyland.  I tried the buffett breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was pretty good. This place is good if you're looking for a nice clean place. Nothing fancy but  good for short stays.  I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the new Doubletree because it is a new property close to Disneyland.  The property looks really nice but a bit slow on service and it is a bit far from the park.  It is about 1 mile away from the theme parks and you must walk or pay $ 3.00 per person per day to ride their shuttle.  Next time I would recommend staying closer to the actual park.
We stayed here for the first time in December and like another guest experienced poor customer service.  I thought the hotel was ok overall, however my first perception was one of distaste.

Summary Heading: Good price, decent value, just an OK place
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in September for three nights. Everything was "OK". There was nothing fabulous (except for the cookies) about this place and also nothing terrible. We had an issue with the fridge in the room and were promptly brought a new one. Maid service was fine. Bottom line for me is that if I can book it cheaper than any of the other average hotels in the area then I would stay there again. To me, it was no better or worse than Paradise Pier.

We stayed from November 26 and checked out on the 30th.  With four kids ages 7-11 in tow we needed space and the suite did not disappoint us.  The room was a nice size and the two TV's were an added plus.  The cookies were a nice treat and the staff was helpful and courteous.  The beds were comfortable and the room was nice and clean.  We did not go to either restaurant so I can't comment about that.  My only complaint (not pertaining to the hotel) was the ART shuttle wasn't consistent.  We ended up walking home one night because we left the park too late.  We would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Our previous stays were at hotels right across the street from Disneyland and the Doubletree was a nice upgrade.  Clean and crisp as compared to dirty and dingy.

Went for my honeymoon and they were great. The staff was very helpful, room was big although the view wasn't the greatest (but we were in a big city). Close to basically all amusement parks, especially Disneyland, and there's tons of shopping around. Didn't really test out the nightlife as we didn't see any clubs in the areas we were. Would really like to go back and do it all over again as it was a blast.

Just got back from two days at Disneyland, and I have to rave about the Doubletree Suites. Now, maybe I had a higher budget than many families traveling to Disney, but I found the suites at Doubletree to be a fantastic value at under $150. The bedroom had two queens and the sitting area had a pull out couch. The bathroom layout had a double sink area outside of the toilet and bathtub room so that really helped the bathroom sharing. The fridge and microwave in the room were really helpful.   The hotel was completely booked and yet I did not hear any noise while in my room. Just heard it when walking through the hallways. So that was another bonus.  I agree with previous posters that the pool in the shade was not great for November swimming, and it is on the small side. But that

We just returned from staying at this hotel and it was great! I was alittle worried that my 3 teenagers would want more, but they were very pleased with my selection of hotel. The only thing I would have changed would be to get the shuttle package for the Mouse House. It seemed like a fine walk in the morning; but at 11 at night not so much. Loved the staff, the service, the spa and especially the bedding. Didn't want to get out of the bed!! Everyone and everything was great, thank you Double Tree.

i stayed here for my birthday with my boyfriend and the place was convinient and comfortable.  It was only 3 blocks away from our disneyland destination and not so far away from the shopping either.  The lobby was very nice along with their restaurant.  Their service was always very attentive.  They have fresh hot of the oven cookies when you check-in and when I asked for bath towels, they were still soft and warm from the dryer... excellent service and excellent stay overall.  Will definitely come back to this location.

I stayed here by choice for work and brought my husband and baby girl.  I was nicely surprised by the hotel.  It isn't at all top notch, but above average.  It did cater nicely to the business traveler in me and also my family.  The free WiFi in the lobby is very nice along with the business office.  The outdoor pool is lacking sun, due to the placement of it, but okay to relax in the shade.  The gym is very small.  Overall, I have no complaints.

Stayed here 11/17-11/19 for a quick getaway.  Arrived to the hotel around 1pm and checked in.  We were given the nice warm cookies and went to our room.....got in to find we had been upgraded to a suite.  What a nice touch!!!  :)  The suite had 2 queen beds and we really wanted a king so we asked to change....a suite wasn't available so we did the normal room.  It was nice.  Nicely decorated and spacious with mini fridge and microwave.  Bed was nice.  After a long day at Disney, it sure felt good to climb into a nice comfy bed.  :) Ate breakfast at the hotel and it had a nice selection.  Not sure on the price as we had breakfast vouchers.   Parking was $11 a day. Offered a shuttle to Disney at $3 per person round trip....shuttle ran every 20-30 min.  It was easier to park at

Summary Heading: Not all its cracked up to be
Summary: The hotel overall is like any other in the area nothing big here.  The staff however, is very unhelpful and should be looked at.  It is like no one seems to care at this hotel about the customers.   The hotel is also 4 blocks from the Disneyland park.  It is about a 20 minute walk or you can pay $ 3.00 a day per person to get there.  Next time we won't be misled by the location of this property.

First, let me say I was impressed with Double Tree Guest Suites and the fact that our room was ready upon our early arrival. Also, they gave my husband and me, each a big, warm cookie. It was sooooo good!   Our room was spacious.  A very nice living area with couch, chair & ottoman, coffee table, a marble top desk/table, and a t.v. Not to mention a refrigerator and a microwave. It just doesn't get any better than this. The bedroom was warm and inviting.  Two large beds with lots of pillows; one large square one that says "Sweet Dreams" on it. A very nice touch. The staff was very friendly. Housekeeping was great! One of the concierges set us up with  VIP Tours. This bus tour turned out not to be so good. Not the hotel's fault, though.  When I told the concierge about this trip,

Summary Heading: Nice place, but a bit far from Disney
Summary: We choose this hotel for our annual Disneyland trip based on the good reviews and the fact we wanted to try a more upscale place in the area.  Our stay was for 3 nights and we booked hassle free via thier website for a reasonable price.  Upon arrival, the property was new, modern and inviting--a welcome change to the older, more run down properties in the area. Lobby was huge and impressive. Check in was easy and quick and they provided us free, warm, fresh-baked cookies, which was a nice touch. When we got to our room, we were a little disappointed to find that our room wasn't a suite because the hotel is advertised as an all-suite place. Turns out they have a couple of rooms on each floor that aren't suites that are a little cheaper. The room was nicely appointed, but was

I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a business trip. My room was a suite (I think they all are) on the seventh (top) floor consisting of two rooms: a living room with couch, easy chair, desk and TV, and a separate bedroom with another TV. The bedroom can be closed off from the rest of the room. Both rooms had a large full-wall window. The bathroom was a two-parter: an alcove with a sink and generous counter, and a separate room for the toilet and tub/shower.   The room was clean and comfortable and seemed modern and well maintained. It was quiet, with a comfortable bed and assortment of pillows. There were ample electric outlets for computers, cell phone chargers, etc. The room has its own thermostat. The room has wired and wireless Internet access, but I didn't try it.

We booked this hotel after our first choice fell through.  Good thing for us.  We flew in from Victoria, BC.  It was my children's first time travelling outside of Canada (and a first time for Disneyland) and they were very excited.  We arrived late in the afternoon.  After checking in and enjoying the delicious, warm cookies they give at check-in, we thought we would get a quick bite to eat, then head over to Disneyland to check things out.  Although the restaurant wasn't open at the time we went downstairs, the chef was there and spoke to us about the restaurant's hours, etc.  He noticed my younger son, and told us that when we came down for breakfast the next morning he would make my son a special treat.  True to his word, when we showed up for breakfast the next day, he made

This hotel is a useful distance from the bustle of Disney, but within easy walking distance.  Our fifth floor corner suite had bedroom with king,lounge with pull out,good sized bathroom and wash area. there was fridge,microwave and safe available. We were pleased with standard and of the quality of the public areas, particularly reception. Only beef would be that we were over junction of 2 main roads and this proved quite noisy at night as windows did not appear to be effectively double glazed. We dined in restaurant and made use of Starbucks franchise, both of which were great. We even got free cookies whilst not being loyalty members of this chain or anything!

This hotel was great, the front desk and the bell staff were excellent in providing assistance during my stay.  They were really good with directions and recommendations.  I had a nice corner room on the sixth floor.    The pool and spa are outside and you can see the fireworks during the Disneyland Fireworks Time.  The hotel has a Disneyland Store where you can buy passes and get information on the hotel.  I also recommend the Budget Rent A Car which is on South Harbor Blvd, it is only a block from the hotel and you can see it from the road of this hotel.  They have great rentals and good prices.  They also were nice with the cookie that they give Hilton Honors Members.

We love staying at this hotel and it is our first pick when there is availability.  We have never had any problems here and the rooms are fantastic!  The beds are wonderful, the chocolate chip cookies are terrific, and we have found it rather quiet even with the Disney crowds staying along with us.  Don't think you will be disappointed here!

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Doubletree for Ozzie family
Summary: My family of 3 (husband and 12 year old girl) flew into LA after a long tiring flight from Sydney. Travelled on the shuttlebus to the hotel, where we were immediately checked in before the official 3pm time. Cookies were a nice welcoming touch.  We travelled past other hotels and we're glad we'd made the decision to stay at the Doubletree!  Accommodation was great for our needs (1 bed suite - 2 double beds and living room - bathroom and basin/vanity in a separate area.  Beds were comfortable, wake-up call on time, friendly staff and all requests were dealt with in a timely manner.   Our primary purpose was to visit Disneyland for 2 days with a one day coach tour of LA (recommeded + booked through the concierge - Gary). We walked the 15 mins to the park - safe and easy walk.

I guess most people stay here to go to Disneyland, and so did we. I found this hotel to be of excellent quality for the price we paid (some USD 100) for the night. Rooms were cozy, the chocolate chip cookie was nice suprise. The pool was very nice relazation after a long day in Disneyland. Also, the breakfast buffet was excellent.   A tip: buy your Disneyland shuttle tickets from the reception (the shuttle goes just by the hotel) but note that it might be that the reception forgets to tell you that when you come back to the hotel: make sure you pick the right shuttle (they did not tell it to us..)!! There are many shuttles leaving for different hotels from Disneyland - which I guess we should have figured you on our own, but we didn't and just hopped on the first bus which took

Read several reviews about the property from TripAdvisor before selecting it. My $130/night room was ready at noon (vs 3pm check-in). I hadn't had lunch yet so the "welcome big hot chocolate chip cookie" was delightful!   I was traveling alone and felt very safe and at home.  The room was enormous for one.  I've stayed at a lot of Ritz Carlton's around the world and this had the same feeling in the bathroom.  Clean, well stocked with soaps, lotions, hairdryer and big fluffy towles.  They have a shuttle pick-up right at the end of the driveway that dropped me off right at Disneyland for $3 round-trip.  It was so convient and fast.  I had dinner in the hotel which was very good.  I also had the breakfast buffet which had a huge selection for a low price!  Hightly recommend this

From the moment we pulled in to the hotel parking lot we were impressed: ample parking, the hotel itself looked new and clean, and the lobby was beautiful.  Check in was quick, efficient, and friendly, and we received vouchers for cookies (which we redeemed later and they were wonderful).  The rooms are a quick walk from the elevators, and the elevators were never busy or full.  Our room was absolutely spectacular:  a large suite with a pullout couch, two queen beds in the bedroom, a refrigerator, a microwave, coffeemaker, and cabinet space for storing food.  The vanity area in the bathroom had tons of shelves and lots of outlets, and the bathroom itself was ample sized with a rounded shower curtain (which always makes for a roomier shower experience).  The towels were sooo much

For the price we paid, the close proximity to Disneyland, and the newness/cleanliness I'd say this place can't be beat.  Many of the hotels in the area close to the parks are much older and have seen better days.   I'll break the rest of the review into the positives and negatives (as there were some).  Positives:  Clean and relatively new 15 minute walk (nice after a delicious meal next door at Ruth's Chris Steak House) Yummy cookies upon check-in Starbuck's Coffee at Cafe Biscotti Good sized bathroom/plenty of space for toiletries, etc. Marble and Corian in bathrooms Refrigerator and Microwave in room Safe in room to keep valuables Felt safe walking around at night Walking distance to good dinner places (Morton's, Ruth's Chris Steak House) and other restaurants Shuttle

Stayed here for our toddler's first trip to Disneyland.  Great hotel, nice welcome with the warm chocolate chip cookies.  The lobby is impressive, the rooms are well kept and the trolley/bus picked us up across the street from the hotel.  Also the restaurant is excellent as far as food and service. (Our server Diego was friendly!)   Would definitely return!  Great value for the price!

Summary Heading: good value and space for family
Summary: Our family of four stayed here in July for our trip to Disneyland.  I felt that for $149 the suite was a good value and had the room we needed for our family.  If noise is an issue for you request a room away from Harbor Blvd. (which is a busy street).   The property is only one year old and very clean.  We did not get a chance to use the pool, but it looked nice.  With our HiltonHonors card we received a free breakfast buffet daily and it was good.  It is about a 15 minute walk to the front of Disney or you can buy a ticket to take the trolley.  Last, but not least, the beds and bedding are very comfortable.

Our family of 4 stayed 5 nights to go to Disneyland and Universal Studios. The room layout worked out really well. There was a  door to the restroom/shower area and the vanity was separate.   We booked our stay through an on-line agency which included the daily parking at $11.00 that the hotel normally charges. This was a real savings. The restaurant in the hotel offers that kids under 12 eat free with a paying adult for either breakfast/lunch or dinner. Each morning we had the breakfast buffet @ $13.50 each and the kids were able to pick something off the menu or the buffet for free. Even though we paid for breakfast it was really nice and lots to choose from. I had stayed at other hotels that offer free breakfast and it is a zoo in the mornings. I would rather pay for the

Wonderful hotel close to Disneyland.  The rooms were large and quite.  Traveling with two teenagers, it was nice to have a seperate living room area and a second TV.  The shuttle runs about every half hour and you need to pay $3 per person but it beats having to park at Disneyland.  Would stay here again.

My family of 3 stayed at the Doubletree from Aug. 15 - 17th after a trip to Palm Desert to enjoy Disney.  Check in was fast and the front desk was very helpful on information on the shuttle to Disney, maps and tickets.  Chocolate chip cookies at check in were a great hit with my son.  The room was super nice and clean, (compared to our room at the Marriott Shadow Ridge).  Again the room was very nice and did I mention clean.   The room and furnishings didn't show any signs of wear - all were top notch condition.  The only down side was our mini fridge did not get very cold and it would have been a problem if were staying longer.  The beds were very comfortable.  The maid does come by early to start cleaning the rooms.  On the day of check out - the maid came by at 8:30 and then

Very nice property and a great place to stay in Disney area.  Very kid friendly.  Had breakfast daily and food was good and kids eat free.  Beds were comfortable and room was quiet.  Only negative was one I noticed on some other reviews: front desk clerks were either not very bright or not well trained.  I inquired at the front desk about Disney transportation and was told the price and where to catch bus but was not told that the tickets were for sale at the front desk.  Found this out after waiting at the DIsneyland desk in the hotel.  Noticed other guest having similar issues with the front desk.  If Doubletree would correct this then this property would be excellent.

Summary Heading: Very nice property and close to the park
Summary: We stayed here for a function at a different hotel a few blocks away  and were very impressed with the property.  Very new hotel, really nice decor which was nicer than pretty much any hotel I've seen at this pricepoint (I  think we paid $126 plus plus various b.s charges and taxes - out the door with parking and tax it was about $160 and we booked direct through the hotel) .  Hotel was very quiet and clean and the room very nice size.  We didn't use food services or pool so can't comment but the bed was very comfy with good linens.  And that most critcal thing- the shower- was very nice and hot with good water pressure. I'd stay here again in a new york minute when in town especially considering it's close to 1/2 what the HIlton at the Convention center charges.  Also, the

OK this place is very beautiful but for the money you would think you would get some free stuff.  Parking is $12, cont breakfast is about 10 and internet that doesn't even work is 10.  The pool is nice minus all the screaming kids. Hotel is clean and staff is extremely nice.  I have stayed at nicer places than this and have gotten complementary paper, breakfast and internet.

We had booked two suites through AAA and upon check in requested that the rooms be next to each other. Even though our son and family weren't arriving until the next day this request wasn't a problem. We also asked to face Disneyland so we could see the fireworks at night. Also no problem. This a Disney partner hotel and it has a special desk for Disney visitors. You can buy passes, etc. if you haven't purchased in advance. There is always someone at the desk to answer any questions you might have about the park. The suites are great for families who want more space than a regular hotel room offers. There is a small frig and a microwave. Highly recommend the dining room here -- never crowded and the food was wonderful, though a bit pricey. Kids under 12 eat free, however. The

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel !!! And I'm very picky and negative too !!!
Summary: I have to say I usually tend to be overly negative in nature, so for me to say this hotel is nice is saying a lot.  My wife and 2 kids (3 and 5) stayed at this hotel last week.  Everything was very nice. Rooms are very clean, cookies are very , very good.  Pool is nice when the kids are tired and need a break from Disneyland.   Pool is not huge, but big enough.  The cafe downstairs (we didnt try the restaurant) is very good, serves tasty treats and good coffee.  I would rate this hotel top notch. One other thing, there is a ART shuttle that stops at the end of the driveway that goes to Disneyland, we found this easier and quicker than driving down to the parking lot and then taking a shuttle from the parking lot to the front entrance.  The shuttle fee is only $3 a day for adults

We decided to take a family vacation to Disneyland. Afetr reading the reviews on trip advisor, we  finally decided on the doubletree suites becasue of the close proximity to the park.   Our room was fine, although the carpet and sofa was a bit dirty. We made several attempts to call the front desk for questions, but many times..the phone just rang. Housekeeping was very helpful wih extra towels, and such.  The real problem came after we checked out. I settled our incidentals upon checkout, for a toatl of $63.00. A week later, I recieved an email from my credit card company stating a $300 charge was made by the doubletree. After making 6 calls to the property, we finally got a "manger on duty". He told us the charge was for a broken window in the room and taht they billed it to

This Doubletree is one of the nicest I've stayed in!  I think the property was either recently built or renovated because everything seemed new and was extremely clean.  The overall decor of the hotel was very nice and seemed quite upscale.  We were able to check in early and the staff was very helpful and friendly.  And, as always, the chocolate chip cookies were delicious!  Our suite was extremely spacious and was laid out very nicely.  Although there were only 2 of us,  there would have been plenty of room for a whole family between the 2 rooms.  The beds had plenty of pillows and were extremely comfortable. The sink was outside of the shower/toilet area (which is always a bonus) and had plenty of counter space.  There were also Neutrogena toilettries and a full size hair

Summary Heading: First time at a Doubletree, very nice hotel w/ exception of jerk manager
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland, this is a great place to stay with the family, because of the accomodations.  Great room set up with separate living room & bedroom, and toilet/shower separate from the double sinks.  Good amenties, very soft beds, probably the MOST pillows i have ever had at any hotel, and I sleep with 7 pillows at home.   My only complaint, since the hotel sells the ART 1 day bus passes, they really should EXPLAIN the system since they are selling them to you.  It's simple, only use 1 pass a day cause it will get punched by the driver, and this is the card you use all day.  I bought 2 days worth of passes for all of my family members, and separated them, but somehow I used them all in 1 day and got them all punched.  When I explained this over the phone to the

Summary Heading: The only place to stay when visiting Disney!
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here while visiting Disneyland from 7/10-7/14. We looked at a number of hotels both inside and outside of the parks, many of which were pretty pricey. We got a great rate for the Doubletree, and after much research decided to book it, and boy are we happy we did. The hotel was suprisingly nice, the room was great....VERY clean, and the beds were soo comfortable. We flew to Vegas afterwards where we stayed at The Wynn, which is famous for the beds, and to be honest, they were pretty similar in comfort. This hotel offers shuttle service every 20 minutes to the parks for about $3, and although you technically could walk, it is a bit of a hike, which we did not think would be a good idea after a long day of walking at Disney, so we stuck with the shuttle. I

Really nice and clean, everyone was very friendly.  Nice large room to accomodate my husband and I w/ 2 kids.  They had their space and we had ours.  Ingredients for a happy vacation!  We went for a conference.  It is a 5 minute walk to the convention center.  We rather enjoyed that bit of distance as the Marriott and Hilton right beside the convention were bustling w/ a capital B.  Only downside was, don't ask the Starbucks located there for a specialty drink of any kind.  We stayed in the Double Tree for a week and I finally figured out to go somewhere else for a good speciaty drink off their menu.  Ladies fixing the drinks tried and were quite accomodating, but just couldn't do it.  Also nice was the laundry facilities located right down the hall from our room.  Really please

I stayed at this hotel for business and I could not have been happier with my choice. It's a pleasant 10-minute walk from the Convention Center, and the room was quiet and comfy for work. I ordered room service one night, and not only did it arrive promptly but the food was really good!  The best part of my stay was the maid service. Always plenty of towels, the room was spotless every day, and on a couple days the maids wrote me thank you notes for leaving a modest tip. A thank you note! I haven't even gotten those for some wedding gifts I've given. I don't know what the Doubletree does to attract such polite and skilled staff, but they need to keep doing it.

We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites during our 3-day trip to Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  We really enjoyed the one-room suite as we were staying with our two children.  The microwave and fridge are a nice touch, although our fridge seemed to have problems getting cold.  The hotel is a 5 minute car drive or 15 minute shuttle drive from the Disneyland entrance.  Not really within walking distance to the main gate unless you're up for a nice little hike.  The staff was very friendly from the time we checked in until our departure.  The best thing:  The rooms were actually very quiet.  With tons of families there, we were worried about noise, but never heard anything from neighboring rooms.  We will certainly stay here again on future Disney trips.

This was our 2nd time staying at the Doubletree.  I was happy that the service and quality was consistent the second time around.  The rooms are large and comfortable.  I really liked the setup of the suite.  Where many suites are a a long room cut in half and you have to walk through the living area to get to the bedroom, these suites are set up with rooms parallel to each other with doors on each side.  A couple things that bug me though... in the two bed suites one bed is in the path of the air conditioning vent so it blows on you all night.  There is no way to turn off the blower.  The outside of the windows could use a washing.  Lastly, they charge 11 dollars a day to park.  All in all,  we really like this hotel. It is great for families and we would stay here again.

Stayed overnight while visiting relatives.  Service at the front counter was outstanding and attentive.  When we arrived at our room it wasn't what we had booked, but was still wonderfully laid out.  A quick call to the front counter and the problem was rapidly rectified to our satisfaction with a minimum of fuss.  Room was large and clean, the beds comfortable.  Breakfast the next morning was great, and the wait staff excellent.  All in all a very nice stay.

Just returned from a two night stay and loved this hotel! Traveling with husband and 12 yr old. We arrived around 10:30 am and were able to check into our room at that time. Which was nice as we could drop luggage and head to Huntington Beach area for the afternoon. Check in was a breeze, nice touch   with the          warm chocolate chip cookies. Room was large, clean and best of all, QUIET! Finally a hotel that has quiet air conditioning, no need for ear plugs to sleep!    We did not hear anyone in surrounding rooms or showers running.                              We had a king bed, very comfortable, and daughter enjoyed the separate sofa/ TV area with play station. We ate at the hotel restaurant breakfast buffet both mornings. Nice selection of items, great service, daughters

Just returned from a couple days at this Anaheim Doubletree.  My husband was attending a Podiatry conference at the Disneyland Hotel.  I chose the Doubletree instead of the Disneyland Hotel and was really pleased.  Very clean, very comfortable beds and friendly staff.  We were checked into a room on the 2nd floor but had to move because of some loud teenagers from a highschool trip.  I called down to the frontdesk and we were moved right away to the 4th floor.  Much better....... It is a good walk to Disneyland about 20-30 minutes but there is a shuttle.

We enjoyed this hotel however the room when we first entered was a little musty but asthetically pleasing and the bed was quite comfy. Bathroom is of good size and everything was nice and clean. The pool is quite small here and if there are more than 6 people in it at a time it is little more then a wading area. They have a small workout room that's nice and was quite empty when I went to use it. Some of the things to note are the trolley to and from Disneyland is $3.00 for a 1 day pass and you must pay an additional $11.00 a day for parking at the Hotel. Taxes are quite exhorbitant in Anaheim as they totalled 21% of the entire bill. We were able to get the room for a Sat. night for $119.00 but with all the taxes and parking it came out to over $150.00.  Also parking at any of

We stayed at the Doubletree Suites Anaheim for 6 nights in May as my husband had a conference in Anaheim. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk to the convention centre, 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland and a 10 minute walk to Target.  We stayed in a suite so we had a bedroom with 2 double beds and a nice size living room with a couch, chair and desk. The rooms were quite nice and the beds were very comfortable. Our room had a refrigerator, a microwave and a coffee maker.  The front desk staff were very helpful and accomodating. We originally weren't booked into a suite but we decided to upgrade since we were traveling with our 6 month old daughter and thought it would be nice to have somewhere to hang out once we put her to bed in the bedroom. We were able to move to a suite

Summary Heading: Absolutely wonderful but watch out for the hidden fees...
Summary: My Fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights while we visited Disney Land and California Adventure.  This hotel was very, very nice and worth the $107 dollars we paid a night.  But the price was a little decieving because upon check-in we had to pay $11 a night for parking and then $16 a night in hotel taxes so it really ended up being almost $134 a night.  But still is was worth that amount.  The hotel is not within realistic walking distance from the parks so you have to take a shuttle.  The shuttles run fairly often and are $3 per person round trip.  There are several restuarants within walking distance of the hotel including a Denny's (right across the street), Bakers Square, Outback Steakhous and Joe's Crab Shack.    The hotel itself was just awesome.  The whole building looked

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and a great value
Summary: We stayed while visiting Disneyland/CA Adventure. I booked a Double Queen,  2 room suite on the hotel website for the five of us at a rate of $151.20 per night. Check-in was speedy  even though we arrived at 1:00 p.m. (loved the cookies). Our suite was roomy, the beds were comfortable and the furnishings were upscale. The suite had a fold out couch in addition to the 2 beds.  Since we were traveling with our 3 teen aged sons, having the separate rooms each with a TV was a big plus. The pool and spa were stocked with plenty of towels each time we visited.  The suite had it's own thermostat, the granite vanity area was separated from the toilet/ bath tub area by a door, however the lighting in the toilet/bath area was a bit dark. Neutrogena bath products, Wolfgang Puck Coffee and

I usually stay at the Hyatt in Garden Grove when we visit Disneyland but they were sold out. Luckily we found this new property and were very happy with it.    We arranged for a 2 queen suite. May 17 - 23rd at $149 per night.  The beds were great and even the sleeper sofa was comfortable. My dad who is 73 spent most of his time in the room or at the pool, thought it was very nice.   Check in was good, the kids had just had warm cookies on the plane, Aloha Airlines, so were not impressed with more cookies at check in. =) Our Bellmen Gary and Albert were by far the best and most attentive people working there. They both addressed my self and the kids each time we came through the lobby.  Room service was needed a couple of times, food was very good.  Having the Microwave in the

This is a fantastic hotel and i think reasonably priced.   we paid $129 per night for a suite on the top floor. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and very clean.  we spent 3 weeks in California/Las Vegas and this was by far the best hotel we stayed in and not the most expensive.  Close to disney and within walking distance of plenty of restaurants.  Nice pool area.  We chose this hotel as we drove past it and didn't regret it for a minute.  Free internet access in business lounge - parking is $12 a night.  Breakfast $12.99 for buffet including bacon, sausage etc.  If we returned to Anaheim we would definately be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location. Will choose again
Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at for the price I paid. I was attending a wedding very close to disneyland and staying only one night so I could not spend too much money but I did not want to stay at a crummy hotel either so I chose the doubletree. Location is great, within walking distance to Disneyland and the convention center. Parking is safe and well lit. Service desk was friendly and fast. Rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. I loved the bed and the pillows, very comfortable. Nothing really to complain,  Will definately stay again if in the area.

Summary Heading: The best hotel in the disneyland area!
Summary: This hotel and the Courtyards by Mariott next door were the only  hotels newly built in 2006 in the disneyland area, I've stayed at both now but I will be coming back to the Doubletree!     I got the price of $89 a night from priceline, not name-your-own-price, just a special rate. The receptionist said that it was an excellent rate, its usually between $100-140.      Loved the elegant lobby, attractively decorated rooms and the small touches, like warm cookies, that added to the experience.  Some info more info for you:    1. The hotel has 1 cafe which serves starbucks coffee, and bagels/pastries/fruit etc (like at starbucks). Nice when you want to eat and run to the DL park in the morning.    2. Also there is a restaurant with buffet breakfast, kids eat free with adult

Ok, well I was a solo traveler. As my husband was on convention in Hollywood. I decided to take a 2 night stay in Anaheim, for Disneyland. and from the other reviewers. I chose the Doubletree. I took the Red line/Amtrak to get to Anaheim. Took a short cab ride to the hotel, just to drop off my bags, so i can run to the parks. Well, when I came back to check in. I was very happy with my choice!  As soon, as I checked in. I was given this nice sized warm delicious chocolate chip cookie. Yummo!! The hotel, was wonderful. Everything was clean, looked new. The hotel staff all were spot on, kind, and nice.  My room was a standard King, it  was spacious, immaculate, it had a microwave,  a mini refrigerator, coffee maker, with wolfgang puck coffee. Yummy! The bed. Heaven!! They also

This Doubletree was gorgeous.  Our room was clean and well-decorated, the bed very comfortable (a must when visiting Disney!) and the cookies at check-in, as always, were delicious.  The only drawback is that disney is about a mile and a half walk.  So if you're going to Disney, make sure to pack a backpack so you don't have to go back to the hotel during the day.

A two night stay at the Doubletree over the Easter weekend (Sun/Mon) was very relaxing.  The hotel lived up to all the reviews posted. The following comments are observations during our stay, but it was overall, very enjoyable.  Check in:  Easy and efficient (no warm cookies but were given rainchecks which we redeemed half an hour later).  The front desk staff/concierge were very helpful with any requests.  Room:  Cozy two rooms plus separated bath.  The sofa pulled out and was pretty comfortable.  The queen beds in the bedroom were much better.  Loved the quilt and the abundant fluffy pillows. Big lag in switching channels using the remote on the large LG TV.  Maid service:  We arrived back at 3:00 pm, hoping to relax in our room.  We noticed the cleaning service was still down

Wonderful, the staff was very attentive, we had saved for our adventure to Disneyland for over 6 months, and booked this hotel online and never felt more lucky. The rooms were huge, the beds were nicely displayed and the kids enjoyed the option of watching tv in the living area while we had the comfort of watching in the room. We definetly will be returning to this place.

Summary Heading: Very Pleasant Stay at the Doubletree
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree from 3/25/07-3/30/07 for a total of 5 nights.  It was a spring break trip to Disneyland with our two young girls.    The Doubletree is a wonderful hotel that was very comfortable.  The lobby was open and inviting.  The front desk staff and bell staff were all extremely polite, friendly and welcoming.  I had never stayed at a Doubletree before but had heard about the delicious chocolate chip cookies upon check-in.  The rumors are absolutely correct!  The cookies were warm and absolutely sinful.  Everytime I passed through the lobby I kept thinking of asking the front desk staff for another cookie!    The room itself was very clean and comfortable.  We had a 1 bedrrom suite.  It was not extremely spacious, but it was comfortable.  Housekeeping was very

We stayed at the Doubletree March 18th - March 24th.  There were 6 of us, all adults with the exception of a 5 year old.  We had a two queen suite, that consisted of a bedroom with two queens and a living area with a pull out couch bed.  The bedroom had a nice sized safe that would easily accomodate a laptop plus other stuff.  Both rooms had tvs, phones, etc.  The living area had a fridge, micro, and plenty of shelving to put food that you have brought yourself.  There were doors on the outside of all this so you don't have to look at it.  The bathroom sink was separate from the bathtub and toilet, which made it easier for all of us getting ready.  We did end up getting a rollaway bed for a charge of $25 for the entire time.  There was  plenty of room in this room for all of us,

Just returned back from a fun few days in Southern California. While I can't compare any other hotels in the area, I can't imagine one being a better value than the Doubletree.   The room itself was perfect for our family - two teenagers who are long past the 'sleeping in the same bed' thing. The suite had a separate bedroom w/ two queen beds and a living room (pretty small) with a pull out couch, that Mom and I slept on. For a pull out, it was very comfy and the kids slept like rocks. For about $150/night, it was a great deal.  The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Disneyland, with an ABC store and 7-11 along the way to buy your bottled water ($3+ at Disneyland for a tiny bottle).   The only meal we ate onsite was breakfast the first day, and 80 bucks later for a mediocre

We just returned from a Saturday thru Monday visit to Disneyland.  We wanted to stay at one of the resort hotels but the price and availability make that near impossible.  The Doubletree is a nice alternative as a slightly more upscale hotel than some in the area.  We reserved a King room but upgraded to a King Suite upon check-in.  It had a nice sized living room and kitchen (fridge, microwave and coffee maker) area.  Very comfortable bed and flat screen TVs in both rooms.  The room, halls and lobby were all very clean and the staff was extremely nice and helpful.  The Doubletree is about 2 blocks south of Disneyland on Harbor Blvd.  Someone in good shape could walk it, but we opted for the ART shuttle which stopped right across the street and was very convenient.  The only

This hotel far exceeded my expectations. From the moment we arrived which was 2am, we were greeted with a sincere smile and made to feel as valued guests. Upon arrival we were given the certificates for the ever so popular- fresh out of oven cookies SCRUMPTIOUS! The rooms were nicely appointed & large in size. The cleaning service kept our room clean which is welcoming after a long day at Disnelyand. The room always had fresh towels and toiletries. My family which included a teenager, tween and energitc son were very impressed with the room, roomservice & pool. It was great to have a room that included a separate living room which comes in handy for teenagers. She was able to watch her own tv and sleep on the pullout sofa.   My teenager and I took advantage of the exercise room

We only stayed one night, but loved the service: all staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was great!  With three adults, there was optimum privacy for the smallish space.  It was very clean and well-stocked.  We will definitely return to Doubletree Suites!

I stayed here for a Disneyland visit with the wife and 2 kids.  The hotel is very new, modern and clean and looks very impressive.  The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Disneyland but is a bit of a hike so take the shuttle or drive there. The staff is also nice, but there were a few minor glitches I would be remiss not to mention.  First, I booked what the website advertises as a "2 bedroom suite."  In reality, it is a one bedroom suite w/2 beds, so be aware of that.  The suite is also VERY cramped (tiny living room area) and the vanity area and bathroom are all very small.    Second, there are computer issues at this hotel. The key card would not work the next morning and had to be re-set (a long haul back down the elevator and vice-versa) and upoon check-out the

very nice hotel.  great accommodation and great service.  the staff at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant.  the restaurant (Agio) is okay, not the best.  the hotel has a microwave and a small refrigerator, so stock up drinks since the drinks at the cafe downstairs (cafe biscotti) are pretty pricey.  overall, this hotel is one of the best.

My fiance and I stayed here last weekend and found our room beautiful. For the price paid, the suites are very spacious, clean, and quiet, considering the hotel is a few blocks from Disneyland. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We checked in at around 10:00 in the morning, and although they couldn't give us the king suite we reserved at that time, we received a 2 queen suite on the top floor of the hotel that was very nice. The only downside was that it was a good 15-20 minute walk from Disneyland, but there is a shuttle that goes to all the hotels in the area. We never used it. I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind staying a few blocks away from Disneyland and California Adventure.

We stayed here Feb 8-12th.  We booked through Hotwire and were expecting just a standard room, but upon check-in, we were given a suite.   This hotel was fantastic!  The beds were plush, with pillow tops mattresses, down comforters, and down pillows.  It was the best that I have slept ever in a hotel.  If I could take the bed home with me, I would have.  The 2 queen bed/suite is spacious.  There were five of us in a room and we never felt crowded.    The bathroom sink is outside of the shower area, so it was nice for getting everyone ready in the mornings.  Props to housekeeping, the rooms were clean~very clean.    Two of the nights that we stayed, we had neighbors who were partying.  One night, they actually got in a fight in the hallways.  However, security responded really

Great hotel!  Easy access to Disneyland.  Very helpful,  polite employees.  Clean, comfortable rooms.  Loved the cookies.  We requested our two rooms be next to each other ,but there weren't any standard rooms adjacent available, so they upgraded our rooms free of charge to accomodate the request.  Wow!!  Would stay here again.  The pool area is very small.  Not the best for relaxing poolside, but we did see the fireworks at Disneyland from the patio.

on our tour around california we had to see disneyland and this hotel ticks all the boxes. Its 15 min walk to disneyland or the hotel lay on buses every 30 mins. but the size and quality of this hotel is its best asset. It was only built 2 years ago and it showed compared to the rest of the out of date run down hotels in the vasinity ie  the Hilton. The rooms are big with two king size beds double sinks and seperate bathroom. the hotel staff apply a perfect 10 policy where if any part of your stay doesn't make 10 out of 10 then you can complain. we struggled to think of any problems!  swimming pool, jacuzzi and gym are well presented. there is a on site disney rep who lets you know any events coming up at disney. plus plenty of other tours can be booked straight from hotel to

Just returned from a 3 week stay at the Doubletree and it  was an excellent choice.The staff on the desk were very helpful as they were in the restaurant,the hotel is very clean and the staff do their best to keep it that way,a few guests seem to think it is ok to leave half eaten cakes in the laundry room,come on people,you wouldn't do that in your own home as you would have to clear it away yourself! There are always plenty of places to park but I would prefer for the car park rate to be included in the room rate,after all you can't park anywhere else! Car parking is $11 per day,that soon adds up for a 22 day stay! The only negative point to the hotel is the swimming pool,it is quite small and can get pretty crowded,it gets no sun on the pool area all day and can be a bit cold

Summary Heading: Beautiful New hotel with some problems...
Summary: We stayed only one night at this hotel.  The hotel is gorgeous - the room was very nice however the bathroom was not very clean and actually needed to be scrubbed down - orange color mold on the shower wall and silicone grout and smelled like mold - so that was gross - especially considering it is a newer hotel - open less than a year.   The maids just need to do a better job of cleaning.  The vanity was dirty on the wood and the hairdryer was downright grimy - so needless to say I went to bed with wet hair that night because I was not  going to use that hair dryer.  After a full day at Disneyland where it was freezing by the way - we got into bed and the air conditioner was on full blast (december?) - and the controls were not working.  I called the front desk and the sort of

We stayed at Doubletree Guest Suites the week before Christmas 2006 so that we could visit Disneyland.  At first I thought this was an all suites hotel because of the name.  When I double checked my reservations shortly before our arrival, I realized I had booked a room not a suite.  At check in, I requested a suite and was given one at no additional charge!  The suite was small but very comfortable.  The beds where the best part.  They where definately heavenly.  Though we could walk to Disney, it would have been a very long walk, so we took the shuttle which comes about every 20-25 minutes.  It worked well for us although I could see some people getting frusturated with the wait time.  The only down side was that the pool was outdoor.  Anaheim gets cold in December (we wore

Stayed 3 days over Christmas with two adults and three children.  We rented the one bedroom suite which provided plenty of room. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the restaurant had good food and the prices were reasonable.   Disneyland is actually a good twenty minute walk but the trolley comes every twenty minutes and stops and drops right in front of the hotel. It starts early in the AM and runs until after midnight. The three dollar daily fee is worth the price and children under 9 are free.   We were very pleased with our stay and will definitely be back.

We stayed in the Doubletree guest suites from december 17th for 4 nights. it was a fabulous experience as a travel agent by profession i have stayed in many hotels and this is by far one of the best in every way. first of all the hotel is absolutely spotless i have never stayed anywhere as clean. the front desk staff are extremly professiona and friendly offering us a raincheck on the customary chocolate chip cookies as there were none available when we checked in. Our room was a suite which was of a good size bedroom had two double beds tv wardrobes etc very nicely decorated. lounge area was very nice with sofa bed and another tv. which was perfect for our party of two adults and two teenagers. we were booked in on a bed and breakfast basis buffet breakfast served in a really

Stayed here for 2 nights for a Disneyland trip.  Everything at this hotel is clean and new.  I loved the Neutrogena products in the bathroom.  The bed is SO comfortable - felt so good after walking around all day at Disney!  You do have to pay $11/day for parking, but with the cheap room rate we got, it didn't really matter to us.  The warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in were so yummy!  We used the ART shuttle bus to go to Disney and it picks you up and drops you off right next to the hotel.  We also walked back to the hotel one time and it took about 15 minutes.   With younger children, you might want to use the shuttle.  The only hotel staff we really interacted with was the front desk and they were very friendly.  Check in and check out was a breeze.  Overall, I had a

The hotel is fairly new, super clean and the service was top notch!  The rooms were very spacious and most importantly...very comfortable beds!!  My husband and I said we would definitely be back here for another stay....we took our three children - this place is a great place for kids, breakfast buffet was excellent!  Can't say enough how much we enjoyed the cleanliness, newness and super service!

My family stayed at the Doubletree a few weeks ago for the Christmas season and it was absolutely wonderful!!  Our room was very clean, modern and comfortable! The bed is amazingly soft and was almost as good as the one at home. I loved the shower there was great water pressure and the nozzle was up higher so I didn't have to squat down and bend back to wash my hair (what a concept!) Oh and did I mention the rooms are spacious!? We had 3 adults and three children in one and it didn't feel cramped! It was so nice to come back to a clean cozy room after a long day at Disneyland! We will be staying at this hotel again next time we are in town! We all loved it! Make sure you get a bite to eat at the little cafe. They have good prices and there fruit and granola parfaits are

We were in California for 11 nights in November 2006, and after reading reviews on trip advisor decided to stay at three different Doubletree hotels - The guest suites in Santa Monica and Mission Valley, San Diego (I have submitted reviews for the other 2 hotels).  All three hotels were really great!  We stayed in Anaheim for 3 nights.  The Doubletree Anaheim Convention Center is convenient for Disney.  We walked each day to the park which took about 15/20 minutes.    Our room was very nice and clean and the bed was so comfortable.  We had a one bed room which was a decent size, don't know what the two bed rooms were like.  We ate out each day for breakfast - there is a Denny's right across the road - so I can't comment on the hotel restaurant.  The hotel has a business centre

We stayed at the Doubletree for one night in September by chance through Priceline.com .  We pretty much got there late, slept, and left at around 7:30 the next morning so our experience is somewhat limited.  This place is very new and looks fantastic.  It's extremely clean and well kept.  The front desk was nice and helpful and they gave us cookies upon checkin so they got on my good side early ;) Our room was a nice size with all the normal ammenities, and again was spotless and very well kept.  The only complaint I have was that we were charged $12 for parking for the night and they don't have any real transportation to Disneyland.  You could probably walk but it is about 1/2-3/4 of a mile from Disneyland to the Doubletree.  Overall I would highly recommend this Hotel.

great location for disneyland, excellent shuttle service to and from the park.  great location for restaurants and shopping.  nice lobby, nice rooms, nice pool and fitness room.  ice maching on my floor was broken and had to pay for parking are my only complaints.  awesome value through priceline.

Booked the Doubletree Anaheim Guest Suites through Priceline for $50 a night between 11/18-21.  Family of four (Mom, Dad and two kids).  We did experience some issues due to our Priceline booking.  We called in advance and asked for a room with two beds but were told that Priceline had arranged a single king bed room and that we had to take what Priceline gave us.  While it is true that Priceline does not guarantee room type or number of beds there was no reason for the hotel to refuse to make a change based solely on a Priceline booking.  We spoke to three people at the front desk before they agreed to make the change.  We found service to be mixed.  There were no bellman available to take our luggage up to our room so we wound up carrying it ourselves and had the same

I usually never post reviews. But we LOVED this hotel. Everything about it was 100% awesome. You cannot get a better value for the dollar. I would have paid double what I did and still been so happy. This hotel is brand new, everything is mint. The service is the best I have ever received. Location is great too. The hotel is amazing, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. The room was so nice and brand new. The bed was SO COMFORTABLE! I would rather sleep in this hotel every night forever, then sleep in my own bed! I wish I could live in the hotel. A+++++++

I absolutely loved this hotel...one of the best that I have stayed in a while...It is at a very convenient spot in Anaheim..Disneyland is less then 3 minutes away...Plus you are on a strip where there are plenty of restaurants and stores...you have Target which is a few blocks away also. About 10 minutes from there you have Main Place shopping mall, so you can get in some shopping while you are in the area.   The hotel overrall was very very clean...The suites are a little small, but I was still very satisfied. BIg huge comfortable King Size Bed with two flatscreen Tvs a couch and a chair in my room.  The service was also very good..I was greeted with a smile by all of the staff in the hotel. They were also very friendly and helpful if you had any questions. I will definitely

Summary Heading: Very impressed. Great Value, Very Nice
Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree anaheim this past week and can't stop talking about how great it was. We generally stay at higher end hotels and choose this because it was new (apr 2006) and we wanted to have an extra room so we could put the kid to bed and still be able to enjoy our evening. We were immediately impressed by this place. It is very nice -- marble floors, nice touches, great service. The room was great -- nice furniture, classy bathroom, 2 queen size beds, VERY quiet. Even the doors in that separated the bedroom from the living area were soundproof.  I've stayed at other doubletrees for business and none of them are even close to this. The restaurant is free for kids and we were actually very impressed by the meal.  Technically you  can walk to Disneyland but with

I stayed at this hotel for 1 week on a business trip.  This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed at any where in the world for service.  The hotel and restaurant staff were pleasant and went out of their way to provide outstanding service and all of the meals in the hotel restaurant were 5-star.  The hotel is new, nicely decorated, and pleasant.  I had a room with a living room and separate bedroom area, and the bed was very comfortable.  The service and quality of the accomodations are an outstanding value for the price.  The hotel is very close to the Convention Center and Disneyland.

The perfect hotel!!  We had booked a King but one was not available at check in so they had to give us a double however they compensated with a free breakfast for the family and in the end the 2 doubles were just what we needed to get over the jet lag!  The beds are super confortable and the rooms are spacious and clean. Particulary liked the seperate bedroom from the living.  The breakfast was great as the selection was good.  We caught a ART (Shuttle) to Disney however this was not needed as it only took 15min to walk home.   The cookies were the icing on the cake as they were delicious.  Would recommend this hotel!! ONe of the best during our stay in the US.

Summary Heading: Surprisely new hotel in a developed area
Summary: I booked this hotel via priceline, in which I have no prior knowledge of what I am getting. I felt like I won the jackpot when I first arrived at this hotel.  It is new and looks more like a 4 stars hotel to me (it is rated 3 stars in priceline)   I was prepared to see an older hotel as Disney has been developed this many years, it is no surprise if we arrived to a big, but old hotel. However, upon my arrival, I reazlied this is a newly renovated hotel in which some locals has no idea. (When I order taxi from another hotel, the porter told me there is no doubletree on S. Harbor Blvd..........oh well....)   I got a spacious 2 double queen bedroom. Room is clean and pretty.  The beds are high, which my mom doesn't like it, but I am ok with it as it gives me this "royal" feeling.

We checked in on 10/4 and stayed till 10/7.  We were greeted buy the front desk clerk and given warm cookies that were excellent.  All the bellman were in a meeting when we checked in, but the front desk clerk took our bags up to the room for us.  Excellent services and very friendly. When we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised the room was very nicely decorated and very clean and spacious.  One of the best hotel experience.  Every day we got fresh towels and the linens on our bed changed.  Beds were extremely comfortable, it felt like home.  While in Anaheim we visited Disneyland very convenient drive.  Hotel is located in a great location.  We didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice.   If we every go back to this area this is the hotel that we will stay in again.

My wife and I stayed here one night on a business trip.  The hotel is quite new, clean, and the staff is very friendly.  The rooms have very comfortable beds, refrigerator, coffee, hairdryer, plenty of towels  (but only one bar of soap?)  I was told it is only three blocks to Disneyland, but in Anaheim a block is about a 1/4 mile in length, so the walk is a healthy 20 minutes plus to the front gate.  When checking in, request a pool view room on the upper floors, as that will also face Disneyland for the fireworks display.  Overall,  we were quite pleased and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Had a Great Experience at the Doubletree
Summary: A friend and I stayed here for one night in a double queen suite (room 329).  Although small, it was extremely comfortable, with two 27 inch TVs, a comfortable sofa, chairs, enclosed microwave and refrigerator, plus a warm chocolate chip cookie for each of us at check-in.  In the evening we received a call from a customer service representive making sure that everything was to our liking.  That has never happened before in any previous hotel experience!  We did not have an opportunity to try out the pool or restaurants.  Overall, we were very pleased with this visit.

My son and I were visiting my family down in San Diego and we went up to Disneyland for a few nights. We stayed in a suite at the Doubletree for 2 nights in July. There were 4 of us and there was plenty of room for everyone. I thought the room was excellent. Of course the fact that the hotel has been only open for around 4 months helps because everything is clean and new.  The bedroom had two double beds and the living area had a  queensize sofabed. My young son and I stayed on the sofabed and it was very comfy. We stayed here because we wanted to be fairly close to Disneyland. There is a shuttle that will pick you up in front the hotel or you can walk, I would say the walk would take a good 15 minutes. I don't  remember what we paid for the shuttle but it wasn't alot.  My

Summary Heading: Mixup turned into a great experience!
Summary: We arrived at our original hotel, having left the confirmation # at home, and were told that we did not have a reservation. So  we decided...what the heck...we'll find another room somewhere. We walked into the Doubletree and, voila, a suite was available.   The location was terrific for getting back & forth to Disneyland. The bus stop was right outside and the 7 minute bus ride took you directly to the entrance. Getting back was just as simple.   The room was sparkling clean, the beds were soft & the housekeeping service was excellent. I loved having the fridge to keep my water bottles cold & the microwave was a great extra. The air conditioning worked well & was fairly quiet.   The moderate sized pool was heated and there was also a hot tub! Towels were provided at the pool.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you need internet connectivity!
Summary: As a business traveler, I rely on a reliable internet connection when I'm in the room.  In this case, I was quite disappointed when I was only able to connect successfully 5% of the time, and even then, only for about 5 minuites before the darn DSL connection would cut-off.  Calls to the helpdesk were useless and they chalked it up to "Must be a lot of users on-line right now" -- NOT acceptable!  Even at 11:00pm, the connection wasn't working.    That said, most of the guests appeared to be tourists, there for a trip to Disneyland, which is literally down the street.  For you folks, this is a great place to stay.  I overheard the reception attendant telling someone that since they booked on the Disney website, they get a reduced daily parking fee of $8 instead of $11.  Parking

We stayed at the hotel a total of 3 nights.  We stayed in a double queen suite.  Perfect for our family of 5 (1 baby).  They provided the crib and we had it set up in the room outside of the bedroom.  This works perfectly, so we don't disturb the baby and the baby doesn't disturb us.  Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  Having two televisions in the room is helpful because generally children only want to watch cartoons.  The staff were nice and courteous.  When asked questions about Disneyland, they were very helpful.  We enjoyed our stay overall.  The only gripe we had was the refrigerator (just cold enough to keep things cool...not cold) and that the location was just a little too far to walk to Disneyland.  The staff highly recommends guests drive to the

We also stayed at the Doubletree after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor.  My family of 5 (including 3 young kids) stayed there on August 12th for one night.  We had a regular room (not a suite) with 2 beds.  Our first impressions were great.  The exterior was well maintained and the parking lot was large, well-lit, and clean.   The room was huge compared with others in the area.  The bathroom was huge too for a room that wasn't a suite.  It had 2 double sinks and a microwave, safe, and mini-fridge.  It had a separate room for the shower/tub and toilet.  We also had a little sitting area with 2 big comfy chairs and a little coffee table.  It was extremely comfortable.  We only wish there was a larger pool considering this was a family hotel so close to Disneyland.  The pool

We booked this hotel well in advance with a prepaid reservation for a king suite.  No cancellations were allowed.  However, when we arrived, the hotel had given away our room and offered us a double queen.  After a long drive with two children, this was not welcoming news.  The front desk staff was not at all accomodating.   Furthermore, our children were looking forward to the chocolate chip cookies upon arrival.  They were unfortunately not available, but I had to ask for a rain check(even after they didn't honor our reservation). The breakfast buffet should have been included with the room charge, as it was not at all worth the price.  The wait staff was extremely rude and uninviting. We would not choose to stay at this hotel again.  The customer service in all areas was

My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Anaheim a on August 4th, 2006 for a trip to Disneyland.  We booked the hotel based on positive reviews from this website and the fact that it was a brand new hotel.  While the outside and lobby look nice, the hallways and guestrooms show just how cheaply this hotel was made.  We were very disapointed in our stay and checked out of the hotel at 2am the night we had checked in.  We arrived about a half an hour before check in and the lady at the counter was happy to let us check in early.  We went up to our room which was a king suite and found that it faced not one, but two streets and that the air conditioner was broken.  The room and hallways smelled very musty in general.  When I called to confirm our reservation a several

Finding a decent hotel in Orange county during summer is challenging. Especially for a state rate. I've stayed at this hotel four times already this year because of the excellent cost performance.   I've stayed both one big room (2 queen beds, Room number 610 and 710) and a suit type room (2 queen beds) and I prefer to one big room as I really don't use a living room in the suite. Avoid a king bed room at the end of the hotel, it's way tiny (and I asked to change the room, which the hotel staff complied for me). The room is new and bathroom is huge.  A free computer access at the lobby is nice. As a HHonors diamond member I get a coupon for free breakfast at the restaurant, which is a plus. They charge $11/night for parking which isn't too bad.  There are so many choices for

Booked our stay on the hotel's website.  Paid, upfront, the lodging rate a few months back because their deal was terrific!
