Room was clean and a great size for my family (wife, 10 year-old  and 13 year-old).  Two t.v.'s as mentioned was great.  A few things: -laundry room is constantly busy.  $1.50 for wash and $1.50 for dry.  $1.00 single-load detergent.  Hint...a laundrymat is across the street on Orangewood.  If you take the back exit, look straight ahead across the street!  -shuttle $3.00 per person over 10 years-old each day is fine.  Took a taxi to downtown Disney for shopping one evening.  Called the front desk for a cab.  The ride was $15 flat.  It was not a cab, rather a black car.  Returned in a city cab for $8.00.  Be up front if asking for a cab that you want a city

We had a very pleasant stay here the nights of July 13th and 14th.  The suite is well designed and pleasantly decorated.  They are not large but it had plenty of space and separation for my family of five.  My wife took a shower the first night we were there and I was in the bed that was right next to the bathroom and could not hear anything.  The beds are very comfortable and the property is oriented perpendicular to Harbor Blvd so the majority of the rooms should be fairly quiet.  Our room was a long hike from the elevators but that seems to be the case virtually every time we stay around Disneyland.    We spent most of our time at Disneyland so I do not have much comment on service etc. but we did enjoy the breakfast buffet that was included in our rate.  If this place were

Room was spacious - I did not realize the rooms were all suites and quite large.  Clean and comfortable (esp the beds).  Two TVs worked great since I have two children.  Pool area nice.  Price was excellent - one of the cheapest and best places I stayed on my two week CA trip!  Only complaint: ad I saw said walking distance to Disneyland but it was too far for us - we took the car.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but service could use a little fine tuning
Summary: Me, my husband and our two kids - ages 1 and 2 - stayed at the Doubletree for two nights.  We got a 2 room suite with two queen beds and for the 4 of us, it was plenty of room.  The suite comes with a small fridge and microwave, which comes in handy if you are traveling with toddlers.  The living area had a couple of chairs, a sofa, TV and a table - really the space was the perfect size for us.  We took the kids to Disneyland and since the hotel does not offer a shuttle, we walked.  Personally for us, it was not a bad walk at all.  It is literally two blocks - long blocks but two blocks all the same.  We do have a double stroller so we're able to pop the kids in and take off.  I did see other families on the way back with older kids, who looked tired of walking.  Perhaps when

We stayed here twice in 2006  (so far) once for Spring Break and then again for the July4th weekend. These are the perfect accomodations for a larger family! The restaurant treated us like royalty, the concierge went above and beyond, and both stays surpassed our expectations from a moderately priced hotel. We'll defintely use this hotel again.

This is a lovely brand new hotel located 1 mile from the Disneyland entrance.  The hotel lobby is gorgeous.  The Cafe Biscotti made it convenient to grab a latte to go before tackling a day at DL!  The rooms were so spacious and nice!  The bedroom was separate from the family room, which made it nice for children to be able to go to sleep while the adults had some alone time!  The 2 TVs were nice too.  The room had a microwave and refrigerator, with a nice pantry type area to store food in as well.  We ate breakfast in our room (cereal, poptarts, etc), had a nice lunch at Downtown Disney every day, and then made sandwiches from the fridge every night.  We ordered pizza one night from Marri's, which the concierge recommended, YUM!  The "Sweet Dreams" Beds, with goosedown

We stayed at the Doubletree Anaheim Convention Center the last weekend in June. The stay was one of the BEST my family has ever had!! We also enjoyed the Doubletree in Ontario, Ca, too. The Doubletree Anaheim was immaculately clean, the staff was very accomodating, and the decor was beautiful. Obviously everything is brand new, but the housekeeping staff gave us more than enough towels, the room looked fresh everyday, & I could not find anything wrong with the room. I am a neat-nick when it comes to hotels! The front desk helped us find directions on Mapquest for a close church which was very helpful. Oh, we needed a handicapped accessible room & it was very accomodating. I strongly recommend this hotel. You can not go wrong with a Hilton.

Summary Heading: if you don't care about service, stay here
Summary: I chose to stay at this hotel because I had read previous reviews and they were positive. I too, found the hotel to be very beautiful, clean and was impressed with all aspects of it -except with the front desk staff. I called down to the front desk to extend my stay and the man at the front desk said, "we are all sold out". There was no help what so ever, come to find out there was rooms available. I found the front desk staff very unprofessional, rude and unhelpful, other than that, the room was very nice.  If you don't care about service, then you will be happy. If you care about being treated kindly and professionally, then stay somewhere else.

We just returned from a stay at the Doubletree mini-suites.  We are annual passholders and stay in Anaheim once a month for a Disney trip.  We have stayed at many many area hotels including the Grand Californian, Disneyland Hotel, Ho Jo's, Del Sol, Candy Cane Inn, etc.  Honestly, the Doubletree has the best room we have ever stayed in.  The "mini-suites" were perfect for us.  Our son slept on a pull-out couch in the front room.  We had a seperate room with a "sweet-dreams" bed.  IT WAS A GREAT NIGHT SLEEP.  The beds and pillows really are great.  Ultra clean room with a good size bath,  2 TV's and a microwave.  Large fluffy bath towels.  Staff extremely nice.  And yes, warm cookies at check-in.  The location was the only drawback.  It really is a bit too far to walk considering

This was our second Hotel of the trip out of 5 different hotels. I loved this hotel. It was so clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful.  The beds and pillows in this hotel were so comfortable I felt like I was at home. We are very picky about staying in clean hotels and this surpassed our expectaions. We will stay here again if we ever go back to Anaheim.

Stayed here May 26 - 28, 2006.  I booked a 2 Queen/2 Room Suite for 4 of us and it was very spacious, the beds were the Sweet Dreams beds and very, very comfortable to sleep in; we loved their beds!!  Of course, when you check-in, you get their famous chocolate chip cookies, nice and warm.  Everything from check-in to, maid serviced, to room service was exceptional.   We had no complaints other than having to leave.  The hotel is only minutes from Disneyland and the Disney Shuttle stops in front of the hotel every 20 minutes.  There is a Denny's and Carls Jr right across the street and several other eateries all around the area.  If you need a rental car, there are several in the area.  If you're looking for bargain shopping, go to the Anaheim Market, just minutes away also.

My family and three children stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May 2006.  It was wonderful.  Excellent service, great pool.  All of the rooms with 2 queen beds are suites with a separate living room.  Excellent for a family with small children.  We walked to Disney two of the days and took the ART the other times.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone doing Disney.  Very comfortable beds.  Extremely clean!!

I just returned from a four day stay at this hotel. because I was in town for a business conference. It was awesome! the place is lovely to look at and to stay in. the lobby is simply beautiful and everything from the floral centerpiece, cozy couches, shiny floors, beautiful ceilings and warm rich colors in the lobby scream "Elegance". The staff are friendly, attentive, professionally dressed and helpful. They even gave us a warm cookie after we checked in as a welcome. :)   The room we had held double queen sized beds and looked like a small one bedroom apartment complete with living room area and ample storage areas. The style of furnishings were modern, clean and new and  the colors used are attractive and restful. The view from the window was great too, we were on the 6th

I loved the hotel. Excellent service. Rooms were quite comfortable. The 2 room suite had just the right amount of closet and storage space. The minifridge (no freezer) had enough space to store the weeks worth of food (it was a size larger than the cube type). The microwave was easy to use.  Small pool. 2 washers/dryers located on 4th floor.  Internet service was good - $9.95/day or $49.95/week. (Free wireless in lobby)  My primary complaint was the hotel uses the ART shuttle service which (for me) has always been more than unreliable.  It took 7 minutes to walk to Convention Center.  For a COnvention Center trip, I would not hesitate to stay there again. For a primary Disney trip I will stay there for a really excellent rate only.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Near Convention Ctr & Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here while at conference at Convention Center which is just down the block and around the corner.  Very new and nice.  Room was spacious and nice.  Ask for room in rear of hotel to be away from traffic noise on Harbor Blvd.  Restaurant was good for breakfast but service can be slow.  No wireless internet except for in lobby and they charge $10/day for this with cable in room. Great location with pick up right out front for trolley to Disneyland parks.  Very nice and quiet since it's new and not a lot know about it.  Much better than Hilton/Marriott and rate was cheaper.

I agree with most of the reviews posted (beautiful albeit small suites, nice decor, wonderful bed).  I will only add a few things:  Disney is a quick 20-minute walk.  My husband and I stayed with our two young boys (3 and 1).  We just popped them in the stroller each morning and walked to Disney.  It was much easier than the day we took the ART (waiting, folding and unfolding stroller).  My husband thinks we beat the bus easily each day we walked.  The pool was a bit of a disappointment.  It is just a basic pool (no frills).  I was expecting something a little larger, but it was fine.  The service left something to be desired.  No one was rude, but they did not know the answer to some of my questions and did not go out of their way to find out.    Great price/value!

My family of four stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites for 3 days last week.  The room decor is very upscale. Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper in the living room which is always great when my two sons don't have to share a bed.  As mentioned in another review the hotel is brand new. If you have any hyper-sensitivity to fumes from new carpets and furniture you might want to wait a month. Great location too.
